statement: There exists a compact convex set in a Banach space that is not the convex hull of its extreme points.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Banach 空间中的紧凸集， 它不是其端点集的凸包。
rationale: For example, consider the subset A in the Banach space $l$, which is the closed convex hull of the union of $\left\{\frac{e_{n}}{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ and $\{0\}$. Then A is a compact convex set. However, A is not equal to the convex hull of its extreme points.
chinese_rationale: 例如，在 Banach 空间  $l$  内取子集  A ， 它是  $\left\{\frac{e_{n}}{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  与  $\{0\}$  的并集的闭凸包， 则  A  为一紧凸集。但  A  并不等于其端点集的凸包。

statement: There exists a non-weakly compact strictly singular operator.
chinese_statement: 存在非弱紧的严格奇异算子。
rationale: The following example is given by Pelczyński. For $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2} \cdots\right) \in l$, let $T x=\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \xi_{k}, \quad \sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \xi_{k}, \cdots\right)$, then T is a bounded linear operator from l to $c_{0}$. The operator T is not weakly compact because $\left\{T e_{n}\right\}$ is a weak Cauchy sequence and it does not have a weak limit in $c_{0}$. However, T is a strictly singular operator because there is no infinite-dimensional subspace in $c_{0}$ that is linearly isomorphic to any subspace of l.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子是由Pelczyński  作出的。对  $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2} \cdots\right) \in l$ , 令$T x=\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \xi_{k}, \quad \sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \xi_{k}, \cdots\right)$,则  T  为由  l  到  $c_{0}$  内的有界线性算子。 算子  T  不是弱紧的, 这是因为  $\left\{T e_{n}\right\}$  是弱 Cauchy 点列, 它在  $c_{0}$  中没有弱极限。 但  T  是严格奇异算子, 这是因为  $c_{0}$  中没有一个无穷维子空间, 它线 性同胚于  l 的某个子空间。

statement: There exists a sequence of bounded linear operators that converge weakly but not strongly.
chinese_statement: 存在弱收敛而不强收敛的有界线性算子列。
rationale: For example, consider the Banach space $l^{2}$. For $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$, let $T_{n} x=\left(0, \cdots, 0, \xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)$. Clearly, $T_{n}$ is a bounded linear operator from $l^{2}$ to $l^{2}$. We now demonstrate that $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ converges weakly but not strongly. First, a bounded linear functional $f$ on $l^{2}$ has the form $f(x)=\sum_{j=1}^{\infty} \xi_{j} \eta_{j}$, where $f=\left(\eta_{1}, \cdots, \eta_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$. According to the definition of $T_{n}$, we have $f\left(T_{n} x\right)=\sum_{j=n+1}^{\infty} \xi_{j-n} \eta_{j}=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \xi_{k} \eta_{n+k}$. Applying the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, we get $\left|f\left(T_{n} x\right)\right|^{2} \leqslant\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{k}\right|^{2}\right)\left(\sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}\right)$. Since $\sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}$ is the remainder of a convergent series, we have $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}=0$, thus $\quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left|f\left(T_{n} x\right)\right|=0$. In other words, $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ converges weakly to the zero operator. However, $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ does not converge strongly, because if we take $x=(1, 0, 0, \cdots)$, we have $\left\|T_{m} x - T_{n} x\right\|=\sqrt{2}(n \neq m)$.
chinese_rationale: 例如， 考虑 Banach 空间  $l^{2}$ 。 对  $x=\left(\xi_{1}\right. ，  \left.\xi_{2}， \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$ ， 令$T_{n} x=\left(0， \cdots， 0， \xi_{1}， \xi_{2}， \cdots\right)$ 。显然，  $T_{n}$  是由  $l^{2}$  到  $l^{2}$  内的有界线性算子。兹证  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛而不强收敛。首先，  $l^{2}$  上的有界线性泛函  f  具有下面的形式:$f(x)=\sum_{j=1}^{\infty} \xi_{j} \eta_{j}$，其中  $f=\left(\eta_{1}， \cdots， \eta_{n}， \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$ 。 据  $T_{n}$  的定义， 得到$f\left(T_{n} x\right)=\sum_{j=n+1}^{\infty} \xi_{j-n} \eta_{j}=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \xi_{k} \eta_{n+k}$应用 Cauchy-Schwarz 不等式，得到$\left|f\left(T_{n} x\right)\right|^{2} \leqslant\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{k}\right|^{2}\right)\left(\sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}\right)$ 。因为  $\sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}$  是收敛级数的余项，所以有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{m=n+1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{m}\right|^{2}=0$ ， 从而  $\quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left|f\left(T_{n} x\right)\right|=0$ 。即  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于零算子。 但是，  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  并不强收敛， 因为若取  $x=   (1，0，0， \cdots)$ ， 就有$\left\|T_{m} x-T_{n} x\right\|=\sqrt{2}(n \neq m)$ 。

statement: There exists a normed linear space whose norm cannot be derived from an inner product.
chinese_statement: 存在某个赋范线性空间,其范数不能由内积得到。
rationale: Consider the Banach space $l^{p}(1 \leqslant p \leqslant+\infty, p \neq 2)$. Take $x=(1,1,0 ,  \cdots) \in l^{p}$ and $y=(1,-1,0, \cdots) \in l^{p}$. Through simple calculations, we get $\|x\|=\|y\|=2^{\frac{1}{p}},\|x+y\|=\|x-y\|=2$. It is evident that when $p \neq 2$, the norm on $l^{p}$ does not satisfy the parallelogram identity, hence this norm cannot be derived from an inner product.
chinese_rationale: 取 Banach 空间  $l^{p}(1 \leqslant p \leqslant+\infty, p \neq 2)$ , 并 取  $x=(1,1,0 ,  \cdots) \in l^{p}, y=(1,-1,0, \cdots) \in l^{p}$ , 经过简单的计算, 得$\|x\|=\|y\|=2^{\frac{1}{p}},\|x+y\|=\|x-y\|=2$,可见当  $p \neq 2$  时,  $l^{p}$  上的范数不满足中线公式, 从而 这个范数不能由内积得到。

statement: There exists a self-adjoint operator T that satisfies neither $T \geq 0$ nor $T \leqslant 0$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个自伴算子 T , 既不满足  $T \geq 0$  ，也不满足  $T \leqslant 0$ 。
rationale: Example: Let $T=\left(\begin{array}{ll}1 & 1 \\1 & 0\end{array}\right), \quad x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right), \quad y=\left(y_{1}, y_{2}\right)$, then $\begin{aligned}T x & =\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right), T y=\left(y_{1}+y_{2}, y_{1}\right), \\\langle T x, y\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right),\left(y_{1}, y_{2}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1} y_{1}+x_{1} y_{2}+x_{2} y_{1}, \\\langle x, T y\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right),\left(y_{1}+y_{2}, y_{1}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1} y_{1}+x_{1} y_{2}+x_{2} y_{1},\end{aligned}$ so $\langle T x, y\rangle=\langle x, T y\rangle$, i.e., T is self-adjoint. However, $\begin{aligned}\langle T x, x\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right),\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1}^{2}+2 x_{1} x_{2},\end{aligned}$ when $x_{1}=x_{2}=1$, $\langle T x, x\rangle=3>0$, and when $x_{1}=1, x_{2}=-1$, $\langle T x, x\rangle=-1<0$, so T satisfies neither $T \geqslant 0$ nor $T \leqslant 0$.
chinese_rationale: 例： 设$T=\left(\begin{array}{ll}1 & 1 \\1 & 0\end{array}\right), \quad x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right), \quad y=\left(y_{1}, y_{2}\right)$,则$\begin{aligned}T x & =\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right), T y=\left(y_{1}+y_{2}, y_{1}\right), \\\langle T x, y\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right),\left(y_{1}, y_{2}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1} y_{1}+x_{1} y_{2}+x_{2} y_{1}, \\\langle x, T y\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right),\left(y_{1}+y_{2}, y_{1}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1} y_{1}+x_{1} y_{2}+x_{2} y_{1},\end{aligned}$所以  $\langle T x, y\rangle=\langle x, T y\rangle$ , 即  T  为自伴算子。 但是$\begin{aligned}\langle T x, x\rangle & =\left\langle\left(x_{1}+x_{2}, x_{1}\right),\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)\right\rangle \\& =x_{1}^{2}+2 x_{1} x_{2},\end{aligned}$当取  $x_{1}=x_{2}=1$  时,  $\langle T x, x\rangle=3>0$ , 而取  $x_{1}=1, x_{2}=-1$  时,  $\langle T x, x\rangle=-1<0$ , 故  T  既不满足  $T \geqslant 0$ , 也不满足  $T \leqslant 0$ 。

statement: The Hahn-Banach theorem cannot be extended to general bounded linear operators.
chinese_statement: Hahn-Banach 定理不能推广到一般的有界线性算子。
rationale: Consider the closed subspace $c_{0}$ of the Banach space c, and define an operator $f : f(x)=x (x \in c_{0})$. It is evident that f is a bounded linear operator from $c_{0}$ to $c_{0}$. Now suppose F is any bounded linear operator extending f to the entire space c, then F is a projection operator from c to $c_{0}$, and $\|F\| \geqslant 2$ . Since F is an arbitrary extension of f, it is evident that for general Banach spaces, the Hahn-Banach extension theorem cannot be extended to bounded linear operators.
chinese_rationale: 考察 Banach 空间  c  的闭子空间  $c_{0}$ ， 并在  $c_{0}$  上定 义算子  $f  :  f(x)=x\left(x \in c_{0}\right)$ 。 易见，  f  是由  $c_{0}$  到  $c_{0}$  上的有界线性算子。现设  F  是  f  扩张到整个空间  c  上的任意一个有界线性算子，则  F  是由  c  到  $c_{0}$  上的一个射影算子， 且  $\|F\| \geqslant 2$  (参看例 6 )。 由于  F  是  f  的任意一个扩张， 可见对于一般的 Banach 空间， 不能把 Hahn-Banach 扩张定理转移到有界线性算子上面。

statement: There exists a closed linear operator defined on a Banach space and taking values in another first-class normed linear space is also an open operator.
chinese_statement: 一个在 Banach空间上定义而在另一个第一纲赋范线性空间上取值的闭线性算子， 使其也是开算子。
rationale: For example, let $X=\left(C^{1}[0，1]，\|x\|=\max _{0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1} \mid x(t) \|\right)，Y=C[0，1]$, T be the identity operator from X to Y. Then T is a closed linear operator, and its inverse operator $T^{-1}$ is also continuous, so T is an open operator.
chinese_rationale: 例如， 设  $X=\left(C^{1}[0，1]，\|x\|=\max _{0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1} \mid x(t) \|\right)， Y=C[0，1]$，  T  为由  X  到  Y  上的恒等算子， 则  T  为闭线性算子， 且逆算子  $T^{-1}$  也连续， 故  T  为开算子。

statement: There exists a Banach space with the bounded approximation property, but not the metric approximation property.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Banach 空间, 它有有界逼近性质而没有度量逼近性质。
rationale: Figiel and Johnson constructed a separable Banach space with the BAP but not the MAP.
chinese_rationale: Figiel 和 Johnson 构造了一个可 分 Banach 空间, 它有 BAP 而没有 MAP。

statement: In an infinite-dimensional separable Hilbert space, with a complete orthonormal system and a real number A, it is impossible to construct a linear operator T such that $\|T\| \geqslant A$, and the norm of T restricted to this orthonormal system does not exceed 1.
chinese_statement: 存在可分无穷维Hilbert 空间的完全的规范正交系与实数  A ,无法构造一个线性算子  T , 使  $\|T\| \geqslant A$, T  限制在这个直交系上的范数不超过1。
rationale: Let $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$ be an arbitrary orthonormal system in the infinite-dimensional separable Hilbert space H. For any given positive integer m, define operator T (dependent on m) as follows: $T x=\left\langle x, \varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}\right\rangle \varphi_{1}$. Thus, $T \varphi_{n}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\varphi_{1}, & n \le m, \\0, & n>n.\end{array}\right.$ Hence, $\left\|T \varphi_{n}\right\| \leqslant 1 (n=1,2, \cdots)$. Since $T^{*} x=\left\langle x, \varphi_{1}\right\rangle\left(\varphi_{1} + \cdots+\varphi_{m}\right)$, it follows that $T^{*} \varphi_{1}=\varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}$, thus $\begin{aligned}\|T\| & =\left\|T^{*}\right\| \geqslant\left\|T^{*} \varphi_{1}\right\|=\left\|\varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}\right\| \\& =\sqrt{m}\end{aligned}$
chinese_rationale: 设  $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$  是可分无穷维H ilbert 空间 H 任意取定正整数  m ,定义算子  T  (依赖于  m  ) 如下:$T x=\left\langle x, \varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}\right\rangle \varphi_{1}$,于是$T \varphi_{n}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\varphi_{1}, & n \le  m, \\0, & n>n 。\end{array}\right.$由此得到  $\left\|T \varphi_{n}\right\| \leqslant 1(n=1,2, \cdots)$ 。 由于$T^{*} x=\left\langle x, \varphi_{1}\right\rangle\left(\varphi_{1} + \cdots+\varphi_{m}\right)$,因而  $T^{*} \varphi_{1}=\varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}$ , 从而得到$\begin{aligned}\|T\| & =\left\|T^{*}\right\| \geqslant\left\|T^{*} \varphi_{1}\right\|=\left\|\varphi_{1}+\cdots+\varphi_{m}\right\| \\& =\sqrt{m}\end{aligned}$

statement: There exists a Banach space X such that X does not have the Banach-Saks property, but $X^{*}$ has the Banach-Saks property.
chinese_statement: 存在 Banach 空间  X , 使  X 不具有 Banach-Saks 性质, 而 $X^{*}$具有 Banach-Saks 性质。
rationale:
Here, we introduce the work of Yu Xintai and Zhang Wenyao as follows: Let $\sigma$ be a non-empty finite set of positive integers. If $\bar{\sigma} \leqslant \min \{n: n \in \sigma\}$, then $\sigma$ is called an admissible set. Let $\Gamma=\{\sigma: \sigma \text{ is an admissible set } \}$. For $\sigma_{1}, \sigma_{2} \in \Gamma$, we stipulate $\sigma_{1}<\sigma_{2} \Longleftrightarrow \max \{n: n \in \sigma_{1}\}<\min \{n: n \in \sigma_{2}\}$. A sequence of admissible sets $\{\sigma_{k}\} \subset \Gamma$ is called a block sequence if $\sigma_{k}<\sigma_{k+1}, k \geqslant 1$. For $\sigma \in \Gamma$ and $x=\{x_{n}\}$, define $s(x, \sigma)=\sum_{i \in \sigma}|x_{i}|$. For the block sequence $\{\sigma_{k}\} \subset \Gamma$, define $s_{p}(x,\{\sigma_{k}\})=(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} s^{p}(x, \sigma_{k}))^{\frac{1}{p}}$ and $\|x\|_{p}=\sup s_{p}(x,\{\sigma_{k}\}) \quad(1<p<+\infty)$. Here, the supremum is taken over all block sequences $\{\sigma_{k}\}$ in $\Gamma$. Let $B_{p}=\{x=\{x_{k}\}:\|x\|_{p}<+\infty\}, 1<p<+\infty$. From the proof of Example 9, it is easy to obtain that $\{e_{n}\}$ is the basis of $B_{p}^{*}$, however, $B_{p}$ does not have BSP.
Next, we prove that $B_{p}^{*}$ has BSP. For simplicity, denote $\|x\|_{p}$ by $\|x\|$. Lemma: Suppose $x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i} \in B_{p},\|x\| \leqslant 1$, then for any n, we have $\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_{i} e_{i}\right\|+\left\|\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i}\right\| \leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{q}}, \frac{1}{p}+\frac{1}{q}=1$. Proof: Note the inequality $(|a|+|b|)^{p} \leqslant 2^{p-1}(|a|^{p}+|b|^{p}), 1<p<+\infty$ and the norm definition in $B_{p}$. Proof complete. Example proof: Since $B_{p}^{*}$ is reflexive, from [83], p. 79, we only need to prove the existence of $\theta(0<\theta<2)$, for any $\{y_{n}^{*}=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{n} f_{i}\} \subset B_{p}^{*},\|y_{n}^{*}\| \leqslant 1, y_{n}^{*} \xrightarrow{\text { weak }} 0$. There exist $n_{1}, n_{2}$ such that $\left\|y_{n_{1}}^{*}+y_{n_{2}}^{*}\right\|<\theta$. For any $\varepsilon>0$, satisfy $\theta=(1+\varepsilon) 2^{\frac{1}{q}}+2 \varepsilon<2$. Choose $N_{1}$ such that $\left\|\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}\right\|<\varepsilon$. Since $y_{n}^{*} \xrightarrow{\text { weak }} 0$, for any i, we have $y_{i}^{n} \rightarrow 0 (n \rightarrow \infty)$, so there exists $N_{2}>N_{1}$ such that $\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\|<\varepsilon$, hence $\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}\right\|<1+\varepsilon,\left\|\sum_{i=N N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\|<1+\varepsilon$. For any $x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i} \in B_{p},\|x\|=1$, make $\begin{aligned}& \left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\| \\= & (\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i})(x),\end{aligned}$ so by (1), we get $\left\|y_{1}^{*}+y_{N_{2}}^{*}\right\|<(\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i})(x)+2 \varepsilon\leqslant(1+\varepsilon)(\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} x_{i} e_{i}\right\|+\left\|\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} e_{i}\right\|)+2 \varepsilon\leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{q}}(1+\varepsilon)+2 \varepsilon=\theta$. Proof complete.
chinese_rationale:
这里, 我们把俞鑫泰和张文耀的工作介绍如下:设  $\sigma$  是正整数的非空有限集, 若  $\bar{\sigma} \leqslant \min \{n: n \in \sigma\}$ , 则 称  $\sigma$ 为可允许集。 令  $\Gamma=\{\sigma: \sigma  是可允许集  \}$ 。 对  $\sigma_{1}, \sigma_{2} \in \Gamma$ , 规定$\sigma_{1}<\sigma_{2} \Longleftrightarrow \max \left\{n: n \in \sigma_{1}\right\}<\min \left\{n: n \in \sigma_{2}\right\}$ 。称可允许集列  $\left\{\sigma_{k}\right\} \subset \Gamma$  为块列, 若  $\sigma_{k}<\sigma_{k+1}, k \geqslant 1$ 。对  $\sigma \in \Gamma$  及  $x=\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ , 定义$s(x, \sigma)=\sum_{i \in \sigma}\left|x_{i}\right|$ 。对块列  $\left\{\sigma_{k}\right\} \subset \Gamma$  ，定义$s_{p}\left(x,\left\{\sigma_{k}\right\}\right)=\left(\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} s^{p}\left(x, \sigma_{k}\right)\right)^{\frac{1}{p}}$和$\|\left. x\right|_{p}=\sup s_{p}\left(x,\left\{\sigma_{k}\right\}\right) \quad(1<p<+\infty)$ 。这里,上确界取遍  \Gamma  中所有的块列  $\left\{\sigma_{k}\right\}$ 。令  $B_{p}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{k}\right\}:\|x\|_{p}<+\infty\right\}, 1<p<+\infty$ , 由例 9 的 证明容易得到  $\left\{e_{n}\right\}$  是  $B_{p}^{*}$  的基，但是,  $B_{p}$  不具有 BSP。
下面, 我们证明  $B_{p}^{*}$  具有 BSP。 为简单起见, 记  $\|x\|_{p}$  为  $\|x\|$  。引理 设  $x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i} \in B_{p},\|x\| \leqslant 1$ , 则对任意  n , 有$\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_{i} e_{i}\right\|+\left\|\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i}\right\| \leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{q}}, \frac{1}{p}+\frac{1}{q}=1$ 。证 注意不等式  $(|a|+|b|)^{p} \leqslant 2^{p-1}\left(|a|^{p}+|b|^{p}\right), 1<p<+\infty$ 及  $B_{p}$  中范数定义即可。 证毕。例子的证明: 因为  $B_{p}^{*}$  是自反的, 由  [83], \mathrm{p} 。79  知只须证明存在  $\theta(0<\theta<2)$ , 对任何  $\left\{y_{n}^{*}=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{n} f_{i}\right\} \subset B_{p}^{*},\left\|y_{n}^{*}\right\| \leqslant 1, y_{n}^{*} \xrightarrow{\text { 弱 }} 0$ 。存在  $n_{1}, n_{2}$ , 使  $\left\|y_{n_{1}}^{*}+y_{n_{2}}^{*}\right\|<\theta$  即可。对任意  $\varepsilon>0$ , 满足  $\theta=(1+\varepsilon) 2^{\frac{1}{q}}+2 \varepsilon<2$ 。 可选取  $N_{1}$ , 使  $\left\|\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}\right\|<\varepsilon $ 。 由于  $y_{n}^{*} \xrightarrow{\text { 弱 }} $0 , 故 对任意  i , 有  $y_{i}^{n} \rightarrow 0   (n \rightarrow \infty)$ , 从而存在  $N_{2}>N_{1}$ , 使  $\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\|<\varepsilon$ , 故$\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}\right\|<1+\varepsilon,\left\|\sum_{i=N N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\|<1+\varepsilon$ 。任取  $x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} e_{i} \in B_{p},\|x\|=1$ , 使$\begin{aligned}& \left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right\| \\= & \left(\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right)(x),\end{aligned}$故由  (1) , 得到$\left\|y_{1}^{*}+y_{N_{2}}^{*}\right\|<\left(\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} y_{i}^{\prime} f_{i}+\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} y_{i}^{N_{2}} f_{i}\right)(x)+2 \varepsilon\leqslant(1+\varepsilon)\left(\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{N_{1}} x_{i} e_{i}\right\|+\left\|\sum_{i=N_{1}+1}^{\infty} e_{i}\right\|\right)+2 \varepsilon\leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{q}}(1+\varepsilon)+2 \varepsilon=\theta$证毕。

statement: There exist two invertible matrices whose product is not invertible.
chinese_statement: 存在两个可逆矩阵， 其积不可逆。
rationale: An infinite matrix A is called invertible (reversible) if for every $y \in c$, the equation $y = A x$ has a unique solution. In other words, an infinite matrix A with elements $a_{i j}(i, j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots)$ is called invertible if for every convergent sequence $\left\{y_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$, there exists a unique sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$ such that $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{i n} x_{n} = y_{i}$, $i=0, 1, 2, \cdots$. The product of two invertible matrices is not necessarily invertible. The following example is given by $Ackerma \mathrm{ns}{ }^{[22]}$. Let A be the diagonal matrix with elements $a_{i j}=2^{-i} \delta_{i j}(i, j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots)$, where $\delta_{i j} = 1 (i = j), \delta_{i j} = 0 (i \neq j)$. Let B be the matrix with elements $b_{0 j} = 2^{-j} (j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots), b_{i j} = \delta_{ij}(i = 1, 2, \cdots; j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots)$. It is easy to see that A is invertible. If $\left\{y_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$ is a convergent sequence, then $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} y_{n}$ is a convergent series, and by the definition of B, we have $x_{n} = y_{n}, n = 1, 2, \cdots$, so $x_{0} + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} y_{n} = y_{0}$. Therefore, $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b_{i n} x_{n} = y_{i}$ has a unique solution $\left\{x_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$, which means B is also invertible. On the other hand, $C = A B$ has elements $c_{0 i} = 2^{-j}(j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots), c_{i j} = 2^{-i} \delta_{i j}(i = 1, 2, \cdots; j = 0, 1, 2, \cdots)$. Since there does not exist a sequence $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\}$ such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{i n} x_{n} = 1, i = 0, 1, 2, \cdots$, C is not invertible.
chinese_rationale: 无穷矩阵  A  叫做可逆的 (reversible)， 是指对每个  $y \in c$ ， 方程  $y   =A x$  有唯一解。换言之，具有元素  $a_{i j}(i， j=0，1，2， \cdots)$  的无穷矩阵  A  叫做可逆的， 是指对每个收敛数列  $\left\{y_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$ ， 存在唯一的数列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$ ， 使$\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{i n} x_{n}=y_{i}， i=0，1，2， \cdots$ 。两个可逆矩阵，其积未必可逆。 下面的例子是 由 $Ackerma \mathrm{ns}{ }^{[22]}$  作出的。设  A  为具有元素  $a_{i j}=2^{-i} \delta_{i j}(i， j=0，1，2， \cdots)$  的对角线矩阵，这里  $\delta_{i j}=1(i=j)， \delta_{i j}=0(i \neq j)$ 。  B  为具有元素  $b_{0 j}=2^{-j}(j=0 ，  1，2， \cdots)， b_{i j}=\delta_{ij}(i=1，2， \cdots ; j=0，1，2， \cdots)$  的 矩阵。 易见，  A 是可逆的。 又若  $\left\{y_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$  是收敛数列， 则  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} y_{n}$  是收敛级数， 且据  B  的定义， 有  $x_{n}=y_{n}， n=1，2， \cdots$ ， 从而$x_{0}+\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} y_{n}=y_{0}$ 。 因此，  $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b_{i n} x_{n}=y_{i}$  有唯一解  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}_{n=0}^{\infty}$ ， 即  B  也是可逆的。另一方面，  $C=A B$  具有元素  $c_{0 i}=2^{-j}(j=0，1，2， \cdots)， c_{i j}=   2^{-i} \delta_{i j}(i=1，2， \cdots ; j=0，1，2， \cdots)$ 。 因为不存在数列  $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\}$ ， 使$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{i n} x_{n}=1， i=0，1，2， \cdots$，故  C  不是可逆的。

statement: There exist strong and weak norms on a certain linear space, such that the space is complete with respect to the strong norm but not complete with respect to the weak norm.
chinese_statement: 存在某个线性空间上的强、弱两个范数， 使强范数完备而弱范数不完备。
rationale: Consider the norms $\|x\|_{1}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{n}\right|$ and $\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right|$ on the linear space $l$, where $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in l$. The normed linear space $\left(l, \|\cdot\|_{1}\right)$ is complete whereas $(l, \|\cdot\|)$ is not complete, and $\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right| \leqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{n}\right|=\|x\|_{1}$. For each positive integer n, let $x_{n}=(1 / n, 1 / n, \cdots, 1 / n, 0,0, \cdots)$, then $\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{1}=1, n=1,2, \cdots$, and $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=1 / n \longrightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$, thus the norm $\|\cdot\|_{1}$ is strictly stronger than the norm $\|\cdot\|$.
chinese_rationale: 在线性空间  $l$  上取范数  $\|x\|_{1}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{n}\right|，\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right|$ ， 其 中  $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in l$ ， 则赋范线性空间  $\left(l，\|\cdot\|_{1}\right)$  完备而  $(l，\|\cdot\|)$  不完备， 且$\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right| \leqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{n}\right|=\|x\|_{1}$ 。对每一正整数  n ， 令  $x_{n}=(1 / n， 1 / n， \cdots， 1 / n， 0，0， \cdots)$ ， 则  $\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{1}= 1， n=1，2， \cdots$， 而 $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=1 / n \longrightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ ， 故范数 $\|\cdot\|_{1}$  严格强于 范数  $\|\cdot\| $。

statement: There exists a mapping f on a complete metric space X, for any $x, y \in X$, there exists a constant $\alpha<1$ such that $d(f(x), f(y)) \leqslant \alpha d(x, y)$, but f has no fixed point.
chinese_statement: 存在某个完备度量空间  X  上的映射  f , 对任意  $x, y \in X$ , 存在常数  $\alpha<1$ , 使  $d(f(x), f(y)) \leqslant \alpha d(x, y)$ , 但  f  没有不动点。
rationale: For $x \in \mathbf{R}^{1}$, let $f(x)=\frac{\pi}{2}+x-\operatorname{arctg} x$, then $\begin{aligned}|f(x)-f(y)| & =|x-y+\operatorname{arctg} y-\operatorname{arc} \operatorname{tg} x| \\ & =\left|x-y+\frac{(y-x)}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}\right| \\ & =\left|\frac{(y-x) \xi^{2}}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}\right| \\ & =\alpha|x-y| \end{aligned}$ where $\xi$ is between x and y, and $\alpha=\frac{\xi^{2}}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}<1$. But f obviously has no fixed point. Note that in the definition of a contraction mapping, the coefficient $\alpha$ does not depend on the choice of x, y. This counterexample illustrates that if $\alpha$ depends on the choice of x, y, then it cannot be guaranteed that f has a fixed point.
chinese_rationale: 对  $x \in \mathbf{R}^{1}$ , 令  $f(x)=\frac{\pi}{2}+x-\operatorname{arctg} x$ , 则$\begin{aligned}|f(x)-f(y)| & =|x-y+\operatorname{arctg} y-\operatorname{arc} \operatorname{tg} x| \\& =\left|x-y+\frac{(y-x)}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}\right| \\& =\left|\frac{(y-x) \xi^{2}}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}\right| \\& =\alpha|x-y|\end{aligned}$其中  $\xi$  在  x  与  y  之间,而  $\alpha=\frac{\xi^{2}}{\left(1+\xi^{2}\right)}<1$ 。 但  f  显然没有不动点。注 压缩映射的定义中系数  $\alpha$  是不依赖于  x, y  的选择。上述反例说明了如果  $\alpha$  依赖于  x, y  的选择,那么就不能保证  f  具有不动点。

statement: There does not exist a vector function that is weakly differentiable but not strongly differentiable.
chinese_statement: 不存在弱可导而强不可导的向量函数。
rationale: Let there be a vector-valued function $x:(-1,1) \rightarrow l^{2}$ ,$x(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{e_{n}}{n}, & t=\frac{1}{n}, \\0, & \text { others, }\end{array}\right.$ $e_{n}$ is the element in $l^{2}$ with the nth coordinate being 1 and the rest coordinates being 0. Hence $\frac{x(t)-x(0)}{t}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}e_{n}, & t=\frac{1}{n}, \\0, & \text { others. }\end{array}\right.$ Since $(weak)\lim _{t \rightarrow 0} \frac{(x(t)-x(0))}{t}=0$ , therefore x is weakly differentiable at $t=0$ and $x^{\prime}(0)=0$. However, $\left\|n\left(x\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)-x(0)\right)\right\|=1$, thus x is not strongly differentiable at $t=0$.
chinese_rationale: 设有向量值函数  $x:(-1,1) \rightarrow l^{2}$ ,$x(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{e_{n}}{n}, & t=\frac{1}{n}, \\0, & \text { 其它, }\end{array}\right.$ $e_{n}$  是  $l^{2}$  中第  n  个坐标为 1 , 其余坐标为 0 的元。 于是$\frac{x(t)-x(0)}{t}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}e_{n}, & t=\frac{1}{n}, \\0, & \text { 其它。 }\end{array}\right.$由于$(弱)\lim _{t \rightarrow 0} \frac{(x(t)-x(0))}{t}=0$ , 因此  x  在  $t=0$  处弱可导, 且  $x^{\prime}(0)=0$ 。 但是  $\left\|n\left(x\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)-x(0)\right)\right\|=1$ , 因而  x  在  $t=0$  处不是强可导的。

statement: We use $B^{\mathrm{x}}$ to represent all bounded continuous mappings from the topological space X to the real Banach space B. For $f_{1}, f_{2} \in B^{x}$, define $\begin{array}{l}\left(f_{1}+f_{2}\right)(x)=f_{1}(x)+f_{2}(x), x \in X, \\(\lambda f)(x)=\lambda f(x), \lambda \in \mathbf{R}^{1}, x \in X, \\\|f\|=\sup _{x \in X}\|f(x)\| .\end{array}$ It is clear that $B^{x}$ is a Banach space. There exists a Banach space $ B $ and compact topological spaces $ X $ and $ Y $ such that $ B^{X} $ and $ B^{Y} $ are isometrically isomorphic, but $ X $ and $ Y $ are not homeomorphic.
chinese_statement: 我们用  $B^{\mathrm{x}}$  代表从拓扑 空间  X  到实 Banach 空间  B  中的一切有界连续映射。 对  $f_{1}， f_{2} \in B^{x}$ ， 定义$\begin{array}{l}\left(f_{1}+f_{2}\right)(x)=f_{1}(x)+f_{2}(x)， x \in X， \\(\lambda f)(x)=\lambda f(x)， \lambda \in \mathbf{R}^{1}， x \in X， \\\|f\|=\sup _{x \in X}\|f(x)\| .\end{array}$显然，  $B^{x}$  为 Banach 空间. 问：是否存在 Banach 空间  B  与紧拓扑空间  X， Y ， 使 $ B^{X}$  与  $B^{Y} $ 等距同构，而  X  与  Y  并不同胚。
rationale: Example: Let Z be the unit interval, and let $\begin{array}{c}X==\left\{(\lambda, \mu):(\lambda, \mu) \in R^{2}, \frac{1}{2} \leqslant \lambda^{2}+\mu^{2} \leqslant 1\right. \\\text { or } 0 \leqslant \lambda \leqslant 2, \mu=0\}, \\Y=\left\{(\lambda, \mu):(\lambda, \mu) \in R^{2}, \frac{1}{2} \leqslant \lambda^{2}+\mu^{2} \leqslant 1\right. \\\text { or } \lambda=0, 1 \leqslant \mu \leqslant 2\},\end{array}$ and endow Z, X, and Y with the usual topology. Then Z, X, and Y are compact topological spaces. It is not difficult to see that the topological spaces $Z \times X$ and $Z \times Y$ are homeomorphic. Hence, for any Banach space B, the Banach spaces $B^{z \times x}$ and $B^{z \times Y}$ are isometrically isomorphic, since Z is a compact topological space, the natural embedding from $B^{z \times x}$ to $\left(B^{z}\right)^{x}$ is a one-to-one isometric isomorphism, i.e., the Banach spaces $B^{z \times x}$ and $\left(B^{z}\right)^{x}$ are isometrically isomorphic. Thus, we know that the Banach spaces $\left(B^{x}\right)^{x}$ and $\left(B^{z}\right)^{y}$ are also isometrically isomorphic. However, the topological spaces X and Y are not homeomorphic.
chinese_rationale: 例： 设  Z  为单位区间， 而令$\begin{array}{c}X==\left\{(\lambda， \mu):(\lambda， \mu) \in R^{2}， \frac{1}{2} \leqslant \lambda^{2}+\mu^{2} \leqslant 1\right. \\\text { 或 } 0 \leqslant \lambda \leqslant 2， \mu=0\}， \\Y=\left\{(\lambda， \mu):(\lambda， \mu) \in R^{2}， \frac{1}{2} \leqslant \lambda^{2}+\mu^{2} \leqslant 1\right. \\\text { 或 } \lambda=0，1 \leqslant \mu \leqslant 2\}，\end{array}$并在  Z， X， Y  上赋予通常的拓扑， 则  Z， X， Y  均为紧拓扑空间。 不难看出， 拓扑空间  $Z \times X$  与 $ Z \times Y $ 是同胚的， 从 而对任一 Banach 空间  B ， Banach 空间  $B^{z \times x}$  与  $B^{z \times Y}$  是等距同 构的， 因只  Z  是紧拓扑空间， 故由  $B^{z \times x}$  到  $\left(B^{z}\right)^{x}$  上的自然嵌入映 射是一对一的等距同构映射， 即 Banach 空间  $B^{z \times x}$  与  $\left(B^{z}\right)^{x}$  是等距同构的。 由此们知， Banach 空间  $\left(B^{x}\right)^{x}$  与  $\left(B^{z}\right)^{y}$  也是等距同构的。 然而， 拓扑空间  X  与  Y  并不同胚。

statement: There exists a metric linear space which does not contain any infinite-dimensional subspace linearly isomorphic to a Banach space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个度量线性空间, 它不含有线性同胚于某个 Banach 空间的无穷维子空间。
rationale: Stiles pointed out that the metric linear space $l^{p}(0<p<1)$ does not contain any infinite-dimensional subspace linearly isomorphic to a Banach space. First, we prove the following theorem: Let X be an infinite-dimensional closed subspace of $l^{p}(0<p<1)$. Then X contains a subspace linearly isomorphic to $l^{p}$. Hence, $l^{p}$ does not contain any infinite-dimensional subspace linearly isomorphic to any Banach space. In fact, suppose Y is a Banach space that is linearly isomorphic to some infinite-dimensional subspace of $l^{\prime}$. According to the above theorem, $l^{p}$ is linearly isomorphic to some subspace of Y. We know that a subspace of Y contains a bounded convex open neighborhood, while $l^{p}$ does not contain any bounded convex open neighborhood, hence this is not possible.
chinese_rationale: Stiles  指出, 度量线性空间  $l^{p}(0<p<1)$  不含有线性同胚于某个 Banach 空间的无穷维子空间。 先证明下面的定理 设  X  是  $l^{p}(0<p<1)$  的一个无穷维的闭子空间, 则  X  含有线性同胚于  $l^{p}$  的子空间。兹证  $l^{p}$  不含有线性同胚于 某 个 Banach 空间 的无 穷维子空间。 事实上, 假如  Y  是一个 Banach 空间, 它线性同胚于  $l^{\prime}$  的某个无穷维子空间,则据上面的定理,  $l^{p}$  线性同胚于  Y  的某个子空间。我们知道,  Y  的子空间含有有界的凸的开邻域, 而  $l^{p}$  不含有有界的凸的开邻域, 故这是不可能的。

statement: There exists a weak Asplund space must be an Asplund space.
chinese_statement: 弱 Asplund 空间, 必是 Asplund 空间。
rationale: Phelps pointed out that Banach space l is not an Asplund space, but it is a weak Asplund space. To prove this statement, we first present Theorem 1: Separable Banach spaces are weak Asplund spaces. In 1975, Namioka and Phelps proved that if X is an Asplund space, then $X^{*}$ has RNP. In 1978, Stegal pointed out that the converse of this theorem is also true. Thus, we have Theorem 2: A Banach space X is an Asplund space if and only if $X^{*}$ has RNP. Since l is a separable Banach space, according to Theorem 1, l is a weak Asplund space. However, $l^{*}=l^{\infty}$, and $l^{\infty}$ does not have RNP, so according to Theorem 2, l is not an Asplund space.
chinese_rationale: Phelps 指出,Banach 空间  l  不是 Asplund 空间，但它是弱 Asplund 空间。为证明这一陈述，我们先给出定理 1 可分 Banach 空间是弱 Asplund 空间。1975 年,Namioka 和 Phelps  证明了。 若  X  是 Asplund 空间, 则  $X^{*}$  有 RNP。1978 年,Stegal  指出这个定理之逆也成立。 于是有定理 2 Banach 空间  X  是 Asplund 空间，当且仅当  $X^{*}$  有 RNP。因l 是可分的 Banach 空间, 故据定理  1, l  是 弱 Asplund 空间。 然而  $l^{*}=l^{\infty}$ , 而  $l^{\infty}$  不具有 RNP,故据定理  2, l  不是 Asplund 空间。

statement: There exists a bijective operator T on some Hilbert space, $T_{n}$, such that $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ strongly converges to T, but $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$ does not strongly converge to $T^{-1}$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个Hilbert空间上的双射算子  T, $T_{n}$ , 使  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  强收敛于  T , 而  $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$  不强收敛于  $T^{-1}$ 。
rationale: It can be proven that if $T_{n}$ and T are both bounded linear bijective operators on a Hilbert space, and $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ uniformly converges to T, then $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$ must uniformly converge to $T^{-1}$. In fact, at this point $\left\{\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\right\}$ must be bounded. Hence, by the inequality $\begin{aligned}\left\|T_{n}^{-1}-T^{-1}\right\| & =\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\left(T-T_{n}\right)T^{-1}\right\| \\& \leqslant\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\left\|T-T_{n}\right\|\left\|T^{-1}\right\|\end{aligned}$, it directly follows that $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$ uniformly converges to $T^{-1}$. However, $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ strongly converging to T does not imply that $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$ strongly converges to $T^{-1}$. For example, for $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$, let $T = I$ (identity operator), $T_{n} x=\left(\xi_{1}, \cdots, \xi_{n-1}, \frac{\xi_{n}}{n}, \xi_{n+1}, \cdots\right)$, then both $T$ and $T_{n}$ are bijective. Hence, $T$ and $T_{n}$ are bijective, and $\left\|T_{n} x - T x\right\|=\left(1- \frac{1}{n}\right)\left|\xi_{n}\right| \rightarrow 0 \quad(n \rightarrow \infty)$, meaning $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ strongly converges to T. However, since $\left\{\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\right\}$ is unbounded, $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$ cannot strongly converge to $T^{-1}$.
chinese_rationale: 可以证明, 若  $T_{n}$ ,  T  都是 Hilbert 空间上双射的有界线性算子,且  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  一致收敛于  T , 则  $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$  必定一致收敛于  $T^{-1}$ 。 其实, 此时 $\left\{\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\right\}$  必定有界，于是由不等式$\begin{aligned}\left\|T_{n}^{-1}-T^{-1}\right\| & =\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\left(T-T_{n}\right) T^{-1}\right\| \\& \leqslant\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\left\|T-T_{n}\right\|\left\|T^{-1}\right\|\end{aligned}$直接得到  $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$  一致收敛于  $T^{-1}$ 。 但  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  强收敛于  T  并不蕴涵  $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$  强收敛于  $T^{-1}$ 。 例如, 对  $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$ , 令  $T=I$  （恒等算子）,  $T_{n} x=\left(\xi_{1}, \cdots, \xi_{n-1}, \frac{\xi_{n}}{n}, \xi_{n+1}, \cdots\right)$ , 则  $T, T_{n}$  均是一对一的满射，即  $T, T_{n}$  都是双射，且$\left\|T_{n} x-T x\right\|=\left(1-\frac{1}{n}\right)\left|\xi_{n}\right| \rightarrow 0 \quad(n \rightarrow \infty)$,即  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  强收敛于  T 。 然而由于  $\left\{\left\|T_{n}^{-1}\right\|\right\}$  无界, 故  $\left\{T_{n}^{-1}\right\}$  不可能强收敛于  $T^{-1}$ 。

statement: There exists a sequence of points $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ in a normed linear space such that $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges weakly to $x_{0}$ and $\left\|\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\| \rightarrow \| x_{0} \|$, but $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ does not converge strongly to $x_{0}$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个赋范线性空间中的点列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ , 使  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于  $x_{0}$  且  $\left\|\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\| \rightarrow \| x_{0} \|$ , 但  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  并不强收敛于  $x_{0}$ 。
rationale: It can be proven that if X is a uniformly convex normed linear space, then $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset X$ converges strongly to $x_{0} \in X$ if and only if $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges weakly to $x_{n}$ and $\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow \|x_{0} \|$. This statement does not hold for non-uniformly convex normed linear spaces. For example, consider $x_{n}=(1, \cdots, 1,0, \cdots)$ and $x_{0}=(1,1, \cdots)$ in the Banach space c. For any $f=\left\{f_{i}\right\} \in c^{*}=l$, we have $f\left(x_{n}\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{n} f_{i} \rightarrow \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} f_{i}=f\left(x_{0}\right)(n \rightarrow \infty)$, hence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges weakly to $x_{0}$. Moreover, $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$, so $\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow \left\|x_{0}\right\|$. However, $\left\|x_{n}-x_{0}\right\|=\|(0, \cdots, 0,1,1, \cdots)\|=1$, indicating that $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ does not converge strongly to $x_{0}$.
chinese_rationale: 可以证明,若  X  是一个一致凸的赋范线性空间,  $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset X$ , 则为使  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  强收敛于  $x_{0} \in X$ , 当且仅当  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于  $x_{n}$  且  $\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow  \|x_{0} \|$ 。 对于非一致凸的赋范线性空间, 这一陈述并不成立。 例如,在Banach空间c 中取  $x_{n}=(1, \cdots, 1,0, \cdots), x_{0}=(1,1, \cdots)$ 。 任取  $f=\left\{f_{i}\right\} \in c^{*}=l$ , 均有 $f\left(x_{n}\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{n} f_{i} \rightarrow \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} f_{i}=f\left(x_{0}\right)(n \rightarrow \infty)$ , 故  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于  $x_{0}$ 。 又,  $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1 $, 故  $\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow\left\|x_{0}\right\| $。 但$\left\|x_{n}-x_{0}\right\|=\|(0, \cdots, 0,1,1, \cdots)\|=1$,可见  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  不强收敛于  $x_{0}$ 。

statement: $R^{2}$ in an absorbing set, It is not absorbing in the complex plane.
chinese_statement: $R^{2}$  中的一个吸收集， 它在复平面内并不吸收。
rationale: Let $B_{1}$ and $B_{2}$ be the unit closed disks on the plane centered at (1, 0) and (-1, 0) respectively. C is the closed line segment with endpoints at (0, -1) and (0, 1). Let $A = B_{1} \cup B_{2} \cup C$, then A, as a subset of real space $\mathbf{R}^{2}$, is evidently an absorbing set. However, as a subset of the complex plane, it is no longer an absorbing set because no matter how small a positive number r is, A cannot contain a disk centered at the origin with radius r.
chinese_rationale: 设  $B_{1}$  与  $B_{2}$  是平面上的分别以  (1，0)  与  (-1，0)  为中心 的单位闭圆盘，  C  是以  (0，-1)  与  (0，1)  为端点的闭直线段。 令  $A=B_{1} \cup B_{2}   \cup C$ ， 则  A  作为实空间  $\mathbf{R}^{2}$  的子集， 它显然是一个吸收 集。 但作为复平面的子集， 它不再是吸收集了， 这是因为对于无论多么小的正数  r， A  不能包含以  r  为半径， 中心在原点的圆盘。

statement: There exists a series in some Banach space that is unconditionally convergent but not absolutely convergent.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Banach 空间中无条件收敛而非绝对收敛的级数。
rationale: It can be proven that for a series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$ in a Banach space to be unconditionally convergent, if and only if every series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \eta_{n} x_{n}$ (where $\eta_{n}=0$ or $1$) converges. Furthermore, it is easy to prove that any absolutely convergent series in a Banach space must be unconditionally convergent. However, the converse is not true, as demonstrated by Thorp${ }^{[310]}$. Consider the sequence of points $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ in the Banach space C[0, 1]: $x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0, & 0 \leq t \leq \frac{1}{(2n+1)} \text{ or } \frac{1}{(2n-1)} \leq t \leq 1, \\\frac{1}{n}, & t=\frac{1}{2n}, \\\text{ linear, } & \frac{1}{(2n+1)} \leq t \leq \frac{1}{2n} \text{ or } \frac{1}{2n} \leq t \leq \frac{1}{(2n-1)}.\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, the function series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}(t)$ converges uniformly on the interval [0, 1], which means that for any $\varepsilon>0$, there exists a positive integer $n_{0}$ such that when $p, q \geq n_{0}$, $\sum_{n=p}^{q} x_{n}(t)<\varepsilon$. Therefore, $\sup_{0<i<1}\left|\sum_{n=p}^{s} i_{n} x_{n}(t)\right| \leq \varepsilon$. Hence, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$ is unconditionally convergent in C[0, 1]. On the other hand, since $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\|x_{n}\right\|=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty$, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$ is not absolutely convergent.
chinese_rationale: 可以证明， 为使 Banach 空间中的级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$  是无 条 件收敛的， 当且仅当每个级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \eta_{n} x_{n}$  (其中  $\eta_{n}=0  或 1$)都收敛。 此外， 还容易证明，Banach 空间中绝对收敛的级数必定是无条件收敛的。然而逆命题并不成立， Thorp  ${ }^{[310]}$  有例如下:在 Banach空间  C[0，1]  中考虑点列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  :$x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{(2 n+1)} \text { 或 } \frac{1}{(2 n-1)} \leqslant t \leqslant 1， \\\frac{1}{n}， & t=\frac{1}{2 n}， \\\text { 线性， } & \frac{1}{(2 n+1)} \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{2 n} \text { 或 } \frac{1}{2 n} \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{(2 n-1)} .\end{array}\right.$易见，函数项级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}(t)$  在区间  [0，1]  上是一致收敛的，从而对任意  $\varepsilon>0$ ，存在正整数  $n_{0}$ ， 当  $p， q \geqslant n_{0}$  时就有$\sum_{n=p}^{q} x_{n}(t)<\varepsilon$ 。所以$\sup _{0<i<1}\left|\sum_{n=p}^{s} i_{n} x_{n}(t)\right| \leqslant \varepsilon$因此， 级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$  在  C[0，1]  中是无条件收敛的。 另一方面， 因为$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\|x_{n}\right\|=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty$，所以  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$  并不绝对收敛。

statement: There exists conjugate space of a Banach space is $weak^{*}$ separable but has no $weak^{*}$ basis.
chinese_statement: 一个 Banach 空间的共轭空间， 它弱$^{*}$可分而没有弱$^{*}$基。
rationale: Example: Take $X = l^{\infty}$, then $X^{*} = \left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$. For $x = \left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in X$, let $f_{n}(x) = \xi_{n}$. Clearly, $\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset X^{*}$, and the $weak^{*}$ closed linear span of $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ is $X^{*}$, hence $X^{*}$ is $weak^{*}$ separable. We now prove that there is no $weak^{*}$ basis in $X^{*}$. Suppose there is a $weak^{*}$ basis $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ in $X^{*}$, then for each $f \in X^{*}$, there exists a unique sequence $\left\{\alpha_{n}\right\}$ such that for any $x \in X$, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left[f(x)-\sum_{i=1}^{n} \alpha_{i} f_{i}(x)\right]=0$. Since $X^{*}=\left(l^{\infty}\right)*$ and $weak^{*}$ convergence of sequences in $X^{*}$ is equivalent to weak convergence , for any $F \in\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{**}$, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} F\left(f-\sum_{i=1}^{n} \alpha_{i} f_{i}\right)=0$. This implies that $\left(l^{*}\right)^{*}$ is weakly separable, therefore $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$ is separable. However, this is impossible because $l^{\infty}$ is not separable. Therefore, there is no $weak^{*}$ basis in $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$. Note: Singer  also constructed a $weak^{*}$ sequence separable but with no $weak^{*}$ Schauder basis conjugate space.
chinese_rationale: 例子如下: 取  $X=l^{\infty}$ ， 则  $X^{*}=\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$ 。 对  $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in X$ ， 令  $f_{n}(x)=   \xi_{n}$ 。显然，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset X^{*}$ ， 且  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  的弱$^{*}$闭线性包就是  $X^{*}$ ， 故  $X^{*}$  是弱$^{*}$可分的。兹证  $X^{*}$  中不存在弱$^{*}$基。如果  X $^{*}$  中存在弱$^{*}$基  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  ，那么对每一  $f \in X^{*}$ ， 存在唯一的数列  $\left\{\alpha_{n}\right\}$ ， 使对任一  $x \in X$ ， 都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left[f(x)-\sum_{i=1}^{n} \alpha_{i} f_{i}(x)\right]=0$ 。因  $X^{*}=\left(l^{\infty}\right) *$  中点列的弱$^{*}$收敛与弱收敛是等价的 (参看第四章例  34) ， 故对任一  $F \in\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{* *}$ ， 也有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} F\left(f-\sum_{i=1}^{n} \alpha_{i} f_{i}\right)=0$ 。这就说明了  $\left(l^{*}\right)^{*}$  是弱可分的， 从而  $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$  是可分的（参看 [37]， p. 134)。然而这是不可能的， 因为  $l^{\infty}$  并不可分。 因此，  $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$  中不存在弱$^{*}$基。注 Singer  ${ }^{[286]}$  还构造了一个弱$^{*}$序列可分而没有弱$^{*}$ Schauder 基的共轭空间。

statement: There exists a continuous image of a reflexive space, which is not a reflexive space.
chinese_statement: 存在一个自反空间的连续象, 它不是自反空间。
rationale: Let $I$ be the identity operator from the reflexive Banach space $l^{2}$ to $c_{0}$. Since $c_{0}$ does not contain any infinite-dimensional reflexive subspaces, $I\left(l^{2}\right)$ is not a reflexive space.
chinese_rationale: 设  $I$  是自反 Banach 空间  $l^{2}$  到  $c_{0}$  内的恒等算子。 由于  $c_{0}$  不含有无穷维的自反子空间, 故  $I\left(l^{2}\right)$  不是自反空间。

statement: There exists a closed, convex, equilibrium absorbing set that is nowhere dense in a normed linear space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个赋范线性空间中的无处稠密的闭的凸均衡吸收集。
rationale: Taking the norm $\|x\|=\sup _{k}\left|\xi_{k}\right| , x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in E^{\infty}$ on $E^{\infty}$, then $\left(E^{\infty}, \| \cdot \| \right)$ is a normed linear space. Let $A=\left\{ x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} : \left| \sum _{k=1} ^{n} \xi_{k} \right| \leqslant 1, n=1,2, \cdots \right\}$, A is evidently a convex equilibrium set. Because for any $x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in E^{\infty}, x \neq 0$, let $t= \sum _{k=1} ^{\infty}\left \{\hat {\xi}_{k}\right \}$, when $0 <\varepsilon <\frac{1}{t}$, then $\begin{aligned} \left| \sum _{k=1} ^{n} \varepsilon \xi_{k} \right| & <\left| \sum _{k=1} ^{n} \frac{\xi_{k}}{t}\right| \\& \leqslant \frac{\sum _{k=1} ^{n}\left| \xi_{k}\right|}{\sum _{k=1} ^{\infty}\left| \xi_{k}\right|} \\& \leqslant 1, \end{aligned}$ thus $\varepsilon x \in A$, i.e., A is absorbing. Also, because $A= \bigcap _{n=1} ^{\infty} \left\{ x: \left| \sum _{k=1} ^{n} \xi_{k} \right| \leqslant 1\right\}$, A is a closed set. It follows that A has no interior point, hence it is a nowhere dense set. (i) The zero element is not an interior point of A. In fact, we have \begin{aligned} \left\|\frac{2}{n} \sum_{k=1} ^{n} e_{k}\right\| & = \left\| \left( \frac{2}{n}, \cdots, \frac{2}{n}, 0, 0, \cdots \right)\right\| \\& = \frac{2}{n} \rightarrow 0 (n \rightarrow \infty), \end{aligned} while for each n, there is $\left| \sum_{k=1} ^{n} \frac{2}{n}\right|=2$, that is $\left( \frac{2}{n}, \cdots, \frac{2}{n}, 0, \cdots \right) \notin A$. It follows that $0 \in A$. (ii) Any $x \in E^{\infty}$ is not an interior point of A. We first prove the equation: $B( x, r) -B( x, r) =B( 0,2r)$, where $B( x, r)= \{y :\| x-y\| <r\}$. Let $y \in B( 0,2r)$, then \|$y\| <2r$. Let $u= x+\frac{y}{2}, v= x-\frac{y}{2}$, then $u, v \in B( x, r)$, and $y= u-v$, so $y \in B( x, r) -B( x, r)$. Conversely, let $y \in B( x, r) -B( x, r)$, i.e., $\left( x+\frac{y}{2}\right) -\left( x-\frac{y}{2}\right) \in B( x, r) -B( x, r)$, then $\left\| \frac{y}{2}\right\| <r$, thus $\| y \| <2r$, i.e., $y \in B( 0,2r)$. We then show that x is not an interior point of A. If x is an interior point of A, then there will be $B( x, r) \subset A$. Since A is a convex set, $A=\frac{1}{2}( A+A)$; also A is balanced, so $A=-A$. Thus we get $A=\frac{1}{2}( A+A)=\frac{1}{2}( A-A)\begin {array} {l} \supset \frac{1}{2}[ B( x, r)-B( x, r)] \\=\frac{1}{2} B( 0,2r) \\=B( 0, r) . \end{array}$ Therefore, 0 is an interior point of A, which contradicts (i).
chinese_rationale: 在  $E^{\infty}$  上取范数  $\|x\|=\sup _{k}\left|\xi_{k}\right|， x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in E^{\infty}$ ， 则  $\left(E^{\infty}，\|\cdot\|\right)$  为一赋范线性空间。令$A=\left\{x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\}:\left|\sum_{k=1}^{n} \xi_{k}\right| \leqslant 1， n=1，2， \cdots\right\}$， A  显然是凸的均衡集。 因对任意  $x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in E^{\infty}， x \neq 0$ ， 令  $t=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left\{\hat{\xi}_{k}\right\}$ ， 当  $0<\varepsilon<\frac{1}{t}$  时， 有$\begin{aligned}\left|\sum_{k=1}^{n} \varepsilon \xi_{k}\right| & <\left|\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{\xi_{k}}{t}\right| \\& \leqslant \frac{\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left|\xi_{k}\right|}{\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{k}\right|} \\& \leqslant 1，\end{aligned}$故  $\varepsilon x \in A$ ， 即  A  是吸收的。 又因为$A=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\{x:\left|\sum_{k=1}^{n} \xi_{k}\right| \leqslant 1\right\}$，所以  A  是闭集。 兹证  A  没有内点， 从而它是一个无处稠密集。（i）零元素不是  A  的内点。事实上，我们有$\begin{aligned}\left\|\frac{2}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} e_{k}\right\| & =\left\|\left(\frac{2}{n}， \cdots， \frac{2}{n}， 0，0， \cdots\right)\right\| \\& =\frac{2}{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)，\end{aligned}$而对每一  n ， 都有  $\left|\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{2}{n}\right|=2$ ， 即  $\left(\frac{2}{n}， \cdots， \frac{2}{n}， 0， \cdots\right) \notin A$ 。 由 此可知，  $0 \in A$ 。(ii) 任意  $x \in E^{\infty}$  都不是  A  的内点。 我们先证明等式:$B(x， r)-B(x， r)=B(0，2 r)$，其中  $B(x， r)=\{y:\|x-y\|<r\}$ 。 设  $y \in B(0，2 r)$ ， 则  $\|y\|<2r$。 令  $u=x+\frac{y}{2}， v=x-\frac{y}{2}$ ， 则  $u， v \in B(x， r)$ ， 且  $y=u-v$ ， 故$y \in B(x， r)-B(x， r)$ 。反之， 设  $y \in B(x， r)-B(x， r)$ ， 即$\left(x+\frac{y}{2}\right)-\left(x-\frac{y}{2}\right) \in B(x， r)-B(x， r)$，则  $\left\|\frac{y}{2}\right\|<r$ ， 从而  $\|y \|<2 r$ ， 即  $y \in B(0，2 r)$ 。我们再证  x  不是  A  的内点。 假若  x  是  A  的内点， 那么将存在  $B(x， r) \subset A$ 。 由于  A  是凸集， 故  $A=\frac{1}{2}(A+A)$ ;  又  A  是均衡的， 故  $A=-A$  。于是得到$A=\frac{1}{2}(A+A)=\frac{1}{2}(A-A)\begin{array}{l}\supset \frac{1}{2}[B(x， r)-B(x， r)] \\=\frac{1}{2} B(0，2 r) \\=B(0， r) .\end{array}$因此， 0 是  A  的内点， 这与 (i)发生矛盾。

statement: There exists a strongly convergent but not uniformly convergent bounded linear subsequence.
chinese_statement: 存在强收敛而不一致收敛的有界线性集子列。
rationale: For example, consider the Banach space $l^{p}(p \geqslant 1)$. For each $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^p$, let $T_{n} x=x_{n}, n=1,2, \cdots$, where $x_{n}=\left(\xi_{n}, \xi_{n+1}, \cdots\right)$. It is not difficult to see that $T_{n}$ is a bounded linear operator from $l^{p}$ to $l^{p}$, and $\left\|T_{n}\right\| \leqslant 1$. Note that for each $x \in l^{p}$, we have $\left\|T_{n} x\right\|=\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$, so $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ strongly converges to the zero operator. On the other hand, if we take $e_{n}=(0, \cdots, 0,1,0 , \cdots)$, then $\left\|e_{n}\right\|=1$ and $T_{n} e_{n}=(1,0,0, \cdots)$, thus $\left\|T_{n}\right\| \geqslant\left\|T_{n} e_{n}\right\|=1$. Therefore, $\left\|T_{n}\right\|=1, n=1,2, \cdots$, so $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$ does not uniformly converge to the zero operator.
chinese_rationale: 例如， 考虑 Banach 空间  $l^{p}(p \geqslant 1)$ 。 对每一  $x=\left(\xi_{1}， \xi_{2}， \cdots， \xi_{n}， \cdots\right) \in l^p$ ， 令  $T_{n} x=x_{n}， n=1，2， \cdots$ ，这里，  $x_{n}=\left(\xi_{n}， \xi_{n+1}， \cdots\right)$ 。 不难看出，  $T_{n}$  是  $l^{p}$  到  $l^{p}$  内的有界线性算子，且  $\left\|T_{n}\right\| \leqslant 1$ 。 注意到对每一  $x \in l^{p}$ ， 有$\left\|T_{n} x\right\|=\left\|x_{n}\right\| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$，故  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  强收敛于零算 子。 另一方面， 若取  $e_{n}=(0， \cdots， 0，1，0 ，  \cdots)$ ， 则  $\left\|e_{n}\right\|=1$  且  $T_{n} e_{n}=(1，0，0， \cdots)$ ， 故$\left\|T_{n}\right\| \geqslant\left\|T_{n} e_{n}\right\|=1$ 。因此，  $\left\|T_{n}\right\|=1， n=1，2， \cdots$ ， 可见  $\left\{T_{n}\right\}$  不一致收敛于零算子。

statement: There exists a non-strictly singular operator whose adjoint is a strictly singular operator.
chinese_statement: 存在某个非严格奇异算子,其共轭算子是严格奇异算子。
rationale: Let $X=l, Y=l^{2}$, B be the continuous linear operator from X to Y, then $T=E^{*}$ is a non-strictly singular operator. Because $T^{*}=B^{**}$ is a continuous linear operator from $X^{**}$ to the reflexive Banach space $Y^{**}=l^{2}$, and $X^{**}$ is isometrically isomorphic to the space $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$, $T^{*}$ is a strictly singular operator.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=l, Y=l^{2}$, B  为  X  到  Y  上的连续线性算子, 则  $T=E^{*}$  为非严格奇异算子 。 因为  $T^{*}=B^{* *}$  为  $X^{* *}$  到自反 Banach  空间  $Y^{* *}=l^{2}$  的连续线性算子, 且  $X^{* *}$  等距同构于空间  $\left(l^{\infty}\right)^{*}$ ,故  $T^{*}$  是严格奇异算子。

statement: There exists a zero-measure metric subspace in $\mathbf{R}^{2}$, such that the boundary of one of its dense open subsets is an uncountable set.
chinese_statement: 存在$\mathbf{R}^{2}$的一个测度为零的度量子空间，它的某个稠密开集的边界为不可数集。
rationale: Let C be the Cantor ternary set in [0,1]. Take the usual metric on $X=C\times C$, then the Lebesgue measure of X is zero. Let $A=\{(a,b):(a,b)\in C\times C, b\neq 0\}$, then A is a dense open subset of X. Since the boundary of A is $C\times\{0\}$, it is an uncountable set.
chinese_rationale: 设C为[0,1]中的Cantor三分集，在$X=C\times C$上取通常距离，则X的Lebesgue测度为零。令$A=\{(a,b):(a,b)\in C\times C,b\neq 0\}$，则A是X的稠密的开子集。因A的边界是$C\times\{0\}$,故它是一个不可数集。

statement: There exists a non-reflexive Banach space whose unit closed ball's extreme points are uncountable.
chinese_statement: 存在不自反的 Banach 空间， 它的单位闭球的端点不可数。
rationale: We have the famous Lindenstrauss-Phelps theorem: If X is an infinite-dimensional reflexive Banach space, A is a bounded closed convex set, and $A \neq \empty$, then ext A is uncountable. It should be noted that the converse of this statement is not true. For example, the extreme points of the unit closed ball of the Banach space $l^\infty$ are uncountable, but $l^\infty$ is not reflexive.
chinese_rationale: 我们有著名的 Lindenstrauss-Phelps 定理：若  X  是无穷维自反 Banach 空间，  A  是有界闭凸集， 且  $A \neq \varnothing$ ， 则  $\operatorname{ext} A$  是不可数的， 应当注意， 这个命题之逆不真。例如， Banach 空间  $l^{\infty}$  的单位闭球的端点不可数，但  $l^{\infty}$  并不自反。

statement: There exists an infinite-dimensional normed linear space in which the strong and weak convergence of sequences are equivalent.
chinese_statement: 存在某个无穷维赋范线性空间， 其中点列的强、弱收敛性是等价的。
rationale: We know that in a normed linear space, a strongly convergent sequence must be weakly convergent, but not vice versa. $Schur^{[279]}$ pointed out that there indeed exists such an infinite-dimensional Banach space where the strong and weak convergence of sequences are equivalent. He pointed out that the sequence space l is such a space. To illustrate this fact, we need to prove that a weakly convergent sequence in l must be strongly convergent. Suppose $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset l$ converges weakly to 0, where $x_{n}=\left\{\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right\}_{i=1}^{\infty}$, meaning for any $y= \left\{a_{i}\right\}_{i=1}^{\infty} \in l^{\infty}$, we have $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{(n)} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. We need to prove $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. Suppose there exists $\varepsilon_{0}>0$ and $n_{1}<n_{2}<\cdots< n_{k}<\cdots$ such that $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right| \geqslant \varepsilon_{0}, k=1,2, \cdots$. Assume the inequality holds for any $n_{k}$. First, from $x_{n} \in l$, we know for each n, $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right|<+\infty$. Hence, for each n, $\sum_{j=i}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{j}^{(n)}\right| \rightarrow 0(i \rightarrow \infty)$. Secondly, since $x_{n}=\left\{\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right\}_{i=1}^{\infty}(n=1,2, \cdots)$ converges weakly to 0, if we take $y=\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots\right)=(0, \cdots, 0,1,0, \cdots) \in l^{\infty}$, with 1 in the j-th position, then for any j, $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{(n)}=\xi_{j}^{(n)} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. Thus, for any fixed $i_{1}$, there must be an $n_{1}$ such that $\sum_{i=1}^{i_{1}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$; from $\left(\xi_{1}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}, \xi_{2}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}, \cdots, \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}, \cdots\right) \in l$, there exists $i_{2}>i_{1}$ such that $\sum_{i=i_{2}+1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$. Thus, $\begin{aligned}\sum_{i=i_{1}+1}^{i_{2}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right| & =\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right|-\sum_{i=1}^{i_{1}}\left|i_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right|-\sum_{i=i_{2}-1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}\right| \\& >\frac{3 \varepsilon_{0}}{5} .\end{aligned}For i_{2}$, there exists $n_{2}>n_{1}$ such that $\sum_{i=1}^{i_{2}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{2}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$. From $x_{n_{2}}=\left(\xi_{1}^{\left(n_{2}\right)}, \xi_{2}^{\left(n_{2}\right)}, \cdots\right) \in l$, there exists $i_{3}>i_{2}$ such that $\sum_{i=i_{3}+1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{2}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$; therefore, $\sum_{i=i_{2}+1}^{i_{3}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{2}\right)}\right|>\frac{3 \varepsilon_{0}}{5}$. By induction, we know for any $i_{k}>i_{k-1}$, there exists $n_{k}>n_{k-1}$ such that $\sum_{i=1}^{i k}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$; because $x_{n_{k}}=\left(\xi_{1}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \xi_{2}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \cdots, \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \cdots\right) \in l$, there exists $i_{k+1}>i_{k}$ such that $\sum_{i=i_{k+1}}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}$. Continuing in this way, we obtain a subsequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$, $\left\{x_{n_{k}}\right\}$, where $x_{n_{k}}= \left\{\xi_{1}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \xi_{2}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \cdots, \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, \cdots\right)$, and the sequence of indices $\left\{i_{k}\right\}$ and $\left\{n_{k}\right\}$, satisfying $i_{k}<i_{k+1}, n_{k}<n_{k+1}, k=1,2, \cdots,\begin{array}{l}\begin{array}{c}\sum_{i=1}^{i_{k}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}, \quad \sum_{i=i_{k+1}+1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|<\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5}, \\\sum_{i=i_{k}+1}^{i k+1}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|>\frac{3 \varepsilon_{0}}{5} . \\\text { Let } \quad a_{i}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\operatorname{sgn} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{1}\right)}, & i_{1} \leqslant i \leqslant i_{2}, \\\operatorname{sgn} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}, & i_{k}<i \leqslant i_{k+1}, k=2,3, \cdots .\end{array}\right.\end{array}\\\text { Then }\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{i}, \cdots\right) \in l^{\infty} \text {, and for any } k \text {, }\end{array}\begin{array}{c}\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}=\sum_{i=1}^{i_{k}} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}+\sum_{i=i_{k}+1}^{i_{k+1}} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}+\sum_{i=i_{k+1}+1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)} \\\geqslant-\sum_{i=1}^{i_{k}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|+\sum_{i=i_{k}+1}^{i_{k+1}}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right|-\sum_{i=i_{k+1}+1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)}\right| \\>\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{5} .\end{array}$. This contradicts with $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{(n)} \rightarrow 0$. Hence $\left.\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{\left(n_{k}\right)} \rightarrow 0\right)$ is contradictory.

l$  弱收敛于 0 ， 其中  $x_{n}=\left\{\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right\}_{i=1}^{\infty}$ ， 即对任意  $y=   \left\{a_{i}\right\}_{i=1}^{\infty} \in l^{\infty}$ ， 都有$\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \xi_{i}^{(n)} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ 。要证明  $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}^{(n)}\right| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ 。 反设存在  $\varepsilon_{0}>0$  及  $n_{1}<n_{2}<\cdots<   n_{k}<\cdots$ ，
