chinese_rationale: 例如， 取  X=L[0，1] ，  $X^{*}=L^{\infty}[0，1]$ 。 显然，  C[0，1]  是  $L^{\infty}[0，1]$  的闭的真子空间。 C[0，1]  在  $L^{\infty}[0，1]$  中是弱^{*}序列稠密的， 因为对任一  $f \in   L^{\infty}[0，1]$ ， 由 Лузин 定理， 存在  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset C[0，1]$ ， 使  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  测度收敛于  f ， 从而对任一  $x \in L[0，1]$ ， 有$f_{n}(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(t) x(i) d t \rightarrow \int_{0}^{1} f(t) x(t) d t=f(x)$ 。即  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  弱^{*}收敛于  f  。 C[0，1]  不是弱^{*}序列闭的。 如 若不然， 就有  C[0，1] 。  $L^{\infty}[0，1]$ ， 此为不可能。

statement: There exist vector-valued functions with weakly bounded variation but not strongly bounded variation.
chinese_statement: 存在弱有界变差而不强有界变差的向量值函数。
rationale: Example: Let X be the linear space of all bounded complex-valued functions $x(t)$ defined on the interval [0,1] with the usual linear operations. For $x \in X$, let $\|x\|=\sup _{0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1}|x(t)|$, then X is a Banach space. Next, we define the vector-valued function from the interval [0,1] to X, $\varphi(\xi)=x_{\xi}(t)$ as follows: $\varphi(\xi)=x_{\xi}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant \xi, \\0, & \xi<t \leqslant 1, \\1, & \xi=1 .\end{array}\right.$ For any finite number of pairwise disjoint intervals $\left(a_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)(i=1,2, \cdots , n)$ in [0,1] and any $f \in X^{*}$, we have $\begin{array}{l}\left|f\left\{\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left[\varphi\left(\beta_{i}\right)-\varphi\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right]\right\}\right| \\\quad \leqslant\|f\|\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left[\varphi\left(\beta_{i}\right)-\varphi\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right]\right\| \\\leqslant\|f\| .\end{array}$ Therefore, $\varphi(\xi)$ is a weakly bounded variation function on [0,1]. On the other hand, for any $\xi, \eta \in[0,1]$, when $\xi \neq \eta$, we have $\|\varphi(\xi)-\varphi(\eta)\|=1$, hence $\varphi(\xi)$ is not strongly bounded variation. This example is attributed to Гелъфанд.
chinese_rationale: 例： 设  X  是定义在区间  [0,1]  上的一切有界复值函数  $x(t)$  按通常线性运算所成的线性空间，对  $x \in X$  ，令$\|x\|=\sup _{0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1}|x(t)|$,则  X  为Banach空间。 其次，我们定义由区间  [0,1]  到  X  的向量值函数  $\varphi(\xi)=x_{\xi}(t)$  如下:$\varphi(\xi)=x_{\xi}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant \xi, \\0, & \xi<t \leqslant 1, \\1, & \xi=1 .\end{array}\right.$对于  [0,1]  中任取有限个两两不相交的区间  $\left(a_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)(i=1,2, \cdots ,  n)$  以及任一  $f \in X^{*}$ , 我们有$\begin{array}{l}\left|f\left\{\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left[\varphi\left(\beta_{i}\right)-\varphi\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right]\right\}\right| \\\quad \leqslant\|f\|\left\|\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left[\varphi\left(\beta_{i}\right)-\varphi\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right]\right\| \\\leqslant\|f\| .\end{array}$因此,  $\varphi(\xi)$  是  [0,1]  上的弱有界变差函数。另一方面，对于任取的  $\xi, \eta \in[0,1]$ , 当  $\xi \neq \eta$  时有$\|\varphi(\xi)-\varphi(\eta)\|=1$,故  $\varphi(\xi)$  不是强有界变差的。这个例子属于 Гелъфанд 。

statement: There exist two positive operators such that their product is not a normal operator.
chinese_statement: 存在两个正算子, 其积不是正规算子。
rationale: Let $S=\left(\begin{array}{ll}13 & 12 \\12 & 13\end{array}\right), \quad T=\left(\begin{array}{cc}16 & 0 \\0 & 49\end{array}\right)$, then both S and T are positive operators. However, $ST=\left(\begin{array}{ll}208 & 588 \\192 & 637\end{array}\right),(ST)^{*}=\left(\begin{array}{ll}208 & 192 \\588 & 637\end{array}\right)$, thus $(ST)^{*}(ST) \ne (ST)(ST)^{*}$, i.e., ST is not a normal operator, similarly it can be proven that TS is also not a normal operator. Note that it can be proven that the product of two commuting normal operators is still a normal operator. The above counterexample shows that in this proposition, the condition of operators commuting cannot be removed, and if removed, even when $\operatorname{dim} H=2$, there exist two positive operators S, T, whose products ST and TS are both not normal operators.
chinese_rationale: 设$S=\left(\begin{array}{ll}13 & 12 \\12 & 13\end{array}\right), \quad T=\left(\begin{array}{cc}16 & 0 \\0 & 49\end{array}\right)$,则  S, T  均为正算子。 而$S T=\left(\begin{array}{ll}208 & 588 \\192 & 637\end{array}\right),(S T)^{*}=\left(\begin{array}{ll}208 & 192 \\588 & 637\end{array}\right)$,故$(S T)^{*}(S T) \ne (S T)(S T)^{*}$ ，即 S T 不是正规算子，同理可证  T S  也不是正规算子。注 可以证明，两个可换的正规算子之积仍是正规算子，上述反例表明了在这个命题中，算子可换的条件不能去掉，去掉之后, 甚至当  $\operatorname{dim} H=2$  时, 就存在两个正算子  S, T , 其积  S T  与  T S 均不是正规算子。

statement: There exists a set in a normed linear space that is weakly sequentially complete but not weakly sequentially compact.
chinese_statement: 存在赋范线性空间中弱序列完备而不弱序列紧的集合。
rationale: Consider the unit closed ball $B$ in the Banach space $l$, and take any weakly Cauchy sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset B$. Since strong and weak convergence in $l$ are equivalent, $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is also a usual Cauchy sequence in $l$. Therefore, by the completeness of $l$, the limit of $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ exists and still belongs to $B$. This indicates that $B$ is weakly sequentially complete. On the other hand, consider the sequence $\left\{e_{n}\right\}$ in $B$, where $e_{n} = (0, \cdots, 0, 1, 0, \cdots)$. For any subsequence $\left\{e_{n_{k}}\right\}$, take $f = \left(f_{1}, f_{2}, \cdots, f_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^{*} = l^{\infty}$, where $f_{n} = \left\{\begin{array}{ll} 1, & n = n_{2m}, m = 1, 2, \cdots ; n = 1, 2, \cdots, \\ 0, & \text{ otherwise } \end{array}\right.$ then $f\left(e_{n_{k}}\right) = 1, k = 2m; f\left(e_{nk}\right) = 0, k = 2m-1$. Therefore, as $k \rightarrow \infty$, $\left\{f\left(e_{n_{k}}\right)\right\}$ does not converge, hence $\left\{e_{nk}\right\}$ is not weakly convergent, meaning $B$ is not weakly sequentially compact.
chinese_rationale: 考虑 Banach 空间  $l$  的单位闭球  $B$ , 并任取 弱 Cauchy 点列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset B$ 。 因  $l$  中点列的强、弱收敛性是等价的, 故  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  即 为  l  中通常的 Cauchy 点列。 于是, 由  l  的完备性即知  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  的极限存在,且该极限仍属于  B 。 此即说明  B  是弱序列完备的。 另一方面, 考虑  B  内的点列  $\left\{e_{n}\right\}$ , 其中  $e_{n}=(0, \cdots, 0,1,0, \cdots)$ 。 对任一子列  $\left\{e_{n_{k}}\right\}$ , 取  $f=\left(f_{1}, f_{2}, \cdots, f_{n}, \cdots\right) \in l^{*}=l^{\infty}$ , 其中$f_{n}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & n=n_{2 m}, m=1,2, \cdots ; n=1,2, \cdots, \\0, & \text { 其它, }\end{array}\right.$则有  $f\left(e_{n_{k}}\right)=1, k=2 m ; f\left(e_{n k}\right)=0, k=2 m-1$ 。 因此, 当  $k \rightarrow \infty$ 时,  $\left\{f\left(e_{n_{k}}\right)\right\}$  无极限存在, 从而更谈不上  $\left\{e_{n k}\right\}$  弱收敛, 即  B  不是弱序列紧的。

statement: There exists a bounded integral operator with a unique eigenvalue $ \lambda=0 $, whose kernel $ K $ has the property $ \left\|K^{n}(s, t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty(n=1,2, \cdots) $.
chinese_statement: 存在某个只有唯一的特征值  $\lambda=0$  的有界积分算子， 其核  K  具有性质$  \left\|K^{n}(s， t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty(n=1，2， \cdots)$ 。
rationale: Define a sequence of functions $ \left\{\varphi_{n}(s)\right\} $ on the interval $[0,1]$ as follows: $\varphi_{1}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2^{\frac{1}{2}}, & 0 \leqslant s<\frac{1}{2}, \\0, & \text{others} \end{array}\right.\begin{array}{l}\boldsymbol{\varphi}_{2}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\left(2^{\frac{1}{2}}\right)^{2}, \frac{1}{2} \leqslant s<\frac{3}{4}, \\0, \text{others} \end{array}\right. \\\varphi_{n}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\left(2^{\frac{1}{2}}\right)^{n}, \frac{\left(2^{n}-2\right)}{2^{n}} \leqslant s<\frac{\left(2^{n}-1\right)}{\textbf{?}^{n}}, \\0, \text{others} \end{array}\right. \\\text{......} \\\end{array}$ Then $\left\{\varphi_{n}(s)\right\}$ is an orthogonal system in $L^{2}[0,1]$, but it is not complete because there exists a function $\varphi(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2^{\frac{1}{3}}, & 0 \leqslant s<\frac{1}{4} \\-2^{\frac{1}{2}}, & \frac{1}{4} \leqslant s<\frac{1}{2} \\0, & \frac{1}{2} \leqslant s \leqslant 1.\end{array}\right.$ in $ L^{2}[0,1] $ orthogonal to every $ \varphi_{n}(s) $. Let $ K(s, t)=\varphi_{2}(s) \varphi_{1}(t)+\varphi_{4}(s) \varphi_{2}(t)+\varphi_{6}(s) \varphi_{3}(t)+\cdots $. It is evident that the integral operator $ Tx(s)=\int_{0}^{1} K(s, t) x(t) dt $ is bounded. Now, we prove that $ T $ has the only eigenvalue $ \lambda=0 $, and $ \left\|K^{n}(s, t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty. (n=1,2, \cdots) $. In fact, for any $ x \in L^{2}[0,1] $, under norm topology, $ x $ can be expressed as: $ x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{1} p_{i}+h $, where $ \left\langle h, \varphi_{i}\right\rangle=0(i=1,2, \cdots) $. Clearly, $ Tx=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{2i} $, hence $ \|Tx \| \leqslant\|x\| $. If $ Tx=\lambda x(\lambda \neq 0) $, then $ \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{2i}=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda \alpha_{i} \varphi_{i}+\lambda h $, thus $ h=0 $ and $ \alpha_{i}=0(i=1,2, \cdots) $, so $ x=0 $, indicating $ \lambda \neq 0 $ is not an eigenvalue of $ T $. If $ Tx=0 \cdot x $, then $ \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \varphi_{2i}=0 $. Therefore, $ a_{i}=0(i=1,2, \cdots) $. Hence, the necessary and sufficient condition for $ x $ to be an eigenvector corresponding to the eigenvalue $ \lambda=0 $ is $ \left\langle x, \varphi_{i}\right\rangle=0(i=1,2, \cdots) $, meaning $ T $ only has the eigenvalue $ \lambda=0 $. Finally, $ T^{n} $ evidently has the kernel $ \begin{aligned}K^{n}(s, t)= & \varphi_{2n}(s) \varphi_{1}(t)+\varphi_{2 \cdot 2^{n}}(s) \varphi_{2}(t) \\& +\varphi_{3 \cdot 2n}(s) \varphi_{3}(t)+\cdots\end{aligned} $ hence, $ \left\|K^{n}(s, t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty $.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0，1]  上定义函数列  $\left\{\varphi_{n}(s)\right\}$  如下:$\varphi_{1}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2^{\frac{1}{2}}， & 0 \leqslant s<\frac{1}{2}， \\0， & \text { 其它， }\end{array}\right.\begin{array}{l}\boldsymbol{\varphi}_{2}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\left(2^{\frac{1}{2}}\right)^{2}， \frac{1}{2} \leqslant s<\frac{3}{4}， \\0， \text { 其它， }\end{array}\right. \\\varphi_{n}(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\left(2^{\frac{1}{2}}\right)^{n}， \frac{\left(2^{n}-2\right)}{2^{n}} \leqslant s<\frac{\left(2^{n}-1\right)}{?^{n}}， \\0， \text { 其它， }\end{array}\right. \\\text {...... } \\\end{array}$则  $\left\{\varphi_{n}(s)\right\}$  是  $L^{2}[0，1]\{$  的一个直交系， 此直交系并不完全， 因 为 $ L^{2}[0，1]$  中的函数$\varphi(s)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2^{\frac{1}{3}}， & 0 \leqslant s<\frac{1}{4} \\-2^{\frac{1}{2}}， & \frac{1}{4} \leqslant s<\frac{1}{2} \\0， & \frac{1}{2} \leqslant s \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$与所有的  $\varphi_{n}(s)$  成直交。 令$K(s， t)=\varphi_{2}(s) \varphi_{1}(t)+\varphi_{4}(s) \varphi_{2}(t)+\varphi_{6}(s) \varphi_{3}(t)+\cdots$ .显然，积分算子$T x(s)=\int_{0}^{1} K(s， t) x(t) d t$是有界的。 兹证T  有唯一的待征徝  $\lambda=0 $， 且 $ \left\|K^{n}(s， t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty .  (n=1，2， \cdots)$ 。 事实上， 对整一  $x \in L^{2}[0，1]$ ， 在范数拓扑下  x  可表成下述形式:$x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{1} p_{i}+h$，这里 $ \left\langle h， \varphi_{i}\right\rangle=0(i=1，2， \cdots) $。 显然，$ T  x=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{2 i}$ ， 因此$\|T  x \|  \leqslant\|x\|$ . 若  $T x=\lambda x(\lambda \neq 0)$ ， 则$\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{2 i}=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda \alpha_{i} \varphi_{i}+\lambda h$，因而  h=0  及  $\alpha_{i}=0(i=1，2， \cdots) $， 故  x=0 ， 即  $\lambda \neq 0 $ 不是  T  的特征值。若 $ T x=0 \cdot x$ ， 则  $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} a_{i} \varphi_{2 i}=0 $。 因此  $a_{i}=0(i=1，2， \cdots)$ 。由此可知，  x  为对应于特征值  $\lambda=0 $ 的特征向量的充要条件是  $\left\langle x， \varphi_{i}\right\rangle=0(i=1，2， \cdots)$ ， 所以  T  仅有的特征值是  $\lambda=0$ 。最后，  $T^{n}$  显然有核$\begin{aligned}K^{n}(s， t)= & \varphi_{2 n}(s) \varphi_{1}(t)+\varphi_{2 \cdot 2^{n}}(s) \varphi_{2}(t) \\& +\varphi_{3 \cdot 2 n}(s) \varphi_{3}(t)+\cdots\end{aligned}$因此，  $\left\|K^{n}(s， t)\right\|_{L^{2}}=+\infty$ 。

statement: Compact operators on Hilbert space are all Hilbert-Schmidt operators.
chinese_statement: Hilbert 空间上的紧算子都是 Hilbert-Schmidt 算子。
rationale: For example: Let $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$ be a complete orthonormal system in the separable Hilbert space H, and define $T \varphi_{n}=n^{-\frac{1}{2}} \varphi_{n} ,  n=1,2, \cdots$. It is obvious that T is compact. However, because $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\|T \varphi_{n}\right\|^{2}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty$, T is not a Hilbert-Schmidt operator.
chinese_rationale: 例如：设  $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$  是可分 Hilbert 空间  H  中的完全的规范直交系, 令  $T \varphi_{n}=n^{-\frac{1}{2}} \varphi_{n} ,  n=1,2, \cdots$  易见，  T  是紧的。 但因$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\|T \varphi_{n}\right\|^{2}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty$,故T不是 Hilbert-Schmidt 算子。

statement: The real number $a(0<a<1)$ in the Riesz's lemma cannot be strengthened to $a=1$.
chinese_statement: Riesz引理中的实数  $a(0<a<1)$  不能加强为  $a=1$ 。
rationale: Riesz's lemma: Let X be a normed linear space, $X_{0}$ is a closed proper subspace of X, then for $0<a<1$, there must exist $x_{a} \in X$, satisfying $\left\|x_{a}\right\|=1$ and $\left\|x_{a}-x\right\| \geqslant a$ for all $x \in X_{0}$. It should be noted that the real number a in Riesz's lemma cannot be taken as 1. For example, let X be the space of all continuous functions $x(t)$ defined on the interval [0,1] and satisfying $x(0)=0$, forming a linear space under usual linear operations. For $x \in X$, let $\|x\|=\max _{0< t< 1 }|x(t)|$, then $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ becomes a Banach space. Let $X_{0}=\{x: x \in X$ and $\int_{0}^{1} x(t) d t=0\}$. It is easy to see that $X_{0}$ is a closed proper subspace of X. We now show that there does not exist $x_{0} \in X$ satisfying $\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$, and $\left\|x_{0}-x\right\| \geqslant 1$ for all $x \in X_{0}$. Suppose there exists $x_{0} \in X$ satisfying $\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$, and $\left\|x_{0}-x\right\| \geqslant 1$ for all $x \in X_{0}$, then for each $y \in X \backslash X_{0}$, if we let $b_{y}=\frac{\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t}{\int_{0}^{1} y(t) d t}$, we have $\int_{0}^{1}\left[x_{0}(t)-b_{y} y(t)\right] d t=0$, so $x_{0}-b_{y} y \in X_{0}$, thus obtaining $1 \leqslant\left\|x_{0}-\left(x_{0}-b_{y} y\right)\right\|=\left\|b_{y} y\right\|$, i.e., $\frac{1}{\left|b_{y}\right|} \leqslant\|y\|$. According to the definition of $b_{y}$, through simple calculations we have $\begin{aligned}\left|\int_{0}^{1} y(t) d t\right| & =\frac{\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|}{\left|b_{y}\right|} \\& \leqslant\|y\|\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|\end{aligned}$ for each positive integer n, clearly $g_{n}(t)=t^{\frac{1}{n}} \in X \backslash X_{0}$. Substituting $g_{n}$ into equation (1), we get $\begin{aligned}\frac{n}{(1+n)} & =\left|\int_{0}^{1} g_{n}(t) d t\right| \leqslant\left\|g_{n}\right\|\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right| \\& =\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|.\end{aligned}$ Since n is any positive integer, thus $1 \leqslant\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|$. However, the condition $x_{0} \in X, \left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$ and $x_{0}(0)=0$ implies $\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|<1$, leading to a contradiction.
chinese_rationale: Riesz引理:设  X  是赋范线性空间，  $X_{0}$  是  X  的闭的真子空间，则对  $0<a<1$ ， 必存在  $x_{a} \in X$ ， 适合  $\left\|x_{a}\right\|=1$  且  $\left\|x_{a}-x\right\| \geqslant a$  对一切  $x \in X_{0}$  成立。应当注意， Riesz引理中的实数  a  不能取作 1。例如， 设  X  为定义在区间  [0，1]  上适合  $x(0)=0$  的全体连续函数  $x(t)$ ， 按通常线性运算所成的线性空间。 对  $x \in X$ ， 令$\|x\|=\max _{0< t<  1  }|x(t)|$，则  $(X，\|\cdot\|)$  成为一个Banach空间。 令$X_{0}=\{x: x \in X$  且  $\int_{0}^{1} x(t) d t=0\}$ 。易见，  $X_{0}$  是  X  的闭的真子空间。 兹证不存在  $x_{0} \in X$  适合  $\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$ ，且  $\left\|x_{0}-x\right\| \geqslant 1$  对一切  $x \in X_{0}$  成立。 反设存在  $x_{0} \in X$  适合  $\left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$ ，且  $\left\|x_{0}-x\right\| \geqslant 1$  对一切  $x \in X_{0}$  成立， 于是对每一  $y \in X \backslash X_{0}$ ， 若令$b_{y}=\frac{\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t}{\int_{0}^{1} y(t) d t}$ 就有  $\int_{0}^{1}\left[x_{0}(t)-b_{y} y(t)\right] d t=0$ ， 从而  $x_{0}-b_{y} y \in X_{0}$ ， 因而得到$1 \leqslant\left\|x_{0}-\left(x_{0}-b_{y} y\right)\right\|=\left\|b_{y} y\right\|$，即$\frac{1}{\left|b_{y}\right|} \leqslant\|y\|$ 。根据  $b_{y}$  的定义， 经过简单的U算可得$\begin{aligned}\left|\int_{0}^{1} y(t) d t\right| & =\frac{\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|}{\left|b_{y}\right|} \\& \leqslant\|y\|\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|\end{aligned}$对每一正整数  n ， 显然有  $g_{n}(t)=t^{\frac{1}{n}} \in X \backslash X_{0}$ 。 把  $g_{n}$  代入 (1)式， 就得到$\begin{aligned}\frac{n}{(1+n)} & =\left|\int_{0}^{1} g_{n}(t) d t\right| \leqslant\left\|g_{n}\right\|\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right| \\& =\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right| .\end{aligned}$由于  n  是任意正整数，因而  $1 \leqslant\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|$ 。 但是， 条件  $x_{0} \in X ，  \left\|x_{0}\right\|=1$  及  $x_{0}(0)=0$  蕴涵  $\left|\int_{0}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t\right|<1$ ， 从而导致预期的矛盾。

statement: There exist isometric homogeneous mappings that are not linear.
chinese_statement: 存在等距齐性而非线性的映射。
rationale: Let X and Y be normed linear spaces. A mapping T:X\to Y is called an isometric homogeneous mapping if for any $x, y \in X$ and $\alpha$, we have $\begin{array}{c}\left\|T x - T y \right \|=\left \|  x-y\right\|, \\T(\alpha x)=\alpha Tx .\end{array}$ Chernoff and Waterhouse raised the question: must T be linear in this case? Masden pointed out that if the normed linear space Y is two-dimensional, or strictly convex, or T is surjective, then T must be a linear mapping. In general, T is not necessarily a linear mapping. The following example was given by Araker. Define a mapping f from $\mathbf{R}^{2}$ to $\mathbf{R}^{1}$ as follows: $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}y, 0 \leqslant y \leqslant x \text { or } x \leqslant y \leqslant 0 , \\x, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant y \text { or } y \leqslant x \leqslant 0 , \\0, \text { otherwise. }\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see: (i) f is nonlinear. (ii) f is homogeneous, i.e., $f(t x, t y)= t f(x, y)$. (iii) For any x, y, u, $v \in \mathbf{R}^{1}$, we have $|f(x, y)-f(u, v)| \leqslant \sqrt{(x-u)^{2}+(y-v)^{2}}$. Let $X=\mathbf{R}^{2}$ with the usual norm, $Y=\mathbf{R}^{3}$ with the norm $\|(x, y, z)\|=\max \left\{\sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}},|z|\right\}$, then Y is a normed linear space. Define a mapping T from X to Y as follows: $T(x, y)=(x, y, f(x, y))$. From (i), (ii), (iii) we know that T is isometric homogeneous but not linear.
chinese_rationale: 设X，Y均为赋范线性空间，T:X\to Y叫做等距齐性映射，如 果对任意  $x， y \in X$  及  $\alpha$ ， 有$\begin{array}{c}\left\|T x - T y \right \|=\left \|  x-y\right\|， \\T(\alpha x)=\alpha Tx .\end{array}$ Chernoff 和 Waterhcise 提出问题：此时T是否必为线性的？Masden指出，若赋范线性空间Y是二维的，或是严格凸的，或是T是满射的，则T必为线性映射。对于一般情形，T不必是线性映射。下面的例子是由 Araker 作出的。定义  $\mathbf{R}^{2}$  到  $\mathbf{R}^{1}$  内的映射  f  如下:$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}y， 0 \leqslant y \leqslant x \text { 或 } x \leqslant y \leqslant 0 ， \\x， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant y \text { 或 } y \leqslant x \leqslant 0 ， \\0， \text { 其它. }\end{array}\right.$不难看出: (i)  f  是非线性的。 (ii)  f  是齐性的， 即  $f(t x， t y)=   t f(x， y)$ .（iii）对任意  x， y， u， $v \in \mathbf{R}^{1}$ ， 有$|f(x， y)-f(u， v)| \leqslant \sqrt{(x-u)^{2}+(y-v)^{2}}$ .设  $X=\mathbf{R}^{2}$  并在  X  上取通常范数，  $Y=\mathbf{R}^{3}$  并在  Y  上取 范数$\|(x， y， z)\|=\max \left\{\sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}，|z|\right\}$，则  Y  为一赋范线性空间。 定义  X  到  Y  内的映射  T  如下：$T(x， y)=(x， y， f(x， y))$ .由(i)， (ii)，(iii)可知，  T  等距齐性而非线性。

statement: There exists a metric linear space where no non-zero continuous linear functional exists.
chinese_statement: 不存在非零连续线性泛函的度量线性空间是存在的。
rationale: Let $\mathrm{X}$ be the set of real-valued functions $x(t)$ defined on the interval [0,1], where each $x(t)$ has only finitely many points of discontinuity on [0,1]. Define the usual linear operations on X, and for $x, \boldsymbol{y} \in X$, let $d(x, y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{|x(t)-y(t)|}{1+|x(t)-y(t)|} d t$. Here the integral is the (R) integral, so $\mathrm{Y}$ is a metric linear space. We will prove that no non-zero continuous linear functional exists on X. Suppose, for the sake of contradiction, that a non-zero continuous linear functional exists on X. Then according to the theorem, there are: (i) a convex neighborhood G of the zero point in X such that $G \neq X$. (ii) $X \neq G+G+\cdots+G$ (for any finite number of terms). Thus, there exists $r>0$, such that $B(0, r) \subset G$, where $B(0, r)$ denotes the open ball with center 0 and radius r. Take a positive integer $n>\frac{1}{r}$ and $x \in X$, and divide the interval [0,1] into n equal subintervals $I_{1}, \cdots, I_{n}$. Define n functions on [0,1] as follows: $x_{k}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x(t), & t \in I_{k}, \\0, & t \in[0,1] \backslash I_{k},\end{array}\right.$ where $k=1,2, \cdots, n$. It is easy to see that $x_{k} \in X$, and $d\left(x_{k}, 0\right)=\int_{I_{k}} \frac{|x(t)|}{1+|x(t)|} d t \leqslant \int_{I_{k}} d t=\frac{1}{n}<r$. Therefore, $x_{k} \in B(0, r) \subset G$. Since $x(t)=\sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}(t)$, it follows that $x \in G+\cdots+G$ (n terms). And since $x \in X$ was arbitrarily chosen, $X=G+\cdots+G$ (n terms), which contradicts the theorem proved earlier. Thus, no non-zero continuous linear functional exists on X.
chinese_rationale: 现设  $\mathrm{X}$  是定义在区间  [0,1]  上的实值函数  $x(t)$  的全体, 其中每个  $x(t)$  在  [0,1]  上只有有限个不连续点。 在  X  上定义通常的线性运算,并对  x, $\boldsymbol{y} \in X$ , 令$d(x, y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{|x(t)-y(t)|}{1+|x(t)-y(t)|} d t$,这里的积分是  (R)  积分, 则 $ \mathrm{Y} $ 为一度量线性空间。 兹证  X  上不存在非零连续线性泛函，反设  X  上存在非零连续线性泛函，则据上述定理, 有(i) 在  X  中存在零点的一个 凸  邻域  G , 使  $G \neq X$ 。(ii)  $X \neq G+G+\cdots+G$  (任意有限项), 于是, 存在  $r>0$ , 使得  $B(0, r) \subset G$ , 这里  $B(0, r)$  代表以 0 为球心,  r  为半径的开球。取正整数  $n>\frac{1}{r}$  以及  $x \in X$ , 并把区间  [0,1]  分成  n  个等长的小区间 $I_{1}, \cdots, I_{n}$ , 在  [0,1]  上如下定义  n  个函数:$x_{k}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x(t), & t \in I_{k}, \\0, & t \in[0,1] \backslash I_{k},\end{array}\right.$其中  $k=1,2, \cdots, n$ 。 易见,  $x_{k} \in X$ , 且$d\left(x_{k}, 0\right)=\int_{I_{k}} \frac{|x(t)|}{1+|x(t)|} d t \leqslant \int_{I_{k}} d t=\frac{1}{n}<r$,因此,  $x_{k} \in B(0, r) \subset G$ 。 由于  $x(t)=\sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}(t)$ , 故$x \in G+\cdots+G $（n  项)。而  $x \in X$  是任取的, 所以  $X=G+\cdots+G$  (  n  项), 这与前面所证的定理发生矛盾，因此，X上不存在非零连续线性泛函。

statement: There exists a uniformly convex but not locally uniformly convex Banach space.
chinese_statement: 存在各向一致凸而非局部一致凸的Banach空间。
rationale:
For  $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$  , let  $x^{\prime}=\left(0, \xi_{2}, \xi_{3}, \cdots\right)$ , and define the norm on  $l^{2}$  as $\|x\|_{p}=\left|\xi_{1}\right|+\left\|x^{\prime}\right\|_{2}$ . Since  $\|\cdot\|_{2} \leqslant\|\cdot\|_{F} \leqslant 2\|\cdot\|_{2}$ ,  $\|\cdot\|_{F}$  is an equivalent norm on  $l^{2}$ . Let  $\left\{\alpha_{n}\right\}$  be a decreasing sequence of positive numbers tending to zero, and define a continuous linear operator  T from the space  $l^{2}$  to  $l^{2}$  as:  $T\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)=\left(\alpha_{2} \xi_{2}, \alpha_{3} \xi_{3}, \cdots\right)$ . For  $x \in l^{2}$ , let $ \|x\|_{A}=\left(\|x\|_{F}^{2}+\|T x\|_{2}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} $, then $\|\cdot\|_{A}$ is an equivalent norm on  $l^{2}$. To prove that  $\|\cdot\|_{A}$  is uniformly convex, we apply the following Zizler theorem.
Define let  X  be a Banach space, for each non-zero element  $z \in X$  and  $0<\varepsilon\leqslant 2$, let $\begin{array}{c}\delta(\varepsilon, z)=\inf \left\{1-\left\|\frac{(x+y)}{2}\right\|: x-y \in S,\right. \\x-y=\alpha z \text { and }\|x-y\| \geqslant \varepsilon\},\end{array}$ where  S  represents the unit sphere in  X. Let  A  be a non-empty subset of  X, if for every non-zero element  $z \in A$, we have  $\delta(\varepsilon, z)>0$, then  X  is called $\mathrm{UR}_{A}$. Zizler theorem states that if  $\left(X,\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$  and  $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  are both Banach spaces,  T  is a continuous linear operator from  X  to  Y, for  $x \in X$, let $\left |  \|x\|  \right |=\left(\|x\|_{X}^{2}+\|T x\|_{Y}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, then $\left |  \|x\|  \right |$ is an equivalent norm on X. Additionally, if  Y  is  $\mathrm{UR}_{T(X)}$  and  X  is  $\mathbf{U R}_{k(T)}$, where $k(T)=\{x \in X: T x=0\}$, then $\|\cdot\| \|$ is uniformly convex $\mathrm{n}_{1}$. According to Zizler theorem, it is evident that we only need to prove  $\|\cdot\|_{F}$  is  $\mathrm{UR}_{k(\tau)}$, where  $k(T)=\left\{x \in l^{2}: T x=0\right\}=\operatorname{span}\left\{e_{1}\right\}$. For this, let  $x=\left\{\xi_{i}\right\}, y= \left\{\eta_{i}\right\} \in l^{2}$, such that $\|x\|_{F}=\|y\|_{F}=1, x-y=\varepsilon e_{1}$ , then for $ i \geqslant 2$, we have  $\xi_{i}= \eta_{i}$. Thus  $\xi_1=-\eta_{1}$ , it is evident that $\left\|\frac{(x+y)}{2}\right\|_{F}=\left(\sum_{i=2}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=\|x\|_{F}-\left|\xi_{i}\right|=1-\frac{\varepsilon}{2}$, therefore  $\delta(\varepsilon, z)>0, z \in r \operatorname{pan}\left\{e_{1}\right\}$. Therefore,  $\|\cdot\|_{1}$  is uniformly convex. However, $\left \| \cdot  \right \|_{A}$ is not weakly locally uniformly convex, and thus not locally uniformly convex, because if we let  $x=e_{1}, x_{n}=e_{n}$, then  $\|x\|_{A}=1,\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{A} \rightarrow 1,\left\|x+x_{n}\right\|_{A} \rightarrow 2$, while $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ weakly converges to zero.

对  $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$  ，令  $x^{\prime}=\left(0, \xi_{2}, \xi_{3}, \cdots\right)$ , 并定义  $l^{2}$  上的范数$\|x\|_{p}=\left|\xi_{1}\right|+\left\|x^{\prime}\right\|_{2}$ 。因为  $\|\cdot\|_{2} \leqslant\|\cdot\|_{F} \leqslant 2\|\cdot\|_{2}$ , 所以  $\|\cdot\|_{F}$  是  $l^{2}$  上的等价范数。设  $\left\{\alpha_{n}\right\}$  是递减且趋于零的正数列, 定义由空间  $l^{2}$  到  $l^{2}$  内的连续线性算子  T 如下:$T\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)=\left(\alpha_{2} \xi_{2}, \alpha_{3} \xi_{3}, \cdots\right)$ 。对  $x \in l^{2}$ , 令$\|x\|_{A}=\left(\|x\|_{F}^{2}+\|T x\|_{2}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$,则  $\|\cdot\|_{A}$  是  $l^{2}$  上的一个等价范数。 为证  $\|\cdot\|_{A}$  是各向一致凸的, 我们要应用下述 Zizler  { }^{[337}  定理。
定义 设  X  是Banach 空间, 对每一非零元  $z \in X$  及  $0<\varepsilon\le  2$ ,令$\begin{array}{c}\delta(\varepsilon, z)=\inf \left\{1-\left\|\frac{(x+y)}{2}\right\|: x-y \in S,\right. \\x-y=\alpha z \text { 且 }\|x-y\| \geqslant \varepsilon\},\end{array}$这里  S  代表  X  中的单位球面．设  A  是  X  的非空子集, 若对每一非零元  $z \in A$ , 均有  $\delta(\varepsilon, z)>0$ , 则称  X  为  $\mathrm{UR}_{A}$ 。Zizler 定理 设  $\left(X,\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$  与  $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  皆为 Banach 空间,  T  是由  X  到  Y  内的连续线性算子, 对  $x \in X$ , 令$\left |  \|x\|  \right |=\left(\|x\|_{X}^{2}+\|T x\|_{Y}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$,则 $\left |  \|x\|  \right |$ 是  X  上的一个等价范数。 此外, 若  Y  是  $\mathrm{UR}_{T(X)}$  而  X  是  $\mathbf{U R}_{k(T)}$ , 这里  $k(T)=\{x \in X: T x=0\}$ , 则  $\|\cdot\| \|$  是各向一致  $\mathrm{n}_{1}$  的。根据 Zizler 定理, 我们显然只要证明  $\|\cdot\|_{F}$  是  $\mathrm{UR}_{k(\tau)}$  即可, 这里  $k(T)=\left\{x \in l^{2}: T x=0\right\}=\operatorname{span}\left\{e_{1}\right\}$ 。 为此, 令  $x=\left\{\xi_{i}\right\}, y=   \left\{\eta_{i}\right\} \in l^{2}$ , 使  $\|x\|_{F}=\|y\|_{F}=1, x-y=\varepsilon e_{1}$ , 则当 $ i \geqslant 2$  时, 有  $\xi_{i}=   \eta_{i}$ 。 因此  $\xi_1=-\eta_{1}$ , 可见$\left\|\frac{(x+y)}{2}\right\|_{F}=\left(\sum_{i=2}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=\|x\|_{F}-\left|\xi_{i}\right|=1-\frac{\varepsilon}{2}$,从而  $\delta(\varepsilon, z)>0, z \in r \operatorname{pan}\left\{e_{1}\right\}$ 。 因此，  $\|\cdot\|_{1}$  是各向一致凸的。然而$\left \| \cdot  \right \|_{A}$不是弱局部一致凸的，从而也不是局部一致凸的，这是因为若令  $x=e_{1}, x_{n}=e_{n} , 则  \|x\|_{A}=1,\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{A} \rightarrow 1,\left\|x+x_{n}\right\|_{A} \rightarrow 2 ,\text { 而 }\left\{x_{n}\right\}   $却弱收敛于零。

statement: There exists a closed compact set in a certain metric space that is equidistant to some of its proper subsets.
chinese_statement: 存在某个度量空间中的列紧集， 它与它的某个真子集等距。
rationale: In $\mathbf{R}^{2}$, take the polar coordinate system and consider the subset $A=\{(\rho, \theta): \rho=1, \theta=0,1,2, \cdots\}$. Thus, the points $(\rho, \theta)$ where $\rho=1$ and $\theta$ are irrational numbers are accumulation points of A, and A is closed and compact. Let $B=\{(\rho, \theta): \rho=1, \theta=1,2, \cdots\}$, then B is a proper subset of A, and A is equidistant to B.
chinese_rationale: 在  $\mathbf{R}^{2}$  中取极坐标系，并考虑子集 $A=\{(\rho， \theta): \rho=1， \theta=0，1，2， \cdots\}$ 。 于是，  $\rho=1$， $\theta$  为无理数的点  $(\rho， \theta)$  均为  A  的聚点， 且  A  是列紧的。 令 $B=\{(\rho， \theta): \rho=1， \theta=1，2， \cdots\}$ ， 则  B  是  A  的真子集， 且  A  与  B  等距。

statement: A biorthogonal sequence $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$, where $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$ is a shrinking basis sequence, but $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$ is not necessarily a bounded complete basis sequence.
chinese_statement: 一个双直交列  $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{n}\right\}$  与  $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$ , 使  $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$  是收缩的基序列, 而  $\left\{\boldsymbol{x}_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$ 却不是有界完全的基序列。
rationale: Let $\left\{e_{n}\right\},\left\{b_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{\delta_{n}\right\}$ be the natural bases in Banach spaces $c_{0}$, l, and $l^{2}$, respectively. In $c_{0} \oplus l^{2}$, take $x_{n}=\left(e_{n}, 2^{-n} \delta_{n}\right)$, and in $\left(c_{0} \oplus l^{2}\right)^{*}=l \oplus l^{2}$, take $f_{n}=\left(0,2^{n} \delta_{n}\right)$. It is easy to see, the biorthogonal sequences $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ are basis sequences in $c_{0} \oplus l^{2}$ and $l \oplus l^{2}$ respectively. Furthermore, $\overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n}\right\}=\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$. Consider any $f=\left(0,\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)\right) \in\left(\{0\} \oplus l^{2}\right)^{*}=\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$. Let $x \in \overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n+1}, f_{n+2}, \cdots\right\}$, then x can be expressed as: $x=\left(0,\left(0, \cdots, 0,2^{n+1} \eta_{n+1}, 2^{n+2} \eta_{n+2}, \cdots\right)\right)$. Since $x \in\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$, it follows that $\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty}\left|2^{i} \eta_{i}\right|^{2} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$, thus $\begin{aligned}|f(x)| & \leqslant\|f\|\|x\| \\& =\left(\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\left(\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty}\left|2^{i} \eta_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty).\end{aligned}$ Therefore, $\begin{array}{c}P_{n}(f)=\sup \left\{f(x): x \in \overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n+1}, f_{n+2}, \cdots\right\},\|x\| \leqslant 1\right\} \rightarrow 0 \$n \rightarrow \infty).\end{array}$ Thus $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ is a shrinking basis of $\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$. On the other hand, the basis sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is not bounded complete.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\left\{e_{n}\right\},\left\{b_{n}\right\}$  与  $\left\{\delta_{n}\right\}$  分别是 Banach 空间  $c_{0}$, l  和  $l^{2}$  中的自然基。 在  $c_{0} \oplus l^{2}$  中取  $x_{n}=\left(e_{n}, 2^{-n} \delta_{n}\right)$ , 在  $\left(c_{0} \oplus l^{2}\right)^{*}=l \oplus l^{2}$  中取  $f_{n}=   \left(0,2^{n} \delta_{n}\right)$ 。 易见, 双直交列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  与  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  分别是  $c_{0} \oplus l^{2}$  与  $l \oplus l^{2}$  中的基序列。此外，$\overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n}\right\}=\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$ 。任取  $f=\left(0,\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)\right) \in\left(\{0\} \oplus l^{2}\right)^{*}=\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$ 。 设  $x \in   \overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n+1}, f_{n+2}, \cdots\right\}$ ,则  x  可表成下列形式:$x=\left(0,\left(0, \cdots, 0,2^{n+1} \eta_{n+1}, 2^{n+2} \eta_{n+2}, \cdots\right)\right)$ 。因  $x \in\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$ , 故  $\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty}\left|2^{i} \eta_{i}\right|^{2} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ , 从而$\begin{aligned}|f(x)| & \leqslant\|f\|\|x\| \\& =\left(\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\left(\sum_{i=n+1}^{\infty}\left|2^{i} \eta_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{aligned}$由此得到$\begin{array}{c}P_{n}(f)=\sup \left\{f(x): x \in \overline{\operatorname{span}}\left\{f_{n+1}, f_{n+2}, \cdots\right\},\|x\| \leqslant 1\right\} \rightarrow 0 \\(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{array}$即  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  是  $\{0\} \oplus l^{2}$  的收缩基。 另一方面, 基序列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  不是有界完全的。

statement: If a non-expansive mapping has a fixed point, its fixed point is unique.
chinese_statement: 非扩张映射若有不动点, 其不动点唯一。
rationale: For example: Let T be the identity mapping on the metric space $\mathrm{X}$ to X, then T is a non-expansive mapping, and every point of X is a fixed point of T.
chinese_rationale: 例如:设  T  是度量空间  $\mathrm{X}$  到  X  上的恒等映射, 则  T  为非扩张映射, 且  X  的每一点皆为  T  的不动点。

statement: A closed convex subset in $C[0, 1]$, which does not contain an element of minimum norm.
chinese_statement: $C[0，1]$  中的一个闭凸子集， 它不含有最小范数的元素。
rationale: Consider the subset $M=\left\{x: x \in C[0,1] \text { and } \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x(t) d t=1\right\}$ in the Banach space  $C[0,1]$. It is easy to prove that $M$ is closed. In fact, suppose $x_{n} \in M$ and $x_{n} \rightarrow x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty)$, i.e., $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t=1$, and $\max _{0<t<1}\left|x_{n}(t)-x_{0}(t)\right| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. Then we have $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t \rightarrow \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{0}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t(n \rightarrow \infty)$, $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{0}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t=1$. Therefore, $x_{0} \in M$, i.e., M is closed. Also, for any $x, y \in M, \alpha \geqslant 0, \beta \geqslant 0, \alpha+\beta =1$, $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}}[\alpha x(t)+\beta y(t)] d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1}[\alpha x(t)+\beta y(t)] d t=1$, so $\alpha x+\beta y \in M$, i.e., M is convex. It is not difficult to see that if $x \in M$, then $\|x\|>1$. Now, define a continuous function on the interval [0,1] $x_{n}(t) :x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll} 1+\varepsilon_{n}, & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{2}-\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}}, \\ \text { linear, } \quad & \frac{1}{2}-\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}} \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{2}+\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}}, \\ -\left(1+\varepsilon_{n}\right), & \frac{1}{2}+\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}} \leqslant t \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right.$ Here, $\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}$ is a sequence of positive numbers with $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. After simple calculations, $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t=1$. Therefore, $x_{n} \in M$. Since $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=1+\varepsilon_{n}$ and $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$, there is no element of minimum norm in M.
chinese_rationale: 考虑 Banach 空间  $C[0，1]$  的子集$M=\left\{x: x \in C[0，1] \text { 且 } \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x(t) d t=1\right\}$ 。易证，  M  是闭集。 事实上， 设  $x_{n} \in M$  且  $x_{n} \rightarrow x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty)$ ， 即$\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t=1$，且  $\max _{0<t<1}\left|x_{n}(t)-x_{0}(t)\right| \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ 。 于是得到$\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t$ $\begin{array}{r}\rightarrow \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{0}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t(n \rightarrow \infty) \\\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{0}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{0}(t) d t=1\end{array}$所以  $x_{0} \in M$ ， 即  M  是闭集。 又，任取  $x， y \in M， \alpha \geqslant 0， \beta \geqslant 0， \alpha+\beta   =1$ ， 则$\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}}[\alpha x(t)+\beta y(t)] d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1}[\alpha x(t)+\beta y(t)] d t=1$，所以  $\alpha x+\beta y \in M$ ， 即  M  是凸集。不难看出， 若  $x \in M$ ， 则  $\|x\|>1$ 。 今在区间  [0，1]  上定义连续函数  $x_{n}(t)  :x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1+\varepsilon_{n}， & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{2}-\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}}， \\\text { 线性， } \quad & \frac{1}{2}-\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}} \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{2}+\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}}， \\-\left(1+\varepsilon_{n}\right)， & \frac{1}{2}+\frac{\varepsilon_{n}}{1+\varepsilon_{n}} \leqslant t \leqslant 1，\end{array}\right.$这里，  $\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}$  是正数列且  $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ 。 经过简单的计算， 可得$\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} x_{n}(t) d t-\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^{1} x_{n}(t) d t=1$ 。因此，  $x_{n} \in M$ 。 由于  $\left\|x_{n}\right\|=1+\varepsilon_{n}$  且  $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ ， 因而  M  中不存在最小范数的元素。

statement: There exists an isometry that is not a unitary operator.
chinese_statement: 存在某个等距算子，它不是酉算子。
rationale: Let T be the right shift operator on $l^{2}$, that is, for $x=(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots) \in l^{2}$, let $T x=(0, \xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots)$. Clearly, T is a linear and isometric operator from $l^{2}$ to its range $R(T) \subset l^{2}$. It is also easy to see that $l^{2} \backslash R(T) \neq \varnothing$, so T is not a unitary operator.
chinese_rationale: 设  T  是  $l^{2}$  上的右移算子, 即对  $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right) \in l^{2}$ , 令$T x=\left(0, \xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right)$ 。 显然,  T  是由  $l^{2}$  到其值域  $R(T) \subset l^{2}$  上的线性而且等距的算子。又易见,  $l^{2} \backslash R(T) \neq \varnothing$ , 所以  T  不是酉算子。

statement: There exists a non-reflexive normed linear space whose conjugate space is reflexive.
chinese_statement: 存在一个不自反的赋范线性空间, 其共轭空间自反。
rationale: For example, let $X= E^{\infty}$, for $x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in X$, define $\|x\|=\left(\sum_{k}\left|\xi_{k}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, then X is a dense linear subspace of the reflexive Banach space $l^{2}$, and since X is incomplete, it is not reflexive. It is proven that $X^{*}=\left(l^{2}\right)^{*}=l^{2}$, so $X^{*}$ is reflexive. In fact, any continuous linear functional f on X, i.e., $f \in X^{*}$, can be extended with preservation of norm to the entire space $l^{2}$ as a continuous linear functional, i.e., there exists $F \in\left(l^{2}\right)^{*}$ such that $\|F\|=\|f\|$, and when $x \in X$, $F(x)=f(x)$. Since X is dense in $l^{2}$, F is uniquely determined, from which it follows that $X^{*}$ is isometrically isomorphic to $\left(l^{2}\right)^{*}$, so $X^{*}$ is a reflexive Banach space.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  $X=   E^{\infty}$ , 对  $x=\left\{\xi_{k}\right\} \in X $ ，令$\|x\|=\left(\sum_{k}\left|\xi_{k}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$,则  X  为自反 Banach 空间  $l^{2}$  的稠密线性子空间, 由于  X  不完备, 故它不自反。兹证  $X^{*}=\left(l^{2}\right)^{*}=l^{2}$ , 从而  $X ^{*}$  自反。 事实上, 任取  X  上的连续线性泛函  f , 即  $f \in X^{*}$ , 据 Hahn-Banach 定理,  f  可保范地扩张到整个空间  $l^{2}$  上的连续线性泛函, 即存在  $F \in\left(l^{2}\right)^{*}$ , 使  $\|F\|=\|f\|$ ,且当  $x \in X$  时  $F(x)=f(x)$ 。 因  X  在  $l^{2}$  中稠密, 故  F  是唯一确定的, 由此可见,  $X^{*}$  与  $\left(l^{2}\right) ^{*}$  是等距同构的, 故  $X ^{*}$  是自反的 Banach 空间。

statement: There exists a sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset l^{r}$ such that $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges in $l^{p}(1 \leqslant r<p<+\infty)$ but does not converge in $l^{r}$.
chinese_statement: 存在点列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset l^{r}$ ， 使  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  在  $l^{p}(1 \leqslant r<p<+\infty)$  中收敛而在  $l^{r}$  中不收敛。
rationale: Let $x_{n}=\left(n^{-\frac{1}{r}}, \cdots, n^{-\frac{1}{r}}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$, then $x_{n} \in l^{r} \subset l^{p}, n=1,2, \cdots$, where $1 \leqslant r<p<+\infty$. Because $\begin{aligned}\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{l^{p}} & =\left(n^{-\frac{p}{r}}+\cdots+n^{-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \\& =\left(n \cdot n^{-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \\& =\left(n^{1-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty),\end{aligned}$ so $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges to 0 in $l^{p}$. But since $\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{l^r}=\left(n^{-1}+\cdots+n^{-1}\right)^{\frac{1}{r}}=1, n=1,2, \cdots$ so $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ does not converge in $l^{r}$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $x_{n}=\left(n^{-\frac{1}{r}}， \cdots， n^{-\frac{1}{r}}， 0，0， \cdots\right)$ ， 则  $x_{n} \in l^{r} \subset l^{p}， n=1，2， \cdots$ ，其中  $1 \leqslant r<p<+\infty$ 。 因为$\begin{aligned}\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{l^{p}} & =\left(n^{-\frac{p}{r}}+\cdots+n^{-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \\& =\left(n \cdot n^{-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \\& =\left(n^{1-\frac{p}{r}}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)，\end{aligned}$故  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  在  $l^{p}$  中收敛于 0 。但因$\left\|x_{n}\right\|_{l^r}=\left(n^{-1}+\cdots+n^{-1}\right)^{\frac{1}{r}}=1， n=1，2， \cdots$故  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  在  $l^{r}$  中不收敛。

statement: There exists a compact subspace $E$ in some metric space such that every ball in $E$ is connected, but the closure of an open ball is not necessarily a closed ball.
chinese_statement: 存在某个度量空间的紧子空间 $E$ ， 使  $E$  中每个球都是连通的,但是开球的闭包未必是闭球。
rationale: $\begin{array}{l}\text { For } p=\left(x_{1}, y_{1}\right), q=\left(x_{2}, y_{2}\right) \in \mathbf{R}^{2}, \text { set } \\d(p, q)=\max \left(\left|x_{1}-x_{2}\right|,\left|y_{1}-y_{2}\right|\right),\end{array}$ hence $\left(\mathbf{R}^{2}, d\right)$ becomes a metric space. Let E be the subspace of $\left(\mathrm{R}^{2}, d\right)$ consisting of points $(x, y)$ meeting the following conditions: either $x=0$ and $0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1$, or $y=0$ and $0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$. It is clear that E is a compact subspace of $\left(\mathbf{R}^{2}, d\right)$, and every ball in E is connected. Consider the open ball $B((1,0), 1)=\{(x, y): 0<x \leqslant 1, y=0\}$ in E, its closure is clearly $\{(x, y): 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1, y=0\}$, while the closed ball $B[(1,0), 1]= E$, hence they are not equal.
chinese_rationale: $\begin{array}{l}\text { 对 } p=\left(x_{1}, y_{1}\right), q=\left(x_{2}, y_{2}\right) \in \mathbf{R}^{2}, \text { 令 } \\d(p, q)=\max \left(\left|x_{1}-x_{2}\right|,\left|y_{1}-y_{2}\right|\right),\end{array}$则  $\left(\mathbf{R}^{2}, d\right)$  为一度量空间。 设  E  是  $\left(\mathrm{R}^{2}, d\right)$  中适 合下述条件的点  $(x, y)$  组成的子空间: 或者  $x=0$  而  $0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1$ , 或者  $y=0$  而  $0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$ 。 易见,  E  是  $\left(\mathbf{R}^{2}, d\right)$  的紧子空间, 且  E  中每个球都是连通的， 我们考虑  E  中的开球$B((1,0), 1)=\{(x, y): 0<x \leqslant 1, y=0\}$ ，其闭包显然是  $\{(x, y): 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1, y=0\}$ , 而闭球  $B[(1,0), 1]=   E$ ， 故二者并不相等。

statement: There does not exist a strongly absolutely continuous function which is nowhere strongly differentiable.
chinese_statement: 不存在无处强可导的强绝对连续函数。
rationale: Example: Let $x(t)$ be a vector-valued function from the interval [0,1] into the space $L[0,1]$: $[x(t)](\xi)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & 0 \leqslant \xi \leqslant t, \\0, & t<\xi \leqslant 1.\end{array}\right.$ Then, $x(t)$ is strongly absolutely continuous on [0,1], and therefore has strong bounded variation, yet it is nowhere strongly differentiable. In fact, for any $[\alpha, \beta] \subset[0,1]$, from $\|[x(\beta)](\xi)-[x(\alpha)](\xi)\|=\int_{\alpha}^{\beta} d \xi=\beta-\alpha$, it is known that for any finitely many disjoint intervals $\left(\alpha_{k}, \beta_{k}\right), k=1,2 , \cdots, n ,$ within [0,1], it must satisfy $\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left\|x\left(\beta_{k}\right)-x\left(\alpha_{k}\right)\right\|=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left(\beta_{k}-\alpha_{k}\right)$, hence it can be immediately concluded that $x(t)$ is strongly absolutely continuous on [0,1]. On the other hand, since $\begin{array}{l}\frac{[x(t)](\xi)-\left[x\left(t_{0}\right)\right](\xi)}{t-t_{0}} \\=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}0 & , 0 \leqslant \xi \leqslant \min \left(t_{0}, t\right), \\\frac{1}{\left|t-t_{0}\right|}, & \min \left(t_{0}, t\right)<\xi \leqslant \max \left(t_{0}, t\right), \\0 & , \max \left(t_{0}, t\right)<\xi \leqslant 1.\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ It is known that if $x(t)$ is strongly differentiable at point $t_{0}$, the above expression must converge almost everywhere to the element 0 in $L[0,1]$ as $t \rightarrow t_{0}$. Nevertheless, $\int_{0}^{1}\left|\left(\frac{x(t)-x\left(t_{0}\right)}{t-t_{0}}\right)(\xi)\right| d \xi=1 \nrightarrow 0\left(t \rightarrow t_{0}\right)$ Therefore, $x(t)$ does not have a strong derivative at any point $t_{0} \in[0,1]$.
chinese_rationale: 例：设  $x(t)$  是由区间  [0,1]  到空间  $L[0,1]$  内的向量值函数:$[x(t)](\xi)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & 0 \leqslant \xi \leqslant t, \\0, & t<\xi \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$那么,  $x(t)$  在  [0,1]  上是强绝对连续的, 从而是强有界变差的,然而却处处不存在强导数。 事实上, 对任意  $[\alpha, \beta] \subset[0,1]$ , 由$\|[x(\beta)](\xi)-[x(\alpha)](\xi)\|=\int_{\alpha}^{\beta} d \xi=\beta-\alpha$,便知对于  [0,1]  内任意有限个互不相交的区间  $\left(\alpha_{k}, \beta_{k}\right), k=1,2 ,  \cdots, n ,$ 必有$\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left\|x\left(\beta_{k}\right)-x\left(\alpha_{k}\right)\right\|=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left(\beta_{k}-\alpha_{k}\right)$,从而立即可以得出  $x(t)$  在  [0,1]  上是强绝对连续的。 另一方面, 由于$\begin{array}{l}\frac{[x(t)](\xi)-\left[x\left(t_{0}\right)\right](\xi)}{t-t_{0}} \\=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}0 & , 0 \leqslant \xi \leqslant \min \left(t_{0}, t\right), \\\frac{1}{\left|t-t_{0}\right|}, & \min \left(t_{0}, t\right)<\xi \leqslant \max \left(t_{0}, t\right), \\0 & , \max \left(t_{0}, t\right)<\xi \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right.\end{array}$故知若  $x(t)$  在  $t_{0}$  点强可导, 则上式当  $t \rightarrow t_{0}$  时必几乎处处收敛 于  $L[0,1]$  中的元 0 。 然而$\int_{0}^{1}\left|\left(\frac{x(t)-x\left(t_{0}\right)}{t-t_{0}}\right)(\xi)\right| d \xi=1 \nrightarrow 0\left(t \rightarrow t_{0}\right)$因此,  $x(t)$  在任一点  $t_{0} \in[0,1]$ , 它都不存在强导数。

statement: There are Banach spaces that cannot be endowed with an equivalent strictly convex norm.
chinese_statement: 存在不能赋予等价的严格凸范数的 Banach 空间。
rationale:
Clarkson pointed out that every separable Banach space can be endowed with an equivalent strictly convex norm. In fact, it can be further proven that every separable Banach space can be endowed with an equivalent locally uniformly convex norm. On the other hand, there are non-separable Banach spaces that can be endowed with an equivalent locally uniformly convex norm. So, is it possible to endow every Banach space with an equivalent strictly convex norm? The answer to this question is negative. Day gives an example: Let $ \Gamma$ be a non-empty set, and $i^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ the set of bounded real-valued functions defined on $\Gamma$. For each $x \in l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$, let $\|x\|=\sup_{r \in \Gamma}|x(r)|$, then $l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ forms a Banach space under this norm. $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ is the set of elements $x$ in $l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ for which $\{r \in \Gamma: x(r) 
eq 0\}$ is at most countable, which is obviously a closed subspace of $l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$. When $\Gamma$ is countable, $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ and $l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ are the usual Banach spaces $l^{\infty}$. It can be shown that when $\Gamma$ is an uncountable set, $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ cannot be endowed with an equivalent strictly convex norm; neither can $l^{\infty}(\Gamma)$. Let $U$ be the unit sphere in $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$. For $x \in l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma),\|x\|=1$, let $F_{x}=\{y \in U: y(r)=x(r) 	ext{ when } x(r) 
eq 0 \}$. If there exists a norm $\|\cdot\|_{1}$ equivalent to $\|\cdot\|$ on $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$, then there exists $K \geq 1$ such that $\|x\| \leq \|x\|_{1} \leq K\|x\|$ for $x \in l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$. Let $M_{x}=\sup\{\|y\|_{1}: y \in F_{x}\}$, $m_{x}=\inf\{\|y\|_{1}: y \in F_{x}\}$. When $\|x\|=1$, it is clear that $M_{x} \leq K, m_{x} \geq 1$. We will prove the equality $M_{x}+m_{x}=2\|x\|_{1}$ holds. (1) In fact, for any $\varepsilon>0$, choose $y \in F_{x}$ such that $\|y\|_{1}<m_{x}+\varepsilon$. Since $\|x \pm(y-x)\| \leq 1$, and when $x(r) 
eq 0$, $x(r) \pm(y(r)-x(r))=x(r)$, so $x \pm(y-x) \in F_{x}$, thus $2\|x\|_{1} =\|x+(y-x)+x-(y-x)\|_{1} \leq\|x+(y-x)\|_{1}+\|x-(y-x)\|_{1} \leq m_{x}+\varepsilon+M_{x}$. Let $\varepsilon ightarrow 0$ to get $2\|x\|_{1} \leq m_{x}+M_{x}$. Similarly, choosing $y \in F_{x}, \|y\|_{1}>M_{x}-\varepsilon$, it follows similarly that $2\|x\|_{1} \geq M_{x}+m_{x}$. Hence, the equation (1) is proved. Rewrite equation (1) as $m_{x}=2\|x\|_{1}-M_{x}$. Choose $x_{1} \in l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma), \left\|x_{1}ight\|=1 , \left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}> rac{(3 K+1)}{4}$ (note, due to choosing $K$ as the smallest number such that the inequality $\|x\| \leq \|x\|_{1} \leq K\|x\|$ holds, such an $x_{1}$ exists), then $m_{x_{1}}=2\left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}-M_{x_{1}} \geq  rac{(3 K+1)}{2}-K= rac{(K+1)}{2}, M_{x_{1}}-m_{x_{1}} \leq K- rac{(K+1)}{2}= rac{(K-1)}{2}$. Choose $x_{2} \in F_{x_{1}}$, such that $\left\|x_{2}ight\|_{1} \geq  rac{\left(3 M_{x_{1}}+\left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}ight)}{4}$ (such $x_{2}$ exists), and from $x_{2} \in F_{x_{1}}$ it follows that $F_{x_{2}} \subset F_{x_{1}}$, so $M_{x_{1}} \geq M_{x_{2}}$. Thus $m_{x_{2}}=2\left\|x_{2}ight\|_{1}-M_{x_{2}} \geq  rac{\left(3 M_{x_{1}}+\left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}ight)}{2}-M_{x_{1}} = rac{\left(M_{x_{1}}+\left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}ight)}{2}, M_{x_{2}}-m_{x_{2}} \leq M_{x_{1}}-m_{x_{2}} \leq  rac{\left(M_{x_{1}}-\left\|x_{1}ight\|_{1}ight)}{2} \leq  rac{\left(M_{x_{1}}-m_{x_{1}}ight)}{2} \leq  rac{(K-1)}{2^{2}}$. Continuing this process, we obtain a sequence $\left\{x_{n}ight\} \subset l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$, for each $n, x_{n+1} \in F_{x_{n}}$, and $0 \leq M_{x_{n}}-m_{x_{n}} \leq  rac{(K-1)}{2^{n}}$, hence $\lim_{n ightarrow \infty} M_{x_{n}}=\lim_{n ightarrow \infty} m_{x_{n}}=\mu$. Clearly, for each $y \in  igcap_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{x_{n}}$, the inequality $m_{x_{n}} \leq\|y\|_{1} \leq M_{x_{n}}, \quad n=1,2, \ldots$ holds, so $\|y\|_{1}=\mu$. Now define $x \in l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$: if $x_{n}(r)=0$ for all $n$, set $x(r)=0$; if there exists an $n$ such that $x_{n}(r) 
eq 0$, set $x(r)=x_{n}(r)$. Since $F_{x_{n+1}} \subset F_{x_{n}}$, when $x_{m}(r) 
eq 0$ for all $n \geq m$, then $x_{n}(r)=x_{m}(r)$, thus $x$ is uniquely determined. For this $x$, we know that $y \in F_{x}$ if and only if $y \in  igcap_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{x_{n}}$. Therefore, for all $y$ in $F_{x}$, $\|y\|_{2}=\|x\|_{1}=\mu$. Since $\Gamma$ is an uncountable set, we know that $F_{x}$ contains infinitely many elements. Let $y_{1}, y_{2} \in F_{x}$, then $\left\|\lambda y_{1}+(1-\lambda) y_{2}ight\| \leq 1$, when $x(r)=0$, $y_{1}(r)=y_{2}(r)=x(r)$, hence $\left(\lambda y_{1}+(1-\lambda) y_{2}ight)(r)=x(r)$. Therefore, $\lambda y_{1}+(1-\lambda) y_{2} \in F_{x}, \| \lambda y_{1}+(1-\lambda) y_{2} \|=\mu$. As a result, the sphere $\left\{z \in l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma):\|z\|_{1} \leq \muight\}$ in $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ under norm $\|\cdot\|_{1}$ is not strictly convex, so $\left \| \cdot ight \|$ is not strictly convex. This demonstrates that any norm equivalent to the original norm $\left \| \cdot ight \|$ in $l_{0}^{\infty}(\Gamma)$ is not strictly convex.

statement: There exists a continuous mapping that maps a certain bounded closed set to a non-closed set.
chinese_statement: 一个连续映射， 它把某个有界闭集映成非闭集。
rationale: Take the usual distance on $X=[0,1)$, then X is an incomplete metric space. Let $F=\left[\frac{1}{2}, 1\right)$, it is easy to see that F is a bounded closed set in X. Let f be the mapping that maps X onto the unit circle: $f(x)=x, 0 \leqslant x<1$, then f is a continuous mapping. But f maps the bounded closed set F to a non-closed set.
chinese_rationale: 在  $X=[0，1)$  上取通常距离， 则  X  为一不完备的度量空间。 令  $F=\left[\frac{1}{2}， 1\right)$ ， 易见，  F  是  X  中的有界闭集。 设  f  是把  X  映到同长圆周上的映射:  $f(x)=x， 0 \leqslant x<1$ ， 则  f  为一连续映射。 但  f  把有界闭集  F  映成非闭集。

statement: There exists a sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$, which is a basis for the Banach spaces $\left(X,\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$ and $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$, but not a basis for $\left(\boldsymbol{X} \cap \boldsymbol{Y},\|\cdot\|=\|\cdot\|_{x}+\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$.
chinese_statement: 存在点列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ ， 它是 Banach 空间  $\left(X，\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$  与  $\left(Y，\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  的基，但不是  $\left(\boldsymbol{X} \cap \boldsymbol{Y}，\|\cdot\|=\|\cdot\|_{x}+\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  的基。
rationale: The example is as follows: Let $X=l^{2}, Y_{0}=l$, then X and $Y_{0}$ are Banach spaces with bases. Let $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$ be the natural bases in X and $Y_{0}$ respectively, i.e., $x_{n}=y_{n}=e_{n}, n=1,2, \cdots$. Let M be the subspace of X formed by all finite linear combinations of the basis $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$. Since X and $Y_{0}$ are both infinite-dimensional separable Banach spaces, their Hamel bases have equal cardinality. By Zorn's lemma, there exists a one-to-one linear mapping T from $Y_{0}$ to X such that for each n, $T y_{n}=x_{n}$. Let $Y=X$, then for each $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in Y$, there is a unique $y=\left\{\eta_{n}\right\} \in Y_{0}$ corresponding to it. We take the norm $\|x\|_{Y}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{n}\right|$ on Y, then $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$ is clearly a Banach space. Since T is a one-to-one linear mapping from $Y_{0}$ to Y, and $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$ is a basis for $Y_{0}$, it follows that $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is a basis for Y. Therefore, $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is a basis for both $\left(X,\|\cdot\|_{x}\right)$ and $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$. Take any $u \in M$, then u can be expressed in the form $\lambda_{1} x_{1}+\cdots+\lambda_{n} x_{n}$, and $\|u\|_{X}=\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left|\lambda_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \leqslant \sum_{i=1}^{n}\left|\lambda_{i}\right|=\|u\|_{Y}$. This shows that for each sequence in M, if it is a Cauchy sequence in $\left(Y,\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$, then it is also a Cauchy sequence in $\left(X,\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$. Take any $z \in X$, then z can be uniquely expressed as $z=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{i} x_{i}$, where the sum of the series is in the sense of the norm $\|\cdot\|_{Y}$. Since the partial sum sequence of this series is a Cauchy sequence in M, it also converges under the norm $\|\cdot\|_{x}$, let its sum be y. We point out that z and y are not necessarily equal. In fact, if for every $z \in X$, the corresponding y equals z, then by the closed graph theorem, the norms $\|\cdot\|_{X}$ and $\|\cdot\|_{Y}$ would be equivalent, and thus $l^{2}$ and l would be linearly homeomorphic. Hence, they would either both be reflexive or both not be reflexive, which is clearly absurd. Now take $z \in X$, so that the corresponding y does not equal z. Therefore, for any sequence $\left\{\lambda_{i}\right\}$, the series $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{i} x_{i}$ cannot converge to z under the norm $\|\cdot\|_{X}+\|\cdot\|_{Y}$, i.e., $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is not a basis for $X \cap Y$.
chinese_rationale: 例子如下:设  $X=l^{2}， Y_{0}=l$ ， 则  X  与  $Y_{0}$  都是具有基的 Banach 空间。 设  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  与  $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$  分别是  X  与  $Y_{0}$  中的自然基， 即  $x_{n}=y_{n}=e_{n}， n=1，2 ，  \cdots$ . 令  M  是由基 $ \left\{x_{n}\right\}$  的一切有限线性组合所构成的  X  的子空间。因  X  与  $Y_{0}$  都是无穷维可分的 Banach 空间， 故它们的 Hamel 基的势均为势。 于是据Zorn引理， 存在由  $Y_{0}$  到  X  上的一对一的线性映射  T ， 使对每一  n ， 有  $T y_{n}=x_{n}$ 。 设  $Y=X$ ， 则对每一  $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in Y$ ，存在唯一的  $y=\left\{\eta_{n}\right\} \in Y_{0}$  与之对应。 我们在  Y  上取范数$\|x\|_{Y}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\eta_{n}\right|$则  $\left(Y，\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  显然为 Banach 空间。 因  T  是由  $Y_{0}$  到  Y  上的一对一线性映射， 而  $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$  是  $Y_{0}$  的基，故  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  是  Y  的基。 因此，  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  既是 $\left(X，\|\cdot\|_{x}\right)$  的基， 又是  $\left(Y，\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  的基。任取  $u \in M$ ， 则  u  可表成  $\lambda_{1} x_{1}+\cdots+\lambda_{n} x_{n}$  的形式， 且$\|u\|_{X}=\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left|\lambda_{i}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \leqslant \sum_{i=1}^{n}\left|\lambda_{i}\right|=\|u\|_{Y}$ 。由此可见，  M  中的每个点列， 如果它是  $\left(Y，\|\cdot\|_{Y}\right)$  中的 Cauchy 点列， 那么它也是  $\left(X，\|\cdot\|_{X}\right)$  中的 Cauchy 点列。 任取  $z \in X$ ， 则  z  可唯一地表成$z=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{i} x_{i}$，这里， 级数的和是在范数  $\|\cdot \|_{Y}$  意义之下的。因为这个级数的部分和点列是  M  中的 Cauchy 点列， 所以它在范数  $\|\cdot\|_{x}$  之下也收敛， 设其和为  y ， 我们指出，  z  与  y  不必相等。事实上， 如果对每一个  $z \in X$ ， 对应的  y  都与  z  相等， 那么 由闭图象定理可知， 范数  $\|\cdot\|_{X}$  与  $\|\cdot\|_{Y}$  将是等价的， 从而  $l^{2}$  与  l  将 是线性同胚的。 于是， 它们或者都是自反的， 或者都不是自反的， 这显然是荒谬的。今取  $z \in X$ ， 使对应的  y  与  z  不相等。 于是， 对任何数列  $\left\{\lambda_{i}\right\}$ ，级数  $\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{i} x_{i}$  不可能在范数  $\|\cdot\|_{X}+\|\cdot\|_{Y}$  之下收敛于  z ， 即  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  不是  $X \cap Y$  的基。

statement: There exist a trigonometric function that converges everywhere, whose sum is not (L) integrable.
chinese_statement: 一个处处收敛的三角函数，其和函数并不(L)可积。
rationale: Consider the trigonometric function $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin nx}{\ln x}$, it is easy to prove that this series converges at every real number x. Let $f(x)=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin n x}{\ln x}$. Now prove that f is not (L) integrable. In fact, if f is (L) integrable, then $F(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$ is an absolutely continuous periodic function. Since f is an odd function, F is an even function, and therefore the Fourier series of F is of the form $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} \cos n x$ where $a_{0}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) d x$, and when $n \geq 2$, $\begin{aligned} a_{n} & =\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) \cos n x d x \\& =\left.\frac{2}{\pi} F(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n}\right|_{0} ^{\pi}-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F^{\prime}(x) \frac{\sin nx}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} f(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{1}{n \ln n}. \end{aligned}$ Since F is absolutely continuous, it is also a function of bounded variation. Thus, by Jordan's test for convergence, its Fourier series converges at every point, especially at $x=0$. From this, it follows that the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{n}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ converges. However, it is known that the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ is divergent. This contradiction shows that the sum function f is not (L) integrable.
chinese_rationale: 考虑三角函数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin nx}{\ln x}$容易证明，此级数在每个实数  x  处都收敛。令$f(x)=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin n x}{\ln x}$ 。现证  f  并不  (L)  可列。事实上，如果  f  是  (L)  可积的， 那么$F(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$是绝对连续的周期函数。由于  f  是奇函数， 所以  F  是偶函数， 因而  F  的 Fourier 级数形如$\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} \cos n x$其中$a_{0}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) d x$ ， 而当$n \geqslant 2$  时，$\begin{aligned}a_{n} & =\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) \cos n x d x \\& =\left.\frac{2}{\pi} F(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n}\right|_{0} ^{\pi}-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F^{\prime}(x) \frac{\sin nx}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} f(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{1}{n \ln n} 。\end{aligned}$因为  F  是绝对连续函数，所以它也是有界变差函数。于是由Jordan 判敛法可知， 其 Fourier 级数在每一点都收敛， 特别在 点 $x=0$  处收敛。 由此推知级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{n}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$  收敛。 然而如所周知， 级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ 是发散的。 这个矛盾表明了和函数  f  并不  (L) 可积。

statement: There exist two disjoint closed sets with distance zero.
chinese_statement: 存在距离为零的两个不相交的闭集。
rationale: Let $\begin{array}{l}F_{1}=\{(x, y): xy=1\}, \\F_{2}=\{(x, y): y=0, x \text{ arbitrary }\}, \end{array}$ then $F_{1}$ and $F_{2}$ are both closed and disjoint. For any given $ \varepsilon>0$, take points $(2/\varepsilon, \varepsilon/2)$ in $F_{1}$ and $(2/\varepsilon, 0)$ in $F_{2}$, it is clear that the distance between these two points is $\varepsilon/2<\varepsilon$. Thus, $d\left(F_{1}, F_{2}\right) \Rightarrow \inf_{p\in F_{1}, q\in F_{2}} d(p, q)=0$. Note: Let $F_{1}$ and $F_{2}$ be two non-empty closed sets, and at least one of them is bounded, then if $d\left(F_{1}, F_{2}\right)=0$, $F_{1}$ and $F_{2}$ must intersect. The above counterexample is possible because both given closed sets are unbounded.
chinese_rationale: 设$\begin{array}{l}F_{1}=\{(x， y): x y=1\}， \\F_{2}=\{(x， y): y=0， x \text { 任意 }\}， \end{array}$则  $F_{1}$  和 $ F_{2}$  都是闭集且不相交。任给$ \varepsilon>0$ ， 在 $ F_{1}$  和  $F_{2}$  中分别取点  $(2 / \varepsilon， \varepsilon / 2)$  和  $(2 / \varepsilon， 0)$  ，易见， 这两点定间的距离为  $\varepsilon / 2<\varepsilon$ 。 由此可知，$d\left(F_{1}， F_{2}\right) \Rightarrow \inf _{p\in F_{1}，q\in F_{2}} d(p， q)=0$ 。注 设$F_{1}$和 $F_{2}$为两个不空的闭集， 并且其中至少有一个是有界的， 那么， 若$d\left(F_{1}， F_{2}\right)=0$ ， 则  $F_{1}$ 与 $F_{2}$必定相交。上述反例之所以成为可能，是由于给定的两个闭集都是无界的。

statement: For a function f on the interval $[a, b]$, if it satisfies any two of the three conditions of Rolle's theorem, then there must exist a $\xi \in(a, b)$ such that $f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$.
chinese_statement: $[a， b]$ 上的函数  f ， 如果它满足 Rolle 定理的三个条件中任两个条件， 那么一定存在  $\xi \in(a， b)$ ， 使$f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$ 。
rationale: Example (1): Let $f(x)=1-|x|, -1 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$, then f is continuous on the closed interval [-1,1] and $f(-1)=f(1)=0$, i.e., f satisfies conditions (i) and (iii) of the theorem. Also, for all x in (-1,1) except at $x=0$, $f^{\prime}(x)$ exists and is finite: $f^{\prime}(x) \quad\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, -1<x<0, \\-1, 0<x<1.\end{array}\right.$ However, there is no $\xi $ in (-1,1) such that $ f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$. Example (2): Let $f(x)=x-[x], 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$, where $[x]$ represents the floor function. It is clear that f is differentiable within (0,1), and $ f(0)=f(1)=0$, i.e., f satisfies conditions (ii) and (iii) of the theorem. However, since $f^{\prime}(x)=1, 0<x<1$, there is no such $\xi \in(0,1)$ such that $f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$. Example (3): Let $f(x)=x, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$, then f is continuous and differentiable on [0,1], hence f satisfies conditions (i) and (ii) of the theorem. But since $f^{\prime}(x) \equiv 1$, there is no $\xi \in(0,1)$ such that $f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$. Note: The above examples illustrate that any two of the three conditions of Rolle's theorem are not sufficient to ensure that the derivative of the function is zero at some point in $(a, b)$. In other words, none of the three assumptions can be omitted.
chinese_rationale:
例(1)： 设$f(x)=1-|x|，-1 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$，则  f  在闭区间  [-1，1]  上连续， 并且 $f(-1)=f(1)=0 $， 即  f  满足定理的条件 (i) 利(iii)。 还有， 对  (-1，1) 中除$x=0$外的所有  x ， $f^{\prime}(x)$ 存在且有限：$f^{\prime}(x) \quad\left\{\begin{array}{l}1，-1<x<0， \\-1，0<x<1 。\end{array}\right.$然而， 在  (-1，1)  中就没有  $\xi $ 能使 $ f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$  。
例(2)： 设$f(x)=x-[x]， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$，其中  $[x]$  代表括号函数。 易见，  f  在  (0，1)  内可微， 且$ f(0)=f(1)   =0$ ， 即  f  满足定理的条件 (ii) 和 (iii)。 然而， 由于  $f^{\prime}(x)=1，0<x   <1 $， 因此， 不存在如此之 $\xi \in(0，1)$ ， 使  $f^{\prime}(\xi)=0 $ 。
例(3) ：设$f(x)=x， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$，则  f  在  [0，1]  上连续且可微， 从而  f  满足定理的条件 (i) 和 (ii)。但由于 $f^{\prime}(x) \equiv 1$ ， 因而不存在$\xi \in(0，1)$ ， 使 $f^{\prime}(\xi)=0$。注： 上述例子说明， Rolle 定理的三个条件， 无论哪两个 都不足以保证导函数在$(a， b)$内某点取值为零， 换句话说， 三个假设中任一个都不能去掉。

statement: There exists a (L) measurable set in the plane, whose projections on the axes are not (L) measurable.
chinese_statement: 存在平面上的一个(L)可测集，它在坐标轴上的射影都不是(L)可测的。
rationale: Let A be a non-(L) measurable set in [0, 1], and let $E=(A \times\{0\}) \cup(\{0\} \times A) \subset[0, 1] \times[0, 1]$, then $A \times\{0\}$ and $\{0\} \times A$ are both (L) measurable sets in the plane, so E is also a (L) measurable set in the plane, and its plane measure is 0. However, the projections of E on the axes are non-($\boldsymbol{L}$) measurable sets.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  是  [0，1]  中的一个非  (L)  可测集，令$E=(A \times\{0\}) \cup(\{0\} \times A) \subset[0，1] \times[0，1]$，则  $A \times\{0\}$  和 $ \{0\} \times A $ 均为平面上的  (L)  可测集， 从而  E  也是平面上的  (L)  可测集， 且其平面测度为0。然而，  E  在坐际轴上的射影均为非  ($\boldsymbol{L}$)  可测集。

statement: The continuous function in Luzin's theorem cannot be replaced by a polynomial.
chinese_statement: 不能把 Лузин 定理中的连续函数改为多项式。
rationale: For example: Take $ E=[0, 1], f(x)=\sin x $ and a positive number $\varepsilon$ such that $ 0<\varepsilon<1$. If there exists a closed set $F \subset E$, such that $ m(E \backslash F)<\varepsilon $, and on F, $f(x)$ is equal to some polynomial $P(x)=a_{0}+a_{1} x ; \cdots +a_{n} x^{n}$, then $f(x)-P(x)$ is identically zero on F. Since $ m(E \backslash F)<\varepsilon$, we have $mF>0$, so $f(x)-P(x)=\sin x-\left(a_{0}+a_{1} x+\cdots+a_{n} x^{n}\right)$ has infinitely many zero points on [0,1]. Thus, when $ k \geqslant n+1 $, $\frac{d^{k}}{d x^{k}}(f(x)-P(x)) $ has infinitely many zero points on $[ 0,1]$, meaning $ \cos x $ or $ \sin x$ has infinitely many zero points on [0,1], which is impossible. Therefore, there does not exist a closed set $ F \subset E$ such that $ m(B \backslash F)<\varepsilon $ and on F, $f(x)$ is equal to some polynomial $ P(x) $.
chinese_rationale: 例如：取$ E=[0，1]， f(x)=\sin x $ 及正数$\varepsilon$  适合 $ 0<\varepsilon<1$ 。 若有闭集  $F \subset E$ ， 使 $ m(E \backslash F)<\varepsilon $， 且在  F  上  $f(x) $ 等于某个多项式$P(x)=a_{0}+a_{1} x ; \cdots +a_{n} x^{n}$，则$f(x)-P(x)$在F上恒等于零。由$ m(E \backslash F)<\varepsilon $得到$mF>0$，所以$f(x)-P(x)=\sin x-\left(a_{0}+a_{1} x+\cdots+a_{n} x^{n}\right)$在 [0，1]上就有无穷多个零点， 从而当 $ k \geqslant n+1 $ 时，  $\frac{d^{k}}{d x^{k}}(f(x)-   P(x)) $ 在 $[ 0，1]$上有无穷多个零点， 即 $ \cos x $ 或 $ \sin x$在  [0，1]  上有无穷多个零点， 这是不可能的。因此， 不存在闭集 $ F \subset E$ ， 使$ m(B \backslash F)   <\varepsilon $ 且在  F  上  $f(x) $ 等于某个多项式 $ P(x) $。

statement: There are differentiable functions that do not satisfy Hölder conditions of any order.
chinese_statement: 存在不满足任何阶Hölder条件的可微函数。
rationale: The function $f(x)=e^{x}$ is differentiable on $[0, +\infty)$. It is easy to prove that $f$ does not satisfy any order of the Hölder condition. In fact, for any $\alpha>0$ and any fixed $x_{0}>0$, there is $\lim _{x \rightarrow+\infty} \frac{e^{x}-e^{x_{0}}}{\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{\alpha}}=+\infty$. Therefore, there is no constant $M>0$ such that for all $x\in[0, +\infty)$, there is $\left|f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right| \leqslant M \| x-x_{0} \|_{n}$, that is, $f$ does not satisfy the Hölder condition of order $\alpha$ on $[0, +\infty)$.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x)=e^{x}$  在 $[0，+\infty)$  内可微。 易证，  f  不满足任何阶 Hölder 条件。 事实上， 任取 $ \alpha>0$  及任意固定$x_{0}>0 $， 有$\lim _{x \rightarrow+\infty} \frac{e^{x}-e^{x_{0}}}{\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{\alpha}}=+\infty$因此， 不存在常数 $ M>0 $， 使对一切$x\in[0，+\infty)$，都有$\left|f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right| \leqslant M \| x-x_{0} \|_{n}$，即  f  在$[0，+\infty)$ 上不满是$\alpha$  阶 Hölder 条件。

statement: There exist functions $f(x)$ and $g(y)$, which are generally (R) integrable on $0 \leqslant x < +\infty$ and $0 \leqslant y < +\infty$, respectively, but $f(x) g(y)$ is not generally (R) integrable on $[0, +\infty) \times [0, +\infty)$.
chinese_statement: 存在函数  $f(x)$  与 $ g(y)$ ， 它们分别在 $ 0 \leqslant x<+\infty $ 与 $ 0 \leqslant y<+\infty$ 上广义  (R)  可积， 但 $ f(x) g(y)$  在 $ [0，+\infty) \times[0，+\infty)$  上并不广义 (R) 可积。
rationale: Define the function $f(x) = \sin x / n, 2(n-1) \pi \leqslant x < 2n\pi, n = 1, 2, \cdots$ on $I_{1} = [0, +\infty)$; also define the function $g(y) = \sin y / n, 2(n-1) \pi \leqslant y < 2n\pi, n = 1, 2, \cdots$ on $I_{2} = [0, +\infty)$. Let $h(x, y) = f(x) g(y), (x, y) \in I_{1} \times I_{2}$. It is evident that $f(x)$ and $g(y)$ are generally (R) integrable on $I_{1}$ and $I_{2}$, respectively, and their integral values are 0. Now we prove that $h(x, y)$ is not generally (R) integrable on $I_{1} \times I_{2}$. In fact, if $h(x, y)$ is generally (R) integrable on $I_{1} \times I_{2}$, then $|h(x, y)|$ should also be generally (R) integrable on $I_{1} \times I_{2}$ (note that the generalized (R) double integral is a kind of absolutely convergent integral, which is different from the generalized (R) single integral). However, $\begin{array}{l}\lim _{\substack{n \rightarrow \infty \\ m \rightarrow \infty}} \int_{0}^{2n\pi} \int_{0}^{2m\pi} |h(x, y)| dx dy \\= \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2n\pi} \mid f(x)\left(\left(\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{k=1}^{m} \int_{2(k-1)\pi}^{2k\pi} \frac{|\sin y|}{k} dy\right) dx\right. \\= \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2n\pi} |f(x)|\left(\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{k=1}^{m} \frac{4}{k}\right) dx = +\infty. \\\end{array}$ Therefore, $|h(x, y)|$ is not generally (R) integrable on $I_{1} \times I_{2}$, and thus $h(x, y)$ is not generally (R) integrable on $I_{1} \times I_{2}$ as well.
chinese_rationale: 在  $I_{1}=[0，+\infty)$  上定义函数 $f(x)=\sin x / n， 2(n-1) \pi \leqslant x<2 \pi \pi， n=1，2， \cdots $; 又在  $I_{2}=[0 ，  +\infty)$  上定义函数$g(y)=\sin y / n， 2(n-1) \pi \leqslant y<2 n \pi， n=1，2， \cdots$ 。并令 $ \quad h(x， y)=f(x) g(y)，(x， y) \in I_{1} \times I_{2}$ 。易见，  $f(x)$  与 $g(y)$  分别在  $I_{1} $ 与 $ I_{2}$  上是广义  (R)  可积的， 且其积分值为 0 。今证  $h(x， y)$  在  $I_{1} \times I_{2}$  上并不广义  (R)  可积。事实上， 如果  $h(x， y) $ 在  $I_{1} \times I_{2} $ 上是 广义(R)  可积的， 那么  $|h(x， y)| $ 在 $ I_{1} \times I_{2} $ 上也应当是广义 (R) 可积的（注意，广义  (R)  二重积分是一种绝对收敛积分，这有别于广义 (R)一重积分）。然而$\begin{array}{l}\lim _{\substack{n \rightarrow \infty \\m \rightarrow \infty}} \int_{0}^{2 n \pi} \int_{0}^{2 m \pi}|h(x， y)| d x d y \\=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 n \pi} \mid f(x)\left(\left(\left.\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty}\right|_{0} ^{2 m \pi}|g(x)| d y\right) d x\right. \\=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 n \pi}|f(x)|\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{k=1}^{n} \int_{2(k-1) \pi}^{2 k \pi} \frac{| \sin y|}{k} d y\right) d x \\=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 n \pi}|f(x)|\left(\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{k=1}^{m} \frac{4}{k}\right) d x=+ \infty 。 \\\end{array}$因此， $|h(x， y) \mid $ 在  $I_{1} \times I_{2}$  上并不了义  (R)  可积， 从而  $h(x， y)$  在 $ I_{1} \times   I_{2}$  上也不广义  (R)  可积。

statement: There exists an (L) integrable function f on [0, 1] such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} n m E[x: f(x) \geqslant n]=+\infty \text {。}$
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  上的一个  (L)  可积函数  f ， 使$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} n m E[x: f(x) \geqslant n]=+\infty \text {。}$
rationale: Define the function f on [0, 1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / \sqrt{x}, 0<x \leqslant 1, \\0, x=0.\end{array}\right.$ Obviously, f is non-negative measurable and (L) integrable on [0, 1]. However, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} n m E[x: f(x) \geqslant n]=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty $.
chinese_rationale: 在  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / \sqrt{x}， 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0， x=0。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f 在[0，1]  上非负可测且  (L)  可积。但是，$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} n m E[x: f(x) \geqslant n]=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}=+\infty $。

statement: There exists a sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on [0,1], such that $\left|f_{n}\right|_{L^{r}[0,1]} \leqslant M(n=1, 2, \cdots), \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges pointwise to f on [0,1], but $\left.\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \mid |f_{n}-f \|_{L^{r}[0,1]}\right. \neq 0$.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  上的一个函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ， 适合  $\left|f_{n}\right|_{L^{r}[0，1]} \leqslant M(n=1 ，  2， \cdots)，\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  [0，1]  上处处收敛于  f ， 但  $\left.\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \mid |f_{n}-f \|_{L^{r}[0，1]}\right. \neq 0 $。
rationale: Define the sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on [0,1] as follows: $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges pointwise to 0 on [0,1], and $\left\|f_{n}\right\|_{L^{r}[0,1]} \leqslant 1 \text{. }$ However, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \|_{L^{r}[0,1]} \neq 0$.
chinese_rationale: 在  [0，1]  上定义函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ 如下:则  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  [0，1]  上处处收敛于 0 ， 且$\left\|f_{n}\right\|_{L^{r}[0，1]} \leqslant 1 \text {。 }$然而 $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \|_{L^{r}[0，1]} \neq 0$ 。

statement: There exist two functions f and g such that ${f}^{2}$ and ${g}^{2}$ are both Riemann integrable, but $(f+g)^{2}$ is not Riemann integrable.
chinese_statement: 存在两个函数f 与 g，使 ${f}^{2}$与${g}^{2}$皆(R)可积而$(f+g)^{2}$ 并不(R)可积。
rationale: Define functions f and g on [0, 1]: $\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & x \text { is irrational, } \\-1, & x \text { is rational, }\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & x \text { is an algebraic number } \\-1, & x \text { is a transcendental number. }\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ Thus, $f^{2}(x) \equiv 1, g^{2}(x)\equiv 1$, so they are both Riemann integrable on [0, 1]. However, $f(x)+g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2, x \text { is both an algebraic number and irrational, } \\0, \text { otherwise, }\end{array}\right.$ Therefore, $(f+g)^{2}$ is nowhere continuous on [0, 1], and thus it is not Riemann integrable on [0, 1].
chinese_rationale: 在  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  和  g: $\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1， & x \text { 为无理数， } \\-1， & x \text { 为有理数， }\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1， & x \text { 为代数数 } \\-1， & x \text { 为超越数。 }\end{array}\right.\end{array}$于是， $f^{2}(x) \equiv 1， g^{2}(x)\equiv 1$， 所以它们在  [0，1]  上都是  (R)  可积的。但是，$f(x)+g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2， x \text { 既为代数数又为无理数， } \\0， \text { 其它， }\end{array}\right.$因此，$(f+g)^{2}$  在  [0，1]  上无处连续， 从而它在  [0，1]  上不  (R)  可积。
