statement: There exists a convergent trigonometric series that is not the Fourier series of any (L) integrable function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个收敛的三角级数， 它不是某个 (L) 可积函数的 Fourier 级数。
rationale: The everywhere convergent trigonometric series $f(x)=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin n x}{\ln n} $ is not the Fourier series of any (L) integrable function. We only need to show that it is not (L) integrable: First, prove that f is not (L) integrable. In fact, if f is (L) integrable, then $F(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$ is an absolutely continuous periodic function. Since f is an odd function, F is an even function, and thus the Fourier series of F is of the form $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} \cos n x$ where $a_{0}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) d x$, and for $n \geqslant 2$, $\begin{aligned}a_{n} & =\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) \cos n x d x \\& =\left.\frac{2}{\pi} F(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n}\right|_{0} ^{\pi}-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F^{\prime}(x) \frac{\sin nx}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} f(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{1}{n \ln n}. \end{aligned}$ Since F is an absolutely continuous function, it is also a function of bounded variation. Thus, by Jordan's criterion for convergence, its Fourier series converges at every point, especially converging at the point $x=0$. It follows that the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{n}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ converges. However, as is well known, the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ diverges. This contradiction shows that the function f is not (L) integrable.
chinese_rationale: 处处收敛的三角级数$f(x)=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{\sin n x}{\ln n}  $不是某个  (L)  可积函数的 Fourier 级数。我们只用说明其不是(L)可积函数即可：现证  f  并不  (L)  可列。事实上，如果  f  是  (L)  可积的， 那么$F(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$是绝对连续的周期函数。由于  f  是奇函数， 所以  F  是偶函数， 因而  F  的 Fourier 级数形如$\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_{n} \cos n x$其中$a_{0}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) d x$ ， 而当$n \geqslant 2$  时，$\begin{aligned}a_{n} & =\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F(x) \cos n x d x \\& =\left.\frac{2}{\pi} F(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n}\right|_{0} ^{\pi}-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} F^{\prime}(x) \frac{\sin nx}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{2}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi} f(x) \frac{\sin n x}{n} d x \\& =-\frac{1}{n \ln n} 。\end{aligned}$因为  F  是绝对连续函数，所以它也是有界变差函数。于是由Jordan 判敛法可知， 其 Fourier 级数在每一点都收敛， 特别在 点 $x=0$  处收敛。 由此推知级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{n}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$  收敛。 然而如所周知， 级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n}$ 是发散的。 这个矛盾表明了函数  f  并不  (L) 可积。

statement: There exists a function that is nowhere continuous but everywhere semi-continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在无处连续而又处处半连续的函数。
rationale: The function $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number. }\end{array}\right.$ is nowhere continuous. However, it is upper semi-continuous at rational points and lower semi-continuous at irrational points.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数. }\end{array}\right.$是无处连续的， 但在有理点上 ， 它是上半连续的， 而在无理点上， 它是下半连续的。

statement: There exists a bounded planar set with no area.
chinese_statement: 存在没有面积的有界平面集。
rationale: Within the unit square, consider the set $S=(\mathscr{D} \cap[0, 1]) \times(\mathscr{D} \cap[0, 1])$ of points where both coordinates are rational. This set has no area because the boundary $F(S)$ of $S$ does not have zero measure (the set $F(S)$ is the unit square itself, hence its area is 1). The outer measure of $S$ is 1, while its inner measure is 0.
chinese_rationale: 单位正方形内， 两个坐标都是有理数的点的集合$S=(\mathscr{D} \cap[0，1]) \times(\mathscr{D}[0，1])$没有面积， 其中$\mathscr{D}$为全体有理数， 这是因为  S  的边界  $F(S)$  的面积不等于零 (集 $ F(S$  ) 是单位正方形本身， 因此， 它的面积等于 1)。 S 的外面积是 1 ， 而它的内面积积 0。

statement: There exists a sequence of pairwise disjoint sets $\left\{A_{n}\right\}$ such that $ m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)<\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个两两不相交的集序列$\left\{A_{n}\right\}$ ， 使 $ m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)<\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}$ 。
rationale: For example: Classify all points in $[-1 / 2,1 / 2]$ as follows. Two points x and y are classified in the same category if and only if $x-y$ is a rational number. Let $x \in[-1 / 2,1 / 2]$, and group all points in [-1 / 2, 1 / 2] of the form $x+r$ (r representing a rational number) into a category $K(x)$. Thus, for a given x, there is a category $K(x)$ corresponding to it, and $x \in \boldsymbol{K}(\boldsymbol{x})$. It can be shown that two different categories $K(x)$ and $K(y)$ are disjoint. If they intersect, then there exists $z \in K(x) \cap K(y)$. Consequently, $z=x+r_{x}=y+r_{r}$ where $r_{z}$ and $r_{y}$ are rational numbers, hence $y=x+r_{x}-r_{y}$. Now, assuming $t \in K(y)$, then from $t=y+r=x+\left(r_{x}-r_{y}+r\right)=x+r^{\prime}$, we get $t \in K(x)$, hence $K(y) \subset K(x)$. Similarly, $K(x) \subset K(y)$, thus $K(x) =\boldsymbol{K}(y)$. This contradicts the assumption. After classifying [-1/2, 1/2] in the above manner, pick an arbitrary point in each category as a representative element, and denote this set by A. Let the set of rational points in [-1, 1] be $r_{0}=0, r_{1}, r_{2}, r_{3}, \cdots$. Define $A_{k}$ to be the set obtained by translating A by $\varphi_{k}(x)=x+r_{k}$. If $x \in A$, then $\varphi_{k}(x) \in A_{k}$; if $x \in A_{k}$, then $x-r_{k} \in A$. Especially, $A_{0}=A$. Let $\left\{A_{n}\right\}$ be the sequence of pairwise disjoint sets defined above. For each $n, m^{*} A_{n}= \beta>0$, and $A_{n} \subset[-3 / 2, 3 / 2]$, thus $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}A_{n} \subset [-3 / 2, 3 / 2]$, hence $m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right) \leqslant 3$. However, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}=+\infty$, so $m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)<\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}$.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 将$[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$  中所有的点以下法分类， 两点  x  与  y ， 当且仅当$x-y $ 是有理数吋， 称  x  与  y  属于同一类。 设  $x \in[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$ ，将  [-1 / 2，1 / 2]  中具有形式 $ x+r$(r  表示有理数  )  的点的全体归为一类  $K(x)$  。这样， 对于一个  x ， 有一类 $ K(x)$  与之对应， 且$x \in \boldsymbol{K}(\boldsymbol{x})$ 。其次可证不同的两类$ K(x)$  和 $ K(y)$  是不相交的。 因为如果它们相交，那么有  $z \in K(x) \cap K(y) $ 。因而$z=x+r_{x}=y+r_{r}，$其中 $ r_{z}$  和 $ r_{y} $ 都是有理数，故得$y=x+r_{x}-r_{y}$ 。现在， 假定 $ t \in K(y)$ ， 则由$t=y+r=x+\left(r_{x}-r_{y}+r\right)=x+r^{\prime}，$得  $t \in K(x)$ ， 从而$  K(y) \subset K(x) $。 同理可得 $ K(x) \subset K(y) $， 因此 $ K(x)   =\boldsymbol{K}(y)$。 此与假定相冲突。将  [-1 / 2，1 / 2]  给以以上述的分类以后， 在每一类中任意选定一点作为代表元素， 这种点的全体记它做  A。 设  [-1，1]  中的有理点的全体是$r_{0}=0， r_{1}， r_{2}， r_{3}， \cdots $。设  A  经平移$\varphi_{k}(x)=x+r_{k}$而得集$ A_{k}$ ， 若  $x \in A$ ， 则 $ \varphi_{k}(x) \in A_{k} $; 又若 $ x \in A_{k}$ ， 则 $ x-r_{k} \in A$ 。 特别是 $ A_{0}=A$。 设 $ \left\{A_{n}\right\}$是上述定义的两两不相交的集序列， 则对每一$n， m^{*} A_{n}=   \beta>0 $， 且$A_{n} \subset[-3 / 2，3 / 2] \text {， }$因此，$\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}A_{n} \subset[-3 / 2，3 / 2]$，由此得到$m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right) \leqslant 3$。然而$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}=+\infty $， 所以$m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)<\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{n}$。

statement: The condition of non-negativity of the function sequence in Levi's theorem cannot be removed.
chinese_statement: Levi定理中函数序列非负性的条件不可取去掉。
rationale: Counterexample: Define the function on the interval $[-1, 1]$ as $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{1}{x}, & x \neq 0, \\0, & x=0,\end{array} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{1}{x}-\frac{1}{n}, & x \neq 0, \\0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.\right.$ then $f_{1}(x) \leqslant f_{2}(x) \leqslant \cdots \leqslant f_{n}(x) \leqslant \cdots$, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=f(x) $. However, $\begin{array}{l}\int_{[-1,1]}\left\{f_{n}\right\}^{+} d x=\int_{0}^{1}\left(\frac{1}{x}-\frac{1}{n}\right) d x=+\infty, \\\int_{[-1,1]}\left\{f_{n}\right\}^{-} d x=\int_{-1}^{0}\left(\frac{1}{n}-\frac{1}{x}\right) d x=+\infty,\end{array}$ thus $\int_{[-1, 1]} f_{n}(x) d x $ does not exist. Similarly, $\int_{[-1,1]} f(x) d x$ also does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 反例如下: 在区间$[-1，1]$上定义函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{1}{x}， & x \neq 0， \\0， & x=0，\end{array} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{1}{x}-\frac{1}{n}， & x \neq 0， \\0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.\right.$则有$f_{1}(x) \leqslant f_{2}(x) \leqslant \cdots \leqslant f_{n}(x) \leqslant \cdots$，$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=f(x) $。然而$\begin{array}{l}\int_{[-1，1]}\left\{f_{n}\right\}^{+} d x=\int_{0}^{1}\left(\frac{1}{x}-\frac{1}{n}\right) d x=+\infty， \\\int_{[-1，1]}\left\{f_{n}\right\}^{-} d x=\int_{-1}^{0}\left(\frac{1}{n}-\frac{1}{x}\right) d x=+\infty，\end{array}$故  $\int_{[-1， 1]} f_{n}(x) d x $ 不存在。 同样，$\int_{[-1，1]} f(x) d x$也不存在。

statement: There exists a divergent series, which can be rearranged to arbitrarily slow down its divergence.
chinese_statement: 存在一个发散级数，用重排可以任意减慢其发散程度。
rationale: Let $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} $ be a divergent series with positive terms where the general term tends to zero. Let $s_{n}+a_{1}+ a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}$, then $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{n}=+\infty$. Choose any sequence $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$, such that $b_{1}<b_{2}<\cdots<b_{n}<\cdots, \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n}=+\infty $. We only need to prove that there exists a rearranged series $a_{v_{1}}+a_{v_{2}}+\cdots+a_{v_{n}}+\cdots,$ so that for all $ n=1,2,3, \cdots $, $a_{v_{1}}+a_{v_{2}}+\cdots+a_{v_{n}} \leqslant b_{n}$. For this, assume $r_{1}, r_{2}, r_{3}, \cdots; s_{1}, s_{2}, s_{3}, \cdots $ are two increasing sequences of positive integers with no common terms, and every positive integer must appear in one of these sequences. Thus, for $m, n=1,2,3, \cdots$, $r_{m}<r_{m+1}, s_{n}<s_{n+1}, r_{m}>s_{n}$ or $r_{m}<s_{n}$. The series $a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\dot{a}_{r_{3}}+\cdots $ and $ a_{s_{1}}+a_{s_{2}}+a_{s_{3}}+\cdots$ ("red" and "blue") are called complementary subseries of the series $ a_{1}+a_{2}+a_{3}+\cdots$. Define the "red" subseries $a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+a_{r_{3}}+\cdots$ such that $a_{r_{n}}<\min \left\{2^{-n}, b_{n}-b_{n-1}\right\}, n=1,2, \cdots, b_{0}=0, \\$ then $\quad a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\cdots+a_{r_{n}}<b_{n}$, and the entire "red" subseries converges. It's also easy to see that $b_{n}-(a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\cdots+a_{r_{n}})$ increases without bound. Thus, within the allowable range of the relationship $\sum_{i=1}^{n} a_{r_{i}}<b_{n}$, the items of the complementary subseries can be incorporated one by one. This completes the required rearrangement.
chinese_rationale: 设$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} $是一个通项趋于零的正项发散级数，令$s_{n}+a_{1}+ a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}$，则 $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{n}=+\infty$ 。 任意取序列 $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$， 适合$b_{1}<b_{2}<\cdots<b_{n}<\cdots， \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n}=+\infty $。我们只要证明， 存在重排级数$a_{v_{1}}+a_{v_{2}}+\cdots+a_{v_{n}}+\cdots，$使对一切 $ n=1，2，3， \cdots $， 都有$a_{v_{1}}+a_{v_{2}}+\cdots+a_{v_{n}} \leqslant b_{n}$。为此， 设$ r_{1}， r_{2}， r_{3}， \cdots ; s_{1}， s_{2}， s_{3}， \cdots  $是两列无公共项的递增的正整数序列， 又设每个正整数总要出现在这两个序列中的一个或另一个之中，于是， 对  $m， n=1，2，3， \cdots ， $有$r_{m}<r_{m+1}， s_{n}<s_{n+1}， r_{m}>s_{n}$ 或$r_{m}<s_{n}$ 。称两个级数$a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\dot{a}_{r_{3}}+\cdots $ 和$ a_{s_{1}}+a_{s_{2}}+a_{s_{3}}+\cdots$(“红”的和“蓝”的) 为级数$ a_{1}+a_{2}+a_{3}+\cdots$  的互补的子级数， 现如次确定“红”的子级数$a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+a_{r_{3}}+\cdots，$使$a_{r_{n}}<\min \left\{2^{-n}， b_{n}-b_{n-1}\right\}， n=1，2， \cdots， b_{0}=0， \\$则$\quad a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\cdots+a_{r_{n}}<b_{n}，$且整个“红”的子级数收敛，还容易看出，$b_{n}-(a_{r_{1}}+a_{r_{2}}+\cdots+a_{r_{n}})$无限制地增加。因而，在关系式$\sum_{i=1}^{n} a_{r_{i}}<b_{n}$的容许范围内可以逐个收容互补子级数的项。这样就完成了所需的重排。

statement: When the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges and $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} / a_{n}= 1$, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$ also converges.
chinese_statement: 级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$收敛且$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} / a_{n}=  1$时， 级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$也收敛。
rationale: Let $a_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}, b_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}+1 / n$, it is easy to see that the series $\sum_{n=1}^{n} a_{n}$ converges, and $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{\frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}+\frac{1}{n}}{\frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}}+\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}=1$. However, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}+\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$ is the sum of a convergent series and a divergent series, hence it is a divergent series. Note: It is easy to prove that if $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ is a convergent series of positive terms, then when $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} / a_{n} = 1$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$ also converges. The above counterexample illustrates that the condition of $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ being a positive term series cannot be omitted in this proposition.
chinese_rationale: 取$a_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}， b_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}+1 / n ，$ 易知级数$\sum_{n=1}^{n} a_{n}$ 收敛，且$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{\frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}+\frac{1}{n}}{\frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}}+\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{(-1)^{n}}{\sqrt{n}}=1$。但是， 级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}+\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$是一个收敛级数与一个发散级数之和， 因而它是一个发散级数。注：容易证明， 如果$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 是收敛的正项级数， 则当$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} / a_{n}   =  1$时， $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$也收敛。 上述反例说明了在这个命题中， $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$为正项级数的条件是去不得的。

statement: There exist a set S and open sets $G_{k}$, k=1, 2, \cdots such that $G_{k}$ is dense in S, but $\bigcap_{k=1}^{\infty} G_{k}$ is not dense in $\boldsymbol{S}$.
chinese_statement: 存在  集  S 和开集  $G_{k}， k=1，2， \cdots $ 使 $G_{k}$  在  S 中稠密， 而  $\bigcap_{k=1}^{\infty} G_{k} $在 $\boldsymbol{S} $ 中不稠密。
rationale: Let S be the set of all rational numbers $r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{k}, \cdots$ on the real line, and $G_{k}$ be the complement of the single-element set $\left\{r_{k}\right\}$: $G_{k}=(-\infty, +\infty) \backslash \left\{r_{k}\right\}$. Thus, each $G_{k}$ is an open set and dense in G, but the intersection of all these sets $\bigcap_{k=1}^{\infty} G_{k}$ has no common point with S and therefore cannot be dense in S. Note: It can be proven that the intersection of a finite number of open sets dense in S is also dense in S. The above counterexample shows that this proposition cannot be extended to the case of infinite open sets.
chinese_rationale: 设  S  是数直线上的全体有理数  $r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{k}， \cdots$  所成之集，  $G_{k}$ 为单元素集  $\left\{r_{k}\right\}$  的余集:  $G_{k}=(-\infty，+\infty) \backslash\left\{r_{k}\right\}$ 。 于是， 各个  $G_{k}$  皆为开集， 且都在  G  中稠密，而所有诸集  $G_{k}$  之交  $\bigcap_{k=1}^{\infty} G_{k}$  与  S  并无公共点， 因而不能在  S  中稠密。注: 可以证明，若有限个开集皆在  S  中稠密，则其交集在  S  中也稠密。 上述反例说明了不能把这一命题推广到无穷多个开集的情形。

statement: There exists a positive continuous function f on $[1, +\infty)$ such that $ \int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) dx $ converges but $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)$ diverges.
chinese_statement: 存在 $[1，+\infty)$上的正值连续函数f ， 使$ \int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) d x $收敛而$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)$发散。
rationale: For each integer $n > 1$, let $g(n) = 1$; at the non-integer endpoints of the closed intervals $\left[n-n^{-2}, n\right]$ and $[n, n+\left.n^{-2}\right]$, g takes 0; while on the interior of the closed intervals $\left[n-n^{-2}, n\right]$ and $\left[n, n+n^{-2}\right]$, g is defined to be linear; finally, at points $x \geqslant 1$ where $g(x)$ is not yet defined, it is stipulated that $g(x)$ takes the value 0. Consequently, the function $f(x)=g(x)+\frac{1}{x^{2}}$ is a positive continuous function on $[1, +\infty)$, and the generalized (R) integral $\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) dx$ converges. However, $\lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} f(n) = 0$ does not hold, and so the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)$ diverges.
chinese_rationale: 在各整数 $n>1$ ， 令  $g(n)=1$  ；在闭区间  $\left[n-n^{-2}， n\right]$  和  $[n， n+   \left.n^{-2}\right] $ 的非整数端点，  g  取 0 ; 而在闭区间 $ \left[n-n^{-2}， n\right] $ 和  $\left[n， n+n^{-2}\right]$  的内部， 定义  g  是线性的; 最后， 在 $ x \geqslant 1 $ 而 $g(x)$尚末定义的点， 规定 $g(x) $的值为 0 ， 于是， 函数$f(x)=g(x)+\frac{1}{x^{2}}$是 $[1，+\infty)$  上的正值连续函数， 且广义(R)  积分  $\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) d x $ 收敛。然而， $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f(n)=0$并不成立， 因此， 级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n) $发散。

statement: There exists a function of bounded variation that does not satisfy any order Hölder condition.
chinese_statement: 存在不满足任何阶 Hölder 条件的有界变差函数。
rationale: Consider the function $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}-1 / \ln x, & 0<x \leqslant 1 / 2, \\0, & x=0\end{array}\right.$. It is evident that f is a strictly increasing continuous function on [0, 1/2], and thus it is a function of bounded variation on [0, 1/2]. However, for any $\alpha>0$, f does not satisfy the $\alpha$ order Hölder condition. To prove this conclusion, we first assume $0<\alpha \leqslant 1$, and take $x^{\prime}=0$. Since $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} \frac{\mid f(x)-f(0)!}{|x-0|^{\alpha}}=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} \frac{-\frac{1}{\ln x}}{x^{a}}=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} \alpha x^{-}=+\infty$, there exists, for any positive number M, $x^{\prime \prime} \in(0, 1/2]$, such that $\frac{\left|f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)-f(0)\right|}{\left|x^{\prime \prime}-0\right|^{\alpha}}>M$, i.e., $\left|f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right) -f(0)\right|>M\left|x^{\prime \prime}-0\right|^{\alpha}$. That is to say, f does not satisfy the $\alpha$ order Hölder condition on [0, 1/2]. Next, assume $\alpha> 1$. If f satisfies the $\alpha$ order Hölder condition, it can be easily proven that f should be a constant function, which is contradictory. Therefore, f cannot satisfy the $\alpha$ order Hölder condition. Note: Functions satisfying the Lipschitz condition must be functions of bounded variation. The above counterexample illustrates that the inverse of this proposition is not true.
chinese_rationale: 作函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}-1 / \ln x， & 0<x \leqslant 1 / 2， \\0， & x=0\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  是  [0，1 / 2]  上严格递增的连续函数，因而它是  [0，1 / 2]  上的有界变差函数。但是， 对于任意的  $\alpha>0， f$  不满足  $\alpha$  阶 Hölder 条件。为证明这个结论， 我们先设 $ 0<\alpha \leqslant 1 $， 并取  $x^{\prime}=0$。 由于$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} \frac{\mid f(x)-f(0)!}{|x-0|^{\alpha}}=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} \frac{-\frac{1}{\ln x}}{x^{a}}=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} \alpha x^{-}=+\infty$，因而对任意正数  M ， 存在  $x^{\prime \prime} \in(0，1 / 2]$ ， 使得$\frac{\left|f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)-f(0)\right|}{\left|x^{\prime \prime}-0\right|^{\alpha}}>M$，即  $\left|f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right) -f(0)\right|>M\left|x^{\prime \prime}-0\right|^{\alpha}$ 。 也就是说，  f  在  [0，1 / 2]  上不满足  $\alpha$  阶 Hölder 条件。再设 $\alpha> 1$，若  f  满足  $\alpha $ 阶 Hölder 条件， 则易证  f  应为常值函数，这是矛盾的， 故  f  不可能满足  $\alpha $ 阶 Hölder 条件。注 满足 Lipschitz 条件的函数必是有界变差函数。 上述反例说明了这个命题之逆并不成立。

statement: There exists an open function that is discontinuous everywhere and does not have the intermediate value property on any interval.
chinese_statement: 存在一个无处连续的开函数， 它在任何区间上都不具有介值性质。
rationale: A function from $R^{1}$ to $R^{1}$ is called an open function if it maps open sets to open sets. Let $F(x)$ be a real-valued function on $(-\infty, \infty)$ that takes on every real value on each non-empty interval. Such a function exists. Define $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}F(x), F(x) \neq 0, \\1, \quad F(x)=0,\end{array}\right.$ Then $f$ cannot take the value zero, yet it takes on any non-zero real value on each non-empty interval. Hence, $f$ is an open function that is discontinuous everywhere because for every non-empty open set $G$, we have $f(G)=(-\infty, \infty) \backslash \{0\}$. Since $f$ can take any non-zero value on any non-empty interval, $f$ does not have the intermediate value property on any non-empty interval. This problem was proposed by Marcus and solved by Exdös. Note: Croft pointed out that on the closed interval $[0, 1]$, there exists a first category Baire function that is not identically zero and is almost everywhere zero, which does have the intermediate value property.
chinese_rationale: 由  $R^{1}$  上到  $R^{1}$  的函数称为开函数， 细果它把开集映成开集。设  $F(x)$  是  $(-\infty， \infty)$ 上的实值函数， 它在每个非空区间上取到每个实数值。 这种函数是存在的。 令$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}F(x)， F(x) \neq 0， \\1， \quad F(x)=0，\end{array}\right.$则  f  不能取零值， 它在每个非空区间上取到异于零的任何实数值。由此可见，  f  是无处连续的开函数， 因为对每个非空开集  G ， 我们有  $f(G)=(-\infty， \infty) \backslash\{0\}$  。 由于  f  在每个非空区间上能取到异于零的任何值， 因而  f  在任何非空区间上都不具有介值性质。这个问题是由 Marcus 提出并由 Exdös 作出的。注： Croft 指出， 在闭区间  [0，1]  上存在一个非恒等于零而又几乎处处为零的第一类 Baire 函数， 它具有介值性质。

statement: There exists a function f on [0, 1] such that both the set A of its continuity points and the set B of its discontinuity points are dense in [0, 1], and for any open interval $(\alpha, \beta) \subset [0, 1]$, the intersections $A \cap (\alpha, \beta)$ and $B \cap (\alpha, \beta)$ both have the cardinality of the continuum.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1] 上的一个函数 f， 它的连续点所成之集 A  与间断点所 成之集  B  在  [0，1]  内都稠密，且对任何开区间  $(\alpha， \beta) \subset[0，1]$，交集$ A \cap(\alpha， \beta)$  与 $ B \cap(\alpha， \beta)$ 都具有连续统的势。
rationale: We divide the interval [0, 1] into two disjoint sets: one is a dense $F_{\sigma}$ set A in [0, 1], and the other is also a dense $G_{\delta}$ set B in [0, 1]. Moreover, for any non-empty open interval $(\alpha, \beta) \subset [0, 1]$, the intersections $A \cap (\alpha, \beta)$ and $B \cap (\alpha, \beta)$ both have the cardinality of the continuum. Let $A = \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}$, where $\left\{F_{n}\right\}$ is an increasing sequence of closed sets, and define a function $f_{n}$ on the interval [0, 1] as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cl}1 / 10^{n}, & x \text{ is a rational point in } F_{m}, \\2 / 10^{n}, & x \text{ is an irrational point in } F_{n}, \\0, & x \text{ is a point in } [0, 1] \backslash F_{n}. \end{array}\right.$ Let $f(x) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$, then f is continuous on B and nowhere continuous on A.
chinese_rationale: 我们把区间  [0，1]  分为两个不相交的集: 一个是在  [0，1]  内稠密的 $F_{\sigma}$型集  A ， 另一个也是在  [0，1]  内稠密的  $G_{\delta}$  型集  B ， 而且对任意非空开区间  $(\alpha， \beta) \subset[0，1] $， 交集 $ A \cap(\alpha， \beta)$  与 $ B \cap(\alpha， \beta)$ 都具有连续统的势。设  $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}$ ， 其中  $\left\{F_{n}\right\}$  是渐张的闭集序列， 并在区间  [0，1] 上定义函数  $f_{n}$  如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cl}1 / 10^{n}， & x \text { 为 } F_{m} \text { 中的有理点， } \\2 / 10^{n}， & x \text { 为 } F_{n} \text { 中的无理点， } \\0， & x \text { 为 }[0，1] \backslash F_{n} \text { 中的点。 }\end{array}\right.$令$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$， 可得  f  在  B  上连续而在  A  上无处连续。

statement: There exists a function whose Maclaurin series converges everywhere but coincides with the function at only one point.
chinese_statement: 存在一个函数， 它的Maclaurin 级数处处收敛， 但仅在一点与这个函数相合。
rationale:
First example: The function $f(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}e^{-1 / x^{2}}, & x 
eq 0, \0, & x=0 .\end{array}ight.$ is infinitely differentiable, and all its derivatives at $x=0$ are zero. Thus, its Maclaurin series $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}  rac{f^{(n)}(0)}{n!}=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} 0$ converges on the real axis to a function that is identically zero. Therefore, it coincides with $f(x)$ only at the unique point $x=0$. This example was given by Scheeffer.
Second example: Let $f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}  rac{(-1)^{n}}{n!} \cdot  rac{1}{1+a^{2 n} x^{2}} \quad(a>1),$ because all series obtained by successive term-by-term differentiation have a factor of $1 / n!$, these series all converge uniformly, indicating that the function $f$ is infinitely differentiable. It is easy to compute that $f^{(k)}(0)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}0, & k=2m-1, \(2 m)!(-1)^{m} e^{-a^{2 m}}, & k=2 m ;\end{array}ight.$ Therefore, $f$'s Maclaurin series is $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{n}\left( rac{1}{e}ight)^{a^{2 n}} x^{2 n}$ and for each $x$, this series converges to the function $\varphi(x) : \varphi(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{n}\left( rac{1}{e}ight)^{a^{2 n}} x^{2 n}$. It is evident that when $x=0$, $\varphi(0)=f(0)=1 / e$, whereas for $x 
eq 0$, $\varphi(x) 
eq f(x)$. This example was given by Pringsheim. Note: The aforementioned counterexamples demonstrate that the existence of all orders of finite derivatives of a function $f$ at a point $a$ does not imply that for any $x 
eq a$, $f(x)=\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}  rac{f^{(k)}(a)}{k!}(x-a)^{k}$. For this reason, when studying the Taylor series of a function, we must consider the remainder of the series.
chinese_rationale:
第一例： 函数$f(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}e^{-1 / x^{2}}， & x 
eq 0， \0， & x=0 。\end{array}ight.$是无穷可微的， 并且它的所有各阶导数在 $ x=0 $ 处都等于零， 所以它的 Maclaurin 级数$\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}  rac{f^{(n)}(0)}{n!}=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} 0$在实轴上收敛于恒等于零的函数。 因此， 它只能在唯一的点  $x=0$ 处与  f(x)  相合。这个例子是由 Scheeffer 作出的。
第二例： 设$f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}  rac{(-1)^{n}}{n!} \cdot  rac{1}{1+a^{2 n} x^{2}} \quad(a>1)，$因为接连逐项微分得到的所有级数中都出现因子 $1 / n !$ ， 所以这些级数全部一致收敛，这就说明了函数  f  是无穷可微的。容易算出，$f^{(k)}(0)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}0， & k=2m-1， \(2 m)!(-1)^{m} e^{-a^{2 m}}， & k=2 m ;\end{array}ight.$因此，  f 的 Maclaurin级数是$\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{n}\left( rac{1}{e}ight)^{a^{2 n}} x^{2 n}$对每一x ， 这个级数都收敛于函数 $\varphi(x) ：\varphi(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{n}\left( rac{1}{e}ight)^{a^{2 n}} x^{2 n}$ 。易见， 当  $x=0$  时 $ \varphi(0)=f(0)=1 / e $， 而当 $ x 
eq 0 $ 时 $ \varphi(x) 
eq f(x) $。这个例子是由 Pringsheim 作出的。注: 上述反例说明了从函数  f  在点  a  的各阶有穷导数的存在性不能推出对任意的$x 
eq a$ ， 有$f(x)=\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}  rac{f^{(k)}(a)}{k!}(x-a)^{k}$ 。正因为如此， 所以我们在研究某个函数的 Taylor 级数时， 就必须讨论这个级数的余项。

statement: There exists a uniformly convergent function series with bounded variation that is not differentiable term-by-term almost everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在一个一致收敛的有界变差的函数项级数，而不能几乎处处逐项微分。
rationale: Define the sequence of functions on $[0,1]$ as follows:$\begin{array}{l}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-[x], & {[x] \leqslant x<[x]+\frac{1}{3}}, \\0, & x=[x]+\frac{1}{2}, \\x-[x]-1, & {[x]+\frac{1}{2}<x<[x]+1}, \\0, & x=1,\end{array}\right. \\(2 x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2 x-[2 x], & {[2 x] \leqslant 2 x<[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}}, \\0, & 2 x=[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}, \\2 x-[2 x]-1, & {[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}<2 x<[2 x]+1}, \\0, & x=1,\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ generally, $(n x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}n x-[n x], & {[n x] \leqslant n x<[n x]+\frac{1}{2}}, \\0, & n x=[n x]+\frac{1}{2}, \\n x-[n x]-1, & {[n x]+\frac{1}{2}<n x<[n x]+1}, \\0, & x=1,\end{array}\right. n=1,2, \cdots,[x]$ represents the bracket function. The function $(x)$ on [0,1] has a discontinuity point only at $x=\frac{1}{2};(2 x)$ on $[0, 1]$ has discontinuity points only at $ \frac{1}{4}, \frac{3}{4}$; generally, $(n x)$ on $[0,1]$ has discontinuity points only at $x=\frac{m}{2 n}$, where $m=1,3,5, \cdots, 2 n-1$. It is clear that for each $n,(n x)$ is a function of bounded variation on [0,1], and $ |(x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2},|(2 x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}$, generally, $|(n x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}$. Therefore, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{(n x)}{n^{2}}$ converges uniformly to a certain function $ f(x)$ on [0,1]. $\frac{f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}} \cdot \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{n}}$ given $ 1 / 2(m - 1)<\left|x-x_{0}\right|=\delta<1 / 2 m$(m naturally greater than N), when $ 1 \leqslant n \leqslant m $, $n\left|x-x_{0}\right|<n / 2 m \leqslant 1 / 2 $, so $\sum_{n=1}^{m} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}=\sum_{n=1}^{n+} \frac{1}{n}$. And $\left|\sum_{n =m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(nx_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| \leqslant \frac{1}{\delta} \sum_{n=m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<2(m+1) \frac{1}{m}<4$, therefore, $\begin{aligned}\left|\frac{f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| & =\left|\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}+\sum_{n=m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| \\& >\sum_{n=1}^{m} \frac{1}{n}-4 .\end{aligned}$ This shows that the finite $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)$ does not exist. Since $x_{0}$ is any point in $\left[0, \frac{1}{2 N}\right)$, f is not differentiable anywhere in $\left[0, \frac{1}{2 N}\right)$, so it cannot be differentiable term-by-term almost everywhere on [0,1].
chinese_rationale: 在  $[0，1]$  上定义函数序列如下:$\begin{array}{l}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-[x]， & {[x] \leqslant x<[x]+\frac{1}{3}，} \\0， & x=[x]+\frac{1}{2}， \\x-[x]-1， & {[x]+\frac{1}{2}<x<[x]+1，} \\0， & x=1，\end{array}\right. \\(2 x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}2 x-[2 x]， & {[2 x] \leqslant 2 x<[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}，} \\0， & 2 x=[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}， \\2 x-[2 x]-1， & {[2 x]+\frac{1}{2}<2 x<[2 x]+1，} \\0， & x=1，\end{array}\right.\end{array}$一般，$(n x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}n x-[n x]， & {[n x] \leqslant n x<[n x]+\frac{1}{2}，} \\0， & n x=[n x]+\frac{1}{2}， \\n x-[n x]-1， & {[n x]+\frac{1}{2}<n x<[n x]+1，} \\0， & x=1，\end{array}\right. n=1，2， \cdots，[x]$  代表括号函数。函数  $(x)$  在[0，1]  上只有不连续点  $x=\frac{1}{2} ;(2 x)$  在  $[0， 1] $ 上只有不连续点 $ \frac{1}{4}， \frac{3}{4} $; 一  般地，  $(n x)$  在  [0，1]  上只有不连 续点  $x=\frac{m}{2 n}$ ，这里 $ m=1，3，5， \cdots， 2 n-1 $， 易见， 对每一  $n，(n x)$  都是  [0，1]  上的有界变差函数，而且 $ |(x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}，|(2 x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}$， 一  般，  $|(n x)| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}$ 。因此， 级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{(n x)}{n^{2}}$在  [0，1]  上一致收敛出某个函数 $ f(x)$  。$\frac{f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}} \cdot \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{n}}$设 $ 1 / 2(m - 1)<\left|x-x_{0}\right|=\delta<1 / 2 m$(m  自然大于  N)  ，当 $ 1 \leqslant n \leqslant m $时，  $n\left|x-x_{0}\right|<n / 2 m \leqslant 1 / 2 $， 所以$\sum_{n=1}^{m} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}=\sum_{n=1}^{n+} \frac{1}{n} \text {。}$又$\left|\sum_{n =m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(nx_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| \leqslant \frac{1}{\delta} \sum_{n=m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<2(m+1) \frac{1}{m}<4$，因此，$\begin{aligned}\left|\frac{f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| & =\left|\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}+\sum_{n=m+1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}} \frac{(n x)-\left(n x_{0}\right)}{x-x_{0}}\right| \\& >\sum_{n=1}^{m} \frac{1}{n}-4 。\end{aligned}$这说明有穷的$f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)$ 不存在。由于  $x_{0} $ 是 $ \left[0， \frac{1}{2 N}\right)$  里的任意一点，因此  f  在 $ \left[0， \frac{1}{2 N}\right)$  内无处可微， 从而不能在  [0，1]  上几乎处处逐项求微分。

statement: We use  $H^{a}[a, b]$  to represent the set of real-valued functions defined on  [a, b] that satisfy the $\alpha$-order Hölder condition. There exists a function f, such that $f\bar\in H^{\beta}[a, b], 0<\alpha<\beta$.
chinese_statement: 我们用  $H^{a}[a， b]$  代表定义在  [a， b] 上的满足$\alpha$ 阶 Hölder 条件的实值函数的全体。存在函数f，使$f\bar\in H^{\beta}[a， b]，0<\alpha<\beta$。
rationale: Let $ f(x)=x$ , then $f \in H^{\alpha}[a, b](0<\alpha \leqslant 1)$ , but  $f \bar\in H^{\beta}[a, b](\beta>1)$. In fact, suppose $ f \in H^{\prime}[a, b]$, that is, there exists a constant M, such that for any $ x, y \in[a, b]$, there is $|f(x)-f(y)| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\beta}$, then  $\quad|f(x)-f(y)|+|x-y| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\beta-1}$, thus $ f^{\prime}(x)=0(a \leqslant x \leqslant b)$. Hence,  f  is a constant function, which contradicts the definition of f. Note: It is easy to prove that if [a, b] is a finite interval, and $ \beta>\alpha>0$, then $H^{\beta}[a ,  b] \subset H^{\alpha}[a, b]$, the above counterexample demonstrates that this inclusion relationship is strict.
chinese_rationale: 令$ f(x)=x$ ， 则 $f \in H^{\alpha}[a， b](0<\alpha \leqslant 1)$ ， 但  $f \bar\in H^{\beta}[a， b](\beta>1)$ 。事实上，假若$ f \in H^{\prime}[a， b]$ ， 即存在常数  M ， 使对任何 $ x， y \in[a， b]$ ， 都有$|f(x)-f(y)| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\beta}$，则  $\quad|f(x)-f(y)|+|x-y| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\beta-1} $，从而 $ f^{\prime}(x)=0(a \leqslant x \leqslant b)$ 。 因此，  f  为常值函数， 这写  f  的定义相矛盾。注： 容易证明， 若  [a， b]  为一有限区间，且$  \beta>\alpha>0$ ， 则  $H^{\beta}[a ，  b] \subset H^{\alpha}[a， b]$  ，上述反例说明了这个包含关系是严格的。

statement: A function f defined on an interval I is called regular if for every point $x \in I$, f has a left limit and a right limit at x, i.e., $ \lim _{\substack{\boldsymbol{x} \in I_{-} \\ \boldsymbol{y}\rightarrow x_{-}}} f(y)$ and $\lim _{\substack{x \in I \\ y \rightarrow x_+}} f(y)$ both exist. The composite function of two regular functions is also regular.
chinese_statement: 定义在区间I上的函数  f  叫做正则的， 如果对每一点  $x \in I$， f 在  x  处有左极限和右极限， 即 $ \lim _{\substack{\boldsymbol{x} \in I_{-} \\ \boldsymbol{y}\rightarrow x_{-}}} f(y)$  和  $\lim _{\substack{x \in I \\ y \rightarrow x_+}} f(y)$  均存在。 两个正则函数，其复合函数一定也正则。
rationale: Obviously, step functions are regular. The function $f(x)=x \sin (1 / x)(f(0)=0)$ is continuous, hence it is regular on the interval $I=[0,1]$. Also, the function $g(y)=\operatorname{sgny}$ is regular on $(-\infty, \infty)$. However, the composite function $g \circ f$ is not regular on I.
chinese_rationale: 显然，阶梯函数是正则的。函数  $f(x)=x \sin (1 / x)(f(0)=0)$  是连续的， 故它在区间  $I=[0，1]$  上是正则的。 又函数  $g(y)=\operatorname{sgny}$  在  $(-\infty， \infty)$  上也是正则的。 然而复合函数  $g \circ f$  在  I  上并不正则。

statement: There exists a sequence of pairwise disjoint complete sparse sets within [0, 1], whose union has a measure of 1.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]内一个两两不相交的完备疏集序列，其并集的测度为1。
rationale: For example: First, construct a complete sparse set $E_{1}$ within [0, 1] with a measure of 1/2. Let the adjacent intervals of $E_{1}$ be $\left(\alpha_{1 i}, \beta_{1 i}\right), i=1, 2, \cdots,$ then construct a complete sparse set $E_{1 i}$ within each $\left(\alpha_{1 i}, \beta_{1i}\right)$ with a measure of $\left(\beta_{1 i}-\alpha_{1 i}\right) / 2$, so $m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{2}}$. It is obvious that $E_{2}=E_{1} \cup\left(\bigcup_{-1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right)$ is also a complete sparse set, and $m E_{2}=m E_{1}+m\left(\bigcup_{-1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right)=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{4}=\frac{3}{4}$. Again, construct a complete sparse set $E_{2 i}$ with measure $(\Phi_{2 i}-\alpha_{2 i}) / 2$ in each adjacent interval $\left(\alpha_{2 i}, \beta_{2i}\right)$ of $E_{2}$, then $m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3} \cdot}$. Therefore, the set $E_{3}=E_{2} \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2i}\right)$ is also complete sparse, and $m E_{3}=m E_{2}+m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2i}\right)=\frac{3}{4}+\frac{1}{8}=\frac{7}{8}$. Continuing this process indefinitely, we obtain the following countable collection of pairwise disjoint complete sets: $\begin{array}{l}E_{1}, E_{11}, E_{12}, \cdots, E_{1i}, \cdots, \\E_{21}, E_{22}, E_{23}, \cdots, E_{2i}, \cdots, \\\cdots\cdots, \\E_{k1}, E_{k2}, E_{k3}, \cdots, E_{2i}, \cdots, \\\cdots, \ldots, \ldots\cdots,\end{array}$ simultaneously, $\begin{array}{l}m E_{1}=\frac{1}{2}, \quad m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1 i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3}}, \quad m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3}} \\\cdots, m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{ki}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{k+1}}, \cdots\end{array}$. Since the above sets are pairwise disjoint, their union's measure equals the sum of their measures. Therefore, $\begin{array}{l}m\left(E_{1} \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right) \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2i}\right) \cup \cdots \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{ki}\right) \cup \cdots\right) \\=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{2^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{2^{k+1}}-\cdots=1 .\end{array}$ Thus, the above constructed sequence of complete sparse sets $E_{1}, E_{ki} (k=1, 2, \cdots; i=1, 2, \cdots)$ meets the required condition.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 先在  [0，1]  内作一测度为  1 / 2  的完备䟽集$E_{1}$ 。 设 $ E_{1}$  的 各个邻接区间为  $\left(\alpha_{1 i}， \beta_{1 i}\right)， i=1，2， \cdots ，$ 再在每个 $ \left(\alpha_{1 i}， \beta_{1i}\right) $ 中作一测度为 $ \left(\beta_{1 i}-\alpha_{1 i}\right) / 2$  的完备䟽集  $E_{1 i}$ ， 则$m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{2}}$易见， $ E_{2}=E_{2} \cup\left(\bigcup_{-1}^{\infty} E_{14}\right)$  也是完备疏集， 且$m E_{2}=m E_{1}+m\left(\bigcup_{-1}^{\infty} E_{1i}\right)=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{4}=\frac{3}{4}$再次，在$E_{2}$ 的每个邻接区间 $ \left(\alpha_{2 i}， \beta_{2i}\right) $ 内作一测度为$(\Phi_{2 i}-\alpha_{2 i}) /2 $的完备疏集 $ E_{2 i} $ ，那么$m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2 i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3} \cdot}$于是， 集 $ E_{3}=E_{2} \cup\left(\bigcup_{=1}^{\infty} E_{2 i}\right)  $也是完备疏集， 且$m E_{3}=m E_{2}+m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2 i}\right)=\frac{3}{4}+\frac{1}{8}=\frac{7}{8}$。继续这个过程以至无穷，我们就得到下面可数个两两不相交的完备就集:$\begin{array}{l}B_{1}， E_{11}， E_{12}， \cdots， E_{1 i}， \cdots， \\E_{21}， E_{22}， E_{23}， \cdots， E_{2 i}， \cdots， \\\cdots \cdots， \\E_{k 1}， B_{k 2}， E_{k 3}， \cdots， B_{2 i}， \cdots， \\\cdots， \ldots， \ldots \cdots，\end{array}$同时，$\begin{array}{l}m E_{1}=\frac{1}{2}， \quad m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1 i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3}}， \quad m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2 i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{3}} \\\cdots， m\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{k i}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{k+1}}， \cdots\end{array}$因为上述诸集两两不相交，所以这些集的并集的测度等于它们的测度之和。 因此，$\begin{array}{l}m\left(E_{1} \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{1 i}\right) \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{2 i}\right) \cup \cdots \cup\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} E_{k i}\right) \cup \cdots\right) \\=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{2^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{2^{k+1}}-\cdots=1 .\end{array}$这样一来， 上面作出的完备疏集序列$ E_{1}， E_{k i}(k=1，2， \cdots ; i=1 ，  2， \cdots)$  满足所需的条件。

statement: There exists a function which is ($\boldsymbol{L}$) integrable on each subset but not ($\boldsymbol{L}$) integrable on their union.
chinese_statement: 存在在每个子集上都  ($\boldsymbol{L}$)  可积，但在并集上并不  ($\boldsymbol{L}$)  可积的函数。
rationale: It is easy to prove that if f is a measurable function on $E_{n}(n=1, 2, \cdots)$, then f is also a measurable function on $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}$. However, for the (L) integral, the corresponding proposition does not hold. For example, let $\boldsymbol{E}_{n}=(1 /(2 n+1), 1 /(2 n-1)], n=1,2, \cdots$, then each $E_{n}$ is mutually disjoint, and $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}=(0,1]$. Also, let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n, 2 n /\left(4 n^{2}-1\right)<x \leqslant 1 /(2 n-1), \\-n, 1(2 n+1)<x \leqslant 2 n /\left(4 n^{2}-1\right), n=1,2 \cdots.\end{array}\right.$ then f is a bounded measurable function on each $E_{n}$, thus (L) integrable, with its integral as $\begin{aligned}\int_{E_{n}} f(x) d x & =\int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}}(-n) d x+\int_{\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}} n d x \\& =-n\left(\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}-\frac{1}{2 n+1}\right)+n\left(\frac{1}{2 n-1}-\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}\right)=0.\end{aligned}$ However, $\begin{array}{l} \int_{0}^{1}|f(x)| d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}}|f(x)| d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}} n d x \\=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{-n}{4 n^{2}-1} \geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{n}{4 n^{2}} =\frac{1}{4} \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}, \\\end{array}$ hence $|f|$ is not (L) integrable on $(0,1]$, and therefore f is also not (L) integrable on $(0,1]$.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明， 若  f  是  $E_{n}(n=1，2， \cdots) $ 上的可测函数， 则  f  也是 $ \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}$  上的可测函数。 然而， 对于  (L)  积分而声， 相应的命题并不成立。例如， 令$\boldsymbol{E}_{n}=(1 /(2 n+1)， 1 /(2 n-1)]， n=1，2， \cdots$，则各个$E_{n}$两两不相交， 且 $ \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}=(0，1]$。又令$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n， 2 n /\left(4 n^{2}-1\right)<x \leqslant 1 /(2 n-1)， \\-n， 1(2 n+1)<x \leqslant 2 n /\left(4 n^{2}-1\right)， n=1，2 \cdots 。\end{array}\right.$则  f  在每个  $E_{n}$  上都是有界可测的函数， 从而  (L)  可积， 其积分值为$\begin{aligned}\int_{E_{n}} f(x) d x & =\int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}}(-n) d x+\int_{\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}} n d x \\& =-n\left(\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}-\frac{1}{2 n+1}\right)+n\left(\frac{1}{2 n-1}-\frac{2 n}{4 n^{2}-1}\right)=0 。\end{aligned}$但是，$\begin{array}{l} \int_{0}^{1}|f(x)| d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}}|f(x)| d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{\frac{1}{2 n+1}}^{\frac{1}{2 n-1}} n d x \\=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{-n}{4 n^{2}-1} \geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{n}{4 n^{2}} =\frac{1}{4} \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}， \\\end{array}$可见$ \mid f|$ 在 $ (0，1]$  上并不  (L)  可积， 从而  f  在 $ (0，1]$  上也不  (L)  可积。

statement: Given a positive sequence $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$ such that $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n}=0$, there exists a divergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ that satisfies $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n}=0$ and $\lim _{{n \rightarrow \infty}} a_{n} / b_{n}=0$.
chinese_statement: 给定使得$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n}=0$正数序列$\left\{b_{n}\right\}$，有一个正项发散级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 适合  $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n}=0 $ 且$\lim _{{n \rightarrow \infty}} a_{n} / b_{n}=0$。
rationale: Choose a subsequence of non-adjacent terms $\left\{b_{n_{k}}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$ from $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$ such that $\lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} b_{n_{k}}=0$. Then set $a_{n_{k}}=b_{n_{k}}^{2}, k=1,2, \cdots$ and for every other value of n: $n=m_{1}, m_{2}, \cdots ,  m_{j}, \cdots,$ set $a_{m_{j}}=1 / j$. Thus, as $n \rightarrow \infty$ $a_{n} \rightarrow 0$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ diverges, and as $k \rightarrow \infty$, $ a_{n_{k}} / b_{n_{k}}=b_{n_{k}} \rightarrow 0$, so $\lim _{\frac{n}{n \rightarrow \infty}} a_{n} / b_{n}=0$. Note: This example specifically demonstrates that no matter how quickly a positive sequence $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$ converges to zero, there is always a positive sequence $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ converging to zero sufficiently slowly to ensure the divergence of the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, and $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ has a subsequence that converges to zero faster than the corresponding subsequence of $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$.
chinese_rationale: 从  $\left\{b_{n}\right\}$  中选取不相邻项的子序列$\left\{b_{n_{k}}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$， 使得 $\lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} b_{n_{k}}=0$ ， 然后设$a_{n_{k}}=b_{n_{k}}^{2}， k=1，2， \cdots$  至于每个其它值的n：$n=m_{1}， m_{2}， \cdots ，  m_{j}， \cdots ，$ 设 $a_{m_{j}}=1 / j$ 。 于是， 当 $n \rightarrow \infty$时$a_{n} \rightarrow 0$， $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 发散， 又$ k \rightarrow   \infty $ 时$ a_{n_{k}} / b_{n_{k}}=b_{n_{k}} \rightarrow 0 $， 所以 $\lim _{\frac{n}{n \rightarrow \infty}} a_{n} / b_{n}=0 $。注: 这个例子特别证明了无论一个正数序列$\left\{b_{n}\right\}$怎样快地收敛于零， 总有一个足够慢能收敛于零的正数序列 $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ 以确保级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 的发散性， 而且 $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ 还有一个子序列比 $ \left\{b_{n}\right\} $ 的相应的子序列收敛于零更快。

statement: There exist two disjoint dense sets A and B within [0, 1] such that $[0, 1] = A \cup B$, and for any $\alpha, \beta (0 \leqslant \alpha < \beta \leqslant 1)$, the intersections $(\alpha, \beta) \cap A$ and $(\alpha, \beta) \cap B$ both have the cardinality of the continuum.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  中的两个不相交的稠密集  A  与  B ， 满足  $[0，1]=A \cup B$ ，且对任何  $\alpha， \beta(0 \leqslant \alpha<\beta \leqslant 1)$ ， 交集  $(\alpha， \beta) \cap A$  与 $(\alpha， \beta) \cap B$  都具有连续统的势。
rationale: We construct a sequence of perfect sets $A_{1}, A_{2}, \cdots, A_{n}, \cdots$ in [0, 1] as follows: $A_{1}$ is chosen as the Cantor ternary set within [0, 1]. To construct $A_{n}(n>1)$, we divide the closed interval [0, 1] into n equal-length closed intervals $\left[0, \frac{1}{n}\right], \left\lfloor\frac{1}{n}, \frac{2}{n}\right\rfloor, \cdots, \left[\frac{n-1}{n}, 1\right]$, and within each of these closed intervals, we construct a perfect nowhere dense set using a method similar to constructing the Cantor ternary set. The union of these n perfect nowhere dense sets is called $A_{n}$. Now let $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}, B=[0,1] \backslash A$. Then A and B are both dense in the interval [0, 1], and $A \cap B = \varnothing, [0, 1] = A \cup B$. It remains to prove that for any $a, \beta (0 \leqslant \alpha < \beta \leqslant 1)$, the intersections $(\alpha, \beta) \cap A$ and $(\alpha, \beta) \cap B$ both have the cardinality of the continuum. To this end, for any open interval $(\alpha, \beta) \subset 0,1]$, as long as n is sufficiently large, there will always be some closed interval $\left[\frac{i}{n}, \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$ contained within $(\alpha, \beta)$. According to the construction, $A_{n}$ has a non-empty perfect set intersection with the closed interval $\left[\frac{i}{n}, \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$, hence $A_{n} \cap \left[\frac{i}{n}, \frac{i-1}{n}\right]$ has the cardinality of the continuum. Since $A \supset A_{n}, (\alpha, \beta) \supset \left[\frac{i}{n}, \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$, the intersection $(\alpha, \beta) \cap A$ must also have the cardinality of the continuum. $(\alpha, \beta) \cap B$ can be obtained as the intersection of the dense open sets $(\alpha, \beta) \backslash A_{1}, (\alpha, \beta) \backslash A_{2}, \cdots$ within $(\alpha, \beta)$, and these open sets' intersection has the cardinality of the continuum, i.e., $(\alpha, \beta) \cap B$ has the cardinality of the continuum.
chinese_rationale: 我们用下面的方法在 [0，1]  中作出完备集序列  $A_{1}， A_{2}， \cdots， A_{n} ，  \cdots: A_{1}$  取作  [0，1]  中的 Cantor 三分集，为了构造  $A_{n}(n>1)$ ， 我们把闭区间  [0，1]  行成  n  个等长的闭区间$\left[0， \frac{1}{n}\right]，\left\lfloor\frac{1}{n}， \frac{2}{n}\right\rfloor， \cdots，\left[\frac{n-1}{n}， 1\right]$，只在这些闭区间的每一个内， 用类似于作出 Cantor 三分集的方法作出一个完备疏集， 把这样得到的  n  个完备疏集的并集叫做 $A_{n}$ 。现令  $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}， B=[0，1] \backslash A$ ， 则  A  与  B  在区间  [0，1]  中皆稠密， 且  $A \cap B=\varnothing，[0，1]=A \cup B$ 。 剩下要证明， 对于任意的  $a， \beta   (0 \leqslant \alpha<\beta \leqslant 1)$  ，交集  $(\alpha， \beta) \cap A$  与  $(\alpha， \beta) \cap B$  都具有连续统的势。为此， 任取开区间  $(\alpha， \beta) \subset 0，1]$ ， 只要  n  充分大， 就总会有某个闭区间  $\left[\frac{i}{n}， \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$  包含在  $(\alpha， \beta)$  之中。 根据作法，  $A_{n}$  与闭区间  $\left[\frac{i}{n}，  \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$  的交集是非空的完备集， 因而  $A_{n} \cap\left[\frac{i}{n}， \frac{i-1}{n}\right]$  具有连续统的势。 又因为  $A \supset A_{n}，(\alpha， \beta) \supset\left[\frac{i}{n}， \frac{i+1}{n}\right]$ ， 所以交集  $(\alpha， \beta) \cap A$  也一定具有连续统的势。 $(\alpha， \beta) \cap B$  可以作为在  $(\alpha， \beta)$  内稠密的开集  $(\alpha， \beta) \backslash A_{1}，(\alpha， \beta) \backslash   A_{2}， \cdots$  的交集而得到， 这些开集的交集具有诖续统的势 ， 即  $(\alpha， \beta) \cap B$  具有连续统的势。

statement: Let $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence. We define $y_{n}=\left(x_{1}+x_{2}+\cdots+x_{n}\right) / n \quad(n=1, 2, \cdots)$ as the arithmetic mean of $x_{n}$. There exists a divergent sequence with a convergent arithmetic mean.
chinese_statement: 设  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  为一序列， 我们称$y_{n}=\left(x_{1}+x_{2}+\cdots+x_{n}\right) / n \quad(n=1，2， \cdots)$为$x_{n}$的算术平均值。存在算术平均值收敛的发散序列。
rationale: Example: Take $ x_{n}=(-1)^{n-1}, n=1,2, \cdots $, then the sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ diverges. But $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(x_{1}+x_{2}+\cdots+x_{n}\right) / n=0 $. Note: It is easy to prove that if the sequence $x_{n}$ converges, then the sequence of its arithmetic mean also converges.
chinese_rationale: 例： 取$ x_{n}=(-1)^{n-1}， n=1，2， \cdots $， 则序列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  发散。但$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(x_{1}+x_{2}+\cdots+x_{n}\right) / n=0 $。注：容易证明，若序列$x_{n}$收敛，则它的算术平均值所成之序列也收敛。

statement: There exists a strictly increasing absolutely continuous function whose inverse is not absolutely continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在一个严格递增的绝对连续函数，其反函数并不绝对连续。
rationale: Let E be a Cantor set with positive measure in [0, 1], and let $\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)(i=1, 2, \cdots)$ be all adjacency intervals of E. Define $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{i}\right) & \left(\beta_{i}-x\right), x \in\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right), i=1,2, \cdots, \\0, & x \in E.\end{array}\right.f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} g(t) dt$. It can be seen that f is a strictly increasing absolutely continuous function, which maps the positive measure set E in $[0,1]$ to the zero measure set $f(E)$. Let $f^{-1}$ be the inverse function of f, then $f^{-1}$ maps the zero measure set $f(E)$ in the interval $[f(0), f(1)]$ to the positive measure set E. From this, it can be determined that $f^{-1}$ is not absolutely continuous on $[f(0), f(1)]$.
chinese_rationale: 设  E  为  [0，1]  中具有正测度的 Canter 集， 又设 $\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)(i=1 ，  2， \cdots)$  为  E  的全体邻接区间，令$g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{i}\right) & \left(\beta_{i}-x\right)， x \in\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)， i=1，2， \cdots， \\0， & x \in E 。\end{array}\right.f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} g(t) d t $。可知f  是严格递增的绝对连续函数，它把$[0，1]$中的正测度集  E  映成零测度集$f(E)$。 设  $f^{-1}$  是  f  的反函数， 则  $f^{-1}$  把区间  $[f(0)， f(1)] $ 中的零测度集  $f(E)$映成正测度集  E。由此可知，  $f^{-1}$  在  $[f(0)， f(1)]$ 上不是绝对连续的。

statement: There exists an absolutely and uniformly convergent functional series, which does not have any positive term superior series.
chinese_statement: 存在一个绝对并一致收敛的函数项级数， 它无任何正项数值优级数。
rationale: Consider the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) \quad(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1)$, where $u_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2^{-(n+1)} \text{ or } 2^{- n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1， \\\frac{1}{n} \sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right)， 2^{-(n+1)}<x<2^{-n} .\end{array}\right.$ First we prove that the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $ is absolutely convergent on [0,1]. Since $ u_{n}(x) \geqslant 0$, we only need to discuss the convergence of $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $. Clearly, for a fixed x, if $ x=0$ or $1 / 2 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$, then $u_{n}(x)=0 (n=1, 2, \cdots)$, so the sum of the series at this point is 0. If $ 0<x<1 / 2$, there is only one term $ u_{n}(x) = \sin^{2} \left(2^{n+1} \pi x \right) / n = 0$ that satisfies the inequality $1 / 2^{n+1} < x < 1 / 2^{n}$, and for the rest of the $ n, u_{n}(x) = 0$. Thus the discussed series consists of only one term, therefore it is convergent. Now we prove that the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $ is uniformly convergent on [0,1]. To this end, let $ u_{n}(x) = v_{n}(x) / n$, where $v_{n}(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2^{-(n+1)} \text { or } 2^{-n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1， \\\sin^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right), & 2^{-(n+1)}<x<2^{-n} .\end{array}\right.$ Since for any $ x \in [0,1]$ and any positive integer n, we have $0 < \sum_{k=1}^{n} v_{k}(x) \leqslant 1$, the partial sums of the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} v_{n}(x)$ are uniformly bounded on [0,1]; and the sequence $ \{1/n\}$ is monotonic for each x, and as $ n \rightarrow \infty$, it uniformly tends to 0 for $ 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$. Thus, by Dirichlet's test, the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} v_{n}(x) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n} v_{n}(x)$ is uniformly convergent on [0,1]. Finally, we prove that the discussed series cannot use a convergent positive term series as its superior series. In fact, if there exists a superior series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n}$, then for any x in the interval [0,1], we should have $ \left|u_{n}(x)\right| \leqslant M_{n}$, and $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n}$ is convergent. Let n be any positive integer, there always exists x in the interval $ \left(1/2^{n+1}, 1/2^{n}\right)$ such that $ \sin^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right) > 1/2$. For this x, we have $u_{n}(x) = \frac{1}{n} \sin^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right) > \frac{1}{2n}$, thus $M_{n} \geqslant \left|u_{n}(x)\right| > 1 / 2n$, leading to the divergence of the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n}$, which contradicts the assumption that $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n}$ is a convergent superior series. Note: The above counterexample shows that for the uniform convergence of some functional series, Weierstrass's M-test cannot be used for the decision.
chinese_rationale: 考虑级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) \quad(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1)$ ， 其中$u_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2^{-(n+1)} \text { 或 } 2^{- n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1， \\\frac{1}{n} \sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right)， 2^{-(n+1)}<x<2^{-n} .\end{array}\right.$我们先来证明， 级数$  \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $ 在  [0，1]  上绝对收敛。 由于$ u_{n}(x) \geqslant 0$ ， 故只需讨论$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $ 的收敛性。 显然， 对于固定的  x ，若$ x=0$  或  $1 / 2 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$ ， 则  $u_{n}(x)=0(n=1，2， \cdots) $， 故此时级数之和为 0 ， 若 $ 0<x<1 / 2$ ， 则唯有满足不等式  $1 / 2^{n+1}<x<1 / 2^{n} $ 的一项 $ u_{n}(x)=\sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right) / n=0$， 对于其余的 $ n， u_{n}(x)=0 $， 于是 所论级数是只有一项组成的，因此它他是收敛的。我们再来证明， 级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} u_{n}(x) $ 在  [0，1]  上一致收敛。 为此， 令 $ u_{n}(x)=v_{n}(x) / n$ ， 其中$v_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2^{-(n+1)} \text { 或 } 2^{-n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1， \\\sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right)， & 2^{-(n+1)}<x<2^{-n} .\end{array}\right.$因为对任何 $ x \in[0，1] $ 及正整数  n ， 都有$0<\sum_{k=1}^{n} v_{k}(x) \leqslant 1，$即级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} v_{n}(x)$的部分和在  [0，1]  上一致有界; 而序列 $ \{1 / n\} $ 对每一x  都是单调的， 且当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时， 对于 $ 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1 $ 的  x  来说， 它一致地趋于0， 于是， 由Dirichlet 判别法知级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} v_{n}(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n} v_{n}(x)$在  [0，1]  上一致收敛。最后证明， 所论级数不能用收敛的正项数值级数作为其优级数。事实上， 假若有优级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n} $ 存在， 那么对下区间[0，1]上的任何  x ， 都应该有$ \left|u_{n}(x)\right| \leqslant M_{n} $， 且 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n} $ 收敛。 设  n  是任意的正整数， 则恒有落在区间$ \left(1 / 2^{n+1}， 1 / 2^{n}\right) $ 内的  x  使 $ \sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right)   >1 / 2 $， 对此  x ， 将有$u_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{n} \sin ^{2}\left(2^{n+1} \pi x\right)>\frac{1}{2 n}，$故必有$ M_{n} \geqslant\left|u_{n}(x)\right|>1 / 2 n $， 从而级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n} $发散， 这与所设$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} M_{n}$为收敛的优级数发生矛盾。注：上述反例表明， 对某些函数项级数的一致收敛性， 是不能用 Weierstrass 的  M -判别法去判别的。

statement: There exists an infinite set of positive real numbers E, for which there is no $\alpha>0$ such that $E \cap(\alpha, +\infty)$ is an infinite set.
chinese_statement: 存在 一个正实数无穷集  E ， 对于它， 不存在  $\alpha>0$ ， 使  $E \cap(\alpha，+\infty)$ 是无穷集。
rationale: Let $E=\{1, 1 / 2, 1 / 3, \cdots, 1 / n, \cdots\}$, then for any $\alpha>0$, $E \cap(\alpha, +\infty)$ is always a finite set.
chinese_rationale: 设  $E=\{1，1 / 2，1 / 3， \cdots， 1 / n， \cdots\}$ ， 则对任意  $\alpha>0， E \cap(\alpha，+\infty)$ 恒为有限集。

statement: There exist two functions belonging to different classes but having the same points of discontinuity.
chinese_statement: 存在属于不同类的两个函数，而有相同的间断点。
rationale: Let $P_{0}$ be the Cantor ternary set in [0, 1], and define functions f and g on the closed interval [0, 1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in P_{0}, \\0, x \in G_{0}=[0,1] \backslash P_{0},\end{array}\right. g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in P_{0} \text{ and } x \text{ is not an endpoint of an adjacent interval of } P_{0}, \\0, \text{ otherwise.}\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that points in $G_{0}$ are continuity points for both functions, while points in $P_{0}$ are their points of discontinuity. Therefore, these two functions have exactly the same points of discontinuity. Since f is the characteristic function of the closed set $P_{0}$, it is a first-class function, whereas g, when restricted to $P_{0}$, is not continuous at every point in $P_{0}$. According to Baire's theorem, g is not a first-class function.
chinese_rationale: 设$P_{0}$为  [0，1]  中的 Cantor 三分集，在闭区间  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  和  g  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in P_{0}， \\0， x \in G_{0}=[0，1] \backslash P_{0}，\end{array}\right. g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in P_{0}且x不是P_{0}的邻接区间的端点， \\0， 其他。\end{array}\right.$易见， $ G_{0}$  中的点都是这两个函数的连续点， 而 $P_{0}$中的点都是它们的间断点。 因此， 这两个函数有完全相同的间断点。 因为  f  是闭集  $P_{0} $ 的特征函数，所以它是第一类的函数， 而  g  作为限制在  $P_{0}$  上的函数时， 它在  $P_{0}$  中的每一点上都不是连续的， 从而据Baire 定理，  g  不是第一类的函数。

statement: Functions f and g, such that f is Lebesgue-Stieltjes integrable with respect to g but not Riemann-Stieltjes integrable.
chinese_statement: 函数  f  与  g ， 使  f  关于g是 Lebesgue-Stieltjes 可积而不是 Riemann-Stieltjes 可积。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0, x \in[-1,0], \\1, x \in(0,1],\end{array} \quad g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0, & x \in[-1,0), \\1 +x,& x \in[0,1\} .\end{array}\right.\right.$ Then, the Lebesgue-Stieltjes integral of f with respect to g can be computed as 1 (see [14], p. 50). However, since $x=0$ is a common discontinuity point for functions f and g, the Riemann-Stieltjes integral of f with respect to g does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， x \in[-1，0]， \\1， x \in(0，1]，\end{array} \quad g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0， & x \in[-1，0)， \\1 +x，& x \in[0，1\} 。\end{array}\right.\right.$那么可以求出  f  关于  g  的Lebesgue-Stie1t jes 积分为1 (参看 [14]， p. 50)。 但是， 由于$x=0$是函数  f  与  g  的公共间断点， 因而 f  关于  g 的Riemann-Stieltjes 积分不存在。

statement: There exist two Borel measurable sets $\boldsymbol{B}_{1}, \boldsymbol{B}_{2}$, such that $\{\boldsymbol{B}_{1}-{B}_{2}=x-\boldsymbol{y}, \boldsymbol{x}\in \boldsymbol{B}_{1}, \boldsymbol{y} \in \boldsymbol{B}_{2}\}$ is not Borel measurable.
chinese_statement: 存在两个 Borel 可测集$ \boldsymbol{B}_{1}， \boldsymbol{B}_{2}$ ， 使得$\{\boldsymbol{B}_{1}-{B}_{2}=x-\boldsymbol{y}， \boldsymbol{x}\in \boldsymbol{B}_{1} ，  \boldsymbol{y} \in \boldsymbol{B}_{2}\}$ 不是 Borel 可测的。
rationale: There exists a Borel set B on the real line and a homeomorphism $\varphi$ of the real line, such that $\{x-\varphi(x): x \in B\}$ is not a Borel set.
chinese_rationale: 存在实直线上的 Borel 集B 及实直线的同胚映射$ \varphi$ ， 使$\{x-\varphi(x): x \in B\}$不是 Borel 集。

statement: There exists an (R) integrable function f, such that $g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$ is differentiable everywhere, but on a dense set, $\boldsymbol{g}^{\prime}(\boldsymbol{x}) \neq \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x})$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个  (R)  可积函数  f ， 使$g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t $处处可微， 但在一个稠密集上， $\boldsymbol{g}^{\prime}(\boldsymbol{x}) \neq \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x})$。
rationale: Define the function f on the interval [0, 1]: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q, x=p / q, p \text{ and } q \text{ are coprime integers and } q>0, \\0, x \text{ is irrational, }\end{array}\right.$ Then f is (R) integrable on [0, 1], and $g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t \equiv 0 \quad(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1)$, so for any $x \in[0, 1]$, we have $g^{\prime}(x)=0$. Hence, at every rational point in [0, 1], $g^{\prime}(x)\neq f(x)$.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q， x=p / q， p \text { 与 } q \text { 是互质的整数且 } q>0， \\0， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$则  f  在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积， 且$g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t \equiv 0 \quad(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1)$，所以对任意$x \in[0，1]$， 都有$ g^{\prime}(x)=0$ 。 由此可见， 在[0， 1] 中的每个有理点上， $ g^{\prime}(x)\neq f(x)$。

statement: There exists mutual non-implication between almost uniform convergence and mean convergence.
chinese_statement: 存在近一致收敛与平均收敛互不蕴涵。
rationale:
Example 1: A sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ almost uniformly convergent on a measurable set $E$, such that for any $p \geqslant 1,\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$, but $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge in p-th mean.
Example 2: A sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on a measurable set $E$, such that for any $p \geqslant 1, \left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$ and $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges in mean, but it does not converge almost uniformly on $E$.
chinese_rationale:
第一例: 一个在可测集  E  上近一致收敛的函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ，使对任何$p \geqslant 1,\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E) $, 但  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 并不  p  次幕平均收敛。
第二例: 一个可测集  E  上的函数序列 $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ，使对任 何$p \geqslant 1  ，  \left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$  且 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 平均收敛, 但它在  E  上并不近一致收敛。

statement: There exists a non-zero function, which when multiplied with any function always results in a measurable function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个非零函数， 它与任何函数之积恒为可测函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text{ is a rational number, } \\0, x \text{ is an irrational number.}\end{array}\right.$ Then for any function $g$, the function $f g$ is almost everywhere equal to zero, hence $f g$ is equivalent to the function that is identically zero, which implies $fg$ is a measurable function.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数。}\end{array}\right.$则对任意函数  g ， 函数  $f g $ 几乎处处等于零， 因此，  $f g $ 与恒等于零的函数对等，这意味着$fg$是可测函数。

statement: There exists a nowhere continuous function whose absolute value is continuous everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在一个无处连续函数，其绝对值却处处连续。
rationale: Let $\quad f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\ -1, x \text { is an irrational number, }\end{array}\right.$ Then f is nowhere continuous on $R^{\prime}$, but $|f(x)| \equiv 1$ is continuous everywhere on $R^{1}$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\quad f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\ -1， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$ 则  f  在  $R^{\prime}$  内无处连续， 而  $|f(x)| \equiv 1$  在  $R^{1}$  内处处连续。

statement: There exists a function that is uniformly continuous but not absolutely continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在一致连续而不绝对连续的函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{2} \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right), & 0<x \leqslant 1, \\0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.$ Then f is continuous on the closed interval [0, 1], hence it is uniformly continuous on [0, 1]. However, the total variation of f on [0, 1] is infinite, thus it is not absolutely continuous on [0, 1].
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{2} \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right)， & 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0， & x_{\Gamma=}=0，\end{array}\right.$则f在闭区间[0，1]上连续，从而它在[0，1]上一致连续。然而，f在[0，1]上的全变差为无穷大，因此， 它在  [0，1] 并不绝对连续。

statement: There exists a divergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ converges.
chinese_statement: 存在一个发散的正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$， 使$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ 收敛。
rationale: Take $a_{n}=1 / n$, then the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 / n$ diverges while $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 / n^{2}$ converges. Note: If the positive term series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges, then the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ also converges. The above counterexample shows that its converse does not hold.
chinese_rationale: 取 $a_{n}=1 / n $， 则级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 / n^{2}$ 发散而 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 / n^{2} $收敛。注： 如果正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 收敛， 那么级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$也收敛。 上述反例说明了它的逆命题并不成立。

statement: There exists a non-negative measurable function belonging to $L^{p-\delta}(0, a)$ but not to $L^{p}(0, a)(p>0,p\ne 2)$.
chinese_statement: 存在属于$L^{p-\delta}(0， a)$  而不属于 $L^{p}(0， a)(p>0,p\ne 2)$ 的非负可测函数。
rationale: Where $0<\boldsymbol{\delta}<\boldsymbol{p}$, let $f(x)=x^{-1/p}$, then $f$ is a non-negative measurable function on $(0, a)$. Because for any $0<\delta<p$, we have $\int_{0}^{a}|f(x)|^{p-\delta} dx=\int_{0}^{a} x^{\frac{\delta}{p}-1} dx=\frac{p}{\delta} a^{\frac{\delta}{p}}<+\infty$, therefore for any $0<\delta<p$, $f \in L^{p-\delta}(0, a)$, but $\int_{0}^{a}|f(x)|^{p} dx=\int_{0}^{a} \frac{1}{x} dx=+\infty$, thus $f \notin L^{p}(0, a)$.
chinese_rationale: 其中$0<\boldsymbol{\delta}<\boldsymbol{p}$ 设 $f(x)=x^{-1 / p}$ ， 则  f  是 $(0， a)$  上的非负可测函数。 因为对任意$ 0<\delta<p$ ， 都有$\int_{0}^{a}|f(x)|^{p-\delta} d x=\int_{0}^{a} x^{\frac{\delta}{p}-1} d x=\frac{p}{\delta} a^{\frac{\delta}{p}}<+\infty$，故对任何$0<\delta<p， f \in L^{p-\delta}(0， a) $ ，但$\int_{0}^{a}|f(x)|^{p} d x=\int_{0}^{a} \frac{1}{x} d x=+\infty，$因此  $f \notin L^{p}(0， a)$。

statement: There exists a function with a true local maximum at every interval.
chinese_statement: 存在在每个区间上都有一个真正局部极大的函数。
rationale: The following example belongs to Posey and Vaugnan. Let $\left\{ r_{n}\right\}=-1$ be a set dense in the reals (distinct points), and let $\begin{array}{l} g(x)=1-\min\{ 1, |x| \}, \\ f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} g_{n}(x), \end{array}$ where $g_{n}(x)=A_{n} g\left( \frac{x-r_{n}}{\omega_{n}} \right)$ and positive reals $A_{n}$ and $\omega_{n}$ to be determined. We define $g_{n}$ inductively for $n$. Clearly, when $\left| x \rightarrow r_{n} \right| > \omega_{n}$, $g_{n}(x) = 0$. Denote the interval $\left| x--r_{n} \right| \leqslant \omega_{n}$ as $I_{n}$, and call it the accompanying interval of $g_{n}$. We also define $f_{n}(x)=\sum_{j=1}^{n} g_{j}(x)$. Generally, we require (i) $0<A_{n} \leqslant 2^{-s}$; (ii) endpoints of $I_{n}$ are distinct from all points $r_{j} (j=1, 2, \cdots)$; and (iii) if $j<n$, either (iii') $r_{n} \in I_{j}$ and $\omega_{n}$ chosen such that $I_{n}$ and $I_{j}$ do not intersect, or (iii'') $r_{n} \in I_{j}$ such that $I_{n}$ lies strictly within $I_{j}$, not within the same half as $r_{n}$, e.g., if $\boldsymbol{r}_{j}-\omega_{j}<\boldsymbol{r}_{n}<\boldsymbol{r}_{j}$, then $r_{j}-\omega_{j}<r_{n}-\omega_{n}<r_{n}+\omega_{n}<r_{j}$. Inductively choose normal constants $A_{n}$ and $\omega_{n}$ for (i), (ii), and (iii). Clearly, from (i), $f$ is well-defined and continuous regardless of $\omega_{n}$ selection. We will adjust some constants $A_{\mathrm{n}}$ and $\omega_{n}$, ensuring conditions (i), (ii), and (iii) are satisfied. Let $A_{1}$ and $\omega_{1}$ be chosen as required, defining $f_{1}$. As a sum of “triangular” functions $g_{n}$, $f_{n}$ fits appropriately: (a) $f_{n}$ has a true local maximum at $r_{n}$, is linearly increasing on $(r_{n}-\omega_{n}, r_{n})$, and linearly decreasing on $(r_{n}, r_{n}+\omega_{n})$. (b) If $I_{n} \subset I_{j}$ and $I_{n} \neq I_{j}$, then $j<n$ and $f_{n}(r_{n})<f_{j}(r_{j})$. Suppose $f_{n-1}$ is well-defined and satisfies (a) and (b). If $I_{s}$ lies outside $I_{j}$ for $j=1, 2, \cdots, n-1$, then $A_{n}$ and $\omega_{n}$ remain unchanged, and (a) and (b) hold for $f_{n}$. Otherwise, let $h$ be the maximum integer less than $n$ such that $r_{n} \in I_{n}$. By previous constraints, $I_{n}$ lies strictly within $(r_{n}-\omega_{A}, r_{A})$ or $(r_{n}, r_{n}+\omega_{b})$ with $f_{k}$ linear on $I_{n}$. From (a), $f_{k}(r_{n}-\omega_{n})$ and $f_{k}(r_{n}+\omega_{n})$ are less than $f_{h}(r_{h})$, so $A_{n}$ can be chosen small enough such that $f_{n}(r_{n})<f_{h}(r_{h})$. If $r_{k} \in I_{j}$ for $j<h$, then $I_{A} \subset I_{j}$, and from (b), $f_{k}(r_{h})<f_{g}(r_{j})$, thus $f_{n}(r_{n})<f_{j}(r_{j})$, satisfying (b). Fixing $A_{u}$, reduce $\omega_{n}$ until (a) is satisfied. Actually, the maximum and minimum slopes of $g_{j}$ are $\pm A_{j}/\omega_{j}$, requiring only $\frac{A_{n}}{\omega_{n}}>\sum_{j=1}^{n-1}\frac{A_{j}}{\omega_{j}}$ for (a) to hold. Thus, induction is complete, and conditions (i), (ii), (iii), (a), and (b) hold. The function f defined this way has a true local maximum at each point $r_{n}$. Indeed, for $x \in I_{n}$ and $x \neq r_{n}$, it's proven $f(x)<f(r_{n})$. If $x \in \boldsymbol{I}_{y}, j=n+\boldsymbol{l}, n+2, \cdots$, then from (a), $f(x)=f_{n}(x)<f_{n}(r_{n}) \leqslant f(r_{n})$. Now let $h$ be the smallest index exceeding $n$ such that $x \in I_{A}$. If $x \in I_{k}$ for max index $k > n$, from (a) and (b), $f(x)=f_{k}(x)<f_{k}(r_{k})<f_{n}(r_{n}) \leqslant f(r_{n})$. If such $k$ doesn't exist, $f(x)=\lim_{i \rightarrow \infty} f_{k_{i}}(x)$, where $x \in I_{k_{i}}, i=1, 2, \cdots$ and all $k_{i}>h$. Thus $f_{k_{i}}(x)<f_{k_{i}}(r_{k_{i}})<f_{h}(r_{h})<f_{n}(r_{n})$, therefore $f(x) \leqslant f_{k}(r_{k})<f_{n}(r_{n})$.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子属于 Posey 和 Vaugnan 。设$\left\{r_{n}\right\}=-1$  是实数集中一个处处稠密的集 (点点不同)， 又设$\begin{array}{l}g(x)=1-\min \{1，|x|\}， \\f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} g_{n}(x)，\end{array}$这里  $g_{n}(x)=A_{n} g\left(\frac{x-r_{n}}{\omega_{n}}\right) $， 而正实数 $ A_{n}$  和  $\omega_{n}$  待定。我们对  n  归纳地定义  $g_{n}$ ， 显然， 当  $\left|x \rightarrow r_{n}\right|>\omega_{n}$  时，  $g_{n}(x)=  0$ 。 以  $I_{n}$  表区间  $\left|x--r_{n}\right| \leqslant \omega_{n}$ ， 并称其为$g_{n}$  的伴随区间。我们还定义$f_{n}(x)=\sum_{j=1}^{n} g_{j}(x) $\text {。 }一般， 我们要求 (i)  $0<A_{n} \leqslant 2^{-s}$ ; (ii)  $I_{n}$  的端点异于所有的点  $r_{j}(j=1，2， \cdots) $; 和 (iii) 若  $j<n$ ， 则不是 $(iii')  r_{n} \in I_{j}$  且  $\omega_{n}$  取得使  $I_{n}$  和  $I_{j}$  不相交， 就是 $(iii  \left.{ }^{\prime \prime}\right) r_{n} \in I_{j}$  且  $\omega_{n}$
