statement: There exists a function that is continuous and differentiable at only one point.
chinese_statement: 存在仅在一点连续并可微的函数。
rationale: The function $f(x, y) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{\frac{1+\alpha}{2}} ; & \text { At rational points, } \\0, & \text { At other points, }\end{array}\right.$ ( $\alpha>0$ ) is obviously discontinuous at any non-zero point, but continuous at zero. Moreover, it is also differentiable at zero: $f(x, y) - f(0,0) = f(x, y) = 0 \cdot x + 0 \cdot y + \rho^{1+\alpha}$ \text { where } $\rho=\sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}, \rho^{1+\alpha}=0(\rho)(\rho \rightarrow 0)$.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{\frac{1+\alpha}{2}} ; & \text { 在有理点， } \\0， & \text { 在其余点， }\end{array}\right.$（  $\alpha>0$ ） 显然在异于零的任意点间断，而在零点连续。又， 它在零点还可微：$f(x， y)-f(0，0)=f(x， y)=0 \cdot x+0 \cdot y+\rho^{1+\alpha}$ \text {。 }这里  $\rho=\sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}， \rho^{1+\alpha}=0(\rho)(\rho \rightarrow 0)$。

statement: There exists a differentiable function on [0, 1] whose derivative is nowhere continuous on a given non-empty perfect nowhere-dense set.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]上的一个可微函数，其导数在已给的非空完备疏集上无处连续。
rationale: Let E be a non-empty perfect nowhere-dense set in [0, 1], $(\alpha_{n}, \beta_{n})(n=1, 2, \cdots)$ be its adjacent intervals. Define a function on [0, 1] $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2} \sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}, & x \in \left(\alpha_{n}, \beta_{n}\right), \\0, & x \in E.\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that f is continuous on [0, 1]. For each $x \in \left(\alpha_{n}, \beta_{n}\right)$, f is differentiable at x and $\begin{aligned} f^{\prime}(x)= & 2\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)\left(\alpha_{n}+\beta_{n}-2 x\right) \sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}} \\ & -\frac{2\left(\alpha_{n}+\beta_{n}-2 x\right)}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)} \cos \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}.\end{aligned}$ In fact, for each $x_{0} \in E$, f is also differentiable at $x_{0}$ and $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right) = 0$. To validate this conclusion, we first let $x > x_{0}$. If $x \in E$, then $f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right) = 0-0 = 0$. If x is contained within some adjacent interval $\left(\alpha_{n}, \beta_{n}\right)$, then $\left.\mid f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right\}=\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}\left|\sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}\right|$, therefore $\begin{aligned} \frac{\left|f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right|}{x-x_{0}} & \leqslant \frac{\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}{x-x_{0}} \\ & = \left(x-x_{0}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2} \rightarrow 0 \left(x \rightarrow x_{0}+\right), \end{aligned}$ hence, we obtain $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}+\right) = 0$. Similarly, $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}-\right) = 0$. Therefore, $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right) = 0$. In conclusion, f is differentiable everywhere on [0, 1]. From the analytical expression of $f^{\prime}$, it is easy to see that $f^{\prime}$ is continuous on [0, 1] but nowhere continuous on E.
chinese_rationale: 设  E  为[0，1]  中的非空完备疏集，$\left(\alpha_{n}， \beta_{n}\right)(n=1，2， \cdots)$  是它的邻接区间， 在[0，1]上定义函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2} \sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}， & x \in\left(\alpha_{n}， \beta_{n}\right)， \\0， & x \in E 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  在  [0，1]  上连续， 对每一  $x \in\left(\alpha_{n}， \beta_{n}\right)$， f  在  x  处可微且$\begin{aligned}f^{\prime}(x)= & 2\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)\left(\alpha_{n}+\beta_{n}-2 x\right) \sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-{x}\right)^{2}} \\& -\frac{2\left(\alpha_{n}+\beta_{n}-2 x\right)}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)} \cos \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-\bar{x}\right)^{2}}。\end{aligned}$其实，对每一 $x_{0} \in E$， f  在$ x_{0}$ 处也可微且$f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)=0$。为证实这一结论， 我们先设 $x>x_{0}$。若 $x \in E$ ， 则$f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)=0-0=0 $。若  x  含于某个邻接区间  $\left(\alpha_{n}， \beta_{n}\right)$内， 则$\left.\mid f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right\}=\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}\left|\sin \frac{1}{\left(x-\alpha_{n}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}\right|$，因而$\begin{aligned}\frac{\left|f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right)\right|}{x-x_{0}} & \leqslant \frac{\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{2}\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2}}{x-x_{0}} \\& =\left(x-x_{0}\right)\left(\beta_{n}-x\right)^{2} \rightarrow 0\left(x \rightarrow x_{0}+\right)，\end{aligned}$于是得到$f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}+\right)=0$。同理可得$f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}-\right)=0$。因之  $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)=0$。综上所述，  f  在  [0，1]  上处处可微。由  $f^{\prime}$  的解析表达式易知，$f^{\prime}$ 在  [0，1]上连续而在  E  上无处连续。

statement: There exists a surface for which the area of its inscribed polyhedra does not converge to its area.
chinese_statement: 存在一个曲面，它的内接多面体的面积不收敛它的面积。
rationale: The following example belongs to a Schwarz. Consider a right circular cylinder S with radius 1 and height 1. We construct inscribed polyhedra within S as follows: On the cylinder S, create n equally spaced circumferences (spaced at $1 / n$). Divide each circumference into m equal arcs, and align each arc's endpoints with the midpoints of arcs on adjacent circumferences. Consider the polyhedron composed of triangles with two vertices at the endpoints of these arcs and a third vertex at the endpoint aligned with the midpoint of the arc above (or below). These triangles form an inscribed polyhedron $P_{m n}$ within S, consisting of $2 m n$ triangles, each with an area of $\sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}+\left(1-\cos \frac{\pi}{m}\right)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$, making the area of $P_{m n}$ equal to $\begin{aligned}A\left(P_{m n}\right)= & 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}+\left(1-\cos \frac{\pi}{m}\right)^{2}\right]^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\& =2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{\pi^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4}\frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{-\frac{1}{2}} 。\end{aligned}$ As m and n tend to infinity, the polyhedron $\boldsymbol{P}_{\mathrm{mn}}$ "approaches S". First, we note $\lim _{m，n \rightarrow \infty} \inf A\left(P_{m n}\right) \geqslant 2 \pi$, because $\begin{aligned}& 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{\pi^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4}\frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \\ \geqslant & 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m} \cdot\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)=2 m \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\end{aligned}$ and $\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} 2 m \sin \frac{\pi}{m}=2 \pi $. Secondly, we prove $\lim _{m， n \rightarrow \infty} \inf A\left(P_{m， n}\right)=2 \pi \text {。 }$ To this end, let $m=n$, then $\left.A\left(P_{m n}\right)=2 n^{2} \sin \frac{\pi}{n} \cdot \frac{1}{n^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4} \frac{\pi}{2 n}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$, so $\lim _{m，n \rightarrow \rightarrow \infty} A\left(P_{0 \pi n}\right)=2 \pi \text {。 }$ However, if n is chosen sufficiently large compared to m, we can achieve any limit greater than $2 \pi$. In fact, if n is chosen as $n=m^{3}$, the limit becomes $+\infty$, because $A\left(P_{m m^{3}}\right)=2 m^{4} \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{m^{6}}+4 \sin ^{4} \frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$ and $\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} A\left(P_{m m^{3}}\right)=+\infty \text {。 }$ Note: The above example shows that definitions similar to curve length are not suitable for defining surface area.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子属一 Schwarz  。考虑一个半径为1，高为1的正圆柱面S。我们按下列方式在S 内作内接多面体：在圆柱面  S  上作  n  个等距间隔 (相距为  $1 / n$  )的圆周。将每一圆周分为  m  段相等的圆弧， 并使每一圆弧的端点与上下相邻圆周上圆弧的中点对齐。考虑由下列三角形组成的多面体，这些三角形的两个顶点就是上述圆弧的两个端点，而其第三个顶点是上面(或下面)相邻圆周上与此圆弧中点对齐的端点。这些三角形构成一个内接于  S  的多面体  $P_{m n}$ ， 这个多面体 由  $2 m n$  个三角形组成，每个三角形的面积为$\sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}+\left(1-\cos \frac{\pi}{m}\right)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$因而  $P_{m n}$  的面积等于$\begin{aligned}A\left(P_{m n}\right)= & 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)^{2}+\left(1-\cos \frac{\pi}{m}\right)^{2}\right]^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\& =2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{\pi^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4}\frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{-\frac{1}{2}} 。\end{aligned}$在， 令  m  及  n  趋向无穷大， 则多面体$\boldsymbol{P}_{\mathrm{mn}}$“趋向  S"  。 首先我们注意到$\lim _{m，n \rightarrow \infty} \inf A\left(P_{m n}\right) \geqslant 2 \pi$，这是因为$\begin{aligned}& 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{\pi^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4}\frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \\\geqslant & 2 m n \sin \frac{\pi}{m} \cdot\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)=2 m \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\end{aligned}$及$\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} 2 m \sin \frac{\pi}{m}=2 \pi $。其次， 我们来证明确定有$\lim _{m， n \rightarrow \infty} \inf A\left(P_{m， n}\right)=2 \pi \text {。 }$为此， 令  $m=n$ ， 则$\left.A\left(P_{m n}\right)=2 n^{2} \sin \frac{\pi}{n} \cdot \frac{1}{n^{2}}+4 \sin ^{4} \frac{\pi}{2 n}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$，所以$\lim _{m，n \rightarrow \rightarrow \infty} A\left(P_{0 \pi n}\right)=2 \pi \text {。 }$但若选取与  m  相比足够大的  n ， 则我们可以得到任意大于$2 \pi$ 的极限。 事实上， 若选取  $n=m^{3}$ ， 就得到极限 $+\infty$ ， 这是因为$A\left(P_{m m^{3}}\right)=2 m^{4} \sin \frac{\pi}{m}\left[\frac{1}{m^{6}}+4 \sin ^{4} \frac{\pi}{2 m}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}$及$\lim _{m \rightarrow \infty} A\left(P_{m m^{3}}\right)=+\infty \text {。 }$注上面的例子告诉我们， 与曲线弧长相类似的定义对定义曲面的面积是不适用的。

statement: The product of two uniformly continuous functions is not necessarily uniformly continuous.
chinese_statement: 两个一致连续的函数的乘积函数一定一致连续。
rationale: The functions $f(x)=x$ and $g(x)=\sin x$ are both uniformly continuous on $R^{1}$, but their product $f(x) g(x)=x \sin x$ is not uniformly continuous on $R^{\prime}$. Note: It is easy to prove that if the functions f and g are both uniformly continuous on their common domain D and are also bounded, then their product $f g$ is also uniformly continuous on D. It is also easy to prove that any function that is uniformly continuous on a bounded set is bounded on that set. Thus, the possibility of the above counterexample is due to the fact that the considered functions have an unbounded common domain and at least one of the functions is unbounded.
chinese_rationale: 函数  $f(x)=x$  和  $g(x)=\sin x$  在  $R^{1}$  上都是一致连续的，但是，它们的乘积  $f(x) g(x)=x \sin x$  在  $R^{\prime}$  上不一致连续。注： 容易证明， 假若函数  f  和  g  在它们共有的定义域  D  上都一致连续， 并且又都是有界的， 那么它们的乘积  $f g $ 在  D  上也一致连续。 也容易证明， 在有界集上一致连续的任何函数在该集上都是有界的。 由此可见， 上述反例之所以可能， 只是由于所考虑的函数， 它们共有的定义域是无界的，而且至少有一个函数是无界的。

statement: There exists a sequence of sets $\left\{A_{n}\right\} $\text{, such that }$\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime} \neq \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime} $.
chinese_statement: 存在集序列 $\left\{A_{n}\right\} $\text {， 使 }$\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime} \neq \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime} $。
rationale: Let $\left\{r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}, \cdots\right\}$ be the set of all rational numbers, $A_{n}$ be the set consisting of the single element $r_{n}$, then for each $n, A_{n}^{\prime}=\varnothing$, hence $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime}=\varnothing$. However, $\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime}=(-\infty, +\infty)$, therefore $\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime} \neq \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime}$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\left\{r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}， \cdots\right\}$  为有理数全体，  $A_{n}$  为单元素  $r_{n}$  所组成之集， 则对每一  $n， A_{n}^{\prime}=\varnothing$ ， 故$\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime}=\varnothing$ 。而  $\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime}=(-\infty，+\infty)$ ， 因此$\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\prime} \neq \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\prime}$ 。

statement: There exist functions that are everywhere continuous but nowhere differentiable.
chinese_statement: 存在处处连续而无处可微的函数。
rationale: The first example of a nowhere differentiable continuous function was given by Weierstrass: $f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b^{n} \cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)$, where $0<b<1$ and a is a positive odd number. This series converges uniformly on any interval, so f is continuous everywhere. On the other hand, if ab>1, the series obtained by term-by-term differentiation diverges. This fact itself does not prove that f is not differentiable, but it does provide a possibility in this regard. We will prove: If $ab>1+ \frac{3}{2} \pi$, then the function f does not have a finite derivative at any point x. First, we have $\frac{f(x+h)}{h}=f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b^{n} \frac{\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}-\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)}{h}=\sum_{n=0}^{m-1}+\sum_{n-m}^{\infty}=S_{m}+R_{m} $ . Because $\begin{aligned}& \left|\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}-\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)\right| \\= & \left\{a^{n} \pi h \sin \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+\theta h)\right\}\left|\leqslant a^{n} \pi\right| h \mid， \text { 其中 } 0<\theta<1。\right.\end{aligned}$ So $\left|S_{m}\right| \sum_{n=0}^{m-1} \pi a^{n} b^{n}=\pi \frac{a^{m} b^{m}-1}{a b-1}<\pi \frac{r^{m} b^{m}}{a b-1} $. Second, we give h a specific numerical value and seek a lower bound for R_{m}, for this, let $\begin{array}{lll}a^{m} x &\alpha_{m}&\xi_{m}, \\ \end{array}$ where it is an integer, and $-\frac{1}{2}\leqslant\xi_{m}\leqslant\frac{1}{2}$. Let $h=\frac{1-\xi_{m}}{a^{m}}$, then $0<h \leqslant \frac{3}{2a^{m}}$ and $a^{\mathrm{n}} \pi(x+h)=a^{n-m} a^{m} \pi(x+h)=a^{n \cdot m} \pi \left(\alpha_{m}+1\right)$. Because a is odd, $\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}=\cos \left\{\alpha^{n-m} \pi\left(\alpha_{m}+1\right)\right\}=(-1)^{\alpha_{m}+1} \cdot$. Also, $\begin{aligned}\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right) & =\cos \left\{a^{n-m} \pi\left(\alpha_{m}+\xi_{m}\right)\right\} \\& =\cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \alpha_{m}\right) \cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right) \\& =(-1)^{\alpha_{m}} \cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right)，\end{aligned}$ so $\quad R_{m}=\frac{(-1)^{a_{m}+1}}{h} \sum_{n=m}^{\infty} b^{n} \left\{1+\cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right)\right\}$. Since each term of the series on the right side of the above equation is positive, if we take only the first term, we get $\left|R_{m}\right|>\frac{b^{m}}{|h|}>\frac{2}{3} a^{m} b^{m}$. Therefore, $\begin{aligned}\left|\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h}\right| & \geqslant\left|R_{m}\right|-\left|S_{m}\right| \\& >\left(\frac{2}{3}-\frac{\pi}{a b-1}\right) a^{m} b^{m} 。\end{aligned}$ If $ab>1+\frac{3}{2}\pi$, the factor in the parentheses is positive. Therefore, as $m \rightarrow \infty, h \rightarrow 0$, the right side of the inequality tends to infinity. Hence, f is not differentiable at point x. Since x is arbitrary, f is nowhere differentiable.
chinese_rationale: 第一个无处可微的连续函数的例子是由 Weierstrass 给出的：$f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b^{n} \cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)$，此处$0<b<1$ ， a为一正奇数. 此级数任任何区间上都一致收敛，所以  f  处处连续。另一方面， 若  a b>1 ， 则由逐项微分得到的级数发散。这个事实本身并没有证明  f  不可微，但却提供了这方面的可能性. 我们将要证明： 若 $a b>1+ \frac{3}{2} \pi$ ， 则在任何点  x  处， 函数  f 都没有有穷的导数。首先，我们有$\frac{f(x+h)}{h}=f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} b^{n} \frac{\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}-\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)}{h}=\sum_{n=0}^{m-1}+\sum_{n-m}^{\infty}=S_{m}+R_{m} $。因为$\begin{aligned}& \left|\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}-\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right)\right| \\= & \left\{a^{n} \pi h \sin \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+\theta h)\right\}\left|\leqslant a^{n} \pi\right| h \mid， \text { 其中 } 0<\theta<1。\right.\end{aligned}$所以$\left|S_{m}\right| \sum_{n=0}^{m-1} \pi a^{n} b^{n}=\pi \frac{a^{m} b^{m}-1}{a b-1}<\pi \frac{r^{m} b^{m}}{a b-1} $。其次， 我们给  h  以特定们数值， 而为  R_{m}  求一下限， 为此， 记$\begin{array}{lll}a^{m} x & \alpha_{m} & \xi_{m}， \\\end{array}$此处为一整数，而$-\frac{1}{2}\leqslant\xi_{m}\leqslant\frac{1}{2}$。命$h=\frac{1-\xi_{m}}{a^{m}}$，则有$0<h \leqslant \frac{3}{2a^{m}}$及$a^{\mathrm{n}} \pi(x+h)=a^{n-m} a^{m} \pi(x+h)=a^{n \cdot m} \pi\left(\alpha_{m}+1\right)$。因为  a  是奇数， 所以$\cos \left\{a^{n} \pi(x+h)\right\}=\cos \left\{\alpha^{n-m} \pi\left(\alpha_{m}+1\right)\right\}=(-1)^{\alpha_{m}+1} \cdot$又因$\begin{aligned}\cos \left(a^{n} \pi x\right) & =\cos \left\{a^{n-m} \pi\left(\alpha_{m}+\xi_{m}\right)\right\} \\& =\cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \alpha_{m}\right) \cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right) \\& =(-1)^{\alpha_{m}} \cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right)，\end{aligned}$所以$\quad R_{m}=\frac{(-1)^{a_{m}+1}}{h} \sum_{n=m}^{\infty} b^{n}\left\{1+\cos \left(a^{n-m} \pi \xi_{m}\right)\right\}$ 。由于上式右端的级数的每 一 项都是正的， 故若只取第一项， 便得$\left|R_{m}\right|>\frac{b^{m}}{|h|}>\frac{2}{3} a^{m} b^{m}$于是$\begin{aligned}\left|\frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h}\right| & \geqslant\left|R_{m}\right|-\left|S_{m}\right| \\& >\left(\frac{2}{3}-\frac{\pi}{a b-1}\right) a^{m} b^{m} 。\end{aligned}$若  $a b>1+\frac{3}{2}\pi$ ， 则括号内的因子取正值; 故当$ m \rightarrow \infty， h \rightarrow 0 $时，不等式的右方趋向无穷。 所以  f  在点  x  处不可微。 由于  x  是任取的， 因而  f  无处何微。

statement: There exists a sequence of bounded variation functions $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ uniformly converging to a bounded variation function f on $[0, 2\pi]$, such that $\lim _{x \rightarrow \infty} V_{0}^{2\pi }\left(f_{\mathrm{n}}\right) \neq V_{0}^{2\pi}(f)$.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，2 \pi ]上的一个一致收敛于某个有界变差函数f的有界变差函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ， 使$\lim _{x \rightarrow \infty} V_{0}^{2\pi }\left(f_{\mathrm{n}}\right) \neq V_{0}^{2\pi}(f)$ 。
rationale: For example: Let $f(x) \equiv 0, f_{n}(x) = n^{-1} \sin n^{s} x, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2\pi $, where s is a real number such that $n^{s}$ is an integer. It is easy to see that $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ uniformly converges to f on $[0, 2\pi]$. Also, $V_{0}^{2\pi}(f) = 0, V_{0}^{2\pi }\left(f_{\mathrm{n}}\right) = 4\pi^{s-1}$, so when $s=1$, we have $0 = V_{0}^{2 \pi}(f) < \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} V_{0}^{2 \pi}\left(f_{n}\right) = 4$; and when $s=2$, we have $0 = \mathbf{V}_{0}^{2\pi}(f) < \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \mathbf{V}_{0}^{2 \pi}\left(f_{n}\right) = +\infty$.
chinese_rationale: 例如： 设 $f (x)\equiv 0， f_{n}(x)=n^{-1} \sin n^{s} x， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2 \pi  $ ，其中 s是实数，使$n^{s}$是正整数。易见，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  [0，2 \pi]  上一致收敛于f。又$V_{0}^{2\pi}(f)=0，V_{0}^{2\pi }\left(f_{\mathrm{n}}\right)=4\pi^{s-1}$于是， 当  $s=1 $ 时，有$0=V_{0}^{2 \pi}(f)<\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} V_{0}^{2 \pi}\left(f_{n}\right)=4$ ;而当 $s=2$  时， 有$0=\mathbf{V}_{0}^{2\pi}(f)<\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \mathbf{V}_{0}^{2 \pi}\left(f_{n}\right)=+\infty$。

statement: There exist functions f and g such that $\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$ exists, but changing the value of f at a certain point causes $\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$ to not exist.
chinese_statement: 存在函数  f  和  g ， 使$\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$  存在， 但改变  f  在某个点的值，  $\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$ 就不存在。
rationale: Define the functions f and g on the interval [-1, 1]: $f(x) \equiv 1, g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \neq 0, \\1, x=0.\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that $\int_{-1}^{1} f(x) d g(x)$ exists and equals 0. Now change the value of f at $x=0$ to 2: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2, x=0, \\1, x \neq 0,\end{array}\right.$ Then, because f and g have a common discontinuity point at $x=0$, $\int_{-1}^{1} f(x) d g(x)$ does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [-1，1]  上定义函数  f  和  g ：$f(x) \equiv 1， g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \neq 0， \\1， x=0。\end{array}\right.$易见，  $\int_{-1}^{1} f(x) d g(x)$ 存在且等于 0 。 现改变  f  在  $x=0$  的值为 2 ：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2， x=0， \\1， x \neq 0，\end{array}\right.$则因  f  和  g  在 $ x=0 $ 处有共同的间断点， 从而$\int_{-1}^{1} f(x) d g(x)$不存在。

statement: There exists an unbounded function on (0,1) whose generalized (R) integral $\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x $ is not the limit of the corresponding integral sum $ \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i}$.
chinese_statement: 存在 (0，1)  上的一个无界函数， 其广义  (R)  积分$\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x  $不是对应的积分和式 $ \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i}$  的极限。
rationale: We consider the function $f(x)=|\ln x|$ defined on (0,1). Its generalized (R) integral on (0,1) exists because $\int_{0}^{1}|\ln x| d x=-\int_{0}^{1} \ln x d x=-\lim _{s \rightarrow 0+} \int_{s}^{1} \ln x d x=1$. However, if we divide (0,1) into n equal subintervals: $\Delta x_{i}=1 / n \quad(i=0,1, \cdots, n-1),$ and choose $\xi_{0}^{\prime}=e^{-n}, {x}_{i} \leqslant \xi_{i}^{\prime} \leqslant x_{i+1} \quad(i=1,2, \cdots, n-i) $, it is clear that $0<\xi_{0}^{r}   <1 / n$. Then choose $ \xi_{0}^{\prime \prime}=e^{-2 n} $, and $x_{i} \leqslant \xi_{i}^{\prime \prime} \leqslant x_{i+1}(i=1,2, \cdots, n-1) $, similarly, $ 0<\xi_{0}^{\prime \prime}<1 / n$. If $\int_{0}^{1}|\ln x| d x $ is the limit of the sum $\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i} $, then $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime \prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}$ should hold. However, there is one distinct term in each sum: $\begin{array}{c}f\left(\xi_{0}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{0}=\frac{1}{n}\left|\ln e^{-n}\right|=1, \\f\left(\xi_{0}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{0}=\frac{1}{n}\left|\ln e^{-2n}\right|=2.\end{array}$ Therefore, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi^{\prime}\right) \Delta {x}_{i}\neq\lim _{n \rightarrow+\infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime \prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}$. From this, we can see that the generalized integral $\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x $ cannot be the limit of the corresponding integral sum $ \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i}$.
chinese_rationale: 我们考察定义在  (0，1)  上的函数$f(x)=|\ln x|$，  它在  (0，1)  上的广义  (R)  积分存在， 因为$\int_{0}^{1}|\ln x| d x=-\int_{0}^{1} \ln x d x=-\lim _{s \rightarrow 0+} \int_{s}^{1} \ln x d x=1$。然而，若将  (0，1)  分成长度相等的  n  个子区间:$\Delta x_{i}=1 / n \quad(i=0，1， \cdots， n-1)，$并取  $\xi_{0}^{\prime}=e^{-n}， {x}_{i} \leqslant \xi_{i}^{\prime} \leqslant x_{i+1} \quad(i=1，2， \cdots， n-i) $ ，则显然有  $0<\xi_{0}^{r}   <1 / n$ 。再取 $ \xi_{0}^{\prime \prime}=e^{-2 n} $， 以及  $x_{i} \leqslant \xi_{i}^{\prime \prime} \leqslant x_{i+1}(i=1，2， \cdots， n-1) $， 同样有 $ 0<\xi_{0}^{\prime \prime}<1 / n$ .如果  $\int_{0}^{1}|\ln x| d x $ 是和式  $\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i} $ 的极限， 则应有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime \prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}$然而， 上述等式两端的和式中有一项相异:$\begin{array}{c}f\left(\xi_{0}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{0}=\frac{1}{n}\left|\ln e^{-n}\right|=1， \\f\left(\xi_{0}^{\prime}\right) \Delta x_{0}=\frac{1}{n}\left|\ln e^{-2n}\right|=2。\end{array}$因此，$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi^{\prime}\right) \Delta {x}_{i}\neq\lim _{n \rightarrow+\infty} \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}^{\prime \prime}\right) \Delta x_{i}$由此可知，广义积分$\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x  $不能是对应的积分和式 $ \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(\xi_{i}\right) \Delta x_{i}$  的极限。

statement: There exists a nowhere monotone bounded variation function with a non-constant local cycle.
chinese_statement: 存在非常值的局部循环的无处单调的有界变差函数。
rationale: A function $f(x)$ is said to have a local cycle at x if there exists a point $x^{\prime}$ different from x within every neighborhood of x such that $f(x^{\prime}) = f(x)$. Here we introduce a nowhere monotone bounded variation function with a non-constant local cycle. Mauldon posed the following question: Does there exist a continuous bounded variation function with a non-constant local cycle on the interval $[a, b]$? Marcus pointed out that such a function does not exist. Then he asked: Does there exist a nowhere monotone bounded variation function with a non-constant local cycle on $[a, b]$? Darst affirmatively answered this question. His construction is as follows: Let $(c, d]$ be a half-open interval, $a \leqslant c < d \leqslant b, t_{1} = c + i / b (d - c), i = 0, 1, 2, \cdots, 6$, and let $p > 0$. Define a function $g(c, d, p)$ on $[a, b]$ as follows: $g(c, d, p) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}(-1)^{i+1} p, & x \in \left(t_{i}, t_{t+1}\right], i = 1,2,3,4, \\0, & \text {otherwise.}\end{array}\right.$ Note that $g(c, d, p)$ has a total variation of $8p$ on $[a, b]$. For each positive integer n, divide $[a, b]$ into $6^{n-1}$ subintervals of length $(b - a) 6^{-(n-1)}$ and let $p_{n}$ be the positive number satisfying the equation $6^{(n-1)} 8 p_{n} = 2^{-n}$. Let $\begin{array}{c}f_{n} = \sum_{i} g \left(c_{i}, d_{i}, p_{n}\right), \\f = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}, \end{array}$ It is evident that the function f has the required properties.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x)$称为在  x  处局部循环，如果在  x  的每个邻域内部存在一个异于x的点$x^{\prime}$ ， 使得$  f\left(x^{\prime}\right)=f(x)$。我们这里介绍的是一个非常值的局部循环得无处单调得有界变差函数。Mauldon 提出如下的向题: 是否存在区间$[a， b]$上的非常值的局部循环的连续有界这差函数？Marcus 指出， 这样的函数并不存在。然后他问: 是否存在  [a， b]  上的非常值的局部循环的无处单调的有界变差函数？Darst 肯定地回答了这个问题。 他的构造法如下:设$(c， d]$是半开区间，  $a \leqslant c<d \leqslant b， t_{1}=c+i / b(d-c)， i=0 ，  1，2， \cdots， 6 $， 又设 $ p>0$。 在  [a， b]  上定义函数  $g(c， d， p)$  如下:$g(c， d， p)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}(-1)^{i+1} p， & x \in\left(t_{i}， t_{t+1}\right]， i=1，2，3，4， \\0， & \text { 其它。}\end{array}\right.$注意，  $g(c， d， p)$  在  $[a， b]  $上的全变差为  $8 p$ 。对每一正整数  n ， 把  [a， b]  分成长为$ (b-a) 6^{-(n-1)} $ 的 $ 6^{n-1}$  个子区间 $ \left(c_{1}， d_{1}\right]$ ， 并设  $p_{n}$  是满足等式$6^{(n-1)} 8 p_{n}=2^{-n}$的正数。 令$\begin{array}{c}f_{n}=\sum_{i} g\left(c_{i}， d_{i}， p_{n}\right)， \\f=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}，\end{array}$易见， 函数  f  具有所需的性质。

statement: Closed set $\boldsymbol{F}$, must ensure $\overline{\left(\boldsymbol{F}^{\circ}\right)} = \boldsymbol{F}$.
chinese_statement: 闭集  $\boldsymbol{F}$, 一定使  $\overline{\left(\boldsymbol{F}^{\circ}\right)} = \boldsymbol{F}$ 。

statement: A uniformly continuous function does not necessarily have a uniformly continuous inverse function.
chinese_statement: 一个一致连续的函数， 其反函数不一定一致连续。
rationale: The function $\ln x$ is uniformly continuous on the interval $[a, -1-\infty) (a>0)$, but its inverse function $e^{x}$ is not uniformly continuous on $[\ln a, +\infty)$.
chinese_rationale: 函数  $\ln x$  在区间  $[a，-1-\infty)(a>0) $ 上是一致连续的， 但其反函数  $e^{x}$  在 $ [\ln a，+\infty) $ 上并不一致连续。

statement: There exists a continuous function that is differentiable at irrational points but not differentiable at rational points.
chinese_statement: 存在在无理点可微而在有理点不可微的连续函数。

statement: There exists a discontinuous function with the intermediate value property.
chinese_statement: 存在具有介值性质的间断函数。
rationale: Define the function on the closed interval [0, 1/2] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x=1/2^{n}, n \text{ is odd, } \\0, x=0 \text{ or } x=1/2^{2}, n \text{ is even, } \\\text{ linear, } 1/2^{n+1} \leqslant x \leqslant 1/2^{n}, n=1,2, \cdots .\end{array}\right.$ It is evident that f is discontinuous at x=0, but f possesses the intermediate value property. That is, if M is any real number between $f(0)=0 $ and $f(1/2)=1 $, then there is at least one point $\xi$ in the open interval $(0, 1/2)$ such that $f(\xi)=M $.
chinese_rationale: 在闭区间  [0，1 / 2]  上如下定义函数：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x=1 / 2^{n}， n \text { 为奇数， } \\0， x=0 \text { 或 } x=1 / 2^{2}， n \text { 为偶数， } \\\text { 线性， } 1 / 2^{n+1} \leqslant x \leqslant 1 / 2^{n}， n=1，2， \cdots 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  在  x=0  不连续， 但  f  却具有介值性质。 即， 如果  M  是介于数  $f(0)=0 $ 和  $f(1 / 2)=1 $ 之间的任意实数，那么在开区间  $(0，1 / 2)$ 内至少可以找到一点$\xi$ ， 使得  $f(\xi)=M $。

eq 0$ and discontinuous at $x=0$. Let $\left\{r_{n}ight\}$ represent all the rational numbers in [0, 1], and let $f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g\left(x-r_{n}ight)$. Clearly, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g^{\prime}\left(x-r_{n}ight)$ converges uniformly on [0, 1], hence $f^{\prime}(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g^{\prime}\left(x-r_{n}ight), 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$. Thus, $f^{\prime}$ is continuous at any irrational point in [0, 1] and discontinuous at any rational point.
chinese_rationale:
在[0，1]上定义函数$g(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}x^{2} \sin (1 / x)， & x 
eq=0， \0， & x=0，\end{array}ight.$则$g^{\prime}(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}2 x \sin (1 / x)-\cos (1 / x)， & x 
eq 0， \0， & x=0，\end{array}ight.$所以  $g^{\prime}(x)$  在 $ x 
eq 0$  处连续而在  $x=0$ 处间断设  $\left\{r_{n}ight\}$  为  [0，1]  中的全体有理数， 令$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g\left(x-r_{n}ight)$ 。显然， 级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g^{\prime}\left(x-r_{n}ight)$  在  [0，1]  上一致收敛， 因而$f^{\prime}(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}  rac{1}{2^{n}} g^{\prime}\left(x-r_{n}ight)， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1$。于是， $f^{\prime}$ 在  [0，1]  中的任一无理点连续而在任一有理点间断。

statement: There exists a non-negative measurable function that belongs to $L^{2}(0,+\infty)$ but does not belong to any $L^{p}(0,+\infty)(p>0, p \neq 2)$.
chinese_statement: 存在属于$L^{2}(0，+\infty)$而不属于任何$L^{p}(0，+\infty)(p>0， p \neq 2)$的非负可测函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=x^{-1/2}(1+|\ln x|)^{-1}$, then f is a non-negative continuous function on $(0,+\infty)$, and therefore also a non-negative measurable function. Because $\begin{aligned}\int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{2} dx & = \int_{0}^{+\infty} x^{-1}(1+|\ln x|)^{-2} dx \\& =\int_{0}^{1} \frac{dx}{x(1-\ln x)^{2}}+\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{dx}{x(1+\ln x)^{2}}=2,\end{aligned}$ so $f \in L^{2}(0,+\infty)$. To prove $f \bar{\in} L^{p}(0,+\infty)(p>0, p \neq 2)$, just note that for non-negative continuous functions, (L) integrability and generalized (R) integrability are equivalent, and $\begin{aligned}& \int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{p} dx=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{dx}{x^{p/2}(1+|\ln x|)^{p}} \\= & \int_{0}^{1} \frac{dx}{x^{p/2}(1-\ln x)^{p}}+\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{dx}{x^{p/2}(1+\ln x)^{p}} \\= & I_{1}+I_{2},\end{aligned}$ according to Cauchy's test for convergence of the generalized (R) integral, integral $I_{1}$ converges while $I_{2}$ diverges, therefore $\int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{p} dx$ diverges, i.e., $f \notin L^{p}(0,+\infty)$.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=x^{-1 / 2}(1+|\ln x|)^{-1}$， 则  f  是$(0，+\infty)$上的非负连续函数， 从而也是非负可测函数。因为$\begin{aligned}\int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{2} d x & = \int_{0}^{+\infty} x^{-1}(1+|\ln x|)^{-2} d x \\& =\int_{0}^{1} \frac{d x}{x(1-\ln x)^{2}}+\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{d x}{x(1+\ln x)^{2}}=2，\end{aligned}$所以 $f \in L^{2}(0，+\infty)$。为证  $f \bar{\in} L^{p}(0，+\infty)(p>0， p \neq 2) $， 只要注意， 对于非负连续函数而言，(L)可积性与广义(R)可积性是等价的，而$\begin{aligned}& \int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{p} d x=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{d x}{x^{p / 2}(1+|\ln x|)^{p}} \\= & \int_{0}^{1} \frac{d x}{x^{p / 2}(1-\ln x)^{p}}+\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{d x}{x^{p / 2}(1+\ln x)^{p}} \\= & I_{1}+I_{2}，\end{aligned}$据广义  (R)  积分的 Cauchy 判别法，积分$I_{1}$ 收敛而$I_{2}$发散， 从而$\int_{0}^{+\infty}|f(x)|^{p} d x $ 发散， 即  $f \notin L^{p}(0，+\infty)$。

statement: There exists a non-measurable function on $[0,1] \times[0,1]$ for which one (L) iterated integral exists and the other does not.
chinese_statement: 存在$[0，1] \times[0，1]$  上的一个不可测函数， 它的一个  (L)  累次积分存在而另一个不存在。
rationale:
Constructing this example requires the assumption of the continuum. According to the assumption of the continuum, the points in [0,1] correspond one-to-one with first and second type ordinals: $a_{1}, a_{2}, a_{3}, \cdots, a_{\omega}, a_{\omega+1}, \cdots, a_{\xi}, \cdots$ (1). Choose a non-measurable set A in the interval [0,1] on the x-axis, and use A to form a set in $R^{2}$: $E=\{(x, y): x \in A$, where in (1) x is before y, $0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1, 0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1\}$. Define the function f on $[0,1] 	imes[0,1]$: $f(x, y)=\left\{ egin{array}{l}1, (x, y) \in E, \0, (x, y) 
otin E,\end{array}ight.$.(i) Calculation of $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x, y_{0}ight) d x $. Choose any $y_{0} \in[0,1]$, and assume in (1) that $ y_{0}=a_{\mu}$. There are only countably many before $y_{0}$. By the definition of $f(x, y)$, $f\left(x, y_{0}ight)$ is equal to 0 except at countably many points, so $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x, y_{0}ight) d x=0$, hence $\int_{0}^{1} d y \int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d x=0$.(ii) Calculation of $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}, yight) d y$. a) Case where $x_{0} \in A$. Assume in (1) that $x_{0}=a_{
u}$. If $\left(x_{0}, yight) \in E$, then the number of y in (1) $>
u$; conversely, the number of y in (1) $<
u$. Therefore, $f( x_{0}, y)$ is equal to 1 except at countably many points. That is $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}, yight) d y=1$. b) Case of $x_{0}$ with A. According to the definition of E, no y makes $\left(x_{0}, yight)$ belong to E. Hence, by the definition of $f\left(x_{0}, yight)$, $ f\left(x_{0}, yight)=0$, so $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}, yight) d y=0$. Therefore, $\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y$ becomes the characteristic function of the non-measurable set A, so $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y$ does not exist.(iii) $f(x, y)$ is non-measurable on $[0,1] 	imes[0,1]$. In fact, if not, f is a bounded measurable function on $[0,1] 	imes[0,1]$, thus it is (L) integrable on $[0,1] 	imes[0,1]$. Then, according to Fubini's theorem, both iterated integrals of f on $[0,1] 	imes[0,1]$ should exist and be equal. This is a contradiction.
chinese_rationale:
构造这个例子， 需要连续统的假设。 根据连续统的假设，  [0，1] 中的点一一对应于第一、二类序数: $a_{1}， a_{2}， a_{3}， \cdots， a_{\omega}， a_{\omega+1}， \cdots， a_{\xi }， \cdots$ (1)。 在  x  轴的区间  [0，1]  中取不可测集  A ， 用  A  作  $R^{2}$  中的集: $E=\{(x， y): x \in A $， 在 (1) 中  x  位于  y  前面，$0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1，0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1\} $。并在$[0，1] 	imes[0，1]$  上定义函数  f  :$f(x， y)=\left\{ egin{array}{l}1，(x， y) \in E， \0，(x， y)  ar{E}，\end{array}ight.$。(i)  $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x， y_{0}ight) d x $ 的计算。任取  $y_{0} \in[0，1]$ ， 设在（1）中， $ y_{0}=a_{\mu}$ 。 在  $y_{0}$  前面的只有可数个。 由  $f(x， y)$  的定义，  $f\left(x， y_{0}ight) $ 除可数个点外等于 0 ， 所以$\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x， y_{0}ight) d x=0$，从而$\int_{0}^{1} d y \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$。(ii)  $\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}， yight) d y$  的计算。a)  $x_{0} \in A$  的情形。 设在  (1)  中，  $x_{0}=a_{
u }$ 。 若  $\left(x_{0}， yight) \in E$ ， 则  y  在 (1) 中的号码  $>

u$ 。 所以  $f( x_{0}， y) $ 除可数个点外等于 1。 即$\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}， yight) d y=1$ 。b)  $x_{0}$  与  A  的情形。 根据  E  的定义，任何  y  都不使  $\left(x_{0}， yight)$  属于 E。于是由  $f\left(x_{0}， yight) $ 的定义， $ f\left(x_{0}， yight)=0$ ， 所以$\int_{0}^{1} f\left(x_{0}， yight) d y=0 $。因此，  $\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$  成了不可测集  A  的特征函数， 所以  $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$  不存在。(iii)  $f(x， y)$  在  $[0，1] 	imes[0，1]$  上是不可测的。事实上，如若不然，则  f  是  $[0，1] 	imes[0，1]$  上的有界可测函数，从而它在  $[0，1] 	imes[0，1]$  上是  (L)  可积的。 于是， 据 Fubini 定理，  f 在  $[0，1] 	imes[0，1]$  上的两个累次积分均应存在而且相等。 此为矛盾。

statement: There exists a divergent series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, such that for every $k \geqslant 2$, the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{k}^{n}$ converges.
chinese_statement: 存在一个发散级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ ， 使对每一$k \geqslant 2$ ， 级数 $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{k}{ }^{n}$都收敛。
rationale: Let $a_{n}=1 / n \ln n$, then the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n \ln n}$ diverges. For every $k \geqslant 2$, the series $\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{k^{n}}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k^{n} n \ln {k}}$ converges.
chinese_rationale: 令 $a_{n}=1 / n \ln n $， 则级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n \ln n}$发散对每一$k \geqslant 2$ ， 级数$\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} a_{k^{n}}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k^{n} n \ln {k}}$收敛。

statement: There exists an absolutely continuous function f such that $\mid f\mid ^{p}(0<p<\mathrm{I})$ is not an absolutely continuous function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个绝对连续函数  f ， 使$\mid f\mid ^{p}(0<p<\mathrm{I})$  不是绝对连续函数。
rationale: For example, let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{2} \cos (\pi / 2 x), & 0<x \leqslant 1, \\ 0, & x=0, \end{array}\right.$ then f is an absolutely continuous function on [0, 1]. However, $|f|^{1 / 2}$ is not absolutely continuous on [0, 1].
chinese_rationale: 例如， 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{2} \cos (\pi  / 2 x)， & 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.$则  f  是  [0，1]上的埩对连续函数。 然而， $|f|^{1 / 2}$ 在  [0，1]  上并不绝对连续。

statement: There exist functions that are finite everywhere but locally unbounded everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在处处有限而又处处局部无界的函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}n, & x=m / n \text { where } m \text { and } n \text { are coprime integers, n>0}, \\0, & x \text { is irrational, }\end{array}\right.$ then f is defined at every point $x_{0} \in R^{1}$ and the function value at that point is finite. However, f is not locally bounded at point $x_{0}$. In fact, if there exists some neighborhood $N\left(x_{0}, \delta\right)$ of $x_{0}$ such that f is bounded on it, then the denominators n of all m / n within $N\left(x_{0}, \delta\right)$ are bounded, and thus the numerators m will also be bounded. But this would only allow finitely many rational numbers in the neighborhood $N\left(x_{0}, \delta\right)$, which contradicts the dense nature of all rational numbers in $R^{1}$. Therefore, f cannot be bounded on $N\left(x_{0}, \delta\right)$:
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}n， & x=m / n \text { 此处 } m \text { 和 } n \text { 是互质的整数， n>0} ， \\0， & x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$则  f  在每一点  $x_{0} \in R^{1}$  都有定义， 且在该点的函数值有限。 然而，  f 在点  $x_{0}$  并不局部有界。 事实上， 假若存在  $x_{0}$  的某个邻域  $N\left(x_{0}\right. ，  \delta  )$， 使得  f  在其上是有界的， 则  $N\left(x_{0}， \delta\right)$  内全体  m / n  的分母  n  有界，从而分子m也将有界。但是这只能许可有限多个有理数在领域$N\left(x_{0}， \delta\right) $内，这与有理数全体在$R^{1}$内稠密的性质发生矛盾。因此，  f  在  $N\left(x_{0}， \delta\right) $ 上不可能是有界的:

statement: There exists a sequence of functions that converges in measure but not uniformly almost everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在测度收敛而非近一致收敛的函数序列。
rationale: For example, let $E=[0, +\infty)$, define $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in\left[n, n+\frac{1}{n}\right], \\0, x \in E \backslash\left[n, n+\frac{1}{n}\right],\end{array}\right.$ then $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges in measure to $f\equiv 0$ on E. However, it does not converge uniformly almost everywhere to f on E (see Example 2).
chinese_rationale: 例如， 设$E=[0，+\infty) $， 命$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in\left[n， n+\frac{1}{n}\right]， \\0， x \in E \backslash\left[n， n+\frac{1}{n}\right]，\end{array}\right.$则  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上依测度收敛于$f\equiv 0$。但是， 它在  E  上并不近一致收敛于 f  (参看例 2)。

statement: There exists an increasing sequence of simple functions that converges to a limit function which is not a simple function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个收敛的递增的简单函数序列， 其极限函数不是简单函数。
rationale: Let $I=(0,1), I_{1}=\left(0, \frac{1}{2}\right], I_{2}=\left(\frac{1}{2}, \frac{3}{4}\right], \cdots, I_{n}=\left(\frac{2^{n}-2}{2^{n}}, \frac{2^{n}-1}{2^{n}}\right), \cdots,$ then $I=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} I_{k}$. Define the sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on (0,1) as follows: $\begin{array}{l}f_{1}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in I_{1}, \\0, x \in I \backslash I_{1},\end{array}\right. \\f_{2}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in I_{1}, \\\frac{1}{2}, x \in I_{2}, \\0, x \in I \backslash\left(I_{1} \cup I_{2}\right),\end{array}\right. \\f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in I_{1}, \\\frac{1}{2}, x \in I_{2}, \\\cdots \cdots, \\\frac{1}{n}, x \in I_{n}, \\0, x \in I \backslash \bigcup_{k=1}^{n} I_{k},\end{array}\right. \\\text {.............. } \\\end{array}$ It is evident that for every $n, f_{n}$ is a simple function on (0,1), and $f_{n}(x) \leqslant f_{n+1}(x), n=1,2, \cdots$. However, $f(x)=\lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)$ on $(0,1)=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} I_{k}$ takes countably many different values, so it is not a simple function on (0,1).
chinese_rationale: 设$I=(0，1)， I_{1}=\left(0， \frac{1}{2}\right]， I_{2}=\left(\frac{1}{2}， \frac{3}{4}\right] ，， \cdots， I_{n}=\left(\frac{2^{n}-2}{2^{n}}， \frac{2^{n}-1}{2^{n}}\right)， \cdots，$则  $I=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} I_{k} $。 在  (0，1)  上定义函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$如下:$\begin{array}{l}f_{1}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in I_{1}， \\0， x \in I \backslash I_{1}，\end{array}\right. \\f_{2}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in I_{1}， \\\frac{1}{2}， x \in I_{2}， \\0， x \in I \backslash\left(I_{1} \cup I_{2}\right)，\end{array}\right. \\f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in I_{1}， \\\frac{1}{2}， x \in I_{2}， \\\cdots \cdots， \\\frac{1}{n}， x \in I_{n}， \\0， x \in I \backslash \bigcup_{k=1}^{n} I_{k}，\end{array}\right. \\\text {.............. } \\\end{array}$易见， 对每一  $n， f_{n} $ 都是  (0，1)  上的简单函数， 且$f_{n}(x) \leqslant f_{n+1}(x)， n=1，2， \cdots$ 。但 $ f(x)=\lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) $ 在  $(0，1)=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} I_{k} $上有可数多个不同的值， 所以它不是  (0，1)  上的简单函数。

statement: An (R) integrable function f does not necessarily make $g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$ differentiable everywhere.
chinese_statement: 一个  (R)  可积函数  f ， 一定使$g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} f(t) d t$  处处可微。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\operatorname{sgn} x$, then f is discontinuous only at $x=0$, so it is (R) integrable on any finite interval. Moreover, $g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} \operatorname{sgn} t d t=|x|$, hence g is not differentiable at $x=0$.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=\operatorname{sgn} x$， 则  f  仅在$x=0$ 处不连续， 所以它在任何有限区间上都是 (R)可积的， 又：$g(x)=\int_{0}^{x} \operatorname{sgn} t d t=|x|$，故  g  在  x=0  处不可微。

statement: There exists the characteristic function of an $F_{\sigma }$ set that is not a first class function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个$F_{\sigma }$型集的特征函数，它不是第一类函数。
rationale: As is well known, the characteristic function of a bounded closed set is a first-class function. However, the characteristic function of an $F_{\sigma }$ set does not have to be a first-class function. To illustrate this statement, we define a function $\varphi$ on the interval [0,1] as follows: $\varphi(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number, }\end{array}\right.$ then $\varphi$ cannot be the limit of a sequence of continuous functions, so it is not a first-class function. However, if we write all rational numbers in [0,1] as $r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}, \cdots,$ and set $ \varphi_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k-1}^{n}, \\a, x \in[0,1] \backslash\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n},\end{array}\right.$ since $\varphi(x)$ is the limit function of $\varphi_{n}(x)$ as $n \rightarrow \infty $, it belongs to the second class. Because the set of rational numbers is countable, it is an $F_{\sigma }$ set. Therefore, the characteristic function of an $F_{\sigma }$ set does not have to be a first-class function; it can be a second-class function.
chinese_rationale: 如所周知， 有界闭集的特往函数是第一类的函数。然而，$F_{\sigma }$型集的特征函数不必是第一类的函数。为说明这一陈述， 我们在区间  [0，1]  上如下定义函数$\varphi$: $\varphi(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$则$\varphi$不可能是连续函数序列的极限， 所以它不是第一类的函数。 但是， 如果我们将  [0，1]  中所有的有理数写成$r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}， \cdots，$并设$ \varphi_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k-1}^{n}， \\a， x \in[0，1] \backslash\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n}，\end{array}\right.$因为$\varphi(x)$  是  $\varphi_{n}(x) $ 当  $n \rightarrow \infty $ 时的极限函数， 所以它属于第二类。因为有理数集是可数的， 所以它是一个$F_{\sigma }$型的集。由此可知，$F_{\sigma }$型集的特征函数不必是第一类的函数，它可能是第二类的函数。

statement: There exists a function f for which $\lim _{p \rightarrow+\infty}|f|_{L^{p}(E)}=|f|_{L^{\infty}(E)}$ does not hold.
chinese_statement: 存在使$\lim _{p \rightarrow+\infty}|f|_{L^{p}(E)}=|f|_{L^{\infty}(E)}$不成立的函数  f 。
rationale: For example, let $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left[n, n + \frac{1}{n}\right]$ define the function f on $R^{1}$ as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in A, \\0, x \in R^{1} \backslash A,\end{array}\right.$ Then when $p<+\infty$, we have $\left\{||f \|_{L^{p}\left(R^{1}\right)}=\left\{\int_{A} d x\right\}^{1 / p}=(m A)^{1 / p}=\left(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\frac{1}{n}\right)^{1 / p}=+\infty.\right.$ But $ \|f\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbf{R}^{1}\right)}=1$, so $\lim _{p \rightarrow+\infty}\|f\|_{L^{p}\left(R^{1}\right)} \neq\|f\|_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)}$.
chinese_rationale: 例如，令$A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left[n， n + \frac{1}{n}\right]$在 $R^{1}$上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in A， \\0， x \in R^{1} \backslash A，\end{array}\right.$则当  $p<+\infty $ 时， 有$\left\{||f \|_{L^{p}\left(R^{1}\right)}=\left\{\int_{A} d x\right\}^{1 / p}=(m A)^{1 / p}=\left(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\frac{1}{n}\right)^{1 / p}=+\infty 。\right.$但$ \|f\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbf{R}^{1}\right)}=1$ ， 所以$\lim _{p \rightarrow+\infty}\|f\|_{L^{p}\left(R^{1}\right)} \neq\|f\|_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)}$。

statement: There exists a set with Borel measure zero that contains a non-Borel measurable set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个 Borel测度为零的集， 其中含有非 Borel 可测集。
rationale: Let E be a Cantor set in [0,1] with positive measure. Define $f(x)=\frac{m\left(\left[0, x] \cap\left([0,1] \backslash E\right)\right)\right.}{m\left([0,1] \backslash E\right)}, \quad 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1,$ then f is a homeomorphism from [0,1] to [0,1], and $m f(E)=0$. Since f is a strictly increasing continuous function on [0,1], it maps open intervals $(\alpha, \beta)$ in [0,1] to open intervals $(f(\alpha), f(\boldsymbol{\beta}))$, it follows that $f(E)$ is also a perfect null set, thus it is Borel measurable with Borel measure zero. Let N be a non-measurable subset of E in the Lebesgue sense, and let $L=f(N)$, then $L\cap f(E)$. It can be proven that L is not Borel measurable. In fact, if L were Borel measurable, then since $f^{-1}$ is a continuous function from [0,1] to [0,1], it would map the Borel measurable set L in [0,1] into a Borel measurable set $N=f^{-1}(L)$, so N would also be Lebesgue measurable, which is a contradiction. Therefore, L is not a Borel measurable set.
chinese_rationale: 设  E  是  [0，1]  中具有正测度的 Cantor 集， 令$f(x)=\frac{m\left(\left[0， x] \cap\left([0，1] \backslash E\right)\right)\right.}{m\left([0，1] \backslash E\right)}， \quad 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1，$则  f  是  [0，1]  到  [0，1]  上的一个同胚映射， 且$  m f(E)=0 $。因为f在[0，1]上是严格递增的连续函数，所有f映[0，1]中的开区间$(\alpha， \beta) $为开区间$(f(\alpha)， f(\boldsymbol{\beta}))$ ，由叫可知，$f(E)$也是一个完备疏集，从而它是Borel可测的，且f(E)的Borel测度为零。设  N  是  E  的依 Lebesgue 意义 下的不可测子集， 令 $L=f(F)$ ，则$L\cap f(E)$。可以证明，L不是Borel可测集。事实上，假若L是Borel可测集，则由于 $f^{-1}$ 是  [0，1]  到  [0，1]  上的连续函数，因而它把  [0，1]  中的 Bore1 可测集  L映成Borel 可测集$N=f^{-1}(L)$，从而  N  也是 Lebesgue 可测集， 这是矛盾的。因此，  L 不是 Borel 可测集。

statement: There exists a set whose derivative set up to (n-1) is non-empty, while the derivative set of order n is an empty set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个集， 它的直到  n-1  阶导集非空， 而  n  阶导集是空集。
rationale: When $n=\mathbf{2}$, the set of points $E_{1}=\{0,1,1 / 2, \cdots, 1 / n, \cdots\}$ on the line satisfies this condition. In this case, $E_{1}^{\prime}=\{0\}$, $E_{1}^{\prime \prime}=\varnothing$. When $n=3$, we can construct the corresponding set $E_{2}$. For example, for each number of the form $\frac{1}{i}$ (where i is a natural number), construct the sequence $\left\{\frac{1}{k}+\frac{1}{i}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$, which converges to $\frac{1}{i}$. Hence, the set composed of points of the form $\frac{1}{k}+\frac{1}{i}(k \geqslant 1, i \geqslant 1)$ along with number 0 is the desired set $E_{2}$. In fact, the set $E_{1}$ is the derivative set of $E_{2}$: $E_{2}^{\prime}=E_{1}$, thus $E_{2}^{\prime \prime}=E_{1}^{\prime} =\{0\}$, $B_{2}^{\prime n}=\varnothing$. For $n>3$, a similar set $E_{n-1}$ can be constructed. Generally, for any $n>2$, the set $E_{n-1}$ composed of points of the form $\frac{1}{i_{1}}+\frac{1}{i_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{i_{k}}$ and the number 0 satisfies the required condition, where $1 \leqslant k<\pi$, and the denominators $i_{1}$, $i_{2}$, $\cdots$, $i_{k}$ each range over the set of natural numbers. In fact, it's easy to see $E_{n-1}^{\prime}=E_{n-2}$, from which by induction we get $E_{n-1}^{(n-1)}=\{0\}$, $E_{n-1}^{(n)} =\varnothing$.
chinese_rationale: 当  $n=\mathbf{2}$  时， 直线上的点集$E_{1}=\{0，1，1 / 2， \cdots， 1 / n， \cdots\}$满兄这个条件， 此时  $E_{1}^{\prime}=\{0\}， E_{1}^{\prime \prime}=\varnothing$ 。当  $n=3$  时， 我们可以作出相应的集  $E_{2}$ 。 例：对每个形如  $\frac{1}{i}$ 的数 (  i  是自然数)，作序列  $\left\{\frac{1}{k}+\frac{1}{i}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$ ， 该序列收敛于  $\frac{1}{i}$ 。 于是，一切形如  $\frac{1}{k}+\frac{1}{i}(k \geqslant 1， i \geqslant 1)$  的点再加上数 0 所组成之集就是所求的集  $E_{2}$ 。 事实上，集  $E_{1}$  是集  $E_{2}$  的导集：  $E_{2}^{\prime}=E_{1}$ ， 因此  $E_{2}^{\prime \prime}=E_{1}^{\prime}   =\{0\}， B_{2}^{\prime n}=\varnothing$ 。当  $n>3$  付可类似地作出集  $E_{n-1}$ 。 一般地，对任意  $n>2$ ， 由一切形如  $\frac{1}{i_{1}}+\frac{1}{i_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{i_{k}}$  的点和数 0 所组成之集  $E_{n-1}$  满足要求的条件， 其中  $1 \leqslant k<\pi$ ， 而分母  $i_{1}， i_{2}， \cdots， i_{k}$  各自走遍自然数集。 事实上， 容易看出  $E_{n-1}^{\prime}=E_{n-2}$ ， 由此按归纳法得到  $E_{n-1}^{(n-1)}=\{0\}， E_{n-1}^{(n)}   =\varnothing$ 。

statement: There exists a strictly increasing absolutely continuous function that maps a set with positive measure to a set with zero measure.
chinese_statement: 存在一个严格递增的绝对连续函数，它把某个测度大于零映成测度等于零的集。
rationale: Let E be the Cantor set in [0,1] with positive measure, and let $\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)(i=1, 2, \cdots)$ be all the adjacent intervals of E. Define $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{i}\right) & \left(\beta_{i}-x\right), x \in\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right), i=1,2, \cdots, \\0, & x \in E.\end{array}\right.f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} g(t) dt $. We now prove that f is a strictly increasing absolutely continuous function on [0,1]. In fact, since f is the indefinite integral of the (L) integrable function g, it is absolutely continuous. To prove that f is strictly increasing on [0,1], we take any two points $ x_{1}$ and $ x_{2}$ in [0,1], and assume $x_{1}>x_{2}$. (i) If $x_{1}, x_{2}$ belong to a certain adjacent interval $\left(\alpha_{k}, B_{k}\right)$, since the continuous function g takes positive values in $\left(\alpha_{k}, \beta_{k}\right)$, we have $f\left(x_{1}\right)-f\left(x_{2}\right)=\int_{x_{2}}^{x_{1}} g(t) dt>0 $. (ii) If $x_{1}, x_{2}$ do not belong to any adjacent interval, according to the construction of the Cantor set, there must exist an adjacent interval $\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)$ such that $\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right) \subset\left(x_{2}, x_{1}\right)$. Since g is non-negative and continuous, and takes positive values in $\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)$, we have $f\left(x_{1}\right)-f\left(x_{2}\right)=\int_{x_{2}}^{x_{1}} g(t) dt \geqslant \int_{\alpha_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) dt>0$. This proves that f is strictly increasing on [0,1]. Finally, we need to prove that f maps the set E with positive measure to a set with zero measure. Note the following equalities hold: $\begin{aligned}{[0,1]=} & E \cup\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right\}, \quad E \cap\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right\}=\varnothing. \\ f([0,1])= & f(E) \cup f\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right) \\= & f(E) \cup\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right)\right\}; \\ & f(E) \cap\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right)\right\}=\varnothing, \\ & f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right) \cap f\left(\left(\alpha_{j}, \beta_{j}\right)\right)=\varnothing(i \neq j).\end{aligned}$ Because f is absolutely continuous, it maps measurable sets to measurable sets. Thus, by the complete additivity of the measure, we get $mf([0,1])=mf(E)+\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} mf\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right)$. (1) Since f is strictly increasing on [0,1], we have $\begin{aligned} & m f([0,1])=m[f(0), f(1)]=f(1)-f(0) \\= & \int_{0}^{1} g(t) dt=\int_{E} g(t) dt+\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{a_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) dt \\= & \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{a_{i}}^{a_{i}} g(t) dt. \\(2) & \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} mf\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(f\left(\beta_{i}\right) - f\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right) \\= & \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{\alpha_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) dt. (3)\end{aligned}$ By comparing equations (2) and (3), we get $mf([0,1])=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} mf\left(\left(\alpha_{i}, \beta_{i}\right)\right)$. Therefore, from equation (1), we can conclude that $mf(E)=0$. That is, f maps the set E with positive measure to a set $f(E)$ with zero measure.
chinese_rationale: 设  E  为  [0，1]  中具有正测度的 Canter 集， 又设 $\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)(i=1 ，  2， \cdots)$  为  E  的全体邻接区间，令$g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-\alpha_{i}\right) & \left(\beta_{i}-x\right)， x \in\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)， i=1，2， \cdots， \\0， & x \in E 。\end{array}\right.f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} g(t) d t $。兹证，f在[0，1]上是严格递增的绝对连续函数。事实上，由于f是  (L)  可积函数  g  的不定积分， 因而它是绝对连续的。 为证  f  在  [0，1]  上是严格递增的， 我们在  [0， 1]  任取两点 $ x_{1}$  及 $ x_{2}$ ， 并设  $x_{1}>x_{2}$。(i) 若  $x_{1}， x_{2}$  同属于某个邻接区间  $\left(\alpha_{k}， B_{k}\right)$ ，则因连续函数  g 在  $\left(\alpha_{k}， \beta_{k}\right)$  内恒取正值，故有$f\left(x_{1}\right)-f\left(x_{2}\right)=\int_{x_{2}}^{x_{1}} g(t) d t>0 $\text { 。 }(ii)若  $x_{1}， x_{2}$ 不属于某个邻接区间，则据Cantor集的构造，一定存在某个邻接区间  $\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right) $， 使  $\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right) \subset\left(x_{2}， x_{1}\right)$ 。 由于  g 非负而且连续， 又在  $\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)$ 内恒取正值， 因而$f\left(x_{1}\right)-f\left(x_{2}\right)=\int_{x_{2}}^{x_{1}} g(t) d t \geqslant \int_{\alpha_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) d t>0$ 。这就证明了  f  在  [0，1]  上是严格递增的。最后，我们要证明f把正测度集E映成零测度集。我们注意，下列等式均成立:$\begin{aligned}{[0，1]=} & E \cup\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right\}， \quad E \cap\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right\}=\varnothing . \\f([0，1])= & f(E) \cup f\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right) \\= & f(E) \cup\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right)\right\} ; \\& f(E) \cap\left\{\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty} f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right)\right\}=\varnothing， \\& f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right) \cap f\left(\left(\alpha_{j}， \beta_{j}\right)\right)=\varnothing(i \neq j) .\end{aligned}$因为  f  绝对连续， 所以它把可测集咉成可测集。 于是， 由测度的完全可加性得到$m f([0，1])=m f(E)+\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} m f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right)$ 。(1)又因为  f  在  [0，1]  上是严格递增的， 所以$\begin{aligned}& m f([0，1])=m[f(0)， f(1)]=f(1)-f(0) \\= & \int_{0}^{1} g(t) d t=\int_{E} g(t) d t+\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{a_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) d t \\= & \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{a_{i}}^{a_{i}} g(t) d t 。 \\(2)& \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} m f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(f\left(\beta_{i}\right)--f\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right) \\= & \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \int_{\alpha_{i}}^{\beta_{i}} g(t) d t 。(3)\end{aligned}$比较(2)，(3)两式，就得到$m f([0，1])=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} m f\left(\left(\alpha_{i}， \beta_{i}\right)\right)$ 。于是， 再由 (1)式可知，  $m f(E)=0$ 。 即  f  把正测度集  E  映成零测度集 $f(E)$ 。

statement: There exists a uniformly convergent sequence of differentiable functions whose sequence of derivatives' limit is not equal to the derivative of the limit function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个一致收敛的可微函数序列，其导函数序列的极限不等于极限函数的导数。
rationale: Consider the function sequence $f_{\mathrm{n}}(x)=\frac{1}{n} \operatorname{arctg} x^{n}, -\infty<x<\infty, n=1,2,\cdots,$. Clearly, for any $ x \in(-\infty,+\infty) $, we have $\left|f_{n}(x)-0\right|=\left|\frac{1}{n} \operatorname{arctg} x^{n}\right| \leqslant \frac{\pi}{2 n},$ so when $ n>\pi / 2\varepsilon$, there exists $\left|f_{n}(x)-0\right|<\varepsilon$. This shows that the function sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ uniformly converges to 0 over $ (-\infty,+\infty) $. On the other hand, we have $\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime}_{X=1}=0,\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}^{\prime}(1)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(\frac{x^{n-1}}{1+x^{2 n}}\right)_{x=1}=\frac{1}{2}$, thus, $\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime} \lim _{x=1} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}^{\prime}(1) $. It should be noted that if we add the condition that the sequence of derivatives $ \left\{f_{n}^{\prime}\right\}$ converges uniformly over the interval, then we must have $\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}^{\prime}(x)$. Thus, for such an example to exist, the limit of the sequence of derivatives cannot be uniform. We can construct a uniformly convergent sequence of infinitely differentiable functions whose limit function is nowhere differentiable. For example, let $s_{n}(x)=\sum_{k=0}^{n} b^{k} \cos \left(a^{k} \pi x\right),$ where $ 0<b<1,$ a is a positive odd number, and $a b>1-1-\frac{3}{2} \pi $, then for each $n, s_{n}(x) $ is infinitely differentiable over $R^{1}$ and $ \left\{s_{n}\right\}$ uniformly converges over $ R^{1}$ to some continuous function $s(x)$. However, the limit function $s(x)$ is nowhere differentiable over $R^{1}$.
chinese_rationale: 考虑函数序列$f_{\mathrm{n}}(x)=\frac{1}{n} \operatorname{arctg} x^{n}，-\infty<x<-1 \cdot \infty， n=1，2， \cdots，$显然， 对任何$ x \in(-\infty，+\infty) $， 都有$\left|f_{n}(x)-0\right|=\left|\frac{1}{n} \operatorname{arctg} x^{n}\right| \leqslant \frac{\pi}{2 n}，$因此当$ n>\pi / 2\varepsilon$时， 就存$\left|f_{n}(x)-0\right|<\varepsilon$ \text {。}由此可见，函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在 $ (-\infty，+\infty) $上一致收敛于 0 。另一方面，我们有$\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime}_{X=1}=0，\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}^{\prime}(1)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(\frac{x^{n-1}}{1+x^{2 n}}\right)_{x=1}=\frac{1}{2}$因此，$\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime} \lim _{x=1} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}^{\prime}(1) \text {。 }$应当注意，如果再加上条件：导函数序列$ \left\{f_{n}^{\prime}\right\}$ 在所论区间上一收收敛，那么必有$\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)\right)^{\prime}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}^{\prime}(x)$。因此，想要这种例子得以存在，导函数序列的极限就不能是一致的。我们可以构造一个一致收敛的无穷可微函数序列， 其极限函数无处可微。例如， 设$s_{n}(x)=\sum_{k=0}^{n} b^{k} \cos \left(a^{k} \pi x\right)，$此处$ 0<b<1，$ a  为一正奇数， 且$a b>1-1-\frac{3}{2} \pi $， 则对每一$n， s_{n}(x) $在  $R^{1}$  上无穷可微， 且 $ \left\{s_{n}\right\}$  在 $ R^{1}$  上一致收敛于某个连续函数$s(x)$。但是， 极限函数 $s(x)$在  $R^{1} $ 上无处可微。

statement: There exists an indeterminate form of complex-valued functions where L'Hospital's rule fails.
chinese_statement: 存在 L'Hospital 法则失效的复值函数的不定式。
rationale: Let $f(x)=x$, $g(x)=x+x^{2} e^{i / x^{2}}$, $0<x<1$. Since for all real numbers $i$, $\left|e^{i t}\right|=1$, it is easy to see $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x)}{g(x)}=1$ (1). On the other hand, $g^{\prime}(x)=1+\left(2 x-\frac{2 i}{x}\right) e^{i / x^{2}}, 0<x<1$, so $\left|g^{\prime}(x)\right| \geqslant\left|2 x-\frac{2 i}{x}\right|{-1 \geqslant\frac{2}{x}-1}$, thus obtaining $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f^{\prime}(x)}{g^{\prime}(x)}$ (2). From (1) and (2), it is known that for the indeterminate form of complex-valued functions, L'Hospital's rule no longer holds.
chinese_rationale: 设 $f(x)=x， g(x)=x+x^{2} e^{i / x^{2}}， 0<x<1 $， 目于对一切 实数  i ，都有  $\left|e^{i t}\right|=1$ ， 因而不难看出$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x)}{g(x)}=1$（1） 另一方面， 有$g^{\prime}(x)=1+\left(2 x-\frac{2 i}{x}\right) e^{i / x^{2}}， 0<x<1，$所以$\left|g^{\prime}(x)\right| \geqslant\left|2 x-\frac{2 i}{x}\right|{-1 \geqslant\frac{2}{x}-1，}$于是得到$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f^{\prime}(x)}{g^{\prime}(x)}$(2) 由(1)， (2)可知对复值函数不定式的定值问题， L'Hospital 法则不再成立。

statement: There exist two non-negative divergent sequences whose sum is a convergent sequence.
chinese_statement: 存在两个非负的发散序列， 其和却是一个收敛序列。
rationale: Consider the sequence $1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, \cdots$ and the sequence $0, \frac{1}{2}, 0, \frac{2}{3}, 0, \frac{3}{4}, \cdots$. Both sequences are divergent, but the sequence formed by adding their corresponding terms is $1, \frac{1}{2}, 1, \frac{2}{3}, 1, \frac{3}{4}, \cdots$, which is a convergent sequence.
chinese_rationale: 取序列  $1，0，1，0，1，0， \cdots$ 及序列  $0， \frac{1}{2}， 0， \frac{2}{3}， 0， \frac{3}{4}， \cdots$ ，这两个序列都发散，但其对应项相加所成之序列是$1， \frac{1}{2}， 1， \frac{2}{3}， 1， \frac{3}{4}， \cdots$，它是一个收敛序列。

statement: Given any convergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, a convergent sequence of positive numbers $\left\{c_{n}\right\}$, converging to zero, can be found such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$ also converges.
chinese_statement: 任给一个收敛的正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ ， 可以找到一个收敛于零的正数序列 $\left\{c_{n}\right\}$， 使 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$仍然收敛。
rationale: Let $r_{n}=\sum_{n=n+1}^{\infty} a_{k}$, $c_{n}=\sqrt{r_{n-1}}+\sqrt{r_{n}}$. Since the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges, we have $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} c_{n}=0$. We now prove that the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n} $ converges. To do this, let $s_{n}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{a_{k}}{c_{k}}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{r_{k-1}-r_{k}}{\sqrt{r_{k-1}}+\sqrt{r_{k}}}=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left(\sqrt{r_{k-1}}-\sqrt{r_{k}}\right) $. Then, when $n>m$, $\begin{array}{r}\left|s_{n}-s_{m}\right|=\sum_{k=m+1}^{n}\left(\sqrt{r_{k-1}}-\sqrt{r_{k}}\right)=\sqrt{r_{m}}-\sqrt{r_{n}} \rightarrow 0 \\(m, n \rightarrow \infty).\end{array}$ According to the Cauchy convergence criterion, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$ converges. Note: This example particularly proves that no matter how a positive series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges, there will always be a positive series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$ that converges more slowly.
chinese_rationale: 令 $r_{n}=\sum_{n=n+1}^{\infty} a_{k}， c_{n}=\sqrt{r_{n-1}}+\sqrt{r_{n}} $， 因为级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  收敛，故有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} c_{n}=0$。兹证级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n} $ 收敛。 为此， 令$s_{n}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{a_{k}}{c_{k}}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{r_{k-1}-r_{k}}{\sqrt{r_{k-1}}+\sqrt{r_{k}}}=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\left(\sqrt{r_{k-1}}-\sqrt{r_{k}}\right) $， 则当 $n>m$  时$\begin{array}{r}\left|s_{n}-s_{m}\right|=\sum_{k=m+1}^{n}\left(\sqrt{r_{k-1}}-\sqrt{r_{k}}\right)=\sqrt{r_{m}}-\sqrt{r_{n}} \rightarrow 0 \\(m， n \rightarrow \infty) 。\end{array}$据 Cauchy 收敛准则， 知级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$ 收敛。注: 这个例子特别证明了无论一个正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ 怎样地收敛， 总会有一个正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} / c_{n}$比它收敛得更慢。

statement: There exists a subset Q of real numbers with cardinality less than the continuum such that for any real number a, there is an $x \in Q$ that makes $x+a$ a rational number.
chinese_statement: 存在势小于连续统的实数子集 Q ， 对任意实数  a ， 都存在  $x \in Q， x+a$ 为有理数。
rationale: Let Q be a subset of real numbers, and $\bar{\bar{Q}}=\mu<\kappa$, S is the set of numbers of the form r-x, where r is a rational number and $x \in Q$. Thus, $\bar{\bar{S}}<\kappa$, so there exists a real number a such that $a \notin \mathrm{S}$. The number $x+a(x \in Q)$ must be irrational, because if x+a is rational, letting $x+a =r$ would lead to a contradiction as $a=r-x \in S$.
chinese_rationale: 设  Q  为一实数子集， 且  $\bar{\bar{Q}}=\mu<\kappa$， S  表形如  r-x  的数的全体， 其中  r  是有理数而 $ x \in Q $。 于是，  $\bar{\bar{S}}<\kappa$， 故存在实数  a ， 使  $a \notin \mathrm{S}$ 。数  $x+a(x \in Q)$  定然是无理数， 因为假若  x+a  是有理数， 令  $x+a   =r$ ， 则将导致  $a=r-x \in S$  的矛盾。

statement: There exists a non-negative (L) measurable function f on $R^{\prime}$, such that for any interval $(a, b) (a<b)$ and $r \in R^{\prime}$, it always holds that $\begin{array}{l}\quad \boldsymbol{m}\{(\boldsymbol{a}, \boldsymbol{b}) \cap\{\boldsymbol{x}: \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) \geqslant \boldsymbol{r}\}\}>\boldsymbol{0}, \\\text { but } \int_{\pi^{\prime}} f(x) d x \neq+\infty 。\end{array}$
chinese_statement: 存在$R^{\prime}$  上的一个非负 (L) 可测函数  f ， 使对任何区间$(a， b)  (a<b)$  及  $r \in R^{\prime}$ ， 恒有$\begin{array}{l}\quad \boldsymbol{m}\{(\boldsymbol{a}， \boldsymbol{b}) \cap\{\boldsymbol{x}: \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) \geqslant \boldsymbol{r}\}\}>\boldsymbol{0}， \\\text { 但 } \int_{\pi^{\prime}} f(x) d x \neq+\infty 。\end{array}$
rationale: The following example is given by Henke1. Let $\left\{r_{n}\right)_{n-1}^{+\infty} $ be all rational numbers in $R^{1}$, define the sequence of functions $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\mathbf{n}}\right\}$ on $R^{1}$ as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-r_{n}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}, & x \in\left(r_{m}, r_{h}+1\right), \\0, & x \bar{\in}\left(r_{n}, r_{n}+1\right) 。\end{array}\right.$ Let $f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{f_{n}(x)}{2^{n}}$, then f is a non-negative (L) measurable function on $R^{1}$. It is easy to see that for any interval $(a, b)$ and $r>0$, there exists a rational number $q \in (a, b)$ and some real number c, such that $(q, c) \subset (q, q+1)$, and on $(q, c)$, $f(x) \geqslant r$. Thus, $m\{(a, b) \cap\{x: f(x) \geqslant r\}\}>0 $. However, it can be calculated that $\int_{R^{1}} f(x) d x=2$.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例了是由 Henke1作出的。设 $\left\{r_{n}\right)_{n-1}^{+\infty} $为  $R^{1}$  中的全体有理数， 在$  R^{1} $ 上定义函数序列$ \left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{\mathbf{n}}\right\}$ 如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x-r_{n}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}， & x \in\left(r_{m}， r_{h}+1\right)， \\0， & x \bar{\in}\left(r_{n}， r_{n}+1\right) 。\end{array}\right.$令$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{f_{n}(x)}{2^{n}}$则  f  是  $R^{1} $ 上的非负  (L)  可测函数，易见，对任何区间$ (a， b)$  及 $ r>0 $ ，存在有理数$q\in(a，b)$及某个实数c，使得$(q， c)\subset (q， q+1)$，而且在  $(q， c)$  上  $f(x) \geqslant r$ 。于是得到$m\{(a， b) \cap\{x: f(x) \geqslant r\}\}>0 $。但是，经过计算可得$\int_{R^{1}} f(x) d x=2$ 。

statement: There exists an infinitely differentiable function f on [0,1] such that \{x: f(x)=0\} is an uncountable sparse set.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  上的一个无穷可微函数f ， 使  $\{x: f(x)=0\}$  为不可数的疏集。
rationale: The following example was made by Rehn and Kennedy. Let E be a complete sparse set in $[0,1]$, and $\left(a_{n}, b_{n}\right)(n=1,2, \cdots)$ be the adjacent intervals of E. Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}e^{-1} /\left(x-a_{n}\right)-1 /\left(b_{n}-x\right), & x \in\left(a_{n}, b_{n}\right), n=1,2, \cdots, \\0, & x \in E,\end{array}\right.$ then f is an infinitely differentiable function defined on [0,1], and $\{x: f(x)=0\}=E$ is an uncountable sparse set.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子是由 Rehn 和 Kennedy作出的。设  E  为  $[0，1]$  中的完备疏集，  $\left(a_{n}， b_{n}\right)(n=1，2， \cdots)$  为  E  的邻接区间，令$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}e^{-1} /\left(x-a_{n}\right)-1 /\left(b_{n}-x\right)， & x \in\left(a_{n}， b_{n}\right)， n=1，2， \cdots， \\0， & x \in E，\end{array}\right.$则  f  定  [0，1]  上的无穷可微函数，且  $\{x: f(x)=0\}=E $ 为一不可数的疏集。

statement: There exists a function whose Maclaurin series converges at only one point.
chinese_statement: 存在一个函数， 它的 Maclaurin 级数仅在一点收敘。
rationale: The function $f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n!} \cdot \frac{a^{-n}}{a^{-2 n}+x^{2}} \quad(a>1)$ is infinitely differentiable. Since every series obtained by successive differentiation involves the factor $ 1 / n! $, all these series converge uniformly. Therefore, $ f(x)$ is infinitely differentiable, and its Maclaurin series is $\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{k} e^{a^{2k-1}} x^{2 k}$. Obviously, for any $ x \neq 0 $, this series diverges; while at $x=0$, it converges to $ e^{a} $.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n!} \cdot \frac{a^{-n}}{a^{-2 n}+x^{2}} \quad(a>1)$是无穷可微的， 因为接连逐项微分得到的所有级数中都出现因子 $ 1 / n! $， 所以这些级数全都一致收敛， 因而 $ f(x)$  是无穷可微的， 它的 Maclaurin 级数是$\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}(-1)^{k} e^{a^{2k-1}} x^{2 k}$。显然，对于任意的 $ x \neq 0 $， 此级数发散; 而在  $x=0 $ 处， 它收敛于 $ e^{a} $。

statement: Given any function g with infinite total variation, a continuous function f can be constructed such that the integral $\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$ does not exist.
chinese_statement: 任给全变差为无穷大的函数 g， 可构造一个连续函 数  f ， 使  f 关于  g  的积分$\int_{a}^{b} f(x) d g(x)$  不存在。
rationale: Suppose g has infinite total variation on the closed interval [a, b]. If the interval [a, b] is halved, at least one of the subintervals will also have infinite total variation for g. Keep halving this subinterval, and continue in this manner. This method identifies a point c where g has infinite total variation in every neighborhood. For simplicity, let $c = b$. In this situation, it's easy to construct a monotonically increasing sequence $ \left\{a_{n}\right\}$ approaching b: $\begin{array}{l} a=a_{0}<a_{1}<\cdots<a_{n}<a_{n+1}<\cdots<b， \\\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}=b，\end{array}$ making the series $\sum_{i=0}^{\infty}|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right) |$ divergent. For this series, a sequence tending towards 0 can also be found $f_{i}>0(i=0，1 ，  2， \cdots $ such that the series $\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right|$ also diverges (see Chapter 5, Example 7). Now we construct the function f. For this, let $\begin{array}{l}f\left(a_{i}\right)=f_{i} \operatorname{sgn}\left[g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right]， i=0，1，2， \cdots， \\f(b)=0，\end{array}$ and within the interval $ \left(a_{i}， a_{1+1}\right) $, $f(x)$ is linear: $f(x)=f\left(a_{i}\right)+\frac{f\left(a_{i+1}\right)-f\left(a_{i}\right)}{a_{i+1}-a_{i}}\left(x-a_{i}\right)， i=0，1，2， \cdots$. Clearly, f is continuous on [a, b]. At the same time, due to the divergence of the series $\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right|$, as $n \rightarrow \infty$ , $\begin{aligned}\sigma_{n} & =\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(a_{i}\right)\left[g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right] \\& =\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right| \rightarrow+\infty(n \rightarrow \infty)，\end{aligned}$ thus the integral of f with respect to g does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 设  g  在闭区间  [a， b]  上的全变差为无穷大。 若将区间  [a， b]  平分， 则两个子区间中至少有一个使  g  的全变差亦为无穷大。将这个子区间又平分， 如此继续下゙去。用这样的方法确定出某一点  c ，g在它的每一邻域上的全变差都为无穷大。为简单起见， 设 $ c=b$ 。在这样的情况下容易作出一个单调递增的且趋近于  b  的数列 $ \left\{a_{n}\right\}$: $\begin{array}{l} a=a_{0}<a_{1}<\cdots<a_{n}<a_{n+1}<\cdots<b， \\\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}=b，\end{array}$使级数$\sum_{i=0}^{\infty}|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right) |$发散。对于这一级数， 又可求得一趋近于 0 的数列$f_{i}>0(i=0，1 ，  2， \cdots $， 使级数$\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right|$亦发散（参看第五章例 7)。 现在我们来构造函数  f 。为此， 令$\begin{array}{l}f\left(a_{i}\right)=f_{i} \operatorname{sgn}\left[g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right]， i=0，1，2， \cdots， \\f(b)=0，\end{array}$而在区间 $ \left(a_{i}， a_{1+1}\right) $ 内，  $f(x)$  是线性的:$f(x)=f\left(a_{i}\right)+\frac{f\left(a_{i+1}\right)-f\left(a_{i}\right)}{a_{i+1}-a_{i}}\left(x-a_{i}\right)， i=0，1，2， \cdots$ 。显然，  f  在  [a， b]  上是连续的。 同时，由于级数 $\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right|$ 发散的缘故， 当 $ n \rightarrow \infty$  时，$\begin{aligned}\sigma_{n} & =\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f\left(a_{i}\right)\left[g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right] \\& =\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} f_{i}\left|g\left(a_{i+1}\right)-g\left(a_{i}\right)\right| \rightarrow+\infty(n \rightarrow \infty)，\end{aligned}$所以  f  关于  g  的积分不存在。

statement: There exists a nowhere continuous function f, possessing the property $f(x-y)=f(x)+f(y)$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个无处连续函数  f ， 而具有性质  $f(x-y)=f(x)+f(y)$ 。
rationale: By utilizing the Hamel basis of the real numbers $R^{1}$ over the field of rationals, such a function can be constructed. A set $H \subset R^{1}$ is called a Hamel basis if for any $x \in R^{1}$, there exist rational numbers $\left\{a_{a}\right\}$ and $\left\{h_{\alpha}\right\} \subset H $ such that $x=\Sigma a_{a} h_{a}$, where the sum is finite and the representation is unique. It is easy to see that by multiplying each number in H by a non-zero real number, the resulting set is still a Hamel basis, so we can assume the Hamel basis is $H=\left\{1, h_{1}, h_{2}, \cdots, h_{a}, \cdots\right\}$. For each real number $x_{0}$, since $x_{0}$ can be uniquely expressed as $x_{0}=a+a_{1} h_{1} \cdot \cdots+a_{n} h_{n}$, we define $f\left(x_{0}\right)=a$. It is evident that the function f satisfies $f(x+y)=f(x)+f(y)$. Now we prove that f is discontinuous at any chosen point $x_{0}$. Assume $x_{0}$ as above. Pick an element h from H distinct from $h_{1}, h_{2}, \cdots, h_{n}$ and approximate $h^{-1}$ with a sequence of rational numbers, i.e., let $\left\{\alpha_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence of rational numbers such that $a_{n} \rightarrow h^{-1} (n \rightarrow \infty)$, hence $\left(1-a_{n} h\right) \rightarrow 0 $ or $\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right)->x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty)$. However, by definition $f\left(x_{0}\right)=a, f\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right)=a+1$, i.e., $\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right) \rightarrow x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty)$, but $f\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right) \nrightarrow f\left(x_{0}\right)(n \rightarrow \infty)$, so f is discontinuous at $x_{0}$.
chinese_rationale: 利用有理数域上的实数  $R^{1}$  的线性空间的 Hamel 基， 能够构造这种函数。集  $H \subset R^{1}$  叫做 Hamel 基， 是指对任一  $x \in R^{1}$ ， 存在有理 数  $\left\{a_{a}\right\}$ 及  $\left\{h_{\alpha}\right\} \subset H $ ， 使$x=\Sigma a_{a} h_{a}$，其中和式是有限项的， 且表示法是唯一的。易知， 用一个非零实数去㴜乘  H  中的每一数后，所得之数集仍为一个 Hamel 基， 故不妨设 Hamel 基为$H=\left\{1， h_{1}， h_{2}， \cdots， h_{a}， \cdots\right\} $。因为对每个实数  $x_{0}$ ， 由 $ x_{0}$  可唯一地表为$x_{0}=a+a_{1} h_{1} \cdot \cdots+a_{n} h_{n}$，我们就定义  $f\left(x_{0}\right)=a $。易见， 函数  f  满足$f(x+y)=f(x)+f(y)$ 。今证  f  在任意取定的  j  一点  $x_{0}$  间断。不妨设  $x_{0}$  如上。 在  H  中任取一个开于$h_{1}， h_{2}， \cdots， h_{n}$的  h ， 用一串有理数去逼近 $ h^{-1} $， 即设 $ \left\{\alpha_{n}\right\} $ 为一串有理数而 $ a_{n} \rightarrow h^{-1}   (n \rightarrow \infty) $， 于是$\left(1-a_{n} h\right) \rightarrow 0 $\text { 或 }$\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right)->x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty) \text {. }$但由定义知  $f\left(x_{0}\right)=a， f\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right)=a+1$ ， 即有$\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right) \rightarrow x_{0}(n \rightarrow \infty)$，而$f\left(x_{0}+1-a_{n} h\right) \nrightarrow f\left(x_{0}\right)(n \rightarrow \infty)$，所以  f  在  $x_{0}$  不连续。

statement: There exists a function that is discontinuous on any given $F_{\sigma}$ set.
chinese_statement: 存在在任意给定的$F_{\sigma}$  型集上间断的函数。
rationale: For a given $F_{\sigma}$ set $E=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}$, where $F_{n}(n=1, 2, \cdots)$ are all closed sets, this sequence can be assumed to be non-decreasing, i.e., $F_{n} \subset F_{n+1}(n=1, 2, \cdots)$. In fact, if it is not non-decreasing, we replace $F_{2}$ with $F_{1} \cup F_{2}$, $F_{3}$ with $F_{1} \cup F_{2} \cup F_{3}$, etc. Thus, the new sequence of closed sets is non-decreasing, and the union of these closed sets is also E. We define a function $f_{n}$ on $R^{1}$ as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}1 / 10^{n}, & x \text { is a rational point in } F_{n}, \\2 / 10^{n}, & x \text { is an irrational point in } F_{n}, \\0, & x \text { is not a point in } F_{n}. \end{array} \right.$ Obviously, the function $f_{n}$ is discontinuous at every point of the set $F_{n}$, and it is continuous at every point of $R^{\prime} \backslash F_{n}$. Let $f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$, since $\left|f_{n}(x)\right| \leqslant 2 / 10^{n}$, by Weierstrass' M-test, the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$ is uniformly convergent on $R^{1}$. We choose any $x_{0} \in R^{1} \backslash E$, since each function $f_{n}$ is continuous at the point $x_{0}$, by the uniform convergence of the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$, the function f is also continuous at the point $x_{0}$. We now prove that for any $x_{0} \in E$, f is discontinuous at $x_{0}$. In fact, suppose $x_{0} \in F_{n}$ but $x_{0} \notin F_{n-1}$, then $x_{0}$ is a continuous point of the functions $f_{1}, f_{2}, \cdots , f_{n-1}$, but a discontinuous point of the functions $f_{n}, f_{n+1}, \cdots$, and the oscillation of the function $f_{n}$ at the point $x_{0}$ is greater than or equal to $1 / 10^{n}$, the sum of the oscillations of the functions $f_{n+1}, f_{n+2}, \cdots$ at the point $x_{0}$ is not greater than $2 / 10^{n+1}+2 / 10^{n+2}+\cdots = 2 / 9 \cdot 10^{n}$. In this way, the oscillation of the function f at the point $x_{0}$ is greater than or equal to $1 / 10^{n}-2 / 9 \cdot 10^{n}$, thus f is discontinuous at the point $x_{0}$. Note: For any function from $R^{1}$ to $R^{1}$, its set of discontinuity points is an $F_{\sigma}$ set. Since the set of all irrational numbers in $R^{1}$ is not an $F_{\sigma}$ set, it is impossible to construct a function from $R^{1}$ to $R^{1}$ that is continuous at every rational point and discontinuous at every irrational point.
chinese_rationale: 对于一个给定的  $F_{\sigma}$  型 集  $E=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n} $， 其 中 $ F_{n}(n=1，2， \cdots)$  都是闭集， 可以认为这个序列是渐张的， 即$ F_{n} \subset F_{n+1}(n=1，2， \cdots) $。事实上， 如果它不是渐张的， 那么， 我们就用  $F_{1} \cup F_{2} $ 代以  $F_{2}， F_{1} \cup   F_{2} \cup F_{3}$  代以 $ F_{3} $， 等等。于是， 新的闭集序列是渐张的， 且这些闭集的并集也是  E 。我们在  $R^{1}$  上定义函数  $f_{n}$  如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}1 / 10^{n}， & x \text { 是 } F_{n} \text { 中的有理点， } \\2 / 10^{n}， & x \text { 是 } F_{n} \text { 中的无理点， } \\0， & x \text { 不是 } F_{n} \text { 中的点。 }\end{array}\right.$显然， 函数  $f_{n}$  在集  $F_{\mathrm{n}}$  的一切点间断， 而在  $R^{\prime} \backslash F_{n}$  的 一切点连续。 令$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$，因为  $\left|f_{n}(x)\right| \leqslant 2 / 10^{n}$ ， 故据 Weierstrass 的  M -判别法， 级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$  在  $R^{1}$上是一致收敛的。 我们任取  $x_{0} \in R^{1} \backslash E $， 由于每个函数  $f_{n}$ 在点  $x_{0}$  都是连续的， 故由级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)$  的一致收敛性可知， 函数  f  在点  $x_{0}$  也是连续的。 兹证， 对于任何  $x_{0} \in E$， f  在  $x_{0}$  都是间断的。 事实上， 可设  $x_{0} \in F_{n}$  而  $x_{0} \bar{E} F_{n-1}$ ， 于是，  $x_{0}$  是函数  $f_{1}， f_{2}， \cdots ，  f_{n-1}$  的连续点， 而是函数 $ f_{n}， f_{n+1}， \cdots $ 的间断点， 并且函数  $f_{n}$  在点  $x_{0}$  处的振幅大于或等于  $1 / 10^{n}$ ， 函数  $f_{n+1}， f_{n+2}， \cdots$  在点  $x_{0}$  处的振幅之和不大于$2 / 10^{n+1}+2 / 10^{n+2}+\cdots t=2 / 9 \cdot 10^{n}$ 。这样一来，函数  f  在点  $x_{0}$  处的振幅大于或等于  $1 / 10^{n}-2 / 9 \cdot 10^{n}$  ，因而  f  在点  $x_{0}$  是间断的。注 对于任何从  $R^{1}$  到  $R^{1}$  内的函数来说，其间断点集都是个  $F_{\sigma}$型集。 由于  $R^{1}$  内全体无理数所成之集不是一个$F_{\sigma}$型集， 因而不可能作出一个在每个有理点速续而又在每个无理点间断的从$R^{1}$上到 $R^{1}$ 内的函数。

statement: There exists a positive continuous function f on $[1, +\infty)$ such that $\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) dx$ diverges while $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)$ converges.
chinese_statement: 存在$[1，+\infty)$上的正值连续函数  f ， 使 $ \int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) d x $ 发散而$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n) $收敛。
rationale: For each integer n>1, let $g(n)=0$; at the non-integer endpoints of the closed intervals $\left[n-n^{-1}, n\right]$ and $[n, n +n^{-1}]$, define the value of g to be 1; and inside these closed intervals, g is linear; finally, at points of $[1, +\infty)$ where $g(x)$ has not yet been defined, $g(x)$ is defined to be 1. Then $f(x)=g(x)+\frac{1}{x^{2}}$ is a positive continuous function on $[1, +\infty)$, and $\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) dx=+\infty, \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<+\infty$. Note: We have the following integral test for series: If f is a non-negative non-increasing function on $[1, +\infty)$, then the necessary and sufficient condition for the convergence of the improper (R) integral $\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) dx$ is that the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)$ converges.
chinese_rationale: 対于各个整数  n>1 ， 设 $g(n)=0 $; 在闭区间  $\left[n-n^{-1}， n\right]$ 和  $[n， n   +n^{-1}] $ 的非整数端点处， 定义  g  的值等于 1 ; 而在这些闭区间内部，  g  是线性的; 最后， 在 $[1，+\infty) $ 上  $g(x)$  还没有确定值的点处，  $g(x)$ 都定义为 1。 于是$f(x)=g(x)+\frac{1}{x^{2}}$是$[1，+\infty)$上的正值连续函数，而$\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) d x=+\infty， \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<+\infty $。注： 我们有如下的级数的积分检验法： 如果  f  是 $ [1，+\infty) $ 上的非负的不增函数，那么广义  (R)  积分$\int_{1}^{+\infty} f(x) d x$收敛的充要条件是级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f(n) $ 收敛。

statement: There exists a differentiable function with infinite total variation.
chinese_statement: 存在全变差为无穷大的可微函数。
rationale: Define the function on the interval [0, 1]: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}x^{2} \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right), & 0<x \leqslant 1 \\0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.$ Then $f^{\prime}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}2 x \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right)-(2 / x) \cos \left(1 / x^{2}\right), & 0<x \leqslant 1, \\0 & x=0.\end{array}\right.$ Therefore, f is differentiable everywhere on [0, 1]. However, the total variation of f on [0, 1] is infinite. In fact, we take partition points in [0, 1]: $\begin{array}{l}0<\frac{1}{\sqrt{n \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}}<\frac{1}{\sqrt{n \pi}}<-\frac{1}{\sqrt{(n-1) \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}}<\cdots<\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}} \\<-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi}}<\frac{1}{\sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2}}}<1,\end{array}$ Which gives $V=\left|\sin 1-\frac{2}{\pi}\right|+\sum_{k=0}^{n} \frac{1}{k \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}+\frac{1}{\pi \pi+\frac{\pi \pi}{2}} $. Thus, it can be seen that, $ V_{0}^{1}(f)=+\infty $.
