chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0 ，1]  上定义函数：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}x^{2} \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right)， & 0<x \leqslant 1 \\0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.$则$f^{\prime}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}2 x \sin \left(1 / x^{2}\right)-(2 / x) \cos \left(1 / x^{2}\right)， & 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0 & x=0。\end{array}\right.$因此，  f  在  [0，1]  上处处可微。然而，  f  在  [0，1]  上的全变差却是无穷大。事实上，我们在  [0，1]  中取分点$\begin{array}{l}0<\frac{1}{\sqrt{n \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}}<\frac{1}{\sqrt{n \pi}}<-\frac{1}{\sqrt{(n-1) \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}}<\cdots<\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}} \\<-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi}}<\frac{1}{\sqrt{\frac{\pi}{2}}}<1，\end{array}$于是便有$V=\left|\sin 1-\frac{2}{\pi}\right|+\sum_{k=0}^{n} \frac{1}{k \pi+\frac{\pi}{2}}+\frac{1}{\pi \pi+\frac{\pi \pi}{2}} $。由此可见， $ V_{0}^{1}(f)=+\infty $。

statement: There exists a divergent series, and it is impossible to accelerate its divergence by rearrangement.
chinese_statement: 存在一个发散级数，用重排不可能加快其发散程度。
rationale: Let $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ be a divergent series with positive terms, satisfying $a_{n} \geqslant a_{n+1}, n=1,2, \cdots$. For any positive integer sequence $0<m_{1}<m_{2}<\cdots<m_{n}<\cdots, \text{therefore}, m_{1} \geqslant 1, m_{2} \geqslant 2, \cdots; m_{n} \geqslant n, \cdots$, thus $a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots, a_{n} \geqslant a_{m_{1}}+a_{m_{2}}+\cdots+a_{m_{n}}$. From this, it can be concluded that any rearrangement cannot accelerate the divergence of $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$.
chinese_rationale: 设 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} $ 是发散的正项级数，满足 $a_{n} \geqslant a_{n+1}， n=1，2， \cdots $， 则对任意正整数序列$0<m_{1}<m_{2}<\cdots<m_{n}<\cdots，$恒有$m_{1} \geqslant 1， m_{2} \geqslant 2， \cdots ; m_{n} \geqslant n， \cdots，$因此$a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots， a_{n} \geqslant a_{m_{1}}+a_{m_{2}}+\cdots+a_{m_{n}}$。由此可知， 用任意的重排却不可能加快$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$的发散程度。

statement: Given any divergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, one can find a positive sequence $\left\{c_{n}\right\}$ converging to zero, such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{n} a_{n}$ nonetheless diverges.
chinese_statement: 任给一个发散的正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$， 可以找到一个收敛于零的正数序列$\left\{c_{n}\right\}$ ， 使$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{n} a_{n}$仍然发散。
rationale: Let $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ be a divergent series of positive terms, set $s_{n}=a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}$. We first prove that the series $\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}$ diverges. Because the sequence $\left(f_{k}\right)_{k=1}^{\infty}$ diverges to infinity, for any positive integer m, a positive integer n can be chosen such that $s_{n+1}>2 s_{m}$. Furthermore, the sequence $\left\{s_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$ is monotonically increasing, thus $\begin{aligned}\sum_{k=m}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}} & \geqslant \sum_{k=m}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{n+1}}=\frac{s_{n+1}-s_{m}}{s_{n+1}} \\ & \frac{s_{n+1}-\frac{1}{2} s_{n+1}}{s_{k+1}}=\frac{1}{2},\end{aligned}$ i.e., for any positive integer m, there exists a positive integer n such that $\sum_{k=n}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}>\frac{1}{2}$. This indicates that the partial sums of the series $\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}$ cannot form a Cauchy sequence, hence $\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}=+\infty$. However, $s_{k+1}-s_{k}=a_{k+1}$, thus $\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{a_{k+1}}{s_{k+1}}=\sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \frac{a_{k}}{s_{k}}=+\infty$. Take $c_{k}=1 / s_{k}$, then as $k \rightarrow \infty$, $c_{k} \rightarrow 0$, and $\sum_{k=2}^{\infty} c_{k} a_{k}=+\infty$. Note: This example specifically proves that regardless of how slowly a series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ diverges to infinity, there will always be a series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{n} \sigma_{n}$ that diverges even slower.
chinese_rationale: 设 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$一个发散的正项级数， 令$s_{n}=a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}$，我们先证明级数$\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}$发散。 因为序列$\left(f_{k}\right)_{k=1}^{\infty}$发散于无穷大， 故对在意的正整数  m ， 可以取正整数  n ， 使 $s_{n+1}>2 s_{m}$。 又， 序列 $\left\{s_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$是单调递增的， 因此$\begin{aligned}\sum_{k=m}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}} & \geqslant \sum_{k=m}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{n+1}}=\frac{s_{n+1}-s_{m}}{s_{n+1}} \\> & \frac{s_{n+1}-\frac{1}{2} s_{n+1}}{s_{k+1}}=\frac{1}{2}，\end{aligned}$即对任意正整数  m ， 存在正整数  n ， 使$\sum_{k=n}^{n} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}>\frac{1}{2} $。这表明级数$\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}$的部分和不能形成 Cauchy 序列， 从而$\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{s_{k+1}-s_{k}}{s_{k+1}}=+\infty$。但$s_{k+1}-s_{k}=a_{k+1}$ ， 因此$\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{a_{k+1}}{s_{k+1}}=\sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \frac{a_{k}}{s_{k}}=+\infty$。取 $c_{k}=1 / s_{k}$ ， 则当 $ k \rightarrow \infty $ 时  $c_{k} \rightarrow 0 $， 且 $\sum_{k=2}^{\infty} c_{k} a_{k}=+\infty$。注： 这个例子特别证明了无论一个正项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$怎样慢地发散于无穷大， 总会有一个正项级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{n} \sigma_{n}$比它发散得更僈。

statement: There exist two disjoint, everywhere dense, uncountable sets on a line.
chinese_statement: 直线上存在两个不相交的处处稠密的不可数集。
rationale: Let A be the set consisting of all negative irrational numbers and all positive rational numbers; B is the complement of A, then A and B are two disjoint uncountable sets that are everywhere dense on the line.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  是由全部负无理数和全部正有理数所组成之集；  B  是  A 的余集, 则  A  与  B  为两个不相 交的不可数集, 且在直线上处处稠密。

statement: There exists an unmeasurable set
chinese_statement: 存在不可测集
rationale: Classify all the points in $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$ as follows: two points $x$ and $y$ are in the same class if and only if $x-y$ is a rational number. Let $x \in [-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$, all points in $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$ of the form $x+r$ (where $r$ denotes a rational number) are grouped into a class $K(x)$. Thus, for a given $x$, there is a class $K(x)$ corresponding to it, and $x \in \boldsymbol{K}(\boldsymbol{x})$. It can be proven that two different classes $K(x)$ and $K(y)$ do not intersect. Because if they intersect, then there exists $z \in K(x) \cap K(y)$. Thus $z=x+r_{x}=y+r_{y}$, where $r_{x}$ and $r_{y}$ are both rational numbers, implying $y=x+r_{x}-r_{y}$. Now, if $t \in K(y)$, then $t=y+r=x+\left(r_{x}-r_{y}+r\right)=x+r^{\prime}$, so $t \in K(x)$, thus $K(y) \subset K(x)$. Similarly, $K(x) \subset K(y)$, therefore $K(x)=\boldsymbol{K}(y)$. This contradicts the assumption. After classifying $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$ as above, choose an arbitrary point in each class as a representative element, and denote the collection of these points as $A$. The following proves that $A$ is an unmeasurable set. Let $r_{0}=0, r_{1}, r_{2}, r_{3}, \cdots$ be all the rational points in $[-1, 1]$. Let $A$ be the set obtained by translating $A$ by $\varphi_{k}(x)=x+r_{k}$, denoted as $A_{k}$. If $x \in A$, then $\varphi_{k}(x) \in A_{k}$; if $x \in A_{k}$, then $x-r_{k} \in A$. Particularly, $A_{0}=A$. By the invariance of Lebesgue inner and outer measure under translation, we get $\begin{array}{c}m_{*} A_{k}=m_{*} A=\alpha, \\m^{*} A_{k}=m^{*} A=\beta. \end{array}$ First, prove that $\beta>0$. (1) To do this, first prove $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2] \subset \bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}$. (2) In fact, for $x \in [-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$, $x$ must belong to one of the aforementioned classes. Let the representative element of this class be ${x}_{0}$, then $x-{x}_{0}$ is a rational number and must be in $[-1, 1]$. Therefore, $x-{x}_{0}=\boldsymbol{r}_{k}$, and $x \in A_{k}$. Thus, (2) is proved. Since $1=m^{*}[-1 / 2, 1 / 2] \leqslant m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}\right) \leqslant \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{k}$, i.e., $1 \leqslant \beta + \beta + \beta + \cdots$, (1) is validated. On the other hand, it is easy to prove that $\boldsymbol{\alpha}=0$. (3) In fact, for $n \neq m$, $A_{n} \cap A_{m}={\varnothing}$. (3) Why? Because if there exists a point $z \in A_{n} \cap A_{m}$, then $x_{n}=z-r_{n}$ and $x_{m}=z-r_{m}$ (obviously different) both belong to $A$ but belong to different classes. This is impossible, as $x_{n}-x_{m}=r_{n}-r_{m}$ is a rational number. Hence, (4) follows. Also, for any $k$, $A_{k} \subset [-3 / 2, 3 / 2]$ (since $x \in A_{k}$ implies $x=x_{0}+r_{k}$, where $\left|x_{0}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2$, and $\left|r_{k}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2$). Thus, $\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k} \subset [-3 / 2, 3 / 2]$. (5) From (5) and (4), we get $3=m_{*}[-3 / 2, 3 / 2] \geqslant m_{*}\left(\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}\right) \geqslant \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} m_{*} A_{k}$, hence $\boldsymbol{\alpha} + \boldsymbol{\alpha} + \boldsymbol{\alpha} + \cdots \leqslant 3$, so $\alpha=0$. This is (3). Combining (1) and (3), we get $m_{*} A < m^{*} A$, so $\boldsymbol{A}$ is an unmeasurable set. If we start from an interval other than $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$, say from any set $E$ with positive measure, and classify it analogously, we see that there exists an unmeasurable subset $\boldsymbol{A}$ in $E^{\prime}$. Therefore, every set with positive measure contains an unmeasurable subset.
chinese_rationale: 将$[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$  中所有的点以下法分类， 两点  x  与  y ， 当且仅当$x-y $ 是有理数吋， 称  x  与  y  属于同一类。 设  $x \in[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$ ，将  [-1 / 2，1 / 2]  中具有形式 $ x+r$(r  表示有理数  )  的点的全体归为一类  $K(x)$  。这样， 对于一个  x ， 有一类 $ K(x)$  与之对应， 且$x \in \boldsymbol{K}(\boldsymbol{x})$ 。其次可证不同的两类$ K(x)$  和 $ K(y)$  是不相交的。 因为如果它们相交，那么有  $z \in K(x) \cap K(y) $ 。因而$z=x+r_{x}=y+r_{r}，$其中 $ r_{z}$  和 $ r_{y} $ 都是有理数，故得$y=x+r_{x}-r_{y}$ 。现在， 假定 $ t \in K(y)$ ， 则由$t=y+r=x+\left(r_{x}-r_{y}+r\right)=x+r^{\prime}，$得  $t \in K(x)$ ， 从而$  K(y) \subset K(x) $。 同理可得 $ K(x) \subset K(y) $， 因此 $ K(x)   =\boldsymbol{K}(y)$。 此与假定相冲突。将  [-1 / 2，1 / 2]  给以以上述的分类以后， 在每一类中任意选定一点作为代表元素， 这种点的全体记它做  A。 下面证明  A  是一个不可测的集。设  [-1，1]  中的有理点的全体是$r_{0}=0， r_{1}， r_{2}， r_{3}， \cdots $。设  A  经平移$\varphi_{k}(x)=x+r_{k}$而得集$ A_{k}$ ， 若  $x \in A$ ， 则 $ \varphi_{k}(x) \in A_{k} $; 又若 $ x \in A_{k}$ ， 则 $ x-r_{k} \in A$ 。 特别是 $ A_{0}=A$。 由 Lebesgue 内、外测度关于平移的不变性， 得到$\begin{array}{c}m_{*} A_{k}=m_{*} A=\alpha， \\m^{*} A_{k}=m^{*} A=\beta 。\end{array}$先证$\beta>0$ 。(1)为此首先证明$[-1 / 2，1 / 2] \subset \bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}$(2)事实上， 当$  x \in[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$  时  x  必属于上述分类中的某一类， 设此类的代表元素是${x}_{0} $， 则 $ x-x_{0}$  是一个有理数并且一定含在  [-1，1] 中， 因此$x-x_{0}=\boldsymbol{r}_{k}$，而  $x \in A_{k}$ 于是 (2)得着证明。由于$1=m^{*}[-1 / 2，1 / 2] \leqslant m^{*}\left(\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}\right) \leqslant \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} m^{*} A_{k}$即$1 \leqslant \beta+\beta+\beta+\cdots \text {。 }$知(1)是真的。另一方面， 容易证明$\boldsymbol{\alpha}=0 $。(3)事实上， 当 $ n \neq m $ 时，$A_{n} \cap A_{m}={\varnothing}$ (3)。何以呢？ 因为如果有点  $z \in A_{n} \cap A_{m}$ ， 则$x_{n}=z-r_{n} \text { 和 } x_{m}=z-r_{m}$（显然是不同的）都属于  A  而属于不同的类。此事由$x_{n}-x_{m}=r_{n}-r_{m}$是一个个有理数而知为不可能。由是得(4)。又对任意的  k ，$A_{k} \subset[-3 / 2，3 / 2]$(因为  $x \in A_{k}$  含有  $x=x_{0} +r_{k}$ ， 其中  $\left|x_{0}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2，\left|r_{k}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2  )$。 由是$\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k} \subset[-3 / 2，3 / 2] $(5)。由 (5)及  (4) ， 得到$3=m_{*}[-3 / 2，3 / 2] \geqslant m_{*}\left(\bigcup_{k=0}^{\infty} A_{k}\right) \geqslant \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} m_{*} A_{k}$从而$\boldsymbol{\alpha}+\boldsymbol{\alpha} +\boldsymbol{\alpha}+\cdots \leqslant 3，$故得  $\alpha=0 $。 这就是  (3) 。将 (1) 和(3)合并得着$m_{*} A<m^{*} A$，所以 $ \boldsymbol{A} $ 是一个不可测集。如果我们不是从闭区间  [-1 / 2，1 / 2]  出发， 而是从任何一个具有正测度的集  E  出发，施行同样的手续而给以分类，那么就知道 $ E^{\prime}$ 中存在着不可测的子集  $\boldsymbol{A}$ 。因此， 凡具有正测度的集合含有不可测的子集。

statement: There exist two square (L) integrable functions, whose sum is not square (L) integrable.
chinese_statement: 存在两个平方  (L)  可积的函数， 它们的和不是平方  (L)  可积的。
rationale: Let $E_{1}$ be a non-measurable subset of $[0, 1]$, and $E_{2}$ be a non-measurable subset of $[2, 3]$. Define $\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & x \in[0,1] \cup E_{2} \\-1, & x \in[2,3] \backslash E_{\mathbf{2}}, \\0, & \text { other points, }\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in[2,3] \cup E_{1}, \\-1, x \in[0,1] \backslash E_{1}, \\0, \text { other points, }\end{array}\right. \\\end{array}$ then $f^{2}(x)=g^{2}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in[0,1] \cup[2,3], \\0, \text { other points, }\end{array}\right.$ so $f^{2}$ and $g^{2}$ are (L) integrable over $R^{1}$. On the other hand, $\begin{array}{l}f(x)+g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2, x \in E_{1} \cup E_{2}, \\0, \text { other points, }\end{array}\right. \\{[f(x)+g(x)]^{2}=\left\{\begin{array}{l}4, x \in E_{1} \cup E_{2}, \\0, \text { other points, }\end{array}\right.} \\\end{array}$ and $E_{1} \cup E_{2}$ is a non-measurable set, thus $(f+g)^{2}$ is not (L) integrable over $R^{1}$.
chinese_rationale: 设$E_{1}$为  $[0，1]$  中的一个不可测子集，  $E_{2}$  为  $[2，3]$  中的一个不可测子集。 令$\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1， & x \in[0，1] \cup E_{2} \\-1， & x \in[2，3] \backslash E_{\mathbf{2}}， \\0， & \text { 其它点， }\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in[2，3] \cup E_{1}， \\-1， x \in[0，1] \backslash E_{1}， \\0， \text { 其它点， }\end{array}\right. \\\end{array}$则$f^{2}(x)=g^{2}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in[0，1] \cup[2，3]， \\0， \text { 其它点， }\end{array}\right.$所以  $f^{2}$  与 $g^{2}$  在 $R^{1}$  上都是 $ ({L})$  可积的。另一方面，$\begin{array}{l}f(x)+g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2， x \in E_{1} \cup E_{2}， \\0， \text { 其他点， }\end{array}\right. \\{[f(x)+g(x)]^{2}=\left\{\begin{array}{l}4， x \in E_{1} \cup E_{2}， \\0， \text { 其它点， }\end{array}\right.} \\\end{array}$而$ E_{1} \cup E_{2}$ 是不可测集， 故$(f+g)^{2}$在$R^{1}$上并不  (L)  可积。

statement: There exists a function that is nowhere semi-continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在无处半连续的函数。
rationale: Consider the function defined on the interval [0,1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(-1)^{n} \frac{n}{n+1}, x=m / n, n, m \text{ are coprime integers, and } n>0, \\0, \quad x \text{ is irrational, }\end{array}\right.$ For any $x_{0} \in[0,1]$, the function f is not upper semi-continuous at $x_{0}$ because $\varlimsup_{x \rightarrow x_{0}} f(x)=1$, making it impossible for $\varlimsup_{x \rightarrow x_{0}} f(x) \leqslant f\left(x_{0}\right)$. Similarly, it can be proven that f is not lower semi-continuous at $x_{0}$.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0,1]  上如下定义函数：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(-1)^{n} \frac{n}{n+1}, x=m / n, n, m \text { 为互质的整数, 且 } n>0, \\0, \quad x \text { 为无理数, }\end{array}\right.$则对任意  $x_{0} \in[0,1]$ , 函数  f  在  $x_{0}$  都不是上半连续的, 这是因为$\varlimsup_{x \rightarrow x_{0}} f(x)=1$,从而不可能有  $\varlimsup_{x \rightarrow x_{0}} f(x) \leqslant f\left(x_{0}\right)$ 。同理可证,  f  在  $x_{0}$  也不是下半连续的。

statement: There exists a compact plane set with no area.
chinese_statement: 存在没有面积的紧平面集。
rationale: Let A be a Cantor set in [0, 1] with positive measure $\varepsilon$, and let $S = A \times [0, 1]$. Clearly, S is a compact plane set, and $F(S) = S$. Therefore, the plane measure of $F(S)$ is equal to the linear measure of A: $m F(S) = m A \times m[0, 1] = m A = \varepsilon$. Since $F(S) = S$ is a compact set, its outer area is equal to its measure, thus it is a positive number $\varepsilon$. However, the inner area of S is equal to zero, so S has no area.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  是  [0，1]  中具有正测度 $\varepsilon$  的 Cantor集， 再设 $ S=A \times[0 ， 1]$。 易见，  S  是一个紧的平面集，  $F(S)=S$ 。 因此，  $F(S)$  的平面测度就等于  A  的线性测度:$m F(S)=m A \times m[0，1]=m A=\varepsilon $。由于  $F(S)=S$  是一个紧集， 所以它的外面积等于它的测度， 因而是正数$\varepsilon$。然而，S的内面积等于零，所以S没有面积。

statement: There exists a trigonometric series that is not a Fourier-Lebesgue series, but it is a Fourier-Stieltjes series.
chinese_statement: 存在一个三角级数， 它不是 Fourier-Lebesgue 级数， 但却是Fourier-Stieltjes 级数。
rationale: Consider the trigonometric series $\frac{1}{2}+\cos x+\cos 2 x+\cdots$, (1) clearly, it cannot be the Fourier series of some (L) integrable function. Let $F(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}-\pi / 2, -\pi \leqslant x<0, \\0, \quad x=0, \\\pi / 2, \quad 0<x \leqslant \pi,\end{array}\right.$ then F is a function of bounded variation on $[-\pi, \pi]$, and $\begin{array}{l}a_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} \cos \pi x d F(x)=1, \\b_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} \sin n x d F(x)=0.\end{array}$ In other words, the coefficients of series (1) can be expressed by Riemann-Stieltjes integrals. Thus, series (1) is the Fourier-Stieltjes series of dF.
chinese_rationale: 考虑三角级数$\frac{1}{2}+\cos x+\cos 2 x+\cdots，$(1)显然，它不可能是某个  (L)  可积函数的 Fourier 级数。 令$F(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}-\pi / 2，-\pi \leqslant x<0， \\0， \quad x=0， \\\pi / 2， \quad 0<x \leqslant \pi，\end{array}\right.$则  F  是 $[-\pi， \pi]$上的有界变差函数，且$\begin{array}{l}a_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} \cos \pi x d F(x)=1， \\b_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} \sin n x d F(x)=0 。\end{array}$也就是说，级数(1)的系数能用 Riemann-Stieltjes 积分表示。 因而级数 (1) 是  d F  的 Fourier-Stieltjes 级数。

statement: There exists a bounded function limit that is not (R) integrable on any non-empty interval.
chinese_statement: 存在一个有界函数的极限，它在任何非空区间上都不(R)可积。
rationale: Let $\begin{array}{c}g(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \sin ^{2n}\pi x \cos ^{2 n} \pi x \\G(x)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} g(n!x),\end{array}$ then when x is an integer, $ g(x)=0 $; whereas when x is not an integer, $ g(x)=1$. Therefore, if x is a rational number, then $ G(x)=0$; if x is an irrational number, then $G(x)=1$. Hence, G(x) is not (R) integrable on any non-empty interval.
chinese_rationale: 设$\begin{array}{c}g(x)=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \sin ^{2n}\pi x \cos ^{2 n} \pi x \\G(x)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} g(n!x)，\end{array}$则当  x  是整数时， $ g(x)=0 $; 而当  x  不是整数时， $ g(x)=1$ 。 因此， 若  x  是有理数， 则 $ G(x)=0$ ; 若  x  是无理数， 则$G(x)=1$。 可见  G(x) 在任何非空区间上都不  (R)  可积。

statement: There exists a differentiable function with unequal second-order mixed partial derivatives.
chinese_statement: 存在二阶混合偏导数不相等的可微函数。

statement: There exists a sequence of real-valued continuous functions $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on [0,1] such that $f_{1}(x) \geqslant f_{2}(x) \geqslant \cdots \geqslant 0$, and if there is a continuous function f such that $f_{n}(x) \geqslant f(x) \geqslant 0({n}=1,2 \cdots)$, then $ f \equiv0$. However, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{1} \operatorname{f}_{n}(x) d x \neq 0$.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  上的一个实值连续函数序列$ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ， 使  $f_{1}(x) \geqslant f_{2}(x) \geqslant   \cdots \geqslant 0 $， 且若有连函数  f  适合  $f_{n}(x) \geqslant f(x) \geqslant 0({n}=1，2 \cdots)$ ，则 $ f \equiv0$， 但  $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{1} \operatorname{f}_{n}(x) d x \neq 0$。
rationale: Use a sequence of open intervals with a total length of 1/2 to cover all rational points in [0,1]. Let K denote the points in [0,1] not covered by these open intervals; thus K is a closed nowhere dense set. For each $x \in[0,1]$, let $f_{n}(x)=(1-d({x}, K))^{n}, n=1,2, \cdots$, where $ d(x, K) $ represents the distance from point x to the closed set K: $d(x, K)=\inf _{\boldsymbol{x} \in \boldsymbol{K}}|x-y|$. Thus, each function $f_{n}$ is continuous on [0,1], and for any $x \in[0,1]$, $f_{1}(x) \geqslant f_{2}(x) \geqslant \cdots \geqslant 0$. Additionally, for any positive integer n, $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \geqslant\frac{1}{2}$ since when $ x \in K$, $f_{n}(x)=1$, and the (L) measure of K $\geqslant 1/2$. Assuming f is a continuous function on [0,1], for each rational point $ q \in[0,1]$, we have $ 0 \leqslant f(q) \leqslant f_{n}(q)(s=1,2, \cdots)$, then since for any rational point q, $1-d(q, K) <1$, thus, by the continuity of $\boldsymbol{f}$, $\boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) \equiv 0(x \in[0,1])$.
chinese_rationale: 用长度之和为  1 / 2  的一串开区间覆盖$[0，1]$中的全体有理点，  K  表$[0，1]$中未被这些开区间覆盖的点，则  K  为一闭的无处稠集。 对每一$x \in[0，1]$ ， 令$f_{n}(x)=(1-d({x}， K))^{n}， n=1，2， \cdots，$这里， $ d(x， K) $ 代表点  x  到闭集  K  之间的距离：$d(x， K)=\inf _{\boldsymbol{x} \in \boldsymbol{K}}|x-y|$。于是， 每个函数$f_{n}$在 $[0，1]$ 上都是连续的， 且对任一$x \in[0，1]$， 有$f_{1}(x) \geqslant f_{2}(x) \geqslant \cdots \geqslant 0 $。此外， 对任何正整数  n ， 有$\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \geqslant\frac{1}{2}$这是因为当$ x \in K$  时，  $f_{n}(x)=1 $， 而  K  的  (L)  测度$\geqslant 1 / 2$ 。假定  f  是$[0，1]$上的连续函数， 对每一有理点$ q \in[0，1]$ ，都有$ 0 \leqslant f(q) \leqslant f_{n}(q)(s=1，2， \cdots)$ ， 则因对任一有理点  q ， 有 $1-d(q， K) <1$ ， 故从  $\boldsymbol{f}$ 的连续性得到 $\boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{x}) \equiv 0(x \in[0，1])$。

statement: There exists a sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L(E)$ that converges almost everywhere to $f$ on $E$, such that $\sup _{n}\left\|f_{n}\right\|=K<+\infty$, while $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ does not weakly converge to $\boldsymbol{f}$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个在  E  上几乎处处收敛于  f  的函数序列$ \left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L(E)$ ， 使$\sup _{n}\left\|f_{n}\right\|=K<+\infty$ ， 而  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}  $并不弱收敛于$  \boldsymbol{f}$。
rationale: For example, define the sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on [0,1] as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \in[1 / n, 1] \\ n, x=0, \\\text { linear, } x \in[0,1 / n] .\end{array} \right.$ Obviously, for any $x_{0} \in(0,1]$, we have $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}\left(x_{0}\right)=0$, so $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges almost everywhere to 0 on [0,1]. Furthermore, $\sup _{n}\left\|f_{n}\right\|_{L[0,1]}=\sup _{n} \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}\left(n-n^{2} x\right) d x=\frac{1}{2}$. However, for the function $g(x) \equiv 1$, we always have $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\frac{1}{2}, n=1,2, \cdots,$ so $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not weakly converge to $f \equiv 0$.
chinese_rationale: 例如， 在  [0，1]  上定义函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ 如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \in[1 / n， 1]  \\n， x=0， \\\text { 线性， } x \in[0，1 / n] 。\end{array}\right.$易见，对任一  $x_{0} \in(0，1]$  ，都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}\left(x_{0}\right)=0$，所以  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  [0，1]  上几乎处处收敛于 0 。 又$\sup _{n}\left\|f_{n}\right\|_{L[0，1}=\sup _{n} \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}\left(n-n^{2} x\right) d x=\frac{1}{2} $。但是， 对于函数 $ g(x) \equiv 1 $ 而言， 恒有$\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\frac{1}{2}， n=1，2， \cdots，$因此$  \left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 并不弱收敛于  $f \equiv 0 $。

statement: There exists a function that is everywhere differentiable but nowhere monotonic.
chinese_statement: 存在处处可微而无处单调的函数。
rationale:
We need to construct a real-valued function H on $R^{1}$ that is everywhere differentiable, not monotonic on any non-empty subinterval of $R^{1}$, and bounded. We proceed in seven steps.

I. Let r and s be real numbers.
(i) If $r > s > 0$, then $(r-s) /\left(r^{2}-s^{2}\right)<2 / r$.
(ii) If $r > 1, s > 1$, then $(r+s-2) /\left(r^{2}+s^{2}-2\right)<2 / s$.
Proof:
(i) is obvious.
(ii) is equivalent to $(r-s)^{2}+(r-1)(s-1)+r^{2}+r+3s>5$. And this is clearly true when $r > 1, s > 1$.

II. Let $v(x) = (1 + |x|)^{-\frac{1}{2}}$, $x \in R^{\prime}$. If a and b are distinct real numbers, then $\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) dx < 4 \min \{v(a), v(b)\}$.
Proof:
Suppose $a < b$, and when $0 \leqslant a$, by the first step, we have

$$
\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) dx = \frac{2(\sqrt{1 + b} - \sqrt{{1 + a}})}{(1 + b) - (1 + a)} \\< \frac{4}{\sqrt{1 + b}} = 4 \min \{v(a), v(b)\} .\end{array}
$$

As $v(-x) = v(x)$, we do not need special consideration when $b \leqslant 0$. Thus, suppose $a < 0 < b$. In this case, we get

$$
\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) dx = \frac{2(\sqrt{1 + b} - \sqrt{{1 + a}} - 2)}{(1 + b) - (1 + a) - 2} \\< 4 \min \{v(a), v(b)\} .\end{array}
$$

III. If v is defined as in step II, and w is any function of the form $w(x) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_{n} v[\lambda_{n}(x - \alpha_{n})]$, where $c_{1}, c_{2}, \cdots, c_{n}$ and $\lambda_{1}, \lambda_{2}, \cdots, \lambda_{n}$ are positive real numbers, and $\alpha_{1}, \alpha_{2}, \cdots, \alpha_{n}$ are arbitrary real numbers, then $\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} w(x) dx < 4 \min \{w(a), w(b))\}$.
Proof: This follows directly from step II and $\frac{1}{b - a} \int_{a}^{b} v(\lambda(x - \alpha)) dx = \frac{1}{\lambda(b - \alpha) - \lambda(a - \alpha)} \int_{\lambda(a - \alpha)}^{\lambda(b - \alpha)} v(t) dt$.

IV. Let the sequence $\left\{w_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ be as in step III. For $x \in R^{1}$ and each n, define $W_{n}(x) = \int_{0}^{x} w_{n}(t) dt$. Suppose for some $a \in R^{1}$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} w_{n}(a) = \varepsilon < \infty$. Then the series $F(x) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} W_{n}(x)$ converges uniformly on any bounded subset of $R^{\prime}$, the function F is differentiable at a, and $F^{\prime}(a) = \varepsilon$. Particularly, if $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} w_{n}(t) = f(t) < \infty$ for all $t \in R^{1}$, then F is everywhere differentiable on $R^{1}$ and $F^{\prime} = f$.
Proof: Let $b \in R^{1}$ satisfy $b \geqslant a$. Using step III, when $-b \leqslant x \leqslant b$,

$$
\begin{aligned}\left|W_{n}(x)\right| & \leqslant \left|\int_{0}^{a} w_{n}(t) dt\right| + \left|\int_{a}^{x} w_{n}(t) dt\right| \\\& \leqslant 4|a| w_{n}(a) + 4|x - a| w_{n}(a) \\\& \leqslant 12 b w_{n}(a).\end{aligned}
$$

Thus, by the Weierstrass M-test, the series $F(x) = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} W_{n}(x)$ converges uniformly on $[-b, b]$. To prove $F^{\prime}(a) = \varepsilon$, let $\varepsilon > 0$ be given, select $n_{0}$ such that $10 \sum_{n=n_{0}+1}^{\infty} w_{n}(a) < \varepsilon$. Since each $w_{n}$ is continuous at a, there exists $\delta > 0$ such that when $0 < |h| < \delta$ and $1 \leq n \leq n_{0}$,

$$\left|\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) dt - w_{n}(a)\right|<\frac{\varepsilon}{2 n_{0}}.$$

Thus, by step III again, when $0 < |h| < \delta$,

$$
\begin{array}{l}\left|\frac{F(a + h) - F(a)}{h} - s\right| = \left|\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \left[\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) dt - w_{n}(a)\right]\right| \\\leq \sum_{n=1}^{n_{0}} \left|\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) dt - w_{n}(a)\right| \\ + \sum_{n=n_{0}+1}^{\infty} \left|\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) dt + w_{n}(a)\right| \\ < \frac{\varepsilon}{2} + \sum_{n=n_{0}+1}^{\infty} 5 w_{n}(a) < \varepsilon.
\end{array}
$$


V. Let $I_{1}, \cdots, I_{n}$ be disjoint open intervals, and let $\alpha_{j}$ be the midpoint of $I_{j}$, and $\varepsilon$ and $y_{1}, \cdots, y_{n}$ be positive real numbers. Then there exists a function w as in step III, such that for each j,
(i) $w(\alpha_{j}) > y_{j}$;
(ii) If $x \in I_{j}$, then $w(x) < y_{j} + \varepsilon$;
(iii) If $x \in I_{1} \cup \cdots \cup I_{n}$, then $w(x) < \varepsilon$.
Proof: Choose $c_{j} = y_{j} + \frac{\varepsilon}{2}$ and define $v_{j}(x)$ as $v_{j}(x) = c_{j} v\left(\lambda_{j}(x - \alpha_{j})\right)$, where $\lambda_{j}$ is chosen large enough so that when $x \notin I_{j}$, $v_{j}(x) < \varepsilon / 2n$. Let $w = v_{1} + \cdots + v_{n}$. Since $I_{1}, \cdots, I_{n}$ are disjoint and $v_{j}$ achieves its maximum $c_{j}$ at $\alpha_{j}$, properties (i), (ii), and (iii) are obvious.

VI. Let $\left\{\alpha_{j}\right\}_{j = 1}^{\infty}$ and $\left\{\beta_{j}\right\}_{j = 1}^{\infty}$ be disjoint countable subsets of $R^{1}$. Then there exists a real-valued function F on $R^{1}$, differentiable everywhere, such that $F^{\prime}(\alpha_{j}) = 1$ and $F^{\prime}(\beta_{j}) < 1$ for all j, and $0 < F^{\prime}(x) \leq 1$ for all x.
Proof: We construct $F^{\prime} = f = \sum_{n = 1}^{\infty} w_{n}$ as in step IV to obtain F. Or more precisely, we construct the partial sum $\hat{f}_{n} = \sum_{k = 1}^{\infty} w_{k}$, so that it satisfies

$$
\begin{array}{c}
f_{n}(\alpha_{j}) > 1 - \frac{1}{n}, 1 \leq j \leq n,
\\(A_{n}) f_{n}(x) < 1 - \frac{1}{n + 1}, x \in R^{1},
\\(B_{n}) w_{n}(\beta_{j}) < \frac{1}{2n \cdot 2^{n}}, 1 \leq j \leq n .
(C_{n})
\end{array}
$$

If achieved, we have

$$
\begin{array}{l}

F^{\prime}(\alpha_{j}) = \lim_{n \to \infty} f_{n}(\alpha_{j}) = 1,
\\0 < F^{\prime}(x) = \lim_{n \to \infty} f_{n}(x) \leq 1,
\end{array}
$$

and for $n > j$,

$$
\begin{array}{c}
F^{\prime}(\beta_{j}) = f_{n-1}(\beta_{j}) + \sum_{k = n}^{\infty} w_{k}(\beta_{j}) < 1 - \frac{1}{n} + \sum_{k = n}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2k \cdot 2^{k}} \\< 1 - \frac{1}{n} + \frac{1}{2n} \cdot 1 = 1 - \frac{1}{2n} < 1.
\end{array}
$$

Thus, we get the required F. We construct $f_{n}$ and $w_{n}$ inductively. First, take an open interval $I_{1}$ with $\alpha_{1}$ as its midpoint, and $\beta_{1} \in I_{1}$. Apply step V (taking $\varepsilon = y_{1} = 1/4$) to get $f_{1} = w_{1}$ satisfying $\left(A_{1}\right), \left(B_{1}\right), \left(C_{1}\right)$. For $n > 1$, and assuming $f_{n-1}$ and $I_{n-1}$ satisfying $\left(A_{n-1}\right), \left(B_{n-1}\right), \left(C_{n-1}\right)$, take disjoint open intervals $I_{1}, \cdots, I_{n}$, such that for $j \in \{1, \cdots, n\}$, $\alpha_{j}$ is the midpoint of $I_{j}$ and $I_{j} \cap \left\{\beta_{1}, \cdots, \beta_{n}\right\} = \emptyset$, and $f_{n-1}(x) < f_{n-1}(\alpha_{j}) + \delta$, for $x \in I_{j}$, where $\delta = \frac{1}{n(n + 1)} - \frac{1}{2n \cdot 2^{n}} > 0$. Now apply step V (taking $\varepsilon = 1 / (2n \cdot 2^{n}), y_{j} = 1 - 1/n - f_{n-1}(\alpha_{j}), 1 \leq j \leq n$) to get $w_{n}$.

(C_{n}) is obvious. For $1 \leq j \leq n$, we have $f_{n}(\alpha_{j}) = f_{n-1}(\alpha_{j}) + w_{n}(\alpha_{j}) > f_{n-1}(\alpha_{j}) + y_{j} = 1 - \frac{1}{n}$, thus satisfying $\left(A_{n}\right)$. To verify $\left(B_{n}\right)$ is satisfied, note: If $x \in I_{j}$, then

$$
\begin{aligned}
f_{n}(x) &= f_{n-1}(x) + w_{n}(x) < f_{n-1}(\alpha_{j}) + \delta + y_{j} + \varepsilon \\
&= 1 - \frac{1}{n} + \frac{1}{n(n + 1)} = 1 - \frac{1}{n + 1};\end{aligned}
$$

and when $x \notin \bigcup_{j=1}^{n} I_{j}$,

$f_{n}(x) = f_{n-1}(x) + w_{n}(x) < 1 - \frac{1}{n} + \varepsilon < 1 - \frac{1}{n + 1}$.

VII. Let $ \left\{\alpha_{j}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}, \left\{\beta_{i}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}$ be disjoint dense subsets of $R^{1}$. Apply step VI to get differentiable functions F and G on $R^{1}$ such that for all j and x,

$$
\begin{array}{c}
F^{\prime}(\alpha_{j}) = G^{\prime}(\beta_{j}) = 1,
G^{\prime}(\alpha_{j}) < 1,
F^{\prime}(\beta_{j}) < 1,
0 < F^{\prime}(x) \leq 1,
0 < G^{\prime}(x) \leq 1.
\end{array}
$$
Let $H = F - G$, then for all j, x,
$H^{\prime}(\alpha_{j}) > 0, H^{\prime}(\beta_{j}) < 0, -1 < H^{\prime}(x) < 1$. Given that $\left\{\alpha_{j}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}$ and $\left\{\beta_{i}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}$ are dense in $R^{1}$, H cannot be strictly monotonic on any interval. The above construction is due to Katznelson and Stromberg.

Note: We denote by D[a, b] the set of functions defined on [a, b] that have a bounded derivative $(f^{\prime}(a) = f^{\prime}(a+), f^{\prime}(b) = f^{\prime}(b-))$. For $f \in D[a, b]$, let $\|f\| = \sup_{a \leq x \leq b} |f(x)| + \sup_{a \leq x \leq b} \left|f^{\prime}(x)\right|$. Let $D_{0}[a, b] = \{f \in D[a, b]: f \text{ nowhere monotonic }\}$. $D_{0}[a, b]$ is non-empty. Tibor Salat pointed out that $D_{0}[a, b]$ is nowhere dense in D[a, b].
chinese_rationale: 我们要构造一个在 $R^{1}$上处处可微的实值函数  H ， 它在$R^{1}$ 的任何非空子区间上都不单调，并且H有界。我们分七步进行。I. 设  r， s  是实数。(i) 若  $r>s>0$ ， 则  $(r-s) /\left(r^{2}-s^{2}\right)<2 / r $。(ii) 若  $r>1， s>1 $， 则 $(r+s-2) /\left(r^{2}+s^{2}-2\right)<2/s $。证 (i) 是明显的(ii等价于$(r-s)^{2}+(r-1)(s-1)+r^{2}+r+3 s>5$。而这个式子当$  r>1， s>1  $应也是明显的。II. 设$v(x)=(1+|x|)^{-\frac{1}{2}}， x \in R^{\prime}$ 。 a， b  是相异实数， 则$\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) d x<4 \min \{v(a)， v(b)\} $。证 设$a<b$， 当 $ 0 \leqslant a$  时， 由第 I 步有$\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) d x=\frac{2(\sqrt{1+b}-\sqrt{{1+a}})}{(\mathbf{1}+{b})-(1+a)} \\<\frac{4}{\sqrt{1+b}}=4 \min \{v(a)， v(b)\} 。\end{array}$因为$v(-x)=v(x) $， 故 $b \leqslant 0$ 时不必特别考虑， 因而设 $a<0<b$。此时由第 I 步得 $\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(x) d x=\frac{2(\sqrt{1+b}-\sqrt{{1+a}}-2)}{(\mathbf{1}+{b})-(1+a)-2} \\<4 \min \{v(a)， v(b)\} \end{array}$ III. 若  v  如第 II 步，  w  是形如$w(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}cv[\lambda_{n}(x-\alpha_{n})]$的任一函数， 其中$c_{1}， c_{2}， \cdots， c_{2}  $与  $\lambda_{1}， \lambda_{2}， \cdots， \lambda_{n} $ 是正实数， $ \alpha_{1}， \alpha_{2}， \cdots ，  \alpha_{n}$  是任意实数， 则$\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{x}^{b} w(x) d x<4 \min \{w(a)， w(b))$ 。证 这由第II步及$\frac{1}{b-a} \int_{a}^{b} v(\lambda(x-\alpha)) d x=\frac{1}{\lambda(b-\alpha)-\lambda(a-\alpha)} \int_{\lambda(a-\alpha)}^{\lambda(b-\alpha)} v(t) d t$直接得到。IV. 设$\left\{w_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  是如第 III步的函数的任一序列。 对 $x \in R^{1}$ 及每个  n  定义$W_{n}(x)=\int_{0}^{x} w_{n}(t) d t$。设对某个 $a \in R^{1}$， $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} w_{n}(a)=\varepsilon<\infty $， 则级数$\boldsymbol{F}(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} W_{n}(x)$在 $ R^{\prime}$  的每个有界子集上一致收敛， 函数  F  在  a  处可微， $ F^{\prime}(a)=\varepsilon$ ，特别地， 若对所有$t \in R^{1} $，$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} w_{n}(t)=f(t)<\infty$，则  F  在  $R^{1}$  上处处可微， $F^{\prime}=f$ 。证 设 $b \in R^{1}$  满足 $b \geqslant\{a\}$ 。 利用第 III步，当$ -b \leqslant x \leqslant b $时，$\begin{aligned}\left|W_{n}(x)\right| & \leqslant\left|\int_{0}^{a} w_{n}(t) d t\right|+\left|\int_{a}^{x} w_{n}(t) d t\right| \\& \leqslant 4|a| w_{n}(a)+4|{x}-a| w_{n}(a) \\& \leqslant 12 b v v_{n}(a)\end{aligned}$于是， 从Weierstrass  M -判别法可得级数$F(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} W_{n}(x)$在  $[-b， b]$  上的一致收敛性。为证$ F^{\prime}(a)=\varepsilon $; 设  $\varepsilon>0$  为已知，取$n_{0}$使$10 \sum_{n=n++1}^{\infty} w_{n}(a)<\varepsilon$。由于每个$\omega_{n}$在a连续; 存在某个$\delta>0$ ， 使 $ 0<|n|<\delta_{n}$， $1 \leqslant n \leqslant n_{0} $ 时$\left|\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) d t-w_{n}(\boldsymbol{a})\right|<\frac{\varepsilon}{2 n_{0}}$。因此， 再次利用第III 步， 当$ 0<|h|<\delta$ 时, $\begin{array}{l}\left|\frac{F(a+h)-F(a)}{h}-s\right|=\left|\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left[\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) d t-w_{n}(a)\right]\right| \\\leqslant \sum_{n=1}^{n_{0}}\left|\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) d t-w_{n}(a)\right| \\+\sum_{n-\kappa \mathrm{Na}^{+1}}^{\infty}\left\lceil\frac{1}{h} \int_{a}^{a+h} w_{n}(t) d t+w_{n}(a)\right] \\<\frac{\varepsilon}{2}+\sum_{n=n+1}^{\infty} 5 w_{n}(a)<\varepsilon .\end{array}$ V. 设 $I_{1}， \cdots， I_{n}$ 是不相交的开区间，  $\alpha_{j}$  是 $I_{j}$ 的中点，  $\varepsilon $ 和$ y_{1}， \cdots， y_{\mathrm{n}}$  是正实数。则存在如第 III 步的函数  w ， 使对每个  j ，(i)$ w\left(\alpha_{j}\right)>y_{j} $;(ii) 若  $x \in I_{y}$ ， 则  $w(x)<y_{j}+\varepsilon$；(iii) 若 $x \in I_{k} U \cdots U I_{n} $， 则  $w(x)<\varepsilon$。证 取  $c_{j}=y_{j}+\frac{\varepsilon}{2}$ ， 定义$v_{j}(x)$  为  $v_{j}(x)=c_{j} v\left(\lambda_{j}(x-\alpha_{j})\right)  )$， 其中$  \lambda_{j} $ 选得如此之大， 使  $x \bar{\epsilon} I_{j}$  时 $ v_{j}(x)<\varepsilon / 2 n $ (只需要对 $ I_{j} $ 的一个端点检查这个不等式)。 取$w=v_{1}+\cdots+v_{n}$。因为 $ I_{1}， \cdots， I_{n}$  不相交， 并且  $v_{j}$  在  $\alpha_{j}$  取得它的最大值 $ c_{j}$ ， 故性质 (i)， (ii)， (iii) 是显然的。VI. 设  $\left\{\alpha_{j}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}，\left\{\beta_{j}\right\}_{j=1}^{\infty}$  是$ R^{1}$  的不相交可数子集， 则存在 $R^{1}$ 上的处处可微的实值函数  F ， 对所有  j  满足  $F^{\prime}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)=1， F^{\prime}\left(\beta_{j}\right)<1 $，对所有  x  满足 $ 0<F^{\prime}(x) \leqslant 1$ 。证 我们先构造 $\boldsymbol{F}^{\prime}=f=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}w_{n}$  如第 IV步那样得到  F ， 或者更严格地说， 先构造部分和 $\hat{f}_{n}=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} w_{k}$ ， 使之满足$\begin{array}{c}f_{n}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)>1-\frac{1}{n}， 1 \leqslant j \leqslant n， \\(A_{n})f_{n}(x)<1-\frac{1}{n+1}， x \in R^{1}， \\(B_{n})w_{n}\left(\beta_{j}\right)<\frac{1}{2 n \cdot 2^{n}}， 1 \leqslant j \leqslant n 。(C_{n})\end{array}$如果这样做了， 便有$\begin{array}{l}F^{\prime}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)=1， \\0<F^{\prime}(x)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) \leqslant 1，\end{array}$同时， 取 $ n>j$ ， \\<1-\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{2 n} \cdot 1=1-\frac{1}{2 n}<1 。\end{array}$这样，我们得到了所要求的  F 。我们归纳地构造 $ f_{n}， w_{n} $。 先取开区间$  I_{1} $， 它以 $ \alpha_{1}$  为中点， 而  $\beta_{1} \in I_{1}$ 。应用第 V步 (取  $的  $f_{n-1}， i_{n-1} $ 已经取得。 取不相交的开区间  $I_{1}， \cdots， I_{n}$ ， 使对  $j \in\{1， \cdots， n\}$， $\alpha_{j}$  是$ I_{j}$的中点， $ I_{j} \cap\left\{\beta_{1}， \cdots， \beta_{n}\right\}=\phi $，$f_{n-1}(x)<f_{n-1}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)+\delta， x \in I_{j}$，其中$\delta=\frac{1}{n(n+1)}-\frac{1}{2 n \cdot 2^{n}} >0 \text {。 }$现在， 应用第V步 (取 $ \varepsilon=1 /\left(2 n \cdot 2^{n}\right)， y_{j}=1-1 / n-f_{\mathrm{s}-1}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)， 1 \leqslant j   \leqslant n $)  得到  $w_{n}$，$\left(C_{n}\right)$  显然是满足的。 又，  $1 \leqslant j \leqslant n $ 时$f_{n}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)=f_{n-1}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)+w_{n}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)>f_{n-1}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)+y_{j}=1-\frac{1}{n}$，从而满足  $\left(A_{n}\right)$ ， 为检查 $ \left(B_{n}\right)$ ，$\begin{array}{c}F^{\prime}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)=G^{\prime}\left(\beta_{j}\right)=1， G^{\prime}\left(\alpha_{j}\right)<1， F^{\prime}\left(\beta_{j}\right)<1， \\0<F^{\prime}(x) \leqslant statement: The generalized (R) double integral $\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d x d y $ exists, and for each $ x \in [0,1]$, the integral $ \int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y $ exists, but the iterated integral $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x,y) d y$ may not exist for the function f.
chinese_statement: 广义  (R)  二重积分  $\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x d y $ 存在， 且对每一 $ x \in   [0，1]$ ， 积分 $ \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y $ 存在，但累次积分  $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x，y)  d y$  不存在的函数  f  。
rationale: Define the function f on $[0,1] \times [0,1]$ as follows: $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2^{n}, x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n} \text{ and } 0<y \leqslant 1 / 2^{n}, \\ n=1,2, \cdots ; m=1,2, \cdots, 2^{n-1}, \\ 0, \text{ otherwise. }\end{array}\right.$ For any $\varepsilon>0 $, on the rectangle $[0,1] \times [\varepsilon, 1]$, the function f is non-zero only on a finite number of line segments (i.e., lines satisfying $1 / 2^{n} \geqslant \varepsilon$, i.e., $x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n} $), so $\iint_{0,1] \times [\varepsilon, 1]} f(x, y) d x d y=0$. As $\varepsilon \rightarrow 0$, we get $\iint_{[0,1} f(x, y) d x d y=0$. In other words, the generalized (R) double integral of f on $[0,1] \times [0,1]$ exists. On the other hand, for any $ x \in [0,1]$, if $ x \neq (2 m-1) / 2^{n}$, then $f(x, y)=0$, thus $\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y=0$. If $x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n}$, then $\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2 ^{n}}} f(x, y) d y=1$. Therefore, for each $x \in [0,1]$, the integral $\int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y$ exists. Since the set of points of the form $(2m-1) / 2^{n}$ is dense in [0,1], the function $\varphi(x)$ is nowhere continuous on [0,1], hence the iterated integral $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x, y) d y$ does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 在  $[0，1] \times[0，1]$  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2^{n}， x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n} \text { 且 } 0<y \leqslant 1 / 2^{n}， \\n=1，2， \cdots ; m=1，2， \cdots， 2^{n-1}， \\0， \text { 在其它情形。 }\end{array}\right.$对任意的 $\varepsilon>0 $， 在矩形  $[0，1] \times[\varepsilon， 1]$  上， 函数  f  只在有限个直线段上(即满足  $1 / 2^{n} \geqslant \varepsilon$  的直线即  $x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n} $ 上) 异于 0 ， 故$\iint_{0，1] \times[\varepsilon， 1]} f(x， y) d x d y=0$ 。当  $\varepsilon \rightarrow 0$  时， 就可得到$\iint_{[0，1} f(x， y) d x d y=0 $\text {。 }也就是说，  f  在  $[0，1] \times[0，1]$  上的广义  (R)  二重积分存在。另一方面， 任取 $ x \in[0，1]$ ， 若 $ x \neq(2 m-1) / 2^{n}$ ， 则  $f(x， y)=0 $，从而$\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y=0$ 。若  $x=(2 m-1) / 2^{n}$ ， 则$\varphi(x)=\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2 ^{n}}} f(x， y) d y=1$ 。因此， 对每一  $x \in[0，1]$ ， 积分$\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$存在。 由于形如  $(2m-1) / 2^{n}$  的点的全体在  [0，1]  内是稠密的， 所以函数  $\varphi(x)$  在  [0，1]  上无处连续， 从而累次积分$\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$不存在。

statement: There exist sequence of functions $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  and $ \left\{g_{n}\right\}$ on $[0, +\infty)$ such that $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\} $ and $\left\{\boldsymbol{g}_{n}\right\}$ converge in measure to f and g on $[0, +\infty)$ respectively, but $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$ does not converge in measure to $fg$ on $[0, +\infty)$.
chinese_statement: 存在$[0，+\infty)$  上的函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  和 $ \left\{g_{n}\right\}$ ， 使  $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\} $ 和  $\left\{\boldsymbol{g}_{n}\right\}$  在  $[0 ，  +\infty)$  上分别依测度收敛于  f  和  g ， 而 $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$  在  $[0，+\infty)$  上并不依测度收敛于$fg$。
rationale: Let's first introduce the concept of convergence in measure. Let E be a measurable set, $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence of almost everywhere finite measurable functions on E. If there is an almost everywhere finite measurable function f on E, such that for any positive number $\sigma$, it holds that $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x)-f(x)\right| \geqslant \sigma\right]=0$, then $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ is said to converge in measure to f on E. It is easy to prove that if $m E < +\infty$, and $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$ converge in measure to f and g on E respectively, then $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$ converges in measure to $f g$ on E. It should be noted that in this proposition, the condition $mE < +\infty$ cannot be omitted. For example, on $B = [0, +\infty)$, define functions as follows: $\begin{array}{c}f(x)=0, g_{n}(x)=x, g(x)=x, \\f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \in[0, n); \\1 / x, x \in[n, +\infty),\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ then for any positive number $\sigma$, when n is sufficiently large, $E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x)-f(x)\right| \geqslant \sigma\right]=\Phi$. Therefore, $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ converges in measure to f on E. Also, $\left\{g_{n}\right\} $ obviously converges in measure to g on E. However, $ \left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\} $ does not converge in measure to $f g \equiv 0$ on E, because for any positive integer n, it holds that $E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x) g_{n}(x)-0\right| \geqslant 1\right]=[n, +\infty)$, hence $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x) g_{n}(x)\right| \geqslant 1\right]=+\infty$.
chinese_rationale: 我们先引进依测度收敛的概念。设  E  为一可测集， $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  是  E  上的几乎处处有限的可测函数序列。如果E上的几乎处处有限的可测函数f，使对任意正数$\sigma$都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x)-f(x)\right| \geqslant \sigma\right]=0，$则称 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上依测度收敛于  f。容易证明， 若  $m E<+\infty $， 且$ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  和  $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上分别依测度收敛于  f  和  g ， 则  $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上依测度收敛于$f g$ 。 应当注意， 在这个命题中， 条件  $mE<+\infty $ 是不能去掉的。例如， 在  $B=[0，+\infty)$  上，如下定义函数:$\begin{array}{c}f(x)=0， g_{n}(x)=x， g(x)=x， \\f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \in[0， n) ; \\1 / x， x \in[n，+\infty)，\end{array}\right.\end{array}$则对任意正数  $\sigma$ ， 当  n  充分大后， 就有$E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x)-f(x)\right| \geqslant \sigma\right]=\Phi$。因此，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  E  上依测度收敛于  f 。 又，  $\left\{g_{n}\right\} $ 在  E  上显然依测度收敛于 g。 但是， $ \left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\} $ 在  E  上并不依测度收敛于 $f g \equiv 0$， 这是因为对任意正整数  n ， 恒有$E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x) g_{n}(x)-0\right| \geqslant 1\right]=[n，+\infty)，$从而$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E\left[x:\left|f_{n}(x) g_{n}(x)\right| \geqslant 1\right]=+\infty \text {。 }$

statement: There exist two functions f and g that are both differentiable at the point $x_{0}$, but such that the functions $\max \{f, g\}$ and $\min \{f, g\}$ are both non-differentiable at $x_{0}$.
chinese_statement: 存在两个在点$x_{0}$  均可微， 而使$\max \{f， g\} $ 与 $ \min \{f， g\}$ 在  $x_{0}$  都不可微的函数  f  和  g。
rationale: Let $f(x)=x-a, \quad g(x) \equiv 0$, then both $f$ and $g$ are differentiable at $x=a$. However, it is easy to see that the maximum function and minimum function $\max \{f, g\}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-a, & x \geqslant a, \\ 0, & x<a, \end{array}\right.$ and $\min \{f, g\}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-a, & x<a \\ 0, & x \geqslant a. \end{array}\right.$ are both non-differentiable at x=a. Note: It is easy to prove that if f and g are differentiable at a, and $f(a) \neq g(a)$, then $max\{f, g\}$ and $\min \{f, g\}$ are also differentiable at a. The above counterexample illustrates that in this statement, the condition $f(a) \neq g(a)$ cannot be omitted.
chinese_rationale: 设 $ f(x)=x-a， \quad g(x) \equiv 0 $， 则 $ f$  和$  g$  在$x=a$ 处均可微。 然而， 容易看出， 最大值函数和最小值函数$\max \{f， g\}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-a， & x \geqslant a， \\0， & x<a，\end{array}\right.$和$\min \{f， g\}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x-a， & x<a \\0， & x \geqslant a 。\end{array}\right.$在  x=a  均不可微。注： 容易证明， 若  f， g  在  a  处可微， 且$f(a) \neq g(a)$ ， 则 $max\{f， g\} $ 和  $\min \{f， g\}$  在 a处也可微，上述反列说明了在这个陈述中， 条件 $f(a) \neq g(a)$是不能去掉的。

statement: There exists a subset within the unit square $[0, 1] \times [0, 1]$ that is dense in $[0, 1] \times [0, 1]$ but nowhere dense on any line parallel to the coordinate axes.
chinese_statement: 存在单位正方形$[0，1] \times[0，1]$  内的一个子集， 它在 $[0，1] \times[0，1]$内稠密，但在任一平行于坐标轴的直线上都是无处稠密的。
rationale: Let E be the set of such points $(x, y)$ in the square $I=\{(x, y):0\le x\le1, 0\le y\le 1\}$ where the numbers x and y can be expressed as finite binary decimals, and the finite digits in the binary decimal expression of x are the same as those in y. Thus, if $x^{\prime}$ can be expressed as a finite binary decimal, there are only finitely many points $\left(x^{\prime}, y^{\prime}\right) \in E$. Similarly, if $y^{\prime}$ can be expressed as a finite binary decimal, then on the line $y=y^{\prime}$ there are only finitely many points $\left(x^{\prime}, y^{\prime}\right) \in E$. Therefore, the intersections of E with each line parallel to the coordinate axes $x=x^{\prime}$ and $y=y^{\prime}$, given by $E_{x^{\prime}}=\left\{y^{\prime}:\left(x^{\prime}, y^{\prime}\right) \in E\right\}$ and $E_{y^{\prime}}=\left\{x^{\prime}:\left(x^{\prime}, y^{\prime}\right) \in E\right\}$, respectively, are nowhere dense on the lines $x=x^{\prime}$ and $y=y^{\prime}$. Now to prove that E is dense in the square I, consider the line $y=x+a$, where a represents a positive or negative finite binary decimal. Then, for those x with a finite binary decimal expression longer than that of a, by the equation $y=x+a$, y has the same number of digits as x, so $(x, y)\in E$. Therefore, the intersection of E with $y=x+a$ is dense in the intersection of I with $y=x+a$. Since the collection of a values is dense in the interval [-1, 1], E is also dense in I.
chinese_rationale: 设E是正方形$I=\{(x，y):0\le x\le1，0\le y\le 1\}$中的这样的点$(x，y)$所成之集，数x，y可表成有穷位数的二进位小数表达式，而且  x  与  y  的二进位小数表达式中的有穷位数是相同的。于是， 如果$ x^{\prime}$可表成有穷位数的二进位小数表达式，那么$x=x^{\prime}$上只有有限多个点$ \left(x^{\prime}， y^{\prime}\right) \in E $ 。 同理，如果  $y^{\prime}$  可表成有穷位数的二连位小数表达式，那么，在直线  $y=y^{\prime}$  上也只有有限多个点 $ \left(x^{\prime}， y^{\prime}\right) \in   E$ 。由此可知，  E 与每一条平行于坐标轴的直线 $x=x^{\prime}$  之交 $ E_{x^{\prime}}=   \left\{y^{\prime}:\left(x^{\prime}， y^{\prime}\right) \in E\right\}$  和 $ y=y^{\prime}$之交$E_{y^{\prime}}=\left\{x^{\prime}:\left(x^{\prime}， y^{\prime}\right) \in E\right\}$  分别在直线$x=x^{\prime}$和$y=y^{\prime}$上是无处稠密的。兹证，  E  在正方形  I  内是稠密的。为此，我们考察直线  $y=   x+a$ ， 其中，  a  代表正的或负的有穷二进位小数表达式。于是，对于有穷二进位小数表达式中位数大于  a  的位数的那些x，由等式$y=x+a$可知，y与x有相同的位数，从而$(x，y)\in E$。因此，E与$y=x+a$的交口在I与$y=x+a$的交口中是稠密的。由于a的全体在区间[-1，1]中是稠密的，因而E在I中也是稠密的。

statement: Young's criterion for convergence and de la Vallée Poussin's criterion for convergence do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: Young 判敛法与 de la Vallée Poussin 判敛法互不蕴涵。
rationale:
First case: Fourier series where de la Vallée Poussin's criterion fails but Young's criterion can be applied. Define function f on $(-\pi, \pi)$ as follows: $f(t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l} \sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) / \ln \frac{1}{t}, t > 0, \\ 0, \\ t = 0, \\ \sin \left(\ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)\right) / \ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right), t < 0. \end{array} \right.$ Then, at $x = 0$, $\begin{aligned} \varphi_{x}(t) & = f(t) + f(-t) = \\ & = \left\{ \begin{array}{l} 2 \sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) / \ln \frac{1}{t}, t > 0, \\ 2 \sin \left(\ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)\right) / \ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right), t < 0. \end{array} \right. \end{aligned}$ Thus, $\Phi_{x}(t) = \frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \phi_{x}(u) d u = 0(1) \quad (t \rightarrow 0)$. When $t \rightarrow 0+$, $\begin{aligned} & \int_{0}^{t} \left| d\left(u \varphi_{x}(u)\right) \right| \\ = & 2 \int_{0}^{t} \left\{ \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} - \frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} + \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)^{2}} \right\} d u \\ = & O(t). \end{aligned}$ Thus, by Young's criterion, we know the Fourier series of f converges to $f(0)$ at $x=0$. However, we can prove that for any positive number e, the function $\Psi(t) = \frac{2}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} d u$ is not of bounded variation on $[0, e]$. In fact, $\begin{aligned} \Psi(t) = & \frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{1}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} \cdot \frac{d}{d u}\left\{ u \left[ \cos \left(\ln -\frac{1}{u}\right) + \sin \left(\ln -\frac{1}{u}\right) \right] \right\} d u \\ = & \frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) + \sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{t}} - \frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right) + \sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)^{2}} d u, \end{aligned}$ the last term is $O\left(\left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)^{-2}\right)(t \rightarrow 0)$. Therefore, $\begin{aligned} \Psi^{\prime}(t) & = 2 \frac{\varphi_{x}(t) - \Psi(t)}{t} = \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) - \cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{2 t \ln \frac{1}{t}} + O\left[ \frac{1}{t(\ln t)^{2}} \right]. \end{aligned}$ The unsigned term belongs to $L[0, e]$, we are to show the integral, $\begin{aligned} & \int_{0}^{t} \left| \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) - \cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{t \ln \frac{1}{t}} \right| d t \\ = & 2 \int_{\ln \frac{1}{t}}^{\infty} \left| \frac{\sin v - \cos v}{v} \right| d v \end{aligned}$ is divergent. Actually, let k be a natural number, in which $\begin{aligned} \int_{2 k \pi - \frac{\pi}{4}}^{2 k\pi} \frac{|\cos v - \sin v|}{v} d v & > \frac{1}{2k \pi} \int_{\frac{\pi}{4}}^{0} |\cos v - \sin v| d v \\ & > \frac{1}{8 k}, \end{aligned}$. Summing over k, we know $\int_{\ln \frac{1}{t}}^{\infty} \frac{|\sin v - \cos v|}{v} d v = +\infty$, implying $\left. \int_{0}^{1} | \Psi^{\prime}(t) \right| d t = +\infty$. Hence, $\Psi(t)$ is not of bounded variation on $[0, e]$, thus does not satisfy the conditions of de la Vallée Poussin's criterion.
Second case: Fourier series where Young's criterion fails but de la Vallée Poussin's criterion can be applied. The function in the first example of Example 2 satisfies the conditions of Dini's criterion, thereby also satisfying the conditions of de la Vallée Poussin's criterion, but it does not meet the conditions of Young's criterion.
chinese_rationale:
第一例: de la Vallée Poussin判敛法失效但能用Young判敛法的 Fourier 级数。在 $(-\pi， \pi)$  上定义函数f如 下:$f(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) / \ln \frac{1}{t}， t>0， \\0， \\t=0， \\\sin \left(\ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)\right) / \ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)， t<0 。\end{array}\right.$于是， 在  $x=0$  处，$\begin{aligned}\varphi_{x}(t) & =f(t)+f(-t)= \\& =\left\{\begin{array}{l}2 \sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right) / \ln \frac{1}{t}， t>0， \\2 \sin \left(\ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)\right) / \ln \left(-\frac{1}{t}\right)， t<0 。\end{array}\right.\end{aligned}$因此，$\Phi_{x}(t)=\frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \phi_{x}(u) d u=0(1) \quad(t \rightarrow 0)$。又当  $t \rightarrow 0+$ 时，$\begin{aligned}& \int_{0}^{t}\left|d\left(u \varphi_{x}(u)\right)\right| \\= & 2 \int_{0}^{t}\left\{\frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}}-\frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}}+\frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)^{2}}\right\} d u \\= & O(t) 。\end{aligned}$故由 Young 判敛法可知，  f  的 Fourier 级数在$x=0$处收敛 于 $ f(0)=0$。但是， 我们可以证明对任意的正数  e ， 函数$\Psi(t)=\frac{2}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} d u$在$ [0， e]$上并非有界变差。 事实上，$\begin{aligned}\Psi(t)= & \frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{1}{\ln \frac{1}{u}} \cdot \frac{d}{d u}\left\{u\left[\cos \left(\ln -\frac{1}{u}\right)+\sin \left(\ln -\frac{1}{u}\right)\right]\right\} d u \\= & \frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)+\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{\ln \frac{1}{t}} . \\& -\frac{1}{t} \int_{0}^{t} \frac{\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)+\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)}{\left(\ln \frac{1}{u}\right)^{2}} d u，\end{aligned}$末项是$O\left(\left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)^{-2}\right)(t \rightarrow 0)$ 。 因此，$\begin{aligned}\Psi^{\prime}(t) & =2 \frac{\varphi_{x}(t)-\Psi(t)}{t} \\& =2 \frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)-\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{2 t \ln \frac{1}{t}}+O\left[\frac{1}{t(\ln t)^{2}}\right] 。\end{aligned}$未项属于$L[0， e]$ ， 我们要证积分$\begin{aligned}& \int_{0}^{t}\left|\frac{\sin \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)-\cos \left(\ln \frac{1}{t}\right)}{t \ln \frac{1}{t}}\right| d t \\= & 2 \int_{\ln \frac{1}{t}}^{\infty}\left|\frac{\sin v-\cos v}{v}\right| d v\end{aligned}$是发散的。实际上， 设  k  是一自然数， 则因$\begin{aligned}\int_{2 k \pi-\frac{\pi}{4}}^{2 k\pi} \frac{|\cos v-\sin v|}{v} d v & >\frac{1}{2 k \pi} \int_{\frac{\pi}{4}}^{0}|\cos v-\sin v| d v \\& >\frac{1}{8 k}，\end{aligned}$关于  k  相加， 就知道$\int_{\ln \frac{1}{t}}^{\infty} \frac{|\sin v-\cos v|}{v} d v=+\infty $\text {， }由是$\left.\int_{0}^{1} \mid \Psi^{\prime}(t)\right\} d t=+\infty$，即  $\Psi(t) $ 在  $[0， e]$  上不是有界变差的， 从而不 满足 de la Val1ée Poussin 判敛法的条件。
第二例: Young 判敛法失效但能用 de la Vallée Poussin判敛法的 Fourjer 级数。例 2 的第一例中的函数满足 Dini 判敛法的条件， 从而也满足 de la Vallée Poussin 判敛法的条件， 但它并不满足 Young判敛法时条件。

statement: There exists a measurable subset within the unit square that cannot be expressed as a countable union of 'rectangles'.
chinese_statement: 存在单位正方形内的一个可测子集， 它不能表成可数个“矩形”的并集。
rationale: For example: Let C be the Cantor set with positive measure in [0,1], and let $S=\{(x, y): x-y \in C, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1, 0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1\}$. It is demonstrated that if $A \times B \subset S$, then either $m A=0$, or $m B=0$. In fact, $A \times B \subset S$ implies $A-B=\{x-y: x \in A, y \in B\} \subset C$. If $m A>0$ and $m B>0$, then $A-B$ would have a non-empty interior. This is a contradiction. Since $A \times B \subset S$ implies $m A=0$ or $m B=0$, and S has positive measure, S cannot be expressed as a countable union of 'rectangles'.
chinese_rationale: 例如：设  C  为  [0，1]  中具有正测度的 Cantor 集， 令$S=\{(x， y): x-y \in C， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1，0 \leqslant y \leqslant 1\}$ .兹证，若$ A \times B \subset S$ ， 则或者有$m A=0$ ， 或者有$ m B=0$。事实上，$A   \times B \subset S$蕴涵了$A-B=\{x-y: x \in A， y \in B\} \subset C $。若  $m A>0$  且  $m B>0$ ， 则 $ A-B$  将有非空的内部。 此为矛盾。因为  $A \times B \subset S $ 蕴涵 $ m A=0$  或  $m B=0 $， 而  S  具有正测度， 所以  S  不能表成可数个“矩形”的并集。

statement: There exists a function that is symmetrically continuous at a point but not continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在在某点对称连续而不连续的函数。
rationale: A function f is said to be symmetrically continuous at $x_{0} \in R^{1}$ if $\lim _{h \rightarrow 0}\left[f\left(x_{0}+h\right)-f\left(x_{0}-h\right)\right]=0$. If f is symmetrically continuous at every point $x \in R^{1}$, then f is said to be symmetrically continuous on $R^{1}$. It is easy to prove that if a function f is continuous at $x_{0}$, then it is also symmetrically continuous at that point. However, the converse does not hold. For example, let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number. }\end{array}\right.$ then when $ x_{0}$ is a rational number, there is $\lim _{h \rightarrow 0}\left[f\left(x_{0}+h\right)-f\left(x_{0}-h\right)\right]=0$, i.e., f is symmetrically continuous at any rational point. However, f is nowhere continuous.
chinese_rationale: 称函数  f  在  $x_{0} \in R^{1}$  处是对称连续的，如果$\lim _{h \rightarrow 0}\left[f\left(x_{0}-h\right)-f\left(x_{0}-h\right)\right]=0 $。若  f  在每一点  $x \in R^{1}$  都是对称连续的， 就说  f  在  $R^{1} $ 上对称连续。容易证明， 若函数  f  在  $x_{0}$  处连续， 则其亦必在该点对称连续。但逆命题并不成立。 例如， 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$则当 $ x_{0}$  为有理数时， 就有$\lim _{h \rightarrow 0}\left[f\left(x_{0}+h\right)-f\left(x_{0}-h\right)\right]=0$，即f在任一有理点都是对称连续的。然而，f是无处连续的。

statement: There exists a decreasing sequence of measurable sets $\left\{E_{n}\right\}$ such that $m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right) \neq \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E_{n}$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个渐缩的可测集序列  $\left\{E_{n}\right\}$ , 使  $m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right) \neq \lim _{n+\infty} m E_{n}$ 。
rationale: Consider $E_{n}=\{x: x \geqslant n\}$ in $R^{\prime}$, then $m E_{n}=+\infty$, while $m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right)=0$, so $m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right) \neq \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E_{n}$.
chinese_rationale: 在  $R^{\prime}$  中取  $E_{n}=\{x: x \geqslant n\}$ , 则  $m E_{n}=+\infty$ , 而  $m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right)=0$ ,所以$m\left(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} E_{n}\right) \neq \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m E_{n}$ 。

statement: There exists an $ (\boldsymbol{R}) $ integrable function on any interval that does not have an antiderivative.
chinese_statement: 存在在任何区间上都没有原函数的 $ (\boldsymbol{R}) $ 可积函数。
rationale: Let $r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}, \cdots$ be all the rational numbers in the interval [0, 1]. Define the function f on [0, 1] as strictly increasing, and f is discontinuous at any rational point and continuous at any irrational point in [0, 1]. Moreover, the jump at the point $r_{n}$ is exactly $1 / 2^{n}$, i.e., $\lim _{x \rightarrow r_{n}^{+}} f(x)-\lim _{x \rightarrow r_{n}^{-}} f(x)=\frac{1}{2^{n}}$. Since f is monotonic decreasing on [0, 1], it is (R) integrable on [0, 1]. However, since the set of jump discontinuities of f is dense in [0, 1], f cannot have an antiderivative in any non-empty sub-interval of [0, 1].
chinese_rationale: 设$r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}， \cdots $ 为区间  [0，1]  中的全体有理数， 令则函数  f  在  [0，1]  上严格递增， 且  f 在  [0，1]  中的任一有理点间断而在任一无理点连续。 又，  f  在点 $r_{n}$  处的跃度给好等于$1 / 2^{n}$ ， 即$\lim _{x \rightarrow r_{n}^{+}} f(x)-\lim _{x \rightarrow r_{n}^{-}} f(x)=\frac{1}{2^{n}}$因为  f  在  [0，1]  上单减，所以它在  [0，1]  上  (R) 可积。 但是， 由于  f  的跳跃间断点的集合在  [0，1]  中稠密， 因而  f 在  [0，1]  的任何非空子区间上都不可能有原函数。

statement: There exist sets A, B and a mapping f such that $B \subset A$ and $f(A \backslash B) \neq f(A) \backslash f(B)$.
chinese_statement: 存在集  A， B  与映射  f ， 使  $B \subset A$  而  $f(A \backslash B) \neq f(A) \backslash f(B)$ 。
rationale: Let A and B be non-empty subsets of set X, with $B \subset A$ and $B \neq A$. Let f be a mapping that maps each element of X to some fixed element a in Y. Then $f(A \backslash B)=\{a\} and $f(A) \backslash f(B)=\varnothing.$ Thus, $f(A \backslash B) \neq f(A) \backslash f(B)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  A， B  均是集  X  的非空子集，  $B \subset A$  且  $B \neq A$， f  是把  X  中的每个元映成  Y  中的某个固定元  a  的一个映射， 则$f(A \backslash B)=\left\{a\}， f(A) \backslash f(B)=\varnothing，\right.$因此，  $f(A \backslash B) \neq f(A) \backslash f(B)$ 。

statement: There exists a function f in $\boldsymbol{L}^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right) $ such that there is no sequence of continuous functions on $R^{\prime}$, $\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\}$, satisfying $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left\|\boldsymbol{f}-\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\| \mathbf{L}^{\infty}\left(\mathbf{R}^{1}\right)=0 $.
chinese_statement: 存在$\boldsymbol{L}^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right) $ 中的一个函数  f ， 使不存在$R^{\prime}$上的连续函数序列$\left\{\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\}$ ， 适合$ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left\|\boldsymbol{f}-\boldsymbol{f}_{n}\right\| \mathbf{L}^{\infty}\left(\mathbf{R}^{1}\right)=0 $。
rationale: Let $(a, b)$ be a non-empty open interval in $R^{1}$. Define a function f on $R^{1}$: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in(a, b), \\0, x \bar{\epsilon}(a, b),\end{array}\right.$ then $f \in L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)$. If there exists a sequence of continuous functions on $R^{1}$, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$, such that $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} ||f-f_{n}||_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)}=0$, then for a positive number $e(e<1 / 2) $, there should be a continuous function g on $R^{1}$, satisfying $|f-g|_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)} \leqslant \boldsymbol{\varepsilon}$. Hence, it holds almost everywhere on $R^{1}$ that $|f(x)-g(x)| \leqslant \varepsilon$. Thus, for any positive number $\delta$, there exist points $x \in(a, a+\delta), y \in(a-\delta, a)$, such that $|1-g(x)| \leqslant \varepsilon, |g(y)| \leqslant \varepsilon$. Therefore, $\limsup _{x \rightarrow a+} g(x) \geqslant 1-\varepsilon, \liminf _{x \rightarrow a-} g(x) \leqslant \varepsilon$. This contradicts the continuity of g.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(a， b)$  是  $R^{1}$  中的非空开区间，在 $R^{1}$上定义函数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in(a， b)， \\0， x \bar{\epsilon}(a， b)，\end{array}\right.$则 $f \in L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)$ 。如果存在$R^{1}$ 上的连续函数序列 $\left\{f_{2}\right\}$，使$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} ||f-f_{n}||_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)}=0$，那么对正数 $e(e<1 / 2) $而言， 就应该有 $R^{1}$上的连续函数  g ， 适合$|f-g|_{L^{\infty}\left(R^{1}\right)} \leqslant \boldsymbol{\varepsilon}$ 。由此得到在$R^{1}$上几乎处处成立着 $|f(x)-g(x)| \leqslant \varepsilon$ 。 于是， 对任意正数  $\delta$ ， 存在点  $x \in(a， a+\delta)， y \in(a-\delta， a)$ ， 使得$|1-g(x)| \leqslant \varepsilon，|g(y)| \leqslant \varepsilon \text {。 }$由此得到$\limsup _{x \rightarrow a+} g(x) \geqslant 1-\varepsilon， \liminf _{x \rightarrow a-} g(x) \leqslant \varepsilon$ 。这与  g  时连续性发生矛盾。

statement: Almost everywhere convergence and weak convergence do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: 几乎处处收敛与弱收敛互不蕴涵。
rationale:
Example 1: A sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on a measurable set E, which converges almost everywhere but is not weakly convergent for any $p \geqslant 1, \left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$. Define the sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on $(0, 1]$: $f_{n}(x)=n \varphi\left(0, \frac{1}{n}\right],$ where $\varphi_{\left(0, \frac{1}{n}\right]}$ is the characteristic function of the interval $\left(0, \frac{1}{n}\right]$. It is obvious that for any $p(1 \leqslant p< +\infty), f_{n} \in L^{p}\left(E^{\prime}\right)$, and for each $x_{0} \in E=(0,1]$, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}\left(x_{0}\right)=0$. However, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not weakly converge to $f \equiv 0$. In fact, taking $g \equiv 1$, then $g \in L^{\mathbf{p}}(E)$, here, when $p>1$ then $1 / p+1 / q=1$, and when $p=1$ then $q=+\infty$, and $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}nd x=1$. Thus, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not weakly converge to f.
Example 2: A sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$, which for any $p \geqslant 1, \left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$ and is weakly convergent, but $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge almost everywhere on E. Let $f_{n}(x)=\cos n x, x \in E=[0 , 2 \pi]; n=1, 2, \cdots $. Clearly, $f_{n} \in L^{p}(E) (p \geqslant 1)$, and for any $g \in L^{p}(E), 1 / p+1 / q=1$; $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 \pi} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 \pi} g(x) \cos nx d x=0$. Thus, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ weakly converges to $f \equiv 0$. However, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge almost everywhere on E.
chinese_rationale:
第一例: 一个在可测集  E  上处处收敛的函数序列  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ， 使对任何 $ p \geqslant 1，\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E) $， 但  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 并不弱收敛。在  $(0，1]$  上定义函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$: $\left.f_{n}(x)=n \varphi\left(0， \frac{1}{n}\right]\right)$，其中 $ \varphi_{\left(0， \frac{1}{n}\right]}$  是区间  $\left(0， \frac{1}{n}\right]$  的特征函数。易见，对任何  $p(1 \leqslant p<   +\infty)， f_{n} \in L^{p}\left(E^{\prime}\right)$ ， 且对每一  $x_{0} \in E=(0，1]$ ， 都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}\left(x_{0}\right)=0 $。但是，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  并不弱收敛于  $f \equiv 0$。事实上， 取 $ g \equiv 1$ ， 则  $g \in L^{\mathbf{p}}(E)$ ， 这里， 当 $ p>1 $ 时  $1 / p+1 / q=1 $， 而当 $p=1$  时  $q=+\infty$ ， 且有$\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}nd x=1$ 。因此，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  不弱收敛于 f  。
第二例: 一个函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\} $， 使对任何 $ p \geqslant 1，\left\{f_{n}\right\} \subset L^{p}(E)$ 且弱收敛， 但  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在E上并不几乎处处收敛。设  $f_{n}(x)=\cos n x， x \in E=[0 ， 2 \pi] ; n=1，2， \cdots $。 易见，  $f_{n} \in L^{p}(E)   (p \geqslant 1) $ ，且对任何  $g \in L^{p}(E)， 1 / p+1 / q=1 $; 都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 \pi} f_{n}(x) g(x) d x=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{2 \pi} g(x) \cos \pi x d x=0$ 。因此，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于 $ f \equiv 0$  。 但是，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上并不几乎处处收敛。

statement: There exist functions that are generally ($\boldsymbol{R}$) integrable but not ($\boldsymbol{L}$) integrable.
chinese_statement: 存在广义  ($\boldsymbol{R}$)  可积而不  ($\boldsymbol{L}$)  可积的函数。
rationale:
First example: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\sin x / x, x \neq 0, \\1, x=0,\end{array}\right.$ then the general (R) integral $\int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x) d x $ converges and $\int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x) d x=\frac{\pi}{2}$. However, $\int_{0}^{+\infty}|{f}(x)| d x=+\infty$ which means $|f|$ is not (L) integrable on $[0, +\infty)$, and thus f is not (L) integrable on $[0, +\infty)$ either.
Second example: Define the function f on the open interval $(0, 1)$: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2 n+1, 1 /(2 n+2)<x<1 /(2 n+1), \\-(2 n+2), 1 /(2 n+3) \leqslant x \leqslant 1 /(2 n+2),\end{array}\right.$ here, $n = 0, 1, 2, \cdots$. It is evident that the general (R) integral of f on $(0, 1)$ exists, and $\begin{array}{l}\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}\left[(2 n+1)\left(\frac{1}{2 n+1}-\frac{1}{2 n+2}\right)-(2 n+2)\right. \\\left.\left(\frac{1}{2 n+2}-\frac{1}{2 n+3}\right)\right]=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(2 n+3)(2 n+2)}.\end{array}$ However, $\int_{0}^{1}|f(x)| d x=+\infty,$ hence f is not (L) integrable on $(0, 1)$.
chinese_rationale:
第一例: 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}\sin x / x， x \neq 0， \\1， x=0，\end{array}\right.$则广义  (R)  积分$\int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x) d x $ 收敛且$\int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x) d x=\frac{\pi}{2}$ 。但是$\int_{0}^{+\infty}|{f}(x)| d x=+\infty$这意味着$|f|$在  $[0，+\infty)$  上不是  (L)  可积的，从而  f  在  $[0，+\infty)$  上也不是  (L)  可积的。
第二例: 在开区间  $(0，1)$  上定义函数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2 n+1，1 /(2 n+2)<x<1 /(2 n+1)， \\-(2 n+2)， 1 /(2 n+3) \leqslant x \leqslant 1 /(2 n+2)，\end{array}\right.$这里，  $n=0，1，2， \cdots$。易见，  f  在  $(0，1)$  上的广义  (R)  积分存在，且$\begin{array}{l}\int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}\left[(2 n+1)\left(\frac{1}{2 n+1}-\frac{1}{2 n+2}\right)-(2 n+2)\right. \\\left.\left(\frac{1}{2 n+2}-\frac{1}{2 n+3}\right)\right]=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(2 n+3)(2 n+2)} 。\end{array}$但是$\int_{0}^{1}|f(x)| d x=+\infty，$可见  f  在  $(0，1)$  上不是  (L)  可积的。

statement: There exist a measurable function f and a continuous function g, forming a non-measurable composite function $f \circ g$.
chinese_statement: 存在可测函数  f  和连续函数g ，构成不可测的复合函数$f \circ g$ 。
rationale: Let $\boldsymbol{E}$ be a Cantor set in [0, 1] with positive measure, and define $\varphi(x)=\frac{m([0, x] \cap([0,1] \backslash E))}{m\left([0,1] \backslash E\right)}$. Then, $\varphi$ is a homeomorphic mapping from [0, 1] to [0, 1], and $m \varphi(E)=0$ (see Example 32 in Chapter 7). Let A be a non-measurable subset of E. Since $\varphi(A) \subset \varphi(E)$, $\varphi(A)$ is a measurable set, and $m \varphi(A)=0$. The inverse mapping $\varphi^{-1}$ maps the measurable set $\varphi(A)$ to the non-measurable set $\varphi^{-1}[\varphi(A)]=A$. Now let $B=\varphi(A)$ and define a function f on [0, 1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in B, \\0, x \in[0,1] \backslash B,\end{array}\right.$. Then f is a measurable function on [0, 1], and $g=\varphi$ is a continuous function from [0, 1] to [0, 1]. However, the composite function $f[g(x)]=f[\varphi(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in A, \\0, x \in[0,1] \backslash A,\end{array}\right.$ is the characteristic function of the non-measurable set A, so it is a non-measurable function.
chinese_rationale: 设 $ \boldsymbol{E}$  是  [0，1]  中具有正测度的 Cantor 集， 令$\varphi(x)=\frac{m([0， x] \cap([0，1] \backslash E))}{m\left([0，1] \backslash E\right)}$，则  $\varphi $ 是由  [0，1]  到  [0，1]  上的一个同胚映射， 且  $m \varphi(E)=0$  (参看第七章例 32)。 设  A  是  E  的一个不可测的子集， 由于 $ \varphi(A) \subset \varphi(E) $，所以  $\varphi(A) $ 是可测集，且  $m \varphi(A)=0$ ， 而逆映射  $\varphi^{-1} $ 把可测集  $\varphi(A)$ 映成不可测集  $\varphi^{-1}[\varphi(A)]=A$ 。现令 $ B=\varphi(A) $， 并在  [0，1]  上如下定义函数  f: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in B， \\0， x \in[0，1] \backslash B，\end{array}\right.$则  f  是  [0，1]  上的可测函数，又  $g=\varphi$  是  [0，1]  到  [0，1]  上的连续函数， 然而复合函数$f[g(x)]=f[\varphi(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in A， \\0， x \in[0，1] \backslash A，\end{array}\right.$是不可测集  A  的特征函数， 所以它是一个不可测的函数。

statement: There exists a differentiable function f, whose absolute value function $|{f}|$ is not differentiable.
chinese_statement: 存在一个可微函数  f ， 而其绝对值函数$|{f}|$ 并不可微。
rationale: The function $f(x)=x$ is differentiable on $R^{1}$, however, $|f(x)|=|x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$. Note that from the above counterexample, it is evident that there is no intrinsic relationship between the differentiability of function f and the differentiability of $|f|$.
chinese_rationale: 函数  $f(x)=x$  在  $R^{1}$  上可微， 然而，  $|f(x)|=|x|$  在  $x=0$  处并不可微。注 由上述反例可知， 函数  f  的可微性与  $|f|$ 的可微性之间并无内在联系。

statement: There exists a periodic function without the smallest positive period, and its range is a countable set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个没有最小正周期的周期函数，它的值域是可数集。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n, x \text{ is a root of an irreducible rational equation of degree } n (n \geqslant 1), \\0, x \text{ is a transcendental number. }\end{array}\right. $. It can be shown that for any rational number $r$, $f(x+r)=f(x)$. Let $\alpha_{1}, \alpha_{2}, \cdots, \alpha_{n}$ be the roots of an irreducible rational equation of degree $n$: $a_{0} x^{n}+a_{1} x^{n-1}+\cdots+a_{n}=0$. We can construct an $n$-degree rational equation such that $\alpha_{1}+r, \alpha_{2}+r, \cdots, \alpha_{n}+r$ are its roots, and it can be proven that this equation is irreducible. Otherwise, assume $\alpha_{1}+r$ is a root of an irreducible rational equation of degree $m$ (m<n), then we can construct an $m$-degree rational equation such that $\alpha_{1}+r +(-r)$ are its roots. So $\alpha_{1}$ is a root of an $m$-degree rational equation, which contradicts the assumption that $a_{0} x^{n}+a_{1} x^{n-1}+\cdots+a_{n}=0$ is irreducible. Therefore, when $x$ is a root of an irreducible rational equation of degree $n$, it always holds that $f(x+r)=f(x)=n$. However, positive rational numbers $r$ have no smallest number, hence $f(x)$ has no smallest positive period. It is easy to show that there exists any $n$-degree rational irreducible equation with real roots, for example, $x^{n} =c$, where $c$ is a positive rational number but not a rational $n$th power. Hence, the range of $f(x)$ is all non-negative integers, and thus it is a countable set.
chinese_rationale: 令  $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n， x \text { 为 } n(n \geqslant 1) \text { 次的既约有理方程的根， } \\0， x \text { 为超越数。 }\end{array}\right. $。 可以证明对任意有理数  r  有  $f(x+r)=f(x)$  。设  $\alpha_{1}， \alpha_{2}， \cdots， \alpha_{n} $ 是  n  次既约有理方程$a_{0} x^{n}+a_{1} x^{n-1}+\cdots+a_{n}=0$的根， 则可构造一  n  次有理方程使  $\alpha_{1}+r， \alpha_{2}+r， \cdots， \alpha_{n}+r$  是它的根，并且可以证明这个方程是既约的，否则设  $\alpha_{1}+r$  是适合  m  次  (m<n)  既约有理方程的根， 则又可构造一  m  次有理方程使  $\alpha_{1}+r   +(-r)$  是它们根．于是 $ \alpha_{1} $ 是  m  次有理方程的根，则必导致与 $ a_{0} x^{n}+a_{1} x^{n-1}+\cdots+a_{n}=0 $ 是既约的假定矛盾。 于是当  x  是  n  次既约有理方程的根附， 恒有$f(x+r)=f(x)=n $。然而正有理数  r  没有最小数， 故 $ f(x) $ 没有最小正周期。容易证明含有实根的任一  n  次有理既约方程是存在的， 如 $ x^{n}   =c$， c  是一个正有理数但  c  不是有理数的  n  次幂就是一例。 故  $f(x) $ 的值域是一切非负整数， 从而它是一个可数集。

statement: There exist two functions that are both not absolutely continuous, yet their composite function is absolutely continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在两个皆非绝对连续的函数，而构成绝对连续的复合函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=1+x-[x]$, $g(x)=\operatorname{sgn} x$. Then $f$ and $g$ are both not absolutely continuous on $[-1, 1]$. However, the composite function $f[g(x)]=1+\operatorname{sgn} x-[\operatorname{sgn} x]=1$ is absolutely continuous on $[-1, 1]$.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=1+x-[x]， g(x)=\operatorname{sgn} x $， 则  f  与  g  在  [-1，1]  上皆非绝对连续。然而，复合函数$f[g(x)]=1+\operatorname{sgn} x-[\operatorname{sgn} x]=1$在  $[-1，1]$上是绝对连续的。

statement: There exists a sequence of continuous functions that converges but does not converge uniformly anywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在收敛而无处一致收敛的连续函数序列。
rationale: We define a function f on the interval [0, 1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / q， & x=p/ q，p\text{ and }q \text{ are coprime integers, and }q>0 \\ 0， & x \text{ is any other point in [0,1]}\end{array}\right. $ Then f is discontinuous at any rational point in [0, 1], but continuous at any irrational point. Next, we define a sequence of continuous functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on the interval [0, 1] as follows: for each positive integer n, the graph of $f_{n}(x)$ is made by connecting the line segments $\begin{array}{l}(0， f(0))，\left(\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)，\left(\frac{2}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{2}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)， \cdots， \\\left(\frac{2^{n}}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{2^{n}}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)，(1， f(1))\end{array}$ in succession. It is easy to see that the sequence of functions $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ is continuous on [0, 1] and converges pointwise to f. Since the limit function f is not continuous on any non-empty subinterval of [0, 1], the sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ cannot converge uniformly to f on any non-empty subinterval of [0, 1], that is, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge uniformly anywhere on [0,1]. It is noted that the limit function in this example is not continuous on any non-empty subinterval of [0, 1]. Regarding this situation, we further construct a sequence of continuous functions that converges to zero everywhere on [0, 1], but does not converge uniformly anywhere. Let $ \quad F_{n}=\left\{\frac{k}{2^{m}}: 0<\frac{k}{2^{m}} \leqslant 1， m \in\{0，1， \cdots， n\}\right. ， k \text{ is a positive integer} \} $, and let $ \quad f_{n}(0)=0， f_{n}\left(\frac{k}{2^{m}}\right)=0， \frac{k}{2^{m}} \in F_{n} $. When $\frac{k}{2^{m}} \in F_{n} $ and k is odd, define $f_{n}\left(\frac{k}{2^{m}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{m}}$. Finally, in the remaining small intervals of [0, 1] where $f_{n}$ is not yet defined, let $f_{n}$ be linear and continuous. Thus, for each n, $f_{n}$ is a continuous function on $[0，1]$. It is easy to see that for each $ x \in[0，1]，\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$ converges to zero. However, for any non-empty subinterval $(\alpha， \beta) \subset[0，1]$，$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ cannot converge uniformly to zero on $(\alpha， \beta)$. In fact, we can take an odd $k_{0}$ and a non-negative integer $m_{0}$ such that $\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}} \in(\alpha， \beta)$，and $ \frac{1}{2^{n+1}} \rightarrow 0(n\rightarrow\infty )$，so there exists a positive integer $N$ such that when $n>N$ we have $\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}} \in(\alpha， \beta)$. Now take a positive number $\varepsilon_{0}\left(0<\varepsilon_{0}<\frac{1}{2^{m_{0}}}\right)$，and let $x_{n}=\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}} $， then when $n>N$，we always have $f_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{m_{0}}}>\varepsilon_{0}$. This indicates that $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge uniformly to zero on $(\alpha， \beta)$.
chinese_rationale: 我们在区间  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / q， & x=p/ q，p与q \text { 是互质的整数，且q>0 } \\ 0， & x \text { 为[0，1]中的其它点， }\end{array}\right. $则  f  在  [0，1]  中的任一有理点间断， 而在任一无理点连续。我们再在区间  [0，1]  上定义连续函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  如下: 对每一正整数 n，令$ f_{n}(x)$  的图形为依次连结$\begin{array}{l}(0， f(0))，\left(\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)，\left(\frac{2}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{2}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)， \cdots， \\\left(\frac{2^{n}}{2^{n+1}}， f\left(\frac{2^{n}}{2^{n+1}}\right)\right)，(1， f(1))\end{array}$的直线段而成的。 易见， 函数序列  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  [0，1]  上连续且处处收敛于  f。 因为极限函数  f  在  [0，1]  的任何非空子区间上都不连续， 所以函数序列  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  [0，1]  的任何非空子区间上都不能一致收敛于f ， 即  $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 在  [0，1]  上无处一致连续。注 这个例子中的极限函数在[0，1]的任何非空子区间上都不连续， 针对这一清况， 我们再进一步构造一个在  [0，1]  上处处收敛 于零的连续函数序列，而它却无处一致收敛。令 $ \quad F_{n}=\left\{\frac{k}{2^{m}}: 0<\frac{k}{2^{m}} \leqslant 1， m \in\{0，1， \cdots， n\}\right. ， k  为正整数  \} $，并令  $\quad f_{n}(0)=0， f_{n}\left(\frac{k}{2^{m}}\right)=0， \frac{k}{2^{m}} \in F_{n}$ .又当$\frac{k}{2^{m}} \in F_{n} $ 且  k  为奇数时，定义$f_{n}\left(\frac{k}{2^{m}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{m}}$最后， 在  [0，1]  上  $f_{n}$  尚未得到定义的各个小区间上， 令  $f_{n}$  为线性函数且连续。 于是， 对每一  $n， f_{n} $ 是  $[0，1] $ 上的连续函数。易见，对每一 $ x \in[0，1]，\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}  $都收敛于零。 然而， 对任何非空子区间 $ (\alpha， \beta) \subset[0，1]$，$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  $(\alpha， \beta)$  上都不可能一致收敛于零。事实上，我们可取奇数  $k_{0} $ 与非负整数  $m_{0}$ ， 使  $\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}} \in(\alpha， \beta)$ ， 而 $ \frac{1}{2^{n+1}} \rightarrow 0(n\rightarrow\infty )$，所以存在正整数$N$，当$n>N$时就有$\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}} \in(\alpha， \beta)$。今取正数  $\varepsilon_{0}\left(0<\varepsilon_{0}<\frac{1}{2^{m_{0}}}\right)$ ， 并令  $x_{n}=\frac{k_{0}}{2^{m_{0}}}-\frac{1}{2^{n+1}} $， 则当  $n>N  $时，恒有$f_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)=\frac{1}{2^{m_{0}}}>\varepsilon_{0}$。这就表明 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在 $ (\alpha， \beta)$上不一致收敛于零。

statement: There exists a continuous function f such that $ \int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x, y) d x $ is a discontinuous function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个连续函数  f ， 使 $ \int_{0}^{+\infty} f(x， y) d x $ 是间断函数。
rationale: Define the function $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin \left(1-y^{2}\right) x / x, & x \neq 0, \\1-y^{2}, & x=0.\end{array}\right.$ on $D=[0,+\infty) \times[-2,2]$. It is easy to see that f is continuous on D. Consider the integral $F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin \left(1-y^{2}\right) x}{x} d x$. When $|y|=1$, $F(y)=0$. When $|y|<1$, by substituting $ t=\left(1-y^{2}\right) x$, we have $F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin t}{t} d t=\frac{\pi}{2}$. When $|y|>1$, by substituting $t=-\left(1-y^{2}\right) x$, we have $F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty}\left(-\frac{\sin t}{t}\right) d t=-\frac{\pi}{2}$. Therefore, $F(y)$ is discontinuous at $y= \pm 1$.
chinese_rationale: 在  $D=[0，+\infty) \times[-2，2]$  上定义函数$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin \left(1-y^{2}\right) x / x， & x \neq 0， \\1-y^{2}， & x=0 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  是  D  上的连续函数。考虑积分$F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin \left(1-y^{2}\right) x}{x} d x$当  $|y|=1$  时，  $F(y)=0$ 。 当  $|y|<1$  时， 作变换 $ t=\left(1-y^{2}\right) x$ ， 则$F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin t}{t} d t=\frac{\pi}{2}$ 。当  $|y|>1$  时， 作变换  $t=-\left(1-y^{2}\right) x$ ， 则$F(y)=\int_{0}^{+\infty}\left(-\frac{\sin t}{t}\right) d t=-\frac{\pi}{2}$。因此，  $F(y)$  在  $y= \pm 1$  处不连续。

statement: There exists a divergent improper integral with a finite Cauchy principal value.
chinese_statement: 存在Cauchy主值为有限的发散广义积分。
rationale: The improper integral $\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} x d x$ diverges, but its Cauchy principal value is $\lim _{a \rightarrow+\infty} \int_{-a}^{a} x d x=0$.
chinese_rationale: 广义积分$\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} x d x$发散， 但它的 Cauchy 主值是$\lim _{a \rightarrow+\infty} \int_{-a}^{a} x d x=0$ 。

chinese_rationale:

statement: There exists a function with infinitely many local maxima and no local minima.
chinese_statement: 存在有无穷多个局部极大值而无局部极小值的函数。
rationale: Let $f(x)=-x, -1 \leqslant x<1$; also, for any $x \in R^{1}$, let $f(x+2)=2 f(x)$, then f is a function from $R^{1}$ to $R^{1}$ with infinitely many local maxima and no local minima.
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(x)=-x，-1 \leqslant x<1 $; 又对任意 $ x \in R^{1}$ ， 令  $f(x+2)=2 f(x) $ ，则  f  是  $R^{1}$  到  $R^{1}$  上的函数， 且具有无穷多个局部极大值而无局部极小值。

statement: There exists a strictly increasing continuous function that is not differentiable everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在一个严格递增的连续函数， 它不处处可微。
rationale: The following example is given by Pringsheim. Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x\left\{1-\frac{1}{3} \sin \left(\ln x^{2}\right)\right\}, & x \neq=0, \\0, & x=0.\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that f is continuous over $ (-\infty, +\infty)$. Since when $x \neq 0$, $f^{\prime}(x)=1+\frac{1}{3} \sin \left(\ln x^{2}\right)+\frac{2}{3} \cos \left(\ln x^{2}\right)>0$, f is strictly increasing on $(-\infty, 0)$ and $(0, +\infty)$. Also, when $x>0$, $f(x)>0$, and when $x<0$, $f(x)<0$. It can be seen that f is strictly increasing over $(-\infty, \infty)$, but since $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x)-f(0)}{x}=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0}\left\{1+\frac{1}{3} \sin \left(\ln x^{2}\right)\right\}$ does not exist, f is not differentiable at $x=0$.
