chinese_rationale: 在  $|x| \leqslant \frac{1}{2}$ ， 设  $f_{1}(x)=|x|$ ， 而在其它的  x  值处， 用 1 为周期来延拓  $f_{1}(x)$ ， 即: 对每个实数  x  和整数  n ， 都有  $f_{1}(x+n)=f_{1}(x)$ 。当  $n>1$  时， 定义  $f_{n}(x)=4^{-n+1} f_{1}\left(4^{n-1} x\right)$ ， 于是， 对于每个整数  $n， f_{n} $是有周期  $4^{-n+1}$  的周期函数，其极大值为$\frac{1}{2} \cdot 4^{-n+1}$ 。 最后，以  $R^{1}$  为定义域规定  f  :$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} f_{n}(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{f_{1}\left(4^{n-1} x\right)}{4^{n-1}}$因为  $\left|f_{n}(x)\right| \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \cdot 4^{-n+1}$ ， 故据 Weierstrass 的  M -判别法， 这级数在  $R^{1}$  上一致收敛，因此  f  在 $ R^{1}$  上处处连续。在任何 形如  $a=k  *  4^{-m}$ 的点， 式中  k  是整数，  m  是正整数， 当  $n>m$  时就有  $f_{n}(a)=0$ ，从而$f(a)=f_{\mathrm{t}}(a)+\cdots+f_{m}(a)$ 。对于任何正整数  m ， 设  $h_{m}$  是正数  $4^{-2 m-1}$ 。 于是， 当  $n>2m+1$  时  $f_{n}\left(a+h_{m}\right)=0 $， 所以$\begin{array}{l}\quad f\left(a+h_{m}\right)-f(a)=\left[f_{1}\left(a+h_{m}\right)-f_{1}(a)\right]+ \\+\cdots+\left[f_{m}\left(a+h_{m}\right)-f_{m}(a)\right]+ \\+f_{m+1}\left(a+h_{m}\right)+\cdots+f_{2 m+1}\left(a+h_{m}\right) \\\geqslant-m h_{m}+(m+1) h_{m}=h_{m}>0 。\end{array}$同样地，$f\left(a-h_{m}\right)-f(a) \geqslant-m h_{m}+(m+1) h_{m}=h_{m}>0 $。由于形如  $a=k \cdot 4^{-m}$  的点在 $ R^{1} $ 中是稠密的， 所以  f  不可能在一个非空开区间上单调。

statement: If the function $f_{n}(x)(n=1, 2, \cdots)$ is continuous at $x_{0}$, then $f(x)=\sup f_{n}(x)$ is continuous at $\hat{x}_{0}$.
chinese_statement: 若函数  $f_{n}(x)(n=1，2， \cdots)$  在 $ x_{0}$  均连续， 那么  $f(x)=\sup f_{n}(x)$ 在  $\hat{x}_{0}$  连续。
rationale: Define the function $f_{n}$ on $R^{1}$ as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \leqslant 0, \\n x, 0<x \leqslant 1 / n, \\1, \quad x>1 / n .\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that the function $f_{n}(n=1, 2, \cdots)$ is continuous on $R^{1}$. However, the supremum function $f(x)=\sup _{n} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \leqslant 0, \\1, x>0,\end{array}\right.$ is discontinuous at the point $x=0$. Note: It can be proved that if a finite number of functions $f_{\text {k}} (k=1, 2, \cdots, n)$ defined on the point set M are continuous at the point $x_{0} \in M$, then their maximum function $f(x)=\max _{1 \leqslant k \leqslant i n} f_{k}(x)$ and minimum function $g(x)=\min _{1 \leqslant k \leqslant \pi} f_{k}(x)$ are also continuous at the point $x_{0}$. The above counterexample shows that this proposition cannot be extended to the case of infinitely many functions.
chinese_rationale: 在  $R^{1}$  上定义函数  $f_{\mathrm{n}}$  如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \leqslant 0， \\n x， 0<x \leqslant 1 / n， \\1， \quad x>1 / n 。\end{array}\right.$易见， 函数  $f_{n}(n=1，2， \cdots) $ 在  $R^{1}$  上都连续。 然而上确界函数$f(x)=\sup _{n} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \leqslant 0， \\1， x>0，\end{array}\right.$在点  $x=0$  间断。注： 可以证明， 假如定义在点集  M  上的有限多个函数  $f_{\text {k}}   (k=1，2， \cdots， n) $ 在点 $ x_{0} \in M $ 都连续， 那么它们的最大值函数$f(x)=\max _{1 \leqslant k \leqslant i n} f_{k}(x)$及最小值函数$g(x)=\min _{1 \leqslant k \leqslant \pi} f_{k}(x)$在点  $x_{0}$  也连续。 上述反例说明了不能把这个命题推广到无穷多个函数的情形。

statement: There exists a sequence of continuous functions whose non-uniform limit is also a continuous function.
chinese_statement: 存在一个连续函数序列， 它的非一致极限也是一个连续函数。
rationale: Let $\quad s_{n}(x)=\frac{n^{2} x}{1+n^{3} x^{2}}, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1, n=1,2, \cdots ,$ then for every $x \in[0,1]$, we have $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{n}(x)=0$. We prove that $\left\{s_{n}(x)\right\}$ does not converge uniformly to zero on [0,1]. For this purpose, it is sufficient to prove that for any positive number M, we can always choose x near $x=0$ and a positive integer n such that $s_{n}(x)>M$. Let $s_{n}^{\prime}(x)=\frac{n^{2}\left(1-n^{3} x^{2}\right)}{\left(1+n^{3} x^{2}\right)^{2}}=0$, then $x_{n}=n^{-3 / 2}, s_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)=\frac{1}{2} n^{1 / 2}$, which shows that when n is sufficiently large, we have $s_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)> M$. Therefore, $\left\{s_{n}(x)\right\}$ does not converge uniformly to zero on [0,1]. This example was constructed by Osgood. Note: The uniform limit of a sequence of continuous functions is also a continuous function. The above counterexample shows that the non-uniform limit of a sequence of continuous functions can also be a continuous function.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\quad s_{n}(x)=\frac{n^{2} x}{1+n^{3} x^{2}}， 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1， n=1，2， \cdots ，$则对每一 $x \in[0，1]$ ， 都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{n}(x)=0$ 。兹证  $\left\{s_{n}(x)\right\}$  在  [0，1]  上不 一致收敛于零。为此， 只要证明对于任何正数  M ， 在  $x=0$  的附近总可以选取  x  及正整数  n ， 使得  $s_{n}(x)>M$。 令$s_{n}^{\prime}(x)=\frac{n^{2}\left(1-n^{3} x^{2}\right)}{\left(1+n^{3} x^{2}\right)^{2}}=0$，得 $ x_{n}=n^{-3 / 2}， s_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)=\frac{1}{2} n^{1 / 2} $， 可见当  n  充分大时， 就有  $s_{n}\left(x_{n}\right)>  M$。因此，  $\left\{s_{n}(x)\right\} $ 在  [0，1]  上不一致收敛于零。这个例子是是Osgood 作出的。注： 连续函数序列的一致极限也是连续函数。上述反列说明了连续函数序列的非一致极限也可能是连续函数。

statement: There exists a sequence of functions with bounded variation whose total variation is not uniformly bounded, but has a convergent subsequence.
chinese_statement: 存在一个有界变差函数序列，其全变差并不一致有界，但有收敛的子列。
rationale: Define the sequence of functions on the interval $[0, 1]$ as $f_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{n} \sin \left(2 \pi \cdot 8^{n} x\right), n=1, 2, \ldots$. It can be easily verified that the total variation of $f_{n}$ on $[0, 1]$ is $4 \cdot 8^{n} / n$, hence the total variation of the sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ on $[0, 1]$ is not uniformly bounded. However, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges to zero everywhere on $[0, 1]$.
chinese_rationale: 在区间$[0，1]$上如下定义函数序列$f_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{n} \sin \left(2 \pi \cdot 8^{n} x\right)， n=1，2， \ldots$。容易验证，  $f_{n}$  在  $[0，1]$  上的全变差是 $ 4 \cdot 8 n / n$ ， 因而函数序列$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  $[0，1]$ 上的全变差并不一致有界。然而，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ 在  $[0，1]$ 上却处处收敛于零。

statement: There exists a differentiable function f, such that $f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)>0$, but f is not monotonic on any open interval containing the point $x_{0}$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个可微函数f， 使$f^{\prime}\left(x_{0}\right)>0$， 但  f  在包含点$x_{0}$的任何开区间内都不是单调的。
rationale: Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{x}{2}+x^{2} \sin \frac{1}{x}, & x \neq 0, \\0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.$ It has a derivative at x=0 of $f^{\prime}(0)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x)-f(0)}{x}=\frac{1}{2}>0 $. However, f is not monotonic on any open interval containing the point x=0. In fact, when $x \neq 0$, $f^{\prime}(x)=\frac{1}{2}-\cos \frac{1}{x}+2 x \sin \frac{1}{x} $. When $x_{k}-\frac{1}{k \pi}(k=1, 2, \cdots)$, $f^{\prime}\left(x_{k}\right)=\frac{1}{2}-(-1)^{k}$, from this expression, it can be seen that the derivative can take values of different signs in any open interval containing zero, therefore, f is not monotonic on this open interval.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{x}{2}+x^{2} \sin \frac{1}{x}， & x \neq 0， \\0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.$它在  x=0  处的导数为$f^{\prime}(0)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x)-f(0)}{x}=\frac{1}{2}>0 $。但是，  f  在任一包含点  x=0  的开区间上都不是单调的。 实际上，当 $ x \neq 0$  时，$f^{\prime}(x)=\frac{1}{2}-\cos \frac{1}{x}+2 x \sin \frac{1}{x} $。当$x_{k}-\frac{1}{k \pi}(k=1，2， \cdots)$  时，$f^{\prime}\left(x_{k}\right)=\frac{1}{2}-(-1)^{k}$，从这个式子可以看出， 在包含零点的任意开区间内， 导数可以取不同符号的值， 因此，  f  在这个开区间上不是单调的。

statement: A function f on [0, 1], if the set of its continuity points is dense in [0, 1], then f is the limit of a sequence of continuous functions.
chinese_statement: [0，1]  上的一个函数  f ， 若它的连续点所成之集在  [0，1]  中稠密，那么  f  是某个连续函数序列的极限。
rationale: First, we state the Baire criterion as follows: Let f be a function defined on the complete set $E^{\prime}$. The necessary and sufficient condition for f to be the limit of a sequence of continuous functions on E is that for every complete subset P of E, f as a function restricted to P has at least one continuous point on P. From the Baire criterion, it follows that the function f in Example 31 cannot be the limit of any sequence of continuous functions. Now we further construct a function defined on the interval [0, 1], whose set of continuous points is dense in [0, 1], but it is still not the limit of any sequence of continuous functions. Let E be a complete sparse set in [0, 1], $\left(\boldsymbol{a}_{i},\beta_{i}\right)(i=1, 2, \cdots)$ be the entire set of neighboring intervals of E in [0, 1]. Define the function f on [0, 1] as follows: $f(x)-\left\{ \begin{array}{l} 1, x=\alpha_{i} \text{ or } x=\beta_{i}, i=1, 2, \cdots, \\ 0, \text{ other cases. } \end{array} \right.$ It is easy to see that f is continuous on the dense subset of $[0, 1]$ $\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}({a}_{i}, \beta_{i})$. However, as a function restricted to E, f is nowhere continuous on E. Thus, from the Baire criterion, it is known that f cannot be the limit of a sequence of continuous functions.
chinese_rationale: 我们先陈述 Baire 准则如下：设  f  是定义在完备集  $E^{\prime}$  上的函数， 则  f  是  E  上某个连续函数序列的极限的必要充分条件是: 对  E  的每个完备子集  P， f  作为限制在  P  上的函数时，它在  P  上至少有一个连续点。由Baire准则推知，例31中的函数f不能作为任何连续函数序列的极限。 现在我们进一步构造一个定义在区间  [0，1]  上的函数， 它的连续点所成之集在  [0，1]  中稠密， 但它仍不是某个连续函数序列的极限。设  E  是  [0，1]  中的完备疏集，  $\left(\boldsymbol{a}_{i}，\beta_{i}\right)(i=1，2， \cdots)$  是  E  的全体邻接区间， 在  [0，1] 。 上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)-\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x=\alpha_{i} \text { 或 } x=\beta_{i}， i=1，2， \cdots， \\0， \text { 其它情形。 }\end{array}\right.$易见，f在$[0，1]$的稠密子集 $\bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}({a}_{i} ， \beta_{i})$上是连续的。然而，f作为限制在  E  上的函数时， 它在  E  上无处连续。于是由 Baire 准则可知，  f  不能作为连续函数序列的极限。

statement: For any conditionally convergent series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ and any real number x, there exists a sequence $\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}$, where $\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}=1, n=1, 2, \cdots$, such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n} a_{n}=x$.
chinese_statement: 30. 对于任一条件收敛级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} $ 和任一实数  x ， 存在序列$\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\} $，其中 $ \left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}=1， n=1，2， \cdots $， 能使$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n} a_{n}=x$ 。
rationale: Since $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right|=+ \infty$, we can add factors $\varepsilon_{n}$ with absolute value 1, such that $\varepsilon_{1} a_{1}+\cdots+\varepsilon_{n} a_{n}=\left|a_{1}\right|+\cdots+\left|a_{n}\right|>x$. Let $n_{1}$ be the smallest n ensuring this inequality holds. Then assign factors $\varepsilon_{n}$ with absolute value 1 to later terms to achieve (use the smallest possible $n_{2}$): $\begin{array}{c}\varepsilon_{1} a_{1}+\cdots+\varepsilon_{n_{2}} a_{n_{2}}=\left|a_{1}\right|+\cdots+\left|a_{n_{1}}\right|-\left|a_{n_{1}+1}\right|-\cdots-\left|a_{n_{2}}\right|<x. \end{array}$ If this process is repeated such that the partial sums alternatively exceed and fall below x, since $a_{n} \rightarrow 0$ as $n \rightarrow +\infty$, the resulting series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n} a_{n}$ must converge to x.
chinese_rationale: 由于$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right|=+   \infty$ ， 我们可以添上绝对值为 1 的因子$\varepsilon_{n}$， 使得$\varepsilon_{1} a_{1}+\cdots+\varepsilon_{n} a_{n}=\left|a_{1}\right|+\cdots+\left|a_{n}\right|>x$。设$n_{1}$为能确保这个不等式成立的 n的最小值。 再给后面的一些项配备绝对值为 1 的因子$\varepsilon_{n} $， 以便得到 (用最小可能的$n_{2}$ ):$\begin{array}{c}\varepsilon_{1} a_{1}+\cdots+\varepsilon_{n_{2}} a_{n_{2}}=\left|a_{1}\right|+\cdots+\left|a_{n_{1}}\right|-\left|a_{n_{1}+1}\right|-\cdots-\left|a_{n_{2}}\right|<x 。\end{array}$如果这个过程以部分和交替地大于  x  和小于  x  重复下去， 由于当$ n \rightarrow+\infty $ 时 $ a_{n} \rightarrow 0 $， 于是， 得到的级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n} a_{n} $ 必然收敛于  x 。

statement: There exists a function that is continuous on [0, 1] but not of bounded variation on any non-empty subinterval of [0, 1].
chinese_statement: 存在在  [0，1]  上连续而在  [0，1]  的任一非空子区间上皆非有界变差的函数。
rationale: Consider the interval $[a, b]$. Let $b = a + h (h > 0), x_{k} = a + h / 2^{k} (k = 1, 2, \cdots)$ as the sequence of points in $[a, b]$, and define the function $\varphi(x; a, b)$ as follows: (i) When $x \geqslant b$ or $x \leqslant a$, $\varphi(x; a, b) = 0$. (ii) $\varphi\left(x_{1}; a, b\right) = h / 2, \varphi\left(x_{2}; a, b\right) = 0, \varphi\left(x_{3}; a, b\right) = h / 3, \varphi\left(x_{4}; a, b\right) = 0, \cdots \cdots$. (iii) On the intervals $[x_{1}, b], [x_{2}, x_{1}], \cdots, [x_{k+1}, x_{k}], \cdots$, $\varphi(x; a, b)$ is linear. Clearly, $\varphi(x; a, b)$ is a continuous function on the interval $[a, b]$, but it is not of bounded variation. Define the function: $\begin{aligned}f_{1}(x) = & \varphi(x; 0, 1), \\f_{2}(x) = & f_{1}(x) + \varphi(x; 1 / 2, 1), \\f_{3}(x) = & f_{2}(x) + \varphi(x; 1 / 4, 1 / 2) + \varphi(x; 3 / 4, 1), \\f_{8}(x) = & f_{7}(x) + \varphi(x; 1 / 8, 1 / 4) + \varphi(x; 3 / 8, 1 / 2) \\& + \varphi(x; 5 / 8, 3 / 4) + \varphi(x; 7 / 8, 1), \\& \ldots \cdots.\end{aligned}$ Consider the series $\begin{array}{c}\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}\left[f_{n}(x) - f_{n-1}(x)\right] = \varphi(x; 0, 1) + \varphi(x; 1/2, 1) \\+ \varphi(x; 1 / 4, 1 / 2) + \varphi(x; 3 / 4, 1) + \cdots.\end{array}$ Since the first term is no greater than 1/2, the second term no greater than 1/4, the sum of the third and fourth terms no greater than 1/8, and the sum of the fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth terms no greater than $ 1 / 16, \cdots$, the above series converges uniformly on the interval [0, 1]. Therefore, the limit function $f(x) = \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)$ is also continuous on [0, 1]. However, $f$ is not of bounded variation on any non-empty subinterval $[\boldsymbol{\alpha}, \beta]$ of [0, 1], because when $n$ is sufficiently large, $[\alpha, \beta]$ always contains an interval of the form $\left[k / 2^{n}, (k + 1) / 2^{n}\right]$, and the function $\varphi\left(x; k / 2^{n}, (k + 1) / 2^{n}\right)$ is not of bounded variation on this interval.
chinese_rationale: 考虑区间 $[a， b]$。 设  $b=a+h(h>0)， x_{k}=a+h / 2^{k}(k=1，2 ，  \cdots)$  为  $[a， b]$  中的点列， 并如下定义函数  $\varphi(x ; a， b)$  :(i) 当  $x \geqslant b$  或  $x \leqslant a$  时， $ \varphi(x ; a， b)=0$ 。(ii)  $\varphi\left(x_{1} ; a， b\right)=h / 2， \varphi\left(x_{2} ; a， b\right)=0 ，  \varphi\left(x_{3} ; a， b\right)=h / 3， \varphi\left(x_{4} ; a， b\right)=0 ，  \cdots \cdots $。(iii) 在区间 $ \left.\left[x_{1}， b\right]，\left[x_{2}， x_{1}\right]， \cdots， [x_{k+1}， x_{k}\right]， \cdots $ 上，  $\varphi(x ; a， b) $为线性的。显然，  $\varphi(x ; a， b)$  为区间  $[a， b]$  上的连续函数， 但不是有界变差的函数。现作一函数：$\begin{aligned}f_{1}(x)= & \varphi(x ; 0，1)， \\f_{2}(x)= & f_{1}(x)+\varphi(x ; 1 / 2，1)， \\f_{3}(x)= & f_{2}(x)+\varphi(x ; 1 / 4，1 / 2)+\varphi(x ; 3 / 4，1)， \\f_{1}(x)= & f_{8}(x)+\varphi(x ; 1 / 8，1 / 4)+\varphi(x ; 3 / 8，1 / 2) \\& +\varphi(x ; 5 / 8，3 / 4)+\varphi(x ; 7 / 8，1)， \\& \ldots \cdots 。\end{aligned}$考虑级数$\begin{array}{c}\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}\left[f_{n}(x)-f_{n-1}(x)\right]=\varphi(x ; 0，1)+\varphi(x ; 1 / 2，1) \\+\varphi(x ; 1 / 4，1 / 2)+\varphi(x ; 3 / 4，1)+\cdots 。\end{array}$由于第一项不大于  1 / 2 ， 第二项不大干  1 / 4 ， 第三项与第四项之和不大于  1 / 8 ， 第五、六、七、八 各项之和不大于 $ 1 / 16， \cdots $， 所以上面的级数在区间  [0，1]  上是一致收敛的， 因而， 极限函数$f(x)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)$在  [0，1]  上也是连续的。但是，  f  在  [0，1]  的任一非空子区间  $[\boldsymbol{\alpha}， \beta]$ 上都不是有界变差的， 因为当  n  充分大时，  $[\alpha， \beta]$  总包含某个形如 $ \left[k / 2^{n}，(k+1) / 2^{n}\right]$  的区间，而函数  $\varphi\left(x ; k / 2^{n}，(k+1) / 2^{n}\right)$在此区间上不是有界变差的。

statement: There exists a positive term series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ where $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{\boldsymbol{a}_{n}}$ exists but $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+1} / a_{n}$ does not exist.
chinese_statement: 存在$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{\boldsymbol{a}_{n}}$存在而 $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+1} / a_{n}$不存在的正项级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$。
rationale: Consider the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2^{n+1}}$. Since $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} 2^{\frac{1}{n}}=1$, and $1 \leqslant\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}} \leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{n}}$, \\$ thus $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}}=1$. Hence we get $\quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}}=\frac{1}{2}$. However, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{a_{n+1}}{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3+(-1)^{n+1}}{3+(-1)^{n}}$ does not exist. Note: If $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+1} / a_{n}$ exists $\left(a_{n}>0\right)$, then $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}$ also exists and $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+t} / a_{n}$. The above counterexample shows that the reverse of this statement is not true.
chinese_rationale: 考虑级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2^{n+1}}$由于$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} 2^{\frac{1}{n}}=1$ ， 而$1 \leqslant\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}} \leqslant 2^{\frac{1}{n}}， \\$故$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}}=1$ 。由此得到$ \quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{3+(-1)^{n}}{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{n}}=\frac{1}{2}$ 。但是$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{a_{n+1}}{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{3+(-1)^{n+1}}{3+(-1)^{n}}$并不存在。注： 若 $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+1} / a_{n} $ 存在 $ \left(a_{n}>0\right) $， 则 $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}$  也存在且有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[n]{a_{n}}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n+t} / a_{n}$上述反例说明了这个陈述反过来是不正确的。

statement: There exists a compact set whose derived set is a countable set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个紧集，它的导集是可数集。
rationale: Let A be the set composed of 0, 1, and numbers of the form $\frac{1}{2^{k}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}$, where $n=1, 2, \cdots; k=0, 1, 2, \cdots$. When $k=0$, the accumulation point of the sequence $\left\{\frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is 1. When k=1, the accumulation point of the sequence $\left\{\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is $\frac{1}{2}$, which is the first term of the previous sequence $\left\{\frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n-1}^{\infty}$, so $\frac{1}{2} \in A$. When $k=2$, the accumulation point of the sequence $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{2}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is $\frac{1}{4}$, which is again the first term of the sequence $\left\{\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$, so $\frac{1}{4} \in A$. Generally, the accumulation point of $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{k-1}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is $\frac{1}{2^{k}}$, which is the first term of the sequence $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{k-1}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$, so $\frac{1}{2^{k}} \in A$. Therefore, the derived set of A is $A^{\prime}=\left\{1, \frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2^{3}}, \cdots, \frac{1}{2^{6}}, \cdots, 0\right\}$, which is a countable set. Since $A^{\prime} \subset A$, A is a bounded closed set. According to the Bolzano-Weierstrass theorem, $\boldsymbol{A}$ is compact.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  是由 0，1 以及形如  $\frac{1}{2^{k}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}$  的数所组成之集， 其中  $n=1 ，  2 \cdots ; k=0，1，2， \cdots$ ， 当  $k=0$  时， 序列  $\left\{\frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  的聚点是 1 。 当  k=  1 时， 序列  $\left\{\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  的聚点是  $\frac{1}{2}$ ， 这是前一个序列  $\left\{\frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n-1}^{\infty}$的第一项， 所以  $\frac{1}{2} \in A$ ， 当  $k=2$  时， 序列  $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{2}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{==1}^{\infty}$  的 聚 点 是$\frac{1}{4}$ ， 这又是序列  $\left\{\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  的第一项， 所以  $\frac{1}{4} \in A$ ， 一般，  $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{k-1}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  的聚点是  $\frac{1}{2^{k}}$  它是序列，  $\left\{\frac{1}{2^{k-1}} \cdot \frac{n}{n+1}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  的第一项， 所以  $\frac{1}{2^{k}}   \in A $。 由此可见， 集  A  的导集是$A^{\prime}=\left\{1， \frac{1}{2}， \frac{1}{2^{3}}， \cdots， \frac{1}{2^{6}}， \cdots， 0\right\}$，它是一个可数集。由于  $A^{\prime} \subset A$ ， 因而  A  是有界闭集， 据Bolzano-Weierstrass 定理，  $\boldsymbol{A}$  是聚集。

statement: For every rational number a, let $\{x: f(x)=a\}$ be a function f where all are non-measurable sets.
chinese_statement: 对每一有理数  a ， 使$\{x: f(x)=a\}$  均为不可测集的函数f。
rationale: For example: Let Q be the set of all rational numbers, and let f be a nowhere continuous function with the property $f(x+y)=f(x)+f(y)$. For each $a \in Q$, the set of points $M_{a}=\{x: f(x)=a\}$ in $R^{1}$ can be defined. It can be proven that all sets $M_{a}$ are non-measurable. Suppose otherwise, let us assume $M_{0}=\{x: f(x)=0\}$ is a measurable set with measure $m M_{0}$. By definition, it is easy to know $M_{a}=M_{0}+a$, where $M_{0}-a=\{x+a: f(x)=0\}$ is clearly pairwise disjoint, and $R^{t}=\bigcup_{\boldsymbol{a} \in \mathbb{Q}} M_{\boldsymbol{a}}$. Thus $m M_{0} \neq 0$. Secondly, we will prove that $m M_{0}$ must be 0 as follows: The first step is to prove the following equality: $A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}=\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right)+i, \quad i \in I$, where $A_{i}=[i, i+1)$ is a half-open interval, and I is the set of integers. Because $\begin{aligned} x \in\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right) & \Longleftrightarrow x \in[0,1) \text{ and } f(x)=\frac{1}{n}+i \\ & \Longleftrightarrow 0 \leqslant x<1 \text{ and } f(x-i)=\frac{1}{n} \\ & \Longleftrightarrow -i \leqslant x-i<1-i 	ext{ and } x-i \in M_{\frac{1}{n}} \\ & \Longleftrightarrow x-i \in\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\ & \Longleftrightarrow x \in\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right)+i \end{aligned}$ hence the above equality holds, and due to the measurability of $M_{\frac{1}{n}}$ and $A_{i}$, we know that $m\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)=m\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right)$. Therefore, in the second step, since $\boldsymbol{R}^{1} \supset \bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}$, we have $\begin{aligned} A_{0} & =\left(A_{0} \cap R^{\prime}\right) \supset \left\{A_{0} \cap \left(\bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)\right\} \\ & = \bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} \left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right) \end{aligned}$ so we also have $1 = m A_{0} \geqslant m\left\{\bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} \left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)\right\} \begin{array}{l} =\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \sum_{i \in I} m\left(A_{0} \cap M_{-1+i}\right) \\ =\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \sum_{i \in I}^{\infty} m\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\ =\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m\left\{\left(\bigcup_{i \in I} A_{-i}\right) \cap M_{\frac{1}{m}} \right\} \\ =\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m\left(R^{1} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\ =\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m M_{\frac{1}{n}} \\ =m M_{0}+m M_{0}+\cdots, \end{array}$so $m M_{0}$ must also be 0. This is a contradiction.
chinese_rationale: 例如：设  Q  为有理数的全体，  f  为具有性质$f(x+y)=f(x)+f(y)$ 的无处连续函数。对每一 $a \in Q$， 可定义$R^{1}$中的点集$M_{a}=\{x: f(x)=a\}$ 。可以证明，诸集$ M_{a}$均为不可测集。假若不然， 不妨设$ M_{0}=\{x: f(x)=0\}$为可测集， 其测度为$m M_{0}$。 按定义易知$M_{a}=M_{0}+a$ ， 其中 $M_{0}-a=\{x+a: f(x)=0\}$ 显然，各个$M_{a}$两两不相交，且$R^{t}=\bigcup_{\boldsymbol{a} \in \mathbb{Q}} M_{\boldsymbol{a}}$由此可知$ m M_{0} \neq 0$。其次， 又将证明$m M_{0}$必为 0 如下:第一步先证明下列等式成立:$A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}=\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right)+i， \quad i \in I \text {， }$其中$A_{i}=[i， i+1)$为半开区间，  I  为整数集。因为$\begin{aligned}x \in\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right) & \Longleftrightarrow x \in[0，1) \text { 及 } f(x)=\frac{1}{n}+i \\& \Longleftrightarrow 0 \leqslant x<1 \text { 及 } f(x-i)=\frac{1}{n} \\& \Leftrightarrow-i \leqslant x-i<1-i 及 x-i \in M_{\frac{1}{n}} \\& \Longleftrightarrow x-i \in\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\& \Leftrightarrow x \in\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right)+i\end{aligned}$故上式成立， 且由诸 $ M_{\frac{1}{n}}$  及  $A_{i}$  的可测性知有$m\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+1}\right)=m\left(A_{-1} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) $。于是第二步由$\boldsymbol{R}^{1} \supset \bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}$知有$\begin{aligned}A_{0} & =\left(A_{0} \cap R^{\prime}\right) \supset\left\{A_{0} \cap\left(\bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I} M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)\right\} \\& =\bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I}\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)\end{aligned}$故又有$1=m A_{0} \geqslant m\left\{\bigcup_{n=2}^{\infty} \bigcup_{i \in I}\left(A_{0} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}+i}\right)\right\}\begin{array}{l}=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \sum_{i \in I} m\left(A_{0} \cap M_{-1+i}\right) \\=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} \sum_{i \in I}^{\infty} m\left(A_{-i} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m\left\{\left(\bigcup_{i \in I} A_{-i}\right) \cap M_{\frac{1}{m}}\right\} \\=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m\left(R^{1} \cap M_{\frac{1}{n}}\right) \\=\sum_{n=2}^{\infty} m M_{\frac{1}{n}} \\=m M_{0}+m M_{0}+\cdots， \\\end{array}$所以$m M_{0}$  又必为 0 。 此为矛盾。

statement: There exists a convergent measurable sequence of functions with varying signs such that the conclusion of Fatou's lemma does not hold.
chinese_statement: 存在一个变号的收敛 可测函 数序列， 使Fatou 引理的结论不成立。
rationale: Let $E=(0,1)$, and define the sequence of functions on E as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, \quad 1 /(n+1)<x<1, \\-n, 0<x \leqslant 1 /(n+1). \end{array}\right.$ Also let $f(x)=1$, then for each $\cdots x \in E$, we have $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=f(x)$, so $\int_{E} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) dx=1 $. On the other hand, we have $\int_{E} f_{n}(x) dx=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n+1}}-n dx+\int_{\frac{1}{n+1}}^{1} dx=-\frac{n}{n+1}+\frac{n}{n+1}=0$, thus $\int_{E} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) dx > \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{E} f_{n}(x) dx=0$. Note that this example illustrates that for sequences of functions with varying signs, the conclusion of Fatou's lemma no longer holds.
chinese_rationale: 取$E=(0，1)$ ， 并在  E  上定义函数序列如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， \quad 1 /(n+1)<x<1， \\-n， 0<x \leqslant 1 /(n+1) 。\end{array}\right.$又令$f(x)=1$ ， 则对每一$\cdots x \in E$ ， 都有$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=f(x)$，所以$\int_{E} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) d x=1 $。另一方面，我们有$\int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n+1}}-n d x+\int_{\frac{1}{n+1}}^{1} d x=-\frac{n}{n+1}+\frac{n}{n+1}=0$，因此$\int_{E} \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x) d x>\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x=0 $。注 这个例子说明了对于变号的函数序列， Fatou 引理的结论不再成立。

statement: A convergent upper semicontinuous function sequence has a limit function that is necessarily upper semicontinuous.
chinese_statement: 一个收敛的上半连续函数序列， 其极限函数一定上半连续。
rationale: Arrange all rational numbers as $r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}, \cdots$, and define the function $f_{n}$ on $R^{\prime}$: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in\left\{r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}\right\}, \\0, x \in\left\{r_{1}, r_{2}, \cdots, r_{n}\right\} .\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to know that for each n, $f_{n}$ is an upper semicontinuous function on $R^{1}$. However, the limit function $f(x) \quad \operatorname{lim}_{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is rational, } \\0, x \text { is irrational.}\end{array}\right.$ is not upper semicontinuous on $R^{1}$. Since $f(x)=\sup f_{n}(x)$, it follows that the supremum function of an upper semicontinuous function sequence is not necessarily upper semicontinuous.
chinese_rationale: 将全体有理数排成  $r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}， \cdots $， 并在  $R^{\prime}$  上定义函数  $f_{n}$：$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in\left\{r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}\right\}， \\0， x \in\left\{r_{1}， r_{2}， \cdots， r_{n}\right\} 。\end{array}\right.$易知，对每一n，$f_{n}$都是$R^{1}$上的上半连续函数。然而，极限函数$f(x) \quad \operatorname{lim}_{n \rightarrow \infty} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 的无理数。}\end{array}\right.$在  $R^{1}$  上并不上半连续。由于  $f(x)=\sup f_{n}(x)$ ， 故知上半连续函数序列， 其上确界函数不必是上半连续的。

statement: There exist four pairwise disjoint planar regions with a common boundary.
chinese_statement: 存在有共同边界的四个两两不相交的平面区域。
rationale: Imagine an island in the ocean with three lakes, and consider the following process. In the first hour, dig channels from the sea and from each of the three lakes, ensuring that each channel is a 'blind endpoint' (essentially bends of each water source), so that these channels do not connect with each other. After an hour of work, every point on the land has a distance to seawater and to the water in each of the three lakes of less than 1 kilometer. In the next half hour, continue to extend the four channels, keeping them as blind endpoints, not connecting with each other, and ensuring that every point on the land is less than 1/2 kilometer from this water source. Then, in the next quarter-hour, the channels are further extended, still not connecting with each other, penetrating into the island with such density that every point on the land is less than 1/8 kilometer from the water of these four sources, and so on. After two hours of such activity, the island now has a continuous set of points C, nowhere dense on the plane, within any neighborhood of each point of which water from each of the four sources is present, yet all these water sources (the sea and the lakes) remain isolated, meaning that no two kinds of water mix. The water sources (extended by the channels that have been dug) form such four regions, and the continuous set of points C forms their common boundary. One of these regions ('the sea') is unbounded while the other three are bounded.
chinese_rationale: 设想大海中的一个岛屿，岛上有三个湖沼，并且想像如次的工作程序。在第一小时内自海及这三个湖沼的每一个开凿运河，要求各运河都是“盲端点”(实际就是各水源的弯流)，使这些运河彼此不相接连，并且要求经过一小时的工作，使陆地上每点到达海水，以及到达三湖沼的每个的湖水之距离统通小于1公里，在以后半小时内，所开凿的四条运河继续延长，仍要所有这些运河保持为盲端，彼此不相连接，并且陆地上每点到达此水源之水的距离统通小于1/2公里，在这以后四分之一小时内，运河延长的更远，仍要彼此不通，它们深入了这个岛屿，其“密度”使陆地上每点到达这四个水源之水的距离统通小于1/8公里，以下类推。经过这么样的两小时的活动，岛屿上这才有了在平面上无处稠密的某连续点集 C，在其每点的任意邻域内都有四水源之每个的水，并且所有这些水源(海及湖沼)仍然彼此分离，也就是其中任何两种的水也不混合，这些水源(由其已被开凿的运河而延长)就是那样的四个区域，连续点集C形成了它们的共同边界;这些区域中之一(“海”)不是有界的而其余三个则是有界的。

statement: There exists a trigonometric series that converges on some countable set, but its coefficients do not tend to zero.
chinese_statement: 存在一个三角级数， 它在某个可数集上收敛， 但其系数并不趋向于零。
rationale: Let $T(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \sin (n!x)$, then when x is any rational multiple of $\pi$, $T(x)$ is convergent, but its coefficients do not tend to zero.
chinese_rationale: 设$T(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \sin (n!x)$，则当  x  是  $\pi$  的任何有理数的倍数时， $ T(x)$  都是收敛的，但是，其系数并不趋向于零。

statement: The composite function is always definitely (R) integrable.
chinese_statement: 复合函数一定 (R)  可积。
rationale:
Let $f(x)$ be a function defined on [a, b], and its range does not exceed the interval [c, d], while $g(y)$ is a function defined on [c, d]. Here we provide various examples to show that the (R) integrability of $f(x)$ on [a, b] and $g(y)$ on [c, d] is neither sufficient nor necessary for the (R) integrability of $g[f(x)]$ on [a, b]. Example (a): Let $f(x)$ be defined on [0,1]: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n, x \text { is a nonzero rational number expressed as an irreducible fraction } m / n, \\0, \quad x \text { is an irrational number or zero, }\end{array}\right.$ then $f(x)$ is (R) integrable on [0,1]. Furthermore, let $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, 0<y \leqslant 1, \\0, y=0.\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, $g(y)$ is (R) integrable on [0,1]. However, the composite function $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number, }\end{array}\right.$ is nowhere continuous on [0,1], so it is not (R) integrable on [0,1]. 
Example (b): Let $f(x)$ be defined on [0,1]: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n, x \text { is a nonzero rational number expressed as an irreducible fraction } m / n, \\0, x \text { is an irrational number or zero.}\end{array}\right.$ Furthermore, let $g(y)$ be defined on [0,1], and $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, y \text { is a rational number, } \\1, y \text { is an irrational number. }\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, $f(x)$ is (R) integrable on [0,1], while $g(y)$ is not (R) integrable on [0,1]. The composite function $g[f(x)] \equiv 0$ is obviously (R) integrable on [0,1].
Example (c): Let $f(x)=1-x $ and in [0,1], $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l} 1, y \text { is an irrational number, } \\0, y \text { is a rational number. }\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, $f(x)$ is (R) integrable on [0,1], but $g(y)$ is not (R) integrable on [0,1], and the composite function $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is an irrational number, } \\0, x \text { is a rational number. }\end{array}\right.$ is evidently not (R) integrable on [0,1].
Example (d): Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x, x \text { is a rational number,} \\0, x \text { is an irrational number, }\end{array}\right.$ on [0,1]. It is evidently not (R) integrable. On [0,1], let $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n, y \text { is a nonzero rational number expressed as an irreducible fraction } m / n, \\0, y \text { is an irrational number or zero. }\end{array}\right.$ It is (R) integrable on [0,1], while the composite function $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n, x \text { is a nonzero rational number expressed as an irreducible fraction } m / n \\0, x \text { is an irrational number or zero. }\end{array}\right.$ is (R) integrable on [0,1].
Example (e): Let $f(x)$ be as in (d), and let $g(y) \Rightarrow y_{1}^{2}$ on [0,1]; at this time, the composite function $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{2}, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number. }\end{array}\right.$ is not (R) integrable on [0,1].
Example (f): Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is an irrational number, } \\0, x \text { is a rational number, }\end{array}\right.$ on [0,1], while $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, y \text { is an irrational number, } \\0, y \text { is a rational number, }\end{array}\right.$ both are not (R) integrable on [0,1], while the composite function $g[f(x)]=0$ is (R) integrable on [0,1].
Example (g): Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x+2, & x \text { is an irrational number, } \\x, & x \text { is a rational number, }\end{array}\right.$ be on [0,1], it is not (R) integrable. Let $g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, y \text { is an irrational number, } \\0, y \text { is a rational number. }\end{array}\right.$ be on [2,3]. Thus, the composite function on [0,1]: $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is an irrational number,} \\0, x \text { is a rational number. }\end{array}\right.g(y)$ and $g[f(x)]$ are both not (R) integrable. As for the case where both $f(x)$ and $g(y)$ are (R) integrable, an example of $g[f(x)]$ being (R) integrable is trivial, such as taking both $f(x)$ and $g(y)$ to be continuous. In conclusion, the table is as follows: $\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f(x) \text { in }[a, b] & g(y) \text { in }[c, d] & g[f(x)] \text { in }[a, b] & \text {Example} \\\hline 1 & \text { Integrable} & \text { Integrable} & \text { Integrable} & \text { Trivial} \\\hline 2 & \text { Integrable} & \text { Integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & (a) \\\hline 3 & \text { Integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Integrable} & (b) \\\hline 4 & \text { Integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & (c) \\\hline 5 & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Integrable} & \text { Integrable} & (d) \\\hline 6 & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & (e) \\\hline 7 & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Integrable} & (f) \\\hline 8 & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & \text { Non-integrable} & (g) \\\hline\end{array}$
chinese_rationale:
设$f(x)$  是定义在  [a， b]  上的函数，且其值域不越出区间  [c， d] ，而$g(y)$是定义在  [c， d]  上的函数。 下面我们举出各种例子，以说明函数$f(x)$在  [a， b]， $g(y)$  在  $[c， d]$  上的  (R)  可积性对于  $g[f(x)]$ 在 $ [a， b]$  上的  (R)  可积性来说既非充分的也非必要的。例(a)： 设  $f(x)$  定义于  [0，1]  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n， x \text { 为非零有理数且表为既约分数 } m / n， \\0， \quad x \text { 为无理数或零， }\end{array}\right.$则  $f(x)$  在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积。 再设$g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1，0<y \leqslant 1， \\0， y=0 。\end{array}\right.$显然，  $g(y)$在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积。 而复合函数$g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$在  [0，1]  上无处连续， 故它在  [0，1]  上不  (R)  可积。
例(b)： 设  $f(x)$  定义于  [0，1] ：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n， x \text { 为非零有理数且表为既约分数 } m / n， \\0， x \text { 为无理数或零。}\end{array}\right.$再设  $g(y)$  定义于  [0，1] ， 且$g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， y \text { 为有理数， } \\1， y \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$显然， $f(x)$ 在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积， 而 $g(y)$ 在  [0，1]  上不  (R)  可积， 复合函数$g[f(x)] \equiv 0$在  [0，1] 上显然  (R)  可积。
例(c): 设在  [0，1]  上，  $f(x)=1-x $， 而在  [0，1]  上，$ g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l} 1， y \text { 为无理数， } \\0， y \text { 为有理数。 }\end{array}\right.$ 显然，  $f(x)$  在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积， $ g(y)$  在  [0，1]  上不(R) 可积， 而复合函数 $g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为无理数， } \\0， x \text { 为有理数. }\end{array}\right.$它在  [0，1]  上显然不  (R)  可积。
例(d): 设在  [0，1]  上，  $f(x)$  为:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x， x \text { 为有理数，} \\0， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$它显然不  (R)  可积， 而在  [0，1]  上  $g(y)$  为:$g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n， y \text { 为非零有理数且表为既约分数 } m / n， \\0， y \text { 为无理数或零。 }\end{array}\right.$它在  [0，1]  上  (R)  可积，而复合函数$g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / n， x \text { 为非理有理数且表为既约分数 } m / n \\0， x \text { 为无理数或零。 }\end{array}\right.$它位在[0，1]  上  (R)  可积。
例(e) :设  $f(x)$  如  (d) ， 而在  [0，1]  上  $g(y) \Rightarrow y_{1}^{2}$； 此时复合函数$g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{2}， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$在  [0，1]  上不  (R)  可积。
例(f): 设在  [0，1]  上，$f(x)$ 为:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为无理数， } \\0， x \text { 为有理数， }\end{array}\right.$而在  [0，1]  上，  $g(y)$  为:$g(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， y \text { 为无理数， } \\0， y \text { 为有理数， }\end{array}\right.$它们在  [0，1]  上均不  (R)  可积， 而复合函数$g[f(x)]=0$在  [0，1]  上  (R) 可积。
例(g): 设在  [0，1]  上$f(x)$ 为：$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x+2， & x \text { 为无理数， } \\x， & x \text { 为有理数， }\end{array}\right.$它在  [0，1]  上为不  (R)  可积。再设在  [2，3]  上 $ g(y)$  为$g(y) =\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， y \text { 为无理数， } \\0， y \text { 为有理数. }\end{array}\right.$于是， 复合函数在  [0，1] 上：$g[f(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为无理数，} \\0， x \text { 为有理数。 }\end{array}\right.g(y)$ 与 $g[f(x)]$ 均不  (R)  可积。至于$f(x)$和  $g(y)$  均 (R) 可积时， $ g[f(x)]$  为 (R) 可积的例子是平凡的，如取$f(x)$及$g(y)$均连续即可。综上所述，有下表:$\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f(x) \text { 在 }[a， b] & g(y) \text { 在 }[c， d] & g[f(x)] \text { 在 }[a， b] & \text {例} \\\hline 1 & \text { 可积 } & \text { 可积} & \text { 可积 } & \text { 平凡 } \\\hline 2 & \text { 可积 } & \text { 可积 } & \text { 不可积 } & (a) \\\hline 3 & \text { 可积 } & \text { 不可积} & \text { 可积 } & (b) \\\hline 4 & \text { 可积 } & \text { 不可积} & \text { 不可积} & \text { (c)} \\\hline 5 & \text { 不可积 } & \text { 可积 } & \text { 可积 } & \text { (d) } \\\hline 6 & \text { 不可积 } & \text { 可积 } & \text {不可积 } & \text {(e)} \\\hline 7 & \text { 不可积 } & \text {不可积} & \text { 可积 } & (f) \\\hline 8 & \text { 不可积 } & \text {不可积} & \text { 不可积 } & (g) \\\hline\end{array}$

statement: There exists a function f, such that $f_{x}\left(x_{0}, y_{0}\right)=0, f_{y}\left(x_{0}, y_{0}\right)=0$, but $\left(x_{0}, y_{0}\right)$ is not an extremum point of $f(x, y)$.
chinese_statement: 存在函数  f  ，使  $f_{x}\left(x_{0}， y_{0}\right)=0 ， f_{y}\left(x_{0}， y_{0}\right)=0 $ ，但  $\left(x_{0}， y_{0}\right)$  并非  $f(x， y)$  的极值点。
rationale: For the function $z=f(x, y)=y^{2}-x^{2}$, the partial derivatives are $\frac{\partial z}{\partial x}=-2x, \frac{\partial z}{\partial y}=2y$, so $f_{x}(0,0)=0, f_{y}(0,0)=0$. When $y=0$, $z=-x^{2}$, so the origin is exactly the maximum point of this parabola; and when $x=0$, $z=y^{2}$, thus the origin is the minimum point of this curve. Therefore, the function $f(x, y)$ has no extremum at point (0,0).
chinese_rationale: 函数  $z=f(x， y)=y^{2}-x^{2}$  的偏导数是  $\frac{\partial z}{\partial x}=-2 x ，\frac{\partial z}{\partial y}=2 y$ ， 所以$f_{x}(0，0)=0， f_{y}(0，0)=0 $\text {。}当  $y=0$  时， $ z=-x^{2}$ ， 所以原点恰是这条抛物线的极大点; 而当 $ x=0 $ 时，  $z=y^{2}$  ，这样原点又是这条曲线的极小点。 由此可知， 函数  $f(x， y)$  在  (0，0)  点无极值。

statement: Given a sequence $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ tending to zero, a sequence of non-negative measurable functions $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ can be constructed such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x$ converges, while $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge to zero anywhere on E.
chinese_statement: 任给趋于零的数列$\left\{a_{n}\right\} $， 可构造一个非负可测函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$ ，使  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x$  收敛， 而  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上无处收敛于零。
rationale: Since $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n}=0$, we can choose a subsequence $\left\{a_{n_{k}}\right\}$ such that $\left|a_{n_{k}}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2^{k} \quad(k=1,2, \cdots)$. Define the sequence of functions $ \left\{f_{n}\right\} $ on the measurable set $E(m E<+\infty)$ as follows: When n equals some $n_{k}$, $f_{n}(x) \equiv 1$; and when n does not equal any $n_{k}$, $f_{n}(x) \equiv 0$. Clearly, $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$ is a sequence of non-negative measurable functions on E, and $\begin{aligned}& \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right| \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n_{k}}\right|\int_{E} d x \\= & \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n_{k}}\right| m E \leqslant m E \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{k}}=m E<+\infty,\end{aligned}$ so the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x$ is convergent. On the other hand, for any positive integer n, a positive integer $ n_{k}>n$ can always be found, at which time $ f_{n_{n}}(x) \equiv 1$. Hence, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ does not converge to zero anywhere on E.
chinese_rationale: 由于$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n}=0$ ， 故可选取子列 $\left\{a_{n_{k}}\right\}$， 使$\left|a_{n_{k}}\right| \leqslant 1 / 2^{k} \quad(k=1，2， \cdots)$ 。在可测集$E(m E<+\infty)$上定义函数序列$ \left\{f_{n}\right\} $如下: 当  n  等于某个 $n_{k}$  时，  $f_{n}(x) \equiv 1$ ; 而当  n  不等于任何一个 $ n_{k}$  时，  $f_{n}(x) \equiv 0$ 。 显然，  $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$  是  E  上的非负可测函数序列，且$\begin{aligned}& \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right| \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n_{k}}\right|\int_{E} d x \\= & \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n_{k}}\right| m E \leqslant m E \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{k}}=m E<+\infty，\end{aligned}$所以级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \int_{E} f_{n}(x) d x$  是收敛的。另一方面， 对任意的正整数  n ， 总可找到正整数 $ n_{k}>n$ ， 此时 $ f_{n_{n}}(x) \equiv 1$ 。 可见$\left\{f_{n}\right\}$在  E  上无处收敛于零。

statement: There exists a function that satisfies the Lipschitz condition but is nowhere monotonic.
chinese_statement: 存在满足 Lipschitz 条件而无处单调的函数。
rationale: Let f be the bounded derivative of a function F on $[a, b]$, such that $\{x: f(x)>0\}$ and $\{x: f(x)<0\}$ are dense in $[a, b]$. Such a function F exists. Since $F^{\prime}=f$ is bounded on [a, b], F satisfies the Lipschitz condition on [a, b]. Furthermore, since the sets $\left\{x: \boldsymbol{F}^{\prime}(x)>0\right\}$ and $\left\{x: F^{\prime}(x)<0\right\}$ are dense in $\left[a, b\right.$, F is nowhere monotonic on $[a, b]$.
chinese_rationale: 设  f  是$[a， b]$上的函数  F  的有界导函数， 使得  $\{x: f(x)>0\}$  和 $ \{x: f(x)<0\}$  在 $ [a， b] $ 内都稠密。 这种函数  F  是存在的。由于 $ F^{\prime}=f $ 在[a， b]  上有界， 故  F  在  [a， b]上满足Lipschitz 条件， 又由于集 $\left\{x: \boldsymbol{F}^{\prime}(x)>0\right)$  和 $ \left\{x: F^{\prime}(x)<0\right\}$  在 $ \left[a， b]\right.$中都稠密， 故  F在$[a， b]$  上无处单增。

statement: There exist a function $ f(x, y)$ that, for every x, is a Borel measurable function of y, and for every y, is a Borel measurable function of x, but f(x, y) is not (L) measurable.
chinese_statement: 函数 $ f(x， y)$ ， 对每一  x ， 它是  y  的 Borel 可测函数， 对每一  y ， 它是  x  的 Borel 可测函数， 但  f(x， y)  并不  (L)  可测。
rationale: Let A be a non-(L) measurable subset of $I=[0,1] \times[0,1]$, intersecting each line parallel to the x-axis and each line parallel to the y-axis at most two points. Define the function f on $I$ as follows: $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, (x, y) \in A, \\0, (x, y) \in I \backslash A,\end{array}\right.$ Since A is a non-(L) measurable subset of I, f is a non-(L) measurable function on I. On the other hand, for each set $A_{x_{0}}=\left\{y:\left(x_{0}, y\right) \in I\right\}, A_{y_{0}}=\left\{x:\left(x, y_{0}\right) \in I\right\}$, they have at most only two points. Hence for any real number a, the sets $\begin{array}{ll} & \left\{y: f\left(x_{0}, y\right)>a, y \in A_{x_{0}}\right\} \\\text { and } & \left\{x: f\left(x, y_{0}\right)>a, x \in A_{y_{0}}\right\}\end{array}$ are always Borel measurable sets, thus $f\left(x_{0}, y\right)$ and $f\left(x, y_{0}\right)$ are respectively Borel measurable functions of y and x.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  为  $I=[0，1] \times[0，1]$  中的一个非  (L)  可测子集， 它与每一平行于  x  轴的直线及每一平行于  y  轴的直线至多只有两个交点。 在  $I$  上定义函数  f  如次:$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1，(x， y) \in A， \\0，(x， y) \in I \backslash A，\end{array}\right.$由于  A  为  I  的非  (L)  可测子集，故  f  是  I  上的非  (L)  可测函数。另一方面， 对每一个集$A_{x_{0}}=\left\{y:\left(x_{0}， y\right) \in I\right\}， A_{y_{0}}=\left\{x:\left(x， y_{0}\right) \in I\right\}$，它们至多仅有两个点， 因而对任意实数  a ， 集$\begin{array}{ll} & \left\{y: f\left(x_{0}， y\right)>a， y \in A_{x_{0}}\right\} \\\text { 与 } & \left\{x: f\left(x， y_{0}\right)>a， x \in A_{y_{0}}\right\}\end{array}$恒为 Borel 可测集， 从而  $f\left(x_{0}， y\right)$  与  $f\left(x， y_{0}\right)$  分别是  y  与  x  的 Borel 可测函数。

statement: Convergence almost everywhere implies convergence nearly uniformly.
chinese_statement: 几乎处处收敛蕴含近一致收敛。
rationale: For example, let $E=[0, +\infty)$, set $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in\left[n, n+\frac{1}{n}\right] \\0, x \in E \backslash\left[n, n+\frac{1}{n}\right] \end{array}\right.$. It is easy to see that $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges to $f \equiv 0$ almost everywhere on $E$. However, it does not converge nearly uniformly to 0 on $E$. Otherwise, for any $\varepsilon>0$, there exists a $e \subset E$ such that $me<\varepsilon$, and $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges uniformly to 0 on $E \backslash e$. Then there exists a positive integer $N$ such that for all $n \geqslant N$, and for all $x \in E \backslash e$, $\left|f_{n}(x)\right|<1$. Let $A_{m}=\left[n, n+\frac{1}{n}\right]$, on $A_{n}$, $f_{n}(x)=1$ always holds. Thus, we see that $(E \backslash e) \cap\left(\bigcup_{k=N}^{\infty} A_{k}\right)=\varnothing$. Therefore, $\bigcup_{k=N}^{\infty} A_{k} \subset e$, hence $me \geqslant \sum_{k=N}^{\infty} m A_{k}=\sum_{k=N}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k}=+\infty$, which contradicts $me<\varepsilon$.
chinese_rationale: 例如， 设  $E=[0，+\infty)$ ， 令$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in\left[n， n+\frac{1}{n}\right] \\0， x \in E \backslash\left[n， n+\frac{1}{n}\right] 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上处处收敛于 $ f \equiv 0 $。但是， 它在  E  上并不近一致收敛于 0。如若不然， 即对任意的 $ \varepsilon>0$ ， 在在 $ e \subset E$ ， 使  $m e<\varepsilon $， 而  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在  $E \backslash e $ 上一致收敛于 0 ， 那么就有正整数  N  存在， 当  $n \geqslant N$  时，对一切 $x \in B \backslash e$ ， 都有$\left|f_{n}(x)\right|<1 $。令  $A_{m}=\left[n， n+\frac{1}{n}\right]$ ， 在  $A_{n}$  上， 恒有$f_{n}(x)=1$ 。 由此可见$(E \backslash e) \cap\left(\bigcup_{k=N}^{\infty} A_{k}\right)=\varnothing$ 。于是得到$ \bigcup_{k=N}^{\infty} A_{k} \subset e$ ， 因而$m e \geqslant \sum_{k=N}^{\infty} m A_{k}=\sum_{k=N}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k}=+\infty$，这与$ m e<\varepsilon $发生矛盾。

statement: A measurable function that is nowhere continuous remains nowhere continuous no matter how its values are altered on any set with measure zero.
chinese_statement: 一个无处连续的可测函数， 不论怎样改变此函数在任何测度为零的集上的值，它仍然是无处连续的。
rationale: Construct a measurable set E within [0,1] such that for any open interval $I\subset [0,1]$, we always have $m(I \cap E)>0, m\left(I \cap E^{c}\right)>0$ (refer to Chapter 7, Example 14). Define a function f on [0,1]: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & x \in E, \\0, & x \in[0,1] \backslash E.\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, f is a nowhere continuous measurable function on [0,1]. Consider any subset e of [0,1] with measure zero, and arbitrarily change the values of f on e, that is, let $\begin{array}{c}\boldsymbol{F}(\boldsymbol{x})=\left\{\begin{array}{l}f(x), x \in[0,1] \backslash e, \\\varphi(x), x \in e, \end{array}\right. \end{array} $ or $\boldsymbol{F}(\boldsymbol{x})=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in E \backslash \boldsymbol{e}, \\0, x \in[0,1] \backslash(E \cup e), \\\varphi(x), x \in e,\end{array}\right.$ where $ \varphi(x)$ is any function on e. Since for any open interval $ I \subset[0,1] $, we always have $m(I \cap(E \backslash e))>0; m\left(I \cap(E \backslash e)^{\circ}\right)>0$, F remains a nowhere continuous function on [0,1]. Note: This example illustrates that the conclusion of the Lusin theorem cannot be strengthened to "there exists a closed set $F \subset E$, such that $m(E \backslash F)=0$, and f is continuous on the closed set F".
chinese_rationale: 在[0，1]内作以可测集E，使对任何开区间$I\subset [0，1]$，恒有$m(I \cap E)>0， m\left(I \cap E^{c}\right)>0$（参看第七章例  14 ）。在  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1， & x \in E， \\0， & x \in[0，1] \backslash E 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  是  [0，1]  上的一个无处连续的可测函数。任取  [0，1]  的测度为零的子集  e ， 作在  e  上任意改变函数  f  的值， 即可设$\begin{array}{c}\boldsymbol{F}(\boldsymbol{x})=\left\{\begin{array}{l}f(x)， x \in[0，1] \backslash e， \\\varphi(x)， x \in e，\end{array}\right. \\$或$\boldsymbol{F}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in E \backslash \boldsymbol{e}， \\0， x \in[0，1] \backslash(E \cup e)， \\\varphi(x)， x \in e，\end{array}\right.\end{array}$其中 $ \varphi(x)$  是  e  上的任意函数。 由于对任意开区间 $ I \subset[0，1] $， 恒有$m(I \cap(E \backslash e))>0 ; m\left(I \cap(E \backslash e)^{\circ}\right)>0，$所以  F  在  [0，1]  上仍然是一个个无处连续的函数。注 这个例子地说明了不能把 Лузин 定理的结论加强为“存在闭集 $ F \subset E$， 使  $m(E \backslash F)=0 $， 而  f  在闭集  F  上是连续的”。

statement: The composite function is always differentiable.
chinese_statement: 复合函数一定可微。
rationale: Regarding the differentiability of composite functions, we know the theorem: If $f(x)$ is differentiable at $x=x_{0}$ and $g(y)$ is differentiable at $y_{0}=f\left(x_{0}\right)$, then the composite function $\left.g_{-}^{-} f(x)\right]$ is differentiable at $x=x_{0}$. However, when $f(x)$ is differentiable at $x=x_{0}$ and $g(y)$ is not differentiable at $y=y_{0}$, or vice versa, different results can occur: (a): $f(x)=x^{2}$ is differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=|y|$ is not differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, yet the composite function $g[f(x)]=x^{2}$ is differentiable at $x=0$. (b): $f(x)=sin x$ is differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=|y|$ is not differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, and the composite function $g[f(x)]=|sin x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$. (c): $f(x)=|x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=y^{2}$ is differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, yet the composite function $g[f(x)]=x^{2}$ is differentiable at $x=0$. (d): $f(x)=|x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=\sin y$ is differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, yet the composite function $\left.g_{-}^{\sim} f(x)\right]=\sin |x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$. (e): $f(x)=\frac{2}{3} x-\frac{1}{3}|x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=2 y+|y|$ is not differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, yet the composite function $g[f(x)]=x$ is differentiable at $x=0$. (f): $f(x)=\sin |x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$, $g(y)=|y|$ is not differentiable at $y_{0}=f(0)=0$, and the composite function $g[f(x)]=|\sin | x||=\sin |x|$ is not differentiable at $x=0$. In summary, the following table can be displayed: $\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f(x) \text { at } x=x_{0} & g(y) \text { at } y_{0}=f\left(x_{0}\right) & g[f(x)] \text { at } x=x_{0} & \text { Example } \\\hline 1 & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Theorem } \\\hline 2 & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { (a) } \\\hline 3 & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { (b) } \\\hline 4 & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & (c) \\\hline 5 & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & (d) \\\hline 6 & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Differentiable } & \text { (e) } \\\hline 7 & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & \text { Not Differentiable } & (f) \\\hline\end{array}$
chinese_rationale: 关于复合函数可微性， 我们熟知定理：若$f(x)$  在  $x=x_{0}$  可微，  $g(y)$  在  $y_{0}=f\left(x_{0}\right)$  可微， 则复合函数  $\left.g_{-}^{-} f(x)\right]$  在  $x=x_{0}$  可微。但当  $f(x)$  在$x=x_{0}$， $g(y)$  在 $ y=y_{0} $ 不同时可微时， 可以有下述各种不同的结果：(a)：$f(x)=x^{2} $ 在 $x=0$ 可微，  $g(y)=|y|$  在 $y_{0}=f(0)=0 $ 不可微， 而复合函数$g[f(x)]=x^{2}$在 $x=0$可微。(b)：$f(x)=sin x $ 在 $x=0$ 可微， $g(y)=|y|$  在 $y_{0}=f(0)=0$ 不可微， 而复台函数$g[f(x)]=|sin x|在  $x=0$  不可微。(c)：$f(x)=|x|$  在  $x=0$  不可微，  $g(y)=y^{2}$  在 $y_{0}=f(0)=0$  可微， 而复合函数$g[f(x)]=x^{2}$在  $x=0$  可微。(d)：$f(x)-=|x|$  在  $x=0$  不可微，  $g(y)=\sin y$  在  $y_{0}=f(0)=0$ 可微， 复合函数$\left.g_{-}^{\sim} f(x)\right]=\sin |x|$在 $ x=0$  不可微。(e) ： $f(x)=\frac{2}{3} x-\frac{1}{3}|x|$  在  $x=0 $ 不可微，  $g(y)=2 y+|y|$  在  $y_{0}   =f(0)=0$  不可微， 而复合函数$g[f(x)]=x$在  $x=0$  可微。(f) ： $f(x)=\sin |x|$  在  $x=0 $ 不可微，  $g(y)=|y|$  在  $y_{0}=f(0)   =0 $ 不可微， 复合函数（在  x=0  的某个领域内）$g[f(x)]=|\sin | x||=\sin |x|$在  $x=0$  不可微。总之， 可列出下表$\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f(x) \text { 在 } x=x_{0} & g(y) \text { 在 } y_{0}=f\left(x_{0}\right) & g[f(x)] \text { 在 } x=x_{0}& \text { 例 } \\\hline 1 & \text { 可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { 定理 } \\\hline 2 & \text { 可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { (a) } \\\hline 3 & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & \text { (b) } \\\hline 4 & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { 可微 } & (c) \\\hline 5 & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & (d) \\\hline 6 & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 可微 } & \text { (e) } \\\hline 7 & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & \text { 不可微 } & (f) \\\hline\end{array}$

statement: There exists a simple arc with infinite length between every two different points.
chinese_statement: 存在每两个不同点之间的弧段长度无限的筒单弧。
rationale: For any function f that is continuous everywhere and nowhere differentiable on a closed interval, its graph possesses the required property. If the arc length between its two different points $(\alpha, f(\alpha))$ and $(\beta, f(\beta))$ is finite, then $f(x)$ should be a function of bounded variation on $[\alpha, \beta]$, making it almost everywhere differentiable on $[\alpha, \beta]$, which is a contradiction.
chinese_rationale: 闭区间上处处连续而又无处可微的任何函数  f ， 其图形都有所要求的性质， 因为， 如果它在其两个不同点  $(\alpha， f(\alpha))$  与  $(\beta， f(\beta)  )$之间的弧段长度是有限的， 那么  $f(x)$  在  $[\alpha， \beta]$  上应当是有界变差的函数， 从而它在  $[\alpha， \beta]$  上几乎处处可微， 此为矛盾。

statement: There exists a function of bounded variation whose Fourier series is not absolutely convergent.
chinese_statement: 存在一个有界变差函数，其 Fourier 级数并不绝对收敛。
rationale: According to Jordan's test for convergence, the Fourier series of a function of bounded variation must converge. Zygmund proved that if a function of bounded variation $f \in H^{a}[0, 2 \pi](\alpha>0)$, then the Fourier series of f is absolutely convergent. However, the Fourier series of a function of bounded variation is not necessarily absolutely convergent. For example, we define a function f on $[0, 2 \pi)$ as follows:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(\pi-s) / 2, 0<x<2 \pi, \\0, \quad x=0,\end{array}\right.$ and define it elsewhere by periodicity. Thus, f is a function of bounded variation on the interval $[0, 2 \pi)$. It is easily seen that it is also an odd function, hence $a_{n}=0$. And for $n>0$, by integration by parts we find $b_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi}(\pi-x) \sin n x d x=\frac{1}{n}$, so the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(\left|a_{n}\right|+\left|b_{n}\right|\right)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$ diverges, that is, the Fourier series of f is not absolutely convergent.
chinese_rationale: 由Jordan 判敛法可知， 有界变差函数的 Fourier 级数必定收敛。 Zygmund  曾证明: 若有界变差函数  $f \in H^{a}[0，2 \pi](\alpha>0)$ ，则  f  的 Fourier 级数必定绝对收敛。 然而， 有界变差函数的Fourier 级数未必绝对收敛。 例如， 我们在$[0，2 \pi)$  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(\pi-s) / 2，0<x<2 \pi， \\0， \quad x=0，\end{array}\right.$而在其它地方由周期性来定义。 于是，  f  是区间  $[0，2 \pi)$  上的有界变差函数。易见，它还是一个奇函数，因而$a_{n}=0$。 而当  $n>0$  时， 由分部积分得$b_{n}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{0}^{\pi}(\pi-x) \sin n x d x=\frac{1}{n}$，故级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(\left|a_{n}\right|+\left|b_{n}\right|\right)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$  发散， 即  f  的 Fourier 级数不绝对收敛。

statement: The condition of uniform boundedness of the function sequence cannot be removed in the Lebesgue Dominated Convergence Theorem.
chinese_statement: Lebesgue 有界收敛定理中函数序列一致有界的 条件不可去掉。
rationale: Define the function sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ on the interval $[0, 1]$ as follows: $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n, 0<x<1 / n, \\0, x=0 \text { or } 1 / n \leqslant x \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$ It is obvious that $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ converges everywhere on $[0, 1]$ to $f \equiv 0$. However, $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) dx=1, \quad \int_{0}^{1} f(x) dx=0$, so $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) dx \neq \int_{0}^{\mathrm{1}} f(x) dx$.
chinese_rationale: 在区间 $[0，1]$上定义函数序列 $\left\{f_{n}\right\} $ 如下:$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}n， 0<x<1 / n， \\0， x=0 \text { 或 } 1 / n \leqslant x \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$易见，  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  在 $[0，1]$上处处收敛于$f \equiv 0$。 但是$\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x=1， \quad \int_{0}^{1} f(x) d x=0$，所以$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \neq\int_{0}^{\mathrm{1}} f(x) d x$ 。

statement: There exists a convergent but not absolutely convergent improper integral.
chinese_statement: 存在收敛而不绝对收敛的广义积分。
rationale: A typical example of an improper integral that is convergent but not absolutely convergent is $\int_{\pi }^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x $. To prove that $\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ converges, for any $s>\pi$, we have (using integration by parts) $\int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x=-\frac{1}{\pi}-\frac{\cos s}{s}-\int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\cos x}{x^{2}} d x$ (1). Since $\quad \frac{|\cos x|}{x^{2}} \leqslant \frac{1}{x^{2}},(\pi \leqslant x<+\infty)$, and the improper integral $ \left.\right|_{\pi} ^{+\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}} d x $ (absolutely) converges, it follows that $ \int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\cos x}{{x}^{2}} d x$ converges absolutely, so it converges. Therefore, when $s\rightarrow+\infty$, each term on the right-hand side of equation (1) tends to a finite limit, so $\lim _{s\rightarrow+\infty} \int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ exists, which proves that $ \int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ converges. Here is the proof that $\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ is not absolutely convergent. For any positive integer N, we have $\begin{array}{l}\int_{\pi}^{N\pi} \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \int_{n\pi}^{(n+1)\pi} \frac{\left.|\sin x\right|}{x} d x \\\geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{(n+1) \pi} \int_{n_{\pi}}^{(n+1)\pi}|\sin x| d x \\\left.\left.=\frac{1}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1} \int_{0}^{\pi} \right[ \sin (u+n \pi)\right] d u 。\\\end{array}$ Now $\begin{aligned}\sin (u+n \pi) & =\sin u \cos n \pi+\cos u \sin n \pi \\& =\sin u \cos n \pi 。\end{aligned}$ Since $\cos n \pi= \pm 1 $, this implies that $|\sin (u+n \pi)|=|\sin u|$ . Therefore, if $0 \leqslant u \leqslant \pi$, then $\sin (u+n \pi)|=\sin u $. Thus $\begin{array}{c}\int_{\pi}^{N} \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x \geqslant \frac{1}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1} \int_{0}^{\pi} \sin u d u \\=\frac{2}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1}=\frac{2}{\pi} \sum_{k=2}^{N} \frac{1}{k}\end{array}$ (2). Since the series $ \sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k} $ diverges, by taking N sufficiently large, the value on the right-hand side of equation (2) can be made as large as desired. This result, combined with equation (2), proves that $\lim _{\varepsilon \rightarrow \infty} \int_{\pi}^{\varepsilon } \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x$ cannot exist. Therefore, $\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ does not converge absolutely.
chinese_rationale: 收敛而不绝对收敛的广义积分的典型例子是$\int_{\pi }^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x $。要证明$\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ 收敛，对于任意的$s>\pi$  ，我们有(利用分部积分法)$\int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x=-\frac{1}{\pi}-\frac{\cos s}{s}-\int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\cos x}{x^{2}} d x$(1)由于$\quad \frac{|\cos x|}{x^{2}} \leqslant \frac{1}{x^{2}}，(\pi \leqslant x<+\infty)$ ，而广义积分$ \left.\right|_{\pi} ^{+\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}} d x $ (绝对)收敛， 的此推得 $ \int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\cos x}{{x}^{2}} d x$  绝对收敛，因而收敛。因此当$s\rightarrow+\infty$时，(1)式右端各项均趋向有限极限，所以$\lim _{s\rightarrow+\infty} \int_{\pi}^{s} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$存在，这就证明了$ \int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$ 收敛。  兹证  $\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$  不绝对收敛。对于任意的正整数  N ， 我们有$\begin{array}{l}\int_{\pi}^{N\pi} \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \int_{n\pi}^{(n+1)\pi} \frac{\left.|\sin x\right|}{x} d x \\\geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{(n+1) \pi} \int_{n_{\pi}}^{(n+1)\pi}|\sin x| d x \\\left.\left.=\frac{1}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1} \int_{0}^{\pi} \right[ \sin (u+n \pi)\right] d u 。\\\end{array}$现在$\begin{aligned}\sin (u+n \pi) & =\sin u \cos n \pi+\cos u \sin n \pi \\& =\sin u \cos n \pi 。\end{aligned}$由于$\cos n \pi= \pm 1 $， 这说明  $|\sin (u+n \pi)|=|\sin u|$ 。 因此， 若$0 \leqslant u   \leqslant \pi$， 则$\sin (u+n \pi)|=\sin u $。 所以$\begin{array}{c}\int_{\pi}^{N} \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x \geqslant \frac{1}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1} \int_{0}^{\pi} \sin u d u \\=\frac{2}{\pi} \sum_{n=1}^{N-1} \frac{1}{n+1}=\frac{2}{\pi} \sum_{k=2}^{N} \frac{1}{k}\end{array}$(2)因为级数$ \sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k} $发散， 所以只要把  N  取得足够大， 就可以使(2)式右端的值要多大就有多大。 这一结果结合(2)式， 就证明了$\lim _{\varepsilon \rightarrow \infty} \int_{\pi}^{\varepsilon } \frac{|\sin x|}{x} d x$不可能存在。因而$\int_{\pi}^{+\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x$不绝对收敛。

statement: There exist sets $A$ and $\boldsymbol{B}$ such that $\boldsymbol{A}^{\circ}\cup\boldsymbol{B}^{\circ}\neq(\boldsymbol{A}\cup\boldsymbol{B})^{\circ}$.
chinese_statement: 存在集$A$与$\boldsymbol{B}$，使$\boldsymbol{A}^{\circ}\cup\boldsymbol{B}^{\circ}\neq(\boldsymbol{A}\cup\boldsymbol{B})^{\circ}$。
rationale: Take $A=[0, 1]$ and $B=[1, 2]$, then $A^{\circ}=(0, 1)$, $B^{\circ}=(1, 2)$, therefore $A^{\circ}\cup B^{\circ}=(0, 2)\backslash\{1\}$. But $(A\cup B)^{\circ}=(0, 2)$, hence $A^{\circ}\cup B^{\circ}\neq(A\cup B)^{\circ}$.
chinese_rationale: 取$A=[0，1]，B=[1，2]$，则$A^{\circ}=(0，1)，B^{\circ}=(1，2)$，从而$A^{\circ}\cup B^{\circ}=(0，2)\backslash\{1\}$。但$(A\cup B)^{\circ}=(0，2)$，因此$A^{\circ}\cup B^{\circ}\neq(A\cup B)^{\circ}$。

statement: There exists a function that is uniformly continuous on both open intervals $I_{1}$ and $I_{2}$, but not uniformly continuous on $I_{1} \cup I_{2}$.
chinese_statement: 存在在开区间  $I_{1}$  与  $I_{2}$  上均一致连续， 但在  $I_{1} \cup I_{2}$  上不一致连续的函数。
rationale: Consider $\quad f(x)=|\sin x|/x$. It can be shown that $f$ is uniformly continuous on the open intervals $I_{1}=(-1,0)$ and $I_{2}=(0,1)$. In fact, let $F(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x=0, \\f(x), 0<x<1, \\\sin 1, x=1.\end{array}\right.$ Since $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} f(x)=1, \lim _{x \rightarrow 1-} f(x)=\sin 1$, the function $F(x)$ is continuous on the closed interval [0,1]. By Cantor's theorem, $F(x)$ is uniformly continuous on [0,1], hence $F(x)$ is also uniformly continuous on (0,1), meaning $f(x)$ is uniformly continuous on the open interval $I_{2}$. Similarly, it can be shown that $f(x)$ is uniformly continuous on the open interval $I_{1}$. Now, to prove that $f$ is not uniformly continuous on $I_{1} \cup I_{2}=\{x: 0<|x|<1\}$, take $x^{\prime}>0 ; x^{\prime \prime}=-x^{\prime}<0$, then $\left|f\left(x^{\prime}\right)-f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)\right|=\left|\frac{\left|\sin x^{\prime}\right|}{x^{\prime}}-\frac{\left|\sin x^{\prime \prime}\right|}{x^{\prime \prime}}\right|=2 \frac{\sin x^{\prime}}{x^{\prime}} $. Since $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \sin x / x=1 $, for any $ \varepsilon(0<\varepsilon<1)$, no matter how small a positive $\delta$ is taken, there exists a positive $h$, such that $ \left|x^{\prime}-x^{\prime \prime}\right|=h<\delta$, and $\left|f\left(x^{\prime}\right)-f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)\right|=2 \sin x^{\prime} / x^{\prime} \geqslant \varepsilon$. Thus, $f$ is not uniformly continuous on $I_{1} \cup I_{2}$.
chinese_rationale: 置  $\quad f(x)=|\sin x|/x$ 可证  f  在开区间  $I_{1}=(-1，0)$  及 $ I_{2}=(0，1)$  上都是一致连续的。 事实上， 设$F(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x=0， \\f(x)， 0<x<1， \\\sin 1， x=1 。\end{array}\right.$因为  $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} f(x)=1， \lim _{x \rightarrow 1-} f(x)=\sin 1 $， 所以函数  $F(x)$  在闭区间  [0，1] 上连续。 由 Cantor 定理知  $F(x)$  在  [0，1]  上一致连续， 从而$F(x)$ 在  (0，1)  上也一致连续， 即  $f(x)$  在开区间 $ I_{2}$  上一致连续。同理可证，  $f(x)$  在开区间  $I_{1}$  上也是一致连续的。兹证  f  在  $I_{1} \cup I_{2}=\{x: 0<|x|<1\}$  上不一致连续。 为此取  $x^{\prime}>0 ; x^{\prime \prime}=-x^{\prime}<0 $， 则$\left|f\left(x^{\prime}\right)-f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)\right|=\left|\frac{\left|\operatorname{Bin} x^{\prime}\right|}{x^{\prime}}-\frac{\left|\sin x^{\prime \prime}\right|}{x^{\prime \prime}}\right|=2 \frac{\sin x^{\prime}}{x^{\prime}} $。由于  $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \sin x / x=1 $， 故对于任意的 $ \varepsilon(0<\varepsilon<1)$ ， 无论正数  $\delta $ 取得怎样小， 必可取得正数  h ， 使得 $ \left|x^{\prime}-x^{\prime \prime}\right|=h<\delta$ ， 而且$\left|f\left(x^{\prime}\right)-f\left(x^{\prime \prime}\right)\right|=2 \sin x^{\prime} / x^{\prime} \geqslant \varepsilon$ 。因此，  f  在  $I_{1} \cup I_{2}$  上不是一致连续的。

statement: There exist piecewise continuous functions for each variable.
chinese_statement: 存在分别对各个变量连续的间断函数。
rationale: Let $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x y /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) & x^{2}+y^{2}>0, \\ 0, & x=y=0,\end{array}\right.$ Then for any fixed $y$, $f(x, y)$ is a continuous function of $x$; and for any fixed $x$, $f(x, y)$ is a continuous function of $y$. However, $f(x, y)$ is not continuous at the point (0, 0), because when $(x, y) \rightarrow(0, 0)$ and $x=y$, $f(x, y)$ does not tend to $f(0, 0)=0$.
chinese_rationale: 设$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x y /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) & x^{2}+y^{2}>0， \\0， & x=y=0，\end{array}\right.$则对任意固定的 $ y， f(x， y)$  是  x  的连续函数; 而对任意周定的 $ x ，  f(x， y)$  是  y  的连续函数。 但是，  $f(x， y)$  在点  (0，0)  处并不连续， 因为当  $(x， y) \rightarrow(0，0) $ 且  $x=y$  时，  $f(x， y)$  并不趋于  $f(0，0)=0$。

statement: There exists a differentiable function f on (0,1) such that f is bounded on (0,1) but f' is unbounded on (0,1).
chinese_statement: 存在(0，1)  上的一个可微函数  f ， 使  f  在  (0，1)  上有界而$f^{\prime}$在  (0 ， 1)上无界。
rationale: Let $\quad f(x)=2 \sqrt{x}$, $0 < x < 1$, then f is differentiable and bounded on (0,1). However, the derivative $f^{\prime}(x)=1 / \sqrt{x}$ is unbounded on (0,1). Note: It is easy to prove that if a function f is differentiable on a finite interval $(a, b)$, then if f is unbounded on $(a, b)$ it implies that $f^{\prime}$ is unbounded on (a, b). The above counterexample shows that the converse of this proposition is not correct.
chinese_rationale: 设$\quad f(x)=2 \sqrt{x}， 0 \cdot \cdots x<1 $，则  f  在  (0，1)  上可微且有界。 然而， 导函数$f^{\prime}(x)=1 / \sqrt{x}$在  (0，1)  上无界。注： 容易证明， 若函数  f  在有穷区间$(a， b)$上可微， 则f在$(a，b)$上无界蕴涵着$f^{\prime}$在  (a， b)  上无界。 上述反例说明了这个命题倒过来是不正确的。

statement: There exists a sequence of functions with bounded variation, whose supremum function is not of bounded variation.
chinese_statement: 存在一个有界变差函数序列，其上确界函数并不有界变差。
rationale: On the interval [0, 1], define the function f and $f_{n} (n=1, 2, \cdots): f(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x=0, \frac{1}{n}, \ 1, x=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right), n=1, 2, \cdots, \\\text{ linearly, otherwise, } \end{array}\right.\\ f_{n}(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{l}0, 0 \leqslant x<\frac{1}{n}, \\ f(x), \frac{1}{n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1. \end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that for each $n, f_{n}$ is a function of bounded variation on [0, 1], and $f(x) = \sup _{n} f_{n}(x)$. However, f is not of bounded variation on [0, 1]. In fact, in [0, 1], choose partition points $\begin{aligned}0 & <\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)<\frac{1}{n}<\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n \rightarrow 1}+\frac{1}{n}\right)<\frac{1}{n-1}<\cdots<\frac{1}{2} \\& <\frac{3}{4}<1\end{aligned}$ then it is easy to see $\begin{aligned}V= & \left|f(1)-f\left(\frac{3}{4}\right)\right|+\left|f\left(\frac{3}{4}\right)-f\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\right| \\& \left.+\cdots+\left.\mid f\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)-f(\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\right.\right) \mid \\& +\left|f\left(\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\right)-f(0)\right|=2 n, \end{aligned}$ thus $ \bigvee_{0}^{1}(f)=+\infty $.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0，1]  上如下定义函数  f  与$f_{n}(n=1，2， \cdots): f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x=0， \frac{1}{n}， \\1， x=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)， n=1，2， \cdots， \\\text { 线性， 其它， } \end{array}\right.\\ f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0，0 \leqslant x<\frac{1}{n}， \\f(x)， \frac{1}{n} \leqslant x \leqslant 1 。\end{array}\right.$易见， 对每一 $ n， f_{n}$  都是  [0，1]  上的有界变差函数， 且 $ f(x)=   \sup _{n} f_{n}(x)$ 。 但  f  在  [0，1]  上并不有界变差。 事实上， 在  [0，1]  中取分点$\begin{aligned}0 & <\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)<\frac{1}{n}<\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n \rightarrow 1}+\frac{1}{n}\right)<\frac{1}{n-1}<\cdots<\frac{1}{2} \\& <\frac{3}{4}<1\end{aligned}$那么容易看出$\begin{aligned}V= & \left|f(1)-f\left(\frac{3}{4}\right)\right|+\left|f\left(\frac{3}{4}\right)-f\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\right| \\& \left.+\cdots+\left.\mid f\left(\frac{1}{n}\right)-f(\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\right.\right) \mid \\& +\left|f\left(\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{n}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\right)-f(0)\right|=2 n，\end{aligned}$从而得到 $ \bigvee_{0}^{1}(f)=+\infty $ 。

statement: There exists a function with second-order mixed partial derivatives that are equal but not continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在二阶混合偏导数相等而不连续的函数。
rationale: Let $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{2} \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right), & x^{2}+y^{2} \neq 0 \\ 0, & x=y=0\end{array}\right.$ When $ x^{2}+y^{2} \neq 0$, $\begin{aligned}f_{x}(x, y)= & 4 x\left(x^{2}-y^{2}\right) \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)- \\& -x \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right), \\f_{y}(x, y)= & 4 y\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)- \\& -y \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right), \\f_{x y}(x, y)= & 8 x y \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) \\& +8 x y \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \\& -x y \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \\& -x y \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) .\end{aligned}$ Also, by the definition of partial derivatives, we have $\begin{array}{l}f_{x}(0,0)=f_{y}(0,0)=0, \\f_{x y}(0,0)=f_{y x}(0,0)=0 .\end{array}$ On the other hand, because when $ m>0$, $\begin{array}{l}\varlimsup_{\substack{x \rightarrow 0 \\y=m x}} f_{x y}(x, y)=\frac{m}{1+m^{2}}, \\\lim _{\substack{x \rightarrow 0 \\y=m x}} f_{x y}(x, y)=-\frac{m}{1+m^{2}}, \\\end{array}$ thus $f_{x y}(x, y)$ is not continuous at (0,0). Similarly, it can be proven that $f_{yx}(x, y)$ is also not continuous at (0,0).
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{2} \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)， & x^{2}+y^{2} \neq 0 \\ 0， & x=y=0\end{array}\right.$ 则当 $ x^{2}+y^{2} \neq 0$  时，$\begin{aligned}f_{x}(x， y)= & 4 x\left(x^{2}-y^{2}\right) \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)- \\& -x \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)， \\f_{y}(x， y)= & 4 y\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)- \\& -y \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right)， \\f_{x y}(x， y)= & 8 x y \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) \\& +8 x y \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \\& -x y \cos \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \\& -x y \sin \left(1 / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}\right) /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right) 。\end{aligned}$又按偏导数的定义，可得$\begin{array}{l}f_{x}(0，0)=f_{y}(0，0)=0， \\f_{x y}(0，0)=f_{y x}(0，0)=0 。\end{array}$另一方面，因为当 $ m>0$  时，$\begin{array}{l}\varlimsup_{\substack{x \rightarrow 0 \\y=m x}} f_{x y}(x， y)=\frac{m}{1+m^{2}}， \\\lim _{\substack{x \rightarrow 0 \\y=m x}} f_{x y}(x， y)=-\frac{m}{1+m^{2}}， \\\end{array}$所以  $f_{x y}(x， y)$  在  (0，0)  不连续。同理可证，  $f_{yx}(x， y)$  在  (0，0)  也不连续。

statement: There exists a non-constant function that achieves a local minimum everywhere.
chinese_statement: 存在处处取得局部极小值的非常值函数。
rationale: Let E be the Cantor set in the interval [0, 1], and define $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & x \in[0,1] \backslash E, \\0, & x \in E,\end{array}\right.$ then the function f has the desired properties.
chinese_rationale: 设  E  是区间  [0，1]  中的 Cantor 集， 令$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1， & x \in[0，1] \backslash E， \\0， & x \in E，\end{array}\right.$则函数  f  具有所需的性质。

statement: There exists a strictly increasing function with continuous derivatives, whose derivative is zero on a given perfect nowhere dense set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个具有连续导数的严格递增函数， 其导数在已给的完备疏集上恒为零。
rationale: Let E be a perfect nowhere dense set in [0, 1]. Define $\varphi(x)=d(x, E)=\inf _{\boldsymbol{y} \in \boldsymbol{E}}|x-y|$, then $\varphi$ is continuous on [0, 1] and $\varphi(x)=0$ when $x \in \boldsymbol{E}$, while $\varphi(x)>0$ when $x \bar{\in}\boldsymbol{E}$. Define a function f on [0, 1]: $f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} \varphi(t) dt$, then for any $x \in[0, 1]$, $f^{\prime}(x)=\varphi(x)$. Particularly, when $x \in E$, $f^{\prime}(x)=0$. Furthermore, f is strictly increasing on $[0, 1]$. To verify this, choose two points $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$, $0 \leqslant x_{1}<x_{2} \leqslant 1$, since E is a nowhere dense set, there exists an open interval $(\alpha, \beta)$ between these two points that contains no points of E. Thus, $f\left(x_{2}\right)-f\left(x_{1}\right)=\int_{x_{1}}^{x_{2}} \varphi(t) d t \geqslant \int_{\alpha}^{\beta} \varphi(t) d t=\varphi(\xi)(\beta-\alpha)$, where $\alpha<\xi<\beta$. Since $\xi \bar{\in} E$, $\varphi(\xi)>0$, thus $f\left(x_{2}\right)>f\left(x_{1}\right)$. QED.
chinese_rationale: 设E为  [0，1]  中的完备䟽集， 令$\varphi(x)=d(x， E)=\inf _{\boldsymbol{y} \in \boldsymbol{E}}|x-y|$，则  $\varphi$  在  [0，1]  上连续， 且当  $x \in \boldsymbol{E}$  时，  $\varphi(x)=0$ ， 而当$x \bar{\in}\boldsymbol{E}$  时， $\varphi(x)>0$。 在 [0，1]上定义函数 f： $f(x)=\int_{0}^{x} \varphi(t) dt$，则对任意 $x \in[0，1]$ ， 都有  $f^{\prime}(x)=\varphi(x)$ 。 特别， 当 $x \in E$  时， 有  $f^{\prime}(x)=0$ 。 此外，  f  在  $[0，1]$  上是严格递增的。 为验证这一结论， 我们任取两点 $x_{1}$ 和 $x_{2}$， $0 \leqslant x_{1}<x_{2} \leqslant 1 $， 由于  E  是疏集， 因而在这两点之间存在着不含有 E中的点的开区间 $(\alpha， \beta)$ ， 于是$f\left(x_{2}\right)-f\left(x_{1}\right)=\int_{x_{1}}^{x_{2}} \varphi(t) d t \geqslant \int_{\alpha}^{\beta} \varphi(t) d t=\varphi(\xi)(\beta-\alpha)$，其中 $ \alpha<\xi<\beta$ 。 因为 $ \xi \bar{\in} E $， 所以  $\varphi(\xi)>0 $， 从而  $f\left(x_{2}\right)>f\left(x_{1}\right)$。得所欲证。

statement: There exists a function f such that $\int_{0}^{2} f(x, y) d x $ is a discontinuous function.
chinese_statement: 存在函数  f ， 使  $\int_{0}^{2} f(x， y) d x $ 是间断函数。
rationale: Let $f(x, y)=y /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)$, and let $F(y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{y}{x^{2}+y^{2}} d x $. Since $F(y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{y}{x^{2}-y^{2}} d x=\operatorname{arctg} \frac{1}{y}$, \\ it follows that $F(0 \mid-)=\lim _{y \rightarrow 0+} F(y)=\pi / 2>0 $. Moreover, $F(0)=0$, so it is evident that $F(y)$ is discontinuous at $y=0$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(x， y)=y /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)$ ， 并令$F(y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{y}{x^{2}+y^{2}} d x $。因为$F(y)=\int_{0}^{1} \frac{y}{x^{2}-y^{2}} d x=\operatorname{arctg} \frac{1}{y}$， \\所以$F(0 \mid-)=\lim _{y \rightarrow 0+} F(y)=\pi / 2>0 $。又  $F(0)=0$ ， 可见  $F(y)$  在  $y=0$  处是间断的。

statement: There exists a convergent series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ diverges.
chinese_statement: 存在一个收敛级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ ， 使 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$发散。
rationale: Take $a_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}$, then the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges, while the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$ diverges. Note: It is easy to prove that if the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges absolutely, then $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ must converge. The above counterexample shows that in this proposition, absolute convergence cannot be weakened to conditional convergence.
chinese_rationale: 取$a_{n}=(-1)^{n} / \sqrt{n}$， 则级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$收敛， 而级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$发散。注： 容易证明， 若级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$绝对收敛， 则$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}$ 必定收敛。上述反例说明了在这个命题中， 不能把绝对收敛减弱为条件收敛。

statement: There exist two absolutely continuous functions that form a non-absolutely continuous composite function.
chinese_statement: 存在两个绝对连续函数，构成不绝对连续的复合函数。
rationale: Let $\begin{array}{l}f(y)=y^{1 / 3}, -1 \leqslant y \leqslant 1, \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{3} \cos ^{3}(\pi / x), & 0<x \leqslant 1 \\0, & \\0, &\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ When $ y \neq 0$, $f^{\prime}(y)=y^{-2 / 3} / 3$. Also, when $ -1<x<0$, we have $\int_{-1}^{x} f^{\prime}(y) d y=\frac{1}{3} \int_{-1}^{x} y^{-2 / 3} d y=x^{1 / 3}+1=f(x)-f(-1)$. While when $0<x<1$, we have $\begin{aligned}\int_{-1}^{2} f^{\prime}(y) d y & =\int_{-1}^{0} f^{\prime}(y) d y+\int_{0}^{2} f^{\prime}(x) d y \\& =-(-1)+x^{1 / 3}=f(x)-f(-1).\end{aligned}$ Therefore, $f(x)=\int_{-1}^{x} f^{\prime}(y) d y-1$. It can be seen that $f(y)=y^{1 / 8}$ is an absolutely continuous function on [-1,1]. Next, we have $g^{\prime}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}3 x^{2} \cos ^{3}(\pi / x)+3 x \sin (\pi / x) \cos ^{2}(\pi / x), & 0<x \leqslant 1, \\0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.$ so $\left|g^{\prime}(x)\right| \leqslant 6$, therefore, $g(x)$ is also an absolutely continuous function on [0,1]. Now consider the composite function $f[g(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x \cos (\pi / x), & 0<x \leqslant 1, \\0, & x=0.\end{array}\right.$ It is not difficult to verify that $f\circ g$ has infinite total variation on [0,1], and thus it is not an absolutely continuous function.
chinese_rationale: 设$\begin{array}{l}f(y)=y^{1 / 3}，-1 \leqslant y \leqslant 1， \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x^{3} \cos ^{3}(\pi / x)， & 0<x \leqslant 1 \\0， & \\0， &\end{array}\right.\end{array}$当 $ y \neq 0$ 时，  $f^{\prime}(y)=y^{-2 / 3} / 3$ 。 又当 $ -1<x<0$  时，$\int_{-1}^{x} f^{\prime}(y) d y=\frac{1}{3} \int_{-1}^{x} y^{-2 / 3} d y=x^{1 / 3}+1=f(x)-f(-1)$ 。而当 $ 0<x<1 $ 时，$\begin{aligned}\int_{-1}^{2} f^{\prime}(y) d y & =\int_{-1}^{0} f^{\prime}(y) d y+\int_{0}^{2} f^{\prime}(x) d y \\& =-(-1)+x^{1 / 3}=f(x)-f(-1) 。\end{aligned}$因之，$f(x)=\int_{-1}^{x} f^{\prime}(y) d y-1$ 。可见  $f(y)=y^{1 / 8} $ 是  [-1，1]  上的绝对连续函数。其次， 我们有$g^{\prime}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}3 x^{2} \cos ^{3}(\pi / x)+3 x \sin (\pi / x) \cos ^{2}(\pi / x)， & 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.$所以$  \left|g^{\prime}(x)\right| \leqslant 6 $， 从而  $g(x)$  也是  [0，1]  上的绝对连续函数。兹考虑复合函数$f[g(x)]=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x \cos (\pi / x)， & 0<x \leqslant 1， \\0， & x=0 .\end{array}\right.$不难验证，$f\circ g$在[0，1]上的全变差无穷大，因而它不是绝对连续的函数。

statement: There exist functions that are continuous and differentiable at only one point.
chinese_statement: 存在仅在一点连续并可微的函数。
rationale: The function $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{2}, x \text{ is irrational, } \\0, x \text{ is rational. }\end{array}\right.$ is discontinuous at all points except $x \neq 0$, but at x=0, the derivative is $f^{\prime}(0)=0$. This is because when h is a rational number, $\frac{f(h)-f(0)}{h}=\frac{0-0}{h}=0$, and when h is irrational, $\frac{f(h)-f(0)}{h}=\frac{h^{2}-0}{h}=h \rightarrow 0(h \rightarrow 0)$. Note that the above counterexample shows that if a function f is differentiable at a certain point, it only ensures that f is continuous at that point, but it does not guarantee that f is continuous in some neighborhood of that point.
chinese_rationale: 函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{2}， x \text { 为无理数， } \\0， x \text { 为有型数. }\end{array}\right.$在 $x \neq 0$  的点都间断， 而在  x=0  处有导数 $f^{\prime}(0)=0 $， 这是因为当  h 是有理数时，$\frac{f(h)-f(0)}{h}=\frac{0-0}{h}=0$，而当  h  是无理数时，$\frac{f(h)-f(0)}{h}=\frac{h^{2}-0}{h}=h \rightarrow 0(h \rightarrow 0) $。注 上述反例表明， 函数  f  在某点可微， 只能保证  f  在该点连续， 而不能保证  f  在该点的某个领域内连续。

statement: There exists a nowhere continuous non-constant periodic function with the smallest positive period.
chinese_statement: 存在一个处处不连续的非常值周期函数，它具有最小正周期。
