statement: There exists a one-to-one continuous function on a finite interval whose inverse function is not continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在有限区间上的一个一对一的连续函数， 其反函数不连续。
rationale: Consider the function $g(x)=(\cos x, \sin x), 0 \leqslant x<2 \pi$, then g is a one-to-one continuous function mapping the interval $J=[0, 2 \pi)$ onto the circumference c of the unit circle in $R^{2}$. However, $g^{-1}$ maps the circumference c onto the interval J, so it cannot be continuous because to map the circle onto an interval, the circle must be 'broken open'. In fact, we see that $g^{-1}$ maps the point (1, 0) to $0 \in J$, and all points on c close to (1, 0) but below it are mapped to points in J approaching $2 \pi$.
chinese_rationale: 考虑函数$g(x)=(\cos x， \sin x)， 0 \leqslant x<2 \pi$，则 g  是一个从区间  $J=[0， 2 \pi)$  映到  $R^{2} $ 中的单位圆的圆周  c  上的一对一的连续函数，但这时  $g^{-1}$  是把圆周  c  映到区间  J  上， 因此它不可能是连续的，因为要把圆周展开在一个区间上， 就必须 “破开”这圆周．事实上我们看到，  $g^{-1}$  把  (1，0)这一点映到 $ 0 \in J $ 上，而把接近  (1，0)  ，但在它以下的  c  上所有的点映到  J  中接近  $2 \pi$  的点上。。

statement: There exists a differentiable function f, such that when x is a rational number, $f(x)$ is a rational number, but $f^{\prime}(x)$ is an irrational number.
chinese_statement: 存在一个可微函数  f ， 当 x  为有理数时， $f(x)$  为有理数， 而$f^{\prime}(x)$为无理数。
rationale: Define the function g on the interval $[-1 / 2, 1 / 2]$ as follows: $g(y)=y\left(1-4 y^{2}\right)$, then extend g with a period of 1 to the whole $R^{1}$, becoming a periodic function. Let $f(x)=\sum_{n \rightarrow 0}^{\infty} \frac{g(n!x)}{(n!)^{2}}$(1) Since g(0)=0, and g is a function with a period of 1, the values of g at all integer points are 0, and the derivative values at any integer point are 1; moreover, for any rational number x, series (1) has at most a finite number of non-zero terms, and each non-zero term is a rational number, therefore, f(x) is a rational number. It is not difficult to verify that the derivative series of series (1) converges uniformly and absolutely, and thus converges to the derivative function of f. For any rational number, the derivative value of series (1) at that point equals the series $ \sum_{n-0}^{\infty} 1 / n! $(whose sum is e), up to at most a finite number of rational terms. Therefore, for a rational x, $f^{\prime}(x)$ is the number e plus some rational number, and since e is irrational, $f^{\prime}(x)$ is also irrational.
chinese_rationale: 在区间$[-1 / 2，1 / 2]$上定义函数  g  如下：$g(y)=y\left(1-4 y^{2}\right)$，然后把  g  以 1 彷周期扩张到整个$R^{1}$ 上，成为周期函数。令$f(x)=\sum_{n \rightarrow 0}^{\infty} \frac{g(n!x)}{(n!)^{2}}$(1)由于g(0)=0，而g是以1为周期的函数，故g在所有整数点处的值都是 0 ， 且任整数点处导数的值为 1 ; 此外， 对任何有理数  x ， 级数（1)至多有有限个非零项， 而且每个非零项都是有理数， 因此，  f(x)  为一有理数。不难验证， 级数 (1)的导函数级数一致且绝对收敛， 从而收敛于f  的导函数。对任何有理数， 级数 (1) 的导数在该点的值等于级数$ \sum_{n-0}^{\infty} 1 / n!  $(其和为  e  )， 顶多除去有限个有理项。 因此， 对有理数  x， $f^{\prime}(x)$  是数  e  加上某个有理数， 而e是无理数， 从而$f^{\prime}(x)$也是无理数。

statement: There exists a function for which only one iterated limit exists.
chinese_statement: 存在仅有一个累次极限存在的函数。
rationale: Let $f(x, y) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{xy}{x^{2}+y^{2}} + y \sin \frac{1}{x}, & x \neq 0, \\ 0, & x=0,\end{array}\right.$ then $\lim_{x \rightarrow 0} \lim_{y \rightarrow 0} f(x, y) = 0$. However, $\lim_{y \rightarrow 0} \lim_{x \rightarrow 0} f(x, y)$ and $\lim_{(x, y) \rightarrow (0, 0)} f(x, y)$ do not exist.
chinese_rationale: 设 $f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\frac{x y}{x^{2}+y^{2}}+y \sin \frac{1}{x}， & x \neq 0， \\ 0， & x=0，\end{array}\right.$ 则$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \lim _{y \rightarrow 0} f(x， y)=0 $。但是，  $\lim _{y \rightarrow 0} \lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f(x， y)$  和  $\lim _{(x， y) \rightarrow(0， 0)} f(x， y) $ 均不存在。

statement: There exists a bijection between two intervals that is nowhere monotonic.
chinese_statement: 存在两个区间之间无处单调的一一对应。
rationale: Define a function on the interval [0, 1]: $f(x)=\begin{cases}x, & \text{if } x \text{ is rational,} \\ 1-x, & \text{if } x \text{ is irrational.} \end{cases}$ Clearly, f cannot be monotonic on any non-empty subinterval of [0, 1]. The range of f is also $[0, 1]$, and f is a bijection from the interval [0, 1] to itself. Similarly, a function can be constructed with the same properties that maps the interval $[a, b]$ to the interval $[c, d]$: $g(x)=\begin{cases}c+(d-c) \frac{x-a}{b-a}, & \frac{x-a}{b-a} \text{ is rational,} \\ d+(c-d) \frac{x-a}{b-a}, & \frac{x-a}{b-a} \text{ is irrational.} \end{cases}$
chinese_rationale: 在区间  [0，1]  上定义目数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x， \quad x & \text { 是有理数， } \\1-x， & \text { 是无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$显然，  f  在  [0，1]  的任何非空子区间上都不可能是单调的。 f  的值域也是  $[0，1]$ ， 而且f  还是区间  [0，1]  到其自身的一个一一对应。类似地， 可以作出具有同样性质的将区间  $[a， b]$  映到区间  $[c ， d]$的函数:$g(x)\left\{\begin{array}{l}c+(d-c) \frac{x-a}{b-a}， \frac{x-a}{b-a} \text { 是有理数， } \\d+(c-d) \frac{x-a}{b-a}， \frac{x-a}{b-a} \text { 是无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$

statement: The sequence of sets $ \left\{\boldsymbol{A}_{n}\right\} $ does not necessarily make $\bigcap_{n=1} \boldsymbol{A}_{n}^{\circ} =\left(\bigcap_{n=1} A_{n}\right)^{\circ}$ .
chinese_statement: 集序列 $ \left\{\boldsymbol{A}_{n}\right\} $ ，不一定使$\bigcap_{n=1} \boldsymbol{A}_{n}^{\circ} =\left(\bigcap_{n=1} A_{n}\right)^{\circ}$ 。
rationale: Let $A_{n}=\left(1-\frac{1}{n}, 1+\frac{1}{n}\right), n=1,2, \cdots$ , then $\begin{array}{l}\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\circ}=\{1\} , \\\left(\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\infty}=\{1\}^{\circ}=\varnothing,\end{array}$, hence $\left(\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\circ} \neq \bigcap_{n= 1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\circ}$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $A_{n}=\left(1-\frac{1}{n}， 1+\frac{1}{n}\right)， n=1，2， \cdots$ ， 则$\begin{array}{l}\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\circ}=\{1\}， \\\left(\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\infty}=\{1\}^{\circ}=\varnothing，\end{array}$，故$\left(\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}\right)^{\circ} \neq \bigcap_{n= 1}^{\infty} A_{n}^{\circ}$。

statement: There exists a sequence of functions that is nowhere continuous, yet it converges uniformly to a function that is everywhere continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在一个无处连续的函数序列， 它一致收敛于一个处处连续的函数。
rationale: Let $f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / n， & x \text { is rational, } \\ 0， & x \text { is irrational, }\end{array}\right.$ Then $ f_{n}(n = 1，2， \cdots) $ is nowhere continuous on $ (-\infty，+\infty) $, but the sequence of functions $ \left\{f_{n}(x)\right)$ converges uniformly on $(-\infty，-\infty)$ to the continuous function $f(x) \equiv 0 $.
chinese_rationale: 设$f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / n， & x \text { 为有理数， } \\ 0， & x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$ 则 $ f_{n}(n = 1，2， \cdots) $ 在 $ (-\infty，+\infty) $ 上无处连续， 但函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}(x)\right)$在  $(-\infty，-\infty)$  上一致收敛于连续函数  $f(x) \equiv 0 $。

statement: There exists a function on $[0, +\infty)$, which is positive-valued, bounded, and integrable on any finite subinterval of $[0, +\infty)$, and the integral $\int_{0}^{+\infty}(f(x))^{\alpha} d x$ converges when $\alpha=1$, but diverges when $\alpha$ is a real number not equal to 1.
chinese_statement: $存在[0，+\infty)$  上的一个函数， 它在$[0，+\infty)$  的任何有限子区间上取正值、有界、可积， 并且积分$\int_{0}^{+\infty}(f(x))^{\alpha} d x$  当$\alpha=1$  时收敛，而当 $\alpha$  为不等于 1 的实数时发散。
rationale: Let $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence of positive numbers, $a_{n}<1 / 2(n=1, 2, \cdots)$, such that the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{\infty} $ converges, and $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{\beta}$ diverges for $\beta<1 $. For example, you can choose $a_{n}=\frac{1}{n(\ln n)^{2}} \quad(n=2, 3, \cdots)$. For $n=1, 2, 3, \cdots$, define the function $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}a_{n}, n-1 \leqslant x<n-a_{n}^{2}, \\1 / a_{n}, n-a_{n}^{2} \leqslant x<n,\end{array}\right.$ where $a_{1}$ is any positive number less than 1 / 2. Note that $\int_{n=1}^{n} f(x) d x<2 a_{n}, \int_{n=1}^{n}(f(x))^{\alpha} d x>\frac{1}{2} a_{n}^{\alpha}+a_{n}^{2+\alpha}$, showing that the function f has the desired properties.
chinese_rationale: 设$\left\{a_{n}\right\}$  是 一个正数序列， $a_{n}<1 / 2(n=1，2， \cdots) $， 使得级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{\infty} $收敛， 并使$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{\beta}$  对  $\beta<1 $ 发散。例如，可取$a_{n}=\frac{1}{n(\ln n)^{2}} \quad(\pi=2，3， \cdots) \text {。}$对  $n=1，2，3， \cdots $， 作函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}a_{n}， n-1 \leqslant x<n-a_{n}^{2}， \\1 / a_{n，}， n-a_{n}^{2} \leqslant x<n，\end{array}\right.$这里$a_{1}$是任一小于  1 / 2  的正数。 注意到$\int_{n=1}^{n} f(x) d x<2 a_{n}， \int_{n=1}^{n}(f(x))^{\alpha} d x>\frac{1}{2} a_{n}^{\alpha}+a_{n}^{2+\alpha}$，可见函数 f 具有所需的性质。

statement: For the non-negative series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, the root test states: Given the non-negative series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$, let $c=\varlimsup_{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[\pi]{a_{n}}$, then (i) if $c<1$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges; (ii) if $c>1$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ diverges; (iii) if $c=1$, the test fails. There exist series where the root test fails.
chinese_statement: 对于非负项级数 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ ， 根检法陈述为:  给定非负项级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$， 令$c=\varlimsup_{n \rightarrow \infty} \sqrt[\pi]{a_{n}}$则 (i)$ c<1$  时$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$收敛;(ii)$c>1$ 时 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$发散;(iii)$c=1$时此法失效。存在根检法失效的级数。
rationale: Consider the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n}$ and $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}$, both have $c=1$, yet the first series diverges and the second series converges. This shows that in the case $c=1$, the root test fails.
chinese_rationale: 考虑级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n} \text { 和 } \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}$，它们都有$c=1$ ， 而第一个级数发散， 第二个级数收敛， 这说明在$c=1$的情况下， 根检法失效。

statement: There exists a second category set whose complement is not a first category set.
chinese_statement: 存在一个第二纲集， 它的余集不是第一纲集。
rationale: The interval [0,1] cannot be expressed as a countable union of nowhere dense sets, thus it is a second category set. Its complement $(-\infty,+\infty) \backslash[0,1]$ also cannot be expressed as a countable union of nowhere dense sets, so it is a second category set as well. Note: The complement of a first category set must be a second category set. The above counterexample shows that the dual proposition is not true.
chinese_rationale: 区间  [0，1]  不能表成可数个疏集的并集， 因而它是一个第二纲的集。 它的余集  $(-\infty，+\infty) \backslash[0，1]$  也不能表成可数个疏集的并集， 因而它也足一个第二纲的等。注： 第一纲的集的余集必是第二纲的集．上述反例说明了对偶的命题并不成立。

statement: Given a sequence of positive numbers $\left\{c_{n}\right\}$ satisfying $\lim _{n\rightarrow\infty} c_{n}=0$, there exists a convergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ and a divergent series of positive terms $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$ such that $a_{n} / b_{n}=c_{n}$.
chinese_statement: 给定一个满足$\lim _{n\rightarrow\infty} c_{n}=0 $ 的正数序列$  \left\{c_{n}\right\}$ ， 有一个正项收敛级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  和一个正项发散级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$ ， 能使  $a_{n} / b_{n}=c_{n}$ 。
rationale: Select a subsequence $\left\{c_{n}\right\}_{n=1}$ such that for positive integer k, $c_{n_{2}}<k^{-2}$. Then set $ a_{n_{k}}=\epsilon_{n_{k}}$, $b_{n_{k}}=1$, $k=1,2, \cdots$. For every other n, set $a_{n}=n^{-2}$, $b_{n}=\left(n^{2} c_{n}\right)^{-1}$. Thus, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges. Since $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} \neq 0$, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}$ diverges, and $a_{n} / b_{n}=c_{n}$ for $n=1,2, \cdots$. Note: This example specifically proves that no matter how slowly a sequence of positive numbers $\left\{c_{n}\right\}$ converges to zero, there always exist two such series, one convergent and the other divergent, where their nth term ratio is $c_{n}$.
chinese_rationale: 选定$\left\{c_{n}\right\}$  的一个子序列 $\left.\left\{c_{n}\right\}\right\}_{n=1}$ ， 使得对于正整数  k ， 都有  $c_{n_{2}}<k^{-2}$ ， 然后设 $ a_{n_{k}}=\epsilon_{n_{k}}， b_{n_{k}}=1， k=1，2， \cdots$。 至于毎个其它值的  n ， 设 $a_{n}=n^{-2}， b_{n}=\left(n^{2} c_{n}\right)^{-1}$。 于是，  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  收敛。 由于 $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n} \neq 0 $， 所以  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n} $ 发散，而且  $a_{n} / b_{n}=c_{n}， n=1，2， \cdots$。 注: 这个例子特别证明了无论一个正数序列$\left\{c_{n}\right\}$  怎样慢地收敛于零， 总存在这样两个正项级数，一个收敛， 另一个发散， 而它们第  n  项的比值就是  $c_{n}$ 。

statement: Given any function f that is not almost everywhere bounded, an (L)-integrable function g can be constructed such that $\boldsymbol{f} \boldsymbol{g}$ is not (L) integrable.
chinese_statement: 任给非几乎处处有界函数f，可构造一个(L)可积函数g，使 $\boldsymbol{f} \boldsymbol{g}$  不  (L)  可积。
rationale: Assume f is on a measurable set $E(mE>0)$, then there exists a real number sequence $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$, satisfying $0<a_{1}<a_{2}<\cdots<a_{n}<\cdots, n \leqslant a_{n}$, and $m E_{n}=\eta_{n} \neq 0$, where $E_{n}=E\left[x: a_{n} \leqslant f(x)<\|_{n+1}\right]$. Define a function g on E: $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}}, x \in E_{n}, n=1,2, \cdots, \\0, \quad x \in E \backslash \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}.\end{array}\right.$ Thus, on one hand, $\begin{aligned}\int_{E} g(x) d x & =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{E_{n}} g(x) d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{\eta_{n}}{na_{n} \eta_{n}} \\& =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n a_{n}} \leqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<+\infty,\end{aligned}$ on the other hand, $\begin{aligned}& \int_{E} f(x) g(x) d x \geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{N} \int_{E_{n}} f(x) g(x) d x \\\geqslant & \sum_{n=1}^{N} \int_{E_{n}} \frac{a_{n}}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{a_{n} \eta_{n}}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}}=\sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{1}{n}.\end{aligned}$ It can be seen that g is (L) integrable on E, but $f g $ is not (L) integrable on E.
chinese_rationale: 不妨设f在可测集$E(mE>0)$，于是存在实数序列  $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ ， 适合$0<a_{1}<a_{2}<\cdots<a_{n}<\cdots， n \leqslant a_{n}$，且$m E_{n}=\eta_{n} \neq 0$，其中$E_{n}=E\left[x: a_{n} \leqslant f(x)<\|_{n+1}\right]$ 。在 E  上定义函数  g  :$g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{c}\frac{1}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}}， x \in E_{n}， n=1，2， \cdots， \\0， \quad x \in E \backslash \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n} .\end{array}\right.$于是，一方面$\begin{aligned}\int_{E} g(x) d x & =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{E_{n}} g(x) d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{\eta_{n}}{na_{n} \eta_{n}} \\& =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n a_{n}} \leqslant \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^{2}}<+\infty，\end{aligned}$另一方面$\begin{aligned}& \int_{E} f(x) g(x) d x \geqslant \sum_{n=1}^{N} \int_{E_{n}} f(x) g(x) d x \\\geqslant & \sum_{n=1}^{N} \int_{E_{n}} \frac{a_{n}}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{a_{n} \eta_{n}}{n a_{n} \eta_{n}}=\sum_{n=1}^{N} \frac{1}{n} 。\end{aligned}$可见  g  在  Е 上 (L)  可积而  $f g $ 在  E  上并不  (L)  可积。

statement: There exists a first category set in [0, 1] with measure equal to 1.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  中测度等于 1 的第一纲集。
rationale: For example: Let $A_{n}$ be a Cantor set in [0, 1] with measure equal to $(n-1) / n$, $n=1, 2, \cdots$, and let $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n}$. Since $A_{n}$ is a meager set for $n=1, 2, \cdots$, A is a first category set, and on the other hand, since $m A_{n}=(n-1) / n \leqslant m A \leqslant 1 \quad (n=1, 2, \cdots),$ therefore $m A=1$.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 设$A_{n}$  为  [0，1]  中测度等于  $(n-1) / n$  的任一Cantor 集， $ n=1 ，  2， \cdots $， 再设  $A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} A_{n} $。 因为  $A_{n} $ 是疏集， $ n=1，2， \cdots $， 所以  A  是第一纲集，另一方面，因为$m A_{n}=(n-1) / n \leqslant m A \leqslant 1 \quad(n=1，2， \cdots)，$所以 $m A=1$。

statement: If the functions $y=f(u)$, $u=g(x)$ satisfy $\lim _{u \rightarrow A} f(u)=B$, $\lim _{x \rightarrow a} g(x)=A$, then $\lim _{x \rightarrow a} f[g(x)]$ exists.
chinese_statement: 函数  $y=f(u)， u=g(x)$  适合  $\lim _{u \rightarrow A} f(u)=B， \lim _{x \rightarrow a} g( \infty)=A$ ，则  $\lim _{x \rightarrow a} f[g( \infty)]$  存在。
rationale: Let $f(u)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, u \neq 0, \\ 0, u=0,\end{array}\right.$, $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}1 / q, & x=p / q, p, q \text { are coprime integers, and } q>0, \\0, & x \text { is irrational. }\end{array}\right.$ Clearly, $\lim _{u \rightarrow 0} f(u)=1, \lim _{x \rightarrow 0} g(x)=0$. However, if x is taken as an irrational number, then $g(x) =0$, hence $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]=0$. If x is taken as a rational number, $x=p / q$, then $g(x)=1 / q$, hence $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]=1$. Therefore, $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]$ does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(u)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， u \neq 0， \\ 0， u=0，\end{array}\right. g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}1 / q， & x=p / q， p， q \text { 是互质的整数， 且 } q>0， \\0， & x \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$显然，  $\lim _{u \rightarrow 0} f(u)=1， \lim _{x \rightarrow 0} g(x)=0$ 。 但是， 若取  x  为无理数， 则  $g(x)   =0$ ， 从而$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]=0$ 。若取  x  为有理数，  $x=p / q$ ， 则  $g(x)=1 / q$ ， 从而$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]=1$ 。可见，  $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f[g(x)]$  不存在。

statement: There exists an open set G such that $(\bar{G})^{\circ} \neq \boldsymbol{G}$.
chinese_statement: 存在使  $(\bar{G})^{\circ} \neq \boldsymbol{G}$  的开集  G 。
rationale: Let C be the Cantor ternary set (see Example 31 in this chapter), then $G=[0,1] \backslash C$ is an open set. Since G is dense in $[0,1]$, $G=[0,1],(\bar{G})^{\circ}=(0,1)$. Therefore, $(\bar{G})^{\circ} \neq G$.
chinese_rationale: 设  C  为 Cantor 三分集 (参看本章的例 31)， 则  $G=[0，1] \backslash C$  为一开集。 出于  G  在  $[0，1]$  中㨄密， 所以  $G=[0，1]，(\bar{G})^{\circ}=(0，1)$ 。 因此， $(\bar{G})^{\circ} \neq G$ 。

statement: There exists a function f with bounded variation on [0, 1] such that $\bigvee_{0}^{1}(f) \neq \int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} K(y) dy$, where $K(y)$ represents the number of x for which $f(x)=y$.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  上的一个有界变差函数  f ， 使$ \bigvee_{0}^{1}(f) \neq \int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} K(y) d y$ ，其中 $ K(y) $ 代表适合  $f(x)=y$  的  x  的个数。
rationale:
Define the function f on [0, 1] as: $f(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}0, & x 
eq 1 / 2, \1, & x=1 / 2,\end{array}ight.$ Then $V_{0}^{\prime}(f)=2$. On the other hand, we have $K(y)=\left\{ egin{array}{l}1, y=1 \+\infty, y=0 \0, y 
eq 0, y 
eq 1\end{array}ight.$ Therefore, $\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} K(y) dy=0$.
chinese_rationale:
在  [0，1]  上定义函数  f  :$f(x)=\left\{ egin{array}{ll}0， & x 
eq 1 / 2， \1， & x=1 / 2，\end{array}ight.$则  $V_{0}^{\prime}(f)=2 $。另一方面，我们有$K(y)=\left\{ egin{array}{l}1， y=1 \+\infty， y=0 \0， y 
eq 0， y

statement: There exists a sequence of functions that converges uniformly on each $ E_{k}(k=1, 2, \cdots) $, but does not converge uniformly on $\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k} $.
chinese_statement: 存在在各个$ E_{k}(k=1，2， \cdots) $ 上一致收敛， 而在  $\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k} $ 上不一致收 敛的函数序列。
rationale: Let $f_{n}(x)=x^{n}(n=1, 2, \cdots) $, then the sequence of functions $ \left\{f_{n}(x)\right\} $ converges uniformly to zero on each interval $E_{k}=\left[\frac{k-1}{k}, \frac{k}{k+1}](k=1, 2, \cdots)\right.$. However, $\left\{f_{n}\right. (x)\}$ does not converge uniformly on $[0,1)=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k} $. Note: It is easy to prove that if $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$ converges uniformly on each $ E_{k}(k=1, 2, \cdots, n)$, then $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$ converges uniformly on $\bigcup_{k=1}^{n} E_{k}$. This counterexample illustrates that this proposition cannot be extended to the union of infinitely many sets.
chinese_rationale: 设$f_{n}(x)=x^{n}(n=1，2， \cdots) $， 则函数序列 $ \left\{f_{n}(x)\right\} $ 在毎 个 区间 $E_{k}=\left[\frac{k-1}{k}， \frac{k}{k+1}](k=1，2， \cdots)\right.$上都一致收敛于零。然而，  $\left\{f_{n}\right.   (x)\}$在$[0，1)=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k} $ 上并不一致收敛。注： 容易证明， 如果  $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$  在各个 $ E_{k}(k=1，2， \cdots， n)$  上一致收敛， 那么  $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$  在  $\bigcup_{k=1}^{n} E_{k}$  上也一致收敛。 上述反例说明了不能把这个命题推广到无穷多个集合的并集上去。

statement: There exists a function on the Cantor set that is nowhere continuous but continuous on its neighboring intervals.
chinese_statement: 存在在 Cantor 集上无处连续而在它的邻接区间上连续的函数。
rationale: Let C be the Cantor ternary set within [0,1], and $\left(a_{n}, b_{n}\right)(n=1,2, \cdots)$ be its neighboring intervals. Define f on [0,1] as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \in C, \\1, x=\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2, \\\text { linear, } x \in\left[a_{n},\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2\right] \text { or }\left[\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2, b_{n}\right] .\end{array}\right.$ As can be seen, f is nowhere continuous on C but is continuous on $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(a_{n}, b_{n}\right)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  C  为  [0，1]  中的 Cantor 三分集，  $\left(a_{n}， b_{n}\right)(n=1，2， \cdots)$  是它的邻接区间，在  [0，1]  上如下定义  f  :$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \in C， \\1， x=\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2， \\\text { 线性， } x \in\left[a_{n}，\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2\right] \text { 或 }\left[\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) / 2， b_{n}\right] 。\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  在  C  上无处连续而在  $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(a_{n}， b_{n}\right)$  上连续。

statement: There exists a function f with continuous and bounded partial derivatives in the neighborhood of a point, but f is not differentiable at that point.
chinese_statement: 存在函数f，它在某点的领域内连续且有界的偏导数，但f在该点仍不能微分。
rationale: Let $\quad f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x y / \sqrt{x^{2}} y^{2}, & x^{2}+y^{2}=0, \\ 0, & x^{2}+y^{2}=0,\end{array}\right.$ Then f is clearly continuous at $x^{2}+y^{2}=0$. Since $|f(x, y)| \leqslant|x y| / \sqrt{2|x y|} \mid=\sqrt{|x y|} / 2,$ f is also continuous at (0,0). Moreover, when $x^{2}+y^{2}>0$, $f_{x}(x, y)=y^{3} /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}, f_{y}(x, y)=x^{3} /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}$, and at (0,0), $f_{x}(0,0)=0, f_{y}(0,0)=0$, so $\left|f_{x}(x, y)\right| \leqslant\left|y^{3}\right| /\left|y^{3}\right|=1,\left|f_{y}(x, y)\right| \leqslant 1$. This means both partial derivatives of f are bounded. It is now proven that f is not differentiable at the point (0,0). In fact, if it were otherwise, then we would have $f(x, y)-f(0,0)=x y / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}=\varepsilon \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}$, and as $(x, y) \rightarrow(0,0)$, $\varepsilon$ in the expression should tend to 0. Specifically, take $x=y>0$ in the expression, then $x / \sqrt{2}=\sqrt{2} \varepsilon x$. Thus, $\varepsilon=1 / 2$, and as $x \rightarrow 0$, $\varepsilon$ does not tend to 0, which violates the assumption of differentiability of f at (0,0).
chinese_rationale: 设  $\quad f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x y / \sqrt{x^{2}} y^{2}， & x^{2}+y^{2}=0， \\ 0， & x^{2}+y^{2}=0，\end{array}\right.$ 则  f  在  $x^{2}+y^{2}=0 $ 处显然是连续的。 因为$|f(x， y)| \leqslant|x y| / \sqrt{2|x y|} \mid=\sqrt{|x y|} / 2，$所以  f  在  (0，0)  点也是连续的。 又当  $x^{2}+y^{2}>0$  时$f_{x}(x， y)=y^{3} /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}， f_{y}(x， y)=x^{3} /\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)^{3 / 2}$，而在 (0，0)  处，  $f_{x}(0，0)=0， f_{y}(0，0)=0$ ， 所以$\left|f_{x}(x， y)\right| \leqslant\left|y^{3}\right| /\left|y^{3}\right|=1，\left|f_{y}(x， y)\right| \leqslant 1$。即  f  的两个偏导数都是有界的。现证  f  在点  (0，0)  处不可微。 事实上， 如若不然， 那么就应该有$f(x， y)-f(0，0)=x y / \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}=\varepsilon \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}}$，当  $(x， y) \rightarrow(0，0)$  时，式中的  $\varepsilon$ 应趋于 0 。 今特别于上式中取 $ x=y>0 $， 则得$x / \sqrt{2}=\sqrt{2} \varepsilon x $。由此，  $\varepsilon=1 / 2$ ， 而当  $x \rightarrow 0 $ 时  $\varepsilon$  却并不趋前于 0 ， 这就违反了函数  f 在  (0，0)  点可微性的假设。

statement: There exists a function with unbounded variation whose absolute value is a function of bounded variation.
chinese_statement: 存在一个非有界变差函数， 其绝对值是有界变差函数。
rationale: Define the function $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}1, & x \text{ is rational}, \\-1, & x \text{ is irrational},\end{array}\right.$ on [0,1]. Since f is nowhere continuous on [0,1], f is not a function of bounded variation. However, $|f(x)| \equiv 1$ is a function of bounded variation on [0,1].
chinese_rationale: 在  [0，1]  上定义函数$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{lr}1， & x为有理数， \\-1， & x为无理数，\end{array}\right.$由于  f  在  [0，1]  上无处连续， 因而  f  不是有界变差函数。 然而，  $|f(x)| \equiv 1$  是  [0，1]  上的有界变差函数。

statement: There exists a divergent series $\sum_{n=1} a_{n} $, such that the infinite product $ \prod_{n=1}\left(1+a_{n}\right) $ converges.
chinese_statement: 存在一个发散级数$\sum_{n=1} a_{n} $， 使无穷乘积 $ \prod_{n=1}\left(1+a_{n}\right) $ 收敛。
rationale: Consider the series $\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right)+\cdots$, it is evident that $s_{2 n}=\frac{1}{2}+-1+\cdots+\frac{1}{n+1}$, hence $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{2 n}=+\infty $. Also, $ \quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{2 n+1}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(s_{2 n}+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+2}}+\frac{1}{n+2}\right)=+\infty $, therefore, this series diverges to $+\infty$. For the infinite product $\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots,$ we have $\begin{array}{l}P_{2 n}=\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots \\\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+1}}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{n}+1}\right) \\=\left(1-\frac{1}{2 \sim^{\prime}}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{3 \sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots\left(1-\frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}}\right) 。 \\\end{array}$ Due to the convergence of the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}} $, the infinite product $\prod_{n=1}^{m}\left(1-\frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}}\right)$ converges, therefore $ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{\text {2n }}$ exists. Moreover, since $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n+1}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n}\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+2}}+\frac{1}{n+2}\right)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n}$, the infinite product $\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots$ converges.
chinese_rationale: 考虑级数$\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)+\left(-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right)+\cdots$，易见$s_{2 n}=\frac{1}{2}+-1+\cdots+\frac{1}{n+1}$，因而$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{2 n}=+\infty $\text {。 }又 $ \quad \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} s_{2 n+1}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(s_{2 n}+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+2}}+\frac{1}{n+2}\right)=+\infty $，因此， 这个级数发散到$+\infty$  。对于无穷乘积$\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots，$我们有$\begin{array}{l}P_{2 n}=\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots \\\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+1}}+\frac{1}{n+1}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{n}+1}\right) \\=\left(1-\frac{1}{2 \sim^{\prime}}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{3 \sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots\left(1-\frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}}\right) 。 \\\end{array}$由于级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}} $收敛， 故无穷乘积$\prod_{n=1}^{m}\left(1-\frac{1}{(n+1) \sqrt{n+1}}\right)$收敛， 因而$ \lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{\text {2n }}$ 存在 又因为$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n+1}=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n}\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+2}}+\frac{1}{n+2}\right)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} P_{2 n}$，所以无穷乘积$\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}+\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3}\right)\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}\right) \cdots$收敛。

statement: There exists a convergent series with a divergent rearrangement
chinese_statement: 存在具有发散重排的收敛级数
rationale: The terms of any conditionally convergent series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ can be rearranged to give a divergent series or to have the sum equal to any predetermined number. In fact, let the non-negative part and negative part of $\sum_{n-1}^{n} a_{n}$ be denoted as $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n}$ and $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n}$ respectively. Since $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right|$ diverges, both $\sum_{n-1}^{\infty} p_{n}$ and $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n}$ also diverge. Let c be an arbitrary finite real number. We can rearrange as follows: first, place terms $p_{1} + p_{2} + \cdots + p_{m_{1}}$ until their sum just exceeds c, then place terms $q_{1} + q_{2} + \cdots + q_{n_{1}}$ until the partial sum just falls below c. Then continue with terms $p_{m_{1}+1} + p_{m_{1}+2} + \cdots + p_{m_{2}}$ until the partial sum just exceeds c again, and then $q_{n_{1}+1} + q_{n_{1}+2} + \cdots + q_{n_{2}}$ until it just falls below c, and so on. Each of these steps is feasible because $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n}$ and $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n}$ diverge. Since as $n \rightarrow \infty$, $p_{n} \rightarrow 0$ and $q_{n} \rightarrow 0$ (because as $n \rightarrow \infty$, $a_{n} \rightarrow 0$), the absolute value of the difference between the partial sum of the rearranged series and c is always less than some term of the series $\left\{p_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ or less than some term of the series $\left\{\left|q_{n}\right|\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$. Therefore, the rearranged series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ converges to c. To see the existence of a rearrangement of $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ that makes its partial sum diverge to $+\infty$, we consider the following rearrangement of $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$: alternately placing a group of positive terms and one negative term. Since the series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n}$ diverges, its partial sums are unbounded. Thus, we can take sufficiently large $m_{1}$ so that $p_{1} < p_{2} + \cdots + p_{m_{1}} > 1 - q_{1}$. Then take $m_{2} > m_{1}$ so that $p_{1} + p_{2} + \cdots + p_{m_{1}} > 2 - q_{1} - q_{2}$. Generally, we can take sufficiently large $m_{k} > m_{k-1}$ so that: $\begin{array}{c}p_{1} + p_{2} + \cdots + p_{m_{k}} > k - q_{1} - q_{2} - \cdots - q_{k}, \  (k = 3, 4, \cdots)\end{array}$. Therefore, the series that alternately places a group of positive terms and one negative term, $p_{1} + \cdots + p_{\mathrm{m}_{1}} + q_{1} + \boldsymbol{p}_{\mathrm{m}_{1}+1} + \cdots + p_{\mathrm{m}_{2}} + q_{2} + p_{\mathrm{m}_{2}+1} + \cdots$, is evidently divergent, as its k-th partial sum, $p_{1} + \cdots + p_{m_{1}} + q_{1} + \cdots + \boldsymbol{p}_{m_{k}} + \boldsymbol{q}_{k}$, exceeds k. Similarly, we can obtain a rearrangement of $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ that diverges to $-\infty$.
chinese_rationale: 任何条件收敛级数$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} $的项都可以重排而给出发散级数或重排后其和为事先指定的任意数，事实上，设$\sum_{n-1}^{n} a_{n} $的非负部分与负部分分别为 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n}$  与  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n}$ ， 因为 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{n}\right|$  发散， 故$ \sum_{n-1}^{\infty} p_{n}$ 与$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n} $也都发散，设  c  是任意 (有限)实数。 我们如下地确定重排: 先放置项$p_{1}+p_{2}+\cdots p_{m_{1}}$直至此和刚超过  c ， 然后接项$q_{1}+q_{2}+\cdots+q_{n_{1}}$直至整个部分和刚小于  c  。然后再接上项$p_{m_{1}+1}+p_{m_{1}+2}+\cdots+p_{m_{2}}$直至整个部分和刚超过  c ， 然后是$q_{n_{1}+1}+q_{n_{1}+2}+\cdots+q_{n_{2}}$直至整个部分和刚小于  c ， 如此继续。上述各步都是能行的， 因为$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n}$  与 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} q_{n} $ 是发散的。 由于$ n \rightarrow \infty $ 时 $ p_{n} \rightarrow 0， q_{n} \rightarrow 0$  (因为 $ n \rightarrow   \infty $ 时$a_{n} \rightarrow 0 $ )，而重排应级数的部分和与  c  的差间绝对值始终小于数列$\left\{p_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty} $ 的某一项， 或者小于数列  $\left\{\left|q_{n}\right|\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty} $ 的某一项， 故这样得到的 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  的重排级数收敛于c。为了看到存在$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$的重排使其部分和发散于$ +\infty $， 我们考虑 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  的这样的重排：交错地放置一组正项和一个负项。由于级数 $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} p_{n} $ 发散， 它的部分和无界， 故可取充分大的 $ m_{1}$  使$p_{1}<p_{2}+\cdots+p_{m_{1}}>1-q_{1}，$然后取$ m_{2}>m_{1} $， 使$p_{1}+p_{2}+ \cdots+p_{{m}_{1}}>2-q_{1}-q_{2}$，一般地， 可取充分大的$m_{k}>m_{k-1}$ ， 使$\begin{array}{c}p_{1}+p_{2}+\cdots+ p_{m_{k}}>k-q_{1}-q_{2}-\cdots-q_{k}， \\(k=3，4， \cdots)\end{array}$因此， 交错地放置一组正项和一个负项的级数$p_{1}+\cdots+p_{\mathrm{m}_{1}}+q_{1}+\boldsymbol{p}_{\mathrm{m}_{1}+1}+\cdots+p_{\mathrm{m}_{2}+}+q_{2}+ p_{\mathrm{m}_{2}+1}+\cdots$显然是发散的，它的第  k  个部分和$p_{1}+\cdots+p_{m_{1}}+q_{1}+\cdots+\boldsymbol{p}_{m_{k}}+\boldsymbol{q}_{k}$超过  k 。类似地可得到 $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$  的发散于$  -\infty $ 的重排。

statement: There exists a non-negative function f such that $f \in L^{2}[1, +\infty)$, but $ \int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{f(x)}{\sqrt{x}} d x=+\infty $.
chinese_statement: 存在一个非负函数  f ， 使 $f \in L^{2}[1，+\infty) $，但$ \int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{f(x)}{\sqrt{x}} d x=+\infty $。
rationale: Let $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence that satisfies the equation $\frac{1}{n \ln n}=a_{n} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} d x$. Define $f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \varphi_{[n, n+1]}(x)$, where $\varphi_{[n, n+1]}$ denotes the characteristic function of the interval $[n, n+1]$. Then $\begin{array}{l}\int_{1}^{+\infty} f^{2}(x) d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} f^{2}(x) \mathrm{d} x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} a_{n}^{2}d x \\=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}=\frac{1}{4} \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(\frac{\sqrt{n+1}+\sqrt{n}}{\sqrt{n}}\right)^{2} \frac{1}{n \ln ^{2} n} .\end{array}$ Since the series on the right-hand side converges, $f \in L^{2}[1, +\infty)$. On the other hand, $\begin{aligned}\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{f(x)}{\sqrt{x}} d x & =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{[1, i+1]}(x) d x \\& =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}}=a_{n} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n} .\end{aligned}$ Since the series on the right-hand side diverges, $f(x) / \sqrt{x} \in L^{2}[1, +\infty)$.
chinese_rationale: 设$ \left\{a_{n}\right\}$  是适合等式$\frac{1}{n \ln n}=a_{n} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} d x$的数列， 令$f(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n} \varphi_{[n ，n+1]}(x)$，其中$\varphi_{[n， n+1]}$代表区间$[n， n+1]$的特征函数， 则$\begin{array}{l}\int_{1}^{+\infty} f^{2}(x) d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} f^{2}(x) \mathrm{d} x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} a_{n}^{2}d x \\=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}^{2}=\frac{1}{4} \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(\frac{\sqrt{n+1}+\sqrt{n}}{\sqrt{n}}\right)^{2} \frac{1}{n \ln ^{2} n} 。\end{array}$因为上式右端的级数收敛， 所以 $f \in L^{2}[1，+\infty)$。另一方面$\begin{aligned}\int_{1}^{+\infty} \frac{f(x)}{\sqrt{x}} d x & =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} \alpha_{i} \varphi_{[1， i+1]}(x) d x \\& =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \int_{n}^{n+1} \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}}=a_{n} d x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}-\frac{1}{n \ln n} 。\end{aligned}$因为上式右端的级数发散， 所以  $f(x) / \sqrt{x} \in L^{2}[1，+\infty)$。

statement: There exists a family of measurable sets whose intersection is non-measurable.
chinese_statement: 存在一族可测集，其交集不可测。
rationale: Let A be a non-measurable set, then its complement $A^{c}$ is also a non-measurable set, and the single-point set $\{\boldsymbol{a})(a \in A)$ is a measurable set, so its complement $\{a\}^{c}$ is also measurable. However, the intersection $\bigcap_{a \in \Delta}\{a\}^{c}=\left(\bigcup_{a \in \Delta}\{a\}\right)^{c}=A^{c}$ is non-measurable.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  为一不可测集， 则其余集$A^{c}$也是不可测集， 而单点集$ \{\boldsymbol{a})(a \in A) $是可测集， 从而它的余集$\{a\}^{c}$也是可测集。 但是， 交集$\bigcap_{a \in \Delta}\{a\}^{c}=\left(\bigcup_{a \in \Delta}\{a\}\right)^{c}=A^{c}$并不可测。

statement: There exist a bounded plane region with boundaries of positive measure.
chinese_statement: 存在边界的测度为正数的有界平面区域。
rationale: Let A be a Cantor set with positive measure within [0,1], and let $R=((0,1) \times(-1,1)) \backslash(A \times[0,1))$. Then R is a region, and the boundary of R is $\begin{aligned}F(R)= & (\{0\} \times[-1,1]) \cup(\{1\} \times[-1,1]) \cup(A \times[0,1)) \\& \cup((0,1) \times\{1\}) \cup((0,1) \times\{-1\}),\end{aligned}$ therefore $m \boldsymbol{F}(R)=m(A \times[0,1))=m A>0$. Clearly, R is not a Jordan region $\left((\bar{R})^{0} \neq R\right) $.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  为  [0，1]  内的一个具有正测度的 Cantor 集， 又设$R=((0，1) \times(-1，1)) \backslash(A \times[0，1))$。那么  R  是一个区域，并且  R  的边界是$\begin{aligned}F(R)= & (\{0\} \times[-1，1]) \cup(\{1\} \times[-1，1]) \cup(A \times[0，1)) \\& \cup((0，1) \times\{1\}) \cup((0，1\} \times\{-1\})，\end{aligned}$因此  $m \boldsymbol{F}(R)=m(A \times[0，1))=m A>0$ 。显然，  R  不是 Jordan区域  $\left((\bar{R})^{0} \neq R\right) $。

statement: The product of functions must be continuous.
chinese_statement: 函数的乘积函数一定连续性。
rationale: Example (a): $f(x)=x$ is continuous at $x=0$, $g(x)=\sin (1 / x), x \neq 0; g(0) = 0$, $g$ is not continuous at $x=0$. Since $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} x \sin (1 / x)=0=f(0) g(0)$, $fg$ is continuous at $x=0$. Example (b): $f(x)=x$ is continuous at $x=0$, $g(x)=1 / x, x \neq 0; g(0)=0$, $g$ is not continuous at $x=0$. Their product $fg$ is discontinuous at $x=0$. Example (c): Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x, x \leqslant 0, \\1, x>0,\end{array} \quad g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}-1, x<0, \\x, x \geqslant 0,\end{array}\right.\right.$ then both $f$ and $g$ are discontinuous at $x=0$, however, $\begin{array}{l}\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} f(x) g(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} x(-1)=0, \\\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} f(x) g(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} 1 \cdot x=0,\end{array}$ so $\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f(x) g(x)=0=f(0) g(0)$, that is, $fg$ is continuous at $x=0$. Example (d): $f(x)=g(x)=1 / x, x=0; f(0)=g(0)=0$, then both $f$ and $g$ are discontinuous at $x=0$, and their product $fg$ is also discontinuous at $x=0$. In conclusion, we can list the following table $\begin{array}{l}\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f \text{ at } x=x_{0} & {g} \text{ at } x=x_{0} & f g \text{ at } x=x_{0} & \text{ Example } \\\hline 1. & \text{ Continuous} & \text{ Continuous } & \text{ Continuous } & \text{ Theorem } \\\hline 2 & \text{ Continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Continuous } & (a) \\\hline 3 & \text{ Continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ (b) } \\\hline 4 & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Continuous } & (c) \\\hline 5 & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & \text{ Not continuous } & (d) \\\hline\end{array}\end{array}$
chinese_rationale: 例(a)：  $f(x)=x$  在  $x=0$  连续，  $g(x)=\sin (1 / x)， x \neq 0 ; g(0) = 0 $，  g  在  $x=0 $ 处不连续。 由于$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} x \sin (1 / x)=0=f(0) g(0)$，故  $f g$  在  $x=0$  连续。例(b)：  $f(x)=x$  在  $x=0$ 连续，  $g(x)=1 / x， x \neq 0 ; g(0)=0$， g  在  $x=0$  不连续。 其积  $f g$  在  x=0  不连续。例(c)： 设$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x， x \leqslant 0， \\1， x>0，\end{array} \quad g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}-1， x<0， \\x， x \geqslant 0，\end{array}\right.\right.$则  $f ，g$  在  $x=0$  处皆不连续，然而$\begin{array}{l}\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} f(x) g(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0-} x(-1)=0， \\\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} f(x) g(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow 0+} 1 \cdot x=0，\end{array}$所以$\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} f(x) g(x)=0=f(0) g(0)$，即 $ f g$  在  $x=0$  处连续。例(d)：  $f(x)=g(x)=1 / x， x=0 ; f(0)=g(0)=0 $， 则  f  与  g 在 $x=0 $ 处皆不连续， 其积$fg$在 $ x=0  $处亦不连续。总之， 可列出下表$\begin{array}{l}\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|}\hline & f \text { 在 } x=x_{0} & {g} \text { 在 } x=x_{0} & f g \text { 在 } x=x_{0} & \text { 例 } \\\hline 1 . & \text { 连续} & \text { 连续 } & \text { 连续 } & \text { 定理 } \\\hline 2 & \text { 连续 } & \text { 不选续 } & \text { 连续 } & (a) \\\hline 3 & \text { 连续 } & \text { 不连续 } & \text { 不连续 } & \text { (b) } \\\hline 4 & \text { 不连续 } & \text { 不连续 } & \text { 连续 } & (c) \\\hline 5 & \text { 不连续 } & \text { 不连续 } & \text { 不连续 } & (d) \\\hline\end{array}\end{array}$

statement: The minimum function of two semicontinuous functions is necessarily semicontinuous.
chinese_statement: 两个半连续函数， 其最小值函数一定半连续。
rationale: Define the functions on the interval $[0, +\infty)$ as follows: $\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin (1 / x), & x>0, \\1, & x=0,\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2, x>0, \\0, x=0,\end{array}\right. \\\end{array}$ Then $\min \left\{f(x), g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin (1 / x), & x>0, \\ 0, & x=0\end{array}\right.\right.$ It is evident that the function f is upper semicontinuous at $x=0$, and g is lower semicontinuous at $x=0$, but $\prod_{x \rightarrow 0} \lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \min \{f(x), g(x)\}=1>0>\frac{\lim}{x \rightarrow 0} \min \{f(x), g(x)\}=-1$, which indicates that the function $\min \{f, g\}$ is neither upper semicontinuous nor lower semicontinuous at $x=0$.
chinese_rationale: 在区间  $[0，+\infty)$  上如下定义函数:$\begin{array}{l}f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin (1 / x)， & x>0， \\1， & x=0，\end{array}\right. \\g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}2， x>0， \\0， x=0，\end{array}\right. \\\end{array}$则  $\min \left\{f(x)， g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\sin (1 / x)， & x>0， \\ 0， & x=0\end{array}\right.\right.$易见， 函数  f  在  $x=0$  上半连续，  g  在  $x=0$  下半连续， 但$\prod_{x \rightarrow 0} \lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \min \{f(x)， g(x)\}=1>0>\frac{\lim}{x \rightarrow 0} \min \{f(x)， g(x)\}=-1$，这表示函数$\min \{f， g\}$在$x=0$既不上半连续也不下半连续。

statement: There exists a function series that converges uniformly but is nowhere absolutely convergent.
chinese_statement: 存在一个一致收敛的函数项级数， 却无处绝对收敛。
rationale: Let $\quad a_{k}(x)=\frac{(-1)^{k-1}}{x^{2}+k}, -\infty<x<+\infty, k=1, 2, \cdots$ Since $ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} a_{k}(x)$ is an alternating series, and for each $x \in(-\infty, +\infty)$, we have $\left|a_{k}(x)\right|>\left|a_{k+1}(x)\right|, \lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} a_{k}(x)=0,$ therefore the series converges over $(-\infty, +\infty)$, let its sum be s(x): $s(x)=\frac{1}{x^{2}+1}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+2}+\frac{1}{x^{2}+3}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+4}+\cdots $. Let $b_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{x^{2}+(2 n-1)}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+2 n}$, then $ s(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}(x) $. Since $b_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{\left[x^{2}+(2 n-1)\right]\left[x^{2}+2 n\right]} \leqslant \frac{1}{(2 n-1) 2n},$ and the series $ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 /(2 n-1) 2 n  $ converges, thus according to the Weierstrass convergence test for uniform convergence, $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}(x)$ converges uniformly over $ (-\infty, +\infty)$. Now to prove that the series $ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{k}(x)\right|=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} 1 /\left(x^{2}+k\right)$ is nowhere convergent within $(-\infty, +\infty)$, pick any $x_{0} \in(-\infty, +\infty)$, and select a positive integer N such that $ N \geqslant x_{0}^{2} $. Then, for $k \geqslant N $, we have $\frac{1}{x_{0}^{2}-1} \geqslant \frac{1}{N+k} \geqslant \frac{1}{2 \vec{k}}$. Since the series $\sum_{k \geqslant N} \frac{1}{2 k} $ is divergent, the series $ \sum_{k \geqslant N} \frac{1}{x_{0}^{2}+k}$ is also divergent. Therefore, the series $ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}+k} $ diverges everywhere over $(-\infty, +\infty) $.
chinese_rationale: 令$\quad a_{k}(x)=\frac{(-1)^{k-1}}{x^{2}+k}，-\infty<x<+\infty， k=1，2， \cdots$ 由于$ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} a_{k}(x)$是交错级数， 而且对每一$x \in(-\infty，+\infty)$ ， 都有$\left|a_{k}(x)\right|>\left|a_{k+1}(x)\right|， \lim _{k \rightarrow \infty} a_{k}(x)=0，$因而该级数在$(-\infty，+\infty)$上收敛， 设其和为 s(x)：$s(x)=\frac{1}{x^{2}+1}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+2}+\frac{1}{x^{2}+3}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+4}+\cdots $。令$b_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{x^{2}+(2 n-1)}-\frac{1}{x^{2}+2 n}$，则有 $ s(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}(x) $。 由于$b_{n}(x)=\frac{1}{\left[x^{2}+(2 n-1)\right]\left[x^{2}+2 n\right]} \leqslant \frac{1}{(2 n-1) 2n}，$而级数$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 1 /(2 n-1) 2 n  $收敛， 因此， 根据级数一致收敛的 Weierstrass 判别法，$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_{n}(x)$在 $ (-\infty，+\infty)$  上一致收敛。兹证级数$ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}\left|a_{k}(x)\right|=\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} 1 /\left(x^{2}+k\right)$在  $(-\infty，+\infty)$  内处处不收敛，为此，任取  $x_{0} \in(-\infty，+\infty)$ ， 并取正整数  N  使 $ N \geqslant x_{0}^{2} $。 于是， 当$k \geqslant N $ 时， 就有$\frac{1}{x_{0}^{2}-1} \geqslant \frac{1}{N+k} \geqslant \frac{1}{2 \vec{k}} $\text {。 }因为级数$\sum_{k \geqslant N} \frac{1}{2 k} $是发散的， 所以级数$ \sum_{k \geqslant N} \frac{1}{x_{0}^{2}+k}$也是发散的。因此，级数 $ \sum_{k=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{x^{2}+k} $ 在  $(-\infty，+\infty) $ 上处处发散。

statement: Given any sequence of positive numbers $\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}$ that tends to zero, a continuous function f can be constructed such that the Fourier coefficients of f satisfy the following relation: $ \left|a_{n}\right| \geqslant \varepsilon_{n}$ or $\left|b_{n}\right| \geqslant \varepsilon_{n}$ for infinitely many n.
chinese_statement: 任给趋于零的正数序列$\left\{\varepsilon_{n}\right\}$ ， 可构造连续函数  f ， 使  f  的 Fourier 系数有以下关系: $ \left|a_{n}\right| \geqslant \varepsilon_{n}$  或  $\left|b_{n}\right| \geqslant \varepsilon_{n} $ 对无穷多个n 成立。
rationale:
Example 1: Since $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$, a sequence of positive integers $\left\{n_{k}\right\}: n_{1}< n_{2}<\cdots$ can be chosen such that $\varepsilon_{\boldsymbol{n}_{1}}+\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{n_{2}}+\cdots<+\infty$. Hence, the trigonometric series $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n_{k}} \cos n_{k} x$ converges uniformly on $[-\pi, \pi]$ to some continuous function $f(x)$, and $a_{n_{k}}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(x) \cos n_{k} x d x=\varepsilon_{n_{k}}$. 
Example 2: Let $n_{1}=2$, $n_{k+1}$ be a multiple of $n_{k}$ and larger than $\left(2 n_{k}\right)^{5}$, and assume $\begin{array}{l}\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k}}}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k}}} \sin { }^{4} n_{k+1} x d x>\frac{1}{5 n_{k}}, \\\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k-1}}}+\left|\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k-1}}}^{\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x\right| \leqslant \frac{1}{n_{k}^{5}}.\end{array}$ On the interval $\left(\pi / n_{k}, 2 \pi / n_{k}\right)$, define $f(x)=n_{k}^{-3} \sin ^{3} n_{k+1} x$. Outside these intervals, $f(x)=0(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2 \pi); f(x+2 \pi)\equiv f(x)$. Therefore, once $n_{k}$ is fixed, $f(x)$ is already defined on $\left(\pi / n_{k-1}, \pi\right)$. Choose $n_{k+1}$ large enough to satisfy the aforementioned inequality. Thus $\begin{array}{l}\begin{array}{l}\pi b_{n_{k+1}}=\int_{0}^{2\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x \\=\int_{0}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k+1}}}+\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k}}}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k}}}+\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k-1}}}^{\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x \\\end{array}\\>-\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k+1}}+\frac{1}{5 n_{k}^{4}}-\frac{1}{n_{k}^{5}}+\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k+1}}}>\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k+1}}}.\end{array}$
chinese_rationale:
第一例: 因为  $\varepsilon_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ ， 所以可取正整数序列  $\left\{n_{k}\right\}: n_{1}<   n_{2}<\cdots $， 使得$\varepsilon_{\boldsymbol{n}_{1}}+\boldsymbol{\varepsilon}_{n_{2}}+\cdots<+\infty$于是， 三角级数  $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \varepsilon_{n_{k}} \cos n_{k} x $ 在  $[-\pi， \pi]$  上一致收敛于某个连续函数  $f(x)$ ， 而且$a_{n_{k}}=\frac{1}{\pi} \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} f(x) \cos n_{k} x d x=\varepsilon_{n_{k}} \text {。 }$ 
第二例: 设  $n_{1}=2$， $n_{k+1}$  是  $n_{k}$  的整数倍而大于  $\left(2 n_{k}\right)^{5}$ ， 且设$\begin{array}{l}\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k}}}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k}}} \sin { }^{4} n_{k+1} x d x>\frac{1}{5 n_{k}}， \\\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k-1}}}+\left|\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k-1}}}^{\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x\right| \leqslant \frac{1}{n_{k}^{5}} 。\end{array}$在区间  $\left(\pi / n_{k}， 2 \pi / n_{k}\right) $ 上， 定义  $f(x)=n_{k}^{-3} \sin ^{3} n_{k+1} x$。 在这些区间的外面，  $f(x)=0(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2 \pi) ; f(x+2 \pi)\equiv  f(x)$ 。因此， 当  $n_{k}$  已定时，  $f(x)$  在  $\left(\pi / n_{k-1}， \pi\right) $ 上已经定好， 取  $n_{k+1}$  足够大， 可使上记不等式成立。由是$\begin{array}{l}\begin{array}{l}\pi b_{n_{k+1}}=\int_{0}^{2\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x \\=\int_{0}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k+1}}}+\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k}}}^{\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k}}}+\int_{\frac{\pi}{n_{k-1}}}^{\pi} f(x) \sin n_{k+1} x d x \\\end{array}\\>-\frac{2 \pi}{n_{k+1}}+\frac{1}{5 n_{k}^{4}}-\frac{1}{n_{k}^{5}}+\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k+1}}}>\sqrt{\varepsilon_{n_{k+1}}}。\end{array}$

statement: Existence in the plane region D such that $f_{V}(x, y) \equiv 0$, but f is a continuously differentiable function in D that is not independent of y.
chinese_statement: 存在在平面区域  D  内 $f_{V}(x， y) \equiv 0$ ， 但是  f  在  D  内并非与  y  无关的连续可微函数。
rationale: Let L be the ray (closed half-line) in $R^{1} \times R^{1}$; $L=\{(x, y): x \geqslant 0, y=0\}$, then let $D=R^{1} \times R^{1} \backslash L$. The function $f(x, y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{3}, x>0 \text{ and } y>0, \\0, \text{ otherwise }(x, y) \in D,\end{array}\right.$ is continuously differentiable in D, and indeed has continuous second partial derivatives (if $x^{3}$ is replaced by $e^{-1 / xy}$, f then has continuous partial derivatives of all orders). Although the first partial derivative of f with respect to y, $f_{y}(x, y)$, is identically zero in D, f is not independent of y; for example $f(1,1)=1$, whereas $f(1,-1)=0$.
chinese_rationale: 设  L  为  $R^{1} \times R^{1}$  内的射线 (闭的半直线);$L=\{(x， y): x \geqslant 0， y=0\} $， 再设 $ D=R^{1} \times R^{1} \backslash L$ 。函数$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x^{3}， x>0 \text { 且 } y>0， \\0， \text { 其它的 }(x， y) \in D，\end{array}\right.$在  D  内是连续可微的， 并且确有连续的二阶偏导数（如果以  $e^{-1 / xy}$ 取代  $x^{3}$， f  就有各阶连续偏导数)。 虽然  f  关于  y  的一阶偏导数  $f_{y}(x， y)$  在  D  内恒等于零， 但是  f  并非与  y  无关; 例如  $f(1，1)=1$ ，而  $f(1，-1)=0$ 。

statement: A sequence of (R) integrable functions has its supremum function also (R) integrable.
chinese_statement: 一个(R)可积函数序列，其上确界函数一定(R)可积。
rationale: Let $\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$ be the set of all rational numbers in [0, 1]. Define a sequence of functions on [0, 1] as follows: $f_{m}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n} \\0, x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n}\end{array}\right.$ Thus, for each positive integer $n, f_{n} $ has only n discontinuity points on [0, 1], so $f_{n}$ is (R) integrable on [0, 1]. However, the supremum function $f(x)=\sup _{n} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x \text { is a rational number, } \\0, x \text { is an irrational number, }\end{array}\right.$ is nowhere continuous on [0, 1], and therefore not (R) integrable. Note: If a finite number of functions $ f_{1}, f_{2}, \cdots, f_{n}$ are (R) integrable on [a, b], then they are almost everywhere continuous on [a, b], thus their maximum function $f(x)=\max _{1\le k\le n} f_{k}(x)$ is also almost everywhere continuous on [a, b]. Therefore, f is (R) integrable on [a, b]. The above counterexample shows that this proposition cannot be extended to the case of infinitely many functions.
chinese_rationale: 设$\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{\infty}$  为  [0，1]  中的全体有理数， 在  [0，1]  上如下定义函数序列:$f_{m}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n} \\0， x \in\left\{r_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{n}\end{array}\right.$于是， 对每一正整数 $n， f_{n} $ 在  [0，1]  上只有  n  个间断点， 所以 $f_{n}$ 在  [0，1]  上是  (R)  可积的。但是， 上确界函数$f(x)=\sup _{n} f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数， }\end{array}\right.$在  [0，1]  上无处连续， 因而不  (R)  可积。注： 若有限个函数$ f_{1}， f_{2}， \cdots， f_{n}$在  [a， b]  上都  (R)  可积， 则它们在  [a， b]  上都几乎处处连续， 从而其最大值函数$f(x)=\max _{1\le k\le n} f_{k}(x)$在  [a， b]  上也几乎处处连续。 因此， f  在[a， b]上(R)可积。上述反例说明了不能把这个命题推广到无穷多个函数的情形。

statement: There exists an (R) integrable function that is not of the first class.
chinese_statement: 存在一个  (R)  可积函数， 它不是第一类的函数。
rationale: For example: Let K be the Cantor perfect dispersed set in $[0, 1]$, and $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is the sequence of points in K, dense in K. For example, we can take all endpoints of adjacent intervals of K as the sequence $\left\{x_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\}$. Define function f on the interval $[0, 1]$ as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \bar\in K, \\1, x=x_{n} \text{ for some } n, \\2, x \in K \text{ and for any } n, x \neq x_{n}.\end{array}\right.$ Hence, f is continuous on the subset of $[0, 1]$ with measure 1, $ [0, 1] \backslash K $ (here, $ m K = 0$), thus it is (R) integrable on $[0, 1]$. However, f, when restricted to the perfect set $\boldsymbol{K}$, has no points of continuity. Therefore, f is not of the first class.
chinese_rationale: 例如：设  K  是  $[0，1]$  中的 Cantor 完备疏集， $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  是  K  中的点列， 它在  K  中稠密。例如， 可取  K  的一切邻接区间的端点作为点列 $ \left\{x_{\boldsymbol{n}}\right\} $。在区间  $[0，1]$  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \bar\in K， \\1， x=x_{n} \text { 对某个 } n， \\2， x \in K \text { 且对任何 } n， x \neq x_{n}。\end{array}\right.$于是，  f  在$[0，1]$  中的测度为 1 的子集 $ [0，1] \backslash K $ 上连续 (这里， $ m K   =0$) ， 从而它在  $[0，1] $ 上是  (R)  可积的。 然而，  f  作为限制在完备 集  $\boldsymbol{K}$  上的函数， 它无连续点。 因此，  f  不是第一类的函数。

statement: There exist a function whose double ($\boldsymbol{R}$) integral exists, but for which only one repeated integral ($\boldsymbol{R}$) exists.
chinese_statement: (R)二重积分存在， 但只有一个  ($\boldsymbol{R}$) 累次积分存在的函数。
rationale: If x is a rational number, express it as an irreducible fraction with a positive denominator, denoted as $q_{x}$. Define the function f on $ D=[0，1] \times[0，1]$ as follows: $f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q_{x}，(x， y) \text { is a rational point， } \\0， \quad \text { otherwise. }\end{array}\right.$ It is easy to see that f has only countably many discontinuities on D, hence f is ($\boldsymbol{R}$) integrable on D, and $\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x d y=0$. For any $y \in[0，1]$, if y is irrational, then $ \varphi(\infty)=f(x， y)=0$, thus $\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$. If y is rational, then $\varphi(x)=f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q_{x}， x \text { is rational, } \\0， x \text { is irrational. }\end{array}\right.$ In this case, we also have $\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$. In summary, for any $y \in[0，1]$, $\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$, so $\int_{0}^{1} d y \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$ is obtained. On the other hand, when $ x_{0} \in[0，1]$ and $x_{0}$ is a rational number, $(y)=f\left(x_{0}， y\right)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / q_{x_{0}}， y \text { is rational, } \\0， & y \text { is irrational. }\end{array}\right.$ Since $ \psi(y)$ is nowhere continuous on [0，1], it is not (R) integrable on [0，1], so the repeated integral $\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$ does not exist.
chinese_rationale: 若  x  为一有理数，则将它表作正分母的既约分数后，表分母为$q_{x}$ 。 在 $ D=[0，1] \times[0，1]$  上定义函数  f  如下:$f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q_{x}，(x， y) \text { 为有理点， } \\0， \quad \text { 在其它情形。 }\end{array}\right.$易见，  f  在  D  上的不连续点只有可数多个，因而  f  在  D  上  (R)  可积，且$\int_{0}^{1} \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x d y=0$ 。对任意的 $y \in[0，1]$ ， 若  y  为无理数， 则 $ \varphi(\infty)=f(x， y)=0$ ， 从而$\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0 \text {。 }$若y为有理数，则$\varphi(x)=f(x， y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1 / q_{x}， x \text { 为有理数， } \\0， x \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$此时也有$\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0 \text {。 }$总之， 对任何  $y \in[0，1]$ ， 都有  $\int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0 $， 所以得到$\int_{0}^{1} d y \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d x=0$另一方面，当 $ x_{0} \in[0，1]$  且  $x_{0}$  为有理数时，$(y)=f\left(x_{0}， y\right)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / q_{x_{0}}， y \text { 为有理数， } \\0， & y \text { 为无理数。 }\end{array}\right.$由于 $ \psi(y)$  在  [0，1]  上无处连续，因有它在  [0，1]  上并不  (R)  可积故累次积分$\int_{0}^{1} d x \int_{0}^{1} f(x， y) d y$也就不存在。

statement: There exists a set $\mathbf{E}$, where its derivative sets $\boldsymbol{E}^{\prime}, \mathbf{E}^{\prime \prime}, \cdots, \boldsymbol{E}^{(n)}, \cdots$ are pairwise distinct, and $\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} \boldsymbol{E}^{(n)} = \varnothing$.
chinese_statement: 存在集  $\mathbf{E}$ ， 它的各阶导集  $\boldsymbol{E}^{\prime}， \mathbf{E}^{\prime \prime}， \cdots， \boldsymbol{E}^{(n)}， \cdots$  两两相异， 且  $\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} \boldsymbol{E}^{(n)}   =\varnothing$ 。
rationale: Within the closed interval [0, 1], create set $E_{1}$, which consists of all points of the form $\frac{1}{n_{1}}, n_{1} = 1, 2, \cdots$. Within [1, 2], create set $E_{2}$, which consists of all points of the form $1 \div \frac{1}{n_{1}} + \frac{1}{n_{2}}, n_{1} = 2, 3, \cdots, n_{2} = 2, 3, \cdots \cdots$. Generally, within $[k-1, k]$, create set $E_{k}$, consisting of all points of the form $\begin{array}{c}k-1 + \frac{1}{n_{1}} + \frac{1}{n_{2}} + \cdots + \frac{1}{n_{k}}, n_{1} = k, k+1, \cdots, n_{2} = k, k+1, \cdots, \\\cdots, n_{k} = k, k+1, \cdots\end{array}$. Let $E = \bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k}$ then $E^{\prime}, E^{n}, \cdots, E^{(n)}, \cdots$ are pairwise distinct, and $\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} E^{(n)} = \varnothing$.
chinese_rationale: 在闭区间  [0，1]  中作集  $E_{1}$ ， 它是由一切形如$\frac{1}{n_{1}}， n_{1}=1，2， \cdots$的点组成。 在  [1，2]  中作集 $E_{2}$ ， 它是由一切形如$1 \div \frac{1}{n_{1}}+\frac{1}{n_{2}}， n_{1}=2，3， \cdots， n_{2}=2，3， \cdots \cdots$的点组成。 一般， 在  $[k-1， k]$  中作集  $E_{k}$ ， 它是由一切形如$\begin{array}{c}k-1+\frac{1}{n_{1}}+\frac{1}{n_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{n_{k}}， n_{1}=k， k+1， \cdots， n_{2}=k， k+1， \cdots， \\\cdots， n_{k}=k， k+1， \cdots\end{array}$的点组成。 令$E=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} E_{k}$则  $E^{\prime}， E^{n}， \cdots， E^{(n)}， \cdots$  两两相异， 且$\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} E^{(n)}=\varnothing$。

statement: There exists a function f such that $f \in \boldsymbol{H}^{1}(-\infty, +\infty)$; whereas for any $\alpha(0 < \alpha < 1), f \bar\in H^{\alpha}(-\infty, +\infty)_{\text {。}} $
chinese_statement: 存在函数  f ， 使$f \in \boldsymbol{H}^{1}(-\infty，+\infty)$；而对任何$\alpha(0<\alpha<1)， f \bar\in H^{\alpha}   (-\infty，+\infty)_{\text {。}} $
rationale: Let $ f(x) = x $, then $ f \in \boldsymbol{H}^{\prime}(-\infty, +\infty) $. On the other hand, there does not exist a constant M such that for all $x, y \in(-\infty, +\infty)$, we have $|x-y| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\alpha}(0<\alpha<1)$, therefore, $f \bar{E} H^{\alpha}(-\infty, +\infty)$. Note: The above counterexample indicates that when $(a, b)$ is an infinite interval, the inclusion relation $H^{\beta}(a, b) \subset H^{\alpha}(a, b)(\beta>\alpha>0)$ no longer holds.
chinese_rationale: 设 $ f(x)=x $， 则 $ f \in \boldsymbol{H}^{\prime}(-\infty，+\infty) $ ，另一方面不存在常数  M ， 使对一切  $x， y \in(-\infty，+\infty)$ ， 都有$|x-y| \leqslant M|x-y|^{\alpha}(0<\alpha<1)$，因此，  $f \bar{E} H^{\alpha}(-\infty，+\infty)$。注： 上述反例说明了当$(a， b)$为无穷区间时，包含关系$H^{\beta}(a ， b)  \subset H^{\alpha}(a， b)(\beta>\alpha>0)$不再成立。

statement: Define a function on $R^{1}$ that is almost everywhere zero, but its range on every non-empty open interval is $ R^{\mathbf{1}} $.
chinese_statement: 定义于$R^{1}$上的一个几乎处处为零的函数， 它在每个非空开区间上的值域都是 $ R^{\mathbf{1}} $ 。
rationale: Let C be the Cantor middle third set on [0,1], $\theta$ the Cantor function, and define $g(x)=\operatorname{tg}\left[\pi\left(\theta(x)-\frac{1}{2}\right)\right], \quad 0<x<1 $. By the definition of $\theta(x)$, when x ranges over $C \cap(0,1)$, the range of $\theta(x)$ is the open interval (0,1), so the range of $g(x)$ is $R^{\prime}$. That is, g is a surjective map of $C \cap(0,1)$ onto $R^{1}$. For any non-empty open interval $ I=(a, b)$, we construct a corresponding function $ g_{I}$ using function g. Let $\begin{array}{c}\boldsymbol{Z}_{I}=\{a+(b-a) x: x \in C \cap(0,1)\}, \\g_{I}(x)=g\left(\frac{x-a}{b-a}\right), \quad x \in \boldsymbol{Z}_{I},\end{array}$ then $ m \mathbf{Z}_{I}=(b-a) m C=0 $, and $g_{I} $ is a surjective map of set $Z_{I}$ onto $R^{1}$. We proceed to define the required function f by setting it initially equal to zero on the integer set $\{n\}(n=0 , \pm 1, \pm 2, \cdots) $. Then define the sequence of open sets $ \left\{U_{n}\right\}$ as follows: Let $ U_{1}= R^{1} \backslash\{n\} $, which is the union of all open intervals of the form $(n, n+1)$, where n is an integer. On each such interval I, let $Z_{I}$ be the zero-measure set as defined above and define f to equal $g_{I}$ on $ Z_{I}$. The points in $U_{1}$ where f has not been defined form the subset $ U_{2}$, which is open, and thus a union of disjoint open intervals. On each such open interval I, let $Z_{I}$ be the zero-measure set as defined above and define f to equal $g_{I}$ on $ Z_{I}$. The subset $U_{3}$ of $U_{2}$ where f is still undefined remains open and thus a union of disjoint open intervals. By taking sets $Z_{I}$ as defined above, the domain of function f can be expanded to include these zero-measure sets. Continue this process using the open set sequence $\left\{U_{n}\right\} $, each with zero-measure complement. Thus, function f is defined on the complement of the intersection of $U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots $, or equivalently, on the union of their complements $ U_{1}^{c}, U_{2}^{c}, \cdots$, such that every non-empty open interval must contain an open interval I of one of the open sets $U_{n}$, and therefore also contains a set $Z_{I}$ where the range of f is $R^{\prime}$. Finally, at the points where f has never been defined, let f be identically zero.
chinese_rationale: 设  C  为  [0，1]  中的 Cantor 三分集，  $\theta$  是 Cantor 函数， 令$g(x)=\operatorname{tg}\left[\pi\left(\theta(x)-\frac{1}{2}\right)\right]， \quad 0<x<1 $。由 $\theta(x)$  的定义可知， 当  x走遍$C \cap(0，1)$  时，  $\theta(x)$  的值域是开区间  (0，1) ， 从而  $g(x)$  的值域是  $R^{\prime}$  。 也就是说，  g  是将  $C \cap(0，1)$  映到  $R^{1}$  上的一个满映射。 现对任意非空开区间 $ I=(a， b)$ ， 我们籍助于函数  g  而相应地构掯函数$ g_{I}$。 为此， 令$\begin{array}{c}\boldsymbol{Z}_{I}=\{a+(b-a) x: x \in C \cap(0，1)\}， \\g_{I}(x)=g\left(\frac{x-a}{b-a}\right)， \quad x \in \boldsymbol{Z}_{I}，\end{array}$则 $ m \mathbf{Z}_{I}=(b-a) m C=0 $， 且  $g_{I} $ 是将集$Z_{I}$ ， 映到$R^{1}$ 上的一个满映射。我们着手定义所要求的函数  f ， 先让它在整数集  $\{n\}(n=0 ，  \pm 1， \pm 2， \cdots) $ 上等于零。 然后定义开集序列 $ \left\{U_{n}\right\}$  如 下: 设 $ U_{1}=   R^{1} \backslash\{n\} $， 它是一切形如 $(n， n+1)$ 的开区间的并集， 此处  n  为整数。在每一个这种区间I上， 设 $Z_{I}$  为以上定义的测度为零的集， 并且在$ Z_{I}$  上定义  f  等于  $g_{I}$。 $U_{1}$内  f  尚未定义的点组成子集 $ U_{2}$ ， 它是开集， 因而是不相交的开区间的并集。 在每一个这种开区间  I  上，设  $Z_{I}$  为以上定义的测度为零的集， 并且在 $ Z_{I}$  上定义  f  等于$g_{I}$ 。 $U_{2}$ 内  f  尚未定义的子集 $U_{3}$  仍是开集， 所以还是不相交的开区间的并集。 如果照着上面的定义再取集 $Z_{I}$ ， 那么函数  f  的定义域就能够又一次地扩大， 以包括这些测度为零的集。 利用开集序列$\left\{U_{n}\right\} $中每一个都有测度为零的余集， 让这个程序继续下去。 从而函数  f  转化为定义在一个测度为零的集——$U_{1}， U_{2}， \cdots $ 的交的余集， 或等价地， 它们的余集$ U_{1}^{c}， U_{2}^{c}， \cdots$ 的并集一上， 用这样一种方法使每个非空开区间必然包含开集$U_{n}$  之一的一个开区间  I ， 因而也就包含一个集 $Z_{I}$ ， 在它上面，  f  的值域是  $R^{\prime}$。 最后， 在  f  一直没有定义的各点， 让  f  恒等于零。

statement: There exists a sequence of measurable functions $\{\varphi_{n}\}$ converging in measure and a continuous function F, but the sequence of composite functions $\left\{F \circ \boldsymbol{\varphi}_{n}\right\}$ does not converge in measure.
chinese_statement: 存在一个依测度收敛的可测函数序列$\{\varphi_{n}\}$和连续函数F，而构成并不依测度收敛的复合函数序列$\left\{F \circ \boldsymbol{\varphi}_{n}\right\}$。
rationale: It is easy to prove that if $m E<-1-\infty$, and the sequence of functions $\left\{\boldsymbol{\varphi}_{n}\right\}$ converges in measure on E to the function $\varphi$, F is a continuous function on $R^{1}$, then the sequence of composite functions $\left\{F \circ \varphi_{n}\right\}$ must converge in measure on E to $F \circ \varphi$. It should be noted that in this proposition, the condition $m E<+\infty$ cannot be removed. For example, take $E=[0, +\infty)$, and define the function on E: $\begin{array}{c}f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0, x \in[0, n), \\1 / x, x \in[n, +\infty),\end{array}\right. \\f(x) \equiv 0, g_{n}(x)=x, g(x)=x,\end{array}$ then $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$ converge in measure on E to f and g respectively. It is easy to see, if we let $\varphi_{n}=f_{n}+g_{n}$, then $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$ converges in measure on E to g. We now show that $\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$ does not converge in measure on E to $g^{2}$. In fact, $\varphi_{n}^{2}=f_{n}^{2}+g_{n}^{2}+2 f_{n} g_{n}$, and it is easy to see $\left\{f_{n}^{2}\right\}$ and $\left\{g_{n}^{2}\right\}$ converge in measure on E to $f^{2}$ and $g^{2}$ respectively, thus, if $\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$ converges in measure on E to $g^{\mathrm{2}}$, then $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$ should converge in measure on E to $f g$. However, example 19 has already pointed out that $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$ does not converge in measure to $f g$. This contradiction shows that $\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$ does not converge in measure on E. From the above discussion, it is clear that for a continuous function $F(x)=x^{2}$ on $R^{\mathrm{1}}$, the measure convergence of $\left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$ does not imply the measure convergence of the sequence of composite functions $\left\{F \circ \varphi_{n}\right\}$.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明， 若$m E<-1-\infty$ ， 且函数序列  $\left\{\boldsymbol{\varphi}_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上依测度收敛于函数 $\varphi$， F  是  $R^{1}$  上的连续函数， 则复合函数序列  $\left\{F \circ \varphi_{n}\right\} $ 在  E  上必定依测度收敛于 $ F \circ \varphi$。 应当注意， 在这个命题中条件  $m E<+\infty$ 是不能去掉的。 例如， 取$E=[0，+\infty)$ ，并在  E  上定义函数:$\begin{array}{c}f_{n}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0， x \in[0， n)， \\1 / x， x \in[n，+\infty)，\end{array}\right. \\f(x) \equiv 0， g_{n}(x)=x， g(x)=x，\end{array}$则 $ \left\{f_{n}\right\}$  和  $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$  在  E  上分别依测度收敛于  f  和  g 。 容易看出， 若令$\varphi_{n}=f_{n}+g_{n}$ ， 则$ \left\{\varphi_{n}\right\}$在  E  上依测度收敛于  g。 兹证 $\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$在  E  上并不依测度收敛于$g^{2}$。 事实上， $ \varphi_{n}^{2}=f_{n}^{2}+g_{n}^{2}+2 f_{n} g_{n}$ ， 而易见$\left\{f_{n}^{2}\right\}$和 $\left\{g_{n}^{2}\right\}$ 在  E  上分别依测度收敛于$ f^{2} $ 和 $g^{2}$ ， 因此， 如果$\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$在  E  上依测度收敛于 $g^{\mathrm{2}}$，那么$\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$在  E  上应该依测度收敛于$f g$。 然而，例 19 已经指出，  $\left\{f_{n} g_{n}\right\}$  并不依测度收敛于$ f g$ 。 这个矛盾表明了$\left\{\varphi_{n}^{2}\right\}$在  E  上并不依测度收敛。由上面的论述可知， 对  $R^{\mathrm{1}} $ 上的连续函数 $ F(x)=x^{2}$  而言， 从$  \left\{\varphi_{n}\right\} $ 的测度收敛性推不出复合函数序列$  \left\{F \circ \varphi_{n}\right\}$  的测度收敛性。

statement: There exists a subset A of the unit square $I=[0,1]\times [0,1]$ which is dense in $I$, and intersects every vertical or horizontal line in $I$ exactly at one point.
chinese_statement: 存在单位正方形$I=[0，1]\times [0，1]$的一个子集A在$I$内稠密，而且与  $I$  相交的每一条铅直或水平直线恰好交  A 于一点。
rationale: In fact, what we are seeking is a one-to-one correspondence f, whose domain and range are both [0,1], with its graph being dense in I. Initially, we define the function $f(x)$ in phases for $x\in[0,1]\bigcap \mathscr{D}$, where $\mathscr{D} $ represents all rational numbers. Let $B=((0,1] \cap \mathscr{D}) \times ((0,1] \cap \varnothing)$ points be arranged in a sequence: $\left(x_{1}, y_{1}\right),\left(x_{2}, y_{2}\right), \cdots,\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right), \cdots$. (This is permissible because the set of points with rational coordinates forms a countable set). First, define $f(x_{1})=y_{1}$. In the first phase, we divide B into four disjoint parts using vertical and horizontal bisectors; $\begin{aligned}\left(\left(0, \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right) & \times\left(\left(0, \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right),\left(\left(0, \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right) \\& \times\left(\left(\frac{1}{2}, 1\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right), \cdots, \ldots\end{aligned}$ and denote these four parts in any order as $ \left. B_{1 1}, B_{12}, B_{13}, B_{14}\right.$. Let $(x_{11}, y_{11})$ denote the first point in the sequence $\left\{\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)\right\}$ that belongs to $B_{11}$ with $x_{11}\ne x_{1}$ and $y_{11}\ne y_{1}$, and set $f(x_{11})=y_{11}$. Let $\left(x_{12}, y_{12}\right)$ represent the first point in the sequence $\left\{\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)\right\}$ belonging to $B_{12}$, such that $x_{12}$ is different from $x_{1}$ and $x_{11}$, and $y_{12}$ is different from $y_{1}$ and $y_{11}$. Set $f(x_{12})=y_{12}$. Once $f\left(x_{13}\right)=y_{13}$ is defined in the same manner, we let $\left(x_{14}, y_{14}\right)$ be the first point in the sequence $\left\{\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)\right\}$ belonging to $B_{11}$ such that $x_{14}$ differs from $x_{1}, x_{11}, x_{12}$, and $x_{13}$, while $y_{14}$ differs from $y_{1}, y_{11}, y_{12}$, and $y_{13}$. Define $f\left(x_{14}\right)=y_{14}$. This completes the first phase. The second phase is similar, except we divide B into $16=4^{2}$ parts using more vertical and horizontal bisectors: $B_{11}, B_{22}, \cdots, B_{24}$. For each of these parts, we define f at a rational point not yet in its domain, with a value not yet in its range. If this process continues indefinitely, the nth stage will divide B into $4^{n}$ equal parts, and the resulting function f will have the specified properties on $(0,1] \cap\$. Finally, we extend the domain and range of f to [0,1] by defining $f(x)=x$ for $x \in[0,1] \backslash(0,1] \cap \mathscr{D})$.
chinese_rationale: 实际上， 所要寻求的是一个一一对应f，它的定义域和值域都是[0，1]，其图形在I内稠密。开头，我们分阶段地对$x\in[0，1]\bigcap  \mathscr{D}$  定义函数$f(x)$ ， 其中 $ \mathscr{D} $ 代表全体有理数。设  $B=((0，1] \cap \mathscr{D}) \times   ((0，1] \cap \varnothing)$  的点已被排成序列:$\left(x_{1}， y_{1}\right)，\left(x_{2}， y_{2}\right)， \cdots，\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)， \cdots$。(这是允许的， 因为坐标为有理数的点的全体成一可数集)。 先定义$f(x_{1})=y_{1}$。第一个阶段，我们用铅直和水平的二等分线将B分成四个不相交的部分;$\begin{aligned}\left(\left(0， \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right) & \times\left(\left(0， \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right)，\left(\left(0， \frac{1}{2}\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right) \\& \times\left(\left(\frac{1}{2}， 1\right] \cap \mathscr{D}\right)， \cdots， \ldots\end{aligned}$并且按照任意的次序将这四部分记作$ \left. B_{1 1}， B_{12 } ,B_{13} ,B_{14}\right.$，以$\left(x_{11}\right. ，y_{11})$表示序列$\left\{\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)\right\}$中第一个属于$B_{11}$而又$x_{11}\ne x_{1}$且$y_{11}\ne y_{1}的点， 设 $f(x_{11})=y_{11}$ 。以  $\left(x_{12}， y_{12}\right) $ 表示序列  $\left\{\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)\right\}$  中第一个属于$ B_{12}$ ， 而又能使 $ x_{12}$  与  $x_{1}$  和 $ x_{11}$  都不相同， $ y_{12}$  与  $y_{1}$  和  $y_{11}$  都不相同的点， 设  $f(x_{12})=y_{12}$。当已经用同样的方法定义 $f\left(x_{13}\right)=y_{13}$  之后， 我们用$ \left(x_{14}， y_{14}\right)$  表示序列 $ \left\{\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)\right\} $ 中第一个属于$B_{11}$ ， 而又能使  $x_{14}$  与  $x_{1}、 x_{11}、 x_{12}$  和  $x_{13}$  都不相同， $y_{11} $ 与  $y_{1}、 y_{11} 、 y_{12}$  和  $y_{13} $ 都不相同的点， 定义  $f\left(x_{14}\right)=y_{14}$  这就完成了第一阶段。第二阶段也一样，只不过是用更多的铅直的和水平的二等分线将B  分成  $16=4^{2}$  部分: $ B_{11}， B_{22}， \cdots， B_{24} $ 在这些部分的每一个，我们依次在一个尚未在其定义域中的有理点f定义，它所取的值是尚未在值域中的有理点。如果这个程序无限地继续进行，第n阶段将B分成$4^{n}$个全等的部分，得到的函数 f  在 $(0，1] \cap \$  上具有指定的性质。 最后，我们把  f  的定义域和值域扩张到[0，1] ， 办法是对 $x \in[0，1] \backslash(0，1]   \cap \mathscr{D})$ 定义 $f(x)=x$。

statement: There exist differentiable complex-valued functions where the mean value theorem fails.
chinese_statement: 存在中值定理失效的可微复值函数。
rationale: We need to consider a function whose range exceeds the real numbers. Define $f(x)=e^{i x} = \cos x - i \sin x$ on the real axis, $-\infty < x < \infty$. This function is continuous and differentiable everywhere, but there is no interval [a, b], a < b, such that there is some $\xi$ between a and b satisfying the equation $f(b)-f(a)=f^{\prime}(\xi)(b-a)$, i.e., $(\cos b + i \sin b)-(\cos a + i \sin a)=(-\sin \xi + i \cos \xi)(b-a)$. In fact, assuming the above equation holds, the squares of the modulus (absolute values) of both sides of the equation should also be equal, i.e., $(\cos b - \cos a)^{2} + (\sin b - \sin a)^{2} = (b-a)^{2}$. Thus, using basic identities, we deduce $\sin^{2} \frac{b-a}{2} = \left(\frac{b-a}{2}\right)^{2}$. But this is impossible since there is no positive number h that can satisfy $\sin \boldsymbol{h} = \boldsymbol{h}$. Note that this counterexample shows that for complex-valued functions, the mean value theorem no longer holds.
chinese_rationale: 我们需要让所论函数的值域超出实数系。 在实轴上定义$f(x)=e^{i x}= \cos x - i \sin x，-\infty<x<\infty，$此函数是处处连续和可微的，但是不存在区间[a，b]，a<b，使得在 a  可  b  之间能有某个$\xi$ 满足等式$f(b)-f(a)=f^{\prime}(\xi)(b-a)$，即$(\cos b+i \sin b)-(\cos a + i \sin a)=(-\sin \xi+i \cos \xi)(b-a)$ 。事实上，假定上述等式成立，则等式两边的模（绝对值）的平方亦应相等， 即$(\cos b-\cos a)^{2}+(\sin b-\sin a)^{2}=(b-a)^{2}$，于是， 利用基本恒等式将得出$\sin ^{2} \frac{b-a}{2}=\left(\frac{b-a}{2}\right)^{2}$。但这是不可能的， 因为没有一个正数  h  能够使$\sin \boldsymbol{h}=\boldsymbol{h}$。注 上述反例说明， 对于复值函数而言， 中值定理不再成立。

statement: There exist sequences $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$ both have accumulation points, but $\left(\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)\right\}$ has no accumulation points.
chinese_statement: 序列$\left\{x_{n}\right\}$与$\left\{y_{n}\right\}$均有聚点，而$\left(\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)\right\}$没有聚点。
rationale: In the plane R^{2}, take $x_{2 n}=1 / n, y_{2 n}=\pi, x_{2 n+1}=\pi, y_{2 n+1}=1 / n $, then 0 is an accumulation point of both $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ and $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$. Since $\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(1 / k, k), n=2 k \\(k, 1 / k), n=2 k+1\end{array}\right.$ it is evident that $\left(\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right)\right\}$ has no accumulation points.
chinese_rationale: 在平面  R^{2}  中取  $x_{2 n}=1 / n， y_{2 n}=\pi， x_{2 n+1}=\pi， y_{2 n+1}=1 / n $， 则 0 既是  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  的聚点， 也是  $\left\{y_{n}\right\}$  的聚点。由于$\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}(1 / k， k)， n=2 k \\(k， 1 / k)， n=2 k+1\end{array}\right.$可见 $\left(\left(x_{n}， y_{n}\right)\right\}$  没有聚点。

statement: There exists a measurable set E in [0,1], such that for any non-empty open interval $I \subset[0,1]$, we always have $m(I \cap E)>0, m\left(I \cap E^{c}\right)>0$.
chinese_statement: 存在[0，1]  中的一个可测集  E ， 使对任一非空开区间  $I \subset[0，1]$ ，恒有 $ m(I \cap E)>0， m\left(I \cap E^{c}\right)>0 $。
rationale: Let $\left\{\lambda_{n}\right\}$ be a sequence of positive numbers less than 1 such that $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{n}<+\infty$. For each positive integer n, construct a sparse closed set $A_{n}$ in [0,1] such that $m A_{n}=\lambda_{n}$. While constructing the set $A_{n}$, we can always assume that the length of the adjacent intervals of $A_{n}$, denoted as $\left(p_{i}, q_{i}\right)$, is less than $1 / n$. This is because if for some open interval $\left(p_{i}, q_{i}\right)$, we have $q_{i}-p_{i} \geqslant 1 / n$, then we can always insert a finite number of points such that the length of each subinterval is less than $1 / n$, and include these points in $A_{n}$, making $A_{n}$ still a closed sparse set with unchanged measure. Now, we construct a sequence of sets $\left\{B_{\mathrm{n}}\right\}$. Let $B_{1}=A_{\mathrm{1}}$. In the closure $\left[a_{i}, b_{i}\right]$ of each adjacent interval $\left(a_{i}, b_{i}\right)$ of $B_{1}$, construct a set that is obtained by mapping $A_{2}$ from [0,1] onto $\left[a_{i}, b_{i}\right]$ through the one-to-one mapping $y=\left(b_{i}-a_{i}\right) x+a_{i}\left(x \in A_{2}\right)$. For each adjacent interval closure of $B_{1}$, construct a set in the manner described above. The union of all such sets and $B_{1}$ is denoted as $B_{2}$. In the closure $\left[a_{i}, b_{i}\right]$ of each adjacent interval $\left(a_{i}, b_{i}\right)$ of $B_{2}$, construct a set that is obtained by mapping $A_{3}$ from [0, 1] onto $\left[a_{i}, b_{i}\right]$ through a one-to-one mapping $y=\left(b_{i}-a_{i}\right) x+a_{i}\left(x\in A_{3}\right)$. The union of all such sets and $B_{2}$ is denoted as $B_{3}$. Continue in this manner indefinitely, thus obtaining a sequence of sets $\left\{B_{n}\right\}$. Let $E=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} B_{n}$. We will prove that the set E has the desired properties. To this end, consider any non-empty open interval $I \subset [0,1]$. Since the length of each adjacent interval of $A_{n}$ is less than $1 / n$, the construction of $B_{n}$ implies that the length of each adjacent interval of $B_{n}$ is also less than $1 / n$. Thus, we can select a natural number m such that some adjacent interval (p, q) of $B_{m}$ is entirely contained within the open interval I. Consequently, $I \cap E$ contains a set obtained from $A_{m+1}$ through the mapping $y=(q -p) x+p\left(x \in A_{m+1}\right)$. Since $m A_{m+1} \neq 0$, the measure of this set is also non-zero, therefore $m(I \cap E)>0$. On the other hand, $[p, q] \cap B_{m+1}$ is a set obtained from $A_{m+1}$ through the mapping $y=(q-p) x+p \left(x \in A_{m+1}\right)$, thus $\left.\boldsymbol{m}\left(p, q\right] \cap B_{m+1}\right)=(q-p) m A_{m+1}=(q-p) \lambda_{m+1}$, hence $m\left([p, q] \backslash[p, q] \cap B_{m+1}\right)=\left(1-\lambda_{m+1}\right)(q-p)$. Similarly, $m\left([p, q] \backslash[p, q] \cap B_{m+2}\right)=\left(1-\lambda_{m+1}\right)\left(1-\lambda_{m+2}\right)(q-p)$, and so on. Since $\left\{B_{n}\right\}$ is an increasing sequence of sets, $E=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} B_{n}$, hence $[p, q] \backslash [p, q] \cap E=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left([p, q] \backslash[\boldsymbol{p}, q] \cap B_{n}\right)$, thus $m([p, q] \backslash[p, q] \cap E)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} m\left([p, q] \backslash[p, q] \cap B_{n}\right)$. Since $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \lambda_{n}<+\infty$, $\prod_{n=m+1}^{\infty}\left(1-\lambda_{n}\right) \neq 0$, hence $\begin{aligned}m([p, q] \backslash & {\left.[p, q] \cap B_{m+k}\right)=\left(1-\lambda_{m+1}\right)\left(1-\lambda_{m+z}\right) \cdots } \\& \left(1-\lambda_{m+k}\right)(q-p) \\& >\prod_{n=m+1}^{\infty}\left(1-\lambda_{n}\right)(q-p)>0,\end{aligned}$, therefore $m([p, q] \backslash[p, q] \cap E)>0$. Since $(p, q) \subset I$, $m\left(I \cap E^{c}\right)>0$.
