chinese_rationale: 考虑 Banach 空间$\begin{array}{c}l^{2}=\left\{x=\left.\left\{\xi_{n}\right\}\left|\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\right| \xi_{n}\right|^{2}<+\infty\right\}, \\\|x\|=\left\{\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left|\xi_{n}\right|^{2}\right\}^{1 / 2} .\end{array}$因  $\left(l^{2}, \sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)\right)$  上每个有界线性泛函都是连续的，故  $\left(l^{2}, \sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)\right)$ 是一个半囿空间.兹证  $\left(l^{2}, \sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)\right.  )$不是  s  囿空间. 为此, 我们只要找出  $l^{2}$  中的一个凸、平衡、  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  直集, 它不是  o  点的一个  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  序列邻域.令$B=\left\{x \in l^{2} \mid\|x\| \leqslant 1\right\}$,并设  u  是  $l^{2}$  上的范数拓扑, 则  B  是  $l^{2}$  中o 点的一个凸、平衡的  u 邻域. 因此,  B  是一个凸、平衡的  u  囿集. 因  $l^{2}$  中  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  有界集与  u  有界集是一致的, 故  B  也是  $l^{2}$  中的凸的平衡的  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  囿集. 但  B  不是  $l^{2}$  中  o  点的  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  序列邻域. 事实上,  $l^{2}$  中的单位向量序列  $\left\{e_{n}\right\}$  弱收敛于  o , 即  $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$  是  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  收敛于  o  的, 其中$\mathrm{e}_{n}=(0,0, \cdots, 0,1,0, \cdots)$(第n位), 而$\|e_{n}\|=1$ , 故  $\left\{e_{n}\right\}$  不能终于在  B  中, 即  B  不是  $l^{2}$  中  o  点的一个  $\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)$  序列邻域. 因此,  $\left(l^{2}, \sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)\right)$  不是  s  囿空间.

statement: There exists a strongest compact topology that is not a Hausdorff topology.
chinese_statement: 存在某个最强的紧拓扑，它不是 Hausdorff 拓扑.
rationale: Example: Let X be the set of all ordered pairs of natural numbers $(i, j)$ along with two hypothetical points x and y. Declare that each single-point set $\{(i, j)\}$ of an ordered pair $(i, j)$ is an open set of X; also declare that a set of the form $X \backslash A$ is an open neighborhood of the hypothetical point x, where A is a set of ordered pairs $(i, j)$ such that at most a finite number of points in each row belong to A; similarly, declare that a set of the form $X \backslash B$ is an open neighborhood of y, where B is a set of ordered pairs such that at most a finite number of points in rows belong to B. The family of open sets thus defined forms a topology on X denoted as $\tau$. (i) $(X, \tau)$ is not a Hausdorff space. In fact, any two open neighborhoods of points x and y are intersecting. (ii) $(X, \tau)$ is compact. Take any open cover $\mathscr{U}=\left\{U_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$ of X. Let $X \backslash A$ and $X \backslash B$ be open neighborhoods of x and y respectively, where $X \backslash A \in \mathscr{U}, X \backslash B \in \mathscr{U}$, then $X \backslash[(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B)]=A \cap B$ is a finite set. Therefore, there exists a subfamily $\left\{U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}\right\} \subset \mathscr{U}$ such that $X \backslash[(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B)] \subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} U_{i}$. Thus, $(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B) \cup \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} U_{i}$ is a finite subcover for $(X, \tau)$, hence $(X, \tau)$ is compact. (iii) The compact sets in $(X, \tau)$ are closed. Suppose there exists a compact set $E \subset X$, and E is not closed. Since each ordered pair $(i, j)$ is an open set and E is not closed, only x or y can be an accumulation point of E and not belong to E. If $y \in \bar E \backslash E$, then E must contain infinitely many points in rows (otherwise, if E contains only finitely many points in rows, then $X \backslash E$ would be a neighborhood of y excluding points of E, making y not an accumulation point of E). Choose a point $(i_{n}, j_{n})$ in each of these infinite rows, then $A=\left\{\left(i_{n}, j_{n}\right)\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty} \subset E$. Thus, $X \backslash A$ is an open set, and together with the family of open sets $A=\left\{\left(i_{n}, j_{n}\right)\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$, forms an open cover for E. It is easy to see that this open cover has no finite subcover, hence E is not compact, contradicting the assumption that E is compact. Similarly, if $x \in \bar{E} \backslash E$, then E must contain infinitely many points in some row. Denote the set of these points in that row as B, then $X \backslash B$ is an open set, and together with the family of open sets B forms an open cover for E, which has no finite subcover, so E is not compact, which is also a contradiction. (iv) r is the strongest compact topology on X. Suppose there is another compact topology $\tau^{*}$ on X that is strictly stronger than $\tau$, i.e., the inclusion $\tau^{*} \supset \tau$ is strict. Then there exists a subset A that is closed in $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ but not closed in $(X, \tau)$. Since $\tau^{*}$ is a compact topology and $A$ is a closed set in $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$, $A$ must be compact in $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$. Since $\tau^{*} \supset \tau$, $A$ is also compact in $(X, \tau)$. According to (iii), $A$ is closed in $(X, \tau)$, which is a contradiction.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 设  X  为平面上全体自然数对  $(i, j)$  连同两个假想点  $x, y$  所成之集. 命每一自然数对  $(i, j)$  所成之单点集  $\{(i, j)\}$  为  X  的开集; 又命形如  $X \backslash A$  的集为假想点  x  的开邻域, 其中  A  是这样的自然数对  $(i, j)$  所成之集，使在每一行上至多有有限个点属于  A ; 再命形如  $X \backslash B$  的集为  y  的开邻域，其中  B  是这样的自然数对所成之集,使至多有有限多个行上的点属于  B . 这样定义的开集族形成了  X 上的一个拓扑  $\tau .(i)  (X, \tau)$  不是 Hausdorff 空间.事实上,点  x  与  y  的任何两个开邻域都是相交的.(ii)  $(X, \tau)$  是紧的.任取  X  的开覆盖  $\mathscr{U}=\left\{U_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$ . 设  $X \backslash A$  与  $X \backslash B$  分别是  x 与  y  的开邻域, 其中  $X \backslash A \in \mathscr{U}, X \backslash B \in \mathscr{U}$ , 则$X \backslash[(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B)]=A \cap B$是有限集. 因此, 存在子族  $\left\{U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}\right\} \subset \mathscr{U}$ , 使得$X \backslash[(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B)] \subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} U_{i} \text {. }$于是,  $(X \backslash A) \cup(X \backslash B) \cup \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} U_{i}$  就是  $(X, \tau)$  的一个有限子覆盖，即  $(X, \tau)$  是紧的.(iii)  $(X, \tau)$  中的紧集都是闭的.假如存在紧集  $E \subset X$  而  E  不闭. 因每一自然数对  $(i, j)$  皆为开集, 而  E  不闭, 故只有  x  或  y  是  E  的聚点且又不属于  E .若  $y \in \bar E  \backslash E$ , 则  E  必定含有无限多个行上的点(如若不然,  E 只含有有限多个行上的点, 则  $X \backslash E$  将是  y  的邻城而无  E  中的点,  y  就不是  E  的聚点了). 在这无穷多行的每一行上任取一点 $(  i_{n} ,  j_{n}  )$, 则$A=\left\{\left(i_{n}, j_{n}\right)\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty} \subset E$ .于是,  $X \backslash A$  是开集,而且  $X \backslash A$  连同开集族  $A=\left\{\left(i_{n}, j_{n}\right)\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  构成了  E  的一个开覆盖. 易见, 此开覆盖没有有限子覆盖, 因而  E  不是紧集，这与  E  是紧集的假设发生矛盾.类似地, 若  $x \in \bar{E} \backslash E$ , 则  E  必定含有某行上的无穷多个点, 把这一行上的这种点的全体记作  B , 则  $X \backslash B$  是开集, 而且  $X \backslash B$  连同开集族  B  构成了  E  的一个开覆盖, 而它没有有限子覆盖, 故  E  不是紧的,此也为矛盾.(iv)  r  是  X  上最强的紧拓扑.假如在  X  上存在另一个紧拓扑  $\tau^{*}$ , 它严格强于  $\tau$ , 即包含关系  $\tau^{*} \supset \tau$  是严格的. 于是, 存在子集  A , 它在  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  中是闭的, 而在  $(X, \tau)$  中不闭. 因  $\tau^{*}$  是紧拓扑, 且  A  是  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  中的闭集,故  A 必是  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  中的紧集. 又因  $\tau^{*} \supset \tau$ , 故  A  也是  $(X, \tau)$  中的紧集. 据 (iii),  A  是  $(X, \tau)$  中的闭集，矛盾.

statement: There exist topological spaces X, Y and a mapping $f: X \rightarrow Y$, such that f is continuous at some point but not closure continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在拓扑空间  X, Y  及映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$ , 使  f  在某点连续而不闭包连续.
rationale: Let X and Y both be topological spaces. If $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is continuous on X, then f must be closure continuous on X. It should be noted that when f is continuous at some point $x_{0} \in X$, f may not be closure continuous at that point. For example: Let $X=\{a, b, c\}$, with open sets $\{a\},\{a, b\}, X$ and the empty set $\varnothing$; also let $Y=\{a, b, c\}$, with open sets $\{a, b\},\{c\}, Y$ and $\varnothing$. Define $f: X \rightarrow Y$ as the identity mapping. Clearly, f is continuous at point b. But for the open set $G=\{a, b\}$ in Y, with $\bar{G}= \{a, b\}$, and the open set in X containing point b is $O=\{a, b\}$ or $O=X$, whose closures are both X, hence $f(\bar{O}) \not \subset \bar{G}$, i.e., f is not closure continuous at point b.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  与  Y  都是拓扑空间. 若  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  在  X  上连续,则  f  在  X 上亦必闭包连续. 应当注意, 当  f  在某点  $x_{0} \in X$  连续时,  f  在该点未必闭包连续. 例如： 设  $X=\{a, b, c\}$ , 开集为  $\{a\},\{a, b\}, X$  及空集  $\varnothing$ ; 再设  $Y=\{a, b, c\}$  ，开集为  $\{a, b\},\{c\}, Y$  及  $\varnothing$ . 定义  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  为恒等映射. 显然,  f  在点  b  连续. 但对  Y  中的开集  $G=\{a, b\}, \bar{G}=   \{a, b\}$  ,而  X  中含有点  b  的开集为  $O=\{a, b\}$  或  $O=X$ , 其闭包都是  X , 故$f(\bar{O}) \not \subset \bar{G}$,即  f  在点  b  并不闭包连续.

statement: There exist non-measurable complete locally convex spaces.
chinese_statement: 存在不可度量化的超完备的局部凸空间.
rationale: Let $(F, \tau)$ be an infinite-dimensional locally convex Fréchet space, let $X=F^{\prime}$, and consider the Mackey topology $m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ on X. It can be shown that the locally convex space $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$ is complete. In fact, given any convex set S in $X^{\prime}$, it is $a w^{*}$ closed. We will prove that S is $\tau$ closed. Thus, since S is a convex set, $w^{*}$ closure of S equals $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ closure equals $\sigma\left(F, F^{\prime}\right)$ closure, proving that $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$ is complete. To show S is $\tau$ closed, consider any sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset S$ and $x_{n} \rightarrow x$. Let $E=\left\{x_{n}\right\} \cup\{x\}$, then E is a compact subset in $(F, \tau)$. Therefore, E is $\tau$ equicontinuous. Hence, $S \cap E$ is a $w^{*}$ closed set in E and thus a $\sigma\left(F, F^{\prime}\right)$ closed set, so $S \cap E$ is $\tau$ closed in E, implying $x \in S$. However, the locally convex space $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$ is not measurable.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(F, \tau)$  是无穷维的局部凸的 Fréchet 空间, 令  $X=F^{\prime}$ , 并在  X  上取 Mackey 拓扑  $m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ , 则可证局部凸空间  $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$ 是超完备的. 事实上, 任取  $X^{\prime}$  中的凸集  S , 它是  $a w^{*}$  闭的. 我们将要证明,  S  是  $\tau$  闭的. 于是, 因  S  是凸集, 故  S  的  $w^{*}  闭  =\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right) 闭  =\sigma\left(F, F^{\prime}\right)  闭$, 从面证明了  $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  是超完备的. 为证  S 是  $\tau$  闭的, 我们任取  $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset S$  且  $x_{n} \rightarrow x$ . 令  $E=\left\{x_{n}\right\} \cup\{x\}$ , 则  E  是  $(F, \tau)$  中的一个紧子集. 因此,  E  是  $\tau$  等度连续的. 于是,  $S \cap E$  是  E 中的  $w^{*}$  闭集,因而  $\sigma\left(F, F^{\prime}\right)$  闭集, 所以  $S \cap E$  在  E  中是  $\tau$  闭的, 故  $x \in S$ .但是, 局部凸空间  $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  不可度量化.

statement: There exists a non-first-countable space such that every cluster point of any set is the limit of some sequence within that set.
chinese_statement: 存在某个非第一可数空间, 使得每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限.
rationale: In a first-countable space, every cluster point of any set must be the limit of some sequence within that set. It should be noted that the converse of this proposition does not hold. For example: Let X be the set of natural numbers. For each natural number $p>1$, let an open neighborhood of p be $\{p\}$; for $p=1$, let an open neighborhood V of p contain 1 and exist as an infinite sequence of natural numbers $l_{1}, l_{2}$, \cdots, such that the other points in V are natural numbers of the form $2^{k}(2 l-1)$, where $k, l$ are natural numbers and $l>l_{k}$. It is evident that the open neighborhood thus defined determines a topology on X, making X a topological space. Obviously, X is also a Hausdorff space. (i) X is not a first-countable space. In fact, let $\left\{V_{n}\right\}$ be an infinite sequence of open sets containing 1, k is a given natural number. Since every neighborhood of 1 contains infinitely many elements of the set $\left\{2^{k}(2 l-\right.  1) \}_{i=1}^{+\infty}$, 1 is a cluster point of the set $\left\{2^{k}(2 l-1)\right\}_{l=1}^{+\infty}$, so there exists a natural number $l_{k}$ such that $2^{k}\left(2 l_{k}-1\right) \in V_{k}$. Let V be the set of all natural numbers of the form $2^{k}(2 l-1)$ and including 1, where $k=1, 2, \cdots$, and $l>l_{k}$, then V is a neighborhood of 1, and hence an open set. However, since $2^{k}\left(2 l_{k}-1\right) \notin V(k=1,2, \cdots)$, it follows that $V_{k} \backslash V \neq \varnothing(k=1,2, \cdots)$, thus X is not a first-countable space. (ii) Every cluster point of any set in X must be the limit of some sequence within that set. In fact, a set $A \subset X$ has a cluster point (element 1) if and only if there exists a natural number k, such that for infinitely many natural numbers l, we have $2^{k}(2 l-1) \in A$. Hence, there exist $l=m_{1}, m_{2}, \cdots$, such that $m_{1}<m_{2}<\cdots$, and $\lim _{i \rightarrow \infty} 2^{k}\left(2 m_{i}-1\right)=1$
chinese_rationale: 在第一可数空间中每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限. 应当注意, 这个命题之逆并不成立. 例如： 设  X 为自然数集, 对每个自然数  $p>1$ , 令  p  的开邻域为  $\{p\}$ ; 对  $p=1$ ,令  p  的开邻域  V  为含有 1 且存在自然数的无穷序列  $l_{1}, l_{2}$, \cdots , 使  V 中其余的点都是形如  $2^{k}(2 l-1)$  的自然数, 这里  $k, l$  均为自然数且  $l>l_{k}$ .易见, 这样定义的开邻域确定了  X  上的一个拓扑, 从而  X  为一拓扑空间. 显然,  X  还是一个 Hausdorff 空间.(i)  X  不是第一可数空间. 事实上, 设  $\left\{V_{n}\right\}$  是含有 1 的无限的开集序列,  k  是给定的自然数. 因为 1 的每个邻域含有  $\left\{2^{k}(2 l-\right.  1)  \}_{i=1}^{+\infty}$  的无穷多个元, 所以 1 是数集  $\left\{2^{k}(2 l-1)\right\}_{l=1}^{+\infty}$  的聚点，于是,存在自然数  $l_{k}$ , 使$2^{k}\left(2 l_{k}-1\right) \in V_{k}$ .令  V  为所有形如  $2^{k}(2 l-1)$  的自然数及 1 所成之集,这里  $k=1 ,  2, \cdots$ , 而  $l>l_{k}$ , 则  V  是 1 的一个邻域, 从而是开集. 但是, 由于$2^{k}\left(2 l_{k}-1\right) \notin V(k=1,2, \cdots)$,故  $V_{k} \backslash V \neq \varnothing(k=1,2, \cdots)$ , 可见  X  不是第一可数空间.（ii）  X  中每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限.事实上,集  $A \subset X$  具有聚点(元素 1 ) 当且仅当存在自然数  k , 使无穷多个自然数  l , 有$2^{k}(2 l-1) \in A$于是, 存在  $l=m_{1}, m_{2}, \cdots$ , 使  $m_{1}<m_{2}<\cdots$ , 且$\lim _{i \rightarrow \infty} 2^{k}\left(2 m_{i}-1\right)=1$

statement: There exists a topological space that is sequentially compact but not countably compact.
chinese_statement: 存在子集紧而不可数紧的拓扑空间.
rationale: Let X be the set of all natural numbers, and for each natural number n, define $U_{n}={2 n-1, 2 n}$. Then, $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$ is clearly a base for the topology on X, thus generating a topology on X. (i) The topological space X is sequentially compact. In fact, for each natural number n, the point $2 n$ is a limit point of the singleton set $\{2 n-1\}$, and the point $2 n-1$ is a limit point of the singleton set $\{2 n\}$. Therefore, every non-empty subset of X has at least one limit point, meaning that X is sequentially compact. (ii) The topological space X is not countably compact. In fact, $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$ is a countable open cover of X, but it has no finite subcover.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一切自然数所成之集, 对每一自然数  n , 命  $U_{n}=\{2 n-   1,2 n\}$ , 则  $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$  显然是  X  的一个拓扑基, 从而生成  X  上的一个拓扑.(i)拓扑空间  X  是子集紧的.事实上, 对于每个自然数  n , 点  $2 n$  是单点集  $\{2 n-1\}$  的一个聚点, 而点  $2 n-1$  是单点集  $\{2 n\}$  的一个聚点, 因而  X  的每个非空子集至少有一个聚点, 即  X  是子集紧的.(ii) 拓扑空间  X  不是可数紧的.事实上,  $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$  是  X  的一个可数开覆盖, 但它没有有限子覆盖.

statement: There exists a mapping from one topological space to another, which is both open and closed, but not continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间到另一个拓扑空间上的映射, 它是开的和闭的, 但不是连续的.
rationale: Let X be the unit circle $\left\{(x, y) \mid x^{2}+y^{2}=1\right\}$, Y be the half-open interval $[0,2 \pi)$, both equipped with the usual topology. Let the mapping f be $(x, y) \rightarrow \theta$, where $x= \cos \theta, y=\sin \theta, 0 \leqslant \theta<2 \pi$. (i) The mapping f is both open and closed. We only need to prove the inverse mapping $f^{-1}$ is continuous. Let $\theta_{n}, \theta \in Y$ and $\theta_{n} \rightarrow \theta(n \rightarrow \infty)$, then $\begin{aligned}\sqrt{\left(x_{n}-x\right)^{2}+\left(y_{n}-y\right)^{2}} & =\sqrt{\left(\cos \theta_{n}-\cos \theta\right)^{2}+\left(\sin \theta_{n}-\sin \theta\right)^{2}} \\& \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{aligned}$ Therefore, $(x, y)=f^{-1}(\theta)$ is continuous. (ii) The mapping f is not continuous at the point $(1,0)$. Let $\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right) \rightarrow(1,0)(n \rightarrow \infty)$, where $x_{n}=\cos \theta_{n}, y_{n}=\sin \theta_{n}$. Thus, $x_{n} \rightarrow 1, y_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. Since $\tan \theta_{n}=\frac{y_{n}}{x_{n}}, \theta_{n}=\operatorname{arccot} \frac{y_{n}}{x_{n}}$, so $\lim _{\substack{x_{n} \rightarrow 1 \\ y_{n} \rightarrow 0^{+}}} \theta_{n}=0, \lim _{\substack{x_{n} \rightarrow 1 \\ y_{n} \rightarrow 0^{-}}} \theta_{n}=2 \pi$, which shows that f is not continuous at the point $(1,0)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为单位圆周  $\left\{(x, y) \mid x^{2}+y^{2}=1\right\}$, Y  为半开区间  $[0,2 \pi)$ ,在  X  与  Y  上都取通常拓扑. 又设映射  f  为  $(x, y) \rightarrow \theta$ , 其中  $x=   \cos \theta, y=\sin \theta, 0 \leqslant \theta<2 \pi$ .(i) 映射  f  是既开又闭的.我们只要证明逆映射  $f^{-1}$  连续即可. 设  $\theta_{n}, \theta \in Y$  且  $\theta_{n} \rightarrow \theta(n \rightarrow   \infty  )$, 则$\begin{aligned}\sqrt{\left(x_{n}-x\right)^{2}+\left(y_{n}-y\right)^{2}} & =\sqrt{\left(\cos \theta_{n}-\cos \theta\right)^{2}+\left(\sin \theta_{n}-\sin \theta\right)^{2}} \\& \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{aligned}$因此,  $(x, y)=f^{-1}(\theta)$  是连续的.(ii) 映射  f  在点  $(1,0)$  不连续.设  $\left(x_{n}, y_{n}\right) \rightarrow(1,0)(n \rightarrow \infty)$ , 其中  $x_{n}=\cos \theta_{n}, y_{n}=\sin \theta_{n}$ . 于是得到  $x_{n} \rightarrow 1, y_{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ . 因为$\tan \theta_{n}=\frac{y_{n}}{x_{n}}, \theta_{n}=\operatorname{arccot} \frac{y_{n}}{x_{n}}$,所以$\lim _{\substack{x_{n} \rightarrow 1 \\ y_{n} \rightarrow 0^{+}}} \theta_{n}=0, \lim _{\substack{x_{n} \rightarrow 1 \\ y_{n} \rightarrow 0^{-}}} \theta_{n}=2 \pi$,这就说明了  f  在点  $(1,0)$  不连续.

statement: The closure of a compact set is necessarily compact.
chinese_statement: 紧集的闭包一定是紧集.
rationale: Let X be an infinite set, $a \in X$, define the open sets of X as the empty set and any subset containing the point a, then the single-point set $A=\{a\}$ is a compact set in the topological space X, but $\bar{A}=X$ is not compact.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一无限集,  $a \in X$ , 命  X  的开集为空集以及含点  a  的任意子集,则单点集  $A=\{a\}$  是拓扑空间  X  的紧集,但  $\bar{A}=X$  不是紧集.

With the usual linear operations, it remains a linear space. Let $P_{r}$ be the projection from $\prod_{r \in \Gamma} X_{r}$ to $X_{r}$. Lemma 1: If S is an absorbing set in the product space $\prod_{r \in \Gamma} X_{r}$, then $P_{r}(S) = X_{r}$ for all but finitely many r. Proof: Otherwise, there exists an infinite sequence $\{r(n)\}$ in $\Gamma$ such that $P_{r(n)}(S)

statement: There exists a map with a strongly closed image that is not weakly continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在某个具有强闭图像的映射, 它井不弱连续.
rationale: Let $X=[0,1]$ with the usual topology and $Y=[0,1]$, with the usual topology on the real numbers restricted to open sets along with the singleton set $\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$ as the subbase for Y. Clearly, the identity map $f: X \rightarrow Y$ has a strongly closed image. However, f is not weakly continuous at $x=\frac{1}{2}$ because for the open set $G=\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$ in Y, there is no open set O in X containing the point $\frac{1}{2}$ such that $f(O) \subset \bar{G}=\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=[0,1]$  并取通常拓扑;  $Y=[0,1]$ , 在  Y  上取实数集的通常拓扑的相对开集连同单点集  $\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$  作为  Y  的子基.显然, 恒等映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  具有强闭图像. 但  f  在  $x=\frac{1}{2}$  处并不弱连续, 这是因为对于  Y  中的开集  $G=\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$  而言;  X  中不存在含有点  $\frac{1}{2}$  的开集  O , 使  $f(O) \subset \bar{G}=\left\{\frac{1}{2}\right\}$ .

statement: There exists a K-quasi-barrel space that is not a K-barrel space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个  K  拟桶空间, 它不是  K  桶空间.
rationale: Let X be the linear space composed of all such sequences of complex numbers $x=\left\{x_{i}\right\}$, where only finitely many $x_{i}$ are non-zero. Considering the topology of pointwise convergence on X, then X is a metrizable locally convex space. Therefore, X is a quasi-barrel space, and consequently also a K-quasi-barrel space. Here we prove for any $K \geqslant 1$, X is not a K-barrel space. To do this, consider $U_{n}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in X|| x_{j} \mid \leqslant 1,1 \leqslant j \leqslant n\right\}$, each $U_{n}$ is a convex balanced closed neighborhood of the point o in X, and their intersection is a barrel in X. Let $\begin{array}{l}U(K)=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\{K^{n} U_{n}\right\}, K \geqslant 1, \\a_{n}=\mathrm{e}^{e^{n}}, a^{(n)}=\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{n}, 0,0, \cdots\right),\end{array}$ then $B=\left\{a^{(n)} \mid n=1,2, \cdots\right\}$ is a bounded subset in X. Because for any $K \geqslant 1$, B is not absorbed by $U(K)$, thus X is not a K-barrel space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一切这样的复数序列  $x=\left\{x_{i}\right\}$  所组成的线性空间, 其中只有有限个  $x_{i}$  不等于 0 . 在  X  上取逐点收敛拓扑, 则  X  为一可度量化的局部凸空间. 因此,  X  是拟桶空问, 从而也是  K  拟桶空间.兹证对任何  $K \geqslant 1$, X  不是  K  桶空间. 为此,我们考虑$U_{n}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in X|| x_{j} \mid \leqslant 1,1 \leqslant j \leqslant n\right\}$,则每个  $U_{n}$  是  X  中  o  点的凸的平衡闭邻域, 它们的交是  X  中的一个桶. 令$\begin{array}{l}U(K)=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}\left\{K^{n} U_{n}\right\}, K \geqslant 1, \\a_{n}=\mathrm{e}^{e^{n}}, a^{(n)}=\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{n}, 0,0, \cdots\right),\end{array}$则  $B=\left\{a^{(n)} \mid n=1,2, \cdots\right\}$  是  X  中的有界子集. 因对任何  $K \geqslant 1$, B  不被  $U(K)$  所吸收,故  X  不是  K  桶空间.

statement: There exist two linear topologies whose intersection is not a linear topology.
chinese_statement: 存在两个线性拓扑, 其交不是线性拓扑.
rationale: Given a linear space H with a Hausdorff topology (not necessarily a linear topology), a subspace X of H is called an $\boldsymbol{F H}$ space if X is a Fréchet space that can be continuously embedded into H, meaning the topology on X is stronger than the relative topology inherited from H. It is easy to prove that if $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ and $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ are both Fréchet spaces, and there exists a Hausdorff topology $\tau$ on X such that $\tau \subset \tau_{1}, \tau \subset \tau_{2}$, then it must be that $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$. In fact, since $\tau \subset \tau_{1}$, $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ is an F H space. Similarly, $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ is also an F H space. Since the $F H$ topology on X is unique, it follows that $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$. Now, take two unequal Fréchet topologies $\tau_{1}$ and $\tau_{2}$ on X, and let $\tau=\tau_{1} \cap \tau_{2}$, then $\tau \subset \tau_{1}, \tau \subset \tau_{2}$. If $\tau$ is a linear topology, then $\tau$ must be a Hausdorff topology. This implies $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$, which is a contradiction. Therefore, $\tau$ is not a linear topology.
chinese_rationale: 给定线性空间  H  并具有 Hausdorff 拓扑(不必为线性拓扑),  H  的子空间  X  称做  $\boldsymbol{F H}$  空间, 是指  X  是 Fréchet 空间且可连续嵌人到  H  内, 即  X  上的拓扑强于由  H  上的拓扑继承下来的相对拓扑.容易证明, 若  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  与  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  均为 Fréchet 空间, 且  X  上存在 Hausdorff 拓扑  $\tau$ , 使  $\tau \subset \tau_{1}, \tau \subset \tau_{2}$ , 则必有  $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$ . 事实上, 因为  $\tau \subset   \tau_{1}$ , 所以,  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  是  F H  空间. 同理,  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  也是  F H  空间. 由于  X 上的  $F H$  拓扑是唯一的, 因而  $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$ .今取  X  上两个不相等的 Fréchet 拓扑  $\tau_{1}$  与  $\tau_{2}$ , 并令  $\tau=\tau_{1} \cap \tau_{2}$ ,则  $\tau \subset \tau_{1}, \tau \subset \tau_{2}$ . 若  $\tau$  是线性拓扑, 则  $\tau$  必为 Hausdorff 拓扑. 于是得到  $\tau_{1}=\tau_{2}$ . 此为矛盾. 因此,  $\tau$  不是线性拓扑.

statement: There exists a family of completely regular spaces whose product space is not completely regular.
chinese_statement: 存在一族完备正规空间,其积空间并不完备正规.
rationale: Consider $I=[0,1]$ with the usual topology on I, then I is a completely regular space. However, the product space $I^I$ of uncountably many completely regular spaces I is not completely regular because single point sets in this space are closed but not $G_{\delta}$ sets. In fact, consider the set formed by the single point $f(x) \equiv 0$ in $I^I$. Let $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$ be a countable family of open neighborhoods of f, where $U_{n}=\bigcap\left\{P_{a}^{-1}\left(U_{a}^{(n)}\right) \mid a \in F_{n}\right\}$, with $U_{a}^{(n)}$ being open in $I_{a}$, a copy of I, and $F_{n}$ a finite subset of I, then $\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{n}=\bigcap\left\{P_{a}^{-1}\left(V_{a}\right) \mid a \in \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}\right\}$ contains o, where $V_{a}=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{a}^{(n)}$. For points a outside $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}$, let $g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x=a, \\0, x \neq a,\end{array}\right.$ then $g \in \bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{n}$. Therefore, the single point set $\{f\}$ cannot be expressed as the intersection of countably many open sets, i.e., $I^I$ is not completely regular.
chinese_rationale: 设  $I=[0,1]$ ,并在  I  上取通常拓扑,则  I  为一完备正规空间.然而，不可数个完备正规空间  I  的乘积空间  $I^{I}$  不是完备正规的，因为这个空间中的单元素集为闭集, 但不是  $G_{\delta }$  集. 事实上, 我们考虑  $I^{I}$  中的单元素  $f(x) \equiv 0$  所成之集. 设  $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$  是  f  的可数个开邻域,不妨设$U_{n}=\bigcap\left\{P_{a}^{-1}\left(U_{a}^{(n)}\right) \mid a \in F_{n}\right\}$,其中  $U_{a}^{(n)}$  为  $I_{a}$  中的开集,  $I_{a}$  为  I  的副本,  $F_{n}$  为  I  的有限子集, 则$\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{n}=\bigcap\left\{P_{a}^{-1}\left(V_{a}\right) \mid a \in \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}\right\}$为含  o  的集, 其中  $V_{a}=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{a}^{(n)}$ . 对  $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} F_{n}$  以外的点  a , 令$g(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, x=a, \\0, x \neq a,\end{array}\right.$则  $g \in \bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} U_{n}$ . 因此, 单元素集  $\{f\}$  不能表成可数个开集之交, 即  $I^{I}$ 并不完备正规.

statement: There exists a strongly locally compact space that is not compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个强局部紧空间, 它不是紧的.
rationale: For example, let X be an infinite set with the discrete topology, then X is strongly locally compact but not compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  X  为带有离散拓扑的无限集, 则  X  是强局部紧的, 但它不是紧的.

statement: There exists a non-metrizable compact separable Hausdorff space satisfying the first axiom of countability.
chinese_statement: 存在不可度量化的满足第一可数公理的可分的紧 Hausdorff 空间.
rationale: The Helly space H is defined as the set of all non-decreasing functions defined on the closed unit interval I and taking values within I. It is a subset of the product space $I^{I}$ and its topology is the relative product topology. (i) H is a compact Hausdorff space. In fact, for any $f \in I^{I} \backslash H$, there exist $x_{1}, x_{2} \in I, x_{1}<x_{2}$, such that $f\left(x_{1}\right)>f\left(x_{2}\right)$. Let $c=\left[f\left(x_{1}\right)+f\left(x_{2}\right)\right] / 2$, and set $U=[0, c), V=(c, 1]$, then $P_{x_{1}}^{-1}(V) \cap P_{x_{2}}^{-1}(U)$ is an open neighborhood of the point f in $I^{I}$. Obviously, $P_{x_{1}}^{-1}(V) \cap P_{x_{2}}^{-1}(U) \subset I^{I} \backslash H$, hence, $I^{I} \backslash H$ is an open set. Thus, H is a closed subset of $I^{I}$, and since I is a compact Hausdorff space, by Tychonoff's theorem, $I^{I}$ is also a compact Hausdorff space. Therefore, H is a compact Hausdorff space. (ii) H satisfies the first axiom of countability. Take any $h \in H$, since h is a non-decreasing function on I, its points of discontinuity are at most countable. Let $A=\left\{x_{i} \mid i \in N\right\}$ be the union of the set of points of discontinuity of h and the set of rational numbers in I, which is countable. Then let $V_{n}=\left\{f|| f\left(x_{i}\right)-h\left(x_{i}\right) \left\lvert\,<\frac{1}{n}\right.\right.  for  i=1,2, \cdots, n  hold  \} \cap H$. It is to be proved that $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$ is a countable neighborhood base of the point h in H. In fact, for any neighborhood of the form $W=P_{x}^{-1}(U) \cap H$ of h in H, where $U=(h(x)-\varepsilon, h(x)+\varepsilon) \cap I$. If $x \in A$, then there exists some $V_{n} \subset W$, if $x \notin A$, then h is continuous at x. Choose $x_{k}, x_{l} \in A$, such that $x_{k}<x<x_{l}$, and $h\left(x_{l}\right)-\frac{\varepsilon}{2}<h(x)<h\left(x_{k}\right)+\frac{\varepsilon}{2}$. Choose a natural number $n_{0}>\max \left\{k, l, \frac{2}{\varepsilon}\right\}$, then for any $f \in V_{n_{0}}$, we have $\begin{aligned}f(x)-h(x) & \leqslant f\left(x_{l}\right)-h(x) \\& \leqslant\left(f\left(x_{l}\right)-h\left(x_{l}\right)\right)+\left(h\left(x_{l}\right)-f(x)\right) \\& \leqslant \frac{1}{n_{0}}+\frac{\varepsilon}{2}<\varepsilon .\end{aligned}$ Similarly, $f(x)-h(x)>-\varepsilon$. Therefore, $f \in U$, i.e. $f \in W, V_{n_{0}} \subset W$, thus $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$ is a countable neighborhood base of h in H, so H satisfies the first axiom of countability. (iii) H is a separable space. Divide I into n equal left-closed subintervals, and define step functions on them that have rational values and are non-decreasing. Then, the family of all such non-decreasing functions $\mathscr{B}$ is countable. For any $f \in H$ and any neighborhood of f $V=\bigcap_{i=1}^{n} P_{x_{i}}^{-1}\left(U_{i}\right)$. Choose a sufficiently large natural number m, so that each left-closed interval $\left[\frac{i}{m}, \frac{i+1}{m}\right)$ contains at most one point $x_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$. For such m, the non-decreasing function $g \in V \cap \mathscr{B}$ which takes rational values $r_{i} \in U_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$ at points $x_{i}$ on $[0,1)$, so $\mathscr{B}$ is a countable dense subset of H, thus H is separable. (iv) H is non-metrizable. In fact, the set $A=\left\{f_{t}\right\} t \in I . \text { When } x<t \text { , } f_{t}(x)=0 \text {; }\left.f_{t}(t)=\frac{1}{2} \text {; when } x>t \text { , } f_{t}(x)=1 .\right\} \text {. }$ is an uncountable subset of H, because for any $f_{t} \in A$, the open neighborhood $P_{t}^{-1}(0,1)$ of $f_{\text {t }}$ contains only one point $f_{\mathrm{t}}$ in A, thus the dense subset of A can only be A itself. Therefore, A is non-separable. If H is a metrizable space, then, since H is compact, it must satisfy the second axiom of countability, and hence its subspace A must be separable, which is a contradiction. Therefore, H is a non-metrizable space.
chinese_rationale: Helly 空间  H  是指定义在单位闭区间  I  上并且取值于  I  内的所有非減函数组成之集,它是乘积空间  $I^{I}$  的一个子集并且它的拓扑是相对乘积拓扑.(i)  H  是紧的 Hausdorff 空间.事实上,对任一  $f \in I^{I} \backslash H$ , 有  $x_{1}, x_{2} \in I, x_{1}<x_{2}$ , 使$f\left(x_{1}\right)>f\left(x_{2}\right)$ .取  $c=\left[f\left(x_{1}\right)+f\left(x_{2}\right)\right] / 2$ , 并令  $U=[0, c), V=(c, 1]$ , 则  $P_{x_{1}}^{-1}(V) \cap   P_{x_{2}}^{-1}(U)$  是  $I^{I}$  中的点  f  的一个开邻域.易见,  $P_{x_{1}}^{-1}(V) \cap P_{x_{2}}^{-1}(U) \subset I^{I} \backslash H$ , 因此,  $I^{I} \backslash H$  是开集, 从而  H 是  $I^{I}$  的闭子集,因  I  是紧 Hausdorff 空间, 故由 Tychonoff 定理知  $I^{I}$  也是紧 Hausdorff 空间. 由此可见,  H  是紧 Hausdorff 空间.(ii)  H  满足第一可数公理.任取  $h \in H$ , 因  h  是  I  上的非減函数,故其不连续点至多可数,令  $A=\left\{x_{i} \mid i \in N\right\}$  是  h  的不连续点所成之集与  I  中的有理数所成之集的并集,它是一个可数集. 再令 $V_{n}=\left\{f|| f\left(x_{i}\right)-h\left(x_{i}\right) \left\lvert\,<\frac{1}{n}\right.\right.  对  i=1,2, \cdots, n  都成立  \} \cap H$ .兹证  $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$  是  H  中的点  h  的可数邻域基.事实上, 对  H  中  h  的任一形如  $W=P_{x}^{-1}(U) \cap H$  的邻域, 其中$U=(h(x)-\varepsilon, h(x)+\varepsilon) \cap I$ .如果  $x \in A$ , 则显然有某一个  $V_{n} \subset W$ , 如果  $x \notin A$ , 则  h  在  x  处连续,取  $x_{k}, x_{l} \in A$ , 使  $x_{k}<x<x_{l}$ , 且$h\left(x_{l}\right)-\frac{\varepsilon}{2}<h(x)<h\left(x_{k}\right)+\frac{\varepsilon}{2}$ .取自然数  $n_{0}>\max \left\{k, l, \frac{2}{\varepsilon}\right\}$ , 则对任一  $f \in V_{n_{0}}$ , 有$\begin{aligned}f(x)-h(x) & \leqslant f\left(x_{l}\right)-h(x) \\& \leqslant\left(f\left(x_{l}\right)-h\left(x_{l}\right)\right)+\left(h\left(x_{l}\right)-f(x)\right) \\& \leqslant \frac{1}{n_{0}}+\frac{\varepsilon}{2}<\varepsilon .\end{aligned}$同样, 有  $f(x)-h(x)>-\varepsilon$ . 因此,  $f \in U$ , 即  $f \in W, V_{n_{0}} \subset W$ , 从而  $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$  是  H  中  h  的可数邻域基, 故  H  满足第一可数公理.(iii)  H  是可分空间.将  I  分成  n  个长度相等的左闭的小区间, 并在其上定义函数值为有理数的不减的阶梯函数, 于是, 所有这种不减函数所成的函数族  $\mathscr{B}$  是可数的,任取  $f \in H$  及  f  的任一邻域$V=\bigcap_{i=1}^{n} P_{x_{i}}^{-1}\left(U_{i}\right)$取自然数  m  充分大, 使每个左闭区间  $\left[\frac{i}{m}, \frac{i+1}{m}\right)$  中至多只含一个点  $x_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$ . 对于这样的  m , 区间  $[0,1)$  上在点  $x_{i}$  取值有理数  $r_{i} \in U_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$  的不减函数  $g \in V \cap \mathscr{B}$ , 故  $\mathscr{B}$  为  H  中的可数稠密子集,即  H  是可分的.(iv)  H  不可度量化.事实上,集$A=\left\{f_{t}\right\} t \in I . \text { 当 } x<t \text { 时, } f_{t}(x)=0 \text {; }\left.f_{t}(t)=\frac{1}{2} \text {; 当 } x>t \text { 时, } f_{t}(x)=1 .\right\} \text {. }$是  H  的不可数的子集, 因对任一  $f_{t} \in A$, $f_{\text {t }}$  的开邻域  $P_{t}^{-1}(0,1)$  只有  A  中的一个点  $f_{\mathrm{t}}$ , 故  A  的稠密子集只有  A  本身. 因此,  A  不可分, 假如  H  是可度量化的空间, 那么, 由于  H  是紧的,因而  H  必定满足第二可数公理, 从而其子空间  A  必定可分, 矛盾. 可见  H 是不可度量化的空间.

statement: Let $\left\{A_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$ be a family of semi-open sets in a topological space $(X, \tau)$. If $\left\{A_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$ is a cover of X, it is called a semi-open cover or S-cover of X. A topological space X is called S-closed if for every S-cover $\left\{U_{\alpha}\right\}$, there exists a finite subset $\left\{U_{\alpha_{i}}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$ such that $X \subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} \bar{U}_{\alpha{i}}$. There exists some S-closed space whose subspace is not S-closed.
chinese_statement: 设  $\left\{A_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$  是拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  中的一些半开集组成的集族.若  $\left\{A_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$  是  X  的一个覆盖, 则称  $\left\{A_{\alpha} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$  是  X  的一个半开覆盖或  S  覆盖.拓扑空间  X  称做  S  闭的, 是指  X  的每个  S  覆盖  $\left\{U_{\alpha}\right\}$ , 存在有限子集  $\left\{U_{\alpha_{i}}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$ , 使得$X \subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{n} \bar{U}_{\alpha{i}}$. 存在某个  S  闭空间, 它的一个子空间不是  S  闭的.
rationale: Here is an example: Let X be the set of real numbers $\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}$, and define non-empty open sets as $X \backslash C$, where C is any at most countable subset of X (it can be empty), forming a topology on X. Obviously, X is S-closed. Let $A=\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}, \cdots\right\}$ be a countable subspace of X, then A is closed. For each $x_{i} \in A$, since $G=X \backslash\left\{A \backslash\left\{x_{i}\right\}\right\}$ is an open set in X, $A \backslash\left\{x_{i}\right\}$ is closed in subspace A, thus the singleton set $\left\{x_{i}\right\}$ is open in A, making A a discrete subspace. Therefore, A is not an S-closed subspace.
chinese_rationale: 栗延龄有例如下:设  X  是实数集  $\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}$ , 命非空开集为  $X \backslash C$ , 其中  C  是  X  的任一至多可数集(可以是空集)，如此确定的开集全体形成  X 的一个拓扑. 显然,  X  是  S  闭的.设  $A=\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}, \cdots\right\}$  是  X  的可数子空间, 则  A  是闭的. 对于每个  $x_{i} \in A$ , 因为$G=X \backslash\left\{A \backslash\left\{x_{i}\right\}\right\}$是  X  的开集, 所以  $A \backslash\left\{x_{i}\right\}$  是子空间  A  的闭集,于是单点集  $\left\{x_{i}\right\}$  是  A  的开集, 从而  A  是离散子空间. 由此可知,  A  不是  S  闭子空间.

statement: There exist two countably compact spaces whose product space is not countably compact.
chinese_statement: 存在两个可数紧空间,其积空间并不可数紧.
rationale: For example, let N be the set of natural numbers with the discrete topology. $\beta N$ is the Stone-Cech compactification of N. Novak proved that there exist countably compact subsets E and F of $\beta N$, such that $E \cup F=\beta N$ and $E \cap F=N$. Consider the product space $X=E \times F$. Let $H=\{(n, n) \mid n \in N\}$, then H is a closed subset of X with the discrete topology. Therefore, X is not countably compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  N  是自然数集,并在  N  上取离散拓扑.  $\beta N$  是  N  的 Stone-Cech 紧化. Novak证明了存在  $\beta N$  的可数紧子集  E  与  F , 使$E \cup F=\beta N, E \cap F=N$ .作乘积空间  $X=E \times F$ . 令  $H=\{(n, n) \mid n \in N\}$ , 则  H  是  X  的闭子集,且具有离散拓扑. 因此,  X  不是可数紧的.

statement: There exist two different topologies on a linear space that have the same closed subspaces.
chinese_statement: 存在某个线性空间上的两个不同拓扑, 它们具有相同的闭子空间.
rationale: Let $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ be an infinite-dimensional normed linear space, then the norm topology is strictly stronger than the weak topology $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$. It is shown that for any linear subspace M of X, M is a closed subspace of $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ if and only if it is a closed subspace of $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$. In fact, if M is a closed subspace of $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$, then it is obviously a closed subspace of $(X,\|\cdot\|)$. Conversely, let M be a closed subspace of $(X,\|\cdot\|)$, $x_{0} \notin M$, then $d\left(x_{0}, M\right)=\delta>0$. By the Hahn-Banach theorem, there exists $f \in X^{\prime}$ such that $f\left(x_{0}\right) \neq 0, f(x)=0$ when $x \in M$. Choose $\varepsilon_{0}=\left|f\left(x_{0}\right)\right| / 2$, and form a weak neighborhood $V=\left\{x \in X || f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right) \mid<\varepsilon_{0}\right\}$ of $x_{0}$. Clearly, $V \cap M=\varnothing$, so $x_{0}$ is not a weak limit point of M. From this, it is known that M contains all its weak limit points. Therefore, M is a closed subspace of $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  是一个无穷维赋范线性空间, 则范数拓扑严格强于弱拓扑  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ .兹证, 对  X  的任一线性子空间  M, M  为  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  的闭子空间当且仅当它是  $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right.  )$的闭子空间. 事实上, 若  M  是  $(X, \sigma   \left.\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  的闭子空间, 则它显然是  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  的闭子空间. 反之, 设  M  为  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  的闭子空间,  $x_{0} \notin M$ , 则  $d\left(x_{0}, M\right)=\delta>0$ . 由 Hahn-Banach 定理, 存在  $f \in X^{\prime}$ , 使  $f\left(x_{0}\right) \neq 0, f(x)=0$  当  $x \in M$  时. 取  $\varepsilon_{0}=\left|f\left(x_{0}\right)\right| / 2$ , 并作  $x_{0}$  的弱邻域$V=\left\{x \in X || f(x)-f\left(x_{0}\right) \mid<\varepsilon_{0}\right\}$ .显然,  $V \cap M=\varnothing$ , 故  $x_{0}$  不是  M  的弱聚点. 由此可知,  M  包含了它的所有弱聚点. 因此,  M  是  $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  的闭子空间.

statement: There exists a subset B of a normed linear space X such that B is totally bounded in the $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ topology but not totally bounded in the norm topology.
chinese_statement: 存在某个赋范线性空间  X  的子集  B , 使  B  是  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$  全有界而不范数拓扑全有界.
rationale: Let X be an infinite-dimensional normed linear space, and let $B=\{x \mid\|x\| \leqslant 1\}$, then B is bounded in the $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ topology. Since $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$ is a $BTB$ space, B is also totally bounded in the $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ topology. However, B is not totally bounded in the norm topology.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一无穷维赋范线性空间, 令$B=\{x \mid\|x\| \leqslant 1\}$,则  B  是  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$  有界的. 因  $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  为一 $BTB$ 空间, 故  B  也是  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$  全有界的. 但是,  B  并不范数拓扑全有界.

statement: There exists a mapping f from a topological space X to Y that is a semi-homeomorphism, but its restriction $f \mid A$ on some subset A of X is not a semi-homeomorphism from A to $f(A)$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个由拓扑空间  X  到  Y  上的半同胚映射  f , 它在  X 的某个子集  A  上的限  $f \mid A$  不是  A  到  $f(A)$  上的半同胚眏射.
rationale: The following example was made by Tuo-Ying Guo. Let $X=\{1,2,3,4\}$, and then let $\begin{array}{l}\tau=\{\varnothing, X,\{1\}\}, \\\sigma=\{\varnothing, X,\{1\},\{1,2\},\{1,3\},\{1,2,3\}\} .\end{array}$ Let $f:(X, \tau) \rightarrow(X, \sigma)$ be the identity mapping, then f is a semi-homeomorphism. Choose $A=\{2 , 3\}$, then $\tau|A=\{\varnothing,\{2,3\}\}, \sigma| f(A)=\{\varnothing,\{2,3\},\{2\},\{3\}\}$. It is obvious that $f \mid A$ is not a semi-homeomorphism.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子是由郭驼英    作出的.设  $X=\{1,2,3,4\}$ , 再设$\begin{array}{l}\tau=\{\varnothing, X,\{1\}\}, \\\sigma=\{\varnothing, X,\{1\},\{1,2\},\{1,3\},\{1,2,3\}\} .\end{array}$令  $f:(X, \tau) \rightarrow(X, \sigma)$  是恒等映射, 则  f  是半同胚映射. 取  $A=\{2 ,  3\}$ , 则$\tau|A=\{\varnothing,\{2,3\}\}, \sigma| f(A)=\{\varnothing,\{2,3\},\{2\},\{3\}\}$ .显然,  $f \mid A$  不是半同胚映射.

statement: There exists a separable metric space that is nowhere locally compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个可分的度量空间, 它无处局部紧.
rationale: The following example is given by Duncan. Let X be the set of all strictly increasing infinite sequences of natural numbers such that for each $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$, the limit $\delta(A)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} A(n) / n$ exists, where $A(n)$ represents the number of elements in A that are $\leqslant n$, $\delta(A)$ is called the density of A. For $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$ and $B=\left\{b_{n}\right\} \in X$, the distance between A and B is defined as $d(A, B)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / k+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)| & , A \neq B, \\0  & , A=B,\end{array}\right.$ i.e., for any n, $a_{n}=b_{n}$. (i) $(X, d)$ is a metric space. Clearly, $d(A, B) \geqslant 0$, and $d(A, B)=0$ if and only if $A=B, d(A, B) =d(B, A)$. Let $\begin{array}{l}d(A, C)=1 / k_{1}+|\delta(A)-\delta(C)|, \\d(A, B)=1 / k_{2}+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|, \\d(B, C)=1 / k_{3}+|\delta(B)-\delta(C)|.\end{array}$ If $d(A, B)$ or $d(B, C)$ is 0, then $d(A, C)$ equals the other. Furthermore, if $k_{1} \geqslant \min \left\{k_{2}, k_{3}\right\}$, then $\frac{1}{k_{1}} \leqslant \frac{1}{k_{2}}+\frac{1}{k_{3}}$. Hence, the triangle inequality holds as $|\delta(A)-\delta(C)| \leqslant|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|+|\delta(B)-\delta(C)|$. Therefore, $(X, d)$ is a metric space. (ii) The metric space $(X, d)$ is separable. For each rational number $r(0 \leqslant r \leqslant 1)$, choose a sequence with density r, $\left\{a_{r, n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$, let $S_{r, p}$ denote the family of sequences of the form $\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{L}, a_{r, p+1}, a_{r, p+2}, \cdots\right\}$. Clearly, every sequence in $S_{r, p}$ also has density r. Given the definition of $S_{r, p}$, $\bigcup_{p} S_{r, p}$ is countable. Therefore, $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$ is also countable. To prove $(X, d)$ is separable, it suffices to show that $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$ is dense in X. For this, take any $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$. For each $\varepsilon>0$, there exists a rational number r such that $|\delta(A)-r|<\varepsilon / 2$. Choose $k>2 / \varepsilon$, then for sufficiently large p, $S_{r, p}$ will contain the sequence $B=\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{k}, a_{r, p+1}, a_{r, p+2}, \cdots\right\}$. Thus, $\begin{aligned}d(A, B) & \leqslant 1 / k+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)| \\& <\varepsilon / 2+\varepsilon / 2=\varepsilon.\end{aligned}$ Therefore, $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$ is dense in X. (iii) The metric space $(X, d)$ is nowhere locally compact. Take any $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$, let $U=\{B \in X \mid d(A, B)<\varepsilon, 0<\varepsilon<1\}$. Choose $B=\left\{b_{x}\right\} \in X$ such that $|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|=\varepsilon / 2$. Let $n_{k}$ be the smallest n such that $a_{k}<b_{n}$ holds, and let $A_{k}=\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{k}, b_{n_{k}}, b_{x_{k+1}}, \cdots\right\}$, then $\delta\left(A_{k}\right)=\delta(B)$. Therefore, $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$ is a Cauchy sequence, and since $d\left(A_{k}, A\right) \leqslant 1 / k+\left|\delta\left(A_{k}\right)-\delta(A)\right|=1 / k+\varepsilon / 2$, for each $-k>2 / \varepsilon$, $A_{k} \in U$. Since $d\left(A_{k}, A\right)>\left|\delta\left(A_{k}\right)-\delta(A)\right|=\varepsilon / 2$, A is not a cluster point of $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$. Furthermore, $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$ cannot have a cluster point different from A, indicating $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$ has no cluster points. Let V be any open set containing the point A, then for sufficiently small $\varepsilon$, we have $U \subset V \subset \bar{V}$. However, because $\left\{A_{k}\right\} \subset U$ and $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$ has no cluster points, $\bar{V}$ is not compact. Thus, $(X, d)$ is nowhere locally compact.
chinese_rationale: 下面的例子是由 Duncan作出的.设  X  是一切自然数的严格单增的无穷序列所组成的序列族，使对每一  $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$ , 极限$\delta(A)=\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} A(n) / n$存在, 这里  $A(n)$  代表  A  中  $\leqslant n$  的元素的数目,  $\delta(A)$  称为  A  的密度，对  $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$  与  $B=\left\{b_{n}\right\} \in X$ , 定义  A  与  B  之间的距离为$d(A, B)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1 / k+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)| & , A \neq B, \\0  & , A=B,\end{array}\right.$即对任意  n , 有  $a_{n}=b_{n}$ .(i)  $(X, d)$  是度量空间.显然,  $d(A, B) \geqslant 0$ , 又,  $d(A, B)=0$  当且仅当  $A=B, d(A, B)   =d(B, A)$ . 令$\begin{array}{l}d(A, C)=1 / k_{1}+|\delta(A)-\delta(C)|, \\d(A, B)=1 / k_{2}+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|, \\d(B, C)=1 / k_{3}+|\delta(B)-\delta(C)| .\end{array}$若  $d(A, B)$  或  $d(B, C)$  之一为 0 , 则  $d(A, C)$  就等于其中的另一个.又, 若  $k_{1} \geqslant \min \left\{k_{2}, k_{3}\right\}$ , 则$\frac{1}{k_{1}} \leqslant \frac{1}{k_{2}}+\frac{1}{k_{3}}$.因此, 由  $|\delta(A)-\delta(C)| \leqslant|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|+|\delta(B)-\delta(C)|$  知三角不等式成立. 可见  $(X, d)$  是度量空间.(ii)度量空间  $(X, d)$  是可分的.对每一有理数  $r(0 \leqslant r \leqslant 1)$ , 选取一个具有密度为  r  的序列  $\left\{a_{r, n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ , 我们用  $S_{r, p}$  代表形如$\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{L}, a_{r, p+1}, a_{r, p+2}, \cdots\right\}$的序列所组成的序列族. 显然,  $S_{r, p}$  中的每个序列也具有密度  r . 据  $S_{r, p}$  的定义,  $\bigcup_{p} S_{r, p}$  是可数的. 因此,  $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$  也是可数的.为证  $(X, d)$  可分, 只要证明,  $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$  在  X  中稠密即可. 为此, 任取  $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$ . 对每一 $\varepsilon>0$ , 存在有理数  r , 使$|\delta(A)-r|<\varepsilon / 2$ .选取  $k>2 / \varepsilon$ , 则当  p  充分大时,  $S_{r, p}$  将包含序列$B=\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{k}, a_{r, p+1}, a_{r, p+2}, \cdots\right\}$ .于是得到$\begin{aligned}d(A, B) & \leqslant 1 / k+|\delta(A)-\delta(B)| \\& <\varepsilon / 2+\varepsilon / 2=\varepsilon .\end{aligned}$因此,  $\bigcup_{r, p} S_{r, p}$  在  X  中稠密.(iii)度量空间  $(X, d)$  是无处局部紧的.任取  $A=\left\{a_{n}\right\} \in X$ , 令$U=\{B \in X \mid d(A, B)<\varepsilon, 0<\varepsilon<1\}$ .选取  $B=\left\{b_{x}\right\} \in X$ , 使$|\delta(A)-\delta(B)|=\varepsilon / 2$ .设  $n_{k}$  是使  $a_{k}<b_{n}$  成立的最小值  n , 并令$A_{k}=\left\{a_{1}, a_{2}, \cdots, a_{k}, b_{n_{k}}, b_{x_{k+1}}, \cdots\right\}$,则  $\delta\left(A_{k}\right)=\delta(B)$ . 因此,  $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$  是一个 Cauchy 序列, 因$d\left(A_{k}, A\right) \leqslant 1 / k+\left|\delta\left(A_{k}\right)-\delta(A)\right|=1 / k+\varepsilon / 2$,故对每  $-k>2 / \varepsilon$ , 有  $A_{k} \in U$ . 由于$d\left(A_{k}, A\right)>\left|\delta\left(A_{k}\right)-\delta(A)\right|=\varepsilon / 2$,因而  A  不是  $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$  的聚点. 又,  $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$  不能有异于  A  的聚点, 可见  $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$ 没有聚点.设  V  是含有点  A  的任一开集,则当  $\varepsilon$  充分小时,就有$U \subset V \subset \bar{V}$ .而  $\left\{A_{k}\right\} \subset U$  且  $\left\{A_{k}\right\}$  没有聚点, 可见  $\bar{V}$  不是紧的, 即  $(X, d)$  是无处局部紧的.

statement: There exist two compact sets in a certain topological space whose intersection is not compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间中的两个紧集,其交不是紧集.
rationale: Let Y be the set of real numbers with the usual topology, Z be the set {$0,1$} with the trivial topology, and $X=Y \times Z$ with the product topology. Define $\begin{array}{l}A=\{[a, b] \times\{0\}\} \cup\{(a, b) \times\{1\}\}, \\B=\{(a, b) \times\{0\}\rangle \cup\{[a, b] \times\{1\}\} .\end{array}$ We note that open sets of X take the form $(c, d) \times \varnothing$ or $(c, d) \times\{0,1\}$. Therefore, if an open set G of X contains the point $x=(y, 0)$, then G must also contain the point $(y, 1)$. Let Y be the set of real numbers with the usual topology, Z be the set {$0,1$} with the trivial topology, and $X=Y \times Z$ with the product topology. Define $\begin{array}{l}A=\{[a, b] \times\{0\}\} \cup\{(a, b) \times\{1\}\}, \\B=\{(a, b) \times\{0\}\rangle \cup\{[a, b] \times\{1\}\} .\end{array}$ We note that open sets of X take the form $(c, d) \times \varnothing$ or $(c, d) \times\{0,1\}$. Therefore, if an open set G of X contains the point $x=(y, 0)$, then G must also contain the point $(y, 1)$. (i) Both A and B are compact subsets of X. Consider any open cover $\bigcup_\alpha G_{\alpha}$ of A, where each open set $G_{\alpha}$ has the form $\left(c_{\alpha}, d_{\alpha}\right) \times\{0,1\}$. Since $[a, b]$ is a closed interval, we can choose a finite number of open sets $\left(c_{i}, d_{i}\right) \times \{0,1\}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$ that cover $[a, b] \times\{0\}$. By the previous observation, $\left(c_{i}, d_{i}\right) \times\{0,1\}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$ also covers $(a, b) \times\{1\}$, thus covering A, making A compact. Similarly, B is also compact. (ii) $A \cap B$ is not compact. Since $A \cap B=(a, b) \times\{0,1\}$, and $(a, b)$ is not a compact subset of Y, $A \cap B$ is also not a compact subset of X.
chinese_rationale: 设  Y  是实数集并取通常拓扑,  Z  是点集  $\{0,1\}$  并取平庸拓扑, $X=Y \times Z$  并取乘积拓扑.令$\begin{array}{l}A=\{[a, b] \times\{0\}\} \cup\{(a, b) \times\{1\}\}, \\B=\{(a, b) \times\{0\}\rangle \cup\{[a, b] \times\{1\}\} .\end{array}$我们注意,  X  的开集具有形式  $(c, d) \times \varnothing$  或  $(c, d) \times\{0,1\}$ . 因此, 假若  X  的开集  G  含有点  $x=(y, 0)$ , 那么  G  也一定含有点  $(y, 1)$ .设  Y  是实数集并取通常拓扑,  Z  是点集  $\{0,1\}$  并取平庸拓扑, $ X=Y \times Z$  并取乘积拓扑。令$\begin{array}{l}A=\{[a, b] \times\{0\}\} \cup\{(a, b) \times\{1\}\}, \\B=\{(a, b) \times\{0\}\rangle \cup\{[a, b] \times\{1\}\} .\end{array}$我们注意,  X  的开集具有形式  $(c, d) \times \varnothing$  或  $(c, d) \times\{0,1\}$ . 因此, 假若  X  的开集  G  含有点  $x=(y, 0)$ , 那么  G  也一定含有点  $(y, 1)$ .(i)  A  与  B  都是  X  的紧子集.任取  A  的一个开覆盖  $\bigcup_\alpha   G_{\alpha}$ , 其中每个开集  $G_{\alpha }$  都具有形式  $\left(c_{\alpha}\right. ,  \left.d_{\alpha}\right) \times\{0,1\}$ . 因  $[a, b]$  是闭区间, 故可选出有限多个开集  $\left(c_{i}, d_{i}\right) \times   \{0,1\}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$ , 它们已经覆盖了  $[a, b] \times\{0\}$ . 又据前面的注意,  $\left(c_{i}, d_{i}\right) \times\{0,1\}(i=1,2, \cdots, n)$  也覆盖了  $(a, b) \times\{1\}$ , 从而它们就覆盖了  A , 即  A  是紧的. 同理可证  B  也是紧的.(ii)  $A \cap B$  不是紧的.因  $A \cap B=(a, b) \times\{0,1\}$ , 而  $(a, b)$  不是  Y  的紧子集，故  $A \cap B$ 也不是  X  的紧子集.

statement: The quotient space of a regular space must be a regular space.
chinese_statement: 正则空间的商空间必是正则空间.
rationale: Let X be a regular space, but it is not a normal space. Thus, there exist closed sets A and B in X such that $A \cap B = \varnothing$, but they cannot be separated by open sets. Let $\Delta = \{(x, x) \mid x \in X\}, M = \Delta \bigcup (A \times A)$. Since X is a regular space, it is also a Hausdorff space, so $\Delta$ is a closed subset of $X \times X$. Also, since A is a closed set in X, $A \times A$ is a closed subset of $X \times X$. Therefore, M is a closed subset of $X \times X$. Let $Y = X / M$, that is, the points of Y are A and $\{\{x\} \mid x \in X \backslash A\}$. Since the points A and the closed set $\{\{x\} \mid x \in B\}$ in Y cannot be separated by open sets, Y is not a regular space. Note: The quotient space of a $T_{1}$ space (Hausdorff space, completely regular space, normal space) may not be a $T_{1}$ space (Hausdorff space, completely regular space, normal space).
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一正则空间, 但它不是正规空间. 于是, 存在  X  的闭集  $A, B$ , 使  $A \cap B=\varnothing$ , 但不能用开集分离. 令$\Delta=\{(x, x) \mid x \in X\},M=\Delta \bigcup(A \times A)$ .因  X  是正则空间, 从而也是 Hausdorff 空间, 故  $\Delta$  为  $X \times X$  的闭子集. 又,  A  量  X  的闭集,故  $A \times A$  是  $X \times X$  的闭子集. 因此,  M  是  $X \times X$  的闭子集. 令$Y=X / M$,即  Y  的点是  A  及  $\{\{x\} \mid x \in X \backslash A\}$ . 因  Y  中的点  A  及闭集  $\{\{x\} \mid x \in   B\}$  不能用开集分离,故  Y  不是正则空间.注： $T_{1}$  空间(Hausdorff 空间, 完全正则空间,正规空间)的商空间也未必是  $T_{1}$  空间 (Hausdorff 空间, 完全正则空间, 正规空间).

statement: There exists a topological space that is locally compact but not strongly locally compact.
chinese_statement: 存在局部紧而不强局部紧的拓扑空间.
rationale: Example: Let N be the set of natural numbers, and let $\begin{array}{c}A_{n}=\{n\} \times N \times\{1\}, n=1,2, \cdots, \\B_{1}=\varnothing, B_{n}=\{(n, 1,2),(n, 2,2), \cdots,(n, n-1,2)\}, \\n=2,3, \cdots .\end{array}$ Then let $\quad C_{n}=A_{n} \cup B_{n}, n=1,2, \cdots , X=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} C_{n}$. Take the topology of X to have a base of all such sets C, such that for some n, $C \subset C_{n}$ and $C_{n} \backslash C$ is finite. Therefore, X is strongly locally compact and X is a $T_{1}$ space. Let $Y=(N \times\{1\}) \cup(N \times\{2\})$, and consider the topology $\tau$ on Y as follows: $\tau=\{C \subset Y \mid(N \times\{1\}) \backslash C \text { is a finite set }\} \cup\{\varnothing\} \text {. }$ The topological space Y is a $T_{1}$ space. Since the closure of every non-empty open set in Y is the entire space, it is not compact, so Y is not strongly locally compact. However, Y is obviously locally compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 设  N  为自然数集,令$\begin{array}{c}A_{n}=\{n\} \times N \times\{1\}, n=1,2, \cdots, \\B_{1}=\varnothing, B_{n}=\{(n, 1,2),(n, 2,2), \cdots,(n, n-1,2)\}, \\n=2,3, \cdots .\end{array}$再令  $\quad C_{n}=A_{n} \cup B_{n}, n=1,2, \cdots  ，X=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} C_{n}$ .取  X  的拓扑基为所有这样的集  C , 使对某个  n, $C \subset C_{n}$  且  $C_{n} \backslash C$ 是有限集. 于是,  X  是强局部紧的,且  X  是  $T_{1}$  空间. 令$Y=(N \times\{1\}) \cup(N \times\{2\})$,并在  Y  上取拓扑  $\tau$  如下:$\tau=\{C \subset Y \mid(N \times\{1\}) \backslash C \text { 是有限集 }\} \cup\{\varnothing\} \text {. }$拓扑空间  Y  是  $T_{1}$  空间. 因为  Y  的每个非空开集的闭包是整个空间, 它不是紧的, 所以  Y  不是强局部紧的. 然而,  Y  显然是局部紧的.

statement: There exists a locally convex Fréchet space that is not a Banach space.
chinese_statement: 存在一个局部凸的 Fréchet 空间, 它不是 Banach 空间.
rationale: Let $R_{n}$ be a copy of the real line with the usual topology. Let $X=\prod_{n=1}^{\infty} R_{n}$, and take the product topology on X. Then X is a locally convex Fréchet space. However, X is not a Banach space because the product of Banach spaces is still a Banach space if and only if the factors in the product are finite.
chinese_rationale: 设  $R_{n}$  为带有通常拓扑的实直线的副本, 令$X=\prod_{n=1}^{\infty} R_{n}$,并在  X  上取乘积拓扑, 则  X  为一局部凸的 Fréchet 空间. 但  X  不是 Banach 空间,因为 Banach 空间的乘积仍为 Banach 空间当且仅当乘积中的因子是有限多个.

statement: There exist two comparable but not equal norms on a certain linear space, such that the strong norm is a barrelled space while the weak norm is a Banach space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个线性空间上两个可以比较而不相等的范数, 使强范数是桶空间而弱范数是 Banach 空间.
rationale: Let $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ be an infinite-dimensional Banach space, and let f be a discontinuous linear functional on X. $X_{0}$ is the kernel of f, i.e., $X_{0}=\{x \in X \mid f(x)=0\}$. Let $x \in X$ such that $f(x)=1$ and $\|x\|=1$, and consider the normed linear space $\left(X_{0} \oplus [x], p\right)$, where $[x]$ represents the one-dimensional subspace generated by x, and p is the norm on $X_{0} \oplus [x]$ determined by the following equation: $p(y+\lambda x)=\|y\|+|\lambda|\left(y \in X_{0}\right)$. Obviously, the norm p is strictly stronger than the norm $\|\cdot\|$. According to Dieudonné^{[50]}, $X_{0}$ is a barrelled space, and therefore $X_{0} \oplus [x]$ is also a barrelled space. Since $X_{0}$ has codimension 1 in X, we can view X as $X_{0} \oplus [x]$. Thus, we obtain $(X_{0} \oplus [x], \|\cdot\|)$ is a Banach space while $(X_{0} \oplus [x], p)$ is a barrelled space (not a Banach space).
chinese_rationale: 设  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  是无穷维 Banach 空间,  f  是  X  上的不连续线性泛函,  $X_{0}$  是  f  的核，即$X_{0}=\{x \in X \mid f(x)=0\}$ .设  $x \in X$  使  $f(x)=1$  且  $\|x\|=1$ , 并考虑赋范线性空间  $\left(X_{0} \oplus\right.   [x], p)$ ,这里  $[x]$  代表由  x  生成的一维子空间,  p  是由下列等式确定的  $X_{0} \oplus[x]$  上的范数：$p(y+\lambda x)=\|y\|+|\lambda|\left(y \in X_{0}\right)$ .显然, 范数  p  严格强于范数  $\|\cdot\| \cdot$ . 据 Dieudonné  { }^{[50]}  知,  $X_{0}$  是桶空间, 从而  $X_{0} \oplus[x]$  也是桶空间. 因  $X_{0}$  在  X  中的余维数为 1 , 故我们可把  X  视为  $X_{0} \oplus[x]$ . 于是, 我们得到 $(  \left.X_{0} \oplus[x],\|\cdot\|\right)$  是 Banach 空间而 $(  X_{0} \oplus[x], p  )$ 是桶空间 (非 Banach 空间).

statement: Let X and Y be topological spaces, $f: X \rightarrow Y$, let $G(f)=\{(x, f(x)) \mid x \in X\} \subset X \times Y$. A mapping f is said to have a strongly closed graph if for each $(x, y) \notin G(f)$, there exist open sets U containing x and V containing y such that $(U \times \bar{V}) \cap G(f)=\varnothing$. A mapping $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is said to have a closed graph if $G(f)$ is a closed set in $X \times Y$. A weakly continuous mapping with a strongly closed graph is necessarily continuous.
chinese_statement: 设  X  与  Y  是拓扑空间,  $f: X \rightarrow Y$ , 令$G(f)=\{(x, f(x)) \mid x \in X\} \subset X \times Y$ .称映射  f  具有强闭图像, 是指对每个  $(x, y) \notin G(f)$ , 分别存在含有  x  与  y  的开集  U  与  V , 使$(U \times \bar{V}) \cap G(f)=\varnothing$ .映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  称做具有闭图像, 是指  f  的图像  $G(f)$  是  $X \times Y$  中的闭集. 具有强闭图像的弱连续映射一定连续.
rationale: Clearly, if f has a strongly closed graph, then f must have a closed graph. Herrington and Long point out that a weakly continuous mapping with a strongly closed graph is not necessarily continuous. Example: Let $X=[0,1]$ with the usual topology. Let $Y=[0,1]$ with the usual topology along with the set $A=\left\{r \mid r\right. \text{ is rational and } \left.\frac{1}{3}<r<\frac{2}{3}\right\}$. Clearly, the identity mapping $f: X \rightarrow Y$ has a closed graph. Moreover, this graph is strongly closed. However, f is not continuous, but it is weakly continuous.
chinese_rationale: 显然, 若  f  具有强闭图像, 则  f  必具有闭图像.Herrington 和 Long 指出, 具有强闭图像的弱连续映射未必连续. 例：设  $X=[0,1]$  并取通常拓扑.  $Y=[0,1]$ , 在  Y  上取通常拓扑连同集  $A=\left\{r \mid r\right.  为有理数且  \left.\frac{1}{3}<r<\frac{2}{3}\right\}$ .显然, 恒等映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  具有闭的图像. 此外, 这个图像还是强闭的. 然而,  f  并不连续, 但它是弱连续的.

statement: $x_{n} \rightarrow o$ does not imply $\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k} \rightarrow o$ in a linear topological space.
chinese_statement: $x_{n} \rightarrow o$  并不蕴涵  $\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k} \rightarrow o$  的线性拓扑空间.
rationale: For example, consider the non-locally convex space $l^{p}(0<p<1)$, and take a real number $\alpha>0$, such that $0<p+\alpha p<1$. Let $x_{n}=\left(0, \cdots, 0,1 / n_{n}^{\alpha}, 0, \cdots\right)$ (at the nth position), then $x_{n} \in l^{p}$ and $x_{n} \rightarrow o$, i.e., $d\left(x_{n}, o\right)=1 / n^{\alpha p} \rightarrow 0$. On the other hand, we have $\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}=\left(\frac{1}{n}, \frac{1}{n \cdot 2^{\alpha }}, \cdots, \frac{1}{n \cdot n^{\alpha}}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$. Therefore, $\begin{aligned}d\left(\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}, o\right) & =\frac{1}{n^{p}}+\frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot 2^{\alpha p}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot n^{\alpha p}} \\& \geqslant n \cdot \frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot n^{\alpha p}}=n^{1-(p+\alpha p)} \rightarrow+\infty.\end{aligned}$
chinese_rationale: 例如, 考虑非局部凸空间  $l^{p}(0<p<1)$ , 并取实数  $\alpha>0$ , 使  $0<p+\alpha p   <1$ . 令$x_{n}=\left(0, \cdots, 0,1 / n_{n}^{\alpha}, 0, \cdots\right)$(第n位),则  $x_{n} \in l^{p}$  且  $x_{n} \rightarrow o$ , 即  $d\left(x_{n}, o\right)=1 / n^{\alpha  p} \rightarrow 0$ . 另一方面, 我们有$\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}=\left(\frac{1}{n}, \frac{1}{n \cdot 2^{\alpha }}, \cdots, \frac{1}{n \cdot n^{\alpha}}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$. 因此,$\begin{aligned}d\left(\frac{1}{n} \sum_{k=1}^{n} x_{k}, o\right) & =\frac{1}{n^{p}}+\frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot 2^{\alpha p}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot n^{\alpha_{p}}} \\& \geqslant n \cdot \frac{1}{n^{p} \cdot n^{\alpha p}}=n^{1-(p+\alpha p)} \rightarrow+\infty.\end{aligned}$

statement: There exists a topological space such that each of its compact sets does not contain a non-empty open set.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间, 它的毎个紧集都不包含非空开集.
rationale: Let X be the set of real numbers, and consider the usual topology $\tau$ on X. Let Q be the set of rational numbers. We consider another topology $\tau^{*}$ on X, which is constructed by adding to $\tau$ sets of the form $Q \cap U$, where $U \in \tau$. Obviously, the topology $\tau^{*}$ is stronger than the topology $\tau$, and since $(X, \tau)$ is a Hausdorff space, so is $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$. We will prove that any compact set in $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ does not contain a non-empty open set. Suppose the contrary, that there exists a compact set C in $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$, which contains a non-empty open set G. Since $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ is a Hausdorff space, C must be a closed set, hence $\bar{G} \subset C$. By the definition of topology $\tau^{*}$, $\bar{G}$ must contain some closed interval $[p, q]$, where $p, q \in Q$. Thus, the family of sets $\mathscr{U}=\{(-\infty, p),(q,+\infty), Q,(x, q) \mid x>p, x \in X \backslash Q\}$ forms an open cover for the compact set C. Take any finite collection $\left(x_{1}, q\right),\left(x_{2}, q\right), \cdots ,  \left(x_{n}, q\right)$, where $x_{i} \in X \backslash Q, i=1,2, \cdots, n$, and let $x_{0}=\min \left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}\right\}$, then $\bigcup_{i=1}^{n}\left(x_{i}, q\right)=\left(x_{0}, q\right)$. Since $p<x_{0}$, $(-\infty, p), Q,\left(x_{0}, q\right),(q,+\infty)$ cannot cover C, which contradicts the condition that C is a compact set. Hence, C does not contain a non-empty open set.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为实数集, 并在  X  上取通常拓扑  $\tau$ , 再设  Q  为有理数集.我们在  X  上取另一个拓扑  $\tau^{*}$ , 它是由  $\tau$  加上形如  $Q \cap U$  的集构成, 其中  $U \in \tau$ . 显然, 拓扑  $\tau^{*}$  强于拓扑  $\tau$ , 而  $(X, \tau)$  是 Hausdorff 空间,故  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  也是 Hausdorff 空间.兹证  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  中的任何紧集都不包含非空开集. 假如相反, 即设  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  中存在紧集  C , 它包含非空开集  G . 因  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  是 Hausdorff 空间, 故  C  必为闭集, 从而  $\bar{G} \subset C$ . 根据拓扑  $\tau^{*}$  的定义,  $\bar{G}$ 必包含某个闭区间  $[p, q]$ , 其中  $p, q \in Q$ . 于是,集族$\mathscr{U}=\{(-\infty, p),(q,+\infty), Q,(x, q) \mid x>p, x \in X \backslash Q\}$就构成了紧集  C  的一个开覆盖. 任取有限个  $\left(x_{1}, q\right),\left(x_{2}, q\right), \cdots ,  \left(x_{n}, q\right)$ , 其中  $x_{i} \in X \backslash Q, i=1,2, \cdots, n$ , 令$x_{0}=\min \left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}\right\}$,则  $\bigcup_{i=1}^{n}\left(x_{i}, q\right)=\left(x_{0}, q\right)$ . 由于  $p<x_{0}$  ，故  $(-\infty, p), Q,\left(x_{0}, q\right),(q,+   \infty  ) $不能覆盖  C , 这与  C  是紧集的条件发生矛盾. 可见  C  不包含非空开集.

statement: Box topology is the same as product topology.
chinese_statement: 箱拓扑与积拓扑相同.
rationale: For a finite number of topological spaces, box topology is the same as product topology. For an infinite number of topological spaces, they are not the same. Here, we provide some examples of their differences: (i) In product topology, the product of connected spaces is still connected. This proposition does not hold for box topology. For example, for the countable product $X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}\left(R_{i}=R, i=1,2, \cdots\right)$ of real number sets, with the box topology, the set of bounded sequences in X is both open and closed, thus the set of unbounded sequences is open. As a result, the set of bounded sequences and the set of unbounded sequences are two disjoint open sets in X whose union is X. Therefore, X is a disconnected topological space. (ii) In product topology, the product of compact sets is still compact; however, in box topology, this proposition does not hold. For example, let $I_{i}$ be copies of the unit closed interval $I=[0,1]$ with the usual topology, $X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} I_{i}$, with the box topology $\tau$ on X. Let $A_{0}=[0,1), A_{1}=(0,1]$, then open sets in the form of $A_{\varepsilon_{1}} \times A_{\varepsilon_{2}} \times \cdots$ constitute an uncountable open cover of X, where $\varepsilon_{i}=0$ or 1. It is not difficult to prove that it has no proper subcover, therefore the box topological space $(X, \tau)$ is not compact. In fact, if any element $A_{\varepsilon_{1}} \times A_{\varepsilon_{2}} \times \cdots$ is removed, the point $\left(\varepsilon_{1}, \varepsilon_{2}, \cdots\right) \in X$ would not be covered. (iii) In product topology, a map $f: X \rightarrow \prod_{\alpha} X_{a}$ is continuous if and only if the coordinate maps $f_{\alpha:} X \rightarrow X_{\alpha}$ are all continuous. This proposition does not hold for box topology. For example, the map $f: R \rightarrow \prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}$ defined as $f(x)=(x, x, x, \cdots)$, where $R, R_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots)$ are one-dimensional Euclidean spaces, and the box topology is used on $\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}$. It is easy to see each coordinate map is continuous. However, f is not continuous. Additionally, we have: The product of countably many metrizable topological spaces is still metrizable. The product of countably many separable spaces is still separable. The product of countably many topological spaces satisfying the first countability axiom still satisfies the first countability axiom. However, it is easy to provide examples where these propositions do not hold for box topology.
chinese_rationale: 对于有限个拓扑空间而言, 箱拓扑与积拓扑相同。对于无限个据扑空间而言,二者并不相同。这里, 我们作出二者之间的差异的一些例子如下:(i)在积拓扑中,连通空间之积仍是连通的. 对于箱拓扑而言, 这一命题并不成立. 例如, 实数集的可数积$X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}\left(R_{i}=R, i=1,2, \cdots\right)$取箱拓扑后,  X  中的有界序列所组成之集是既开又闭的, 从而无界序列所组成之集是开的. 于是,有界序列所组成之集与无界序列所组成之集是  X  的两个不相交的开集, 其并为  X . 因此,  X  是一个不连通的拓扑空间.（ii）在积拓扑中, 紧集之积仍为紧集; 而在箱拓扑中, 这一命题也不成立. 例如, 设  $I_{i}$  是单位闭区间  $I=[0,1]$  的副本并取通常拓扑,  $X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} I_{i}$ , 在  X  上取箱拓扑  $\tau$ . 令$A_{0}=[0,1), A_{1}=(0,1]$,则形如  $A_{\varepsilon_{1}} \times A_{\varepsilon_{2}} \times \cdots$  的开集之积的全体构成了  X  的一个不可数的开覆盖, 其中  $\varepsilon_{i}=0$  或 1 . 不难证明, 它没有真子覆盖, 从而箱拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  不是紧的. 事实上,假如删去某个元  $A_{\varepsilon_{1}} \times A_{\varepsilon_{2}} \times \cdots$ ,那么点  $\left(\varepsilon_{1}, \varepsilon_{2}, \cdots\right) \in X$  就役有被覆盖了.（iii）在积拓扑中, 映射  $f: X \rightarrow \prod_{\alpha} X_{a}$  连续是坐标映射  $f_{\alpha:} X   \rightarrow X_{\alpha}$  都连续的特征. 对于箱拓扑而言, 这一命题也不成立. 例如,映射  $f: R \rightarrow \prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}$  定义为$f(x)=(x, x, x, \cdots)$,其中  $R, R_{i}(i=1,2, \cdots)$  都是一维欧氏空间,并在  $\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} R_{i}$  上取箱拓扑.易见，每个坐标映射都是连续的. 但是,  f  却并不连续.此外,我们有: 可数个可度量化的拓扑空间的积仍可度量化.可数个可分空间之积仍可分. 可数个满足第一可数公理的拓扑空间之积仍满足第一可数公理. 然而, 容易作出例子, 对于箱拓扑而言, 这些命题都不成立.

statement: There exists a mapping from one topological space to another. It is continuous but neither open nor closed.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间到另一个拓扑空间上的映射. 它是连续的. 但既不是开的也不是闭的.
rationale: Let $f(x)=\mathrm{e}^{x} \cos x$, with both domain and range being the real numbers R with the usual topology. It is easy to see that f is continuous. It is also easy to show that f achieves a minimum in the open interval $(-\infty, 0)$ at $f\left(-\frac{3}{4} \pi\right)=-\frac{\sqrt{2} e^{-\frac{3}{4} π}}{2}$. Hence, $-\frac{\sqrt{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{3}{4} π}}{2}$ is not an interior point of the set $f((-\infty, 0))$, i.e., $f((-\infty , 0))$ is not an open set in R. Therefore, f is not an open mapping. It is also evident that $\{-n \pi\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is a closed set in R, while $f\left(\{-n \pi\}_{n=1}^{\infty}\right)=\left\{(-1)^{n} \mathrm{e}^{-n \pi}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is not a closed set, hence f is not a closed mapping.
chinese_rationale: 设  $f(x)=\mathrm{e}^{x} \cos x$ , 定义域与值域均为带有通常拓扑的实数集  R . 易见,  f  是连续的. 还容易证明,  f  在开区间  $(-\infty, 0)$  内取得最小值$f\left(-\frac{3}{4} \pi\right)=-\frac{\sqrt{2} e^{-\frac{3}{4} π}}{2}$由此可知,  $-\frac{\sqrt{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{3}{4} π}}{2}$  不是集  $f((-\infty, 0))$  的内点, 即  $f((-\infty ,  0)  )$不是  R  中的开集, 因此,  f  不是开映射. 又易见,  $\{-n \pi\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  是  R 中的闭集,而$f\left(\{-n \pi\}_{n=1}^{\infty}\right)=\left\{(-1)^{n} \mathrm{e}^{-n \pi}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$不是闭集，故  f  不是闭映射.

statement: There exists a fully complete but not super complete linear topological space.
chinese_statement: 存在全完备而不超完备的线性拓扑空间.
rationale: Let X be a linear space, $X^{\#}$ its algebraic dual, and take the topology $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$ on $X^{\#}$. It can be shown that the linear topological space $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)$ is fully complete, i.e., every $a w^{*}$ closed linear subspace in $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime}$ is $w^{*}$ closed. In fact, because $m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$ is the strongest locally convex topology on X, every subspace of $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$ is closed. Also, since $m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$ and $\sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$ are two compatible topologies on X, every subspace of $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$ is also $\sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$ closed. Since $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime }=X$, therefore $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)=\left(\left(X^{\#}\right)^{\prime}, \sigma\left[\left(X^{\#}\right)^{\prime}, X^{\#}\right]\right)$. Thus, every subspace in $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime}$ is also $w^{*}$ closed, i.e., $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}\right.\right. ,  X ))$ is fully complete. Now take $X=[0,1]$, and let m be the Lebesgue measure on X, $S(X, m)$ is the linear space of all $(L)$ measurable real-valued functions on X. For each natural number n, let $U_{n}=\left\{x \left\lvert\, m\left\{t|| x(t) \left\lvert\,>\frac{1}{n}\right.\right\}<\frac{1}{n}\right.\right\}$, then $\left\{U_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ is a local base of some linear topology $\tau$ on $S(X, m)$. Therefore, $(S(X, m), \tau)$ is a linear topological space. It is easily seen that there is no nonzero continuous linear functional on $(S(X, m), \tau)$. In fact, there is also no nonzero and nonnegative linear functional on $(S(X, m), \tau)$. Let $F=S(X, m)$, as mentioned above, $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)$ is fully complete. Let $A=\{x \mid x \geqslant 0\}$, then A is an $a w^{\bullet}$ closed convex set in $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)^{\prime}$. Since there is no nonzero and nonnegative linear functional on $(F, \tau)$, A is not $w^{\bullet}$ closed. Thus, $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)$ is not super complete.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一线性空间,  $X^{\#}$  为  X  的代数对偶, 并在  $X^{\#}$  上取拓扑  $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$ .兹证线性拓扑空间  $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)$  是全完备的, 即要证明  $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime}$  中每个  $a w^{*}$  闭的线性子空间都是  $w^{*}$  闭的. 事实上,因  $m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$  是  X  上最强的局部凸拓扑,故  $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$  的每个子空间是闭的. 又因  $m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$  与  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$  是  X  上的两个相容的拓扑,故  $\left(X, m\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$  的每个子空间也是  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)$  闭的.由于  $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime }=X$ , 因而$\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)=\left(\left(X^{\#}\right)^{\prime}, \sigma\left[\left(X^{\#}\right)^{\prime}, X^{\#}\right]\right)$ .于是,  $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)\right)^{\prime}$  中每个子空同是  $w^{*}$  闭的, 即  $\left(X^{\#}, \sigma\left(X^{\#}\right.\right. ,  X  ))$是全完备的.今取  $X=[0,1]$ , 并设  m  是  X  上的 Lebesgue 测度,  $S(X, m)$  是  X  上一切  $(L)$  可测的实值函数所组成的线性空间. 对每一自然数  n , 令$U_{n}=\left\{x \left\lvert\, m\left\{t|| x(t) \left\lvert\,>\frac{1}{n}\right.\right\}<\frac{1}{n}\right.\right\}$,则  $\left\{U_{n}\right\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$  是  $S(X, m)$  上某个线性拓扑  $\tau$  的一个局部基. 因此,  $(S(X, m), \tau)$  为一线性拓扑空间. 易证，  $(S(X, m), \tau)$  上不存在非零连续线性泛函. 其实,  $(S(X, m), \tau)$  上也不存在非零且非负的线性泛函.现取  $F=S(X, m)$ , 如上所述,  $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)$  是全完备的. 令  $A=\{x \mid x \geqslant 0\}$ , 则  A  是  $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)^{\prime}$  中的  $a w^{\bullet}$  闭凸集. 由于  $(F, \tau)$  上不存在非零且非负的线性泛函，因而  A  不是  $w^{\bullet}$  闭的. 于是,  $\left(F^{\#}, \sigma\left(F^{\#}, F\right)\right)$  不是超完备的.

statement: There exist two topological spaces where every cluster point of each set is necessarily the limit of a sequence within that set, but their product space does not have this property.
chinese_statement: 存在两个拓扑空间, 其中每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限，但其积空间却无此性质.
rationale: Let $X=[0,1]$ with the usual topology on X, then every cluster point of each set in X must be the limit of a sequence within that set. Also, let $R^{2}$ be the real plane with the usual topology, and let A be the set of all points of the form $(x, 0)$ where $x \in R$. Y is a decomposition of $R^{2}$, consisting of A and all singletons $\{(x, y)\}$ where $(x, y) \notin A$. Take the quotient topology on Y. Clearly, every cluster point of each set in Y must be the limit of a sequence within that set. Let $B=\left\{\left(\frac{1}{n},\left(n, \frac{1}{m}\right)\right)|n, m=1,2, \cdots\rangle \subset X \times Y,\right.$ then $(0, A)$ is a cluster point of set B, but no sequence in B can converge to $(0, A)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=[0,1]$  并在  X  上取通常拓扑, 则  X  中每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限.又设  $R^{2}$  是带有通常拓扑的实平面,  A  是形如  $(x, 0)$  的点的全体, 其中  $x \in R$ . Y  是  $R^{2}$  的一个分解, 它是由  A  以及一切单点集  $\{(x, y)\}$  所构成, 其中  $(x, y) \notin A$ . 在  Y  上取商拓扑. 显然,  Y  中每个集的每个聚点必是该集中某个序列的极限. 令$B=\left\{\left(\frac{1}{n},\left(n, \frac{1}{m}\right)\right)|n, m=1,2, \cdots\rangle \subset X \times Y,\right.$则  $(0, A)$  是集  B  的一个聚点,但  B  中没有序列能收敛于  $(0, A)$ .

statement: Given any natural number $n$, a topological space can be constructed with an $n$-point compactification, but for $m>n$, there exists no $m$-point compactification space.
chinese_statement: 任给自然数$n$,可构造一个具有$n$点紧化的拓扑空间,但对$m>n$, 不存在  $m$  点紧化空间.
rationale: Let X be a Hausdorff space. Denote $\xi(X)$ as the compactification space of X, which refers to a compact space containing X, where X is dense. Let n be a natural number. The compactification $\xi(X)$ of X is called an n-point compactification, meaning $\xi(X) \backslash X$ consists of n points. The following theorem and the construction of counterexamples are taken from Magill. Theorem 1: For a Hausdorff space X, the following statements are equivalent: (i) X has an n-point compactification space. (ii) X is locally compact and contains a compact subset K, whose complement is the union of n pairwise disjoint open sets $\left\{G_{i}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$, such that for every $i(1 \leqslant i \leqslant n), K \cup G_{i}$ is not compact. Theorem 2: If a topological space X has the following property: every compact subset of X is contained in some compact subset whose complement has at most n connected components, then for $m> n$, X does not have an m-point compactification. Now construct the needed counterexample: Let i be a natural number, let $\begin{array}{c}L_{i}=\{(x, y) \in R \times R \mid y=x / i, x \geqslant 0\}, \\S_{n}=\bigcup_{i=1}^{n} L_{i},\end{array}$ and inherit the topology from the Euclidean plane on $S_{n}$. Then let $K=\{(0,0)\}, S_{n} \backslash K=\bigcup_{i=1}^{n} L_{i}^{2}$, here $L_{i}^{\prime}=L_{i} \backslash\{(0,0)\}$. Obviously, the elements in $\left\{L_{i}^{\prime}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$ are pairwise disjoint, and for each i, $K \cup L_{i}^{\prime}$ is not compact. According to Theorem 1, $S_{n}$ has an n-point compactification space. Let K be any compact subset of $S_{n}$, then there exists a positive number r, such that $K \subset\left\{(x, y) \in S_{n} \mid \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \leqslant r\right\}=K^{*}$. Obviously, $K^{*}$ is compact, and $S_{n} \backslash K^{*}$ has exactly n connected components. According to Theorem 2, when $m>n$, $S_{n}$ does not have an m-point compactification.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一 Hausdorff 空间. 称  $\xi(X)$  为  X  的紧化空间, 是指 $\xi(X)$  是包含  X  的紧空间,且  X  在其中稠密.设  n  是自然数,  X  的紧化  $\xi(X)$  称为  n  点紧化, 是指  $\xi(X) \backslash X$ 由  n  个点组成.下面的定理以及反例的构造均取于 Magill. 定理 1: 对于 Hausdorff 空间  X  而言,下列断语彼此等价:（i）  X  有  n  点紧化空间.（ii）X是局部紧的且包含一个紧子集  K , 它的补集是  n  个两两不相交的开集  $\left\{G_{i}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$  之并, 使对每一  $i(1 \leqslant i \leqslant n), K \cup G_{i}$  都不是紫的.定理 2: 若拓扑空间  X  有如下性质:  X  的每个紧子集包含于某个紧子集之中,该紧子集的补集至多有  n  个连通分支,则当  $m>   n$  时,  X  没有  m  点紧化. 现在构造所需的反例: 设  i  是自然数,令$\begin{array}{c}L_{i}=\{(x, y) \in R \times R \mid y=x / i, x \geqslant 0\}, \\S_{n}=\bigcup_{i=1}^{n} L_{i},\end{array}$并在  $S_{n}$  上取由欧氏平面继承下来的拓扑. 再令$K=\{(0,0)\}, S_{x} \backslash K=\bigcup_{i=1}^{n} L_{i}^{2}$,这里  $L_{i}^{\prime}=L_{i} \backslash\{(0,0)\}$ . 显然,  $\left\{L_{i}^{\prime}\right\}_{i=1}^{n}$  中的各个元两两不相交, 且对每一  i, $K \cup L_{i}^{\prime}$  不是紧的. 据定理  1, $S_{n}$  有  n  点紧化空间.设  K  是  $S_{n}$  的任一紧子集, 则存在正数  r , 使$K \subset\left\{(x, y) \in S_{n} \mid \sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}} \leqslant r\right\}=K^{*}$ .显然,  $K^{*}$  是紧的,且  $S_{n} \backslash K^{*}$  恰有  n  个连通分支. 据定理 2, 当  $m>n$ 时,  $S_{n}$  就没有  m  点紧化.

statement: Let X and Y be topological spaces, a map $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is called closure-continuous at a point $x \in X$ if for every open set G in Y, satisfying $f(x) \in G$, there exists an open set O in X such that $x \in O$ and $f(\bar{O}) \subset \bar{G}$. The map $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is called closure-continuous on X if f is closure-continuous at every point $x \in X$. There exists some closure-continuous map which is nowhere continuous.
chinese_statement: 设  X  与  Y  都是拓扑空间, 映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  称做在点  $x \in X$  是闭包连续的, 是指对  Y  中的每个开集  G , 满足  $f(x) \in G$ , 存在  X  中的开集  O , 使得  $x \in O$  且  $f(\bar{O}) \subset \bar{G}$ . 称  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  在  X  上是闭包连续的, 是指  f  在每一点  $x \in X$  都是闭包连续的.存在某个闭包连续映射, 它却无处连续.
rationale: Andrew and Whittlesy proved that if X and Y are topological spaces and $f : X \rightarrow Y$ is continuous on X, then f is also closure-continuous on X. However, the converse of this proposition does not hold. For example: Let $X=Y=[0,1]$, define the open sets of X as the empty set and its complement as finite sets, while defining the open sets of Y as the empty set and its complement as at most countable sets. It is evident that these families of open sets determine the topologies on X and Y. Let $f: X \rightarrow Y$ be the identity map. Since in Y every non-empty open set G has $\bar{G}=Y$, f is closure-continuous on X. However, f is not continuous at any point $x \in X$.
chinese_rationale: Andrew 和 Whittlesy证明了, 若  X  与  Y  都是拓扑空间,  $f :  X \rightarrow Y$  在  X  上连续, 则  f  在  X  上亦必闭包连续. 然而, 这个命题之逆并不成立. 例如： 设  $X=Y=[0,1]$ , 规定  X  的开集为空集以及其补集为有限的集; 而规定  Y  的开集为空集以及其补集为至多可数的集. 易见,这些开集族分别确定了  X  与  Y  上的拓扑.设  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  为恒等映射. 因  Y  中每个非空开集  G , 都有  $\bar{G}=Y$ ,故  f  在  X  上是闭包连续的. 然而, 对任一点  $x \in X$, f  在点  x  并不连续.

statement: c sequence space and s neighborhood space do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: c  序列空间与  s  囿空间互不蕴涵.
rationale:
Example 1: An s neighborhood space that is not a c sequence space. A locally convex space X is said to be a braked space if for any sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ in X converging to o, there exists a sequence of positive real numbers $\left\{\lambda_{n}\right\}$ such that $\lambda_{n} \rightarrow+\infty$ and the sequence $\left\{\lambda_{n} x_{n}\right\}$ converges to o in X. Snipes pointed out that a braked space must be an s neighborhood space. We shall prove that the locally convex space $\left(l^{1}, \sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)\right)$ is an s neighborhood space. For this, it suffices to prove it is a braked space. Assume u is the norm topology on $l^{1}$, and $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is a sequence in $l^{1}$ converging to o under the weak topology $\sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)$. Since the norm convergence and weak convergence of sequences in $l^{1}$ are equivalent, $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is also a sequence converging to o under u. Since $\left(l^{1}, u\right)$ is a normed linear space, it is obviously a braked space. Thus, there exists a sequence of positive real numbers $\left\{\lambda_{n}\right\}$ such that $\lambda_{n} \rightarrow+\infty$ and the sequence $\left\{\lambda_{n} x_{n}\right\}$ converges to o under topology u, hence it is also a sequence converging to o under $\sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)$, i.e., $\left(l^{1}, \sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)\right)$ is a braked space. It is now proven that $\left(l^{1}, \sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)\right)$ is not a c sequence space. In fact, the unit ball B in $l^{1}$, $B=\left\{x \in l^{1} \mid\|x\|<1\right\}$, is convex, balanced, and sequentially open with respect to $\sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)$, but it is not open with respect to $\sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)$. Therefore, $\left(l^{1}, \sigma\left(l^{1}, l^{\infty}\right)\right)$ is not a c sequence space.
Example 2: A c sequence locally convex space that is not an s neighborhood space. Consider the c sequence locally convex space $\left(l^{2}\right. ,  \left.\sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)_{c s}\right)$ generated by the locally convex space $\left(l^{2}, \sigma\left(l^{2}, l^{2}\right)\right)$.
