\omega_{1}\right)$,则  W  是开集且  $H \subset W, U \cap W=\varnothing$ .(iv)  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  不是完备正规空间.设  F  为  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  中的极限数全体,则  F  是闭集.  F  与  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right) \backslash F$ 都是共尾的, 故由 (ii),  F  必不是零集. 由定义,  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  不是完备正规空间.(v)  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  上连续函数  f  是有界的.若  f  是无界连续函数, 则存在  $\alpha_{1}, \alpha_{2}, \cdots<\omega_{1}$ , 使  $\left|f\left(\alpha_{i}\right)\right|>i$ . 若 $sup  \alpha_{i}=\beta$ , 则  f  在  $\beta$  连续性不成立.(vi) 对于  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  上的连续函数  f , 存在  $\alpha<\omega_{1}$ , 对于  $\alpha \leqslant \beta<\omega_{1}$ 的任意  $\beta$ , 有  $f(\alpha)=f(\beta)$ .由 (v),  f  是有界的. 故存在正数  a , 使  $|f| \leqslant a$ . 设  f  的图像为 G.$G(\alpha)=G \cap\left(\left[\alpha, \omega_{1}\right) \times[-a, a]\right), \alpha<\omega_{1}$ .若  $A=\{\alpha \mid f(\alpha) \geqslant 0\}$ , 则  A  是某函数的零集. 由 (ii),  A  或  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right) \backslash A$ 是等终的, 即有  $a_{1}$  存在, 使下述之一成立.$\begin{array}{c}G\left(\alpha_{1}\right) \subset\left[\alpha_{1}, \omega_{1}\right) \times[-a, 0], \\G\left(\alpha_{1}\right) \subset\left[\alpha_{1}, \omega_{1}\right) \times[0, a] .\end{array}$用二分法将此作法继续作下去, 可取得点列  $\left\{\alpha_{i}\right\}$ , 闭区间序列  $\left\{I_{i}\right\}$ ,满足$\begin{array}{c}G\left(\alpha_{i}\right) \subset\left[\alpha_{i}, \omega_{1}\right) \times I_{i}, I_{i} \supset I_{i+1}, \\d\left(I_{i}\right) \longrightarrow 0 .\end{array}$注意,  $\bigcap_{i} I_{i}$  为一点, 令为  $\{b\}$ . 设  $\sup \alpha_{i}=\alpha$ , 则当  $\alpha<\beta$  时, 有  $f(\alpha)=   f(\beta)=b$ .

statement: Separable spaces and compact spaces do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: 可分空间与紧空间互不蕴涵.
rationale:
It is easy to prove that compact metric spaces are necessarily separable, but separable metric spaces are not necessarily compact. However, compact topological spaces are not necessarily separable, so compact spaces and separable spaces do not imply each other.
First example: Non-separable compact space. Let X be an uncountable set, $a \in X$, define the non-empty open set of X as $X \backslash C$, where C is any finite subset of X or any subset containing the point a. (i) X is compact. In fact, every open cover of X must have an open set U containing the point a, such that the complement of U is finite, meaning U only does not cover finitely many points $x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}$ in X. Thus, we can select n open sets $U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}$ from this open cover to cover the points $x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}$, so $U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}$ along with U cover X. Therefore, X is compact. (ii) X is non-separable. In fact, any infinite countable subset of X has only one accumulation point a, so X is non-separable.
Second example: A separable non-compact space. The Hilbert space $l^{2}$ has the desired properties.
chinese_rationale:
容易证明,紧度量空间必定可分, 而可分的度量空间未必紧.但是，紧拓扑空间未必可分，从而紧空间与可分空间互不蕴涵.
第一例: 不可分的紧空间.设  X  为一不可数集,  $a \in X$ , 命  X  的非空开集为  $X \backslash C$ , 这里,  C 是  X  的任意有限子集或是含有点  a  的任意子集.(i)  X  是紧的. 事实上,  X  的每个开覆盖中必定有一个含有点  a 的这样的开集  U , 使得  U  的补集是有限的, 也就是说,  U  只盖不住  X  中的有限个点  $x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}$ . 这样一来, 我们就可以从这个开覆盖中选出  n  个开集  $U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}$ , 使得它们盖住了点  $x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots ,  x_{n}$ , 于是,  $U_{1}, U_{2}, \cdots, U_{n}$  连同  U  就覆盖了  X . 因此,  X  是紧的.(ii)  X  不可分. 事实上,  X  的任一无穷可数子集只有一个聚点  a , 可见  X  不可分.
第二例 :可分的非紧空间.Hilbert 空间  $l^{2}$  具有所需的性质.

statement: There exists a peculiar space, which is not a quasi-barrelled space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个特异空间, 它不是拟桶空间.
rationale: Let Y be a non-reflexive Banach space, X be a Mackey space $\left(Y^{\prime}\right., m\left(Y^{\prime}, Y\right)$, then $X^{\prime}=Y$, and the strong topology on $X^{\prime}$ is the norm topology, because $\sigma\left(Y^{\prime}, Y\right)$ bounded sets are norm bounded. Thus, X is a locally convex space that is semi-reflexive but not reflexive. Since a locally convex space is reflexive if and only if it is both semi-reflexive and quasi-barrelled, it follows that X is not a quasi-barrelled space. However, because X is semi-reflexive, it is a peculiar space.
chinese_rationale: 设  Y  是一个非自反的 Banach 空间,  X  是 Mackey 空间  $\left(Y^{\prime}\right. ,  m\left(Y^{\prime}, Y\right)$ , 则  $X^{\prime}=Y$ , 且  $X^{\prime}$  上的强拓扑就是范数拓扑, 这是因为  $\sigma\left(Y^{\prime}, Y\right)$  有界集都是范数有界的. 于是,  X  是一个半自反而不自反的局部凸空间. 因一个局部凸空间为自反的,当且仅当它既是半自反空间, 又是拟桶空间, 故  X  不是拟桶空间. 然而,由于  X  是半自反空间,因而它是一个特异空间.

statement: There exists a subspace of a locally compact space that is not locally compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个局部紧空间的子空间, 它不是局部紧的.
rationale: For example, let X be the set of real numbers with the usual topology, then X is a locally compact space. The set of rational numbers is a subspace of X that is not locally compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  X  为带有通常拓扑的实数集,则  X  是一个局部紧空间. 有理数集是  X  的一个子空间,它不是局部紧的.

statement: A $T_{1}$ space, if every compact subset is closed, it must be a Hausdorff space.
chinese_statement: $T_{1}$  空间, 若其中每个紧子集都是闭的, 那么它必是 Hausdorff 空间.
rationale: It is easy to prove that compact subsets in a Hausdorff space are closed. However, a topological space where compact subsets are closed is not necessarily a Hausdorff space. It can be proven that if a topological space X satisfies the first countability axiom and every compact subset is closed, then X must be a Hausdorff space. It should be noted that for a $T_{1}$ space, even if every compact subset is closed, it cannot guarantee that the space is a Hausdorff space. We provide a counterexample as follows: let X be an uncountable set, and we define the topology on X as the family of closed subsets of X consisting of at most countable subsets along with X. It is apparent that any two points in X cannot be separated by open sets, thus X is not a Hausdorff space. Now, we prove X, define $U_{n}=X \backslash\left\{a_{i} \mid i \geqslant n\right\}$. Then the family $\left\{U_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$ is an open cover for A, but it has no finite subcover, so A is not compact, proving that every compact subset of X is a finite set. Because every finite subset of X is closed, every compact subset of X is also closed. Finally, it is not difficult to show that X is a $T_{1}$ space, but does not satisfy the first countability axiom.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明, Hausdorff 空间中的紧子集都是闭的.然而, 紧子集都是闭的拓扑空间未必是 Hausdorff 空间. 可以证明, 若拓扑空间  X  满足第一可数性公理,且其中每个紧子集都是闭的, 则  X  必为 Hausdorff 空间. 应当注意, 对于  $T_{1}$  空间, 即使其中每个紧子集都是闭的，也不能保证该空间是 Hausdorff 空间，我们给出反例如下:设  X  为一不可数集,我们规定  X  上的拓扑为：  X  的闭子集族由  X  的至多可数子集连同  X  组成. 易见,  X  中任何两个点都不能被开集分离，因而  X  不是 Hausdorff 空间.现证  X , 定义$U_{n}=X \backslash\left\{a_{i} \mid i \geqslant n\right\}$.则集族  $\left\{U_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$  是  A  的一个开覆盖，而它没有有限子覆盖，故  A 不是紧的,这就证明了  X  的每个紧子集是有限集. 由于  X  的每个有限子集是闭的,因而  X  的毎个紧子集也是闭的.最后,不难看出  X  是  $T_{1}$  空间,但不满足第一可数性公理.

statement: There exists a family of hypercomplete spaces whose direct sum is not hypercomplete.
chinese_statement: 存在一族超完备空间,其直接和并不超完备.
rationale: The direct sum space $K^{(H)}$ is not fully complete, and therefore not hypercomplete. However, the locally convex space K is hypercomplete. Grothendieck also provided a counterexample: there exist countably many locally convex Fréchet spaces whose direct sum is not fully complete, and therefore not hypercomplete.
chinese_rationale: 直接和空间  $K^{(H)}$  不是全完备的, 从而也不是超完备的. 但局部凸空间  K  是超完备的.Grothendieck还给出了一个反例: 存在可数个局部凸的 Fréchet 空间, 它们的直接和不是全完备的,从而也不是超完备的.

statement: There exists a dual space $\langle X, Y\rangle$, such that a compatible topology on X is not located between $\sigma(X, Y)$ and $m(X, Y)$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个对偶空间  $\langle X, Y\rangle$ , 使  X  上的一个相容拓扑并不位于  $\sigma(X, Y)$  与  $m(X, Y)$  之间.
rationale: For example, let $T_{0}$ be the isolated linear topology on X, such that $\left(X, T_{0}\right)^{\prime}=\{0\}$. Let $T=m(X, Y) \cup T_{0}$, then $(X, T)^{\prime}=Y$, so T is a compatible topology on X. However, T is not located between $\sigma(X, Y)$ and $m(X, Y)$.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  $T_{0}$  是  X  上隔离的线性拓扑, 使得  $\left(X, T_{0}\right)^{\prime}=\{0\}$ . 令$T=m(X, Y) \cup T_{0}$,则  $(X, T)^{\prime}=Y$ , 故  T  是  X  上的相容拓扑. 但  T  并不位于  $\sigma(X, Y)$ 与  $m(X, Y)$  之间.

statement: There exists a topological space $\boldsymbol{X}$, where the points of $\boldsymbol{X}$ are functions, and its topology is equivalent to pointwise convergence, yet X is not a metrizable space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间  $\boldsymbol{X}$, $\boldsymbol{X}$  的点都是函数, 其拓扑相当于逐点收敛,而  X  不是可度量化的空间.
rationale: Let $(X, \tau)$ be the space of all real-valued continuous functions with domain $[0,1]$, with $\tau$ generated by the neighborhood system $N_{f}=\{g|x \in F \Rightarrow| g(x)-f(x) \mid<\varepsilon\}$, where F is a non-empty finite subset of $[0,1]$, $f \in X$, $\varepsilon>0$. Clearly, according to this topology, if $g_{n} \rightarrow g$ as $n \rightarrow \infty$, then for each $x \in[0,1]$, $g_{n}(x) \rightarrow g(x)$ as $n \rightarrow \infty$, because F can be a singleton set $\{x\}$. Conversely, if $g_{n}(x) \rightarrow g(x)$ for each $x \in[0,1]$ as $n \rightarrow \infty$, then $g_{n} \rightarrow g$ as $n \rightarrow \infty$, because for every $\varepsilon>0$ and finite subset F of $[0,1]$, a sufficiently large n can be chosen to ensure $\left|g_{n}(x)-g(x)\right|<\varepsilon$ for each $x \in F$. Let A be the set of all functions in X such that: (i) $x \in[0,1] \Rightarrow 0 \leqslant f(x) \leqslant 1$, (ii) $m\{x \mid f(x)=1\} \geqslant \frac{1}{2}$, where m represents the Lebesgue measure. Then, 0 is an accumulation point of A. However, if a sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ of elements of A converges to 0 according to topology $\tau$, then for each $x \in[0 , 1]$, $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$ converges to 0. By the Lebesgue Dominated Convergence Theorem, $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \rightarrow 0$ as $n \rightarrow \infty$. This contradicts the inequality $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \geqslant \frac{1}{2}$. Therefore, there does not exist a sequence $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ in A that converges to 0 according to topology $\tau$, and thus X is not a metrizable space.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(X, \tau)$  是以  $[0,1]$  为定义域的全体实值连续函数的空间, 而  $\tau$  由邻域系$N_{f}=\{g|x \in F \Rightarrow| g(x)-f(x) \mid<\varepsilon\}$所生成,其中  F  为  $[0,1]$  的非空有限子集,  $f \in X$, $\varepsilon>0$ .显然, 如果按照这个拓扑, 当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时有  $g_{n} \rightarrow g$ , 那么对各个  $x \in[0,1]$ , 当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时有  $g_{n}(x) \rightarrow g(x)$ , 这是因为  F  能取成单点集  $\{x\}$ . 另一方面, 如果对于各个  $x \in[0,1]$ , 当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时有  $g_{n}(x) \rightarrow   g(x)$ , 那么当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时有  $g_{n} \rightarrow g$ , 这是因为对于每一个  $\varepsilon>0$  和  $[0,1]$  的有限子集  F , 能选取足够大的  n , 以保证对于每一个  $x \in F$ 都有$\left|g_{n}(x)-g(x)\right|<\varepsilon$ .设  A  为  X  内有下述性质的全体函数的集合：(i)  $x \in[0,1] \Rightarrow 0 \leqslant f(x) \leqslant 1$ ,(ii)  $m\{x \mid f(x)=1\} \geqslant \frac{1}{2}$ ,这里  m  代表 Lebesgue 测度. 那么, 0 是  A  的一个聚点. 但是, 如果  A  的元素的序列  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  按照拓扑  $\tau$  收敛于 0 , 那么对于每个  $x \in[0 , 1]$, 有  $\left\{f_{n}(x)\right\}$  收敛于 0 , 又由 Lebesgue 控制收敛定理, 当  $n \rightarrow \infty$  时有$\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \rightarrow 0$ .这与不等式  $\int_{0}^{1} f_{n}(x) d x \geqslant \frac{1}{2}$  相矛盾. 因此,  A  中不存在序列  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  按照拓扑  $\tau$  收敛于 0 , 故  X  不是可度量化的空间.

statement: There exist subsets with connected closures that are not connected themselves.
chinese_statement: 存在闭包连通而本身并不连通的子集.
rationale: It is easy to prove that if A is a connected subset of a topological space X, then the closure of A, $\bar{A}$, is also a connected subset of X. It should be noted that the converse of this proposition does not hold. For example: Let A be the set of all rational points on the real line, then A is a disconnected set, but $\bar{A}$ is a connected set.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明, 若  A  是拓扑空间  X  的连通子集, 则  A  的闭包  $\bar{A}$  也是  X  的连通子集. 应当注意, 这个命题之逆并不成立. 例如：设  A 是实直线上的一切有理点所成之集, 则  A  为非连通集, 而  $\bar{A}$  为连通集.

statement: There exists a non-metrizable Moore space.
chinese_statement: 存在不可度量化的 Moore 空间.
rationale: For example, let X be the set of natural numbers. Let $P= \{\{2k-1, 2k\}\}$, a subset of X is open if and only if it is a union of some subsets in P. Therefore, a set is open if and only if it is closed. Thus, X is a regular space. Also, X is clearly a developable space, so it is a Moore space. However, X is non-metrizable.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  X  是自然数的全体, 令  $P=   \{\{2 k-1,2 k\}\}$, X  的非空子集是开的, 当且仅当它是  P  中一些子集的并集. 因此,一个集是开集当且仅当它是闭集. 于是,  X  为一正则空间. 又,  X  显然是一个可展空间,故它是一个 Moore 空间.然而,  X  不可度量化.

statement: There exists a countably compact but not compact topological space.
chinese_statement: 存在可数仿紧而不仿紧的拓扑空间.
rationale: Let $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$ be the set of all ordinals less than the first uncountable ordinal $\omega_{1}$, equipped with the interval topology. Since every sequence in $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$ has an accumulation point belonging to $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$, it is countably compact, and thus also countably paracompact. On the other hand, a topological space is compact if and only if it is both countably compact and Lindelöf. However, $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$ is not a compact space, so $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$ is not Lindelöf, and therefore not paracompact.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  是一切小于第一个不可数序数  $\omega_{1}$  的序数之集, 并在  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  上取区间拓扑. 因  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  中每个序列都有属于  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  的聚点，故  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  是可数紧的, 从而它也是可数仿紧的.另一方面,一个拓扑空间是紧的, 当且仅当它既是可数紧的又是亚紧的.而  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  不是紧空间,故  $\left[0, \omega_{1}\right)$  不是亚紧空间，从而也不是仿紧空间.

statement: There exists a totally disconnected metric space where the closure of any open ball $B(a, r)$ is the closed ball $B[a, r]$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个完全不连通的度量空间, 其中任意开球  $B(a, r)$ 的闭包都是闭球  $B[a, r]$ .
rationale: Let X be the Cantor ternary set with the usual topology, then X is a totally disconnected metric space, and the closure of any open ball $B(a, r) = \{x \mid d(x, a) < r\}$ is the closed ball $B[a, r] = \{x \mid d(x, a) \leqslant r\}$. Note: Generally speaking, the closure of an open ball in a metric space is not necessarily a closed ball. The above counterexample shows that a totally disconnected metric space does exist where the closure of any open ball is a closed ball.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为带有通常拓扑的 Cantor三分集, 则  X  为完全不连通的度量空间,且其中任意开球$B(a, r)=\{x \mid d(x, a)<r\}$的闭包都是闭球$B[a, r]=\{x \mid d(x, a) \leqslant r\}$ .注:一般说来, 度量空间中开球的闭包未必是一个闭球. 上述反例说明了也确实存在完全不连通的度量空间, 其中任意开球的闭包都是闭球.

statement: There exists a linear topological space, within which there is a compact but not sequentially compact subset.
chinese_statement: 存在某个线性拓扑空间, 其中存在紧而不序列等的子集.
rationale: Let $X=l^{\infty}$, i.e., X is the linear space formed by all bounded sequences. On X, take the supremum norm, then according to the Banach-Alaoglu theorem, the closed unit ball $U=U\left(X^{\prime}\right)=\left\{f \in X^{\prime} \mid\|f\| \leqslant 1\right\}$ in $\left(X^{\prime},\|\cdot\|\right)$ is $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ compact. Now prove that U is not $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ sequentially compact. In fact, for $x=\left\{\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right\} \in X$, let $f_{n}(x)=\xi_{n}$, then $f_{n} \in U$. However, $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$ has no $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ convergent subsequence. This is because for any subsequence $\left\{f_{n_{i}}\right\}$ of $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$, take $x \in l^{\infty}$ as follows: $x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, \cdots\right)$, where $\xi_{n_{1}}=1, \xi_{n_{2}}=2, \xi_{n_{3}}=1, \xi_{n_{4}}=2, \cdots$, and the remaining $\xi_{n}=0$. Clearly $\left\{f_{n_{i}}(x)\right\}$ does not converge. Therefore, $\left\{f_{n_{i}}\right\}$ is not $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ convergent.
chinese_rationale: 令  $X=l^{\infty}$ , 即  X  是有界数列的全体所成的线性空间. 在  X  上取上确界范数, 则据 Banach-Alaoglu 定理,  $\left(X^{\prime},\|\cdot\|\right)$  中的闭单位球$U=U\left(X^{\prime}\right)=\left\{f \in X^{\prime} \mid\|f\| \leqslant 1\right\}$是  $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$  紧的.兹证  U  不是  $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$  序列紧的. 事实上,对  $x=\left\{\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots\right\} \in   X $, 令  $f_{n}(x)=\xi_{n}$ , 则  $f_{n} \in U$ . 但是,  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  没有  $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$  收敛子列. 因为对  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  的任一子列  $\left\{f_{n_{i}}\right\}$ , 取  $x \in l^{\infty}$  如下:$x=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, \cdots\right)$,其中  $\xi_{n_{1}}=1, \xi_{n_{2}}=2, \xi_{n_{3}}=1, \xi_{n_{4}}=2, \cdots$ , 其余的  $\xi_{n}=0$ . 显然  $\left\{f_{n_{i}}(x)\right\}$ 并不收敛. 因此  $\left\{f_{n_{i}}\right\}$  不是  $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$  收敛的.

statement: There exists a non-discrete topological space where every open set is a closed set, and every closed set is also an open set.
chinese_statement: 存在某个非离散的拓扑空间, 其中每个开集都是闭集,而每个闭集也都是开集.
rationale: For example: Let X be the set of all natural numbers, and let $P=\{\{2n-1,2n\} \mid n=1,2, \cdots,\}$ . Define the family of open sets of X as the empty set $\varnothing$ and the union of elements in P. Then this family of open sets determines a topology $\tau$ on X, called the even-odd topology. In the topological space $(X, \tau)$, every open set is a closed set, and every closed set is an open set. However, since singleton sets are not open sets, $(X, \tau)$ is not a discrete topological space.
chinese_rationale: 例如： 设  X  为自然数的全体, 又设$P=\{\{2 n-1,2 n\} \mid n=1,2, \cdots,\}$ .命  X  的开集族为空集  $\varnothing$  以及  P  中元素的并集, 则此开集族确定了  X  上的一个拓扑  $\tau$ , 称  $\tau$  为奇偶拓扑. 在拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  中, 每个开集都是闭集, 而每个闭集也都是开集. 然而, 因单点集不是开集, 故  $(X, \tau)$  不是离散拓扑空间.

statement: There exists a metrizable topological space, one of whose quotient spaces is non-metrizable.
chinese_statement: 存在某个可度量化的拓扑空间, 它的一个商空间不可度化.
rationale: Let X be the Euclidean plane with the usual topology, and let A be the set of all points (x, y) such that y=0. Let the decomposition Y consist of A and all sets {(x, y)} such that (x, y) \notin A, with the quotient topology on Y. It is easy to prove that the projection P from X onto the quotient space Y must be a closed map. (i) There exist countably many neighborhoods of A whose intersection is A. Let $U_{n}=\{(x, y)|| y \mid<1 / n\}$. Since $P^{-1}\left(P\left(U_{n}\right)\right)=U_{n}$ is an open set containing A, it is an open neighborhood of A, and $A=\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty} P\left(U_{n}\right)$. (ii) The quotient space Y is non-metrizable. It can be proven that element A in the quotient space Y does not have a countable neighborhood base, which means it does not satisfy the first countability axiom, and thus is non-metrizable. In fact, suppose otherwise, then there exists a countable neighborhood base of A satisfying: $U_{1} \supset U_{2} \supset \cdots \supset U_{n} \supset \cdots $. For each non-negative integer m, the sequence $\{(m, 1 /(n+1))\}$ converges to A in the quotient space, so there exists a natural number $N_{m}$ such that $\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right) \in U_{m}$. Thus, the sequence $\left\{m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right\}$ frequently lies in each $U_{n}$. The set $B=\left\{\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right)\right\}$ is closed in X, and its projection onto the quotient space Y, $P(B)=\left\{\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{n+1}\right)\right)\right\}=B$, is also closed in Y. Therefore, $Y \backslash B$ is an open set in the quotient space Y containing A. Since it does not contain any element of the neighborhood base $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$, this leads to a contradiction. Consequently, Y does not satisfy the first countability axiom.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为带有通常拓扑的欧氏平面,  A  为所有使得  $y=0$  的点  $(x, y)$  所组成之集, 又设分解  Y  由  A  和所有使得  $(x, y) \notin A$  的集  $\{(x, y)\}$  所组成,  Y  带有商拓扑.容易证明, 由  X  到商空间  Y  上的射影  P  必是闭映射.(i)存在  A  的可数多个邻域，它们的交是  A .令  $U_{n}=\{(x, y)|| y \mid<1 / n\}$ . 因  $P^{-1}\left(P\left(U_{n}\right)\right)=U_{n}$  为开集且包含  A , 故为  A  的开邻域, 且$A=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} P\left(U_{n}\right)$ .(ii)商空间  Y  不可度量化.可以证明, 商空间  Y  中的元  A  没有可数邻域基, 即不满足第一可数公理, 从而不可度量化. 事实上, 假如不然, 即设存在  A  的可数邻域基满足:$U_{1} \supset U_{2} \supset \cdots \supset U_{n} \supset \cdots $.对每个非负整数  m , 序列  $\{(m, 1 /(n+1))\}$  在商空间中收敛于  A ,从而有自然数  $N_{m}$ , 使$\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right) \in U_{m}$ .于是, 序列  $\left\{m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right\}$  经常在每个  $U_{n}$  中, 集  $B=\left\{\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{m+1}\right)\right)\right\}$ 在  X  中是闭的，它在商空间  Y  上的射影$P(B)=\left\{\left(m, 1 /\left(N_{n+1}\right)\right)\right\}=B$亦为  Y  中的闭集, 从而  $Y \backslash B$  为商空间  Y  中的开集且包含  A . 因它不包含邻域基  $\left\{U_{n}\right\}$  的元，故导致矛盾. 因此,  Y  不满足第一可数公理.

statement: There exist countable $\sigma$-compact spaces whose product is not $\sigma$-compact.
chinese_statement: 存在可数个  $\sigma$  紧空间,其积不是  $\sigma$  紧的.
rationale: For example, let $Z^{+}$ be the set of natural numbers with the discrete topology. Define $X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} Z_{i}^{+}$, where $Z_{i}^{+}=Z^{+}$, then $Z_{i}^{+}$ is $\sigma$-compact. It can be proved that X is not $\sigma$-compact. Suppose the opposite, that X is $\sigma$-compact, i.e., $X=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} Y_{k} $,  where $ Y_{k}(k=1,2, \cdots)$ are compact subsets of X. Let $P_{n}$ be the projection from X to $Z_{n}^{+}$, then $P_{n}$ is continuous, and thus $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$ is a compact subset of $Z_{n}^{+}$. Since $Z_{n}^{+}$ is a discrete topological space, $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$ must be a finite set. Let $m(n, k)$ be the maximum integer in $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$, then point $x=(m(1,1)+1, \cdots, m(n, n)+1, \cdots) \in X$, and $x \notin Y_{k}(k=1,2, \cdots)$, resulting in a contradiction. Therefore, X is not $\sigma$-compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  $Z^{+}$ 为自然数集, 并在  $Z^{+}$ 上取离散拓扑. 命$X=\prod_{i=1}^{\infty} Z_{i}^{+}$,其中  $Z_{i}^{+}=Z^{+}$ , 则  $Z_{i}^{+}$ 是  $\sigma$  紧的.兹证  X  不是  $\sigma$  紧的, 假如相反, 即  X  是  $\sigma$  紧的, 亦即$X=\bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} Y_{k} \text {, }其中  Y_{k}(k=1,2, \cdots)$  都是  X  的紧子集, 设  $P_{n}$  是  X  到  $Z_{n}^{+}$ 上的射影, 则  $P_{n}$  是连续的, 从而  $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$  是  $Z_{n}^{+}$ 的紧子集. 因  $Z_{n}^{+}$ 是离散的拓扑空间, 故  $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$  必为有限集. 令  $m(n, k)$  是  $P_{n}\left(Y_{k}\right)$  中的最大整数,则点$x=(m(1,1)+1, \cdots, m(n, n)+1, \cdots) \in X$,而  $x \notin Y_{k}(k=1,2, \cdots)$ ,此为矛盾. 因此,  X  不是  $\sigma$  紧的.

statement: There exist two completely normal spaces whose product space is not completely normal.
chinese_statement: 存在两个完全正规空间,其积空间并不完全正规.
rationale: Let X be the real line, and let $\mathscr{U}=\{[a, b) \mid a, b \in X\}$. It is easily shown that $\{[a, b) \mid a, b \in X\}$ is a neighborhood basis for X, which generates a topology $\tau$ on X making X a topological space. Thus, sets of the form $(-\infty, a),[a, b),[a,+\infty)$ are both open and closed. Since $(a, b)=U\{[a, b) \mid a<a<b\}$, $(a, b)$ is open. Similarly, sets of the form $(-\infty, a)$ and $(a,+\infty)$ are also open. Therefore, the topology $\tau$ is stronger than the Euclidean topology on X, making $(X, \tau)$ a Hausdorff space. Assume A and B are two separated subsets of X, i.e., $\bar{A} \cap B=A \cap \bar{B}=\varnothing$, since $X \backslash \bar{B}$ is open, for any $a \in X \backslash \bar{B}$, there exists $x_{a} \in X$ such that $\left[a, x_{a}\right) \subset X \backslash \bar{B}$. Define $O_{A}=\bigcup_{a \in A}\left[a, x_{a}\right)$, then $O_{A}$ is an open set containing A. Similarly, an open set containing B, $O_{B}$, can be defined. It can be shown that $O_{A} \cap O_{B}=\varnothing$. Suppose $O_{A} \cap O_{B} \neq \varnothing$, then there exist $a \in A, b \in B$ such that $\left[a, x_{a}\right) \cap\left[b, x_{b}\right) \neq \varnothing$. Without loss of generality, assume $a<b$, then $b \in\left[a, x_{a}\right) \subset X \backslash \bar B$. This is impossible. Thus, $O_{a} \cap O_{b} =\varnothing$, i.e., X is a $T_{5}$ space. Since X is also a Hausdorff space, it is completely normal. Let $Y=X \times X$. It can be shown that Y is not a normal space, thus not completely normal. For each point $p=(x, y) \in Y$, let the neighborhood basis of point p be $\{S(p, \varepsilon)\}$, where $S(p, \varepsilon)$ is a half-open square with lower left corner at point p and side $\varepsilon>0$. Let $L=\{(x, y) \mid y=-x\}$, then L is a closed subset of Y; moreover, since for $p \in L$, $L \cap S(p, \varepsilon)=\{p\}$, each singleton set in L is open under the relative topology. Thus, the relative topology on L is discrete. Therefore, if we let $K=\{(\alpha,-\alpha) \mid \alpha \text { is irrational }\}$, K and $L \backslash K$ are both closed subsets of Y, and $K \cap(L \backslash K)=\varnothing$. Now, it is shown that K and $L \backslash K$ cannot be separated by open sets, i.e., there do not exist open sets $O_{K}$ and $O_{L \backslash X}$ such that $K \subset O_{K}$ and $(L \backslash K) \subset O_{L \backslash K}$, and $O_{K} \cap O_{L \backslash K}=\varnothing$. In fact, for any open set U containing K, there exists a half-open square $S\left(p, \mu_{p}\right) \subset U$ with side $\mu_{p}$ for each point $p \in U \cap L$. Let $S_{n}=\left\{p \in K \mid \mu_{p}>1 / n \text  { and } S\left(p, \mu_{p}\right) \subset U\right\}$. Since $L=(L \backslash K) \bigcup \bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} S_{n}$, the family $(L \backslash K) \bigcup \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} S_{n}$ forms a countable cover of $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$, where $\tau^{*}$ is the Euclidean topology on L. Moreover, since $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$ is a Lindelöf space, there is at least one $S_{n_{0}}$, which is not nowhere dense in $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$. Therefore, there exists an open interval $(a, b)$ in L such that $(a, b) \subset \bar{S}_{n_{0}}$, where $\bar{S}_{n_{0}}$ is the closure of $S_{n_{0}}$ in $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$. Therefore, for any rational number r in $(a, b)$, every neighborhood of r intersects U, and hence K and $L \backslash K$ cannot be separated by open sets, i.e., $Y=X \times X$ is not a normal space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为实直线，令$\mathscr{U}=\{[a, b) \mid a, b \in X\}$ .易证,  $\{[a, b) \mid a, b \in X\}$  是  X  的一个邻域基, 这个邻域基生成  X  上的一个拓扑  $\tau$  而使  X  为一拓扑空间. 于是, 形如  $(-\infty, a),[a, b) ,  [a,+\infty)$  之集都是既开又闭的. 因$(a, b)=U\{[a, b) \mid a<a<b\}$,故  $(a, b)$  是开集. 同理, 形如  $(-\infty, a)$  与  $(a,+\infty)$  之集也都是开集.因此,拓扑  $\tau$  强于  X  上的欧氏拓扑, 从而  $(X, \tau)$  是 Hausdorff 空间.设  A  与  B  是  X  的两个分离子集, 即  $\bar{A} \cap B=A \cap \bar{B}=\varnothing$ , 因  $X \backslash \bar{B}$  是开集, 故任取  $a \in X \backslash \bar{B}$ , 存在  $x_{a} \in X$  而有  $\left[a, x_{a}\right) \subset X \backslash \bar{B}$ . 命$O_{A}=\bigcup_{a \in A}\left[a, x_{a}\right)$,则  $O_{A}$  是包含  A  的开集. 类似地, 可定义包含  B  的开集  $O_{B}$ .兹证  $O_{A} \cap O_{B}=\varnothing$ . 假如  $O_{A} \cap O_{B} \neq \varnothing$ , 则存在  $a \in A, b \in B$  而有$\left[a, x_{a}\right) \cap\left[b, x_{b}\right) \neq \varnothing$ .不妨假定  $a<b$ , 则  $b \in\left[a, x_{a}\right) \subset X \backslash \bar B$ . 这是不可能的. 因此,  $O_{a} \cap O_{b}   =\varnothing$ , 即  X  是  $T_{5}$  空间. 因  X  还是一个 Hausdorff 空间,故它是完全正规空间.令  $Y=X \times X$ . 可证  Y  不是正规空间, 从而也不是完全正规空间.对每一点  $p=(x, y) \in Y$ , 命点  p  的邻域基为  $\{S(p, \varepsilon)\}$ , 其中  $S(p, \varepsilon)$  是左下角为点  p  并以  $\varepsilon>0$  为边的半开正方形.令  $L=\{(x, y) \mid y=-x\}$ , 则  L  是  Y  的闭子集; 而且由于当  $p \in L$  时,  $L \cap S(p, \varepsilon)=\{p\}$ , 即在相对拓扑下,  L  上的每一点构成的单点集都是开集. 因此,  L  上的相对拓扑是离散拓扑.于是,若令$K=\{(\alpha,-\alpha) \mid \alpha \text { 为无理数 }\}$ ，则  K  与  $L \backslash K$  都是  Y  的闭子集,且$K \cap(L \backslash K)=\varnothing$ .今证  K  与  $L \backslash K$  不能被开集分离, 即不存在开集  $O_{K}$  与  $O_{L \backslash X}$  而有  $K \subset O_{K}$  与  $(L \backslash K) \subset O_{L \backslash K}$ , 且  $O_{K} \cap O_{L \backslash K}=\varnothing$ .事实上, 任取包含  K  的开集  U , 则对每一点  $p \in U \cap L$ , 存在以 $\mu_{p}$  为边的半开正方形  $S\left(p, \mu_{p}\right) \subset U$ . 令$S_{n}=\left\{p \in K \mid \mu_{p}>1 / n \text { 且 } S\left(p, \mu_{p}\right) \subset U\right\}$ .因  $L=(L \backslash K) \bigcup \bigcup_{k=1}^{\infty} S_{n}$ , 故集族  $(L \backslash K) \bigcup \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} S_{n}$  构成了  $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$  的一个可数覆盖, 其中  $\tau^{*}$  是  L  上的欧氏拓扑. 又因  $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$  是第二纲集, 故  $\left\{S_{n}\right\}$  中至少有一个  $S_{n_{0}}$ , 它在  $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$  中不是无处稠密的. 于是, 在  L 中存在开区间  $(a, b)$  而有  $(a, b) \subset \bar{S}_{n_{0}}$ , 这里  $\bar{S}_{n_{0}}$  是  $S_{n_{0}}$  在  $\left(L, \tau^{*}\right)$  中的闭包. 因此, 对  $(a, b)$  中的任意有理数  r, r  的每个邻域都与  U  相交,故  K  与  $L \backslash K$  不能被开集分离, 即  $Y=X \times X$  不是正规空间.

statement: There exists a Lindelöf space that is not $\sigma$-compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Lindelöf 空间, 它不是  $\sigma$  紧的.
rationale: For example, let X be an uncountable set, and define the open sets of X as the set X itself, the empty set $\varnothing$, and the complements of all at most countable subsets. Since the complement of each open set in X is at most countable, X is a Lindelöf space. Furthermore, since only finite sets in X are compact, X cannot be $\sigma$-compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如，设  X  为一不可数集, 命  X  的开集为  X  本身,空集  $\varnothing$ , 以及补集为至多可数的一切子集. 因  X  的每个开集的补集都是至多可数的,故  X  是 Lindelöf 空间. 又因  X  中只有有限集才是紧的，故  X  不可能是  $\sigma$  紧的.

statement: There exists a strongest linear topology which is not locally convex.
chinese_statement: 存在某个最强的线性拓扑, 它不是局部凸的.
rationale: For example, let X be an infinite-dimensional linear space, and let $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}} \mid \alpha \in A\right\}$ be a Hamel basis for X. Then $\left\{\left.x\left|x=\sum \lambda_{\alpha } e_{\alpha}, \sum\right| \lambda_{\alpha}\right|^{1 / 2} \leqslant 1\right\}$ is a neighborhood of point o under the strongest linear topology on X, but it does not contain a balanced convex set around point o. Thus, this strongest linear topology is not locally convex.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  X  为一不可数维的线性空间, 并设  $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}} \mid \alpha \in A\right\}$  为  X  的一个 Hamel 基,则$\left\{\left.x\left|x=\sum \lambda_{\alpha } e_{\alpha}, \sum\right| \lambda_{\alpha}\right|^{1 / 2} \leqslant 1\right\}$是  X  上最强的线性拓扑之下  o  点的邻域,但它并不包含有  o  点的平衡凸集,故这个最强的线性拓扑不是局部凸的.

statement: There exists a countable quasi-barrelled space (and thus a $\sigma$ quasi-barrelled space) that is not a $\sigma$ barrelled space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个可数拟桶空间（因而是$\sigma$拟桶空间）,它不是$\sigma$桶空间.
rationale: Let $\varphi=R^{(N)}$ be a finite sequence space, equipped with the supremum norm topology, then $\varphi$ is a bornological space (a metrizable locally convex space is always a bornological space), therefore it is a quasi-barrelled space and certainly a countable quasi-barrelled space. On the other hand, if a locally convex space is both a quasi-barrelled space and a $\sigma$ barrelled space, then it must be a barrelled space. However, $\varphi$ is not a barrelled space, thus it is also not a $\sigma$ barrelled space.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\varphi=R^{(N)}$  是有限序列空间,并在  $\varphi$  上取上确界范数拓扑,则  $\varphi$  为一囿空间（可度量化的局部凸空间必是囿空间）从而是拟桶空间,当然也是可数拟桶空间. 另一方面, 如果一个局部凸空间既是拟桶空间，又是  $\sigma$  桶空间，那么它必然是一个桶空间. 但是$\varphi$  不是桶空间,故它也不是  $\sigma$  桶空间.

statement: There exist non-closed arc-connected components.
chinese_statement: 存在不闭的弧状连通区.
rationale: We know that the connected components of a topological space must be closed sets in that space. However, the arc-connected components of a topological space need not be closed sets. For example, let $Y=\{(x, y) \mid y=\sin (1 / x), 0<x \leqslant 1\}$, $\bar{Y}$ denotes the closure of Y in the usual topology of the real plane, and consider the relative topology on $\bar{Y}$, then Y is an arc-connected component of $\bar{Y}$, but it is not closed in $\bar{Y}$.
chinese_rationale: 我们知道, 拓扑空间的连通区一定是该空间的闭集. 但是, 拓扑空间的弧状连通区不必是该空间的闭集. 例如 , 设$Y=\{(x, y) \mid y=\sin (1 / x), 0<x \leqslant 1\}$, $\bar{Y}$  表  Y  在取通常拓扑的实平面中的闭包,并在  $\bar{Y}$  上取相对拓扑,则  Y  是  $\bar{Y}$  的孤状连通区, 但它在  $\bar{Y}$  中不是闭的.

statement: There exists a semicontinuous but discontinuous mapping.
chinese_statement: 存在半连续而不连续的映射.
rationale: Every continuous mapping must be semicontinuous, but the converse is not true. For example: let $X=Y=[0,1]$ with the usual topology. Let $f: X \rightarrow Y$ be $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1, 0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}, \\0, \frac{1}{2}<x \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$ Then $f$ is a semicontinuous but not continuous mapping from $X$ to $Y$.
chinese_rationale: 连续映射必为半连续映射, 但逆命题并不成立. 例如:设  $X=Y=[0,1]$  并取通常拓扑. 令  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  为$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}1,0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}, \\0, \frac{1}{2}<x \leqslant 1 .\end{array}\right.$则  f  是  X  到  Y  的半连续而不连续的映射.

statement: There exists a topological space that is hereditarily normal but not perfectly normal.
chinese_statement: 存在族正规而不完全族正规的拓扑空间.
rationale: Let $I=[0,1]$ with the usual topology, and let $I_{i}$ be a copy of $I$. Define $X=\prod_{i \in I} I_{i}$ and equip $X$ with the product topology. Then $X$ is a compact Hausdorff space, hence $X$ is also a normal space. Let $Z^{+}$ be the set of natural numbers with the discrete topology, and let $Z_{i}^{+}$ be a copy of $Z^{+}$. Define $A=\left\{1 / n \in I \mid n \in Z^{+}\right\}$, where $A_{i}$ is a copy of $A$. Since the subspace topology on $A$ is homeomorphic to the discrete topology on $Z^{+}$, $X$ contains a subspace $Y=\prod_{i \in I} A_{i}$ that is homeomorphic to $\prod_{i \in I} Z_{i}^{+}$. Thus, $Y$ is a non-normal subspace of $X$, meaning $X$ is not perfectly normal. Therefore, $X$ is also not perfectly hereditarily normal. However, it can be proven that $X$ is hereditarily normal.
chinese_rationale: 设  $I=[0,1]$  并取通常拓扑,  $I_{i}$  是  I  的副本. 令$X=\prod_{i \in I} I_{i} \text {, }$并在  X  上取积拓扑, 则  X  是紧的 Hausdorff 空间, 从而  X  也是正规空间.设  $Z^{+}$ 为自然数集，并在  $Z^{+}$ 上取离散拓扑，  $Z_{i}^{+}$ 是  $Z^{+}$ 的副本.令$A=\left\{1 / n \in I \mid n \in Z^{+}\right\}$, $A_{i}$  是  A  的副本. 因  A  上的相对拓扑同胚于  $Z^{+}$ 上的离散拓扑,故  X 包含一个子空间  $Y=\prod_{i \in I} A_{i}$ , 它同胚于  $\prod_{i \in I} Z_{i}^{+}$ . 于是,  Y  是  X  的一个非正规的子空间, 从而  X  不是完全正规的. 因此,  X  也不是完全族正规空间. 然而可以证明,  X  族正规的.

statement: There exists a topological space X, in which every non-empty subset is dense in X.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间  X , 其中每个非空子集在  X  中都是稠密的.
rationale: Consider the trivial topology on set X, then for any $A \subset X$, we have $\bar{A}=X$, where $A \neq \varnothing$.
chinese_rationale: 在集  X  上取平庸拓补, 则对任意  $A \subset X$ , 都有  $\bar{A}=X$ , 其中  $A   \neq \varnothing$ .

statement: There exists a one-to-one closed mapping whose inverse mapping is not a closed mapping.
chinese_statement: 存在某个一对一的闭映射, 其逆映射不是闭映射.
rationale: Let $X=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}, Y=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\} \cup\{2\}$, and consider the usual topology on both X and Y. Define $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x, & 0 \leqslant x<1, \\2, & x=1 .\end{array}\right.$. It is clear that f is a one-to-one mapping from X to Y, and f maps every closed set in X to a closed set in Y, i.e., f is a closed mapping. However, the inverse mapping $x=f^{-1}(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}y, 0 \leqslant y<1, \\1, y=2 .\end{array}\right.$ is not a closed mapping, because it maps the closed set $[0,1)$ in Y to the non-closed set $[0,1)$ in X.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}, Y=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\} \cup\{2\}$ , 并在  X  与  Y  上都取通常拓扑。令$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}x, & 0 \leqslant x<1, \\2, & x=1 .\end{array}\right.$易见,  f  是  X  到  Y  上的一对一的映射, 且  f  把  X  中的每一闭集映成  Y  中的闭集, 即  f  是闭映射. 但逆映射$x=f^{-1}(y)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}y, 0 \leqslant y<1, \\1, y=2 .\end{array}\right.$不是闭映射,因为它映  Y  中的闭集  $[0,1)$  为  X  中的非闭集  $[0,1)$ .

statement: There exists a linear mapping that is continuous but not strongly bounded.
chinese_statement: 存在连续而不强有界的线性映射.
rationale: For example, consider the distance $d(x, y)=\frac{|x-y|}{1+|x-y|}, x, y \in R$ on the linear space R. Then $(R, d)$ is a linear metric space. Let $f(x)=x$, then f is a continuous linear functional on $(R, d)$ and $|f(x)|=|x|$. For this linear functional f, there does not exist a positive number M such that for all $x \in R$, $|f(x)| \leqslant M d(x, o)$, i.e., $|x| \leqslant M|x| /(1+|x|)$. In fact, for any natural number n, take $x_{n}=n$, then it always holds that $\left|f\left(x_{n}\right)\right|=\left|x_{n}\right|>n \cdot \frac{\left|x_{n}\right|}{1+\left|x_{n}\right|}=n d\left(x_{n}, 0\right)$.
chinese_rationale: 例如,在线性空间  R  上取距离$d(x, y)=\frac{|x-y|}{1+|x-y|}, x, y \in R$,则  $(R, d)$  为一线性度量空间. 令  $f(x)=x$ , 则  f  是  $(R, d)$  上的连续线性泛函, 且  $|f(x)|=|x|$ . 对于这个线性泛函  f , 不存在正数  M ,使对一切  $x \in R$ , 都有$|f(x)| \leqslant M d(x, o)$,即$|x| \leqslant M|x| /(1+|x|)$ .事实上, 对任意自然数  n , 取  $x_{n}=n$ , 则恒有$\left|f\left(x_{n}\right)\right|=\left|x_{n}\right|>n \cdot \frac{\left|x_{n}\right|}{1+\left|x_{n}\right|}=n d\left(x_{n}, 0\right)$ .

statement: There exist two convex compact sets A and B in a locally convex Hausdorff space, such that $\operatorname{ext}(A+B) \neq \operatorname{ext}(A)+\operatorname{ext}(B)$.
chinese_statement: 存在一个局部凸 Hausdorff 空间中的两个凸紧集  A  与  B , 使  $\operatorname{ext}(A+B) \neq \operatorname{ext}(A)+\operatorname{ext}(B)$ .
rationale: Let A, B be non-empty convex compact subsets in a locally convex Hausdorff space X, then $A \times B$ is a compact subset in $X \times X$, and $\operatorname{ext}(A \times B)=\operatorname{ext}(A) \times \operatorname{ext}(B)$. It is also easy to prove that $A+B=\{x+y \mid x \in A, y \in B\}$ is a non-empty convex compact subset in X, and $\operatorname{ext}(A+B) \subset \operatorname{ext}(A)+\operatorname{ext}(B)$. Note that this inclusion is generally strict.
chinese_rationale: 设  A, B  是局部凸 Hausdorff 空间  X  中非空凸紧子集, 则  $A \times B$  是  $X \times X$  中的紧子集,且$\operatorname{ext}(A \times B)=\operatorname{ext}(A) \times \operatorname{ext}(B)$ .又容易证明,  $A+B=\{x+y \mid x \in A, y \in B\}$  是  X  中的非空凸紧子集,且$\operatorname{ext}(A+B) \subset \operatorname{ext}(A)+\operatorname{ext}(B)$应当注意,这个包含关系一般是严格的.

statement: There exists a locally convex space that is complete and bounded, but it is not a sequence barrel space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个有界完备的局部凸空间, 它不是序列桶空间.
rationale: Let $\omega$ be the linear space composed of all sequences. Then let $\alpha$ be the set of all such sequences $\left\{a_{i}\right\}$ such that $a_{i}=0$ or $a_{i}=1$, and $\frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_{i} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$. Let $\omega_{0}=\left\{a x=\left\{a_{i} x_{i}\right\} \mid a=\left\{a_{i}\right\} \in \alpha, x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in \omega\right\}$, and use $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\# }, \omega\right)$ to represent the normal topology on $\omega^{\#}$. Then we have (A) $\beta\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)=\beta\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega\right)$; (B) $\sigma\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right) \leqslant|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right) \leqslant r\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$. Therefore, a subset of $\omega^{\#}$ is bounded in $\sigma\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$ if and only if it is bounded in $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$. (C) Every $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$-bounded subset of $\omega^{\#}$ is $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega\right)$-bounded.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\omega$  是一切数列所组成的线性空间, 再设  $\alpha$  是一切这样的数列  $\left\{a_{i}\right\}$  所组成的集合, 使得  $a_{i}=0$  或  $a_{i}=1$ , 且$\frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_{i} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty)$ .令  $\omega_{0}=\left\{a x=\left\{a_{i} x_{i}\right\} \mid a=\left\{a_{i}\right\} \in \alpha, x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in \omega\right\}$ , 并用  $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\# }, \omega\right)$ 代表  $\omega^{\#}$  上的正规拓扑, 则有(A)  $\beta\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)=\beta\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega\right)$ ;(B)  $\sigma\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right) \leqslant|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right) \leqslant r\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$ .因此,为使  $\omega^{\#}$  的子集是  $\sigma\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$  有界的当且仅当它是  $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$  有界的.(C)  $\omega^{\#}$  的每个  $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega_{0}\right)$  有界子集是  $|\sigma|\left(\omega^{\#}, \omega\right)$  有界的.

statement: First countable spaces and Hausdorff spaces do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: 第一可数空间与 Hausdorff 空间互不蕴涵.
rationale:
First example: A first countable space that is not a Hausdorff space. Let X be a set, and take the trivial topology on X. Then the topological space X has the desired property.
Second example: A Hausdorff space that is not a first countable space. Let X be an uncountable set, and fix $a \in X$. $	au$ consists of all such subsets V of X such that $X  ackslash V$ is finite or $a

(ii) $(X, 	au)$ is not a first countable space. Suppose the contrary, that is, assume $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in Night\}$ is a countable local base at point a. Since for each $n \in N, X  ackslash V_n$ is finite, $X  ackslash  igcap_{n=1}^{\infty} V_{n}= igcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(X  ackslash V_{n}ight)$ is countable. Since X is uncountable, there exists a point $y \in  igcup_{n=1}^{\infty} V_{n}$ such that $y 
eq a$. Thus, $X  ackslash\{y\}$ is a neighborhood of a, so for some $m \in N$ we have $V_{m} \subset X  ackslash\{y\}$. However, this is impossible because $y \in V_{m}$. Hence, $(X, 	au)$ is not a first countable space.

第二例: 一个 Hausdorff 空间, 它不是第一可数空间.设  X  为一不可数集, 取定  $a \in x$ . $	au$  为  X  的一切这样的子集  V 所组成, 使得  $X  ackslash V$  是有限集或者  $a

eq z$ , 则  y  与  z  中至少有一个不同于  a , 不妨设  $y 
eq a$ , 则单点集  $\{y\}$  与  $X  ackslash\{y\}$  分别为  y  与  z  的两个不相交的邻域. 因此,  $(X, 	au)$  是 Hausdorff 空间.(ii)  $(X, 	au)$  不是第一可数空间.假如相反, 即设  $\left\{V_{n} \mid n \in Night\}$  是点  a  的一个可数的拓扑基. 因对每一  $n \in N, X  ackslash V_n$  是有限集, 故$X  ackslash  igcap_{n=1}^{\infty} V_{n}= igcup_{n=1}^{\infty}\left(X  ackslash V_{n}ight)$是可数的. 又因  X  不可数, 故存在点  $y \in  igcup_{n=1}^{\infty} V_{n}$ , 使得  $y
