eq \varnothing$ . 事实上, 假如  $A \cap B=\varnothing$ , 则  $A \subset X  ackslash B$ , 而  $A \in 	au$, A  应不可数; 又因  $B \in 	au$ , 故  $X  ackslash B$ 应至多可数, 从而  A  应至多可数,此为矛盾. 因此,  $	au$  中任何两个非空开集都是相交的, 可见  $(X, 	au)$  满足可数链条件. 但它不是可分的,因为所有可数子集都是  $(X, 	au)$  中的闭的真子集,故可数子集在  $(X, 	au)$  中并不稠密.

statement: There exist two topologies $\tau_{1}$ and $\tau_{2}$ on a set X, such that if $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges to x under $\tau_{1}$, it necessarily implies that $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ converges to x under $\tau_{2}$, but $\tau_{1}$ is not stronger than $\tau_{2}$.
chinese_statement: 存在某个集 X 上的两个拓扑$\tau_{1}$与$\tau_{2}$，凡$\left\{x_{n}\right\}$依$\tau_{1}$收敛于x必蕴涵  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  依  $\tau_{2}$  收敛于  x , 但  $\tau_{1}$  并不强于  $\tau_{2}$ .
rationale: It is easy to prove that if $d_{1}$ and $d_{2}$ are two metrics on the set X, then $d_{1}$ is stronger than $d_{2}$ if and only if $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(d_{1}\right)$ implies $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(d_{2}\right)$. In the topological spaces $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ and $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$, if $\tau_{1}$ is stronger than $\tau_{2}$, then when $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{1}\right)$, it must be that $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{2}\right)$, but the converse is not true. For example: Let $X=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}$, and define the non-empty open sets of X as $X \backslash C$, where C is any at most countable subset of X. This collection of open sets forms a topology $\tau_{1}$ on X. On X, also consider the discrete topology $\tau_{2}$. It is easy to see that $\tau_{1}$ is strictly weaker than $\tau_{2}$. Let $x_{n}, x \in X$, and assume $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{1}\right)$, then there exists a natural number $n_{0}$, such that for $n \geqslant n_{0}$, $x_{n}=x$. In fact, if not, then from the $\tau_{1}$ neighborhood $U=\left(X \backslash\left\{x_{n}\right\}\right) \cup\{x\}$ of x, it follows that x is not the limit of sequence $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ under topology $\tau_{1}$, which is a contradiction. Therefore, when $n \geqslant n_{0}$, $x_{n}=x$, hence $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{2}\right)$.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明,若  $d_{1}$  与  $d_{2}$  是集  X  上的两个距离, 则  $d_{1}$  强于  $d_{2}$  当且仅当  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(d_{1}\right)$  蕴涵  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(d_{2}\right)$ . 在拓扑空间  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  与  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ 中, 若  $\tau_{1}$  强于  $\tau_{2}$ , 则当  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{1}\right)$  时, 必有  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{2}\right)$ , 但逆命题并不成立. 例如：设$X=\{x \mid 0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\}$,命  X  的非空开集为  $X \backslash C$ , 其中  C  是  X  的任一至多可数集. 如此确定的开集族形成  X  的一个拓扑  $\tau_{1}$ . 又在  X  上取离散拓扑  $\tau_{2}$ . 易见，$\tau_{1}$严格弱于$\tau_{2}$.设  $x_{n}, x \in X$ , 且  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{1}\right)$ , 则存在自然数  $n_{0}$ , 当  $n \geqslant n_{0}$  时  $x_{n}=x$ . 事实上, 假如不然, 则由  x  的  $\tau_{1}$  邻域$U=\left(X \backslash\left\{x_{n}\right\}\right) \cup\{x\}$推知,  x  不是序列  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  在拓扑  $\tau_{1}$  之下的极限, 此为矛盾. 因此, 当  $n \geqslant n_{0}$  时  $x_{n}=x$ , 以而  $x_{n} \rightarrow x\left(\tau_{2}\right)$ .

statement: There exists an inseparable locally convex space, each of whose bounded subsets is separable.
chinese_statement: 存在某个不可分的局部凸空间, 它的每个有界子集都是可分的.
rationale: Consider the strongest locally convex topology $\tau$ on the linear space $l^{\infty}$, then $\left(l^{\infty}, \tau\right)$ is an inseparable locally convex space. Moreover, each bounded subset in $\left(l^{\infty}, \tau\right)$ is finite-dimensional, hence it is separable.
chinese_rationale: 在线性空间  $l^{\infty}$  上取最强的局部凸拓扑  $\tau$ , 则  $\left(l^{\infty}, \tau\right)$  为一不可分的局部凸空间. 又,  $\left(l^{\infty}, \tau\right)$  中每个有界子集都是有限维的，从而它是可分的.

statement: There exists a mapping from one topological space to another that is open, but neither continuous nor closed.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间到另一个拓扑空间上的映射, 它是开的, 但既不是连续的也不是闭的.
rationale: Let $(X, \tau)$ be the real plane, where the topology $\tau$ consists of the empty set $\varnothing$ and complements of at most countable sets; $(Y, \sigma)$ is the set of real numbers R, where the topology $\sigma$ consists of the empty set $\varnothing$ and complements of finite sets. Define the mapping as the projection $P:(x, y) \rightarrow x$. Thus, P is open because any non-empty open set in $(X, \tau)$ must contain a horizontal line, whose image is R. On the other hand, P is not closed because the set of points $(n, 0)$ for $n \in R$ is closed in $(X, \tau)$, but its image is not closed in $(Y, \sigma)$. Moreover, any open set in $(Y, \sigma)$, if it is a proper subset of Y, its preimage cannot be an open set in $(X, \tau)$, hence P is not continuous.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(X, \tau)$  是实平面, 其拓扑  $\tau$  由空集  $\varnothing$  以及至多可数集的补集组成;  $(Y, \sigma)$  为实数集  R , 其拓扑  $\sigma$  由空集  $\varnothing$  以及有限集的补集组成, 再设映射为射影  $P:(x, y) \rightarrow x$ .于是,  P  是开的, 这是因为  $(X, \tau)$  内的任一非空开集必定包含有一条水平直线, 它的像是  R . 另一方面,  P  不是闭的,因为  $n \in R$ 的点  $(n, 0)$  的集在  $(X, \tau)$  内是闭的, 但是它的像在  $(Y, \sigma)$  内不是闭的. 又因为  $(Y, \sigma)$  内任一开集, 假如它是  Y  的真子集,那么它的原像在  $(X, \tau)$  内不能是开集, 所以  P  不是连续的.

statement: There exists a derived set of some set that is not a closed set.
chinese_statement: 存在某个集的导集, 它不是闭集.
rationale: In a $T_{1}$ space, the derived set of a set must be a closed set. In general topological spaces, the derived set of a set is not necessarily a closed set. For example: Let $X=\{a, b, c\}$ and $\tau=\{X,\{a\},\{b, c\}, \varnothing\}$, then $(X,\tau)$ is a topological space. Take $A=\{b\}$, it is evident that $A^{\prime}=\{c\}$, and $A^{\prime}$ is not a closed set.
chinese_rationale: 在  $T_{1}$  空间内,一个集的导集必为闭集. 在一般的拓扑空间内,一个集的导集未必是闭集. 例如： 设  $X=\{a, b, c\}$ ,令$\tau=\{X,\{a\},\{b, c\}, \varnothing\}$,则  $(X,\tau)$  为一拓扑空间. 取  $A=\{b\}$ , 易见,  $A^{\prime}=\{c\}$ , 且  $A^{\prime}$  不是闭集.

statement: The pointwise limit of a sequence of semicontinuous mappings is necessarily semicontinuous.
chinese_statement: 半连续映射序列的逐点极限一定半连续.
rationale: Let $X=Y=[0,1]$ with the usual topology, the mapping $f_{n}: X \rightarrow Y$ is defined as $f_{n}(x)=x^{n}, n=1,2, \cdots.$ $f_{0}: X \rightarrow Y$ is the pointwise limit of $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$. Here $f_{0}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0,0 \leqslant x<1 \\1, x=1 .\end{array}\right.$ but $f_{0}$ is not semicontinuous, because $\left(\frac{1}{2}, 1\right]$ is an open set in Y, while $f_{0}^{-1}\left(\left(\frac{1}{2}, 1\right]\right)=\{1\}$ is not half-open in X.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=Y=[0,1]$  并取通常拓扑，映射  $f_{n}: X \rightarrow Y$  定义为$f_{n}(x)=x^{n}, n=1,2, \cdots .$ $f_{0}: X \rightarrow Y$  是  $\left\{f_{n}\right\}$  的逐点极限. 这里$f_{0}(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}0,0 \leqslant x<1 \\1, x=1 .\end{array}\right.$但  $f_{0}$  不是半连续的, 因为  $\left(\frac{1}{2}, 1\right]$  是  Y  中的一个开集, 而  $f_{0}^{-1}\left(\left(\frac{1}{2}, 1\right]\right)=\{1\}$  在  X  中不是半开的.

statement: There exists a locally convex space with property (c) that is not a $\sigma$-barrelled space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个具有性质  (c)  的局部凸空间, 它不是  $\sigma$ 桶空间.
rationale: Let X be an infinite-dimensional linear space, and $X^{\#}$ be the algebraic dual of X. Since every $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$ bounded subset of $X^{\#}$ is $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$ relatively compact, $(X, \sigma(X, \left.X^{\#}\right))$ has property (c). We demonstrate that $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$ is not a $\sigma$-barrelled space. To do this, let B be any Hamel basis of X, and $B_{0}$ be a countable subset of B. For $x \in B_{0}$, let $f_{x}$ be a linear functional on X such that when $y \in B \backslash\{x\}$, $f_{x}(y)=0$, and $f_{x}(x)=1$. Then, the set $A=\left\{f_{x} \mid x \in B_{0}\right\}$ is a countable $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$ bounded subset of $X^{\#}$, and $A^{0}$ does not contain a finite-codimensional subspace of X. Therefore, A is not equicontinuous, thus $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$ is not a $\sigma$-barrelled space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一个无穷维线性空间,  $X^{\#}$  是  X  的代数对偶. 因  $X^{\#}$  的每个  $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$  有界子集都是  $\sigma\left(X^{\#}, X\right)$  相对紧的, 故  $(X, \sigma(X ,  \left.X^{\#}\right)  )$具有性质 (c) .兹证  $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right.  )$不是  $\sigma$  桶空间. 为此, 设  B  为  X  的任意一个 Hamel 基,  $B_{0}$  为  B  的可数子集. 对  $x \in B_{0}$ , 设  $f_{x}$  是  X  上的线性泛函,使当  $y \in B \backslash\{x\}$  时,  $f_{x}(y)=0$ ,而  $f_{x}(x)=1$ . 于是, 集$A=\left\{f_{x} \mid x \in B_{0}\right\}$是  $X^{\#}$  的可数  $\sigma\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)$  有界子集, 并且  $A^{0}$  不包含  X  的有限余维子空间. 因此,  A  不是等度连续的, 从而  $\left(X, \sigma\left(X, X^{\#}\right)\right)$  不是  $\sigma$  桶空间.

statement: There exists a subnet of a sequence that is not a subsequence.
chinese_statement: 存在某个序列的子网, 它不是子序列.
rationale: Any subsequence of a sequence is a subnet. However, a subnet of a sequence is not necessarily a subsequence. For example, let X denote all positive real numbers and order X by size. For each $t \in X$, let $[t]$ represent the largest integer not greater than t. It is clear that $\left\{x_{[t]} \mid t \in X\right\}$ is a subnet of the sequence $\left\{x_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$, but it is not a subsequence.
chinese_rationale: 序列的任何子列都是子网. 但是, 序列的子网末必是子列. 例如:我们用  X  表示正实数的全体,并在  X  上以大小定序. 对每一  $t \in X$ , 令  $[t]$  代表不大于  t  的最大整数. 易见,  $\left\{x_{[t]} \mid t \in\right.   X\}$  是序列  $\left\{x_{n} \mid n \in N\right\}$  的一个子网,但它不是一个序列.

statement: There exist two closed subspaces in a linear topological space whose sum is not closed.
chinese_statement: 存在一个线性拓扑空间中的两个闭子空间,其和不闭.
rationale: Let $X=C[-1,1]$ represent the linear space composed of all continuous functions defined on $[-1,1]$. For $x, y \in X$, let $(x, y)=\int_{-1}^{1} x(t) y(t) \mathrm{d} t$, and let $\begin{array}{l}M_{1}=\{x \in X \mid \text{when } t \leqslant 0 \text{, } x(t)=0\}, \\M_{2}=\{x \in X \mid \text{when } t \geqslant 0 \text{, } x(t)=0\},\end{array}$ then $M_{1}, M_{2}$ are both closed subspaces of X, and $M_{1} \cap M_{2}=\{0\}, M_{1} \perp M_{2} \text{.}$ It is hereby shown that $M_{1}+M_{2}=\left\{x+y \mid x \in M_{1}, y \in M_{2}\right\}$ is not closed. For this, let $x(t) \equiv 1$, and let $\begin{array}{l}x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0, & t \leqslant 0, \\n t, & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1 / n, \\1, & 1 / n \leqslant t \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right. \\y_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & -1 \leqslant t \leqslant-1 / n, \\-n t, & -1 / n \leqslant t \leqslant 0, \\0, & t \geqslant 0,\end{array}\right.\end{array}$ then $x_{n}+y_{n} \in M_{1}+M_{2}$, and $\begin{array}{c}\int_{-1}^{1}\left|x(t)-x_{n}(t)-y_{\mathrm{n}}(t)\right|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t=\int_{-\frac{1}{n}}^{0}|1+n t|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t \\+\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}|1-n t|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t=\frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{array}$ Hence, $x \in \overline{M_{1}+M_{2}}$. But $x \in X$ and $x \notin M_{1}+M_{2}$, so $M_{1}+M_{2}$ is not closed.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=C[-1,1]$  代表定义在  $[-1,1]$  上的一切连续函数所组成的线性空间. 对  $x, y \in X$ , 令$(x, y)=\int_{-1}^{1} x(t) y(t) \mathrm{d} t$,并令$\begin{array}{l}M_{1}=\{x \in X \mid \text { 当 } t \leqslant 0 \text { 时 } x(t)=0\}, \\M_{2}=\{x \in X \mid \text { 当 } t \geqslant 0 \text { 时 } x(t)=0\},\end{array}$则  $M_{1}, M_{2}$  皆为  X  的闭子空间, 而且$M_{1} \cap M_{2}=\{0\}, M_{1} \perp M_{2} \text {. }$兹证  $M_{1}+M_{2}=\left\{x+y \mid x \in M_{1}, y \in M_{2}\right\}$  不闭. 为此, 令  $x(t) \equiv  1$ , 再令$\begin{array}{l}x_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}0, & t \leqslant 0, \\n t, & 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1 / n, \\1, & 1 / n \leqslant t \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right. \\y_{n}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}1, & -1 \leqslant t \leqslant-1 / n, \\-n t, & -1 / n \leqslant t \leqslant 0, \\0, & t \geqslant 0,\end{array}\right.\end{array}$则  $x_{n}+y_{n} \in M_{1}+M_{2}$ , 且$\begin{array}{c}\int_{-1}^{1}\left|x(t)-x_{n}(t)-y_{\mathrm{n}}(t)\right|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t=\int_{-\frac{1}{n}}^{0}|1+n t|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t \\+\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{n}}|1-n t|^{2} \mathrm{~d} t=\frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1}{n} \rightarrow 0(n \rightarrow \infty) .\end{array}$因此,  $x \in \overline{M_{1}+M_{2}}$ . 但  $x \in X$  而  $x \notin M_{1}+M_{2}$ , 故  $M_{1}+M_{2}$  不闭.

statement: In $R^{2}$, there exist two locally compact subspaces which are not locally compact.
chinese_statement: 存在$R^{2}$  中存在两个局部紧的子空间, 其并不是局部紧的.
rationale: Let $A=\left\{(x, y) \mid(x, y) \in R^{2}, x>0\right\}, B=\{(0,0)\}$. Then both A and B are locally compact subspaces in the two-dimensional Euclidean space $R^{2}$. Since the point $(0,0)$ has no compact neighborhood in $A \cup B$, $A \cup B$ is not locally compact.
chinese_rationale: 令  $A=\left\{(x, y) \mid(x, y) \in R^{2}, x>0\right\}, B=\{(0,0)\}$ , 则  A  与  B  都是二维欧氏空间  $R^{2}$  中的局部紧的子空间. 因点  $(0,0)$  在  $A \cup B$  中没有紧的邻域，故  $A \cup B$  不是局部紧的.

statement: There exists a non-regular space where every proper subspace is regular.
chinese_statement: 存在某个非正规空间, 它的每个真子空间都是正规的.
rationale: Let $X=\{1,2,3\}$, and $\tau=\{\varnothing,\{1,2,3\},\{1,2\},\{2,3\},\{2\}\}$, then the closed subsets of X are $\varnothing, X,\{3\},\{1\},\{1,3\}$. Obviously, the only non-empty disjoint closed proper subsets are $\{3\}$ and $\{1\}$. The open sets containing $\{3\}$ and $\{1\}$ must intersect, so X is not a regular space. However, every proper subspace of X is obviously regular.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=\{1,2,3\}$ , 令$\tau=\{\varnothing,\{1,2,3\},\{1,2\},\{2,3\}\{2\}\}$,则  X  的闭子集为  $\varnothing, X,\{3\},\{1\},\{1,3\}$ . 显然, 不相交的非空闭的真子集只有  $\{3\}$  与  $\{1\}$ . 分别包含  $\{3\}$  与  $\{1\}$  的开集必相交, 故  X  不是正规空间. 然而,  X  的每个真子空间显然都是正规的.

statement: First countable spaces and Lindelöf spaces do not imply each other.
chinese_statement: 第一可数空间与 Lindelöf 空间互不蕴涵.
rationale:
It can be proven that a second countable space must be a Lindelöf space. However, a first countable space is not necessarily a Lindelöf space, and a Lindelöf space is not necessarily a first countable space. 
Example 1: A first countable space that is not a Lindelöf space. Let X be an uncountable set with the discrete topology on X, then X is a first countable space, but it is not a Lindelöf space.
Example 2: A Lindelöf space that is not a first countable space. Let X be an uncountable set with the cofinite topology on X, i.e., the non-empty open sets of X are $X \backslash C$, where C is a finite set. Clearly, X is a Lindelöf space. However, X is not a first countable space. In fact, if there exists a countable base at point $x \in X$, then there must be a countable collection of open sets $\mathscr{B}_{x}$ that every open neighborhood of x includes some $B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}$. Thus, $\bigcup_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}} B= \{x\}$, leading to $X \backslash\{x\}=x \backslash \bigcap_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}} B=\bigcup_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}}(X \backslash B)$. Since each $X \backslash B$ is a finite set, $X \backslash\{x\}$ is at most countable, which contradicts the condition that X is an uncountable set. Thus, X is not a first countable space.
chinese_rationale:
可以证明,第二可数空间必是 Lindelöf 空间. 但是,第一可数空间未必是 Lindelöf 空间,Lindelöf 空间也未必是第一可数空间. 
第一例: 一个第一可数空间, 它不是 Lindelöf 空间.设  X  为一不可数集, 在  X  上取离散拓扑, 则  X  是第一可数空间,但它不是 Lindelöf 空间.
第二例: 一个 Lindelöf 空间, 它不是第一可数空间.设  X  为一不可数集, 在  X  上取有限补拓扑, 即  X  的非空开集为  $X \backslash C$ , 其中  C  为有限集.显然,  X  是 Lindelöf 空间. 然而,  X  不是第一可数空间. 事实上,假如在点  $x \in X$  存在可数的拓扑基, 则必有含有点  x  的可数的开集族  $\mathscr{B}_{x}$ , 便  x  的每个开邻域包含某个  $B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}$ . 因此，  $\bigcup_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}} B=   \{x\}$ , 从而得到$X \backslash\{x\}=x \backslash \bigcap_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}} B=\bigcup_{B \in \mathscr{B}_{x}}(X \backslash B)$ .因每个  $X \backslash B$  为有限集, 故  $X \backslash\{x\}$  为一至多可数集, 这与  X  为一不可数集的条件发生矛盾. 由此可知  X  不是第一可数空间.

statement: There exists a continuous image of a locally compact space that is not locally compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个局部紧空间的连续像，它不是局部紧的.
rationale: For example, let $X=\{-1\} \cup(0,1]$, consider X as a subset of the one-dimensional Euclidean space and give X the relative topology. Then X is obviously a locally compact topological space. Let S be the set of all points on the graph of the function $g(x)=\sin (1 / x)(0<x \leqslant 1)$. Let $Y=S \cup\{(0,0)\}$, and consider Y as a subset of the two-dimensional Euclidean space with the relative topology. It can be shown that Y is not locally compact. In fact, it suffices to prove that no neighborhood of the point $(0,0)$ is compact. Take an arbitrary neighborhood U of $(0,0)$, then there must be a disk O centered at the origin with radius $\varepsilon$ such that $O \cap Y \subset U$. Consider the line parallel to the x-axis $y=\varepsilon / 2$, all intersection points of this line with the set $O \cap Y$ form an infinite subset of U. Clearly, this subset has no accumulation point, hence U is not compact, and therefore Y is not locally compact. Now define the mapping f from X to Y as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}(0,0), & x=-1, \\(x, \sin (1 / x)), & 0<x \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right.$ Then f is a continuous mapping, and its image set $f(x)=Y$ is not locally compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  $X=\{-1\} \cup(0,1]$ , 把  X  作为一维欧氏空间的子集而在  X  上取相对拓扑,则  X  显然是一个局部紧的拓扑空间.设  S  是函数  $g(x)=\sin (1 / x)(0<x \leqslant 1)$  的图像上的点的全体. 令$Y=S \cup\{(0,0)\}$,并把  Y  作为二维欧氏空间的子集而在  Y  上取相对拓扑, 则可证  Y 不是局部紧的. 其实, 我们只要证明点  $(0,0)$  的任何邻域都不是紧的即可. 任取  $(0,0)$  的一个邻域  U , 则必有欧氏平面上的以原点为中心,  $\varepsilon$  为半径的圆盘  O , 使得  $O \cap Y \subset U$ . 取平行于  x  轴的直线  $y   =\varepsilon / 2$ , 这条直线与集  $O \cap Y$  的一切交点构成  U  的一个无穷子集.显然, 这个子集没有聚点，故  U  不是紧的, 从而  Y  不是局部紧的.现在定义由  X  到  Y  上的映射  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}(0,0), & x=-1, \\(x, \sin (1 / x)), & 0<x \leqslant 1,\end{array}\right.$则  f  是连续映射,其像集  $f(x)=Y$  不是局部紧的.

statement: There exists a topological space that is $T_{0}$ but not $T_{1}$.
chinese_statement: 存在$T_{0}$而非$T_{1}$的拓扑空间.
rationale: Let $X=\{a, b, c\}$, and define the open sets in X as $\varnothing,\{a\},\{a, b\},\{a, c\}$ and X. Then X is a topological space. It is easy to see that X is a $T_{0}$ space because for the points $a, c$, any open set containing point c must also contain point a. Therefore, X is not a $T_{1}$ space.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=\{a, b, c\}$ , 规定  X  的开集为  $\varnothing,\{a\},\{a, b\},\{a, c\}$  和  X ,则  X  为一拓扑空间. 易见,  X  是  $T_{0}$  空间. 因为对于点  $a, c$  而言，含点  c  的开集必含点  a , 所以  X  不是  $T_{1}$  空间.

statement: Even if a general topological space is a Hausdorff space, a fundamentally bounded set is not necessarily compactly bounded.
chinese_statement: 一般的拓扑空间即使是 Hausdorff 空间,基本有界集未必是紧有界.
rationale: Let X be the closed interval $[0,1]$, $A=X \backslash Q$, where Q is the set of rational numbers. Define $\tau=\{U \cup(V \cap A) \mid U, V \text{ are open sets in the usual topology on } [0,1] \}$. It is easy to see that $\tau$ is a Hausdorff topology on X. For any topological base $\mathscr{B}$ of the topological space $(X, \tau)$, we can express $\mathscr{R}$ as $\mathscr{B}=\left\{U_{\delta} \cup\left(V_{\delta} \cap A\right) \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\}$. Thus, $\left\{U_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\} \cup\left\{V_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\}$ is an open cover of $[0,1]$ under the usual topology. Since $[0,1]$ is compact, there exists a finite subcover $\left\{U_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta^{\prime}\right\} \bigcup\left\{V_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta^{\prime}\right\}$. At this point, $A \subset \bigcup_{\delta \in \Delta^{\prime}}\left(U_{\delta} \cup\left(V_{\delta} \cap A\right)\right)$, thus A is fundamentally bounded. Moreover, the topological space $(X, \tau)$ is obviously not compact, and since $\bar{A}=X$, A is not compactly bounded.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是闭区间  $[0,1]$, $A=X \backslash Q$, Q  为有理数集. 命 $\tau=\{U \cup(V \cap A) \mid U, V  是  [0,1]  上的通常拓扑下的开集  \}$. 易见,  $\tau$  是  X  上的一个 Hausdorff 拓扑. 任取拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  的一个拓扑基  $\mathscr{B}$ , 我们可把  $\mathscr{R}$  表成$\mathscr{B}=\left\{U_{\delta} \cup\left(V_{\delta} \cap A\right) \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\}$ .于是,  $\left\{U_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\} \cup\left\{V_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta\right\}$  是  $[0,1]$  在通常拓扑下的一个开覆盖. 因  $[0,1]$  是紧的, 故存在有限子覆盖 $ \left\{U_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta^{\prime}\right\} \bigcup\left\{V_{\delta} \mid \delta \in \Delta^{\prime}\right\}$ .但此时$A \subset \bigcup_{\delta \in \Delta^{\prime}}\left(U_{\delta} \cup\left(V_{\delta} \cap A\right)\right)$,因此,  A  是基本有界的, 又, 拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  显然不紧, 而  $\bar{A}=X$ , 故A 不是紧有界的.

statement: There exists a metrizable space, whose strong double dual is not a metrizable space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个囿空间, 它的强双对偶不是囿空间.
rationale: Let A be an infinite set, $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$ be a sequence of positive functions defined on $\Lambda$, such that when $i<j$, for all $\lambda \in \Lambda$, we have $f_{i}(\lambda) \leqslant f_{j}(\lambda)$. Thus, we obtain a metrizable space E. It is the inductive limit of a Banach space sequence $\left\{E_{i}\right\}$, where the unit ball of $E_{i}$ is $\left\{f|| f(\lambda) \mid \leqslant f_{i}(\lambda), \lambda \in \Lambda\right\}$. It can be shown that $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$ can be appropriately chosen such that $E^{\prime \prime}$ is not a metrizable space. In fact, let F be the set of such functions g on $\Lambda$ such that $\sum_{\lambda \in \Lambda} f_{i}(\lambda)|g(\lambda)|<+\infty, i=1,2, \cdots$. Thus, F can be seen as a subspace of $E^{\prime}$ (where g can be considered as a continuous linear functional on E, $f \rightarrow \left.\sum_{\lambda \in \Lambda} f(\lambda) g(\lambda)\right.$), F can also be regarded as the dual space of a subspace $E_{0}$ of E, where $E_{0}$ consists of all such functions $f \in E$: except for finitely many $\lambda \in \Lambda$, $f(\lambda) \neq 0$, and for the remaining $\lambda \in \Lambda$, the value of f is all zero. It is easy to prove that $F^{\prime}$ is an isomorphic image of $E^{\prime \prime}$. Therefore, to show that $E^{\prime \prime}$ is not a metrizable space, it suffices to prove that $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$ can be chosen so that $F^{\prime}$ is not a metrizable space. This can be done by taking $\Lambda$ as the set of ordered pairs of natural numbers $(n, m)$, and letting $f_{i}(n, m)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}m, & n \leqslant i, \\1, & n>i\end{array}\right.$.
chinese_rationale: 设  A  为一无限集,  $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$  是定义在  $\Lambda$  上的正值函数序列, 使当  $i<j$  时, 对一切  $\lambda \in \Lambda$ , 都有$f_{i}(\lambda) \leqslant f_{j}(\lambda)$ .于是, 我们得到一个囿空间  E . 它是 Banach 空间序列  $\left\{E_{i}\right\}$  的归纳极限,  $E_{i}$  的单位球是$\left\{f|| f(\lambda) \mid \leqslant f_{i}(\lambda), \lambda \in \Lambda\right\}$ .兹证, 可以适当选择  $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$ , 使得  $E^{\prime \prime}$  不是囿空间. 事实上, 设  F 是  $\Lambda$  上这样的函数  g  的全体, 使得$\sum_{\lambda \in \Lambda} f_{i}(\lambda)|g(\lambda)|<+\infty, i=1,2, \cdots$于是,  F  可以视为  $E^{\prime}$  的子空间 (  g  可视为  E  上的连续线性泛函  $f \rightarrow   \left.\sum_{\lambda \in \Lambda} f(\lambda) g(\lambda)\right.$), F  也可视为  E  的子空间  $E_{0}$  的对偶空间, 这里,  $E_{0}$ 是一切这样的函数  $f \in E$  组成: 除了有限个  $\lambda \in \Lambda$ , 有  $f(\lambda) \neq 0$  而外, 在其余的  $\lambda \in \Lambda$  上,  f  的值全为 0 . 容易证明,  $F^{\prime}$  是  $E^{\prime \prime}$  的一个同胚像. 因此,为了证明  $E^{\prime \prime}$  不是囿空间. 只要证明可以适当选择  $\left\{f_{i}\right\}$ ,使得  $F^{\prime}$  不是囿空间即可. 这是可以做到的, 只要取  $\Lambda$  为自然数序对  $(n, m)$  所组成之集, 并令$f_{i}(n, m)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}m, & n \leqslant i, \\1, & n>i\end{array}\right.$即可.

statement: There exists a self-reflexive open mapping with no continuity point.
chinese_statement: 存在无处连续的自反开映射.
rationale: A mapping f from a topological space X to a topological space Y is called a self-reflexive open mapping if for every open set $U \subset X, f^{-1}[f(U)]$ is open. To construct the required example, we first prove the following theorem. Theorem 1: Let X be a metric space, Y be a topological space, and f be a surjection from X to Y. Then the following statements are equivalent. a. f is a self-reflexive open mapping. b. When $x_{n} \rightarrow x$, $f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset \liminf f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$. c. When $x_{n} \rightarrow x$, $f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset \limsup f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$. Proof of $\mathrm{a} \Rightarrow \mathrm{b}$: If U is an open set in X, intersecting with $f^{-1}[f(x)]$, then $f^{-1}[f(U)]$ contains all $x_{n}$ except for finitely many. Therefore, except for finitely many n, we have $U \cap f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right] \neq \varnothing$. $\mathrm{b} \Rightarrow \mathrm{c}$ is obvious. $\mathrm{c} \Rightarrow \mathrm{a}$: Assume $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$ is a sequence in $X \backslash f^{-1}[f(x)]$ converging to $x_{0} \in f^{-1}[f(U)]$. Since each $f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$ intersects both $f^{-1}[f(U)]$ and U, U is not open, hence $\mathrm{c} \Rightarrow \mathrm{a}$ holds. Q.E.D. Theorem 2: Let X and Y be normed linear spaces, and $f: X \rightarrow Y$ be an additive mapping, i.e., $f(x+y)=f(x)+{f}(y)$, then f must be a self-reflexive open mapping. Proof: Let $x_{n} \rightarrow x, z \in f^{-1}[f(x)]$. If U is an open neighborhood of z, then U-z is a neighborhood of o. Since $x_{n}-x \rightarrow o$, for sufficiently large n, we have $x_{n}-x \in U-z$. Thus, $z+\left(x_{n}-x\right) \in U$ (for sufficiently large n). Therefore, for sufficiently large n, $f^{-1}[f(z+\left.\left.\left(x_{x}-x\right)\right)\right]=f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$ intersects U, and thus $f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset \liminf f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$. According to Theorem 1, f is a self-reflexive open mapping. Q.E.D. Now construct the required example. Let X be the real line with the usual topology, H be a Hamel basis of X. For $x_{0} \in H$, define the mapping $f: X \rightarrow X$ as follows: $f\left(x_{0}\right)=1 / 2, f(x)=1$, when $x \in H$ and $x \neq x_{0}$. If $x \in X \backslash H$, there exist finitely many rational numbers $r_{1}, \cdots, r_{n}$ such that $x=\sum_{i=1}^{n} r_{i} x_{i}\left(x_{i} \in H\right)$, then define $f(x)=\sum_{i=1}^{n} r_{i} f\left(x_{i}\right)$. Clearly, f is an additive mapping. According to Theorem 2, f is a self-reflexive open mapping. However, f is not continuous at $x_{0}$, so f is nowhere continuous on X.
chinese_rationale: 从拓扑空间  X  到拓扑空间  Y  的映射  f  称做自反开映射, 是指对每一开集  $U \subset X, f^{-1}[f(U)]$  是开集. 为构造所需的例子,我们先证明下面的定理.定理 1 设  X  是度量空间,  Y  是拓扑空间,  f  是  X  到  Y  上的满射, 则下列断语彼此等价.a.  f  是自反开映射.b. 当  $x_{n} \rightarrow x$  时,  $f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset \liminf f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$ .c. 当  $x_{n} \rightarrow x$  时,  $f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset  limsup  f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$ .证明  $\mathrm{a} \Rightarrow \mathrm{b}$ . 若  U  是  X  中的开集,它与  $f^{-1}[f(x)]$  相交,则  $f^{-1}[f(U)]$  包含除有限个  n  外的一切  $x_{n}$ . 因此, 除有限个  n  外, 有$U \cap f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right] \neq \varnothing \text {. }$ $\mathrm{b} \Rightarrow \mathrm{c}$ . 这是显然的. $\mathrm{c} \Rightarrow \mathrm{a}$ . 假如  $\left\{x_{n}\right\}$  是  $X \backslash f^{-1}[f(x)]$  中的序列, 它收敛于  $x_{0} \in   f^{-1}[f(U)]$ . 因每个  $f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$  既与  $f^{-1}[f(U)]$  相交, 又与  U  相交,可见  U  不是开的, 故  $\mathrm{c} \Rightarrow \mathrm{a}$  成立. 证毕.定理 2 设  X  与  Y  是赋范线性空间,  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  是可加映射, 即$f(x+y)=f(x)+{f}(y)$,则  f  必为自反开映射.证明 设  $x_{n} \rightarrow x, z \in f^{-1}[f(x)]$ . 若  U  是  z  的开邻域, 则  U-z 是  o  点的一个邻域. 因  $x_{n}-x \rightarrow o$ , 故当  n  充分大时, 就有$x_{n}-x \in U-z \text {. }$因此,  $z+\left(x_{n}-x\right) \in U$  (  n  充分大). 于是, 当  n  充分大时,  $f^{-1}[f(z+   \left.\left.\left(x_{x}-x\right)\right)\right]=f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$  与  U  相交, 从而$f^{-1}[f(x)] \subset \liminf f^{-1}\left[f\left(x_{n}\right)\right]$ .据定理  1, f  是自反开映射. 证毕.现在构造所需的例子. 设  X  为实直线并取通常拓扑,  H  是  X 的一个 Hamel 基. 对  $x_{0} \in H$ , 定义映射  $f: X \rightarrow X$  如下:$\begin{array}{l}f\left(x_{0}\right)=1 / 2, \\f(x)=1, \text { 当 } x \in H \text { 且 } x \neq x_{0} \text { 时, }\end{array}$若  $x \in X \backslash H$ , 则存在有限个有理数  $r_{1}, \cdots, r_{n}$ , 使$x=\sum_{i=1}^{n} r_{i} x_{i}\left(x_{i} \in H\right)$,此时令  $f(x)=\sum_{i=1}^{n} r_{i} f\left(x_{i}\right)$ . 显然,  f  是可加映射. 据定理 2,  f  是自反开映射. 但  f  在  $x_{0}$  处不连续, 从而  f  在  X  上无处连续.

statement: There exists a convex set with dense endpoints.
chinese_statement: 存在具有稠密端点的凸集.
rationale: Example: Let $l^{2}$ be a real Hilbert space: $\begin{array}{c}l^{2}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i}^{2}<+\infty\right\}, \\(x, y)=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} y_{i} .\end{array}$ C is a subset of $l^{2}$: $C=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid \sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(2^{i} x_{i}\right)^{2} \leqslant 1\right\}$, then C is a convex set, and C is the closure of its endpoints. In fact, let $E^{n}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid x_{n+1}=x_{n+2}=\cdots=0\right\}$, then $E^{n}$ is a subspace of $l^{2}$. Let $P_{n}$ be the projection of $l^{2}$ onto $E^{n}$, that is, if $x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in l^{2}$, then $P_{n}(x)=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$. Thus, we get $\begin{aligned}C \cap E^{n} & =P_{n}(C) \\& =\left\{\left\{x_{i}\right\} \left\lvert\, \frac{x_{1}^{2}}{\left(2^{-1}\right)^{2}}+\frac{x_{2}^{2}}{\left(2^{-2}\right)^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{x_{n}^{2}}{\left(2^{-n}\right)^{2}} \leqslant 1\right.\right\} .\end{aligned}$ Let $C_{n}=C \cap E^{n}$, then $C_{n}$ as a subspace of $E^{n}$, the endpoints of $C_{n}$ are points on the boundary $B_{n}$ of $C_{n}$. Moreover, every point on $B_{n}$ is an endpoint of $C_{n}$. Because if $x_{0} \in B_{n}$, and $0 \neq y \in l^{2}$, there exists $m \geqslant n$ such that $P_{m}(y) \neq 0$. Since $x_{0} \in B_{n} \subset B_{m}$, $x_{0}$ is an endpoint of $C_{m}$, and for all $-1 \leqslant t \leqslant 1, x_{0}+t P_{m}(y)=P_{m}\left(x_{0}+t y\right)$ does not belong to $C_{\mathrm{m}}=P_{m}(C)$. Therefore, for all $-1 \leqslant t \leqslant 1, x_{0}+t y$ does not belong to C. Since y is arbitrary, $x_{0}$ is an endpoint of C. Let $B=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} B_{n}$, then B is contained in the endpoint set of C. Also, C is obviously closed, so we only need to prove that B is dense in C. To this end, for any $x \in C$, $P_{n}(x) \in C_{n}$, and $\left\|x-P_{n}(x)\right\| \leqslant 2^{-n-1}+2^{-n-2}+\cdots=2^{-n}$. Since the shortest semi-axis of the ellipsoid $C_{n}: \frac{x_{1}^{2}}{\left(2^{-1}\right)^{2}}+\frac{x_{2}^{2}}{\left(2^{-2}\right)^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{x_{n}^{2}}{\left(2^{-n}\right)^{2}} \leqslant 1$ is $2^{-n}$, every point of $C_{n}$ is at most $2^{-n}$ away from $B_{n}$, thus every point of C is at most $2^{-n}+2^{-n}=2^{-n+1}$ away from $B_{n}$, i.e., B is dense in C.
chinese_rationale: 例子如下：设  $l^{2}$  是实 Hilbert 空间:$\begin{array}{c}l^{2}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid \sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i}^{2}<+\infty\right\}, \\(x, y)=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty} x_{i} y_{i} .\end{array}$ C  为  $l^{2}$  的子集:$C=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid \sum_{i=1}^{\infty}\left(2^{i} x_{i}\right)^{2} \leqslant 1\right\}$,则  C  是凸集,且  C  是其端点集的闭包. 事实上, 令$E^{n}=\left\{x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \mid x_{n+1}=x_{n+2}=\cdots=0\right\}$,则  $E^{n}$  是  $l^{2}$  的子空间. 设  $P_{n}$  是  $l^{2}$  到  $E^{n}$  上的射影, 即若  $x=\left\{x_{i}\right\} \in   l^{2}$ , 则$P_{n}(x)=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}, \cdots, x_{n}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$ .于是,我们得到$\begin{aligned}C \cap E^{n} & =P_{n}(C) \\& =\left\{\left\{x_{i}\right\} \left\lvert\, \frac{x_{1}^{2}}{\left(2^{-1}\right)^{2}}+\frac{x_{2}^{2}}{\left(2^{-2}\right)^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{x_{n}^{2}}{\left(2^{-n}\right)^{2}} \leqslant 1\right.\right\} .\end{aligned}$令  $C_{n}=C \cap E^{n}$ , 则  $C_{n}$  作为  $E^{n}$  的子空间时,  $C_{n}$  的端点是  $C_{n}$  的边界  $B_{n}$  上的点. 此外,  $B_{n}$  上的每一点都是  $C_{n}$  的端点. 因为如果  $x_{0} \in B_{n}$ , 且  $0 \neq y \in l^{2}$ , 则存在  $m \geqslant n$  使  $P_{m}(y) \neq 0$ . 因  $x_{0} \in B_{n} \subset B_{m}$ ,故  $x_{0}$  是  $C_{m}$  的端点, 且对所有  $-1 \leqslant t \leqslant 1, x_{0}+t P_{m}(y)=P_{m}\left(x_{0}+t y\right) 不属于  C_{\mathrm{m}}=P_{m}(C) . 因此, 对所有  -1 \leqslant t \leqslant 1, x_{0}+t y$  不属于  C . 由于  y  是任取的, 因而  $x_{0}$  是  C  的端点.令  $B=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} B_{n}$ , 则  B  包含于  C  的端点集之中. 又,  C  显然是闭集, 故只要证明  B  在  C  中稠密即可. 为此, 任取  $x \in C$ , 则  $P_{n}(x) \in   C_{n}$ , 且$\left\|x-P_{n}(x)\right\| \leqslant 2^{-n-1}+2^{-n-2}+\cdots=2^{-n}$ .因椭球  $C_{n}: \frac{x_{1}^{2}}{\left(2^{-1}\right)^{2}}+\frac{x_{2}^{2}}{\left(2^{-2}\right)^{2}}+\cdots+\frac{x_{n}^{2}}{\left(2^{-n}\right)^{2}} \leqslant 1$  的最短半轴之长为  $2^{-n}$ , 故  $C_{n}$  的每一点与  $B_{n}$  的距离至多为  $2^{-n}$ , 从而  C  的每一点与  $B_{n}$  的距离至多为  $2^{-n}+2^{-n}=2^{-n+1}$ , 即  B  在  C  中是稠密的.

statement: There exists at most one accumulation point in a topological space.
chinese_statement: 存在至多有一个聚点的拓扑空间.
rationale: Let X be a door space, i.e., every subset of X is either open or closed. Now to prove that a Hausdorff door space has at most one accumulation point. In fact, if $t \neq s$, and both t and s are accumulation points of X, then there exist disjoint open sets U and V, containing t and s respectively. Thus, t is an accumulation point of U. According to Theorem 1 from the introduction, there exists a net $\left\{x_{a} \mid \alpha \in D\right\} \subset U \backslash \{t\}$ such that $\lim _{\alpha} x_{\alpha}=t$. Let $E=\left\{x_{a} \mid \alpha \in D\right\} \cup\{s\}$; since s is not an interior point of E, E is not an open set. Moreover, the accumulation point $t\not \in E$, so E is not a closed set, which contradicts the condition of X being a door space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一个门空间,即  X  的每个子集非开即闭. 兹证， Hausdorff 门空间至多有一个聚点. 事实上, 假如  $t \neq s$ , 且  t  与  s  都是  X  的聚点, 则存在不相交的开集  U  与  V , 它们分别含有  t  与  s .于是,  t  是  U  的聚点. 据引言中的定理 1 , 存在网  $\left\{x_{a} \mid \alpha \in D\right\} \subset U \backslash   \{t\}$ ,使$\lim _{\alpha} x_{\alpha}=t$ .令  $E=\left\{x_{a} \mid \alpha \in D\right\} \cup\{s\}$ , 因  s  不是  E  的内点, 故  E  不是开集: 又,  E 的聚点$t\not \in E$,故E不是闭集,这与X为一门空间的条件发生矛盾.

statement: There exist two compatible topologies, one of which is complete and the other is not complete.
chinese_statement: 存在两个相容的拓扑,其中一个完备而另一个不完备.
rationale: For example, we use $c_{0}$ to denote the linear space consisting of all sequences converging to 0. The norm topology on $c_{0}$, $\|x\|_{\infty}= \sup\limits_{n}^{} \left|\xi_{n}\right|$, and the weak topology $\sigma\left(c_{0}, l\right)$ are compatible topologies. However, $\left(c_{0},\|\cdot\|_{\infty}\right)$ is complete, whereas $\left(c_{0}, \sigma\left(c_{0}, l\right)\right)$ is not even sequentially complete.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 我们用  $c_{0}$  代表一切收敛于 0 的数列所组成的线性空间, 则  $c_{0}$  上的范数拓扑  $\|x\|_{\infty}= \sup\limits_{n}^{} \left|\xi_{n}\right|$  与弱拓扑  $\sigma\left(c_{0}, l\right)$  是相容拓扑. 然而  $\left(c_{0},\|\cdot\|_{\infty}\right)$  是完备的,  $\left(c_{0}, \sigma\left(c_{0}, l\right)\right)$  甚至不是序列完备的.

statement: Let X and Y be topological spaces, $f: X \rightarrow Y$. A mapping f is called $\theta-\mathrm{s}$ continuous if for every $x \in X$ and semi-open set $G \ni f(x)$, there exists an open neighborhood O of x such that $f(O) \subset \bar{G}$. There exists a weakly continuous mapping that is not $\theta-\mathrm{s}$ continuous.
chinese_statement: 设  X  与  Y  都是拓扑空间,  $f: X \rightarrow Y$ . 称映射  f  为  $\theta-\mathrm{s}$  连续的,是指对每一  $x \in X$  和半开集  $G \ni f(x)$ , 存在  x  的开邻域  O , 使$f(O) \subset \bar{G}$ .存在弱连续而非  $\theta-\mathrm{s}$  连续的映射.
rationale: $\theta-s$ continuous mappings must be weakly continuous. Li Houyuan and Jiang Shouzha pointed out that the converse of this proposition does not hold. For example: let $X=\{a, b, c\}$, and let the open set family be $\tau=\{\varnothing,\{a\},\{b\},\{a, b\},\{a, b, c\}\}$, then the closed set family is $\sigma=\{\varnothing,\{b, c\},\{a, c\},\{c\},\{a, b, c\}\}$. Clearly, the identity mapping $f:(X, \tau) \rightarrow(X, \tau)$ is continuous, thus it is weakly continuous. However, f is not $\theta-s$ continuous because $\overline{\{b\}}=\{b, c\}, c \in \overline{\{b\}}$, but there is no open set O containing c such that $f(O)=O\subset \overline{\{b\}}$.
chinese_rationale: $\theta-s$  连续映射必是弱连续的. 李厚源和江守札 指出,这个命题之逆并不成立. 例如：设  $X=\{a, b, c\}$ , 并令开集族为$\tau=\{\varnothing,\{a\},\{b\},\{a, b\},\{a, b, c\}\}$则闭集族为$\sigma=\{\varnothing,\{b, c\},\{a, c\},\{c\},\{a, b, c\}\}$ .显然, 恒等映射  $f:(X, \tau) \rightarrow(X, \tau)$  是连续的, 从而是弱连续的. 但  f 不是  $\theta-s$  连续的, 因为  $\overline{\{b\}}=\{b, c\}, c \in \overline{\{b\}}$ , 但没有包含  c  的开集  O ,使$f(O)=O\subset \overline{\{b\}}$.

statement: Let $(X, \tau)$ be a topological space. If for any cover S of X, there must be a finite subcover, then X is called S-compact. There exists a compact subset of some topological space that is not S-compact.
chinese_statement: 设  $(X, \tau)$  是拓扑空间. 若对  X  的任一  S  覆盖必有有限子覆盖，则称  X  是  S  紧的.存在某个拓扑空间的紧子集,它不量  S  紧的.
rationale: Obviously, an S-compact space is definitely compact, but a compact space is not necessarily S-compact. For example: Let $X=[-1,1]$ and have the subspace topology of the real number space $\tau$, then the topological space $(X, \tau)$ is compact. Let $\mathscr{U}=[-1,0] \cup\left\{\left.\left(\frac{1}{n+1}, \frac{1}{n}\right) \right\rvert\, n \in N\right\}$, then $\mathscr{U}$ is an S-cover of X, but $\mathscr{U}$ does not have a finite subcover. Therefore, X is not S-compact.
chinese_rationale: 显然,  S  紧空间一定是紧空间, 但紧空间未必是  S  紧的. 例如: 设  $X=[-1,1]$ , 并具有实数空间的子空间拓扑  $\tau$ , 则拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  是紧的. 令$\mathscr{U}=[-1,0] \cup\left\{\left.\left(\frac{1}{n+1}, \frac{1}{n}\right) \right\rvert\, n \in N\right\}$,则  $\mathscr{U}$  是  X  的一个  S  覆盖, 但  $\mathscr{U}$  没有有限子覆盖. 因此,  X  不是  S 紧的.

statement: There exists a complete locally convex space that is not a quasi-barrelled space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个完备的局部凸空间, 它不是拟桶空间.
rationale: Let X be a non-reflexive locally convex Fréchet space, for example, $X=c_{0}$. Then the Mackey space $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right. )$ is a complete semi-reflexive space. Since the strong dual of $( X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}\right. , X) )$, X, is not reflexive, $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right. )$ is also not reflexive (the strong dual of a reflexive space must be a reflexive space). Also, since a locally convex space is reflexive if and only if it is both semi-reflexive and a quasi-barrelled space, it follows that $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right)$ is not a quasi-barrelled space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一个非自反的局部凸的 Fréchet 空间, 例如,  $X=c_{0}$ , 则 Mackey 空间  $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right.  )$是完备的半自反空间. 因 $(  X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}\right. ,  X)  )$的强对偶  X  不是自反的, 故  $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right.  )$ 也不是自反的(自反空间的强对偶必是自反空间). 又因一个局部凸空间是自反的,当且仅当它既是半自反的, 又是拟桶空间, 故知  $\left(X^{\prime}, m\left(X^{\prime}, X\right)\right)$  不是拟桶空间.

statement: There exists a closed subspace of a separable space that is not separable.
chinese_statement: 存在某个可分空间的闭子空间, 它不是可分的.
rationale: It is easy to prove that the quotient space of a separable space must be separable. The open subspace of a separable space is also necessarily separable. However, the closed subspace of a separable space may not be separable. For example: Let X be an uncountable set, $p \in X$, the open sets of X are the empty set $\varnothing$ and any subset containing the point p. It is easy to see that the singleton set $\{p\}$ is dense in X. Thus, X is separable, yet $X \backslash\{p\}$ is a closed subspace of X. Since X is uncountable, $X \backslash\{p\}$ is not separable.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明,可分空间的商空间必定可分. 可分空间的开子空间也一定可分. 但是, 可分空间的闭子空间未必可分. 例如：设  X  为一不可数集,  $p \in X$ , 命  X  的开集为空集  $\varnothing$  以及含有点  p  的任意子集. 易见, 单点集  $\{p\}$  在  X  中稠密. 因此,  X  是可分的, 又,  $X \backslash\{p\}$  是  X  的闭子空间. 因  X  不可数, 故  $X \backslash\{p\}$  不可分.

statement: There exists a normed space, which is not a barrelled space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个赋范空间, 它不是桶空间.
rationale: For example, let $\varphi=R^{(N)}$ be the linear space consisting of all sequences with only a finite number of non-zero coordinates. For $x= \left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in \varphi$, let $\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right|$, then $(\varphi,\|\cdot\|)$ is a normed space, and $A=\left\{x| \xi_{n} \left\lvert\, \leqslant \frac{1}{n}\right., n=1,2,3, \cdots\right\}$ is a balanced, absorbing closed convex set in $(\varphi,\|\cdot\|)$, i.e., A is a barrel. But for any $\varepsilon>0$, A cannot contain $\{x \mid\|x\|<\varepsilon\}$. Therefore, A is not a neighborhood of the zero point, meaning $(\boldsymbol{\varphi},\|\cdot\|)$ is not a barrelled space.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  $\varphi=R^{(N)}$  代表一切只有有限个非零坐标的数列所组成的线性空间. 对  $x=   \left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in \varphi$, 令$\|x\|=\sup _{n}\left|\xi_{n}\right|$,则  $(\varphi,\|\cdot\|)$  为一赋范空间,且$A=\left\{x|| \xi_{n} \left\lvert\, \leqslant \frac{1}{n}\right., n=1,2,3, \cdots\right\}$是  $(\varphi,\|\cdot\|)$  中的一个平衡、吸收的闭凸集, 即  A  是一个桶. 但对任意  $\varepsilon>0$, A  不能包含  $\{x \mid\|x\|<\varepsilon\}$ . 因此,  A  不是  o  点的一个邻域,即  $(\boldsymbol{\varphi},\|\cdot\|)$  不是桶空间.

statement: There exist two incomparable topologies $\tau_{1}$ and $\tau_{2}$ on set X such that $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ and $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ are homeomorphic.
chinese_statement: 存在集  X  上两个不可比较的拓扑  $\tau_{1}$  与  $\tau_{2}$ , 使  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  与  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  同胚.
rationale: Let X be a set, with $a, b \in X$ and $a \neq b$. Define the open set family $\tau_{1}$ to be X, $\varnothing$, and all subsets containing the point a; also define the open set family $\tau_{2}$ to be X, $\varnothing$, and all subsets containing the point b. Thus, the topological spaces $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ and $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ are incomparable. On the other hand, it is not difficult to see that $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x, x \neq a, b, \\a, x=b, \\b, x=a\end{array}\right.$ is a homeomorphism from $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ to $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$, hence $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$ and $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$ are homeomorphic topological spaces.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一集,  a, $b \in X$  且  $a \neq b$ . 命开集族  $\tau_{1}$  为  X, $\varnothing$  以及含点  a  的一切子集; 又命开集族  $\tau_{2}$  为  X, $\varnothing$  以及含点  b  的一切子集. 于是, 拓扑空间  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  与拓扑空间  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  是不可比较的. 另一方面,不难看出,$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x, x \neq a, b, \\a, x=b, \\b, x=a\end{array}\right.$是  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  到  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  上的一个同胚映射, 从而  $\left(X, \tau_{1}\right)$  与  $\left(X, \tau_{2}\right)$  是同胚的拓扑空间.

statement: There exists a non-locally convex quasi-weak$^{*}$ topology.
chinese_statement: 存在非局部凸的几平弱$^{*}$拓扑.
rationale: Let X be a locally convex space, the $aw^{*}$ topology on $X^{\prime}$ is called locally convex if there exists a locally convex topology $\tau$ on $X^{\prime}$ such that the $\tau$-closed sets in $X^{\prime}$ are the same as the $\alpha w^{*}$ closed sets. It should be noted that the $aw^{*}$ topology on $X^{\prime}$ is not necessarily locally convex. In fact, it can be proven that if the $aw^{*}$ topology on $X^{\prime}$ is locally convex and X is a complete locally convex space, then X must be ultracomplete. Now, let X be a complete but not ultracomplete locally convex space, then the $aw^{*}$ topology on $X^{\prime}$ cannot be locally convex.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是局部凸空间,  $X^{\prime}$  上  $a w^{*}$  拓扑称做局部凸的, 是指  $X^{\prime}$  上存在局部凸拓扑  $\tau$ ,使  $X^{\prime}$  中的  $\tau$  闭集与  $\alpha w^{*}$闭集是相同的.应当注意,  $X^{\prime}$  上的  $a w^{*}$  拓扑未必是局部凸的. 事实上, 可以证明, 如果  $X^{\prime}$  上的  $a w^{*}$  拓扑是局部凸的, 且  X  是完备的局部凸空间,那么  X  必定是超完备的. 今取  X  为一完备而非超完备的局部凸空间, 则  $X^{\prime}$  上的  $a w^{*}$  拓扑必然不是局部凸的.

statement: There exists a Darboux mapping that is not a continuous mapping.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Darboux 映射, 它不是连续映射.
rationale:
It's easy to prove that a continuous map must be a Darboux map, but the converse does not hold. For example, define a real-valued function f on R as follows: $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}\sin \frac{1}{x}, & x>0, \\0, & x \leqslant 0 .\end{array}\right.$ Then f is a Darboux map, but it is not continuous.
Example 1: There exists a quasi-open map that is not an induced closed map. Let $\boldsymbol{X}$ be the real number space $\boldsymbol{R}$, and $\boldsymbol{Y}$ be the quotient space obtained by treating the open interval $(a, b)$ in $\boldsymbol{R}$ as a single point $\boldsymbol{p}$. The quotient map $f: X \rightarrow Y$ is open, and thus is quasi-open. The singleton set $\{p\}$ in Y is open, but not closed. Let $\boldsymbol{X}_{0}$ be a subspace of $\boldsymbol{X}$ such that $\boldsymbol{f}\left(\boldsymbol{X}_{0}\right)=\boldsymbol{Y}$, then $X_{0} \cap(a, b) \neq \varnothing$. Take $x \in X_{0} \cap(a, b)$, then $\{x\}$ is both a closed set in R and a closed subset of $X_{0}$. But $\left(f \mid X_{0}\right)(x)=f(x)=p$, and the set $\{\boldsymbol{p}\}$ is not closed in Y, so $\boldsymbol{f}$ is not an induced closed map.
Example 2: There exists an induced closed map that is not a closed map. The projection P of the plane ${X} \times \mathbf{Y}$ onto the coordinate axis $\boldsymbol{X}$ is not a closed map. If one takes any compact subset $Y_{0}$ of Y, then the restriction of P on $X \times Y_{0}$, $\boldsymbol{P} \mid \boldsymbol{X} \times \boldsymbol{Y}_{0}$ is a closed map, thus $\boldsymbol{P}$ is an induced closed map.
chinese_rationale:
容易证明, 连续映射必为 Darboux 映射, 但逆命题并不成立.例如：在  R  上定义实值函数  f  如下:$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}\sin \frac{1}{x}, & x>0, \\0, & x \leqslant 0 .\end{array}\right.$则  f  是 Darboux 映射, 但它并不连续.
例 1 存在某个伪开映射, 它不是诱导闭映射.设  $\boldsymbol{X}$  是实数空间  $\boldsymbol{R}, \boldsymbol{Y}$  是把  $\boldsymbol{R}$  中的开区间  $(a, b)$  作为一点  $\boldsymbol{p}$  而得到的商空间. 商映射  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  是开的, 从而是伪开的.  Y  中的单点集  $\{p\}$  是开集, 不是闭集. 设  $\boldsymbol{X}_{0}$  是  $\boldsymbol{X}$  的子空间满足  $\boldsymbol{f}\left(\boldsymbol{X}_{0}\right)=\boldsymbol{Y}$ ,则$X_{0} \cap(a, b) \neq \varnothing$ .取  $x \in X_{0} \cap(a, b)$ , 则  $\{x\}$  既是  R  的闭集也是  $X_{0}$  的闭子集. 但$\left(f \mid X_{0}\right)(x)=f(x)=p$,而  $\{\boldsymbol{p}\}$  不是  Y  中的闭集, 故  $\boldsymbol{f}$  不是诱导闭映射.
例 2 存在某个诱导闭映射, 它不是闭映射.等知平面  ${X} \times \mathbf{Y}$  到坐标轴  $\boldsymbol{X}$  上的射影  P  不是闭映射. 若取  Y 的任一紧子集  $Y_{0}$ , 则  P  在  $X \times Y_{0}$  上的限制  $\boldsymbol{P} \mid \boldsymbol{X} \times \boldsymbol{Y}_{0}$  是闭映射, 故  $\boldsymbol{P}$  是诱导闭映射.

statement: A subset A of a topological space X is called strongly connected if whenever $A \subset U \cup V$, it follows that $A \subset U$ or $A \subset V$, where U and V are open sets in X. There exist topological spaces that are connected but not strongly connected.
chinese_statement: 拓扑空间  X  的子集  A  称做强连通的, 是指当  $A \subset U \cup V$  时, 就有  $A \subset U$  或者  $A \subset V$ , 这里,  U  和  V  都是  X  的开集. 存在连通而不强连通的拓扑空间.
rationale: It is easy to prove that if A is strongly connected, then A must also be connected. However, the converse is not true. For example: Let $X=\{a, b, c\}$. Define $\tau=\{\varnothing, \{a\}, \{a, b\}, \{a, c\}, X\}$, then X is connected. However, X is not strongly connected because $X \subset \{a, b\} \cup \{a, c\}$, yet X is neither contained in $\{a, b\}$ nor in $\{a, c\}$.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明, 若  A  是强连通的, 则  A  亦必是连通的. 但逆命题并不成立. 例如： 设  $X=\{a, b, c\}$ . 令$\tau=\{\varnothing\{a\},\{a, b\},\{a, c\}, X\}$,则  X  是连通的. 但  X  并不强连通, 因为$X \subset\{a, b\} \cup\{a, c\}$,而  X  既不包含于  $\{a, b\}$ , 也不包含于  $\{a, c\}$ .

statement: There exists a closed subspace of a barrel space that is not a barrel space.
chinese_statement: 存在一个桶空间的闭子空间,它不是桶空间.
rationale: It can be proven that the product of barrel spaces is a barrel space; the quotient space of a barrel space is a barrel space; the direct sum of barrel spaces is a barrel space; the strict inductive limit and inductive limit of barrel spaces remain barrel spaces. However, a subspace of a barrel space is not necessarily a barrel space. In fact, since any Hausdorff locally convex space is a closed subspace of some barrel space, we only need to construct a Hausdorff locally convex space that is not a barrel space. Let $c_{0}$ be the linear space of all sequences converging to 0, u be the supremum norm topology on $c_{0}$, v be the weak topology on $c_{0}$. For each natural number n, define the mapping $g_{n}$ from $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$ to $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$ as follows: for each $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in\left(C_{0}, v\right)$, let $g_{n}(x)=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, 0, \cdots\right)$. Then $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$ is a sequence of linear continuous mappings from $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$ to $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$, making $\left\{g_{n}(x)\right\}$ converge to x in $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$ for each x in $c_{0}$. Additionally, $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$ is uniformly bounded on bounded sets, for the following reason: if B is the unit ball in $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$, then for each n, $g_{n}(B) \subset B$, thus $\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} g_{n}(B) \subset B$. Because v is strictly weaker than u, $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$ is not equicontinuous, therefore $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$ is not a countably quasi-barrel space, and certainly not a barrel space.
chinese_rationale: 可以证明，桶空间之积是桶空间；桶空间的商空间是桶空间；桶空间的直接和是桶空间; 桶空间的严格归纳极限及归纳极限仍是桶空间. 但是,桶空间的子空间不必是桶空间. 事实上,由于任何一个 Hausdorff 局部凸空间必是某个桶空间的闭子空间, 因而我们只要构造一个 Hausdorff 局部凸空间, 它不是桶空间即可.设  $c_{0}$  是一切收敛于 0 的数列所组成的线性空间,  u  是  $c_{0}$  上的上确界范数拓扑,  v  是  $c_{0}$  上的弱拓扑. 对每一自然数  n , 定义  $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$ 到  $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$  上的映射  $g_{n}$  如下:对毎一  $x=\left\{\xi_{n}\right\} \in\left(C_{0}, v\right)$  ，令$g_{n}(x)=\left(\xi_{1}, \xi_{2}, \cdots, \xi_{n}, 0, \cdots\right)$,则  $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$  是  $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$  到  $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$  上的线性连续映射序列, 使对每一  $x \in c_{0} ,  \left\{g_{n}(x)\right\}$  在  $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$  中收敛于  x . 此外,  $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$  在有界集上是一致有界的，理由如下: 如果  B  是  $\left(c_{0}, u\right)$  中的单位球，那么对每一  n, $g_{n}(B)   \subset B$ ,因而$\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} g_{n}(B) \subset B$ .因为  v  严格弱于  u , 所以  $\left\{g_{n}\right\}$  不是等度连续的, 从而  $\left(c_{0}, v\right)$  不是可数拟桶空间，当然也就不是桶空间了.

statement: There exists a bounded set whose convex hull is not bounded.
chinese_statement: 存在某个有界集,它的凸包不是有界的.
rationale: For example, consider the linear topological space $l^{p}(0<p<1)$. Let D denote the closed ball in $l^{p}$ centered at o with radius 1. Then D is metrically bounded. Thus, D is also bounded. Let $\mathrm{e}_{n}=(0, \cdots, 0, \underset{n \text{ th position}}{1}, 0, \cdots) \text{, }then \mathrm{e}_{n} \in D$. Take $a_{n}=\frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \mathrm{e}_{i}=\left(\frac{1}{n}, \cdots, \frac{1}{n}, 0,0, \cdots\right)$, then $a_{n} \in \operatorname{co}(D)$. However, since $d\left(o, a_{n}\right)=\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left|\frac{1}{n}\right|^{p}=n^{1-p} \rightarrow+\infty$, the set $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ is metrically unbounded, therefore $\operatorname{co}(D)$ is not bounded.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 考虑线性拓扑空间 $l^{p}(0

statement: There exists an infinite topological space, where every subset is compact.
chinese_statement: 存在某个无限拓扑空间, 其中每个子集都是紧的.
rationale: Let X be an infinite set, and define the closed sets of X as $\varnothing$, X, and any finite set. For any open cover of X, each of these open sets covers only a finite number of sets, for example, n points. Thus, we can select at most n open sets from this open cover that cover these n points. Therefore, along with one previous open set, at most $n+1$ open sets cover X, so X is compact. Obviously, every subset of X is also compact.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一无限集,命  X  的闭集为  $\varnothing$, X  以及任意有限集. 对  X 的任意一个开覆盖, 这些开集中的任意一个只盖不住有限个集, 例如  n  个点. 于是, 我们可以从这个开覆盖中至多选出  n  个开集, 它们覆盖了这  n  个点. 因此, 连同前面一个开集共至多  $n+1$  个开集就覆了  X , 故  X  是紧的. 显然,  X  的每个子集也都是紧的.

statement: There exists a locally compact metrizable space whose one-point compactification is not metrizable.
chinese_statement: 存在某个可度量化的局部紧空间, 其一点紧化不可度量化.
rationale: Let X be an uncountable set, and consider the discrete topology on X. Then X is a locally compact metrizable space. However, its one-point compactification is not metrizable. In fact, the hypothetical point does not satisfy the first countability axiom, because the complement of any open set containing the hypothetical point must be finite. However, the intersection of the elements of a countable basis of the hypothetical point is exactly this hypothetical point. Since the complement of each element is finite, the complement of this hypothetical point will be countable. This contradicts the condition that X is an uncountable set.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  为一不可数集, 并在  X  上取离散拓扑, 则  X  为一可度量化的局部紧空间. 然而, 它的一点紧化不可度量化. 事实上, 假想点不满足第一可数公理, 这是因为任何一个含有假想点的开集的补集必是有限集. 但是, 假想点的可数基的元素之交正好是这个假想点. 因为每个元索的补集是有限集, 故这个假想点的补集将是可数的. 这与  X  为一不可数集的条件发生矛盾.

statement: There exist topological spaces X and Y, and a continuous surjective map f from X to Y, such that $f(X)=Y$ is a connected space, while X is not a connected space.
chinese_statement: 存在拓扑空间  X  与  Y  以及  X  到  Y  上的连续满射  f , 便  $f(X)=Y$  是连通空间，而  X  不是连通空间.
rationale: For example, let X be the set of real numbers with the discrete topology, Y be the set of real numbers with the usual topology, and f be the identity map from X to Y. Then f is a one-to-one continuous surjective map from X to Y. However, Y is connected while X is not connected.
chinese_rationale: 例如, 设  X  为带有离散拓扑的实数集,  Y  为带有通常拓扑的实数集,  f  是  X  到  Y  上的恒等映射, 则  f  是  X  到  Y  上的一对一的连续满射. 但  Y  连通而  X  并不连通.

statement: Accumulation point, $\omega$-accumulation point, and condensation point are equivalent concepts.
chinese_statement: 聚点，$\omega$  聚点与凝聚点这三个概念相互等价.
rationale:
It is obvious that a condensation point must be an $\omega$-accumulation point, and an $\omega$-accumulation point must be an accumulation point. However, the reverse is not true. We provide counterexamples as follows:
Example 1: An accumulation point of a set that is not an $\omega$-accumulation point of the set. Let X be an uncountable set, with the empty set $\varnothing$ and any set containing a fixed point x as the open sets of X, then this collection of open sets determines a topology on X. Suppose Y is a subset containing point x, then every point $y \neq x$ is an accumulation point of Y. But y is clearly not an $\omega$-accumulation point of Y.
Example 2: An $\omega$-accumulation point of a set that is not a condensation point. Let R be the real numbers with the usual topology. Let $A=\left\{\left.\frac{1}{n} \right\rvert\, n=1,2, \cdots\right\}$, then 0 is an $\omega$-accumulation point of $A \cup[2,3]$. However, 0 is clearly not a condensation point of $A \cup[2,3]$.
chinese_rationale:
易见, 凝聚点必为  $\omega$  聚点,  $\omega$  聚点必为聚点. 但其逆不真, 我们举出反例如下:
例 1 ：某个集的聚点，它不是该集的  $\omega$  聚点.设  X  为一不可数集, 空集  $\varnothing$  以及一切含有固定点  x  的集作为  X  的开集, 则此开集族确定了  X  上的一个拓扑. 又设  Y  是含有点  x  的子集, 则每一点  $y \neq x$  都是  Y  的聚点. 但  y  显然不是  Y  的  $\omega$  聚点.
例 2 ：某个集的  $\omega$  聚点，它不是该集的凝聚点.设  R  为实数集并取通常拓扑. 令$A=\left\{\left.\frac{1}{n} \right\rvert\, n=1,2, \cdots\right\}$,则 0 是  $A \cup[2,3]$  的一个  $\omega$  聚点. 然而, 0 显然不是  $A \cup[2,3]$  的凝聚点.

statement: There exist two different topologies on a linear space that have the same bounded sets.
chinese_statement: 存在某个线性空间上的两个不同拓扑, 它们具有相同的有界集.
rationale: Let $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ be a normed linear space, and equip X with the weak topology $\sigma(X , \left.X^{\prime}\right)$. It is easy to prove that a subset A of X is bounded in $(X,\|\cdot\|)$ if and only if it is bounded in $(X , \left.\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$. However, for an infinite-dimensional normed linear space $(X,\|\cdot\|)$, the norm topology is strictly stronger than the weak topology $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$.
chinese_rationale: 设  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  为一赋范线性空间, 在  X  上赋予弱拓扑  $\sigma(X ,  \left.X^{\prime}\right)$ . 容易证明,  X  的子集  A  在  $(X,\|\cdot|)$  中有界当且仅当它在  $(X ,  \left.\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)\right)$  中有界. 但对于无穷维赋范线性空间  $(X,\|\cdot\|)$  而言, 范数拓扑严格强于弱拓扑  $\sigma\left(X, X^{\prime}\right)$ .

statement: There exists a Hausdorff space whose one-point compactification is not a Hausdorff space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个 Hausdorff 空间, 它的一点紧化不是 Hausdorff 空间.
rationale: Let $X=(Q,\tau )$ be the set of rational numbers with the usual topology, $p\notin(Q,\tau )$. Define $Q^{*}=Q \bigcup\{p\} \text {, }$ and consider the topology $\tau^{*}$ on $Q^{*}$ as follows: open sets in $Q^{*}$ are either open sets in $(Q, \tau)$, or their complements are closed and compact subsets in $(Q, \tau)$. It is easy to see that $(Q, \tau)$ is a Hausdorff space. On the other hand, since $(Q, \tau)$ is not locally compact, $(Q^{*}, \tau^{*})$ is not a Hausdorff space.
chinese_rationale: 设$X=(Q,\tau )$是有理数集并取通常拓扑，$p\notin(Q,\tau )$.令 $Q^{*}=Q \bigcup\{p\} \text {, }$并在  $Q^{*}$  上取拓扑  $\tau^{*}$  如下:  $Q^{*}$  中的开集或为  $(Q, \tau)$  中的开集, 或其补集为  $(Q, \tau)$  中的闭的紧子集.易见,  $(Q, \tau)$  是 Hausdorff 空间. 另一方面, 因  $(Q, \tau)$  不是局部紧的,故 $(  Q^{*}, \tau^{*}  )$ 不是 Hausdorff 空间.

statement: A subspace of a Lindelöf space is not necessarily a Lindelöf space.
chinese_statement: Lindelöf 空间的子空间, 不一定是 Lindelöf 空间.
rationale: It is easy to prove that a closed subspace of a Lindelöf space must be a Lindelöf space, however, a non-closed subspace of a Lindelöf space is not necessarily a Lindelöf space. For example: Let $X=[0, 1]$, with a topology on $X$ generated by $[0,1]$ and all singletons $\{x\}(x \neq 0)$. Since any open cover of $X$ must contain $[0,1]$, $X$ is a Lindelöf space. However, the subspace $(0,1]$ is an uncountable discrete space, hence it is not a Lindelöf space.
chinese_rationale: 容易证明,Lindelöf 空间的闭子空间必为 Lindelöf 空间, 但是, Lindelöf 空间的非闭子空间未必是 Lindelöf 空间. 例如:令  $X=[0 , 1]$, 以  $[0,1]$  及所有单点集  $\{x\}(x \neq 0)$  为邻域基生成  X  上的一个拓扑, 因  X  的任一开覆盖必含有  $[0,1]$ , 故  X  为一Lindelöf 空间, 但子空间  $(0,1]$  为不可数的离散空间,故它不是 Lndelöf 空间.

statement: There exists a quasi-bucket space, which is neither a confined space nor a bucket space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拟桶空间, 它既不是囿空间, 也不是桶空间
rationale: Let X be a bucket space, it is not a confined space; Y is a confined space, it is not a bucket space. Obviously, the product space $X \times Y$ is a quasi-bucket space. However, $X \times Y$ is neither a confined space nor a bucket space. Because let A be a convex confined set in X, it is not a neighborhood of the point o in X, then $A \times Y$ is a confined set in $X \times Y$, it is not a neighborhood of the point 0 in $X \times Y$. Therefore, $X \times Y$ is not a confined space. Secondly, let B be a bucket in Y, it is not a neighborhood of the point o in Y, then $X \times B$ is a bucket in $X \times Y$, it is not a neighborhood of the point o in $X \times Y$. Therefore, $X \times Y$ is not a bucket space.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是一个桶空间,它不是囿空间;  Y  是一个囿空间, 它不是桶空间. 显然,积空间  $X \times Y$  是一个拟桶空间. 然而，  $X \times Y$  既不是囿空间, 也不是桶空间. 因为设  A  是  X  中的一个凸的囿集, 它不是  X  中  o  点的一个邻城, 则  $A \times Y$  是  $X \times Y$  中的囿集,它不是  $X \times Y$  中 0 点的一个邻域. 因此,  $X \times Y$ 不是囿空间. 其次,设  B  是  Y  中的一个桶, 它不是  Y  中  o  点的一个邻域,则  $X \times B$  是  $X \times Y$  中的一个桶, 它不是  $X \times Y$  中  o  点的一个邻域. 因此,  $X \times Y$ 不是桶空间.

statement: For a topological space that satisfies the first countability axiom, any continuous image of it must also satisfy the first countability axiom.
chinese_statement: 满足第一可数公理的拓扑空间, 它的任意连续像一定也满足第一可数公理.
rationale: Let X be the set of all ordered pairs of non-negative integers $(m, n)$, equipped with the Arens-Fort topology $\tau$ on X, then the topological space $(X, \tau)$ does not satisfy the first countability axiom. We then equip X with the discrete topology $\tau^{*}$, and the topological space $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ satisfies the second countability axiom, and therefore also satisfies the first countability axiom. Let f be the identity mapping from $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ to $(X, \tau)$, then f is a continuous mapping. But the continuous image of $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$, which is $(X, \tau)$, does not satisfy the first countability axiom.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  是全体非负整数的有序对偶  $(m, n)$  所成之集, 我们在  X 上取 Arens-Fort 拓扑  $\tau$ , 则拓扑空间  $(X, \tau)$  不满足第一可数公理. 我们在  X  再取离散拓扑  $\tau^{*}$ , 则拓扑空间  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  满足第二可数公理, 从而也满足第一可数公理.设  f  是  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  到  $(X, \tau)$  上的恒等映射, 则  f  是连续映射. 但  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  的连续像  $(X, \tau)$  不满足第一可数公理.

statement: There exists a compact but not sequentially compact topological space.
chinese_statement: 存在紧而不序列紧的拓扑空间.
rationale: For example: Let I be the closed unit interval, and consider the usual topology on I. Let X be the product space $I^{I}$. According to Tychonoff's theorem, X is compact. We shall show that X is not sequentially compact. To do this, we define a sequence of functions $\alpha_{n} \in X(n=1,2, \cdots)$ as follows: $\alpha_{n}(x)$ represents the n-th digit of the binary representation of $x \in I$. To prove that X is not sequentially compact, it suffices to show that there is no convergent subsequence in $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$. Suppose, on the contrary, that $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$ has a subsequence $\left\{a_{n_{k}}\right\}$ converging to $\alpha \in X$. Because convergence in product spaces is equivalent to coordinate-wise convergence, for each $x \in I$, $a_{n_{k}}(x)$ converges in I to $\alpha(x)$. Choose $x \in I$ such that the digits in its binary representation are 0 in odd positions and 1 in even positions. Then, by the definition of the function $\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)$, when k is odd, $\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)=0$. When k is even, $\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)=1$. Thus, the sequence $\left\{\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)\right\}$ is $0,1,0,1,0,1, \cdots$, which does not converge. Therefore, X is not sequentially compact.
chinese_rationale: 例如: 设  I  为单位闭区间,并在  I  上取通常拓扑,  X  为乘积空间  $I^{I}$ .据 Tychonoff 定理,  X  是紧的. 兹证  X  不是序列紧的. 为此, 我们定义函数序列  $\alpha_{n} \in X(n=1,2, \cdots)$  如下:  $\alpha_{n}(x)$  代表  $x \in I$  的二进位表示式中的第  n  个数字. 为证  X  不是序列紧的, 只要证明  $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$  中不存在收敛子列即可. 假如相反, 设  $\left\{a_{n}\right\}$  有子列  $\left\{a_{n_{4}}\right\}$  收敛于  $\alpha \in X$ . 因乘积空间中的收敛性等价于依坐标收敛,故对每一  $x \in I, a_{n_{1}}(x)$  在  I 内收敛于  $\alpha(x)$ . 取  $x \in I$ , 使其在二进位表示式中奇数位置上的数字为 0 , 偶数位置上的数字为 1 , 则据函数  $\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)$  的定义, 当  k  为奇数时  $\alpha_{x_{k}}(x)=0$ . 而当  k  为偶数时  $\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)=1$ . 也就是说，序列  $\left\{\alpha_{n_{k}}(x)\right\}$  是  $0,1,0,1,0,1, \cdots$ , 它并不收敛. 因此,  X  不是序列紧的.

statement: There exists a one-to-one closed map f from a regular space X to a topological space Y such that $f(X)=Y$ is not a regular space.
chinese_statement: 存在某个由正则空间  X  到拓扑空间  Y  上的一对一的闭映射  f , 使  $f(X)=Y$  不是正则空间.
rationale: It can be proven that if X and Y are topological spaces and f is a one-to-one closed map from X to Y, then when X is a $T_{0}$ space, a $T_{1}$ space, a Hausdorff space, or a completely Hausdorff space, Y is also correspondingly a $T_{0}$ space, a $T_{1}$ space, a Hausdorff space, or a completely Hausdorff space. However, when X is a regular space, a normal space, a completely normal space, or a completely normal space, Y does not have to be a regular space, a normal space, a completely normal space, or a completely normal space. Example: Let X be the set of real numbers with the usual topology $\tau$, and Q be the set of rational numbers. We take another topology $\tau^{*}$ on X which is generated by $\tau$ along with sets of the form $Q \cup U$, where $U \in \tau$. Thus, the topology $\tau^{*}$ is stronger than the topology $\tau$. Therefore, the identity map from $(X, \tau)$ to $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ is a one-to-one closed map. Clearly, $(X, \tau)$ is a completely normal space, hence also a completely normal space, a normal space, and a regular space. However, $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$ is not a regular space, and hence not a normal space, a completely normal space, or a completely normal space. In fact, since $Q \cap X$ is a $\tau^{*}$ open set, $X \backslash Q$ is a $\tau^{*}$ closed set. Since $X \backslash Q$ is $\tau$ dense in X, for any $\tau^{*}$ open set G that contains $X \backslash Q$, the $\tau^{*}$ closure of G is X. Therefore, there does not exist a point $x \in Q$, such that there are disjoint open sets G and $G_{x}$ containing $X \backslash Q$ and the point x respectively, i.e., $\left(X, r^{*}\right)$ is not a regular space.
chinese_rationale: 可以证明, 若  X  与  Y  都是拓扑空间,且  f  是  X  到  Y  上的一对一的闭映射, 则当  X  分别为  $T_{0}$  空间,  $T_{1}$  空间, Hausdorff 空间, 完全 Hausdorff 空间时,  Y  也分别是  $T_{0}$  空间,  $T_{1}$  空间, Hausdorff 空间,完全 Hausdorff 空间. 然而, 当  X  是正则空间, 正规空间, 完全正规空间或完备正规空间时,  Y  不必是正则空间, 正规空间, 完全正规空间或完备正规空间. 例：设  X  为带有通常拓扑  $\tau$  的实数集,  Q  是有理数集, 我们在  X  上取另一拓扑  $\tau^{*}$  ，它是由  $\tau$  再加上形如  $Q \cup U$  的集生成的拓扑, 其中  $U \in \tau$ . 于是, 拓扑  $\tau^{*}$  强于拓扑  $\tau$ .因此, 由  $(X, \tau)$  到  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  上的恒等映射是一对一的闭映射. 显然,  $(X, \tau)$  是完备正规空间, 从而也是完全正规空间,正规空间和正则空间. 然而,  $\left(X, \tau^{*}\right)$  不是正则空间, 从而也不是正规空间, 完全正规空间和完备正规空间. 事实上,因  $Q \cap X$  是  $\tau^{*}$  开集，故  $X \backslash Q$  是  $\tau^{*}$  闭集. 由于  $X \backslash Q$  是  X  的  $\tau$  稠密集, 因而对任何包含  $X \backslash Q$  的  $\tau^{*}$ 开集  G, G  的  $\tau^{*}$  闭包就是  X . 因此, 不存在点  $x \in Q$ , 使有分别包含  $X \backslash Q$  与点  x  的不相交的开集  G  与  $G_{x}$ , 即  $\left(X, r^{*}\right)$  不是正则空间.

statement: There exist non-metrizable complete locally convex spaces.
chinese_statement: 存在不可度量化的完备的局部凸空间.
rationale:
First example: Let I be an uncountable index set, R be the real line with the usual topology. Since R is a complete locally convex space, the product space $R^{I}$ is also a complete locally convex space. However, it is non-metrizable because a necessary and sufficient condition for the topological product of metrizable locally convex spaces to be metrizable is that only finitely many or countably many factors are involved.
Second example: Consider the linear space $\varphi=R^{(N)}$ consisting of all sequences with only finitely many non-zero coordinates, and take the strongest locally convex topology on $\varphi$. Then $\varphi$ is a complete locally convex space. We prove that there is no complete translation-invariant metric on $\varphi$. Suppose there exists a complete translation-invariant metric d on $\varphi$, then $(\varphi, d)$ is a Fréchet space, hence a space of the second category. On the other hand, $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$ is a Hamel basis for $\varphi$, where $\mathrm{e}_{n}=(0,\cdots,0,1,0, \cdots)$ (the n-th position). Let the subspace spanned by $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{1}, \cdots, \mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$ be $E_{n}$, i.e., $E_{n}=\operatorname{span}\left\{\mathrm{e}_{1}, \cdots, \mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$, then $E_{n}$ is a closed proper subspace of $(\varphi, d)$, and $\varphi=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}$. We now prove that each $E_{n}$ is nowhere dense in $(\varphi, d)$, meaning $\left(\frac{o}{E}\right)=\stackrel{o}{E}=\varnothing$. Suppose there exists some $n_{0}$ such that $\stackrel{o}{E}_{n_{0}} \neq \varnothing$, then there exists $x_{0}\in{\stackrel{o}{E}_{n_{0}}}$ and some spherical neighborhood $B\left(x_{0}, r\right)$ of $x_{0}$ such that $B\left(x_{0}, r\right) \subset \stackrel{o}E_{n_{0}} \subset E_{n_{0}}$. Take any $x \in \varphi$, clearly there exists $\alpha>0$ such that $\alpha x+x_{0} \in B\left(x_{0}, r\right) \subset E_{n_{0}}$, and since ${E}_{n_{0}}$ is a linear space, $x\in {E}_{n_{0}}$, leading to $\varphi={E}_{n_{0}}$. This contradicts the fact that ${E}_{n_{0}}$ is a proper subspace of $\varphi$. Thus, it proves that each $E_{n}$ is nowhere dense in $(\varphi, d)$, making $(\varphi, d)$ a space of the first category. This is a contradiction. Therefore, there is no complete translation-invariant metric on $\varphi$.
chinese_rationale:
第一例: 设  I  是不可数的指标集,  R  是实直线并取通常拓扑.因  R  是完备的局部凸空间,故乘积空间  $R^{I}$  也是完备的局部凸空间. 但它不可度量化, 因为可度量化的局部凸空间的拓扑积仍可度量化的充要条件是乘积中只有有限个或可数个因子.
第二例: 考虑一切只有有限个非零坐标的数列所组成的线性空间  $\varphi=R^{(N)}$ , 并在  $\varphi$  上取最强的局部凸拓扑, 则  $\varphi$  是一个完备的局部凸空间. 兹证  $\varphi$  上不存在完备的平移不变的距离. 反设在  $\varphi$  上存在完备的平移不变的距离  d , 则  $(\varphi, d)$  为一Fréchet 空间, 从而它是一个第二纲的集.  另一方面$\left\{\mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$是$\varphi$的一个Hamel基，其中$\mathrm{e}_{n}=(0,\cdots,0,1,0, \cdots)$(第n位) . 令  $\left\{\mathrm{e}_{1}, \cdots, \mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$  张成的子空间为  $E_{n}$ , 即$E_{n}=\operatorname{span}\left\{\mathrm{e}_{1}, \cdots, \mathrm{e}_{n}\right\}$,则  $E_{n}$  是  $(\varphi, d)$  的一个闭的真子空间, 且$\varphi=\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty} E_{n}$ .现证每个  $E_{\mathrm{n}}$  在  $(\varphi, d)$  内都是无处稠密的, 即  $\left(\frac{o}{E}\right)=\stackrel{o}{E}=\varnothing$ . 假如存在某个$n_{0}$使$\stackrel{o}{E}_{n_{0}} \neq \varnothing$,于是存在$x_{0}\in{\stackrel{o}{E}_{n_{0}}}$及 $x_{0}$的某个球形领域 $B\left(x_{0}, r\right)$ , 使  $B\left(x_{0}, r\right) \subset \stackrel{o}E_{n_{0}} \subset E_{n_{0}}$ . 任取  $x \in \varphi$ , 显然存在  $\alpha>0$ , 使$\alpha x+x_{0} \in B\left(x_{0}, r\right) \subset E_{n_{0}}$,而${E}_{n_{0}}$是线性空间,故$x\in {E}_{n_{0}}$,从而$\varphi={E}_{n_{0}}$.这与${E}_{n_{0}}$是$\varphi$的真子空间发生矛盾. 这样便证明了各个  $E_{n}$  在  $(\varphi, d)$  内都是无处稠密的,从而  $(\varphi, d)$  为一第一纲的集. 此为矛盾. 因此,  $\varphi$  上不存在完备的平移不变的距离.

statement: There exists a complete locally convex space, one of whose quotient spaces is not complete.
chinese_statement: 存在一个完备的局部凸空间,它的一个商空间并不完备.
rationale: Let $\omega$ represent the linear space of all sequences, and $\varphi$ represent the linear space of all finite sequences. Let both $\omega$ and $\varphi$ have the strongest locally convex topology, then both $\omega$ and $\varphi$ are complete Montel spaces. We use $\varphi \omega$ to represent the topological countable direct sum of copies of $\omega$, and $\omega \varphi$ to represent the topological countable product of copies of $\varphi$. Let $X=\varphi \omega \oplus \omega \varphi$. Then X is a complete locally convex space. Let $M=\{(x, x) \mid x \in \varphi \omega \cap \omega \varphi=\varphi\}$, it can be proven that the quotient space $X / M$ is not even sequentially complete.
chinese_rationale: 设  $\omega$  代表一切数列所组成的线性空间,  $\varphi$  是一切有限数列所组成的线性空间, 并在  $\omega$  和  $\varphi$  上都取最强的局部凸拓扑, 则  $\omega$  和  $\varphi$ 都是完备的 Montel 空间. 我们用  $\varphi \omega$  代表  $\omega$  的副本的拓扑可数直接和, 而用  $\omega \varphi$  代表  $\varphi$  的副本的拓扑可数积, 并令$X=\varphi \omega \oplus \omega \varphi$, 则  X  为一完备的局部凸空间. 令$M=\{(x, x) \mid x \in \varphi \omega \cap \omega \varphi=\varphi\}$,则可证明,商空间  $X / M$  甚至不是序列完备的.

statement: There exists a sequence barrel space which does not have property (s).
chinese_statement: 存在某个序列桶空间, 它没有性质 (s).
rationale: Since a complete sequence space with Mackey topology is a sequence barrel space, therefore $\left(l^{1}, m\left(l^{1}, c_{0}\right)\right)$ is a sequence barrel space. However, it obviously does not have property (s).
chinese_rationale: 因具有 Mackey 拓扑的完全序列空间是序列桶空间, 故  $\left(l^{1}, m\left(l^{1}, c_{0}\right)\right)$  是序列桶空间. 然而, 它显然没有性质  (s) .

statement: There exists a mapping that is sequentially continuous and weakly continuous but not weak* continuous.
chinese_statement: 存在序列连续且弱连续而不$弱^{*}$连续的映射.
rationale: Let $X=[0,1]$, and define the non-empty open sets of X as those whose complements are at most countable; then consider $Y=\{a, b\}$, with the open sets of Y being $\varnothing,\{a\}$ and Y. Define $f: X \rightarrow Y$ by $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}a, x \text { is a rational number in } X, \\b, x \text { is an irrational number in } X. \end{array}\right.$ Choose any $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset X$ such that $x_{n} \rightarrow x$. According to the definition of topology on X, there exists a natural number $n_{0}$ such that when $n > n_{0}$, we have $x_{n}=x$. Hence, $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f\left(x_{n}\right)=f(x)$, meaning f is sequentially continuous. For any non-empty open set G in Y, we have $\bar{G}=\mathrm{Y}$. Thus, f is weakly continuous. However, for the open set $\{a\}$ in Y, $\{a\}^{b}=\overline{\{a\}} \cap\overline{\{b\}} =\{b\}$, and $f^{-1}(b)$ is the set of irrational numbers in X, which is not a closed set, so f is not weak* continuous.
chinese_rationale: 设  $X=[0,1]$ ,命  X  的非空开集为其补集至多可数的集; 再设  $Y=\{a, b\}$, Y  的开集为  $\varnothing,\{a\}$  及  Y . 令  $f: X \rightarrow Y$  为$f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}a, x \text { 为 } X \text { 中的有理数, } \\b, x \text { 为 } X \text { 中的无理数. }\end{array}\right.$任取  $\left\{x_{n}\right\} \subset X$  且  $x_{n} \rightarrow x$ , 据  X  上拓扑的定义,存在自然数  $n_{0}$ , 当  $n>   n_{0}$  时, 都有  $x_{n}=x$ . 因此,$\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} f\left(x_{n}\right)=f(x)$,即  f  是序列连续的. 又对  Y  中的任一非空开集  G , 都有  $\bar{G}=\mathrm{Y}$ , 故  f 是弱连续的. 但对  Y  中的开集  $\{a\}$ , 有$\{a\}^{b}=\overline{\{a\}} \cap\overline{\{b\}} =\{b\}$,而  $f^{-1}(b)$  是  X  中的无理数集, 它不是闭集, 故  f  不是$弱^{*}$连续的.

statement: There exists a set in some $T_{1}$ space that is not closed.
chinese_statement: 存在某个  T_{1}  空间中的集, 它不是闭的.
rationale: In general topological spaces and even $T_{1}$ spaces, compact sets are not necessarily closed. For example: let X be the set of real numbers, and define the open sets of X as the empty set $\varnothing$ and all $X \backslash C$, where C is any finite set. This collection of open sets forms a topology $\tau$ on X, which we call the finite complement topology. In this topological space, all finite sets are closed, thus it is a $T_{1}$ space. Now take a subset of X, $A=\left\{0,1, \frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{3}, \cdots\right\}$, and any open cover of A $\mathscr{\mathscr { U }}=\left\{U_{a}=X \backslash C_{a} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$, where $C_{\alpha}$ is a finite set. Then, there exists $U_{0} \in \mathscr{U}$ such that $0 \in U_{0}=X \backslash C_{0}$. Since $C_{0}$ is a finite set, there exists an interval I such that $0 \in I \subset U_{0}$. Therefore, there exists a natural number $n_{0}$ such that when $n>n_{0}$, we have $x_{\mathrm{n}}=\frac{1}{n} \in I \subset U_{0}$. Hence, we can select finitely many open sets $U_{\alpha}$ from $\mathscr{U}$ that suffice to cover A, i.e., A is compact. However, since A is an infinite set, according to the definition of topology $\tau$, A is not closed.
chinese_rationale: 在一般拓扑空间甚至  $T_{1}$  空间中,紧集未必是闭的. 例如：设  X 为实数集,命  X  的开集为空集  $\varnothing$  以及一切  $X \backslash C$ , 其中  C  为任意有限集. 此开集族形成  X  的一个拓扑  $\tau$ , 我们称  $\tau$  为有限补拓朴. 这个拓扑空间中的有限集都是闭的,故它是一个  $T_{1}$  空间.现取  X  的子集  $A=\left\{0,1, \frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{3}, \cdots\right\}$ , 并任取  A  的一个开覆盖$\mathscr{\mathscr { U }}=\left\{U_{a}=X \backslash C_{a} \mid \alpha \in \Delta\right\}$,其中  $C_{\alpha}$  为有限集. 于是, 存在  $U_{0} \in \mathscr{U}$ , 使  $0 \in U_{0}=X \backslash C_{0}$ . 由于  $C_{0}$ 是有限集, 故存在某个区间  I , 使  $0 \in I \subset U_{0}$ . 因此存在自然数  $n_{0}$ , 当  $n>n_{0}$  时, 就有$x_{\mathrm{n}}=\frac{1}{n} \in I \subset U_{0}$ .由此可见, 我们可从  $\mathscr{U}$  中选出有限多个开集  $U_{\alpha}$ , 它们足以覆盖  A , 即  A  是紧的. 然而, 由于  A  是无限集, 故据拓扑  $\tau$  的定义,  A  不是闭的.

statement: There exists a mapping from one topological space to another that is continuous and open, but not closed.
chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间到另一个拓扑空间上的眏射, 它是连续的和是开的, 但不是闭的.
rationale: Let X and Y be the two-dimensional Euclidean space $R^{2}$ and the one-dimensional Euclidean space R, respectively. Let the mapping be the projection $P: P(x, y)=x$. P is clearly both open and continuous. The set $F=\left\{(x, y) \left\lvert\, y=\frac{1}{x}>0\right.\right\}$ is a closed subset of X, but $P(F)=\{x \mid 0<x<+\infty\}$ is not closed in Y. Therefore, P is not a closed mapping.
chinese_rationale: 设  X  与  Y  分别是二维欧氏空间  $R^{2}$  与一维欧氏空间  R , 再设映射为射影  $P: P(x, y)=x$, P  显然是既开且连续的. 又集$F=\left\{(x, y) \left\lvert\, y=\frac{1}{x}>0\right.\right\}$是  X  的闭子集, 而  $P(F)=\{x \mid 0<x<+\infty\}$  在  Y  内不是闭的, 故  P 不是闭映射.

chinese_statement: 存在某个拓扑空间到另一个拓扑空间上的映射, 它是闭的, 但既不是开的也不是连续的.
